85FXxhHrb-Q2Lh3ezybJXw.text: We visited Giada's on the last day of our Vegas trip for lunch and was left a bit disappointed. I'm a huge fan and had some high expectations for the food there - maybe the dinner menu is better? My husband ordered a SLAT (smoked salmon and avocado) which was very heavy on the salmon but was "eh, OK." I ordered a lemon pesto grilled cheese with prosciutto that was actually quite tasty though for $22 didn't blow me away. Our favorite item ended up being the drinks and appetizers - great bloody marys and the chefs board is always a solid choice. Luckily we had a Groupon to make our meal a bit better. On a side note- the restaurant itself is absolutely adorable. Sit by the window for a nice view of the strip and look at all the detail taken into consideration when decorating - even down to the silverwear and napkins. Next time we would probably just stick with apps and drinks.

7fYPYiPEN0vKXOWdMxuXHw.text: After having trouble getting a reservation, I was contacted almost immediately be the general manager, Laurent.  He went out of his way to accommodate us for lunch the following day.    Our table was gorgeous, with a view of the Bellagio fountain.  Laurent went out of his way to come over and made sure everything was going well throughout the entire meal.  Our server was Erin, who was fantastic.  She gave us suggestions and was right about everything she offered as a suggestion.  We started out with the cured beef, which came with the most amazing pickled cherries.  Then we tried two different cheeses and the orzo meatball.  We split the ricotta pizza and finished up with the selection of cookies.  Everything was incredible and the dining experience was not to be outdone in the near future.  Not only was this meal that we will not forget, it is one that we will be taking about for a long time.

gmtRJFfuJAHNDtSbcD0-BQ.text: So very disappointed. After nearly a week of delicious meals in Vegas, this one fell very short. The service was incredibly slow (think 30 mins to get a drink slow, 15 to get silverware so we could eat the food in front of us slow). The food was also just bland. Nothing to write home about. We had the tasting menu and the only thing that was remotely memorable was the pasta course. Unfortunately, the pasta was about 2oz and the tasting course is $120 a person. Definitely not worth a visit when there are so many outstanding restaurants on the strip!

qI2MC-GZ3xGeHmaO80AFMw.text: Our 4th time here. Great views of the strip, great service, and fantastic food. Dining room offers spectacular views of the Bellagio fountains, and Cesar's palace. Our waiter David was attentive and entertaining, a refreshing combination. Overall a wonderful culinary experience.

ebDrOXq37Ip-aZRieOc4Kg.text: Wow, what an amazing experience from top to bottom.  My wife is a huge Giada fan so said I needed to eat here on a recent work trip to Las Vegas.  I'm glad I took her word as it was a delicious meal.  The front staff wasn't super friendly or warm but after you got through the doors the experience changed.    I was by myself but they gave me a phenomenal seat right along the window.  I was lucky enough to see Giada there too as she came out to speak with the table next to me.  I started off with a cocktail and had to try the tasting menu after the waiter described it to me.  Plus I was able to bring home an autographed photo of Giada for my wife.  Be prepared because the tasting menu is massive so you better be hungry.  They first brought out the bread plate which was awesome and the lemon butter made it that much better.  The tasting menu started off with bacon wrapped dates, a stuffed pepper with cheese and Vitello Tonnato crostini.  All were delicious but I loved the dates and I'm not a huge date fan.  For the second course I had the super tasty lemon spaghetti with two of the most massive shrimp I've ever seen.  For the third course I got the roasted lamb which was good and the mustard crust made the meal.  For dessert you got to choose from 5 which was too much.  I had the strawberry gelato (yum), a strawberry tart, lemon ricotta cookie, amaretti cookie, and my favorite the blueberry tiny donut.  Excellent job Giada!

2fBs9OMewr0UKUIefEXK1A.text: Another Las Vegas winner. Had lunch at their bar. Friendly and efficient staff went the extra mile to ensure I had all I needed, and were never intrusive. The salad was delightful, full of fresh ingredients and beautifully plated. Nice to find a refreshing light lunch, in an airy and  nicely appointed environment with a beautiful view. So many strip restaurants are dark and heavy feeling. Not so here. Good martini as well. Fully recommended.

HPE6PDmFwrCkC7ozFZFiow.text: We loved the chia parfait, the lemon roasted potatoes and the berries and lemon yogurt! I also had poached eggs, toast, sausage meatballs and heirloom tomatoes. All great! My husband's salmon cakes Benedict was a bit fishy, so I couldn't give it a five, atmosphere and wait staff were also great. It's pricey, but would love to have dinner there sometime.

8bGFcpQQfRnBO6skbTOVpw.text: Lucky to have been able to get a table within the first month of opening in 2014. Also lucky enough to get a table by the window facing the Las Vegas Strip for my birthday. Dining here was definitely an experience  I would love to repeat. The food were delicious and our waiter was wonderful. For the price I wished the portions were bigger though but not surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rack of lamb
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. shrimp spaghetti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meatball appetizer

DtDXBlC5il2rdsCKZT-Eww.text: Oh Giada... Your restaurant could have not been prettier. Right away when you walk in her decor is super cute and clean. Anyways I do not want to make this long so let me get to the point. We got seated right away and lucky for us we had a table right next to the window. Our bread came out and I loved the butter mixed with mascarpone cheese and also the pesto. Our server was foreign and at first I thought he was a little rude but he turned out to be great! The boyfriend had the orzo meatballs which were okay. Then for our entree I had the Lemon spaghetti with prawns and the lobster ravioli. Let me just say that the lemon spaghetti was beyond amazing. So simple yet so delicious. I cannot stop thinking about it. The ravioli was really buttery and had a hint of lemon which was really good as well. Even tho the portions were small I got full and had to take half of the ravioli to go. My boyfriend order the surf n turf. The steak was nicely cooked and he loved the prawns. Only thing he did not like was some pasta that was on his plate that was really salty and had a weird flavored to it. Anyways it was dessert time. I had a nutella latte, paired with Giadas famous Lemon Ricotta cookies and her chocolate chip one. Ugh they were so good! At first I was really scare because of all the mix reviews on yelp to try this place but I am glad I had a great experience. I feel sorry for all those who did not. And yes the price was a little higher but you are paying for the whole experience not just the food, keep that in mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple martini &amp; lemon drop.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ugh! Fave!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Spaghetti

CogXQqnnL_08WC0HoMpffg.text: Ok, let's get the one thing out of the way. It can be pricey, but that's what is expected with a well know chef and being on the strip. That said, there are some nice differences that make Giada rise to the top versus the rest!  First, the location is on the second floor of the new Cromwell casino an elegant boutique casino that sits in the corner of Flamingo and the strip. Well, if your looking for a good view point Giada is on that corner on the second floor!  Atmosphere starts from the escalator that moves you to the elegant reception area with comfortable seating area an then, yes my favorite a photo booth! We all hate the wait to be seated area where people stand and look at each other annoyingly until someone calls your mispronounced name within what is hopeful, an hr later. Well, this place is cool and using the photo booth with your friends and family while you wait is lot better and it's free!  Service starts immediately with eager receptionist waiting to attend to you. However, the popularity and packed reservation gives them the little shortness in their attitude. Too much to go on in the decor and the design but it's very nicely sat with feminine, clean, yet elegant but not too over the top. For me, I like the clean feeling as you walk in the dining area.  Food, let's just put a spot light on this right now! It's darn good! Best description is, simple, beautiful, and taste that will pleasantly surprise you. Never knew how wonderful a simple meat ball will taste or squash strings that you'll swear it's the best shoe string fries you ever had. Let's just say it's not your typical fill me up place littered on the strip to fulfill your hunger from night after drink binging. Plus, putting your famous name on something doesn't mean it's gonna be any good like manny celebrity filled over priced places on the strip. Yes, Giada puts her name on it but the significant difference is everything. Finally, she is there quite frequently to oversee every corner of the operations from the kitchen to her customers. Ya, she actually spends lots of time in the dining area and genuine like your the guest over her house.   Spent some time on this review for sure but it deserves the attention from my perspective..!

x0mqjv_tkFpd15SsQGL5Ng.text: After a not so great experience at Lavo's, we ventured over to the Cromwell to Giada's. The BLUF is that the food and service was good, yet priced typical for Vegas Strip. Wine was priced much better than Lavo's (3.5x vice 4.5x). The ambiance was a bit noisy, but tolerable.

p6K77q1BRnmY2lX2Yw8HfA.text: When I say I might have had the top 3 worst service in my life, I really mean it. I am so annoyed right now it crazy. And the worst part is the food was actually pretty good. I mean I get it, I know black people don't tip well, my girlfriend when she was a server and all my friends have always said the same thing so when I do get bad service I don't let it bother me, I get it. But today was just beyond bad. If your going to be a server you just gotta take the good with the bad. I literally sat at the bar for 20 minutes waiting on Katie to take my order while she made drinks or the table servers and checked on the couple that was sitting directly next me to lol. I swear to god I thought for a second I was being punked.  This threw my whole vibe off. Now off to my room to meditate so I can get my good energy back.

Dax-9w_1y9y8e-AaPlQ2fw.text: I had a great evening at Giada's! We were a ground of 8 girls, and had a wonderful time. The staff was attentive and friendly, the food was delicious and then atmosphere was cozy yet chic. The modern decor was also really interesting and added to the ambiance. I would not hesitate to dine there again!

kR2BQFF8onBZkDIa1JnvoA.text: This is my second time here. The first time, I came with friends and everything that we ordered were just awesome.  This time I came here with my husband.   He's been wanting to come since I told him how great my first experience was.  I was able to get a reservation for two online.  I felt lucky cause it's really hard to get a table here.  You have to really book way in advance.   We ordered the following as appetizers: grilled octopus,  anchovies over toasts and oysters. Everything was delicious; however,  we were a little disappointed with the oysters because it wasn't fresh. One was still frozen which was unexpected at a restaurant of this quality.   For the entree, we ordered the spaghetti with shrimp, lemon and basil and the farrotto with creamy porcini mushrooms, brussels sprout leaves, pomegranate and pecorino tartufo. Both were absolutely delicious even though the farrotto was a bit rich.  All in all,  we would come again but probably won't order the oysters unless it was cooked like an oyster rockefeller.  Make sure to rsvp in advance. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lpHcn4fhG2hozsC_FCN9AQ.text: My first trip. Located on second floor of the Cromwell.   Tips. This place takes reservations. Most dinner times of 5-9 are a two month out for a reservation. Lunch recently began to be served. Lunch dress code is relaxed and dinner is business casual. Dress code is enforced.  Experience. At arrival we are greeted immediately at the base of stairs to confirm our lunch reservation. Also confirmed and greeted at the front desk. She kindly informs us to wait a few moments to try the photo booth to the left and are escorted to our tables.  Our server Anthony arrived in a timely manner to introduce himself and his help. He was kindly insured we placed a drink order. We were unsure on what to order and he described some of his favorite beverage choices. Giada's Sangria with Brachetto and Fortunella 1958 with Don Julio were the drinks we ordered. Anthony kindly informed us that restaurant was out of Don Juilo and was substituting with Patron. Rare to find a restaurant out of beverage. Without Don Julio I went with my second choice Barbarella 1968 with Tanqueray Ten. Waiter respected and agreed with my opinion and affirmed the second choice was his favorite drink.   Drinks were served and food order was taken without delay. Both drinks I would describe as a good balance with alcohol and freshly matched ingredients. Sangria was crisp and savory. Barbarella similar to a Moscow Mule was harmony of gin, ginger beer, fresh lemon and basil. Drinks ordered were refreshing for the hot temperatures outside of the restaurant. Alcohol was not over powering either.   Anthony made suggestions for the meal. We followed some suggestions and ordered others. We ordered appetizers from the antipasti meat and cheese including Chicken Marsala Meatballs, and Pecorino Tartufo with Apricot Preserves served with fresh made flat bread and dipping sauce. Dipping sauce similar to that of a pesto. Yum. Pairing flat bread with pecorino and apricot spread just magnificent. The components of pecorino worked well on its own and together. Harmony.   Meatballs paired with vine roasted tomatoes in a savory Marsala. Tender soft meatballs. Sauce was flavorful and one of the best I had. Tomatoes lightly toasted to maintain it's integrity. As a whole this was a nice antipasti. Pieces were good on its own but in my opinion lacked a little cohesion for the appetizer. This item is on their dinner menu and I would still order it.   We ordered from the sandwiches from servers suggestions. Muffuletta sandwich with mortadella, finocchoina, porchetta, prosciutto cotto, and aged provolone. Similar to an Italian salumi trio, was bursting with spice and fair amount of provolone on a fresh rustic bread. Prepared warm from the grill, this is what a  sandwich should be. This sandwich pays True homage to the influences of Giada's family into the restaurant. Sandwich is served with choice of arugula salad or zucchini scapecce. Arugula salad was elected to pair with this. Lightly dressed and topped with parmesan that hit an accord with the sandwich. I couldn't complain if this was the only thing I ordered. Between the muffuletta sandwich and arugula salad I think I could eat all day without feeling guilty.  Other sandwich was the Lobster Roll with lemon basil aioli and fried capers. The roll was by far one of the best deals on the menu. Ten ounces of lobster piled on a roll with the citrus aioli was succulent, creamy, savory, and sweet. Nothing over powering just right and not too aromatic with the lobster and citrus. Paired this with the zucchini scapecce like a zucchini onion strings. Not greasy but crispy enough with flavor to enjoy on it's own or pair with the lobster roll. Lightness of the zucchini paired nicely to the sandwich. Both light sides were good pairings.   Overall the appetizers, sandwiches, sides, and drinks were great. Service was outstanding. Restaurant as a whole was refreshing, exceeded the expectations and hype. The restaurant reflects the pride, tradition which tributes to Giada's family and California influences. I would make sure I had a reservation the next time I am out to Las Vegas. A must try if you like food.   Server was very personal and knowledgeable of menu. Server was efficient, friendly, and well articulated. It showed with suggestions. We enjoyed the meal from some suggestions he made and our own selections. Serve, wait, and host staff worked well like a oiled machine or an orchestra on key.  Overall four stars for exceptions from a slight delay on the check to get to us, a little pricy, and no clue what lunch was because lunch menu (just started serving lunch) was not available until we ate there. Five stars on food, service, and drinks.   We had plenty on our list of things to do for this Vegas trip and this is a definite return place for us.

jLGkp1nCVmR7TA6KL3NUTw.text: We had friends in town and it was of their b-day so we decided to hit up Giada. The was my first time in the Cromwell I have to say they have done a real nice job renovating it.   Got to the restaurant got seated the first thing I noticed the cups were dirty so I asked to get it swapped out.  The waiter was on point and took good care of us. His jacket though really bothered my wife it was all wrinkly and wasn't sitting right on him. We ordered the margarita pizza which was awesome wish it was bigger than what it was. I ordered the soup which was good. The branzini was awesome. The pasta dish I didn't really care for. Overall the experience was ok.

BCbdNRpp9wgB8AbyugLtag.text: Perhaps the most pleasant, comfortable and relaxing dining experience I have ever had.  Everything was perfect from cocktails to dessert and everything in-between.

1-uhOXkp1Wc9pT6tE1_T9w.text: Upon arrival my friend and I had trouble getting into the restaurant.  The first set of hostess, which are downstairs before going up the escalators wouldn't let us inside because we did not have reservations.  We had called before arriving to ensure we were able to sit in bar/lounge area w/out reservations and were told that we could.  After politely speaking w/ the manager we were able to resolve the issue and get seated.  Once inside the night seemed to flow perfectly.  The inside of the restaurant is very classy and elegant w/ nice neutral colors, beautiful art work, and big open windows w/ a great view of the Bellagio Fountains...I LOVED IT!  The service was first class and everyone including the manager greeted and treated us very well.  In particular, our bartender, Martin, was very friendly and attentive.   We started the night w/ a special blood orange "mocktail" and it was very sweet and refreshing!   First was a warm and delicate Artichoke Soup w/ Cruton and Homemade Focaccia Bread.  I was tempted to keep eating it!  Second we had a Mushroom Pizette and White Anchovies Caesar w/ Germolata Butter Crostini; both were perfect savory bites.   Third was the Lobster Ravioli w/ Asparagus Tips, Tarragon and Lemon Sauce...my favorite!  They were like light, airy pillows of fresh homemade pasta and I couldn't get enough!  However, I had to save room for my sweet tooth and most favorite thing of all...DESSERT!  For dessert we got the Trio of Tiramisu - Blackberry, Chocolate and PB & J along w/ assorted cookies (2 of each) that included Warm Chocolate Chip, Sugared Chocolate, Mini Palmers and Lemon Ricotta (My Favorite)!  To end the night we were lucky enough to meet Giada.  My friend and I were so excited since we're such big fans!  She is the sweetest person and besides taking pictures she signed my "Feel Good Food" book...it was such an honor to meet her!  The biggest thing to stress is give her some space and have patience...it's tough getting her attention, especially when she's slaving away in the kitchen and making sure things are going well in her restaurant.    What an Amazing Dinner!  My new favorite in Vegas and I can't wait to go back w/ my husband when he returns from Afghanistan!

nJsL8jBODtycKFcsInqu_w.text: I went to Giada's on Saturday night with a friend and thought it was good.  We ordered the artichoke with the hummus inside which was probably the least favorite thing we ordered.   For the main course we split the salmon and spaghetti with prawns and thought both were extremely delicious and the portions were a good size and absolutely made me full.  The downfall was our waiter, he was a little bit awkward, asking us many times if we wanted a drink which we finally told him after the 3rd time that we are not drinking right now.  The atmosphere was really nice and was right next to Drais which was nice because that's where we were going after.   Overall, I thought the main course was really delicious and I would eat there again.

laPZAJhPE0aeRDSpw1cq_Q.text: WOW! Giada blew us away tonight. We arrived and had a drink at the bar before our reservation where service was a little slow but we were certainly in no rush! We wanted to fully enjoy our experience and take in the amazing ambiance and view of that Las Vegas strip anyway. We were promptly greeted at the bar and whisked away to one of the best tables in the house, in our opinion, right along the windows over looking the bellagio fountains and Caesars palace. Nancy, our server greeted up right away with the most welcoming smile and guided us through the menu options. We of course had to choose the tasting menu as requested by our fabulous knowledgeable server, Nancy. Not one item left us disappointed! The food, drinks, wine, dessert (that dessert cart is no joke!), atmosphere and of course Nancy who guided our entire experience was impeccable. If you're in Las Vegas visiting or as a resident you have to stop in, you won't be disappointed unless you miss out on this one of a kind dining experience! Thanks Nancy, you're AMAZING!!!!

49Rnald9-Gw5od2gMVMXMg.text: My friends and I came here last weekend, when I was visiting Vegas. My friends and I ordered bottomless mimosas since it was around brunch time when we got there, and it's 30$ for bottomless. Also, the level of service was excellent since the servers are very tentative and also made sure our glasses of champagne were always full with just a splash of orange juice lol. The food was pretty good too. But overall I loved the ambiance of the restaurant and the great view! Will definitely come Back when I'm in Vegas again next time!

Mqm4aNzF1msRuBstlJjvvA.text: There's not much I can say about Giada's that won't sound cliche. The bread was amazing, shrimp pasta was to die for and the chocolate macaroon was delectable. Top it off with Giada's signature cocktail and you get one of the best meals I've ever had in Vegas. The pepper also comes to your table in a HUGE grinder. I had to take a second glance as I thought someone had a baseball bat in the Resturant.

tRucvB-iVgRO5XVNccf5GA.text: We've been here twice in the past year. I think our latest visit was the best. Make a reservation. Our waiter was Fred and he was a pro from beginning to end. Attentive as a waiter and knowledgeable about the the menu. This is a high end restaurant, but everything is homemade and wonderful. If you appreciate fine Italian dining, this is your place. If they're not busy and you have a reservation, ask for a window table. The bar is cool and quite large. Have a crafted cocktail while you wait for your table. Enjoy your experience here and don't rush it.

Thank you so much to the entire staff for making out 20 year Anniversary dinner so special. I ordered the Halibut with Swiss chard and Donna had the spaghetti with shrimp. Both meals were fantastic!

vr_VAjhxwJIbj5I8b56d4g.text: Took advantage of a Groupon. Was able to call in for a reservations. Self-Parking was $10. Got a great booth with a view. Our server was nice. We ordered chicken meatballs ---yummy, very flavorful. I had the lobster hash - could have used a little more lobster. But the bacon and veggies were wonderful. We also got the Giada burger. The smoked provolone was a little too strong for my taste. Other than that...yummy.   Would have been 4-stars, but server forgot the lemons we asked for and didn't ask if we wanted fresh ground pepper on our salad. Also overcharged for a splash of peach puree for my drink.

68h-drtMKuxPm4QuyrsxLQ.text: The best dinner I had during my stay in Las Vegas was at Giada's. The awesome waiter helped me determine what to order and they were spot on. The service was excellent. I would go back anytime I was in Vegas.

HXyaoKz7HraaOJosDhiAFQ.text: This was my first time at Giada.  I've seen her shows on the Food Network and was very curious what her food tastes like at her restaurant.  Because she's a celebrity chef, I fully expected prices to be on the expensive side, but I also expected food to taste great.  The bread course was a promising start.  The olive loaf and the rosemary bread were delicious, along with the accompanying butter and pesto dip.  We inhaled the bread course.  Unfortunately, the main course was a huge disappointment.  I love Cacio e Pepe, and have had this dish at other restaurants in Los Angeles.  I was curious to see how Giada's Cacio e Pepe would compare to those I've had before.  It was a pretty expensive dish at $64, as it is only portioned for two people and served on a cheese bowl.  When the dish arrived, it was inedible.  There was too much pepper.  The pasta was so peppery, we couldn't have more than a couple bites, and my husband actually went to the restroom as his food was coming back up.  I don't know if this was a fluke, an error, but I can't know how anyone could finish this dish, let alone enjoy it.    Gratefully, our server noticed that we weren't enjoying the dish we ordered, and volunteered to take the dish back and offered us a replacement dish.  Given that our dish of choice was a huge error, we asked our server for her recommendation, and she offered the lobster ravioli as one of her personal favorites, and a popular favorite as well.  She also gave my husband a complimentary ginger beer concoction from the bar to help settle his stomach.  That was really nice of her, so I truly appreciate her attentive and friendly service.  Kudos to our server.  When the lobster ravioli came out, it tasted okay.  It wasn't anything spectacular to justify the $34 price tag.  But again, I was expecting premium prices just for Giada's name.  The lobster was tender and cooked well, the sauce was buttery but maybe a tad too lemony for my taste.  But the most egregious error is that the ravioli was under-cooked.  I know pasta should be al dente, but this was under-cooked and tough.  And for an Italian restaurant named after an Italian celebrity chef, pasta is something they should know how to do right.  Though I didn't originally plan to order dessert, the peppery taste from the Cacio e Pepe was still lingering in my mouth, so I felt like I needed something sweet.  I tried Giada's raspberry ricotta cheesecake.  The texture of the cheesecake was good, and it wasn't too sweet, which I appreciated.  The cheesecake goes well with the fresh raspberry and citrus sauces that came with it.  However, there were some candied orange peel mixed into the cheesecake as well, which I could have done without.  Maybe some people like that, but it was a pretty bold flavor that stood out too much on the otherwise mellow & delicate flavor of the cheesecake.  It reminded me too much of fruitcake instead of cheesecake.  So overall, I can't really say that I recommend this restaurant.

x3OMrQph5F8U-DpRF5i4tA.text: Somewhat a bit pricey due to a celebrity chef's popularity.  We ordered menu items to share and cocktails as we were not too hungry.  The food was solid but nothing to brag about. We ordered the arrugala salad, roasted chicken with cacciatore dipping sauce  and jumbo shrimp.  The chicken dish was flavorful along a side of cacciatore marinara.  But nothing impressive. The salad came with a lemon vinaigrette and parmigiano reggiano shavings and was quite tasty. My date had the jumbo shrimp and he liked it.  I had a cosmopolitan made with fresh grapefruit juice I believe. I've had better.  All orders came with fresh bread along with dipping sauces.  Located inside The Cromwell (a lovely hotel btw), it offers breakfast, lunch and dinner.     I'm sure there are better Italian restaurants but I guess if your a fan of Giadia then its a destination on your list.

4dHZEESzpwi2rLBSh71ulg.text: We try to visit Vegas about twice a year and Giada has become a must on our restaurant stops! The space is gorgeous and overlooks the Strip and the Bellagio fountains. If we don't have time or aren't too hungry we sit in the bar area where the entire menu is available and you can sit in lounge chairs and visit. #1 on my list is the arancini appetizer...I'm hungry again just thinking of it. #2 is the charcuterie board with amazing meats, cheeses, mustards and honey...add on the olives. I could go on and on. All of that and every time with outstanding service.

NPZ1HqWaqGhaO3p0_Dkwpg.text: You want Italian? Go to Maggianos. Yes it's a chain but it was fantastic! Giada Was just ok. Oysters were terrible. Food portion was incredibly small. Drinks, mas o menos. I would not recommend going, it's SUPER expensive for what you get. Incredible service though and GORGEOUS restaurant, truly. Maybe going there for desert and coffee is a good choice? Enjoy your stay in sin city

AA6hpOtDCG2t-8DeH82tZw.text: Have to say this was a little disappointing being a Giada fan! The appetizers were amazing but the entrees were not the best. My family and I came to eat here mainly for the Cacino e Pepe Bucatini (pasta in the cheese wheel) for $64. The waiter told us they have it but won't be given to you in the cheese wheel. In one of our dishes we had a fly in our food and we still got charged. Also have to say that the customer service was unacceptable, our waiter was very rude and gave my family and I bad looks and made us felt like we didn't belong there. Which made me feel very uncomfortable and very judged. This was very disappointing and I didn't have a good experience.

xAePLrqV2BAQ3fOm2vX2Gw.text: Good meal, decent service, expected more. The dishes were light and well prepared. Arugula salad well dressed, bacon-wrapped dates tasty and I loved the hint of chile oil, risotto had great creamy texture served with crab and nicely-seared scallops.  Good meal but not stellar. Pricey but expected in Vegas at a celebrity restaurant. Service slightly off.  Highlight: CITRUS MASCARPONE CHEESECAKE. One of the best desserts ever. Light, creamy, not sweet. Satisfying and beautiful with raspberries, citrus sauce, raspberry puree. Oh so delightful!

LjBK6lreQ3bze7DkcWLKZQ.text: This rating is for the brunch tasting menu.  I bought a Groupon deal for the brunch tasting menu.  We had reservation, but we had one more guest to our party, so we informed the hostess that it was a party of 5 vs 4.  They took over 10 minutes to add one more place setting to our booth.  So not a good start, but when we walked in the restaurant, it had a nice view and we were hopeful.   Our main server was pleasant but her "helper" was having a bad day.  She was grumpy and we had to keep asking for coffee refills (it didn't help she only filled it half way every time!).  Now to the food!  Only 3 of us ordered the tasting menu.  So they brought out one pastry per person, slices of salami and plate of salad and said that was for 3 people.  The food was okay, nothing special.  Then entrees..2 of us ordered Salmon Benedict and one order the Burger.  the food was blah....meh...and as someone else mentioned in previous review, the tasting menu is not a good deal if you look the entree prices on the menu.    Dessert was ok.  My son ordered a pasta dish with chicken and he says the chicken tasted like "cancer" meaning he can taste the burnt char taste from the grill.  And the pesto type pasta dish was so bland, my pasta dish at home is far superior and I'm not even a chef let alone a celebrity chef.  Even with the Groupon "Deal" this brunch was complete waste of money!!!  If you are looking for a tasty Italian style brunch, go to Buddy's at the Venetian.  Far superior food quality and you don't need a Groupon deal!!!  Yes, we tipped 20% off the full price tasting menu of $55 instead of the Groupon price.  Because its not the server's fault the food is so Meh...Blah...

lAe2qrvoKhPAx6oI8UQx-A.text: Beau the bartender at Giadas made some great drinks and his customer service was excellent!

Y_0nfUFMJah8YbfYF6OZ7Q.text: Went there for brunch. Awesome location with huge windows to look over the Strip. I had the strawberry polenta waffles which were yummy. Light and fluffy with just a little crunch from the polenta. And it came with Nutella which of course made it better! Overall wasn't too expensive either for the strip. About $30/person with drinks and an appetizer.  And don't miss the free photobooth just at the top of the escalator near the entrance!!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RHHcw9HGwza311w5wZr3hg.text: Really no complaints. I'm not rating it a 5 Star experience because the restaurant or food didn't really "Wow!" me. It's an upperclass place with pricey food, nothing really different from any other "fancy" restaurant but if you're curious in trying it it's worth a shot.

tG061zbFlsAl8JHwwJ738g.text: Came her for my aunt's birthday and our server Dave made it so special! The food was very good, and atmosphere is nice. Try and get a table by the window.

hvydTzqLee2r4rIge66vdA.text: Nice view of the Strip, beautiful design and very good service. The food was good but not exceptional. We had the orzo meatballs,  a couple of pasta dishes and the veal chop. The veal chop was very good. But when we asked for a side of pasta, they couldn't do it. That left a bad test in my mouth. For the prices they charge, this was not acceptable. In conclusion, there are better restaurants in Vegas for the same price.

ilRJk1WgI36f0elnnuBrMg.text: Service was phenomenal, as was the food! Recommend the bacon wrapped dates, they have a bit of a kick!

99ZGUonKcOrY9PHP6qutFA.text: Such high expectations.  This was Chef Boy R Dee in a Denny's -- absolutely pedestrian and unremarkable in every way.  Giada has sold Vegas a complete bill of goods.  Will never return.  The word "fraud" comes to mind!

pMhiJWeQodmW-Zzt58l8yw.text: Giada's....  WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!!!!  Spaghetti Warehouse looks like a five star restaurant in comparison.  The worst food and service I've ever had in my life.  If you are use to better restaurants and don't mind spending money.. this place is not for you.  A total joke.  SO DISAPPOINTED.  Giada should be ashamed to put her name on this joint.

8niMj7WmDkK22zCCgOUbdg.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!! First time here-FINALLY!! Visiting Vegas from San Diego for AGD (Academy of General Dentistry). Husband (Dr.), self, 4 year old son. Everything was amazing!  Our server, Nancy was terrific! Explained the menus, executed food/beverages and engaged in conversation as a person that enjoys her job and people.  The food: DELICIOUS!!!! We ordered: Bacon wrapped dates, charred octopus, Orzo meatballs, wood fired mushrooms w/Marcona almonds, lemon spaghetti w/prawns, cookies for dessert. Kids menu: Pizzete w/meatballs, green beans and s'mores dessert.  Everything was delicious   Favorites: Lemon spaghetti, mushrooms w/Marcona almonds Thank you Giadawe love it!! Congratulations! We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excited to be here!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids s&#39;mores dessert-thumbs up!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

st9bcBlD2sFjo5Me2fHt0Q.text: Oh I wish I could remember the name of our wonderful bartender at Giada.  He was fun and made me the best drink I've ever had, I don't remember the official name but it's on their cocktail menu, called something like a white cosmopolitan.  Delicious!!!  We had a long discussion about doing the Sky Jump at the Stratosphere and our bartender wanted to come back and tell him if we went through with it.  If he's reading this review, we did!  He had done it twice!   We didn't order food but this bar was the place we hung out the longest while we were in Vegas.  Elegant and comfortable too. We had a great time!

98Sh3St0EPq87KittkrzGA.text: We had an absolutely wonderful dinner. I ordered the eggplant avocado vegetarian Tower. It was absolutely to die for and the best vegetarian entree I've ever had. The BF had some kind of a pasta that he really enjoyed.. the waiter recommended both entrees and we were extremely happy. We had a beautiful table overlooking the strip. The View was breathtaking. We did a Yelp check-in for a taste of Prosecco which was a half glass!  We really enjoyed the Prosecco with the complimentary rosemary  bread and items to put on the bread such as Capers butter salt peppers...it was a really nice touch. Our waiter was excellent... I wish I could remember his name. Next time we're in Vegas we will definitely return to this restaurant.

r8izteD04u3JFXQGiMZlig.text: I'm updating in response to the managers reply to my original review. I never stated that I was denied service. And my review is not based on one visit but now 2 visits where service was poor each time. However, this last visit that Management referring to was the icing on the cake.   I came with a party of 3 and mentioned upon being seated we had a travel zoo promo we were looking to use. The waiter already gave us a ton of hesitation and said he'd be back to check on the voucher details. Came back, and told us we needed to be a party of 4 to use that voucher but we could speak with management about any exceptions. We've used a plethora of these type of vouchers all up and down the strip and this is the first time anyone's said anything. So we were like sure, Mina came over and without introducing herself strait away said we wouldn't use it but we could purchase the travel zoo for the party of 2 and use that one. We explained that we were going to order plenty of food and wine and didn't understand what the difference was and she cited it was a travel zoo policy, which is unTrue and/or she's misinformed. It's manager's discretion... everyone knows that.   So we left, mainly because by the time Mina got there we'd already had to deal with at least 3 other people who are terrible at their jobs and weren't about to deal with one more. We hoped over to BLT and used their travel zoo, which states it's for 4 people, and the staff there were happy to have us, we could use it on anything with no stipulations. We ordered a few bottles of wine, had incredible steaks and a great waiter. No drama and no BS.   Giada's only looks nice, other than that it's mediocre food and the crappiest service on the strip. No thanks, wouldn't be back if you paid me.

c768DU86bqlHOHZlkPuHvg.text: We ordered the tricolore salad for starters and the chef was nice enough to split the plate.  Salads are always my favorite to start off a glutenous meal.  See the variety of ingredients in the salad in my pictuures?  As a meat lover the prosciutto was melt in my mouth with a nice serving of gorgonzola to make this meal really promising.    I ordered the crudo oysters and my husband was a fan.  Smaller in size, already cleaned and placed back in the half shell for our enjoyment.  Semi sweet, not too much of the ocean taste, which is a good thing.    We had the salume pizza, about the size of a personal pizza.  I wish it would have been crisped up more, but it was popping with flavor.  You can't mess that one up, but good dough and good seasoning makes this a popular dish to share.    My husband enjoyed the bucatini, but I thought this pasta dish was way too spicy for it's own good.  Topped with ricotta, I thought it was the saving grace for this dish.  We were forewarned, but it's definitely not my favorite dish.  For my main dish, I went with the salmon.  The buttery rich fatty goodness was the highlight of my meal.  My husband went with the surf and turf and all were cooked to perfection.    Just shy of $180, I thought it was a much better deal than what they offered for their tasting menu.  I'm not a fan when I can't really switch out the set tasting menu.  Some things just sound less enticing than the rest of the choices.   Overall, I'm still a fan.  Eat a little bit of everything is Giada's motto.  The only reason why we're here is for our special anniversary.  The view is amazing when the sun is setting.  I think Giada lucked out with this prime location in the Cromwell hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tricolore salad, gorgonzola cheese, kale, dates, awesome cuts of prosciutto, pictured of split plate

lTQqHYIytnC3MjQB6cgHaw.text: My husband and I love this restaurant.  The combination of the decor, cocktails, wine list, service and food is excellent! The salami and cheese plates are so good, and the white coffee gelato was very unique.

MeJOOzmLpcXOa5_OiQfa2g.text: I highly recommend trying the tasting menu at least once in your life, it's a great way to explore menu items and its a lot of amazing food for one person; with it you receive a picture of Giada and her autograph along with a couple recipes from the menu.   Yes, it's all pricey but the service, ambiance, and food is beyond excellent.  Everything from the starter bread with dippings to the dessert cart is flavorful and fantastic! I enjoyed the strip view too.  I can't wait to try brunch!

FG3QMrSNJmwaW6jBXg7z6Q.text: We didn't even make it to our seats. Upon arrival we were greeted by a 4 inch roach crawling on the walls. About 50 bread baskets were sitting ready under heat lamps (at a place this upscale the bread should be fresh) and we were assaulted by the smell of rancid seafood. Such a shame.

qjJYKXJRXFZZWZTxLE9XfA.text: Celebrated our pre valentine dinner last night and it was a great Giada experience. Seated by the table w/ the view of the Eiffel Tower. Forgot the name of our server but he was so friendly and accommodating. Food was great esp the Calamari. We loved all that we ordered. Will be back and will try their brunch next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wH413HtTasqke_FW17jeCg.text: We had a great experience! The restaurant is beautiful with every detail thought of. Check out the chandeliers and the napkins in the bathroom! We went for brunch and the bottomless mimosas come with a Prosecco lady who's only job is to keep your glass full. The food was awesome too and spoke to the flavors Giada loves like lemon, prosciutto, and basil. It was the highlight of my Vegas trip!

NiaFRTx3VV97MziOT9X5ZQ.text: We had a fantastic meal at Giada's Las Vegas restaurant!!! The wait staff is attentive and Nancy took good care of us! I ordered the pasta flight because I could not decide which delicious pasta to try.  It was an excellent way to try more than one pasta dish, and the size of each is just right! My husband had the seafood  risotto and it was creamy and delicious!! As wonderful as the dinner was, the lemon cookie for dessert (part of Giada's Cookie Plate on the menu) was over the top amazing! The cookie is light with a subtle lemon flavor and the icing is just the right amount  to seal in the lemon flavor.  This restaurant will be on my "must do" list for the next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

15_RoGVDY1zPa0F9ZPM6cw.text: I have been watching Giada on Food Network ever since I was a young teenager (over a decade now!).  I love her show, recipes, and products.  Basically, I'm a HUGE Giada fan.  When I arrived in Las Vegas for work, I knew that I had to try out Giada's restaurant.  I had huge expectations and was preparing myself to be WOWed.  Giada is located in the Cromwell, right when you go up the escalator.  It's a beautiful restaurant with lots of fanciness.  I had The Giada cocktail and a porchetta and spinach mini pizza.  The cocktail was delicious and the mini pizza was tasty, but nothing too out of the ordinary.    I originally was planning to order something more, but the service here is just annoying.  I only got a light snack because I don't like eating full on meals at bars.  I asked the hostess if I could get a table, but she said that since I was alone, I HAD to sit at the bar.  She was a huge grump and no smile or welcome at all.  If she had said something along the lines of they can't give me a table due to not having a reservation, fine.  But she literally said, "Since you're alone, you can ONLY sit at the bar."  Really?  That's odd to me.   The bartender was fine, but not friendly at all.  The atmosphere here is way too pretentious.  The hostess left a very sour taste in my mouth before I even was seated.    Despite my admiration of Giada, would I come back?  Nope.  There are far too many delicious places with excellent service on the Strip, so why deal with young snooty pretentious girls?

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KRtbXKPHC56KDQSpzoNCwQ.text: Awesome enjoyed every moment!Great place for a celebration! Took my mom there for her birthday and she had a wonderful time!The food was great and we had an awesome view of the strip.

4wPY7w9MnVp3XJw90vWeUg.text: Giada, I wanted to love your restaurant SO badly! But it just didn't happen.   Ambiance is great and I loved the decor of the restaurant. Service was a little slow from the actual waiter, but major props to the support staff who were on top of water refills, clearing plates, etc.   The food was okay, but nothing to get excited about. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend the restaurant because I think there are similarly priced options with better food. We started off with the fritto misto (over seasoned) and the meatballs (under seasoned). Their antipasti menu is vast and I would probably just make a meal out of items on this menu if I go back. The table next to us ordered cheese, salumi, pizzettes and it looked good.  For entrees we ordered the crab and scallop risotto and pea pesto tortellini. My friend liked the risotto but I was underwhelmed by the tortellini. The sauce was too lemony and I got no hint of tortellini filling or pesto. Bummer!   If you're a fan of Giada's it's worth checking out once, but go in with low expectations!

XeAEZENU9wFT3ehE9JTImg.text: The food at Giada's was fantastic, we got the fettuccine and risotto and the tiramisu cheesecake. But I was disappointed about the cleanliness of the restaurant. There were crumbs all over the table and our utensils were dirty. For the price and prestige of the restaurant I expected a higher cleanliness standard.

8EeJeW8NWurb_jUZkCuA5A.text: We came here for brunch on Super Bowl Sunday. It was a beautiful day and we were seated directly on the corner of the strip with a view of the Bellagio water show.  It felt like you were truly on vacation.  The drinks mocktails and cocktails were delicious.  I enjoyed the sweet potato pasta and pizza.  Will have to leave room for the build your own brownie cart!  The photo booth was a great touch.  Our reservation was an hour before they closed lunch.  We felt slightly rushed, our waiter was setting up tables for dinner so maybe was not as attentive as we recvd the wrong meatballs as ordered, recvd cappuccino after we finished our dessert and they completely forgot about the lemon ricotta cookies we inquired about.  Most were corrected but just a minor downfall to the experience.  I still would recommend as the overall experience was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zftONNkBX6AYphEMVedpDQ.text: Overall dinning experience was excellent. Our server was amazing and made us feel like we were regulars. We were dressed a little too casual for such a beautiful restaurant but our server treated us as if we wore formal attire. The food was great but I wish I would have ordered one more pasta dish since the restaurant is known for its fresh pasta. For desert the gelato is amazing; supper creamy. Here's photos of our entire meal from start to finish.

_qfWdgFikUrUMkrtqBzd-A.text: We had an outstanding experience. The service was incredible. From the hostess, to the chefs in the open section of the kitchen, to our server, Rebecca. They made our day! The food was absolutely delicious. We tried the pastry platter (polenta muffin, rosemary scone, chocolate croissant monkey bread, and blueberry cheese Danish), cavatelli, romaine salad, and sunrise polenta waffle without pancetta. I can say with absolute certainty that every bite we ate was scrumptious. They even made a simple romaine salad bright and yummy, with citrus dressing and fried capers. At the end of our meal we were provided with a lemon cookie and a chocolate peanut butter cookie with blueberry jam in the center. Both were also delicious. The ambiance was great. Our booth was surprisingly comfortable with an amazing view of the strip. Look up! The ceiling fans are pretty neat. Don't miss the photo booth outside by the host / hostess stand!

5T0MBZA0PZL9NpeXfCNbQg.text: My wife and I had Saturday brunch at Giada's and it was really excellent. Billy and Aaron waited on us and did an outstanding job. The food was amazing!!  We ordered the Brunch menu and everything from the apps to the dessert was incredible. I also ordered the bottomless Mimosa's and my glass stayed full!!  Giada should be very proud that her team, both front and back of the house obviously work very hard to protect her good name and deliver a fantastic product.   I would highly recommend Giada's to anyone looking to experience 5 star food along with 5 star service!!  JIM ACCORDINO

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mAkJUlmGfoLp_dHeEWb7Vw.text: I would personally give this place 4 starts, but since my husband complained he was still hungry afterwards, I'll settle at 3.  The restaurant is gorgeous! We went here in January for dinner at 8 pm and it has a beautiful view of the Strip that looks out onto the Bellagio fountains. Very romantic! We shared the antipasti platter and a romaine salad to start. For dinner we had a filet, fried Brussels sprouts and an order of spaghetti. All of the food was wonderful, but the portions were a bit small for the price. I also think we are just use to American size entrees...not what is actually served in Europe.  Giada did a wonderful job with this place!

jDA178UyM0e5kXB-Qmh6uA.text: A difficult review, start with the atmosphere....the most amazing view of any restaurant, beautifully decorated, five star service.  The bad side is the loud club type music, totally ruins the Italian fine (or even casual) dining experience.   The food, on the good side, presentation in all dishes was amazing.  The pasta was fresh, well cooked.  The bad, which was not bad it was just OK, 4 separate appetizers and none with a wow by any means.  Missing small stuff, no black napkins, plates so over used marks on them. For the price, worth dessert for the view but that's about it

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WId8O-HKZFdH6YnyCTluig.text: I really enjoyed coming here on my first day in Vegas for lunch.  The restaurant is beautiful and very welcoming.  It is pricey but my bf and I really enjoyed the food as well as the view.  We both had their sangrias, super good.  Then we split the sweet pea tortellini and lemon pesto grilled cheese.  Both were very light but filling.  Perfect way to start our trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a0dbTx4IAr19_k4hf9VHgQ.text: The food was amazing! We had a great experience. I got the lamb rack which was so flavorful and made beautifully and my boyfriend got the veal which he loved as well. The give you a little bread/cracker plate with dips which is DELICIOUS! and the appetizers were really good as well.

43wBIBdgUiBF3K_7h7cYQA.text: I guess if salt is her secret ingredient, then good for her. Mashed potatoes: salty. Beef tenderloin: salty. Bacon: surprisingly, the least salty item on the dish. I've never felt so negatively toward a restaurant that is located on the strip. Maybe the salt masks the horrible cooking. The staff came by with water constantly. Explains a lot.  The service is great. Our waiter was very pleasant. I would not come here again.

kw9TNvEKHlnmByBFYGeBkg.text: Dinner at Giada's at the Cromwell. You'd think with all the hype, and being a "celebrity" chef, we'd at least have a decent meal. I had a sample of pasta, and what big disappointment. Spaghetti tasted like Chef Boyardee. The Pappardele tasted like ragu, and odd and old. The Bucatini was too acidic. The pasta was likely precooked and not fresh. The risotto was mushy yet not cooked.  With such bad food, I don't even know why people come. Oh to say they went to a celebrity restaurant... we decided not to have dessert since we couldn't stomach the entrees. Disappointed

kC5cQsyhcXhgql8nByM_rQ.text: Had the Lunch Pasta Special and it was a Sausage and Vegetable Lasagna. If came in it's own little bowl and a side of Arugula salad. The Lasagna bowl didn't look big, but it was multi layered and dense with ingredients. The Arugula was tossed in a light vinegarette and perfect starter. Great lunch.

rYOPh_DjqPJcqnklaffycw.text: We came to Giada's tonight to celebrate a birthday while we're in Vegas. The birthday girl requested Giada's thinking it would be a nice way to celebrate her birthday. Decor of the restaurant is cute, service is excellent, but the food was beyond disappointing.  Everything we ordered was bland and the flavors were boring. I love italian and traveling to Italy for the cuisine especially are some of my favorite trips -- Giada does italian food such an injustice at this restaurant that it truly makes me wonder how this can be her speciality.   Between the four of us, we ordered a number of dishes to get a True sampling of the menu:  - Wood Fired Mushrooms: Meh. I love mushrooms but there was really no seasoning or taste beyond the natural taste of the mushrooms.  - Eggplant Parmigiana: Recommended by our server. Not terrible, not great, not really memorable. - Parmigiano Reggiano: My favorite dish. Simple cheese with wild sage honey.  - Salmon: Nicely cooked and flakey. Seasoning was okay as well, not spectacular but enjoyable. - 7 oz Filet: $60 of MEH. So unimpressive, bland, and boring. Everyone that tasted a bite of the filet had the same opinion --  disappointing. - Rigatoni: Interesting composition, not as flavorful as I was expecting but in a table of bland dishes, this still stood out as having a little oomph. Interesting take on vegetarian bolognese.  - Spagetti: Giada's specialty dish... should be taken off the menu and never served again to keep any self respect for this restaurant. THIS IS HER SPECIALTY! Dry, bland, and tasted like the pasta you cook at home after it has been in the fridge all night and the pasta soaks up the entire sauce and is left dry and blah. The lemon and basil in the spagetti were difficult to detect at all, the huge shrimp were pretty to look at but also lacked any seasoning. I mean seriously?! - Lemon Potatoes: nothing special. - Roasted Broccolini: i love broccolini and this was just that...basic broccolini with nothing to give it any pizzazz.   At about $300 for dinner, the worst offenders were the steak and the spagetti -- essentially dishes totaling $100 that left me realizing I would likely never return to Giada's. The service on the other hand was friendly, courteous, and on top of it. If only the food was up to par with the classy feel of the restaurant and staff. What a disappointment.

mFECarp4hexpJeFjHfUynQ.text: Awesome gluten free dishes, awesome service. Nancy was a great and helpful server! Best gluten free pasta you could ever find.

q8eJ9P7QXVWF95wO2acbjA.text: One star? Well, when the restaurant is as expensive as Giada's, there is no room for error. I remember when this restaurant first opened and it was amazing. The food was fresh and it was delicious and it was literally perfect. My favorite dish has always been the rack of lamb. To be specific, I have been to the restaurant nine times and have had it seven times! The last time that I was there, it was just OK. This time, today, it was a disaster! Is there a new chef? Am I missing something? We started with the Verdure antipasto: medium size for $49. It is mainly vegetables in different combinations. It also contains olives. It was good. The initial bread that came out was OK yet, as usual, very oily. My friend ordered the yellow tomato soup which had a very tiny amount of soup but was OK to taste. She went ahead and ordered the seafood lasagna and said that it was absolutely disappointing as the seafood was overcooked. She is a seafood fanatic so if anyone knows proper seafood, she is definitely at the top of her game. She was disappointed and said she would never get the dish again. As for me, I ordered the rack of lamb. I ordered it medium and it was practically medium raw. The worst part is that it looked like it was rotting as it was breaking down off the bones with a lot of fat on it and just very unattractive and unappealing to the pallet. It looked old like it was wasting away rather than fresh delicious lamb that is properly cooked. To make it worse, there was this cold quinoa concoction along with it that was just disgusting. Cold quinoa with warm lamb??? Not to mention, again, the lamb was terrible. $54 for a dish that was as good as a bad dish that was $25.00 at a Denny's or Fridays. The bill, and we had no alcohol, came out to $160. No dessert either! When the prices this high, the quality better be phenomenal... It was anything but phenomenal. I am so disappointed in this restaurant and will not be coming back. I contemplated, as did my friend, calling the manager over to tell them how bad the meal was, but we were not looking for a free meal. We also did not want to make a scene. Quite frankly, my thoughts on it I don't want to restaurant is this expensive, there is absolutely no room for error. Today, huge errors were made. This restaurant is no longer worth the money that it charges and I would not recommend it at all. Unfortunately, this restaurant was a very poor presentation of the chef it represents. I will say that the service was nice. We had a very nice waiter and I felt bad because it was obvious to him that I did not really touch a lot of my rack of lamb but I was not saying anything and I think he was trying to be polite as well. Therefore, no complaints about service. I have lots of complaints about the quality of the food and the price associated with it. Therefore, not recommended.

9f5Vmf1-3U-_XEeBZYkFUQ.text: Thae quality is really good but the portion of the food for the price a customer pays is really sad.

0jh3NHPoPlfaEaN2tmw21w.text: Ambiance is wonderful, the service is prompt and a lot of attention to detail.   Nancy our server was so attentive and very knowledgeable to us new comers.  The food is delicious and very filling.  We loved our experience and would definitively be back again!

yncXj7CtV1GYYrrO1BYfDA.text: I was super excited to try out Giada because of the previous reviews and pictures I had viewed on Yelp and because of Giada's reputation in the culinary world (I just love her!) However, I was not overly impressed with my overall experience when I dined here for breakfast a couple of weeks ago.  I made a reservation for 2 people on a Sunday morning, so when I showed up right on time, I was surprised they weren't able to seat us right away since we were one of the first tables there. They told us it would be about a 5-10 minute wait... I would have understood this if they were just waiting for their full wait staff to show up for the morning shift, however they kept seating other tables before us that had actually arrived after us. After about 20 minutes of waiting around, I finally went back to the hostess stand to ask what the scoop was, and she rushed around a little bit to finally get us seated.  The restaurant decor was absolutely beautiful though, with so many "Giada" details throughout the space. Giada signature tableware and even Giada signature cappuccino cups and saucers. These little touches were great.  The service was extremely slow. Our server would disappear forever before we could track her down to order more items. Wasn't my favorite.   We started with the Breakfast Pastry Assortment... $15 and not really worth it. There were maybe 2 items out of the 5 or so that I actually liked. Our entrees were good though; I went with the Italian Hash:  potatoes, bacon,  salami, peppers, tomato, onion with sunny side up eggs & toast. Felt like a cleaner version of "hash" compared to what I am used to in Texas. This plate was $19...  kind of expensive for a breakfast item... but then again, this is Vegas. My boyfriend had the American Breakfast, which was fine... nothing special. So for some lackluster pastries, two entrees, two coffees, and 1 over-priced mimosa, the final bill for breakfast came out to $100 after tip.   Not sure I would suggest this spot to anyone. Happy I tried it, but doubt I will ever be back. Sorry Giada :(

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Hash

iPn_m5AYjlPsHdqeg3UgbQ.text: We had dinner here.  Didn't make a reservation but we were able to sit in the bar area almost immediately.  Right away you can see that this place is all about quality.  You can see the hand made noodles hanging in the kitchen as well as fresh rolls of Rosemary focaccia coming out of the oven.  We started with the Bucatini which my husband and I both agreed was the best pasta dish we ever had!  It was just cooked perfectly al dente and the flavors were just incredible!  It's a must order!    Next we had the whole roasted chicken (for 2).  It said on the menu "as featured in Food and Wine magazine".  This was one of the reasons why we came here.  Well the chicken looked and tasted amazing but when we started spooning the cacciatore sauce on it we started noticing that there were pieces of pork in it.  We quickly checked the recipe from the magazine and it didn't list any pork.  (I should also mention that my husband and I don't eat pork products).  We asked the waiter and the manager about it and they were both confused.  Turned out that the kitchen just recently started adding the pork.  Well then, don't print "as featured in Food and Wine magazine" because they also have the recipe with the article.  They felt so bad that that they gave us a dessert on the house.  We chose a leaning tower of chocolate and espresso gelatos.  It was like a cheesecake made of the different flavored gelatos and then they made it leaning as part of the presentation.  It was pretty amazing!  Overall, I thought this place was great!  Even though the sauce for the chicken was messed up, the chicken itself and the bucatini were just fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leaning tower of yumminess!!!

wI6Rp96qvaTTyjSBReNRGw.text: I don't know why this place had such a low score. My husband and I went for dinner to celebrate his birthday. Not only was the food amazing but the customer service was spectacular. Lindsey was our waitress and she was so friendly. The food was light and delight. I recommended treating this restaurant as a three course meal. Amazing

HvmqEjZ4-3a23uorOV1DfA.text: You come across few places which leave ever lasting impression. Giada lives up to it's name. The staff takes time to explain the options on the menu. And would give there suggestions as per you palate. We had meat and cheese platter and veg platter. The meat platter had prosciutto wine cooked beef chesse of different type. The mozzarella chesse just melted in my mouth the moment I ate it. And for main course I had lobster with side of zucchini. The bread was loaded with lobster meat cooked inside a bag put in boiling water. So the lobster is cooked in it's own juice. The bread was crisp even after 20 minutes of serving. And the way lobster and bread mix in the mouth is like mesmerising  jazz happening performance happening. And yes most of the desserts are freshly made on order. So don't miss it I recommend this place whenever you visit Vegas as a must to visit

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat platter

JeXkqVxS8YQfxjuz3rY78Q.text: My boyfriend & I went here Saturday evening for our 1 year anniversary. Beautiful restaurant, very classy & elegant, great decor. When making reservations I requested a table by the front window so we could have a view of the strip. I was told we wouldn't be guaranteed that unless we spend $100+ but they would still mark it down as requested. We ended up getting a window seat but it was towards the back where the shutters cover most of the window so we didn't really have a view. Didn't think we would spend over $100 but we did so we should've just guaranteed the spending of $100 when making the reservations & maybe gotten a better view.  There's a free photo booth in the waiting area which I thought was cute & a nice touch.   Service was a little slow. We weren't in any hurry but I felt it drag a little bit. We were treated very nicely.  Pricey. Food was very good. Heavy but small portions. I got the rigatoni & my boyfriend got the spaghetti which came with the biggest shrimp I'd ever seen/had! Both dishes were very good & again different than your traditional spaghetti & rigatoni.  When making the reservations I told them it was our anniversary & for dessert they brought us a cute dish with 2 of Giada's famous cookies, lemon & chocolate with "happy anniversary" written on the plate. Very cute! (Lemon cookie was delish!)  I will be going back again because I'd like to try the brunch menu.

ZokLJMvalEf0FIAgB-GriA.text: Amazing amazing amazing!!! My new favorite restaurant in vegas!!! If I could give it 10 stars I would. First off the restaurant is beautiful. Very modern with a hint of a homey feel. The views are terrific and the food is perfection!! When for brunch and had the strawberry waffles it was fantastic. So tasty and even looked as good as it tasted. Will be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

JZED5RBSsBeTUPHnSBqIwQ.text: What a lovely evening.  Great views and interior.  Food was wonderful.  Our server, Radislav, did a great job!!

NUnlWJ8evT16PDOGQJKvdQ.text: Finally ate at Giada's with family.  Food: Tasted good, but not great. There was simply not enough seasoning. The food presentation was excellent. The Risotto was flawless (minus the 100 peas). However, they add 2.8 thousand peas to everything. When a manager asked how we liked the food, I mentioned the excessive amount of peas included in every portion. He responded "That's the number one complaint we receive, but we're working on it". I thought to myself, "how hard can it be to reduce the number of peas?" The Tuna, was great but the scallops that each of us received were undercooked quite a bit. The lemon potatoes were very dry and management thought they were just not hot enough. So the manager brought out a new batch of lemon potatoes even though we had a full bowl of them still sitting on the table and,,, we were in the middle of eating dessert. He had a good heart though.   View: Spectacular  Dessert: it looked great but had very little flavor to it. I searched for the taste of sugar throughout. There was just a hint of that ingredient.   Overall: We won't eat there again. We simply expected great tasting food and that didn't happen. Compared to Hell's Kitchen and other restaurants, Giada, missed the mark overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K8-LDPRYc8zxDMjMiZQY4Q.text: Unfortunately, Giada really has declined in the quality of their food and service. We were on time to our reservation and were seated 20 minutes late. In addition to the tardiness, our company was sat in the bar area which was a huge letdown. The seating didn't feel formal at all. Our server was horrible but his assistant server was wonderful. He did everything he could to mend the horrible service we received with the main server. The manager also tried to help and did an excellent job but it was pretty much over by the end of it.  The food: Steak was excellent, most dishes were average in flavor but he fish and Cacio de pepe were horrible in flavor, texture and overall quality. Very disappointing considering all the choices in Vegas.

oOaOK6y4ADCqkT0b-RLD5Q.text: We stopped in for a solid weekend brunch. Very good service and very nicely done restaurant. Both of our meals were good but the prices were quite high for what we got. Even for Vegas where everything is expensive, this was a bit much.   Overall a good meal, but not good enough to support the price and bring me back.

u1TQgZFbnVNe3D_UbcNmVQ.text: I had a fantastic experience dining at Giada. Everything was great: the food, the service, the ambience and the view were all top notch. What really set the experience apart from the rest, however, was the sommelier, Aaron Gross. Aaron is very knowledgeable, incredibly helpful and just an overall great guy. If you're in Las Vegas and serious about wine, definitely make a reservation and ask for Aaron -- you won't regret it!

OqtWERTWamUVAoBS0D1tQg.text: We have been here several times.  Each and every visit has been phenomenal.  My favorite thing to eat is the meatballs.  I dip the bread in the sauce, and I cry....with joy!  Great location.  Tastefully decorated.  In fact, I ended up purchasing 8 of the glasses.  I would have purchased the placemats as well, but I didn't want "Giada" plastered across the table at my next dinner party.  It's fine for the restaurant; I get it, she's a celebrity chef..... I know this is a review of the restaurant. Restaurant is wonderful, but I really want those placemats (Giadaless)  (no offense) (think she's great), now that I think about it.

sWEaniriHrSGBSKHaRSSsQ.text: I will give you this.... presentation means a lot but if it doesn't satisfy the palet, you are not doing the job.   The meatballs were good but come-on - this is an Italian restaurant - the meatballs should be good. Not the hardest task to accomplish.  The Risotto - pretty tasty.  Cacio e Pepe Bucatini - the presentation was nice. The flavor lacked.  Sweet corn & spicy sausage (side dish) was the best thing on the menu. But - it is a side dish.  Please, remove Ravioli from your menu. Mediocre at best. Over zested and not very good. Barely palatable.   The veal was pretty good. When you mask everything with too much cheese, it is just OK.   For the price - I could have eaten anywhere else in Vegas and should have. A beautiful restaurant but the food was just OK.   I will have to say - the "celebrity chef" thing is a bit overrated.

QSloHfYpcA_S8MVpieeqGg.text: Robert and Vincenzo at Giada in Las Vegas we're terrific. We felt like royalty with attention given to us during our meal. The bucatini is quite spicy but delicious. The ambiance and window views add to flavor of the meals.  We will certainly be back!

-eAXZvmDFYe0GbIwwx_4mQ.text: Fabulous restaurant with great food and ambiance! More specifically, Billy was a fantastic waiter. He made great recommendations to us, paid the perfect amount of attention to us and was simply a joy to have. He made the experience at Giada extra special

pZelZ14uxbbhElCk9pUOLQ.text: The food here is not good enough to be this over priced, three sandwiches and a piece of chocolate cake was almost $100.  10 out of 10 would skip again.

hIdO_ptfm-v4iv2TNd-UjQ.text: Went there just for desserts . Got the summer berry almond pannacotta and the tiramisu baked alaska The pannacotta was amazing with layers of toffee pieces, sorbet . The tiramisu had loads of alcohol .

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
