8vI2Gx-_eFlBMiXaD0EC5g.text: Got the best table in the house, had an awesome brunch and saw Giada herself as we left. I loved the salmon patty pouched egg plate. I was hesitant because some salmon taste too fishy. This was perfect! No fishy smell at all and and it was crispy and delicious! We shared a chocolate chip pancake but it was too sweet for my taste. Nothing special there. I tasted the potatoes that my friend had as a side, not much flavor.

DmVwx58b-hofAwsgbHzZ2A.text: Absolutely fabulous experience.  We will definitely be back.   The food was out of this world.   Very unique taste to the menu items and the presentation was great.   Our wait staff was equally wonderful.   Keep up the good work.

hD4AFCl6l_ryF_SiBMbQ-Q.text: Where do I start besides that I loved watching her show so why doesn't her food taste as good as it looks on tv...   Lovely decor, a unique photo booth, super cute napkins, plates, silverware, glasses, a 'G' symbol on desserts, nice touches & the windows surrounding the dining area open out to the strip.  New Years Eve of the Caesar's fireworks... fabulous!  28oz Bone In Tuscan Rib-Eye w/ a sunny side up egg & the Milanese Style Veal Saltimbocca are the best menu items.  (Sinatra's is the best for Veal fyi)  A glass of wine paired w/ Cheese, Salumi & Honey Board is truly what I recommend.  Enjoy the ambience w/ Parmigiana-Reggiano, Wild Sage or Raw Pear Honey & Bresaola, served w/ Apple, mustard & bread, yum.   Why one star? The Sausage Pizzetta was undercooked & tasteless.   The Mushroom Arancini's are not creamy melt-in-your-mouth like they look on her show. They serve & recommend the Caponata, which is like a mushy ratatouille w/ everything.  Why?  I think they even put it on the Muffuletta, which ruins a picture worthy sandwich.  If you get it ask for none of that, whatever the binder is.  Mayo would be better.   Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese w/ Heirloom Tomatoes, ok, not memorable to order again.   Pork ragout Pappardelle, I don't think is on the menu anymore, it was over cooked. Tiramisu comes in a cute espresso cup w/ hazelnuts & a powdered 'G' on it.  Perfect size since I can't eat a whole tiramisu.  It's creamier than tasting the lady fingers texture that I really like about tiramisu. The Bacon Rosemary Muffins look good & some breakfast items do to.    Over five trips to Giada's for lunch, dinner & disappointed more than half of those times so I'd say cheese & wine only!  All of my meals were comp'd w/ my Total Rewards card.  I have given this restaurant many chances cause I was in disbelief.  And the few items that are good, are not worth coming back for because someone else on the strip is knocking your socks off.

1uMdVX-Oj8AttcgrIDnWTA.text: Brunch at Giada was extremely disappointing!! The food was terrible, lobster hash seemed like only bell peppers made it! The pancakes were dry, over medium eggs were more like over-hard.  We ordered a seafood platter the crab salad was more like a shell salad! I rather just watch her cook on tv and assumed the food is delicious rather than spending $600  I should had just gone to a regular basic restaurant and had the same hi g for $100 dollars

869UgBiHoooKqKLUysY5ag.text: As a huge fan of Giada, I had very high hopes for this place. I was not disappointed! Rebecca was our waitress and she was wonderful. She was friendly, quick, and so attentive. I tried the orzo meatballs and the grilled cheese with the arugula salad. Everything was wonderful and every last crumb was devoured. Other things to note are the decor is absolutely gorgeous and they play AWESOME music.

XwRP55PBR0N345Z79uB2Dg.text: First we walked in without reservation on a busy night and we got seated almost immediately without any problem.  Service was absolutely awesome by both of our servers Jesse and Robert.  Menu selection and food was very good as I expected pasta was cooked perfect  and my wife's dinner was also excellent

abEMqBz0RbyxRha7vxwnGQ.text: This place is incredible. Walking in the entryway, you're met with grandeur.   I was in Vegas for business with a group of girls and we were a bit early for our reservation. The photo booth in the waiting area made time fly - and the decor was incredible.  We were promptly sat at what is arguably the best view in the house with a full view of the strip.   We wanted to try everything, so we tried the Ricotta  Crostinis, Bacon Wrapped Dates and Tomato Arancini.   The ricotta crostini appetizer was the perfect balance, nice and light with a hint of sweet stemming from the ricotta/honey combo. The bacon wrapped dates were a favorite, particularly if you like a hearty app. The tomato arancini was addictive. We ate every single bite.  We shared the Cacio e Pepe and it's a True show. Brought out with a large cheese wheel and made table side, this was legit the best cacio e pepe I've ever had.   We had desserts, but honestly the rest of the meal was the star of the show. Hats off to this fab spot!

2awo4gqUxbslmMMtvOLfdA.text: I would like to preface this review by stating that Giada is one of my favorite Chefs in the world. I went to the restaurant with incredibly high expectations as I make so many recipes of hers at home. The food was just okay. The salad wasn't anything special and the risotto was gritty and overcooked. I was hoping her risotto would be amazing. It wasn't. The best part about the whole meal was the bread service, which was in fact amazing. Homemade bread with delicious dips/toppings. Fantastic. Overall, the portions were extremely small and we left feeling disappointed. Quite a bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-pa0NAyDi4176E8QEqKsBw.text: Love her on Food Network Star and some other shows, so of course had to go to her restaurant while we were in Las Vegas. Too start out with, I went with the Summer Caprese Salad which was very crisp and tasty! For the entree, went with  Veal Chop Saltimbocca which I thought was a little over cooked, but still pretty good. And for the desert, knowing that this is one of her strong suits, I went Strawberry Pistachio Tart as I can't pass up anything Strawberry lol. She (My wife) went with Arugula, Salmon (which I took a bite of and was perfect) and for desert went with Chocolate Hazelnut Crunch Overall, the food was pretty good, didn't disappoint me like Guy Furi's burger joint did, and I would recommend this place!

df0HZ4Q9IivJEi6eZfjN0A.text: Going to Giada made for such a lovely, personalized dining experience! I called about an hour in advance to make lunch reservations, and they were able to seat us by the window with a view. On the phone, they asked if the reservation was for a special occasion (it was for an anniversary), which was where the ~magic~ began.  From the minute we walked in, the host greeted us and wished us a happy anniversary: a sweet and personal touch. While we waited for our table (as we had arrived a few minutes early), we took pictures in the photo booth. Our server then showed us to our table, and we ordered from the brunch menu.   Unfortunately, there weren't a lot of vegetarian options other than the salad - and no substitutions could be made - but the options they did have were marked as vegetarian on the menu, making them easy to find. I ordered the cavatelli pasta, which tasted delicious, and my partner and I both had glasses of the house sangria, which was sweet and crisp, but tasted a bit diluted because of all the ice. For dessert, I used the Yelp check-in offer for a plate of cookies, which they decorated with a chocolate-piped "Happy Anniversary", which was the finishing touch on our personalized dining experience.   Overall, Giada exceeded our expectations. Despite the fact that they couldn't do a lot of vegetarian substitutions, their tasty food and personalized dining experience and service (from start to finish) were truly one of a kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L9atMHAfstNUL_2lZ76iMg.text: Had a great diner experience last month. Excellent food and service. Had to wait a little because they ware busy.

Dy4YAIU49Vp95hvHNujXYg.text: My wife and I were really looking forward  to this new experience, but were  somewhat  disappointed. Had reservations and still had to wait 35 minutes to be seated. Food was nothing to brag about. Good ambiance. Not a very good value.

ozoGPlP3rMqXrEllBdunaQ.text: Came here for lunch. I ordered the Tuscan Kale salad and chicken meatballs. The salad was good. The meatballs were a little dry.  For $14, you get 6 small meatballs. The meal was not memorable. The ambiance was nice, but I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

rzAfSjApYooq3wXl3O2bgA.text: Seating was very slow. There were many tables available, but it took about 15 minutes to be seated.  Also took a while to get drinks, but once food was delivered, things changed.  Pizza was very good and service improved.

01XUd2yR70kD6nGEzwpGYw.text: Made lunch reservations to test drive before inviting dinner  guests. We were made to wait 20 minutes before being seated despite reservations. The menu is limited & pricey. We tried appetizers as well as several entrees. Worst part was the partially uncooked lobster in the lobster roll. The taste was unremarkable for all items & certainly did not reflect the prices charged. The wait staff were great although the hostesses were clearly not trained properly to make their guests feel welcome. No apologies for the extra wait. Needless to say we went home  & called in to cancel our dinner reservations later in the month since we all agreed that they need to work out some flaws in this new place & I prefer they don't waste my time & money.

-NyntodCPDjfVNKfdM2ujw.text: Amazing experience! Food was so tasty and friendly staff! I want to go again but I live 3k miles away! Giada....Please open a restaurant in Washington DC!

o2U74fIlA0vQKe724Qw7Mg.text: To summarize the food we had was great the service and waitress we had was terrible to say the least.  We tried to make a reservation ahead of time and of course it's very busy because it's a brand new and first giada restaurant.  We were informed by the hostess to come in and try to get a seat in the bar area as it was not a very busy night. Beware if you sit in the bar area it is a different menu than the regular dining.  We arrived and checked with the hostess and she showed us where we could sit in the lounge next to the bar. This is when the terrible experience started.... Keep in mind this is a Tuesday night and while all tables were full it was not busy other than that.  It took around 15 minutes to first be greeted by any server. We then got greeted by one server and got told another one would be around right away. 5 minutes later she came around.  We informed her that we would be eating in the lounge area and ordered drinks.  My girlfriend had a bad dairy allergy so we thought all of the vegan options on the regular menu would make this a great place to go.  Unfortunately the lounge menu had no vegan options, when asking the waitress for possible options without dairy she suggested ONE appetizer and was not knowledgable at all. When asking about other items she said she would check with the kitchen.. While she did that we ordered the one item.  We also asked for the bread provided to all customers who are dining which we NEVER received.  A kitchen staff brought the one item we ordered out and it was delicious.  Our waitress finally came back 10 minutes later and did not give us any information on the non dairy items nor did she bring over any bread. I did not want to wait any longer so I asked for the check stating that it didn't seem like the dairy allergy could be accommodated.  Meanwhile I know from looking at the full menu there are vegan items. The waitress did not even try and stop us from leaving or ask kitchen staff for recommendations.  It was truly a bad experience.    I had very high hopes for the restaurant. And it was the most anticipated dinner on our vacation. But to avoid my girlfriend being embarrassed or trying to deal with terrible waiting staff I can say I will not be coming back or recommending this to anyone else.

I9ynt_7Cy_LCT90YTh7OHg.text: Our server Dave was awesome and made our experience perfect. He was so accommodating to our dietary needs and made great suggestions. Our food was delicious and we really enjoyed our meal.

pBt52tnfjoa3nUhMszj7FQ.text: We had heard rave reviews and went with a group of six for our friends birthday. I loved the ambiance of the Restaurant and the service from being greeted by the manager to the bussers was top notch. The lamb was amazing as well as the spaghetti and bucatini which were al dente and just great. All the ingredients were fresh and just about everything we got was amazing. I only rated a 4 because the portions were a tick small for the prices even though we were on the strip. Great spot though all and all.

9getiPvdDzIdILe8si2j_g.text: This was my second attempt to love Giadas restuarant and it was even more disappointing than the first 3 years ago. After all the bad reviews of charging up to $35 or more for 1\2 cup of pasta hasn't changed.  I ordered the tortellini with asparagus and artichokes. With the few items on my plate to make up the entire dish I thought I only had a couple tortellini.  When I questioned the waiter about it, he proceeded to pick up my spoon touching my plate saying "there's a tortellini, there's a tortilini, there's a tortellini...ok sorry there were 5 dime size tortellinis that looked to me like the 1/2 small tomato that was in the dish..I found that way of answering to be a bit rude.  (He did offer to make me another dish, which I declined but he insisted and did not charge).  We also ordered the "smashed" lemon potatoes which I had my first visit and was very disappointed to find they were no longer smashed lemon potatoes, but roasted fingerlings w/Parmesan cheese.  When I asked the waiter about the potoes he said they were the same...please...I loved them so much the first time I looked up Giadas recipe and made them myself..this was not the same dish. The desert man came by with his cart, he deliberately bent over to one of the people in our party to say "do you always look like your mad after eating".then walked away and never came back...who does that!!!!  I was hoping for a redemption dinner from my first expierence, but I won't be back and won't be recommending this resturant. If I'm going to pay these expensive prices I expect an amazing dish, one that exudes the talents of a master chef...this was less appetizing than the family Italian resturant we might frequent on a causal night.

necHI-BW0jnAhKC8AHQ09w.text: Came here and sat in the lounge/bar to eat food. Our server was a lady with black short hair. She never told us her name. It took 10 min for us to get water!!! Her service was very slow and she made us we feel like we weren't there. She took forever too get us water and bread. And then when my lobster ravioli came...it was 6 raviolis for $36. If I knew the plate was going to be so small I would of ordered something else. It was honestly a rip off. Save yourself the trip. This trendy new restaurant is a sham. I guess maybe the service would of been better in the dining room. But cocktail waitresses should have some sort of service training.

yluNxcWZbFX6nkdf5GRnBg.text: Love it here.  The service is impeccable. You need to make reservations. Place overlooks the strip. I had the lobster roll. Loved the pizza I had the spicy. The expresso drinks are amazing. I will be back

uKktAUivl-kkZx5l8SwbTA.text: By far our best meal in Vegas. We went there for lunch and were very impressed and satisfied. I had the red sangria which was perfect for an afternoon drink. Absolutely wonderful experience, our server Victor was very friendly and personable and delivered excellent service.

W11bP20A_pkY1VYhIgpxBw.text: Second time here, much better this trip! Food was amazing! Had the bucatini .. Very very good, excellent wine menu salad and quite a large dessert selection, service is over the top

lu7bfzG1BdPRltBnfPY97w.text: Ok, so my friend made a reservation and asked for table by the window... Instead, we were in the corner, BUT  food was great and service was great!  I am allergic to gluten and dairy (so sad...), but they were accommodating!  According to my friend, they asked if we have any allergies when she made a reservation.  Lauren, our server, was friendly and quick.  I know server should be "serving" us, but she really gave me the impression that she wanted to take care of us.    I would go back again. : )  oh, I also loved the decorations and all the details that Giada put into the restaurant.

F7g_j7LJ6cLLUMUKrp13Hg.text: Service was excellent, our waiter was good but our busser was on top of it. The food was very average, the bread was probably the highlight of the meal. They had dessert carts instead of made-to-order desserts. all the desserts were pre made, so I wasn't too crazy about that. Overall we still had a great time.

KWpI_eDxP4d-k8E_yuaiUQ.text: Small portions,very expensive but great fancy place... very romantic invoirment. The service a great our waitress was very friendly and nice.we had all the deserts on the Manu it was sooooooooo good...she specialist on deserts...love the surf and turf Amazing,will be back

LubDmmMRv-Tfkv2jLEIgKg.text: We had the absolute BEST waffle of our lives here! Called the Sunrise Polenta Waffle, we were mesmerized by the crisp bits of pancetta baked perfect inside, and smothered with beschamel sauce and the most extraordinary chamomile-vanilla bean infused maple syrup and topped with two eggs sunny side up. To. Die. For!! We also had the Italian Hash which is great as well. But that waffle... Oh. My. Additionally, the ambiance was fabulous with touches of what felt like home, and the most amazing aroma from two wood-fired ovens. Service was fabulous, food was incredible, and overall, Giada was by far our favorite breakfast in Vegas.

7pSkA2TXMC1nXWVex43c4w.text: It was reservation for 1, for myself of course, on Sunday, August 3. Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted with the most pleasant energy from the staff. I loved the tour of the place before seated at my table. I absolutely appreciated meeting the manager, Avi, during my stay and the wait staff was wonderful. The menu presentation is current and unique and the bread tray was delightfully unexpected in design. I ordered the seafood risotto, a dish I had been eyeing leading up to my restaurant visit. I love how the spice/ garnish tray complimented my meal, with mini bowls of capers, red chili flakes, pesto, and grated Pecorino Romano. The dish was the right combination of savory and salty and truly satisfying as I hope it would be. Very minor detail of the night that could use improvement - filling my water glass. Water was my primary beverage for the evening and rarely had someone come over to make sure my glass remained filled. But that is just a minor detail that can easily be fixed. All in all, my experience was fantastic. Best customer service I received ever from any place I've eaten. I am coming back next time I'm in Vegas. And I'm bringing friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dinner selection for the night- a seafood risotto, complimented with Giada&#39;s signature bread tray,

lbAibi81m1FqHLt1QelRdQ.text: The wife and I decided to check Giada's restaurant out as we were walking the strip.  We were greeted by the hostess and grabbed a seat at the bar.  Service was exceptional and the staff seemed to emulate Giada's enthusiasm (as seen on her show).  I had a glass of both versions of her sangria.  They were both very good.  My wife had espresso drink that was very good as well.  We shared some cheese and meats as we dropped in for a snack.  I like the decor of the restaurant.  It definitely has a Giada feel to it.  My only complaint is that the restaurant is a bit overpriced when compared other other restaurants in the same class.  All in all, a place to definitely check out.

2oPrgS4DUnu42T710uRhDA.text: Tip: make an open table reservation!! But they don't allow you to get the points from 6-8  Super super underwhelmed with this place. I feel like just like most big name restaurants, you get good quality food served in a very unnatural and non palate pleasing manner.  Came here with a Groupon because I had always wanted to try it but the prices are quite pricey (entrees ranging from 30-65$) Wanted to try and make a reservation for sitting by the window to enjoy the view, but was told that you need to spend 150$ per person to sit there: we had 4 people so they expected us to spend $600 which was ridiculous.  When we arrived we were sat in the back of the restaurant (probably due to the groupon) and had no view or was even close to the window.  TIP: When you check in- the whole table gets a free sparkling wine- they were serving proseco that night.  Food ordered was: 1) appetizers: - orzo meatballs: $15 very bland meatballs that were covered in red tomato sauce- super underwhelming and not tasty- not recommended- 5 meatballs were served about 1 inch in diameter- not the meaty/veal/ground beef umami taste I expected- more like dry turkey meatballs and orzo  - eggplant Parmesan: $12- 2 very small slivers of eggplant broiled with scamorza cheese and covered in red sauce- not recommended  2) pasta sample platter (x2): a small small small portion of pasta- less than a small fistful of pasta 36$- me and my friend ordered one each so we could try them all - lemon caper spaghetti- I personally hated it but my friend loved the fact that it was a new flavor combination and the zesty garlicky taste felt fresh and not heavy or expected- SUPPOSEDLY with shrimp but both mine and my friends order has no sign of shrimp in it -bucatini: very spicy and more spice than taste- both of us disliked it- kinda mango spicy tangy - rigatoni: vegetable bolognase- mine was personally had a burnt taste- overly roasted  - the last one was my personal fav: served with braised beef and basil- long noodles (don't remember the name)  3) branzino- served with olives and tomatoes- super crispy and white tender inside- Def recommend  4) Salmon- nothing special- served on top of a risotto or something- broiled- plain- no taste, was tender but def needed seasonings  Overall the food was subpar, service was great don't get me wrong, but I would never return or recommended this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta flight
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzini

AKmxeeXDaSiE0M6BYIQymQ.text: My sister and I came to Vegas for a sisters' trip and enjoyed our first meal here. Reservations are basically a must (open table didn't seem to work for us so had to call), walking or uber/lyft recommended since parking is expensive at the Cromwell. Giada is located on the 2nd floor so follow signs, look for the escalator. Decor is gorgeous, love the huge floor to ceiling rounded windows with perfect view of the Bellagio fountains and rest of the strip. My sister and I split the cheese wheel pasta, which was so amazingly and decadently delicious. Enjoyed that they plated it tableside, surprised that they gave us the entire wheel (it was a mini wheel, not like the giant parmesan wheels we were thinking about), and portions were huge so we had leftovers to munch on for the next day. Complimentary bread and dipping sauces was nice, free yelp check in for sparkling wine splash was cool, service was decent (our main waiter was a little snotty but the others seemed pleasant and helpful), looks like they can cater a mix of party sizes, lots of conference folks but could also envision a proposal here too

HoHkSzDrxclBhyBKooVC3g.text: Located inside the Cromwell casino / resort. Giada is a very nice looking restaurant. When I came in, I felt like I was immediately transported to a modern restaurant in Italy. They had a wood fire stove going on and displayed some seafoods, meat, and cheese. Yum!  I had a reservation, and upon arrival, I was seated immediately. They use iPads as menus for drinks.  The food was pretty decent. I ordered the chicken Marsala meatballs and was satisfied!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-vJKnj-CcGfvq8awNiby2Q.text: The view is across from the Bellagio so great view of the water show.  The service of the personnel is amazingly attentive.  My girlfriend ordered the spaghetti and it was cooked perfectly al dente with great seasoning.   I ordered the risotto and it was completely overcooked.  desert was good, nothign to write home about.  May come back in the future but not my first choice of restaurants here.

9NZDXqBuvD_8d8w3OmwKqQ.text: Totally disappointed.  I had higher hopes for this restaurant when I booked a table for brunch a couple of Sundays ago when I was back in Vegas for work.  I was only able to enjoy a few times out during my work trip, and it was recommended for brunch, so we gave it a try.  I love Giada's TV personality and her carefully crafted selections whenever I catch a glimpse of her show.  Now, yes, I get it, her name is on the door and she may have stake in this establishment, but sadly, only the decor was a reflection of how I imagine her to be.  The service and the food, not so much.  I'll preface this review by stating that we were in the restaurant for a total of 2 hours and 15 minutes.  When we arrived a few minutes early for our 1pm reservation, the table was still being prepared.  Five minutes or so after 1 we were seated.  The restaurant was barely half full as it's later in the day.  The view overlooking the corner of Flamingo Rd and LV BLVD is a sight.  Bellagio fountains across the way.    Our server was friendly enough and went over the menu, we took a few minutes to decide.  She may have gotten distracted, as we didn't see her again for another 20 minutes.  My friend orders a coffee drink and I, a grapefruit juice.  I alert my server of my allergy to peppers, and ask if I could do the salmon cake benedict without the piquillo peppers, and she   complied with my request.  My friend orders the same thing with peppers.  We don't order any starters, as we will be having a large dinner later.  Our beverages arrive, and then about a half an hour later (tick tock, tick tock, immmm.... knaws off my own arm in starvation), the server returns only to inform me that there are peppers in the actual salmon cake mix.... So, I order the Breakfast Contadina (since the other 3 options I wanted had peppers in them too)... although this $21 brunch entree better be good for that price.  I feel bad as my friend and I are just sitting there, hungry.... It's 2:15... ho hum    A server (not ours, she's been MIA as I've been wondering where my food was) comes over and nearly drops the plates on the table (accidentally) but scared the bejeezus out of us, and all our neighbors look over.  Apologizing profusely, but I was AWAKE now.  My friends dish looks so much better than mine.  Serious food FOMO.  I look at my sad wilted spinach with tomatoes in a cup, and the water pooled at the bottom... then to my eggs (clearly overcooked and browned - see photo), the smallest cup of fruit and the polenta cakes.  As my friend is eating her dish, and she admits it's only okay, the cakes were a bit dry... and her Prosecco hollandaise (looks like grits - see pic, not creamy) doesn't eve have a hint of Prosecco flavor.  I look around, and for minutes, I'm literally waving my hand in the air to grab anyones attention!    Finally after 5 minutes or so, I am greeted by Mina?  (possibly a manager), while pleasant enough, I tell her that I am not happy with my overcooked eggs, she proceeds to tell me that they are not overcooked, and this is how they cook them.  I doubt Giada serves up browned eggs that are heavy and not fluffy. (I don't recall her eggs ever looking like that on the Food Network). Mina is happy to ask for the chef to prepare soft scrambled eggs.  It's not a matter of the actual scrambling, it's a matter that the eggs were overcooked and started to turn brown, not fluffy and light yellow.  Scrambled eggs in the dictionary - a dish of eggs prepared by beating them with a little liquid and then cooking and stirring gently.  The eggs I received were either A. cooked on too high of a heat B. using the wrong pan or C. leaving the eggs on the heat too long making them slightly fried.  If I'm wrong, please check out overcooked scrambled eggs on google images.  At this point I'm downing the spinach, which is tasty enough, but watery at the bottom.  The strainer must have Sundays off.  The only savior on the plate were the amazing polenta cakes.  Even the fruit was a bit sour.  The eggs were eventually replaced, we finished our meal and had to flag down our original server again.... by the time we paid the check (they took nothing off), and I'm not looking for a free meal, but waiting two hours for some scrambled eggs and some watery spinach for $21 plus I think $9 for juice.... DUDE

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 11/2017
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 11/2017
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view

_Y5nes3tOHws-HMXTt6vBQ.text: This is my 3rd time eating here and the service at this restaurant is probably the best I have ever had....anywhere.  Robert and Katie were awesome at the bar!  I had a white cosmo and it was delish!  Dave was our server and he was great!  They bring out an amazing presentation for the bread and you get two types - a rosemary olive oil and a cheese crisp type cracker. This is served with a variety of toppings.  One of the appetizers we ordered we didn't like and Dave quickly removed it and replaced with another.  If you like mushrooms, don't miss out on the wood roasted mushrooms - best mushroom dish ever!!!    I always have the bucatini and this last time I was disappointed as it wasn't as spicy as it normally is. When I mentioned this to Dave, he told me that "they had to tone it down as people thought it was too spicy" but he immediately brought me out the Calabrian chili to spice it up and it was much better.  My husband had the crab and scallop risotto and he said the scallop was cooked perfectly but he didn't taste any of the crab in the risotto.    Make a reservation as this place is hoppin'!  There is a photo fun booth in the entrance which is a fun touch; you email your photo to yourself.

8FeLmSuPAYqQka9Rgzl9uA.text: Was finishing up a work trip in Las Vegas and opted to go to Giada as a coworker is a very big fan and wanted to live vicariously through me - so I indulged. I came at a weird time where it wasn't lunch or dinner but grabbed a seat at the empty bar where there was a snack menu available. I ordered a variety of snacks and the bartender was super helpful in helping me pick a variety. I ended up with an arugula salad with candied lemon and pancetta (yum!) and a plate of 2 meats and a cheese which came with raw honey, mustards and apple. Everything I had was great! Obviously I didn't get the opportunity to delve into the full dinner menu because by then I was full but before I left I felt like I needed to give dessert a go. I ordered the cookie plate and honestly, those were damn good cookies. Lemon ricotta were totally worth it but what really shocked me was described to me as a peanut butter raspberry? Whatever it was, I was impressed. If I'm back in Vegas, I'd definitely head there for a dinner or brunch to be able to try more items. In the end, what made Giada even better was the top notch service! Bartenders, Rick and Giovanni (Jovaughn?) were very friendly, helpful and attentive. I think some of the friendliest bartenders on the strip!

ZVrk5tGaLEPCg9SbxugaFg.text: I was really looking forward to this dinner but was not as impressed this time around.  It took forever to place a drink order.   Service was a bit off.  After spending $110/person, most persons left hungry.  They were stingy with bread, I'm not sure if bread is the item they should be saving money on.  Appetizers and salads arrived and were served simultaneously.  We would have preferred them as separate courses.  My waiter cared more about selling me more wine and left me to sit in dirty dishes after checking back two times.  Most pasta entrees are served at approx. 5 ounces and cost what you'd expect to pay for a huge portion.   I was also disappointed that their tiramisu was tiramisu cheesecake, we tried it but it was not great.  They also did not have my favorite italian liqueur at their bar.  For $110 per diner, I am sad to say that most of my party was a tad bit hungry soon after.   Lastly, they hit everyone in my party with a gratuity.  We finally left dinner past 9 pm from a 530 pm reservation.  I need to speak up when asked whether I have anywhere to be after dinner -  we did not have a show to catch but I lose major interest after the 2 hour mark when in Las Vegas, and there is some love lost for leaving me to sit in dirty dishes.

U7JpRkbw0TwMRlIvVsmBkg.text: I bought a travelzoo voucher for dinner at Giada's, which was a credit towards dinner for two. It was a good deal! Our server was efficient, however she was really pushy on us to order more. We chose the Cacio e pepe bucatini for two at 64$ and our server kept saying, most people would order another main with it etc. We dont eat too much and we felt really pressured and uncomfortable! And guess what? We didn't even finish the pasta. I swear unless you have a massive appetite dont listen to them when they try to upsell you. I felt like she was trying to make us spend more to give a bigger tip or something... it was so bizarre! I lowered the rating because of the service, I don't like going out to eat and being judged, maybe it was because I used a voucher.The dinner was delicious and almost theatrical as it arrives in a pecorino wheel and they serve it tableside. Very heavy and creamy!

ylCdPs1c5cjIYeG1bI_0mA.text: I surprised my mom for her 60th bday with dinner at Giada's(her favorite chef). We had the bacon wrapped stuffed dates which we loved. We also tried the pizza and the fettuccine with shrimp both were very flavorful. I loved the open space ambience and the light decor. Service was fantastic! This place has so many little details from the moment you walk in there's so much to see and read. I would definitely be back here to try some of the other dishes on the menu.

diJxkUxQDFgY1MIdHPYwvw.text: The absolute best breakfast in Las Vegas ! Finally came to try their breakfast and was not disappointed at all! I ordered the salmon Benedict & bellisimo cocktail and for dessert the double decker cheesecake brownie. Absolutely everything was amazing. My husband and I will now be coming twice a month for our treat out for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gnZcqw7m1QVskPqW7fS72Q.text: I really wished I could say that I liked this place. First off, if I know I'm spending a lot of money, please be sure to offer good food. The food was just OK - not worth spending $500 for 4 people.   I spent my "golden year" 29 on 29 there, and apparently the server also knew, but we were never even given a birthday dessert or even a candle. How disappointing.   We ordered the orzo meatballs for $20 bucks, which were miniscule pieces. The taste wasn't anything special.   I personally ordered the Branzino, and since I'm not too familiar with this term, I thought it would be a similar style to a Chilean Sea Bass - nope, just fried fish with tomatoes that you can get at your local fish store.   From our entire table, I must say that maybe the lobster ravioli was the best, which was not even that great, and it didn't even fill any of us up. We had to walk over to Giordano's at Bally's later on to satisfy our hunger after leaving Giada's.   Well...I guess I could say at least I've been there!

oQCqeBV-9hEND5943WzhMQ.text: Top 5 best meal ever. The ambiance is great. The seats are extremely comfortable. We had the crab arancini as an app and it was amazing. The complimentary bread basket was delicious. We had the risotto and lobster fettuccine. Both excellent and delicious. We finished the meal with a berry panna cotta which was very good. Service was good. We loved it. We are already planning a return visit!!!

vcYx8BFfMraNN9-LNfGh-A.text: I'm often disappointed by high-end restaurants and this was no exception. Our friends went prior and highly recommended Giada's, but I think the difference is that when the boss is there, everyone in the restaurant delivers top notch service.   We went on an ordinary day for dinner and there was no Giada. We were seated, and sat for a while before being greeted. Once greeted, we were immediately given the wine menu. We sat, and sat, and our server came to take our wine order, except she never offered us a cocktail menu. We asked for a cocktail menu and the drinks were either a hit or a miss. The first thing you do in a restaurant is offer the drink menu...isn't that the easiest way to earn revenue?  Then we proceeded to order our main dish. We ordered the fried chicken, spaghetti with shrimp, lemon and marscapone, the octopus panzanella and lobster ravioli. While we waited for our main dish to arrive, we were given one bread basket with 4 pieces of bread the share amongst the 7 of us. When we asked for an additional bread basket, we were told we had to finish the first bread basket before receiving another and got a funny look. How lame is that when a table of two receives 4 pieces of bread like we did, but a table of 7 also receives 4 pieces? We complained to our server, and she indicated that's the rule. No need to be conjuice Giada!  Anyhow, the bread was fabulous, the ravioli was good, the friend chicken was nothing out of the ordinary, the octopus panzanella was just okay, and the pasta, which is a Giada signature, totally fell flat on flavor. You couldn't taste any lemon and it tasted like a boring alfredo. We did order all three sides and they were good, but nothing special. But I must say the corn and sausage was delicious.  I was so excited to try a celebrity owned restaurant and this was a big disappointment. I've often made Giada's recipes with great success, so I was looking forward to this experience. But totally not worth the money or the hype. I heard the Bobby Flay restaurants are all consistently great. That's where I'll go next time.

TXo7NMpuROII-v6TlIdRtA.text: This was our first visit to Giada. We arrived at 6:00 which was perfect time to see it go from daylight to nighttime during our dinner.  Our table was against the window looking out at Bellagio and Caesar's.  Our great server Joseph suggested we try the special tasting menu which was $120 pp. - we were so glad we did as it was spectacular. The only downside is that we were so full that we had to take our dessert home with us. Make your reservations well in advance and ask for a window table. Truly a unique experience with fantastic service and delicious Giada food.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything beautifully prepared
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spectacular view of strip
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our great server Joseph

JqWU83vjk71AgecXAxXOnA.text: Came from Texas to visit to Vegas to celebrate a new career opportunity and knew for sure where I would be dining while I was here!  Visited Giada's on 7/21/18 and had the pleasure of Rocco M.'s wisdom to guide us to just the right selections. If you ever find yourself at Giada's do yourself a favor from the start and ask for a Rocco table!  Rocco expertly steered me to the Risotto with crab and scallops and it was incredible!  The atomsphere, view, service . . . everything was topnotch.   My best friend and I had such an amazing meal that we came back the next night (7/22/18) and asked to be seated at a " Rocco M" table again!  This time we had the added bonus of having Saji helping us out for the night.  Between the two of them we had another great meal and were also able to pepper them with every " Giada's " question we ever wanted to ask . . . which they patiently answered!  Thanks for going the extra mile, Rocco and Saji!   Showing that those hailing from the great state of Texas do indeed do things bigger, the Manager ( who hails from San Antonio) even stopped by our table to say Howdy to his fellow Texans!    The second night, to save room for desserts, we had 2 Antipasti, Corn Arancini and Baconwrapped dates. I am sure I will never have another dessert as good as the Salted Caramel and Berry Panna Cotta.  Overall, Giada's did not disappoint and we will be coming back!

nYYIwQMMmTF5xxxQr0DzNg.text: Father's Day Brunch 2017  Wait: ~30 minutes without a reservation around noon.  Ordered: Rise and Shine Juice $9 The Brunch tasting Menu $45- Assorted pastry basket, antipasti platter, Italian Chicken & Waffles and cacciatore sauce, and Limoncello Souffle with Creme Anglaise  Wait for food: longer than I've experienced (during the dinner hours). Asked server about the delay and she stated they were having "issues in the kitchen"  The food: Since opening, I have always been a fan of the antipasti at Giada's & the platter is a must-try every time (esp the bacon wrapped dates!). Rise and Shine Juice was refreshing with a nice balance between all components (not too much celery..thankfully). The Italian Chicken and Waffles utilizes the same chicken offered as 'Whole Roasted Chicken for 2' on the dinner menu, chicken pieces were drier than I've had at Giada's previously, but it is a hearty portion in comparison to some of the other mains offered. Limoncello souffle portion is plenty for two..more than enough for one. A great ending to a satisfying meal.  Service: Spotty at best. Our servers seemed overwhelmed with the brunch crowd and rarely checked our table..despite passing by it in order to reach their stand. In the past, we never had issues with getting our drinks refilled..however, this time around we only received refills if we waved one of them down.  Overall: 4 star brunch experience minus 1 star for lackluster service. I'll probably return for dinner.  P.S. Don't forget to swing by the photobooth (to the left of the hostess stand when you get off the escalators)
