We also got a meat plate and it was amazing. the pasta is home made and delicious. must get- Chicken Marsala Meatballs, Burrata cheese, Prosciutto di Parma, Pappardelle  pasta. There was so many great things to choose from! I never watched the cooking show, so I didn't feel like it was over hyped. it was just really great food!

l5ZfYbcSpnN0v94UQgGBHQ.text: Wow, not very good at all, surf and turf was not good at all, tortolini was OK but tiny, tiny portion actually embarrassing, wine list and service was excellent! !

iAbV97k7V54JX679wOc2Vw.text: To tell you the truth we didnt get in. We called to make reservation (ph on webpage) and guy told us to walk in. Rude lady at entrance sent us away, said its been booked for a month and was unapologetic about our misleading ph call, said we probably dialed wrong. Totally unacceptable. Very disappointed... sharing this with all my LA friends

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rude one was the one in black behind lady in red. Lady in red not helpful either

jbfpD2eFAhMKgFPS8eH71w.text: 3.5 stars.  I told myself I would write more reviews for this last foray to my favorite city, but writing a review for Giada is tough.  There are equal amounts of pluses and minuses in my mind....and the fact that Giada DeLaurentis is my fantasy woman (don't tell the wife) makes this review especially difficult, but here goes.  You need to make reservations well ahead of time.  Right now, this restaurant seems to be the hottest thing around and even calling a month ahead only got us a 10:15 p.m. reservation.   The Cromwell seems nicely redone.  Leaving our taxi, we walked through the casino to the escalator leading straight up to Giada.  It was bustling even at 10:00.  While we waited, we took advantage of her photo booth-a definite thumbs up!  The restaurant, like the woman, is beautiful and so......tasteful.  Should we expect less?  Our table gave us a partial view of Caesar's and the Bellagio. Clientele were well dressed except for one party of 4 dudes in shorts, jerseys, and baseball caps worn backwards.    Giada opened her windows, letting in the cool fall air.  Good in theory, but a few things worked against the ambience.  First of all, the restaurant was a bit noisy considering the beautiful people dining....ahem.  On this night, sirens cut through the restaurant every few minutes.  (We found out later that a distubance had occurred downtown.)  Our waiter seemed to know his stuff and had a wry demeanor I liked.  The problem was his timing was not in synch with ours.  For instance, he was ready to take our drink orders when we were still deciding between a red or a white to go along with our food.  When we decided, he was gone.  I know we could have used the iPad, but neither the wife nor I could get it to go where we wanted it.  In general, everything was a little slow....ordering, drinks, food, coffee, check.  We were always waiting......  The food was perplexing.  Servings were small, but ingredients were quality.  Tastes were innovative, but not necessarily what I wanted.  For instance, I imagined the Crispy Oysters Rockefellers would be spinachy, cheesy, and bacony, with a rich sauce that I thought would be crisped up somehow.  (My vocabulary is growing!)  Now maybe I'm wrong, but although the oysters were fresh, they were cooked in what tasted like a mignonette sauce (wine vinegar).  I think the crispy part was the bacon.  So it was refreshing and different, but not what I was looking for.  The same thing happened with her spaghetti with shrimp.  I wasn't expecting that much lemon so the first bite surprised me. The rich. cheesy pasta needs to be eaten hot. It grew on me as I ate and while you might think there isn't enough shrimp, they are quite large and cooked perfectly.  I should have asked more questions about each dish.....at least then I wouldn't have been off balance so much.  I would give the food 4 stars, but service gets only 3 stars for all the waiting......I still love you, Giada.......

9gJgZp2e8xmx00CISVUz1Q.text: I used to eat at Giada's grandfather's (Dino) restaurant in Beverly Hills. This family knows great food!!!! Don't miss this place. It's hip, DELICIOUS, and reasonable. Impeccable food.

b25esQNVrRDab-XcUCeUqA.text: Restaurant is pretty and food was OK. I'M not someone that minds spending money on a dinner, but when I pay fine dining prices I expect 5 star service. When we finished dinner and asked for dessert menus our table was dirty and they never wiped it before setting our clean dessert setups down. So when our desserts came to the table there were chunks of cauliflower and onions on our table. Not OK. Check came and table still not wiped. I watched a hostess shoot breath spray in her mouth in the middle of the dining room while waiters were first bumping each other...I might expect this at cheesecake factory but this place should be a higher standard. Top notch restaurants in this city where service is outstanding and a lot of attention to detail.

FkzSae8OuSyGcgxIt3DSxA.text: I love Giada and decided to try her restaurant with my bestie. The ambiance is great and the view is gorgeous. A great place to have a romantic dinner. The food is good and in a pricey side. I had the house lasagna with the arugula salad. It was delicious! My bestie had the mufaleta and she did not like it. I thought there are better mufaleta in New Orleans, LA. Desserts are great.

l-eDvt7vK95mOlDObqsVHw.text: We arrived about 20 minutes before our reservation, and I was told I would be called when the table was ready.  For our reservation we were sat right on time with the requested window table. Menus were delivered to the table right away, and drinks were taken after we had a minute to view the menu.  Our server, Nancie, was right on time with everything.  From the timing of appetizers to wine and bread, all was perfect.  She was completely fine with us taking our time between courses, even when we had the best seat in the house overlooking the fountains.   My wife and I had a couple different orders of crustini (both which were great), oysters, and finished with Spaghetti and Ravioli.  When we placed our order for the pasta, we asked Nancie if she could put that order in after we had a bit to enjoy the view and our cocktails, and she was great to do so.  I also asked her for a nice full bodied glass of wine that she would recommend, not wanting to review the menu again, and she was quick with exactly what i was looking for.  Our pasta and sides (sweet corn and potatoes) were perfect and the experience was great,  Ended dinner with one of the best cups of  double espresso i have ever had.   This place was top notch with service, food quality and expectation.  Nothing missed on taste, presentation, and timing.

89j7PnvK4gHuON8owtSjog.text: Well, that was disappointing.  My husband and I came here to celebrate our 7th anniversary after finally scoring a reservation at a reasonable hour. We'd heard mixed reviews and lots of bad ones regarding the service, but we generally care more about food than service anyway so didn't pay much attention.  The main positive at Giada is the food. Bread was good. For the first time ever, we actually finished everything on a salumi & formaggi plate. It was delicious! The tortellini was fantastic, as was the chocolate tart that few restaurants get right. My husband's bucatini was good (but not unique), but being so upset about other aspects of the experience, he won't admit it.  Now the negatives. First, we had to wait an extra 10 minutes after our reservation time to be seated. This wouldn't be so bad if it was the only problem. But when we were finally seated, it was in the crappiest seat in the back room. So much for the cool atmosphere.  The hostess and our first server both wished us a happy anniversary and were pleasant enough. However, after taking our order, we never saw our server again. The salumi and formaggi platter came out quick enough, but it was about 45 minutes before we got our tortellini and risotto. Only problem was we didn't order risotto. It should've been bucatini. When we told the next employee who finally walked by our table, he said he'd tell someone but no apology. A new server (we were never informed our old one was gone) came out to say they would get the bucatini ready, but we could snack on the risotto. Well, I don't like scallops, and my husband is in the process of finding out about a possible shellfish allergy, so we weren't doing that. Still no apology.  I tried to put off eating my tortellini but didn't want it to get cold so ate it in very slow motion. Long after I finished it and it was taken away, the bucatini finally arrived. Once my husband started eating it, the server apologized and said the first waitress entered the ticket incorrectly. At this point, my husband's mood was ruined.  Once he was finished, the server said he was checking with the manager to see if we could get a free dessert, which she approved. Most upscale restaurants-- or even Applebee's for that matter-- give us a complimentary dessert for our anniversary anyway, so that offer was annoying. Maybe they don't do that there though, so whatever.  What I know they DO do is at least write "Happy Anniversary" on the plate, but that didn't happen for us. The chocolate tart was very tasty though, and I was happy they weren't afraid of making it super sweet. The manager came over later to apologize and tell us the dessert would be complimentary. Yeah, yeah, we know. She seemed nervous and like this was her first restaurant job.  The only attentive part of the service was the guy who constantly kept my water glass full. I saw a woman at another table drop her clutch, and instead of handing it to her or saying something (she hadn't noticed), the busser kept kicking it under her table without acknowledging it out loud.  Also, when leaving a good restaurant, employees generally step aside to let customers pass. At Giada, I almost got mowed down by the busboy.  The food was really impressive, but the unprofessional service (or lack thereof) was a huge turn-off and made the constant waiting not really worth the time. Some of the issues were minor, but the way they were dealt with was immature and not standard in a high end restaurant. I doubt we'll be back. Luckily, we have another anniversary reservation at CUT tomorrow, where we can rely on service that matches the food.

usvFDKZBdgTyuSRe7BcdSQ.text: love love love! I've been here a few times and it gets better and better! The staff is so nice and the food is amazing! The decor is clean and has great views of the strip! I got pasta with the prawns, it was delicious!

h9gwbz6CsLL1wg0WL1GNYw.text: This place is a second tier Italian restaurant. The staff did the best the could with a kitchen that cannot deliver. Our entrees arrived over a ten minute period without our sides.My ravioli was desiccated with no moisture left in the pasta and over cooked lobster. The veal portion was huge and was eaten cold because we were waiting for the last entree to arrive.  Over priced and incredibly average. Good thing Giada is famous, because this restaurant could not survive on its own.

iB5O0w2YxbCPjuI9CaY0Ow.text: I waited weeks for a dinner reservation and on the evening that I was finally able to dine here, the service was impeccable, the setting was beautiful, and the cuisine was no exception! The entire dinner was about 3 hours long, but it was a delightful 3 hours because the setting, the wait staff, the food, the cocktails, and the company I was keeping were key components to my enjoyment that evening. The bread board is delicious and consists of focaccia and cracker breads and is served with 5 spreads; lemon butter and pesto were my favorite spreads. Burrata cheese with Balsamic salt and chicken Marsala meatballs were the appetizers we chose and we  did not regret our choices! There are many great selections on the general menu, but we decided to go with the tasting menu. An antipasti plate with bacon wrapped dates, cheese-stuffed peppers and tuna tar-tar crostinis start you off, followed by a second course of your choice of either lemon spaghetti or vegetable Bolognese. I selected lemon spaghetti because I make lemon spaghetti at home and naturally, I had to try it at Giada for comparison...it was great---as is my own if I do say so myself ;-). The third course is a choice of either salmon on a bed of summer succotash with whole grain mustard (my choice and it was delicious), or Sicilian roasted Colorado lamb (I tried a bite---also delicious), or Farroto with fava and morels. The sides were smashed lemon potatoes and a dish of sweet corn with spicy Italian sausage...they did not disappoint! The tasting menu was very filling...AMPLE portions! If you go with the tasting menu, you can select 5 desserts from the dessert cart. Unfortunately, I cannot remember the name of one dessert that I particularly enjoyed; although, the lemon ricotta cookie was another favorite from the dessert cart. I left with the recipes for the lemon ricotta cookie, and two pasta dishes, which were a gift if you ordered the tasting menu...I was tickled pink to get that cookie recipe presented in a special Giada envelope and an autographed Giada photograph. This might not matter to some, but I thought it was a unique touch that I've not been offered at other restaurants. On your way in or out of Giada, note that there is a small room with a black curtain by the escalator...it is a complimentary Giada photo booth! Be sure to take advantage of this complimentary feature and take home a souvenir photo strip...the machine will shoot out two copies for you to preserve the memory of your visit there! :-)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A portion of my 5 dessert choices from the dessert cart...a yummy truffle and some kind of mouth-watering strawberry creation
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corn with spicy Italian sausage and smashed lemon potatoes side dishes at Giada
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sicilian roasted Colorado lamb

Tv6UJ-rIMBZsRht_I9CAhA.text: Despite having an 11:30 reservation for brunch, we had to wait 15 minutes just to be seated. We started out with some coffee and the pastry basket, which took another 15 minutes to get to the table. Ordered 3 waffles for brunch. 45 minutes later and no waffles. Our waiter, Billy, didn't even bother to check on us during this time or give us an update as to where the food was. As he was nowhere to be found, I had to flag down the manager to ask her to cancel the order, and as I did, the waffles came. She was at least extremely apologetic and comped the waffles, but the wait was unacceptable for a simple order. Waffles themselves were good, but nothing special. And FYI, the restaurant is trying to improve their Yelp ratings via the check-in offer. Basically, if you check-in and write a positive review, you get a plate of cookies. Just something to be mindful of.  Overall a disappointing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla latte

1Hkjitv7wKZsPZwdHRjA1A.text: The view of the Bellagio fountain is really cool. I didn't care for the food here. It wasnt outstanding for the price. This place is a new twist on Itailian food. They also don't do white/cream sauces which are my fav. Everything here is miniaturized. They want you to order the food in courses. I ordered some pasta and paid 50 bucks for my plate and it wasnt bigger than my fist. We left there hungry. Bread was the best part of the meal. Drinks were overpriced as well

StSvBCnBbTayy49IT1_eoA.text: Amazing dinner to celebrate our anniversary! We did the tasting menu with wine pairings. Each dish was superb. We loved the seared tenderloin crostini as an appetizer. Melt in your mouth delicious. We definitely did not leave hungry and can't wait to go back again. The lemon ricotta cookies are a must try for dessert. Our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and always made sure our water and wine glasses were full. Great place to celebrate and enjoy fantastic food.

J_FBWO-xULcd3NjZTZW7Jw.text: We did the brunch tasting menu. It was amazing! I expected to enjoy it but didn't expect to walk out stuffed. Service was wonderful as well. Next time we'll be back for dinner. Love the photo booth, too!

fnqDsd0aC5OAmPJq2ibiwg.text: Maybe we just mis-ordered, maybe it was a bad night, but this was a big letdown.  Our server was barely engaged in waiting on us.  Rude and truly wanted to be somewhere else.  Started with the artichoke.  Just a long-stemmed artichoke with a little olive oil and lemon.  Nothing exciting.  Then we ordered the veal saltimbocca with came with a tidbit of tomato sauce tiny little ramekin. We had to ask for more.  At $57.00 this should have been better - it was nice be needed to be sauced.  Would not got back.

NPS3YYX2dhuqMWY2Jy-1xQ.text: We are fans of Giada's cookbook and show, hence the visit to the restaurant for dinner. It's located in the Cromwell and the view of the strip and the nearby Bellagio is nice. We made a reservation and they were over 30 minutes late to seat us. The drinks in the bar were meh but Yelp check-in gets you a splash of prosecco. Now for the food part. We ordered the octopus appetizer which was the best part of the whole meal. Perfect--smokey, tender, sauce amazing. Three people in our party had the branzino for a main course. It was perfectly cooked not over or under done, which is not easy. Here's the bad part--zero seasoning, zero effort to make it delicious. The menu said it was served with "citrus braised escarole & caperberry relish." Nope. Decorated with a tiny piece of escarole and a drop of relish. Maybe you could ask the chef to at least use some salt and pepper? This dish costs $39. If you are going to charge this for one piece of fish, it had better be amazing and it was just a giant disappointment. I had the lobster ravioli which actually very good but an appetizer portion. Now the service. The waiters wear these retro white tux jackets. When your dish is ready a parade of servers comes out following the white tux person and ceremoniously places your dishes down. Giada has the mechanics of the kitchen down as the food temperature and timing were perfect and it's a big place. But our female waiter, while efficient as heck, was robot-like and cold. With the exception of the hostess and cocktail waitress, I got the feeling no one cared if we were there or someplace else. We were not even offered a dessert menu.

-ztopZjHPFDgZ4RLQqRYyw.text: I have decided part of my bucket list is to eat at as many Food Network Chef's restaurants, as possible.  My first was the D Bar Denver, where I live, owned by Food Network Celebrity Chef, Keegan Gerhard.  My second restaurant was Giada's, in Las Vegas.  I made our reservation on Open Table the day before and were able to book the time just 15 minutes outside of what we were looking for.  We arrived, were greeted by the hostesses, and immediately shown to our table.  Our waitress, Tina, showed up minutes later welcoming us to Giada's.  You could sense her dedication to her job, her love of Giada, and pride for sharing with us the menu, guiding us to what we would most enjoy eating for lunch.  Our table faced the strip, but also the mountains beyond the strip.  The windows were open, and you could faintly hear the bustling on the street below as people were laughing, talking, and walking by.  Giada's decor is warm, welcoming and if you take time to really look around, you will see thoughtful meaning in every aspect.  Her flower print chairs have what I refer to as, kitchen cupboard handles or pulls, on the backs~ perhaps making it easier to pull the chair out for someone.  Her slatted window blinds are ceiling to floor and are BIG, but really beautiful.  Her lamps have phrases cut in them, and her bar shares a glass cooler where beautiful olives, cheeses, wines and breads are on display.  Behind this bar is a burning wood fire oven and next to it is fresh pasta, hanging in rows in a glass case.  Our lunch of salads and lasagna were delicious.  Beautiful presentation, just the right flavors throughout each bite, nothing overpowering any of the other ingredients.  As we were enjoying each bite, I turned around, and there was Giada; standing on a bank of steps which enters part of the dining room.  People in the restaurant began to walk up, shake her hand, hug her, tell her how much they loved her, and of course have a photo with her.  She welcomed each person as though they were coming into her home and were friends.  I was so impressed to know she exudes the same warmth and love you feel sitting at home watching her show through the television!   Giada is real, down to earth, grounded, caring and grateful.  We were sitting close enough to overhear most of her conversations with people, and she just kept thanking them for choosing to dine in her restaurant and thanking them for their compliments.  She probably stood there for 35 minutes greeting people.  Wow~  I returned to eating my salad, and somehow, it tasted even better after watching her, meeting her and realizing how authentic Giada truly is.  While I still want to eat at more Food Network chef's restaurants, I'm somewhat leary that it will just never compare to my experience here.  I guess we will just have to see~  If you are ever in the Vegas area, you must come try this restaurant.  Even if Giada happens not to be there, you will feel her not only through her food, but in the manner in which you are treated by her staff, the humor in her pepper grinder, and the subtle thoughtfulness in her decor!  I personally can't wait to come back from breakfast and dinner sometime!  Grazie mille e tantissimi auguri per il tuo locale ed il tuo successo!!  Diane~ Denver, Colorado

5K8zQ-Fm8z_XjlMFlwvCjQ.text: Expect to wait past your reservation time.  Place was crazy busy arriving a little early for a 6:30 reserve on a Thursday night.  Checked in at the front desk and was seated right around 7pm.  Felt extremely lucky to find two seats in the bar area while we waited.   Tasting menu - antipasti was good.  Bread service selection to start was freaking awesome.  Three bite sized samples off the antipasti menu made for a nice variety and a light first course.  Pasta, then main plates were surprisingly big.  Could not finish the main, and boxed the dessert selection for later in the room.  The food was good, it was just big servings.  Are they catering to middle America that wants a big place of food for their dollar?  Perhaps we just did ourselves in enjoying the bread to start.    Summary - beautiful place, good food.  You won't get surprises here, you'll get Giada's classic dishes prepared to recipe.  She did a really good job of translating her brand into a restaurant.   Next time we'll stick with our instincts and get antipasti, salad and pasta, period.

sDsBIAOmc-8lg_gfMQIUtg.text: A new low, even for Giada.  I was in Vegas last weekend with a friend who didn't want to miss eating there.  She made a reservation for a window table many weeks in advance.  The night before our planned dinner, she got a call from the restaurant asking if we planned to spend at least $100 per person because those are "premium" tables.  At this point, I would have told them to stick their table but she said yes. So we ate there.  Magnificent view, so-so overpriced food.  We wound up spending $90 per person.  I was afraid they would add $20 to the bill.  I DO NOT understand what this place is so popular.

dOiI4u18ow0-fpSD1iXMmw.text: Hostess were very pleasant and helpful. We loved the photo booth idea while waiting. Restaurant is beautiful. Sangria lacked in the wine department, very refreshing drink but not made well. Way too many people walking around not doing anything productive or even asking if we need anything or if we are ok. We wanted to order something and no one came to help us.  Food was ok, not full of flavor but if you are looking for something refreshing and light, this is a great stop. Probably won't come back but we appreciated the experience.

DYLiSnCx8KOzgsVpgyDo0g.text: Husband and I were thinking about having a brunch so we opted for Giadas at Cromwell, which we have never been but love her cooking shows, etc. Perhaps the Dinner (which we haven't tried)  is better but I wouldn't eat Brunch here again because of service and quality of food. We arrived around 9:05 am, shortly after opening at 9 am. Took 10 minutes to get seated in a near empty restaurant as it had just opened and there was no crowd; there were only 2 other tables with couples at them. The Hostess just smiled dumbly, seeming a bit confused but polite enough. Finally was seated and we were approached a long time later by our waiter.  By this time, a few more tables and the bar was filling up. Mind you, it was early, we didn't see that he had any other tables to serve but a couple. I motioned the 'Senior Waiter' who was training another person and asked if we have someone take our order. His response was "I've important things to do. I'll see if I can get you someone." Waiter finally came over, took our order, super slow....meanwhile the other tables are getting their water, coffee and juices and eventually food with their waiter. We are not. It took 20 minutes for us to get hot water. I ordered the flavorless Lobster Hash; it could've been the same at Denny's. Hardly any potatoes or lobster, just peppers and 'onion confit', which I saw no special 'confit'. Eggs were requested over easy, I got something harder. Toast (dry) came with my entree but no jam or butter came with it until I requested it. That finally came when I was nearly done with my hash. I was underwhelmed. Staff was slow and not super willing to be helpful or say they were sorry. Food was less than mediocre, somewhat cold and flavorless. It resembled warmed up leftovers. I wanted to like it but first impressions are everything.

IL0j-oj48esfYtItipXxyQ.text: I didn't know what to expect going to Giada.  I'm a fan of her show however there are mixed reviews about this restaurant.  I give Giada 3.5 but rounded up to 4  Preface: I came with a party of 9 and a baby  //Food// Amazing! Everything was pretty tasty.  We ordered an large appetizer to share.  I'm not exactly sure which one it was but it included what I believe was Giada's "favorites" like Crostini, bacon wrapped dates, wood roasted mushrooms, eggplant, olives, etc.  Favorites: 28 oz bone-in ribeye.  Holy moly was it huge.  The sunny side egg just made it even better.  My husband thought it was a bit salty and his was overdone which is why I took 1 star off.  He didn't send it back because service was SLOW...he was starving so he gave in and ate it the way it came. Pappardelle - it was perfect.  Pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce was flavorful.  I also had our server add a bunch of parmesan cheese on top.  It was amazing. I forgot what it was called but we had a hazelnut chocolate tart for dessert to share.  It just hit the spot.  Everyone had a couple bites and it satisfied our sweet tooth.    Risotto was good but I generally don't like risotto and my cousin liked her lobster ravioli which I didn't taste.  //Service// SLOW.  I loved our server Joseph.  He was great however food came out extremely slow.  I was also disappointed that they didn't offer any birthday desserts.  When you spend that much money, it's a shame you can't provide them with at least a cake and candle on the house.    //Highlights// There's a Photo Booth in the waiting area and you can have them emailed to you.  The printing option wasn't available when we went.

lilszFTeD3YhAxMWCyVz_A.text: Siiiiiiiiiiiiiiigh. This is going to be a long review so brace yourself, but this is probably one of the worst experience I've had with a restaurant for a long time...  It was a good start. The restaurant is nicely decorated with an open kitchen and a swanky set up with an option to be seated at couches, tables with great views of the strip and Bellagio's water fountain, and also a back room for a large party.   Well, and that was the good. Yea, sadly that's all it was for us. Let's begin with the downhill roll...starting with the service.  || SERVICE || Unfortunately we were not seated on any comfy couches, or in an area with a great view, instead we were seated at this 2-person table that seems like they just stuffed in the hallway because they had extra space.   1ST ADVICE: request a table with a nice view - along the window facing the Bellagio water fountain.  Our server came by and greeted us, gave us our menus, and was MIA for the next 15-20 minutes. No drinks, just bread on the table. When she finally remembered we existed, I asked her for recommendations and she just spilled out 10 items under 5 seconds with names that sometimes didn't describe the dish well. I responded with "Ok... so I didn't catch any of that, would you mind repeating yourself and describing what the dish is or at least pointing it out on the menu?"   This is my issue right off the bat. Let's be frank, these dishes are priced ridiculously high, so I'm under the impression that you, Giada, are setting your restaurant to be somewhat high class, no? So okay let's agree this is a high class restaurant. High class food should come with high class service, am i right? I definitely didn't receive the appropriate service you would typically associate with  this high-end dining.  Okay the order is in and still no water. I guess it's really hard to notice anyone sitting in this little hallway. Our server's assistant finally came by with a pitcher of water and poured it directly into my glass sitting on the table. Oh me oh my, you can go to a hole in the wall and they know to grab the glass, face away from the customer, and pour the water preventing it from splashing everywhere - I MEAN COME ON IT'S COMMON RESTAURANT KNOWLEDGE. Well of course the water spilled all over the table so she grabbed her white linen and attempted to clean it up. It obviously wasn't enough to clean up the mess so she left and came back with a dirty rag to wipe the rest. Ugh, this is such a classy restaurant.  || FOOD || Okay let's start off with the bread because that was pretty much the highlight of the evening. You think I'm kidding but the bread was pretty damn delicious. Assorted bread, bread sticks, etc with of course olive oil to soak and butter on the side. Not sure how to really describe it cause it's quite simple, but I thoroughly enjoyed going through all of it.   2ND ADVICE: Get full off the bread.  The food didn't take too long to come out, thankfully. We started with the meatballs and octopus.  The meatballs come in 4 and have the height of about a half dollar. I'm not quite sure why these are a popular item on the menu. There were quite bland and really not that remarkable. "It's just .... meatballs.." was my reaction.  The octopus is terrible. Just skip it. It was over-charred so basically I was just eating burnt flavorless rubber. I honestly can make it for you for $16 if that's what you want.  3RD ADVICE: Don't waste your money on the meatballs and octopus.  For the main entree we went with the popular Spaghetti and the Rigatoni. The Spaghetti was good but it's not like it saved the night or anything. It was dried out and needed more sauce. The Rigatoni was just bland. The Spaghetti came in a size of a fist with two large prawns, and the Rigatoni could maybe give you a couple more bites than the Spaghetti. Both were tiny dishes, so good luck to all the hungry men dining here. With all the disappointments I was happy to find something that left me pleased... VERY happy to say that the pasta was cooked to perfection!!  Really, all I could say was that this whole experience was BASIC. Expensive basic food with 'meh' service.

GyboPFaLdND30lIJQyGm7g.text: Overpriced Italian food.   From the moment I stepped into this restaurant I did not feel welcome. I look young, but I really enjoy my food! I was very taken aback when the hostesses didn't treat me like a paying customer...they kind of brushed me off and didn't check up on me until 30 minutes later to ask my name again. Please respect all customers no matter if they may seem important or not! STRIKE 1!   If you have a friend that's a girl and you ask her to pull her hand into a fist...that will be the exact portion size of the lemon shrimp spaghetti. Savor every bite, cause those bites go fast! I didn't feel as if the price (~$35) justified the taste AT ALL. If it's going to be $35, it better rock my world. STRIKE 2!   Overall, I love ya Giada but I'm really disappointed with your restaurant.

mJ-0QIPoTzk4l4I3u0q5yw.text: Great Experience!! I don't know where to start.  I'm not going to write an essay or a novel for this.  Just come and try the restaurant.  Window-view table.. That's what I wanted.  Started off with excellent service, gave us all these menus from wine-list and an Ipad to pick your drinks, also information about the dishes.  It was overwhelming for me.  I didn't even know where to start.  So I took my phone out and started to Yelp reviews.  Lolz.  Thanks Yelpers...   The cocktail drinks were Flash Gordon, and The hannibal.  Good to start with some drinks to relax the night.  We ordered the Fritto Misto shrimp & Calamari with fennel & lemon aioli, Mortadella pizza Bianca for appetizer.  For the entrees was Spaghetti shrimp, lemon, and basil, and Whole roasted chicken for two, cacciatore style.  We skipped the salad part.  My recommendations, don't order the chicken.  Our chicken (white meat was dry and chewy).  The pasta is excellent!  For dessert we picked the Tiramisu trio.  Oh yums!!   No Giada tonight.. it's okay her name and logo was everywhere..lolz.. Overall service and food quality is top-notch.    Hint:  Remember before you check-in, go have some fun at the photo-booth (waiting area)  on your left.  Behind the black curtains.  A hidden picture taking booth and you can do your Selfies there!!   Enjoying dinner with the person you love, cherish, and birthday celebration = priceless.    Thank you Giada, a great night to remember!!

kfldTsMmt_JDb6end7T8AQ.text: Had a wonderful experience. The food was excellent. It took a while before someone came to our table, however they realized it and gave us complementary cocktails . Lauren, and Nancy were excellent servers. Very knowledgeable.

ElCgODriz1oMkUz6dHYVnw.text: Ambiance is great.  Food was really good.  Drinks were ok.    The only thing I would say is if you don't plan to eat pasta, which is what she talks about a lot on her show, and I guess is 'known' for in a sense, there are other places you can get a better steak and fish entree.  I had the salmon which was great and my husband had the ribeye (it's HUGE); both were delish but had I known I wasn't going to order any pasta, I would've chosen an actual steakhouse to dine at.  I had just a bite of the steak and it was good, but not $80 good.  We were advised against the pasta as the portions were very small.   It's a great dining experience no doubt....there are just a lot of other places I'd rather go for a nice steak that isn't super pricey.    I would go back if a friend invited me out, but not by choice.

fFAMzxvuI2VH9_rkjYolSQ.text: Went here for brunch. I thought this will be different since I am in vegas. Food was blend and boring. Eggs and toast with a cup of tomatoes. If you want to spend $$$$ on blend go for it. Major disappointment.

DrZ7261nA0GPSISDUrRHSg.text: Had a wonderful breakfast at Giada's for Valentine's Day with the family. The restaurant is beautiful, I can tell that a lot of attention has been put into every single detail. Great job with the decor and overall ambiance! Our reservation was for 9:30am, but we arrived 30 minutes early ,and we were warmly greeted and seated right away. We were seated on a great table with view to the strip and all the restaurant.Our server Christopher was great, he answered some questions and explained some special items that were available for Valentine's weekend. We ordered the American breakfast that came with smashed potatoes and some sausage meatballs in marinara. Both my kids ordered the polenta waffles with pineapple and strawberries accompanied by Nutella and maple syrup. My picky daughter ate the whole thing , don't know where she put so much food ,but she was very happy with her waffles. I ordered the savory waffle with eggs and pancetta served with maple and bechamel. This was a really good waffle, I was surprised that it remained crispy even though I'm a slow eater , excellent! Same with the kids waffles, crispy and chewy. If that wasn't enough food we ordered the pastry assortment to share: savory muffin, orange sticky bun, croissant , hazelnut cake and my favorite the Rosemary strawberry scone, soooo good! The pastry assortment came with some raspberry preserves, mascarpone and almond butter, the tiny plate where  the mascarpone was served was chipped , an overlook I'm sure, I bet Giada would just throw the plate away, right? They also have some bar seating , where you can look at the nice pizza oven and a deli display with all their antipasto and pastry options, everything looked fresh and delicious!  At the end of our breakfast we had some fun with the kids taking pics in their photo booth, unfortunately their internet connection was done and we couldn't email or post directly to FB but we were able to print out our pics. Overall, I say if you are a fan of Giada , visiting the restaurant should be on your to do list when visiting Vegas. The prices are not cheap , they're comparable to other celebrity chef's restaurants on the strip so this was no surprise!

sbUC_mXFz5GeRitJzLBUZQ.text: We went here for business dinner and the table of eight of us were not impressed from the service to the food.  The decor and view are the two positives.  The server we had was not friendly or helpful.  No recommendations given by him. We felt hurried as he had our plates removed as we were barely finished.  No smile, no "how is everything",  the normal that is expected from any restaurant.  The food was bland, served at  room temp and very small portions.  We had appetizers: the  Oysters Rockefeller, were the one item that was pretty good.  The octopus, mushrooms and pizza not so much.  All the entrees we're very bland and none served even close to warm much less hot.  The lack of much protein in the portions is noticable particularly for the price. Most everything was seasoned with lemon, but no garlic, pepper or salt. No grated or shaved cheese was offered for our entrees as in most Italian restaurants.  Won't return as very disappointed and we really hated that we didn't like it,  as we had wanted to come here for quite awhile.

iDyCVmWUMfCKCRIf4aG0mg.text: I called and made a reservation a day before for my wife's birthday and I specially asked to see if they have the pasta with the cheese wheel and they informed me they do. The next day we went in and they informed us that they do not have the cheese wheel pasta due to the supplier. What a disappointment since that was the only dish we went there for.    Food:  28oz tomahawk steak was just okay, a bit too salty. Spaghetti was a bit dried. Fettuccine was good. Risotto was overcooked and it was like mashed. Raw Oyster was over powered by the sauce they put on top.  Overall the experience was poor and we will not likely to return.

bChNylY78ApYaU7WrCGBzA.text: We were very lucky to have eaten dinner here. Walked in on a Saturday night st 730 and we got seated in 10 min with no reservation. Would highly recommend making a reservation.  Italian restaurant. They oysters were amazing. Bone in filet was to die for. You get a free drink or cookie plate if you check in on yelp.  Great restaurant for friends or dates.  Only regret is I did not order a pasta. They looked amazing on other tables as we were walking out.   Highly recommend this place when in Vegas.

sDpPBPO4kqpGjGcIhoxQ8g.text: I would give this a zero star if I could the experience was that bad!  My family and I took a weekend trip to Vegas and wanted to try a celebrity chef restaurant this go around and chose Giada's for our love of her show.  We've made several of her dishes at home and was eager to see what her restaurant was like.  To prepare, I made a reservation for 2:45 on saturday.  Little did I know the restaurant closed at 3 for their dinner prep when I booked the reservation or I would have made it earlier.   From the start the entire experience was off, we arrived a couple minutes before our reservation and the hostess greeted us and said she would have to check on our table.  While we were waiting, we stepped inside to see the seafood case and I noticed 2/3 of the restaurant was empty. Odd, as we were still waiting to be seated.  She came out and said it would be a couple minutes.  One of my party members asked if we were early and I said no and seemed puzzled.  During this time, two parties arrived in which the hostess said the dining room was at capacity and the bar was open.  About 5 minutes later she seated us.  When I booked the reservation I was not aware it was a brunch only menu, it would have been helpful to know as my family was not looking for brunch.  We sat down and was very disappointed by the brunch menu; there is zero options on there that all the yelp reviews rave about and the best the waitress had to offer was a burger!  This is an Italian restaurant, why would I order a burger!   That's not even the disappointing part, we sat and waited for about 7 minutes before we were seen by the waitress, took about 5 minutes or so to get drinks and then she came back to us and said if you aren't ready to order the kitchen is closed so you need to place your order now.  Are you serious! Why would you accept a 2:45 reservation if the restaurant closes at 3 and then rush us to place an order!  In an outrage we left and will never return again!   The worse service I've ever had at "fine dining".    Something our family was looking forward to left a sour note to us.

9jwAlVa_n7vTwOxdsHujkA.text: Absolutely horrible service, we didn't even eat and walked out. Waited for an hour in lounge area while no one offered drinks or menus or anything, the hostess said the full menu was served in the lounge area. We were told we would have a table in 30 minutes and sat there for an hour while the hostess ran and sat people who came in way after us (other people without reservations) then made them get up from their table and moved back to the lounge area and then sat someone else. The hostess had no idea what was going on and there were plenty of empty tables. The vibe seemed chaotic and unorganized. There's plenty of places to eat on the strip with much better service.

Sywuy_UZ4PSMMAP7jT1eMA.text: My girlfriends and I had brunch at 'Giada' to celebrate one of my friends birthday. My girlfriends bought a bottomless mimosas Groupon.  Appetizer: Salad, antipasti platter, pastry Main: Salmon cake benedict Desert: Limoncello souffle with crane angelaise   My girlfriends mimosas kept coming, they really did not make them wait for another refill.  My most favorite were the roman salad and antipasti platter.  Service here was great! From our main server to the servers who served us our different meal courses. All were very attentive to detail. Thank you for a memorable experience.

OtCvQc1dK2DW_msp-nNV4A.text: We made a reservation for 9 pm , we arrived about 10 minutes late due to traffic, so when we got there we were asked to wait for 5-10 minute (that turned into about 25 minutes). Once we got seated they brought us water and our waiter was with us immediately. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us his recommendations. The watermelon caprese salad (not photographed) was amazing. Very refreshing and the flavor combination was just so good. My fiance ordered the lemon spaghetti with shrimp, and I ordered the lobster and kale ravioli. Both filling and just delicious. They had a list of dessert choices that sounded amazing, we ended up going with the raspberry chocolate cheesecake. It was perfect and was just what we needed after our delicious meal. Service was great, prices were just right. Over all great experience. Will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas. Thank you for the great service.

IAhZSBNpOy2DbPmXZfHKzw.text: Service  The servers got us seated in about 10 mins but then they never come back to check on us. (probably over 30mins) of us just looking at the menu. We actually have to get up and ask if someone can take our order. Which has never happened before especially from a restaurant of this scale.   The food -   Spaghetti - Were cold as if it been sitting there for a while. The spaghetti absorbed all the sauce which makes it chunky and dry. First taste was flavorless. It was sour and basically tasteless.   Braised Wagyu - No flavor as well, the meat doesn't have any significant taste to be labeled as "Wagyu" No depth of flavor for a dish that's been braised for a long time. Very disappointed   We couldn't even grab the servers attention to show them how chunky the spaghetti was. We barely finish the food because it was so bad. For the price we are paying, it was not worth it.

FUnTX1juJiv-LhlYrBTv5Q.text: We had a reservation for 8pm and came about 15 minutes late due to traffic, so when we got there, we had to wait another 15 minutes before being seated. There was a photo booth (out of order at the time) in the waiting area that kept us entertained for a little while. Decor was beautiful, it matched the classic old-school feel of the Cromwell. The view from our table was beautiful, overlooking the Strip and Bellagio fountains. When we were seated, our server came out with waters right away and was super helpful in giving his recommendations for starters, drinks, and entrees. We placed our orders and were greeted with a beautiful bread plate with fun dips including lemon butter, pesto, dried capers, sea salt and red chili flakes.  Our table had ordered the seafood tower, which was incredible. Usually I'm a little suspect about huge jumbo shrimp, as it tends to lack in flavor, but the ones that came out at the top of the tower were super succulent and not disappointing at all. The oysters had an interesting topping of prosecco gelee, which detracted from the natural oyster taste. We also got the chicken marsala meatballs with broiled tomatoes, which were delicious. The fritto misto of calamari and squid was fried to perfection and the lemon mayo that came with it was the perfect amount of acidity to break up the richness of the fry. For our main courses, we got the margherita pizza (with sun-dried tomatoes and a perfect crust), along with the mushroom pizza. The lemon spaghetti was as good as I imagined it to be, and the risotto was one of the best I had ever tasted. We have been to Italy before, and the food that came out of this kitchen was very comparable to what we remember it to be!  Overall, this was an amazing experience and everyone at our table was very pleased with the food and service. We will definitely be back here the next time we're in Vegas!

iC0l7GuLjiZ8D9oSI86qIg.text: I really enjoyed the food experience here. We went for a Saturday brunch and everything they placed on the table was delicious. The restaurant was always busy. We were lucky enough to have made reservations a few weeks in advance and got hooked up with a table with a great view. Overall a very god dinning experience. My only semi negative comment is be prepared to spend a few hours dinning. Never felt like anyone was in a hurry. Again not bad just don't go if you are in a hurry.

g6Y8FN7R6zIdJ6qjGKVLCA.text: As you've seen in other reviews, the customer 'service' leaves a lot to be desired. Note: self parking at the Cromwell is $20. I didn't deduct a star for that, I just thought potential customers would like to know. Anyway... I had a reservation for brunch for a party of 4 at 1030AM. For Vegas standards, that's pretty early, but my group woke up inordinately early, so I moved the reservation (via OpenTable) to 10AM. Two of us arrived at 10AM and the other two were en route. The hostess said "we don't seat until the entire party is here". Keep in mind, there were only three other tables occupied, so I'm not sure why they have that policy, but rules are rules and I'm not deducting stars for that. Fair is fair and we were seated. When the server arrived (and I want to be accurate, so I'll say that he wasn't yelling, rude, etc) we asked about the brunch menu and I said "which of these items don't contain dairy, because I don't have dairy. I'm interested in XYZ, is that dairy-free". He replied by saying "is 'no dairy a preference or medical reason?". I actually paused before I answered because I didn't know why I was being questioned when I asked about the ingredients. Imagine if you asked "is it cold outside" and someone replied "why do you want to know". Not cool (pun intended). And in case any yelpers! want to know, its for religious reasons (I don't want to go into what the Bible says about eating meat and byproducts from which animals, so I won't belabor with you with that information here). However, as I have the freedom to practice religion as I chose in the US, I don't think I should be made to explain the reason the Bible guides to and away certain animals. I don't eat dairy, that's it. If the item has dairy, then I'll order something else. Very simple. Anyway, let's get back to the experience: the server asks the question, I pause and say "what difference does it make, if I don't have it, I don't have it". He then replied that the "chef would want to know". I was about to say (but I didn't) "you should suggest the chef download 'the bible' app on his or her iPhone" but I didn't. I just politely replied that I don't want dairy and that's that. I was very bothered by this entire exchange and I couldn't help but wonder: if people were wearing certain articles of clothing while dining and they say "we don't want pork" would the server then ask if its a "preference"? Is religion a preference? The religion itself or the choice to practice? None of this should be brought up when ordering food; because its much more simple: the customer is buying and they are saying what ingredients are suitable for them. The merchant doesn't have to alter the ingredients, the customer can chose something that suits them. The meal ended, we tipped 20% and left. I then emailed giada.com but didn't get a reply (clearly they don't care about their customers at all), so I'm writing to let potential customers know what to expect.

DZhyabKTDEXZWa9ufpLzBQ.text: I am not sure why this place is only a 3 1/2 star...  let's be real... the ONLY complaint is the photo booth is not always running but we are truly very happy to just take selfies in there!!   {{after you go up the escalator to check in at the hostess table just to your left there is a photo booth}}   We eat here every time we are in town!!  The pasta is always perfect, simple and perfect.   Try the spaghetti....  sooooo good!   We also go between the salmon and the filet.   Both always cooked to perfection.   Each and every dish we have tried we have truly been big fans of!!     The staff is professional and always so helpful!   My advice, don't listen to the negative nellies and give this place a try!!  We are always very satisfied and ready to come back again and again.

x_yYBC7niHT5YCGQ4ok1BQ.text: Had a fabulous meal here with a girlfriend. I was super impressed with the menu and can't wait to come back. We shared the "Italian style" fried chicken,  a simple cheese spaghetti, and of course, the cookies. Everything was amazing. The fried chicken was so crispy and tasty. Pasta was on point. Lemon cookies were to die for. Wine prices were pretty high upon first glance (wow!!!), but we managed to find a bottle we recognized and enjoyed for around $58, which isn't that bad for Vegas.   Check out Open Table for reservations at least a day ahead and you should be good to go.

lDz-KqO_9LrP3fn_w9aw6w.text: Finally got the chance to go to giada and everything was amazing, I unfortunately forgot to take photos as this is my very first yelp review. We ended up ordering the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer, the shrimp tasted very fresh but the cocktail sauce fell a little short. For dinner me and my husband shared the cacio e Pepe bucatini and the risotto. The personal cheese wheel is the best thing about this whole experience, we love that we had the chance to take it home and we had a nice snack the next day. The overall experience was pleasant and the atmosphere was lively, unfortunately the last star fell off when we got the check, the server circled the gratuity 3 or 4 times (fair I guess, we tip anyways so it doesn't really matter) but when we got the check back after giving him our card, he hid our card behind the receipt and it looked like he circled the gratuity once again, it's in very poor taste for this type of restaurant, while everything is great, if I do come back, I would ask for a different server. Service was great other than that.

rpbrsG3-FVcKsFAttwMqpg.text: I've dine at Giada a few times for brunch. I finally made it for dinner, so I sorta knew what to expect. The service was much quicker than normal which was great. The food was average, nothing really blew me away. I really enjoyed the cocktails though. A bit over priced for the quality. The presentation was good but the overall flavor was lacking.

NRPRvhh9ZxBLtSV8V1_zBA.text: 1. Nice, fancy cute place, view of the strip 2. Good food (not amazing) 3. We got two "splash" of Prosecco with Yelp check in 4. They were willing to change my reservation 5. Super busy 6. Pricey No major complaints about this place, but it's not place I was greatly impressed that I would have to come back.

NAOJD5O_yoc79QyB7o70wA.text: After trying Giada's on my previous trip, I knew I wanted to make this the special birthday dinner for this trip.  My long time friend and I were celebrating birthdays (a day apart) and I knew Giada's would make for a great celebration dinner and they didn't disappoint.  I made reservations via Open Table before I even began my trip and I'm glad I did.  Our birthdays fell on the weekend this year and it was fairly crowded on this Sunday night so the reservations assured we got prime seating during the busy dinner rush.  On the second floor of the Cromwell Hotel, Giada's overlooks the Las Vegas Strip with views of the Bellagio Fountains and Caesars Palace across the street, a purely Vegas setting with the lights, fountains and excitement just outside.  We were seated at the window and our service was impeccable throughout.   After Giada's bread selection, we started our dinner with the Mushroom Crostini and Tricolore Salad.  For the main courses, I had the Ravioli (lobster & crispy Brussel sprouts) and she had the Petit Filet.  Everything tasted fantastic and the Ravioli really was done well with the richness of the sauce.  Dessert was again wonderful.  We had the Citrus Ricotta Cheesecake and a Chocolate Souffle completed the dinner experience with a gastronomic exclamation point.   This was my only meal on the Strip this visit to Vegas.  I'm glad I made it Giada's.  The overall experience of the decor, service and wonderful food makes special occasions into special memories.

We enjoyed the brunch tasting menu and each plate was so delicious! I definitely recommend visiting Giada's!

6i0js7NXo522s7qfuZlxSg.text: Beware of GEORGE CATACALOS the restaurant manager. Hes extremely rude! We haven't even been seated yet and we already had a bad taste in our mouths. My sister purchased a build ur own brownie for my nephew while we were waiting to be seated. We went to go get it ourselves since there wasn't any signs stating that only employees can handle it (located in the front of the restaurant by the waiting area) & George got upset & told us not to touch it! Both employees and other guest were starring at us... so it was quite embarrassing. He started giving us all these rules about the health regulations!  If that's the case put up a sign stating that employees will serve it! Or have the cashier advise the guest that an employee will serve it! It's not that hard to do! What a way to treat guest! Ohh and it was on Mothers Day. Instead of getting a mothers day greeting we get a DONT TOUCH THAT greeting. Great job George! Definitely would've given 5 stars but thanks to George they get 3....

ihrLbaoEu3VFt91dW35HLA.text: How can this place have 3.5 stars are you Yelpers STUPID? I didn't even bother to read any of the reviews because I'm sure it had complaints like it's not all you can eat salad and soup like the "Italian" place like back home in Iowa, or I couldn't find s coupon for this place, this is great food, and I mean everything that I have had here over the last 3 years. I don't eat seafood but I do eat everything else, Some of my favorites are the Prosciutto fresh Burrata  with tomatoes Parmesan cheese with honeycomb fried chicken and every pasta dish and bread. You know food is good when you are cussing  at it as your eating it, or you just shake your head as your eating everything. So to the crew who takes care of me from behind the scenes like Michael S to the cooks, servers and hostess, thank you so very much for making each visit special

n5zH_BdxpCOoNTF0BvGP7A.text: The flavors she brings to the tabla are amazing!!  We had an awesome table with a view of the Bellagio Water Show. Our waitress Nancy was awesome!! Our service was impeccable and she was kind enough to take multiple pictures of us and even made us look younger and thinner than we already are. Love Giada and Nancy for a memorable evening.   Thank you,   Gabriel and Floyd

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tNU7G_iXnZ-20SgjnidY0g.text: Great experience from the moment walking in the door. Everyone was very friendly and attentive. We went to the bar and had a cocktail before dinner. They were all delicious - Tempest, Barberello & a strawberry basil one. All were flavorful, the strawberry was a favorite.   We were seated by the window (which was amazed by) and had views of the Bellagio water show and an awesome lightning storm in the distance. The place settings were gorgeous and I loved the ambience. It truly felt like Giada put her touch all over the restaurant.   Our waitress, Nancie, provided several suggestions and was very helpful. We went with the following:  Appetizers - bread plate (muffin was amazing as was the pesto) - bacon wrapped dates (everyone's favorite) - bruschetta  - meatballs  Main - lobster raviolis (my favorite) - spaghetti (delicious) - vegetarian rigatoni  - Bucatini with chicken (very flavorful and didn't need the added chicken)  Dessert - strawberry semifreddo - chocolate hazelnut macaron (my favorite) - tiramisu - smores gelato (2nd favorite)  The pastas are made from scratch daily and are cool ones perfectly. The display of each plate was gorgeous and was all Giada!   Everything truly was amazing! I would recommend this place and can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread plates
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Tiramisu

h0RCqDpZNycQM6BJ0kHgxg.text: Everything was good and some was really good (Watermelon tomato salad was excellent!) but as my 12 yr old said "literally everything tastes like lemon! The appetizers, the pasta, even the potatoes!"  I do love lemon and apparently Giada does too. Like I said, it was good but when I spend well over $400 on dinner I want it to be really great!

jVBAMGHEEGyVfVjeMAgb7A.text: When you charge $34 for a plate of pasta I can see where the reviews can get polarized. That said, I enjoyed the lemon spaghetti though will not be making it a regular occurrence.

SaYn81ZbbSu23eXcZJXW-Q.text: Stop, drop, and look at my reviews to know it takes an exceptionally bad restaurant to make me blast a bad review...  To start - 4* for atmosphere and service.  We did get a table by the window as requested and our waiter was amazing.   The food.  Sweet jesus, the food.  1* if even.  We were in a semi hurry to catch a show so we decided to do multiple apps and share an entree...   First up - bacon wrapped dates - or as I like to call them "would anyone notice if I spit this shit out of the beautiful window seating?"  HORRIBLE!! So bad the waiter (I wish I could remember his name cause he was truly great) noticed we each choked half a bite down and removed it from our bill.  Crises averted.   Shrimp cocktail - most basic bitch app ever ordered, no chance it could go wrong, right?  WRONG!  The prawns were HUGE!  Which I think they think is a good thing but when you have to (not because they're huge but because they're as tough as an overcooked toe) cut them with a steak knife and chew until your jaw is sore...no.  Just no.  And the cocktail sauce had the flavor of watered down ketchup.  Ugh.  Next!  I can't remember the menu title of this item but it was basically deep fried risotto balls with cheese and tomato.  In a nutshell it was a glorified Totinos pizza roll.  I just can't.    And finally the lobster ravioli.  Maybe the best thing?  We had one each.  And they were truly unremarkable.   I need serious redemption for taking my husband here on his birthday thinking it would be a perfect staycation dinner before a show.  Oh so wrong.  I have making up to do.  I'm not a picky person, I understand with new restaurant experiences it may be I just ordered the wrong thing.  But every EVERY single dish was less than mediocre bad.  Just bad.  Just no. No.  Don't go.  Ever. Don't.

MzmrjPGT4FKWjZztkH_s-w.text: I was prepared to not like this restaurant  after being disappointed in the past by other celebrity chef (Bobbie Flay in particular.  Don't get me started about that cockroach strolling across the bar) venues.  But I really enjoyed everything about my experience dining at Giada's.    When we arrived the concierge at the Bellagio had not successfully made our reservation and we were so disappointed.  The receptionist kindly seated us anyway, even though the restaurant was full.   The restaurant is lovely. We had a window table and it was fun to look out.   Our waiter was very sweet and helpful.  He took extra care to make sure our selections would be exactly what we were hoping for, even accommodating a weird food allergy.   The food was superb.  We started with cocktails and appetizers.  The mulled strawberry and basil drink was surprisingly lush and fresh.  Where do you get strawberries with that kind of flavor in November?  We had the dates, the artichokes and the calamari.  I would definitely recommend the artichokes.  The dates were too hot for me but everyone else loved them.  The calamari was nothing special.    For dinner, I had risotto and it was brimming  with fresh crab.  The scallops were a tad over but still good.  Two of us had the spaghetti with lemon and shrimp and it was really delicious, the spaghetti, cooked and sauced perfectly.  The fourth person had the lobster ravioli for the final entree and loved it.  The table shared the Brussels sprouts and I heard they were really good, can't verify it since I wouldn't taste them.  We shared a chocolate dessert that was exquisite.    I will definitely return!   Maybe even on this same trip .

Hmo3INkReKcE3Xuf1MHhfA.text: Was able to get the center table in the main dining room on a busy Saturday night.  It gave us shelter from the blistering sunset with a view of eveything.  Before our entrees came we snacked on the olives, artichokes & cheesy crisps while we enjoyed delicious cocktails.  I ordered the lamb, which was cooked to perfection & seasoned just right!  Each bite was sumptuous & makes me hungry just thinking about it.  Since it was also my birthday, I was too full to order a proper dessert but they brought 2 delightful cookies, which I found room for - a chocolate that tasted like it had hints of PB&J and a refreshing lemon flavored cookie.    Oh, and did I mention, Giada stopped by our table?  She was sooooo nice, wished me happy birthday & hoped we enjoyed all the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a great birthday memory
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sb-rhTeKrMmtOH9akeXZbA.text: I have only visited Las Vegas 3 times and Giada's was the best restaurant I have ever ate at on the strip.  The staff was friendly and excellent.  I had the Caesar salad as a starter and the lobster ravioli-both tasted so fresh and light.  I would even recommend treating yourself to the expresso martini!

iB5LBUT3NFoJtcg1V0Us4A.text: Had made reservations a week prior to dining here. Our Anniversary Date Night.. Saturday Feb. 17 7:45 PM. We arrived on time & waited another 15 mins or so, as the hostesses were trying to get us a window seat. Hostess staff was great!   The waiters are very professional & dressed to the nines. Atmosphere is beautiful, elegant & classy.  Started with a complementary sampler type platter with several dipping sauces.   I ordered the Spaghetti (Spicy) which comes with shrimp. Two medium shrimp?! Presentation was beautiful however, it's about 4-6 oz of pasta nestled up with a shrimp on each side. Delicious yet a disappointment for the amount & cost $35. My husband had the Pasta Flight. 3 pastas Spaghetti, Bucatini & Rigatoni- outstanding, but again not enough meal for the cost. It's about 12 bites total. Yes, you'll leave not satisfied or full after eating here!   * Yelper Elite- you may get an offer when checking in here. Two glasses of Prosecco wine, that was a plus as well as the elegant Anniversary cookies they plated & granted to us at the end of our meal.  They offer a 5 course meal for $120 per person.   Sadly, you're paying for the name, location & ambience.   We can say we've experienced it, but won't return. BTW- our meal here was more expensive than our hotel stay for two nights! Crazy...

9BZ-m2ROXX2IHaXK_j5d8Q.text: When we go to Vegas, that always means we're having breakfast at Giadas!  8/18/17 Friday Morning.  We get there a little after it opens and ask to be seated in Chris's section. The view is beautiful and we love the aroma this restaurant gives off.   Like always my wife got her Dolce Vita and I tried a Sangria for the first time here. Both amazing drinks and the Sangria you have have two different ways. I wanted mine sweet and it did not disappoint.  We love the American Breakfast so stuck with that. Life for us doesn't get any better when where in Vegas eating breakast at Giadas! It starts our day off on a positive note!  I always see people wondering Las Vegas looking for places to eat Breakfast. We always tell them about Giadas and their wonderful offerings and beautiful atmosphere.   See you again in a few months!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Sangria!!!

cEi0jL9BeUTlgxT9rjDNmA.text: I love Giada, so finally getting to dine at her restaurant was so exciting!  Let's start with the complimentary "bread," which is NOT your average bread & butter. They served a bread plate with fresh rosemary bread, bread sticks, and a crispy "pita" type bread, which came with condiments such as: butter, pesto, red pepper flakes, fried capers, and sea salt. It was so good! Great way to start off our dinner.  Appetizer: - Arancini. Completely forgot if they were crab or lobster, but I remember them being very good, especially with the red sauce.  Entrees: - Shrimp spaghetti: delicious and the shrimp were HUGE! Love the capers in it, too. - 28oz. Bone-In Tuscan Rib-eye: this was a show-stopper. Definitely a sight to see. This rib-eye was so big, it barely fit on our 2-person table. It was also topped with arugula and a fried egg, which made it that much better.  After dinner, we were given complimentary "anniversary" cookies for dessert! These cookies were the "Giada's Favorite Cookies" item on the menu, which consisted of: - A chocolate chip cookie: this was my FAVE! It came out warm, too. - 2 lemon ricotta cookies with lemon glaze: I'm not a big fan of lemony desserts, but these were VERY good. I was surprised at how much I enjoyed them. - 2 peanut butter cookies with blackberry jam: I preferably don't like peanut butter cookies, but the hubs does and he really liked these.  Our overall dining experience was great. Looking forward to trying the brunch menu next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 28oz. Tuscan Bone-In Ribeye Steak w/ arugula &amp; fried egg
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YuNhljMBFpoopDl_umONeQ.text: I finally got here for brunch with some friends. I am a big lover of chicken and waffles. It is great seeing all the different ways it can be prepared.  This was probably the least desired and enjoyed. It comes with a Cacciatore Sauce and they put parmesan cheese on the waffles.  Chicken and waffles are supposed to be sweet and salty and delicious. The waffle was not edible because that cheese ( ??) ruins the flavors of the rest of the dish. The chicken was on the bone. It was a real failure of flavors.   The bloody mary was very delicious and we all agreed to that point. The pastries that we ordered too, meh. They did not wow at all. I am truly disappointed that I paid over 60 dollars for a meal that was halfway inedible and over priced. You can tell that no one was overly impressed because not one picture went out on our IG.  Id go somewhere else if I was you. Your palate will thank you.

Hz4r4G9NmlO3Xrls2fk1WQ.text: Updated review. Back to Giadas for a 3rd time. I really think this restaurant is underrated. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is top notch, lots of fun.

epgT9-DnpgfljwY1oBsITw.text: Food is amazing..but service was the worst I've ever experienced..hardly anyone I. The restaurant..I had reservations and still had to wait 30 min.to be seated. Staff needs to get itself together. I wanted to try it..but back to my favorite...hells kitchen!

0mircVXrApUXrjVmE8khJw.text: I was really looking forward to trying Giada, but had an "eh" experience.  I made reservations well in advance and needed to wait about 45 minutes to be seated (table for 2 on a Monday night... yikes).  The place smelled like bacon and had an interesting mix of Hollywood meets the beach meets Italian countryside decor, and the food all looked great in the display up front.  The service once seated was good.  I liked our friendly waiter that joked with us, made recommendations, and wasn't too smothering.  The bread at the beginning of the meal was really good, especially with the fried capers and olive oil.  To start we tried the bacon wrapped dates with Gorgonzola cream and it was tasty/very rich!    My pasta entree was itsy bitsy for an extremely expensive price.  Lil stuffed pink tortellini shaped pasta with tiny diced butternut squash and brown butter sauce.  I think there were like 8 or 10 pieces?  Luckily the appetizer filled me up but I was expecting more of an Italian sized portion.  The taste of the dish was watery and fairly bland.  My guest got the spee-gay-tee entree and it also wasn't anything that she would recommend.  Big ol shrimp on top of a small cheesy pasta scoop. We both finished our meals, not enough for leftovers, and just sort of stared at each other.  The only thing above average about the meal was the price.  No big toothy grin from me!

mjqD2h_yyancxZQcF8Dvuw.text: If there is less than 1 star, I would give it to this restaurant. Nothing signature about her signature food. The signature salad, which I expected to have a special kind of dressing, the reality is the dressing is jussst a lemon!! The pasta was as bad as the salad, it wasn't rich in flavor at all to the point that you actually can taste the dough of the pasta. I was a huge fan of her but I changed my mind after 3 bad main dishes that I tried

bhulf7bKVIyumcfs4Wp8tQ.text: Woot woot! Another one of the few places I would give a five star rating to. Decided to go here because I am a fan of Giada and what better way to show appreciation than to check out her first restaurant?! All I have to say is that the food, service, and experience was one of the best, and I'm not just saying that. Been to quite a few places so trust me on this one.  I went here with some friends to celebrate both a birthday and surviving a semester of medical school. We made our reservation about a month in advance and the earliest time we got was 9:45 p.m. Parking is pretty confusing to find and we ended up in the confusing and super shady Linq parking structure. We arrived late, but they were also running behind schedule so we didn't get seated until 10:30ish. Waiting usually bothers me, but there was a photo booth that you must check out. It kills time and is a great way to get a little FREE souvenir because you can print out photo strips!!!  The food was pretty awesome. I ended up ordering Giada's signature dish of lemon spaghetti which seems so plain, but it was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever eaten. I was finally able to appreciate good pasta and experience what True al dente is like. You must give this place a shot at least once. The pasta had some firmness and chewiness that was just so novel to me. You get two huge pieces of shrimp which was so tasty and light since they were not drenched in sauce. The capers were a weird addition to the dish, but they kept things interesting with their strong taste. You also get free bread so check out my photos to see what that's like. I also ordered a molten chocolate lava cake which was way too sweet for me so I didn't finish it. The sauce they gave was pretty interesting because it had such a unique citrus taste to it.   The whole experience was just awesome and it was nice to have a terrace view of the strip while dining. Our server was really nice and helpful. He made us feel at home and made sure we knew what we were ordering and was honest about the portion sizes of the dishes. Definitely a big plus in my book. Most waiters would just try to make you order the most expensive items on the menu.  Again, check this place out if you ever get the chance. Just don't come here super hungry, unless you have serious cash to burn, then by all means go for it.
