Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Molten chocolate lava cake.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti with shrimp!

dG3yaJBdZZ2wvIU1uw563w.text: Dinner on June 24, 2018 for my husband's 50th. This was our 5th or 6th trip to Giada, and it's always the highlight of our visits to Vegas. We started with the meat/cheese tray--melt-in-your-mouth prosciutto is a great way to start the meal. We also had the charred octopus panzanella (which I had just watched Giada and Aunt Raffy make on tv last week!) and the bucatini for 2 served jn a pecorino wheel--outstanding! And we had a lovely view of the Bellagio fountain show! We always have a perfect meal at Giada and really appreciate all the detail she puts into her recipes to make them extra special. The service is first-rate, and we have made some wonderful memories dining with friends and family here.

ZcBTm9sr1UICNrqV0Ey3eg.text: My second visit to Giada was just as good as the first.   This time I went for Saturday Brunch and had the opportunity to try several items. I started my morning with a wonderfully light and refreshing Prosecco Sangria and a small plate of assorted Pastries that included a Cinnamon Croissant Monkey Bread Muffin, Rosemary Scone and a Polenta Muffin. They were all good, but the Scone was my favorite!  My next course was the Breakfast Contadina with Two Poached Eggs, Crispy Polenta Cakes,  Sauteed Spinach, Roasted Tomatoes & Grilled Bread. Along with this came several butters and spreads like Chocolate Hazelnut and Strawberry. Everything was perfectly prepared and tasted amazing!   When I was ordering, I mentioned to the waiter that I was also intrigued by the Polenta Waffle. As I started to eat my breakfast, my server dropped off a small sample of that waffle. It was crisp on the outside with a soft, almost creamy interior. This will definitely be included on my next visit to Giada. I finished this visit with a well made Cafe Mocha.  Giada is a Beautiful Restaurant with superior food and wonderful service! I really couldn't ask for anything more. Giada is a rarity for me. A Las Vegas restaurant that I will return to on every trip!

gTJJyED2_b1baWLbqiNZmw.text: I would have given this place a 5 for the view & food. But since the waiter we had was really rude, I'll give it a 3. Firstly, we bought a coupon from travelzoo, that Giada's offered. Waiter seemed annoyed by it. Then we ordered dinner but didn't order cocktails. Then the waiter didn't give us the time of day. So rude! I mentioned it was my friends bday. No one even acknowledged it. I shouldn't have tipped him at all. But I did and figured it would be best to Yelp my experience. I guess you only get attention if you spend a lot of $$ on cocktails.

NTxYSD5cJv4qRerTukqt9w.text: Was pleased to see Giada here. She was entertaining people and was also running food out the kitchen. The food last week was better than the food today. The service was terrible which you would think would be on point since Giada was in the building.   The food was not worth the price paid. I had spaghetti which was very small portion. Although be warned its not meant to be a dinner portion more of a tapas size. But 34.00 is way too expensive in my opinion.   Family felt their meals were not fantastic. It's a bummer the food didn't meet expectation. The decor is amazing food is average. Combine with the poor service not worth the trip. Mostly hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf. My son said was a bit on the tough side. Definitely had better.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal was huge. Wife liked it didn&#39;t love it. Won&#39;t order again
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with shrimp. Ehh nothing special

jJQg94UvKw3dZUAOH9OgGw.text: I came here twice both for dinner and I have to say that the second time but I came I thought that the first time was just an off day All I can remember was ordering these little meatballs with dates in them something with dates were the only thing that I liked out of the five are six things that we had ordered  I basically tried everything on one side of the menu but I wasn't particularly wowed by it.  It certainly has a eyed twist to Italian it is not traditional or classic Italian at all the on Beyonce is nice and it seems like it's just one of those fly by the seat kind of restaurants that will be here today and gone tomorrow.  We parking valet we were not staying at the Cromwell we just wanted to check this place out.   The bar was for both times that I went I know that I ordered a risotto but it wasn't that great.  I kind of felt like everybody else's food was better than mine.   It was really odd sitting I didn't know what to think of this place Only that I wish we would've went to Sinatra instead

lOIpPK59Og6AqLfBK1TKRA.text: My fiance brought me here to celebrate my birthday. I was absolutely amazed how delicious the food was. Drinks were very good. They gave us bread to start off with and that came with different toppings and each one was very delicious. We had two  appetizers, The orzo meatballs (to die for) and my fiance had the fried calamari he said it was delicious. Then our food came out, we ordered the Rigatoni with vegetable bolognese sauce, OMG WAS IT BOMB!!!!! so hearty and flavorful!!! My fiance had the lemon spaghetti with jumbo shrimp he said that was very delicious too. Then dessert, cheesecake Tiramisu and giadas favorite cookies. Both very good. OVERALL this place was amazing from service to food! I would recommend this place!

wR8uaawGG7pRFQN4OHZKrA.text: The bf and I had lunch here and couldn't be more thrilled. The ambience was beautiful, with the restaurant split into three tiers giving it an open airy feel while everyone getting a glimpse of the strip. We split the Carbonara pizza and gnocchi pomadoro. The highlight was the pizza with its light crust and perfectly cooked Sunnyside egg. We ate at the bar and the service was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gnocchi pomadoro
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara pizza

bHk-F0QQYovkgni8C-JIIQ.text: This is probably one of our best restaurants to come to when where in town in  Las Vegas would definitely recommend it to friends and family very peaceful. It's corner restaurant in the second floor so if you get to sit by the window you have a great view of the strip

woIXpK_cmomcqhe9avlBqQ.text: Fellow Yelpers, you are correct. Definitely was not impressed with the meal or the service.   I love Giada's recipes and I have a couple of her cookbooks as well. So I was excited with the idea of going to her restaurant. I did read the yelp reviews and thought to myself that I may have a different experience than the other reviewers who did not rate so well...so I pushed forward with keeping the reservation.   When you first walk in, the place looks very impressive. Very open feel and a nice view of the strip. But that's where it stops. The waiter was less than attentive and frankly didn't care whether we were there or not. For the price of the meal we were paying, you expect a certain level of service.   Next, the food. I was less than impressed with the food.  I heard so many wonderful thing about their shrimp spaghetti. I asked the waiter and he agreed. So that is what I ordered. My hubby order the rack of lamb. When our food came, my spaghetti was luke warm, on the verge of getting cold. You can tell it has been sitting out (probably because the lamb was still cooking) because the sauce started to harden and the spaghetti kinda stuck together. Most fine dining places I go to keep the plate really warm that they actually caution you about the hot plate as they are bringing it out. I can tell the flavor is nice, but it just would have been that much better better if it wasn't cold :(  As for my hubby's lamb, I didn't care for it too much but he liked it.  I think the only thing that was good was the free bread and cracker that came before your meal.   On top of bad service and bad food, what was the most appalling thing for me was that the plates and bowls were chipped around the edges. I fully expect chipped dishes In a chinese restaurant but I never care because the food is good AND cheap. But at Giada's???!!!  Giada...if you are going to serve my food in a chipped plate and bowl, then you really should charge me chinese restaurant pricing. Sorry...but I sorta lost respect for you. In a city where there are sooooo many good restaurants to compete with, you just could not keep up with the big boys. I really wanted to like the food and restaurant, but have to agree with with all other Yelpers  that it was sub par. Go to any restaurants at Caesars or Bellagio, you will get better food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks can be deceiving. It looks pretty, but my food was barely Luke warm.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipped bowl??? Am I at a chinese restaurant???

cWJHePn504mCcz4ZRO0g9w.text: Nancy was our server and was very professional.  The food was not traditional Italian and portions were to small and completely over priced. If your a True Italian I would not recommend and if your not Italian make sure your wallet is thick. The worst food ever!

EwB3sije2hEvRLMJAh2qpg.text: We lunched at Giada this past Friday, our first visit. From the moment we arrived at check in to the moment we left, the service was excellent. I misplaced the receipt, so I cannot give personal credit to our fantastic server. We started with the Gorgonzola Dolce with Raw Pear Honey that was served with a crispy lavash. A perfect starter!!! Our entrees were the Salmon Cake Benedict and the Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese, which we paired with a rose from France followed by mimosas. The grilled cheese had freshness from the hint of lemon, tanginess from the heirloom tomatoes, cheesy goodness, and a perfect crunch on the bread. We finished with Lemon Ricotta cookies covered with a lemon icing. WE WILL BE BACK!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Ricotta Cookies, Lemon-Pesto Grilled Cheese, Mimosa, Gorgonzola Honey Appetizer, Salmon Cake Benedict.

Qb0VrEVDEvmqkJPZ_kieHA.text: Thought the food was great and the portions were tiny. Don't come hungry or be prepared to eat somewhere else after your meal.

w6qzwvyPYlEBS0v5oC8SWw.text: Oh good ole Giada's.  This place is legit and off the hook. This is a must try if you like Italian food.   Fresh noodles, high quality cheeses, great service.... Amazing.   The Orzco Meatballs... Soft meat and the sauce was super good. Great flavors.   Baked Pasta of the Day: Lasagna- this little portion of lasagna was good! It had mushrooms in it and the noodles tasted adente. Definitely worth the $24   Pasta Carbonara- very standard carbonara.   Pizza- the dough was so light and the cheese was so stringy. UGHHH I wanted to eat all of it. Soooooo good. Get the pizza.   Sliders- these were the highlight for me. The meat was tender. The red pepper jam was amazing. These fried zucchini fries were soooooo good!!! Ahhhhh I wanted to eat all the sliders!   Dessert- the lemon cookies and the peanut butter chocolate cookies. Ok. Seriously.... These stupid cookies are SOOOOOO GOOD!!!! Different than all the other cookies I've had. It's so good.   Great place to eat! Must eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert. Tiramisu. Cookies. Strawberry.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders... Best thing ever
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

u7k3dswpKnlGKMIt4rYkfA.text: I don't get the hype.  I came here for lunch - maybe dinner is better here?    I did not receive a good first impression upon arrival.  We had to wait a few minutes before we were seated.  I would have sat down in their waiting area at the top of the stairs by the hostess stand, but it was filthy!  And the restaurant had only been open for less than an hour!  So there I stood instead :p  When we were seated, we were given a table by their windows as requested, but the spacing there was ridiculously tight!!  I understand wanting to accommodate as many tables over in that area, but at the expense of comfort?  The chairs aren't the best for hanging purses on either, and there isn't much room to hang them on the chairs without hitting the person behind you anyway.  I saw women put their purses on the floor.  For a germaphobe like me, and as someone who likes to keep my bags as clean as can be, that's just a no-no.  As for the food, I wasn't impressed either.  I split a lobster roll which was too heavy on the lemon side for my taste.  I've had better from food trucks :p  I also split their carbonara pizza which was ok by me since it had bacon and I love bacon!  For dessert we had their zeppoles, which was nothing special and too "citrus-y" for my taste.    Would I come back?  Maybe, but not for lunch, which was not bad, just ok in my opinion.  I would have come for dinner but good luck getting a dinner reservation!    FYI if you are driving to the restaurant, the Cromwell only has valet parking.  We self-parked next door at the Flamingo which was quite a trek, and their parking structure is quite old and narrow!

zDdX8jjPunaNgm83JxGuEA.text: 10 Steps to a Nice Date on the Strip...  Step #1:  Make a reservation to Giada De Laurentiis' new restaurant, GIADA.  GIADA is new and reservations are a must.  My suggestion, request a table with a view.   Step #2:  Review the menu online.  You can also read the good, okay and bad reviews on Yelp.  GIADA's menu includes Italian dishes, with Giada's personal touches to them.  Menu consists of antipastas, soups, salads, pastas like Spah-geh-tee, ree-gah-TOH-neh, ree-ZOHT-oh, & Rah-VEEOH-lee, and main dishes like rib-eyes, salmon, chicken, rack of lamb, veal, and steak.  And let's not forget the sides...asparagus, potatoes, sweet corn, etc.  Step #3:  Arrive for your reservation.  GIADA is located in the Cromwell and their entrance is on Flamingo just east of Las Vegas Blvd.  I suggest valet at the Cromwell.  For those of you that wish to take a stroll through the Linq or walk off dinner, then park at the Linq.  Step #4:  Check in and wait in their lobby's comfortable seating.  The lobby also sports a photo booth where you can take instant pictures.  These pictures can be printed on the spot (we didn't print our since the printer was busted), uploaded on Twitter, and/or uploaded to The Facebook.  Step #5:  Your hostess will take you to your table.  You server will arrive shortly for your drink order and of course, drop off some carbs (i.e. breads and spreads) and some of their $8 water.   You smell that?  Yup, it's fresh Las Vegas Strip air.  The restaurant has retractable windows (opened when we dined) and a good view of the strip.  Step #6:  Check out the menu one last time and make your decision.  For me, it was the Orzo Meatballs and Risotto (crab & scallops).  My beautiful date had the Spaghetti and Lobster Arancini.    Step #7:  Enjoy the view.  That means phones down, no Yelping, no texting, and no Facebook.  My gf had a pretty good view of Caesar's and the Bellagio Fountains.  My view was the gf.  My thoughts....I had the best view.   Step #8:  Food arrives and it's time to eat.  Okay, bring the phones back out for some pictures if you do that kinda thing.  To be frank, our food pictures are really unnecessary since almost every food photo is already posted on Yelp.  Just remember, there's only one original fork pic.  As for our meal, I loved mine and my gf's.  Yes, we tend to sample each other's dishes because that's what Yelpers do.  Everything tasted good, presentation was as good as it gets, and the portions were just right (enough that kept your satisfied, not too much that your belly couldn't afford dessert).   Step #9:  Decide or have one of their Italian doughnuts, cookies, Tiramisu, gelato, or sorbets for dessert. We passed since we already had dessert lined up elsewhere  Step #10:  Repeat.  I look forward to trying their lunch next time.   PS:  I have to mention the overall service at Giada.  5 Stars for the service here.  Our hostess and servers were great.  The Manager made multiple stops at our table to check on us and on the way out, he went out of his way to thank us for dining here.  Kudos, Giada!  So far, I'm a fan.

FWUtujIDFugGYaYTXxFQ1g.text: Worst meal Very expensive Disgusting sauce Skimpy - not generous Service good though They fill your water all night long. Menu is borderline Italian - they should stick to the basics instead of cooking things that are absurd.   Good service. Disgusting food taste.

VSIMLaJrGoKm6jaUKBJBMg.text: First off let me say, we're locals. We came when the restaurant opened, for lunch, and it was abysmal. I had a "panini" that amounted to cat food on two slices of white bread. I digress. That was two years ago, a lifetime in restaurant terms, so we decided to try again on our anniversary. Big mistake. Our reservation was at 8:15, we were sat at 8:40, after watching people around us sat before us. Bad start. We sit down and get our menus, and we waited 20+ minutes until the server came back to take our wine order. Here's the thing, I saw that he was was working, but for the level of overpriced we are paying I expect someone to notice how long we're sitting without even getting water. WHERE'S MY WINE? I digress. Our poor waiter. We were already irritated and my level of judgy was already through the roof. He apologized for the wait, but when I explained that we'd already had a bad experience and this wasn't starting off promising, he wallflowered. Practically disappeared. I'm not mean or imposing, I try to explain wth levity, and my hope is that someone will say, I got you!! I'm proud of what we do here and this meal will rock your socks off! Yeah, no. That didn't happen. He proceeded to not make eye contact the rest of the meal. The food... the food was tasty. We had meatballs, bruschetta, and arancini, all yummy. We split the bucatini, which was overcooked and gummy, very disappointing. Lastly we ordered salmon and branzino. The branzino was good, but my salmon promised summer vegetables and I got corn with like 6 Lima beans.  Sigh. Suffice to say, we should have stuck to our regular Vegas haunts. In this city, I expect great service first, and great food second. If you can't deliver on one, you'd better deliver on the other. If you undeliver on both? Two strikes, you're out. Giada, I'm in the middle of watching Next Food Network Star, and I'm fully side eyeing you. I have no doubt you make hand over fist money, but it's at the cost of your reputation and food authority. Try harder.

Uo67dKywwUuUXZ8lG641IQ.text: So happy I finally made it to Giada! The food was great I went on thanksgiving day and tried the tasting menu. The starter was fresh and the variety was great. The second course was even better with each course getting better I was to full for dessert. The tasting course was $80 bucks and well worth the price I will return. I asked to be sat by the terrace because of the view of the Bellagio, however the windows were open and it was chilly.

UMVcU0SP-Oe5rltocqFzlA.text: Seeing as Giada is the creation of a television chef, I didn't necessarily have high hopes. I was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance is aided by a good spot on the Strip with spanning glass windows that give way to views of the Bellagio fountains and Caesars Palace. It feels more high-class than it is, but that's not to say the meal disappoints. I found myself wanting more of the Three Cheese Tortellini, as the braised beef broth and Genovese sauce was dynamite.  We were in Las Vegas for my birthday, and our very kind (and legit Italian!) server sneaky brought me birthday cookies, with fanciful presentation. He continuously thanked us for attending and making the restaurant part of my birthday.  The only complaint was the initial wait. We had reservations and for a Saturday night, they did not seem particularly busy. There were maybe five people waiting to be seated, so we went ahead and asked for a window seat. They said they would try to accommodate, and after about 25 minutes, we passed an open window seat to be seated not at a window. Oh well. Oh, and they offered this hokey, expensive three-course option for like $100 where you get a souvenir menu encased in a silver pamphlet that had a generic picture of Giada De Laurentiis in it that probably wouldn't have even been worth stealing.  Ambiance: 5/5 Cocktails: 4.5/5 Actual Giada De Laurentiis presence: 0/5

2r_1ICJIQfHuHbXmPuKbZQ.text: Worst service I've ever had. We had high hopes as giada has always been our favorite celebrity chef. Our reservation was at 6:30pm but we didn't get seated until 7:15 and served food at 8pm. We waived waiters left and right but were ignored. Disappointed because we were looking forward to it. Felt ignored the entire time (bar and seated)   Locals in the waiting room said it's only good service when giada is in town

7AD1xvdiLpdyCImwrbnLYw.text: This was everything I had hoped it would be. Excellent service, top notch, well prepared and presented dishes!! If you're smart you'll ask for Joseph to be your server, style, class, grace and killer cookies:)

pkrId-prg3ugnyHa2VvsZA.text: The steak was very dry and it's over priced, the waiter was ok until I had to put him in his place after being terribly rude when we first sat down, over all the only good thing about this place is the chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream!  Will we be back??most likely not

tqIa0YQN74-D7366Y3Qw3w.text: I've been several times, love sitting at the bar. The bread plate is amazing! This time we had a window seat and did the chefs tasting menu, I highly recommend this! We ordered a starter of meat and burrata (fantastic) off the regular menu and were thankful, the antipasti with the tasting menu was eh. Mrs loved the lemon crema spaghetti with shrimp, I had the rigatoni with Bolognese which was very tasty. Both had the steak to finish, YUM! Could have done without the sides that came with the third course. We aren't big dessert people but they bring the cart over and offer you 3 each - the lemon cookies are hands down the most fantastic! Kudos all!

U2rYaBIo4MS2hScLXKghnA.text: Was so excited to go to Giada's for my daughters 21st birthday with a group of ladies and sadly disappointed. We were tucked away in a small room so missed out on the beauty of the restaurant. We ordered 7 dishes and the portion sizes we're ridiculously small and so overpriced. I completely understand that you are paying for atmosphere and location but it was ludicrous. My friend ordered a side of Polenta and it was a 2" scoop, lol. We laughed about it and when the bill came we cried. The waiter was very unfriendly and didn't provide top service like you would expect at an upscale restaurant. If you decide to go get ready to empty your pockets, not happy.

7Mx0e_AEYI7QXoKzcpSqRA.text: Giada is my absolute favorite Food Network chef. She inspired me in so many ways to cook, eat healthier, etc. I have met her several times and she's been a pleasure to be with.  So when I heard that she was opening a restaurant, I couldn't pass it up. Let's fast forward to a year of wishing: I finally was able to pay a visit! And let me tell you...it was everything I imagined her restaurant to be.  Ambience: Very modern, elegant, yet welcoming. It feels as if you're walking into Giada's home. It's surrounded with pics of her family, furniture that she has at home, etc. I love how it has a woman's touch to the decor...  Food: Delicious! Exactly what I would expect from Giada. Portions are smaller but good enough to have a bite from lots of things from the menu. I encourage sharing as this will allow you to try all the items you want to order (it's difficult to choose just one! lol. My first experience at dinner was so good that I had to come back for lunch the next day...  What I Ordered (Dinner):  * Complimentary Bread Plate: I enjoyed the homemade rosemary focaccia! So flavorful dipped in the pesto sauce it comes with!  * Orzo Meatballs: The best meatballs I've ever had. Not exaggerating. Very tender and flavorful. My mom who is not a meatball person enjoyed it and stole my portion! I was so mad haha. Please get this...it's Jade's favorite (Giada's daughter). This was so good I ordered it again on my second visit!  * Grilled Octopus: Not chewy at all. Super tender. It had a nice char on the outside and paired well with the potato caper salsa it was served with. It's a favorite of Giada's.  * Fritto Misto: I've had better. The batter wasn't too crispy but loved the lemon aioli and fennel salad it came with.  * Oysters with Prosecco Mignonette: Sweet, fresh, & clean tasting from the mignonette sauce. Wish we had more!  * Sopressata: How could you go wrong with spicy salami?!  * Caprese Salad: The mini heirloom tomatoes were super sweet and the mozzarella was oozing with creaminess. Such a guilty pleasure.  * Romaine Salad (Giada's version of a Caesar Salad): I loved how Giada added crispy capers and bits of anchovies. Worked well with the grated parmesan and crispy romaine.  * Lobster Ravioli: I wasn't a fan. The tarragon butter sauce had a unique flavor I wasn't too fond of. The ravioli was al dente though which I was happy about.   * Crispy Branzino with Orange Vinaigrette: I was really surprised with this dish. Absolutely delicious! The fish was very crispy and the meat was moist. I wouldn't have expected it to work well with the arugula salad with orange vinaigrette but it was a match made in heaven! Bitter from the arugula and nice citrus pop from the vinaigrette. Highly recommended if you like fish!  * Lemon Spaghetti with Jumbo Shrimp: I fell in love with this dish. It's deceiving at first that it's on the smaller side bit it's very filling!!!! You get two jumbo prawns and they are huge! The sauce is very light and refreshing even if it is a creamy sauce. I love the clean flavor the lemon gives and the nice pop the fried capers provided. I can see why this is one of her signature dishes.  * Tuscan Ribeye with A Fried Egg: A meat lover's dream come True. 28 oz ribeye cooked to your liking with a fried egg on top...who wouldn't love that?! I love the oozing yoke paired with the juicy ribeye. The other table beside us couldn't take their eyes off this thing...it's definitely a sight to see.  * Giada's Signature Cookies: My favorite was the chocolate chip. Warm and chocolatey!   What I Ordered (Brunch):  * Carbonara Pizza w/ Fried Egg: Pancetta and an egg on a pizza? I'm sold. So good! Everything you'd ever want in a pizza...  * Margherita Pizza: Simplicity at it's best. The tomato sauce was very sweet and the traditional combo of basil, tomato, & mozzarella never fails. And on a side note...Giada's pizza dough is very good. Has a nice honey note to it and it's charred to perfection in her brick oven.  * Orzo Meatballs: It's that good that I had to order it again!  * Zucchini Scapece: I'm so glad I was able to get this as a side order. Strands of potato, zucchini, and onion are lightly fried and served piled high to your table. I couldn't stop snacking on this in between bites from my pizza!  * Arugula Salad with Candied Lemon Vinaigrette: As simple as the salad was....I really enjoyed the vinaigrette. Little bits of candied lemon bits floated around and provided a nice burst of citrus that contrasted with the peppery arugula and crispy pancetta.   * White Sangria: Bubbly, fruity, and crisp. Perfect for the hot weather!  Overall I had a great time at Giada's. Service was superb and the food was amazing. I'll admit it's very expensive but worth every penny. You absolutely get what you pay for. It definitely was the highlight of my trip to Vegas. I can't wait to go back.   PS: Make sure you stop by the photo booth for an opportunity to capture your visit!!!!

2wIPOu0_3b84IvJVBecuiw.text: Classy, but relaxed atmosphere? Yep. Beautiful views? True. Delicious food? Without a doubt! Portions? Perfect for us. Expensive? Duh. Worth it? You bet - every last cent!   My man and I never go out to fancy dining restaurants. Heck, we rarely go out to eat, period (we're fantastic cooks, and I'm picky). But, we were back in good ole' Vegas for a wedding and decided to treat ourselves to brunch after we'd been dying to know what Giada's has to offer. Man, we were NOT disappointed in the least.   The first thing that caught our attention was the classy, elegant, yet very "homey" look and vibe of the joint. Giada did a really great job with creating that welcome sense of environment, yet still adding that special splash of classiness. We arrived early and had cocktails at the bar (hello our new fave whiskey drink, Serpico - and I'm not even a whiskey girl - and the delicious White Peach Bellini and Prosecco) while the friendly hostess prepared our table a half hour early for us. Every employee we encountered and talked to was super friendly and provided superb customer service. Now, down to the food....  We ordered the Tasting Board, which comes with different cheeses (OMG, the parmigiano reggiano! YUM!), olives, a honeycomb, some salumi (or prosciutto di parma), and a veggie mixture (can't remember the name). We also ordered the arugula salad (but swapped the crispy pancetta for the fried capers...again, YUM), the Caprese Egg White Fritata, and the Salumi Pizza. The portion sizes were absolutely perfect for us, and the food.....OUT OF BOUNDS! I seriously couldn't believe how good just an arugula salad can be. The pizza dough was by far one of the best tasting doughs I've ever had - light and airy, yet had that wood fired char throughout. The fresh mozzarella on both the pizza and my fritata was so, so, so DELICIOUS - there's nothing better than watching the gooey cheese pull away for miles! We topped off our meal with the cookie platter: PB&J, Chocolate Chunk (the ooey, gooey melted chocolate that resembled the perfectly melted gooey cheese), and the Lemon Ricotta, which, ok, let's get real....that Lemon Ricotta cookie is like crack (sorry, no other way to put it!).   We had such an amazing, memorable experience! If there was a con to this place (besides the damage it does to your wallet) would be the service was rather slow on a slow day. We honestly didn't mind, though, because I feel that is done on purpose to allow folks to talk and feel like they're in an intimate setting without feeling pressured by a wait staff that can sometimes have that used car salesman vibe. I highly recommend (just save up for 6 months before going)!

6a-RuOCIsoWWsIMMmr3iMg.text: Very classy place and the food is excellent!! A little pricey, well worth it and the view is fantastic!! Right on the heart of the Strip. Make it really special  and request a window seat.  Going for breakfast (brunch) or lunch is a real treat. Giada's style of cooking is incorporated in every dish, which makes this place truly unique.  The bar is very pretty with elegance, not overdone though.

UAVI-oetuhqL2tBqg1EOdQ.text: Always a great dining experience!  We shared the arugula salad, filet, polenta, and Marsala meatballs, along with a wonderful bottle of wine. The service, (Joseph), and all employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. Service was wonderful. We've been to this restaurant  a minimum of 5 times. It's Valentine's Day! Great time. We'll dine again at Giada's on our next trip to Vegas!  The view was breathtaking too!

_f5Cde9dHbI1bp6jHImTjQ.text: Great food, gorgeous atmosphere, and even better service! We got the Groupon and were very happy with it! Nancy is the best server- would definitely recommend her!

MWhsf_O_FububvPncbFLCw.text: Great decor and atmosphere with fantastic views of the Strip. The speciality drinks were very good while we waited for a table. The bar staff and host staff were very friendly. So was our waiter and he made several recommendations. The Prosciutto do Parma was nice and the Fritto Misto was excellent. The Orzo Meatballs were just ok, nothing special and the sauce was very simple.   I ordered the Branzino for the main course. The fish was cooked nicely but the salad was very light and not overly flavorful. It was fresh but just too simple to be paired with a light fish. The fennel puree was nice but I would have preferred some bolder flavor. My friends ordered the Salmon and Lobster Ravioli. Both looked great and they loved theirs, I drew the short straw! Overall, a very nice restaurant.

nDJnQCr4ySkqV_aobWdItA.text: We loved everything we ordered. I am Italian,  I cook gourmet italian and have been to Italy 7 times ,so I know authentic Italian food with good ingredients. To start, My husband and I loved the bread  ensemble and our pasta dishes. Mine had marscapone cheese and was amazing and he had the lobster  ravioli. The Marsala meatballs were amazing!!Also a great wine pairing suggested by waitress. Cookies were so tasty but unfortunately, we were so full, we could not order 2 desserts. While our waitress may have not been the greatest waitress, I am just judging the food because I don't care that she was forgetful because her recommendations were great. I don't understand the low ratings. I feel it is reasonably priced for how amazing the food is.  We will be back every time we visit. My new favorite restaurant.

-RJVOeLWsRJl-h0Y1O8-XA.text: Fantastic lunch today. Signature Sangria. Ordered the lemon pesto grilled cheese and ther SLAT. Both were excellent and would order again. Has the great orzo meatballs

w4yxg7E-Sp08Rwa4Z3tTmw.text: Dined here with the family for a surprise anniversary party - the dinner was AMAZING! Loved the Giada's favorite appetizers, the lobster ravioli, rack of lamb, filet mignon, sweet corn and sausage... the whole experience was wonderful! Beautiful views of the strip, delicious food, fantastic service from our server Nancy. Highly recommend!!!! Worth every penny!

nQ5hbp6lXNiV0vSuBTSkDA.text: This restaurant was good, but there are better Italian restaurants to visit in Vegas. I recommend Giada for a cocktail and antipasti- the ricotta crostini is delicious!!! Portions are large and meant to be shared. Prosciutto di Parma is as buttery as it gets! Pasta was just ok. I had both the shrimp spaghetti and  lobster ravioli. The ravioli had anise in it, which really overpowered the dish.   Service started off slow, but by the middle of the meal was excellent! I think it just took a minute for the waiter to warm up to us :)  Also- just a side note to the restaurant- we ordered a bottle of Biale Black Chicken- and the woman (unsure if sommelier or not) that served the bottled mispronounced it. I am only bringing this up because it seemed as if her designated job was to serve the wine, and if so, she should be familiar with the vineyards/wineries pronunciation.    If given stars on the service and antipasti- would definitely be a 4. Unfortunately, I felt as if the pasta flavors were too bold and didn't blend well. Like I said- I highly recommend Giada's for a drink and antipasti. Great place to visit for a small bite before a night out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti- Fresh Ricotta Crostini, Prosciutto di Parma, Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese. Delicious!!

gf0uL7rH3JPol25pCxic8w.text: To start off we made reservations and were greeted nicely and escorted to the bar to wait, order drinks, or tapas while we waited for our reservation(we were early). The bartenders were nice, down to earth, knowledgeable of the menu and eager to suggest good wines or cocktails. Despite a busy bar, they were attentive and timely. We were escorted to our table and told happy birthday on our way. We were asked if the seating was okay which is always a plus. We had a view of he fountains at the Bellagio too. We sat in comfortable chairs at adequate height and width that I did not have to readjust I the entire night. The table is laid with monogrammed dishes and decor that are simple but yet you know where you're at...Giada's duh! The waitress, Nancy, was prompt and explained the drink menu, tasting menu and regular menu to us and explained how she would suggest ordering. Not only did Nancy greet us sweetly but she was able to manage up her assistant and their menu. I'm not the biggest spicy food fan and Nancy offered to have the chef tone the spice down so I could still enjoy an item. The assistant brought us bread to go with our wine that we got at the bar and explained the different toppings to us. Oh my the BREAD and the delicious toppings! To die for. We decided on the tasting menu and it did not disappoint. The bacon wrapped dates melted in our mouths, the crostini and goat cheese peppers were delicious. Oh my goodness, an amazing start! Lemon Spaghetti and the Bucatini were superb! Fresh pastas and light but powerful flavors. We both ordered the filet medium rare, him with lobster and I with shrimp. Holy Hell!! It came with sweet potato mash and some onions with lemon potatoes and polenta served family style. Wow, it was all perfect. For dessert we got to pick from the dessert tray and my plate said Happy Birthday in chocolate. Get the Napoli! Great! Never once did we feel rushed and we always had a full glass of sparkling water. Nancy was amazing and so is Giada's. Highly satisfied and will tell all my friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sT0yrzUZum5WEotjp2W58A.text: Sorry Gordon Ramsay, but Giada is easier on the eyes!  So you're walking the Vegas strip and you want to have lunch at one of the top restaurants. Well, there's a lot to choose from. That's what makes Vegas VEGAS.  Giada is one of those restaurants you want to eat at. Located on the strip at the Cromwell, Giada offers a unique dining experience for anyone!   If you like lobster, take advice from me and try the Lobster Roll. I've eaten the best lobster out of Boston, MA but Giada is a super close second, or maybe even a tie!  She takes a different spin on the traditional Lobster Roll, but you will not be disappointed by this buttery crustacean paradise.  Why only 3 stars...the management is not good! Ever had that experience where they could care less if you ate there or not...yep it was that kind of experience.

oZHEZWSokVCqIC3goFM4vA.text: By far one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! Drinks to dessert, it is a great experience. Thank you, Nancie for making our last visit even better!

cN1K3-pyd5EfC5HiGNdLpg.text: I had the ravioli, the lobster seemed like there was bits of shell and the pasta portion was hard.  I was not impressed.  Wifie had the veal meatball, and the taste was like a really good chef boyrdee meatball.  The service was outstanding, but I don't go to restaurants to make friends.

i-uPvxnOhFoQ39nQuQeMZQ.text: We had a great time.  Food and view are top notch.  Nancie was a great server too.  Four stars due to missing reservation that was made over the phone last week.

aSUa8a0z4GDK2UZfaHrRwQ.text: Dinner with the fam! First off, the decor was probably my favorite part! Very modern/contemporary, even right down to the hostess outfit.  The bar area has quiet an expansive loungey area that spills into the dining room. The actual dining area is intimate and a little bunched together. I just felt that the food was okay and not really worth the price paid. Maybe I hyped it up too much so that I expected a Robuchon-esq dinner. *shrugs* My family of 17 people ended up splitting the tab and it came out to something like $90/pp. This would be a dinner consisting of one entree, lots of antipasta to share, a couple bottles of wine. Quick-E tips: -The photo booth is right by the escalators. Right when you get off, turn left and you'll see a little door. I totally missed it! -It's dimly lit AKA - kind of dark. Sets the mood if you're out on a date I guess! -If you plan to order alcoholic bevy with dinner, expect to spend dough people!  -Antipasti portions are super small. More like teasers. One dish is suited for sharing with maybe a dinner party of 4. I personally enjoyed the complimentary bread plate with spreads the most.... -Pappardelle was the best bang for your buck IMO. Flavorful pork ragot! My husband ordered and I was so envious. -Fregolotto portion was very small and I also felt the sauce wasn't salted. Even with the starters and bread, I finished my main dish and still felt a tinge of hunger. This is coming from a pregnant person who would normally get full off a small portion! To those that don't know exactly what it is, the pasta kind of looks like large pearl like cous cous.  -If you're one of those Rib Eye fanatics, you might love or hate Giada's ribeye. It's a Tomohawk. A couple people ordered it and said that there was more fat than meat. I tasted a well done piece and thought it was nothing special. -Roasted Fennel side was really disappointing. I took a couple small bites and gave the rest to my husband. It did nothing for me taste wise because it felt very plain.  -Whole Roasted Chicken looked delicious, but I didn't steal a piece. DARN! Wanted to see how it stacked up to Thomas Keller's version.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fregolotto @giadavegas #VegasEats
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I like these sofas!

0fM-lvFmp2pmWYOojBsudg.text: From start to finish we had a fabulous meal. We we *slightly* worried after some reviews and are so glad we went.   The tasting menu is by far the way to go. I would much rather have a few smaller portions and get to try more the menu any day.   We loved the small bread tray and like others wished it was bigger at the time, but in all honestly once our food came we were glad it did not fill us up. The bacon wrapped dates were packed with flavor, the lemon shrimp spaghetti had the best shrimp i have had in my life and as a steakhouse fan I was blown away by the tender filet I had. The polenta was creamy with slighlty spicy sausage that was like velvet.   My biggest tip is to save room for dessert. The chocolate chip cookies are the best cookies i have ever had in my life. I know you are thinking its a chocolate chip cookie, no big deal but this cookie is the best you will ever have.    I must tell you that sitting by the windows is worth the wait every time. We were very lucky to be dinning on a night with perfect weather with wide open windows. Our server, Greg, was one of the best waiters we have ever had. Excellent attentive and caring all at the same time.   We cant wait to come back...

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu... Out of this world excellent
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing desserts from the tasting menu. The chocolate chip cookies are out of this world good

ADQCRvKYhL5uwyVjgc-KoA.text: My friends and I decided to celebrate Valentine's day at Giada. What made our evening was not only the elegant restaurant, the fabulous and tasty food but the excellent service provided by our server Radoslav. His attention to detail, the very detailed and knowledgeable menu, suggestions and making us feel like we were the only customers in the restaurant made our evening very special!

Z8114CJsfGHuRHJU4jv4fA.text: I'm so glad that my sis and I walked in here and had dinner at the bar the other night! The cocktails are beautifully made and taste refreshing. Food was on point and exactly the light and delicious meal we were craving. We shared the arugula salad, pasta flight, and lemon souffle. Our bartender, Robert, was awesome. We pretty much went with his recommendations and had the best dinner experience-at-the-bar ever. Giada's ambiance is upscale and warm. I highly recommend this place for a romantic night out, girls dress-up dinner, or just to eat at the bar and have great conversations with Robert :)

0YafTddVjt6rWv6IKrm7tA.text: I was kind of hesitant about coming here just because of some of the reviews that I have read.  But I just had to try out one of my favorite celebrity chefs.  I must say that our whole dining experience here was top notch.  We had a great server, I think her name was Amber, and was able to get a table at the window which had some awesome views of the strip and Belagio's water show.   Everything we ordered was delicious.  Started off with the Wagyu beef salamis which were so amazingly addicting.  The Charred octopus which was so tender that it almost didn't tasted like octopus.  I guess I like my octopus somewhat chewy and it just didn't have that same consitency which must have been the reason I wasn't too impressed.  But none the less still very tasty.  And lastly the Imported Burrata which was very tasty with the balsamic salt that it came with. For the mains we ordered the Veal chop milanese which was a generous portion of veal the was butterflied and deep fried with fontina cheese.  My favorite dish of the whole night was the crab and scallop risotto.  The risotto was perfectly cooked along with some of the best tasting scallops I have ever had.  Pros: Our server was the best.  She offered great suggestions, really nice, and came and checked up on us at the perfect times. They have a nice wine list, with good variety of Californian wines.   I really liked their bread.   Beautiful restaurant with great views.  If you can try to get a window seat. The food was great and liked everything that we ordered specially the crab and scalp risotto.  Cons: I did notice that some tables that looked like it might have been tight and hidden in the corners.    Overall: I highly recommend coming here.  Our experience was top notch and really enjoyed our time there. However, I can see how the restaurant may come across as "pretentious" to some and how some people might have had a totally different experience as ours.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal chop saltinbocca
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and scallop risotto. The best!!!

tkLgCDb5SVWUxJsdbU2NtQ.text: Meh. We had dinner on Christmas Eve. The staff are friendly and attentive and my arugula salad was to die for, but everything else was disappointing. The bread we received was stale and our whole roast chicken cacciatore style for two was over cooked, dry and tough.  The smashed potatoes side were alright, but nothing to write home about. We skipped dessert. My excitement and anticipation for her new restaurant opening in Baltimore this Spring is waning.

8BydJBVOcAbSu7cJTtbnUg.text: My husband and I searched high and low for a 7:30 reservation at a place that wasn't a steakhouse in Las Vegas. It was surprisingly difficult. We needed that time because we had tickets to the 9:30 Ka show at MGM, a few hotels away. This was supposed to be a big night for us. We brought our twin 3-year olds with us to Vegas, so there wasn't much opportunity to eat a nice meal (mostly cafe or buffet) Anyways, we get there at 7:25 and the hostess tells us it is going to be about 10 minutes because a table hasn't yet cleared. No problem, we go the bar, get a drink. We get up after a while to check out the menu. Now it is 7:40. At 7:50 we check with the hostess. Any minute now, she says. I tell her we have a show to make and are getting close to a problem. She seems to understand.....by 8:00 I am really concerned. I go back and she says the table will be ready in just a few minutes. I tell her that unless the people have left and the table is being turned I am not interested. She assured me that it was and we are finally seated. But now we have to rush through dinner at a rapid pace to get to the show on time. So much for my nice dinner out. I ordered the crab toast (delicious), risotto balls (ok but not amazing) and fried Brussels sprouts. Why are fried Brussels sprouts with balsamic glaze so amazing? Every time I get them I love them.My husband got the filet and said it was VERY good. Our waiter even gave us cookies to go as a mea culpa for the wait time. I appreciated his rapid response. All in all I was disappointed with the hostess issues which ended up making the rest of the evening hard to enjoy. I won't be back.

SaGEbLDjwqRKTY6lZw9J5g.text: Good but not great. The service was okay at best. The things that were good (orzo meatballs for example) were very good but everything else we had was pretty average.  Had a good meal but probably wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Temptest. Delicious!

qbbh0yEIJSMmH0vXBArtNg.text: Best brunch in Vegas!! I love Giada so we had to try her restaurant on our recent trip to Vegas. I had the polenta waffle, which was perfectly delicious and my boyfriend had the American breakfast. The bread that accompanied his breakfast was some of the best bread we have ever had!! We loved being able to people watch out over the strip while we ate. We will be back for dinner on our next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Obsessed with the place settings!

ZHmcgJis1dvoNWC6EzXYLw.text: Hands down Giada is tops in Vegas. The food & service is always spot on 5 . Vegas has amazing variety of restaurants to choose from but Giada is my first stop when in town.

aYZxjdHbT2xNCbP3vdDFHw.text: Wanted to go someplace nice for my birthday. I'd been to brunch here so figured, as an Italian place, it would be good. Unfortunately, it wasn't. First, I don't eat cream and literally every pasta except one has cream in it. Even the spaghetti bolognese. Usually, there are plenty of things I can eat on an Italian menu but not here. The server, who was very nice, recommended I get the boucatini without the ricotta cheese on it. So I did. It was a bad suggestion and I doubt he'd ever tried it without the cheese. Really bland. I told him it needed something and ordered a side of shrimp. It turned out that two shrimp were $14. The shrimp were good, but still, overall, really disappointing. My fiance got the scallop risotto which was good, but he agreed he'd had better. The bread they give you at the beginning was excellent though and we had the orzo meatballs for our appetizer which were also really good. For the price you pay, you're better off going to one of the many great steakhouses like BLT across the street or Mastro's a block down. Lastly, they did nothing for my birthday at all even though the hostess asked if it was my birthday when we checked in and we heard her tell the server it was. So that was a bummer. And then the next day I got a message from OpenTable (I'd made the reservation through them) that we had skipped out on the reservation. So I guess the hostesses (all four them???) forgot to check us in even though she had to have seen the reservation to know it was my birthday. Anyway, you don't have to spend a lot to get great food, but when we do spend a lot, we expect something much better than this. We will most certainly not be back. Too many other good restaurants on the strip to waste time and money at Giada again.

Enep0J-LWOnICYxOozJwYw.text: This dining experience did NOT live up to all the hype & our expectations. The food was good, but not great. Our dinner order was placed, but the kitchen somehow lost the order & we had to wait 30-40 minutes later to get our food. Thank goodness, we made dinner reservations early otherwise we would've been late for the Beatles Love show at the Mirage. Other patrons who came in after us all got their dinner before we did.   Also, we were celebrating my wife's birthday that night & we made reservations 1 month in advance & requested a window seat to over look the Bellagio water show. Only 1 day before our dinner date, the personnel at the restaurant called to confirm our reservations & said "by the way" in order to get a window seat, each of us would have to order at least $100.00 of food each!!! Such a ridiculous & crazy rule and to only tell us 1 day before our dinner event. If I knew ahead of time, I would have never made reservations or come to this restaurant! I would've had time to make other arrangements & book a different restaurant for my wife's birthday! But since we were already in Vegas & it's too late to book a nice restaurant for this special occasion, we had to come here.  The only good experience here was our waitress (Lauren). She gave impeccable service & explained every detail of the menu & made us feel very welcome. Also at the end, she gave my wife a complimentary birthday dessert consisting of 3 cookies. She gave excellent service!  Also, I like to point out that while you wait for your table in the front lobby, there's a photo booth machine that you can take pictures. But down side is there photo printer is broken!   Overall, disappointing experience at Giada's! Horrible rule of $100.00 to spend per person to sit at a window seat & NOT telling your patrons until the day before their dinner reservations. Losing the order ticket & making us wait 40 minutes for our dinner. Giada, you need to take notice of such poor practices at your restaurant & make changes. There are plenty of other fine dining establishments in Vegas that people can go spend their hard earned money on instead of here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A nice gesture by our waitress...yummy lemon cookies
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their 3 most popular dishes - Spaghetti with shrimp, lemon, &amp; basil, Crab &amp; scallop risotto, and Lobster ravioli
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti - Orzo meatballs with parmesan pomodoro &amp; Charred Octopus with potato, fennel, and olive salsa

_6CHPxAfLAR9hgK_QLaSFA.text: After the less than stellar service we received on our first visit to Giada's we decided to give it another shot, this time for dinner.  The restaurant is always so booked that we had to take an 8:45pm dinner reservation even though we booked weeks in advance.  Not a huge deal as it's Vegas and you're going to be up late every night anway.  We arrived a little early and had to wait about 10 minutes to get a table.  Just enough time for me to go to the bar and order a red Sangria to sip on while we waited.  We got our table and were pleasantly surprised to see that they sat us at a booth near the center facing the windows so we had a good view of the Bellagio fountain.  I'm not sure if telling them this was an anniversary dinner had anything to do with it.  Much better than our view last time when we were put at the far right of the windows.  Our waiter was Cliff and he was MUCH better than the Miley Cyrus lookin' girl we had the last time.  We has friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu.  I ordered the Surf and Turf, (Filet Mignon with Lobster Ravioli and Cliff made a great recommendation on a glass of red wine to go with it. The wife was Spaghetti with Shrimp and the mother in law had Risotto with Scallops.  Everything was very good.  My steak was cooked perfectly.  However I was a little disappointed that the dish only came with ONE ravioli, (not a lot of food for the $56 price tag the dish carries).  I guess Giada doesn't want you getting too full.  For dessert we ordered the leaning tower of chocolate and Cliff also brought us some complimentary lemon cookies on a plate that said, "Happy Anniversary".  Nice touch.  My wife raved about the coffee the last time we were here so when Cliff came to take our dessert order I mentioned that my wife was looking forward to it.  Unfortunately Cliff thought I meant she just wanted a cup of regular coffee when what she wanted was the mocha that she had had on our last visit.  The wife tried the plain coffee but didn't really like it.  So I went over to Cliff and apologized for the misunderstanding.  I showed him a picture of the coffee drink she previously had as I had it on my phone.  Apparently they make a different mocha drink at night than they do in the evening and Cliff wasn't quite sure which one she had had.  But he brought her both an Orange Mocha and a kind of Amaretto Espresso.  The wife liked them both but ended up drinking the Espresso and giving the Mocha to her mom.  Overall the experience was amazing and Cliff did an excellent job of making the evening memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

7RX14qtkOe-MsE3ws3rkXQ.text: My husband and I chose to celebrate Valentine's Day here and we are so glad we did..... When we arrived, the restaurant had an amazing aroma of burning wood chips which made us feel at home and the ambience was just beautiful. The hostesses were so friendly and took us right to our table, which was a curved booth facing the window where we were able to see the Bellagio fountains! Perfect scenery for a romantic dinner! We were greeted by our waiter, Joe R., who was incredibly friendly and personable and did not skip a beat when explaining some of the more popular food items. He also suggested a red wine that ended up pairing perfect with our meal. Everything he suggested off of the menu, we ordered, and it was one of the BEST meals we've ever had! Here's a rundown of our meal....Baby Sweet Peppers, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Meat & Cheese plate, Spaghetti w/shrimp, lemon & basil (DELICIOUS), Lobster Ravioli, Salmon, Brussel Sprouts, and for dessert we had a Chocolate Chip Cookie, Lemon Cheesecake, and a Chocolate Truffle candy bar....O.M.G...Hats off to Joe for making us feel so special and for showing us his professional serving skills! (Did I mention that we were served a plate with 2 heart lemon cookies and "Happy Valentine's Day" written in chocolate?!) 5 stars all the way around! Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XQagBMbtzU9XmIAcEho7eQ.text: This was our second time in for dinner...8 months apart...and the menu was the same, not even a special for a Friday night.   I love Giada...watch her shows...made many of her recipes...but for an overall dining experience in Vegas, where there are so many to choose from, not really excited about recommending to others. Don't get me wrong, the food was excellent with a nice wine list, and the chocolate tart is delicious (so light for being so decadent!)...so if you like her recipes, then you should go once. They were very accommodating by splitting a pasta entre for our app and cutting the tomahawk rib eye for us to share, so kudos there.   The problem is the vibe...its an extremely tiny space with a tiny bar...trying to be a CA restaurant with a CA attitude. It's loud with not enough staff for the amount of people they pack in...and the bar definitely needs more help. I don't mind waiting for my reservation (that you have to make a month in advance) if I can order a cocktail, but when the staff is rude because there's no place to stand to order a drink...and there's only one bartender to service the entire restaurant...then it's a problem. With that, I'm still willing to try them for brunch next trip and see if daytime is better. I want Giada's to succeed, but Vegas is a tough crowd to please.

0OUjafQOS-ALV1lrLg9LSg.text: I have been here 3 times now and I only have very positive things to say. Walking into the restaurant, you're not assaulted by over the top decor. It is very relaxed and easy on the eyes. If anything, the setting immediately draws your attention to food as there is a huge brick oven and chefs are preparing plates.  The menu they offer is small, but this is so time is dedicated to your food. I always get the Parmigiana-Reggiano cheese with wild sage honey as an appetizer. For my meal, I chose the Lasagna with eggplant and sausage. It was served with an arugula salad. I really felt like I was sitting at home eating comfort food when I dived into this dish. The flavors only complimented each other and not one thing was competing. Each time I eat here, I am amazed at how well the food is prepared and have not been disappointed with any of my choices.   If you're into non-alcoholic beverages, Dolce Vita is a fantastic drink served with a sprig of rosemary. Don't worry about the Rosemary overpowering the drink, in fact the scent only seems to add to the drink of fresh orange, peach puree, blood orange syrup, elderflower tonic, and club soda. I'm a fan of her signature cocktail "G": G Kappa Pisco, pineapple simple syrup, fresh lime, homemade apricot preserves, egg white & Angostura bitters.  But honestly, the lemon ricotta cookies are my favorite here. If I only ever wanted one dessert in my life, it would be those cookies. They come on an assorted cookie plate, but I always ask for just them and they accommodate my request.   Plan to spend time here because the experience is relaxed and unhurried. You are given time to appreciate your food, which I feel makes it a solid Italian experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muffuletta sandwich
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dolce Vita
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmigiana- Reggiano cheese with wild-sage honey.

k1ornB6Vr_6n4OPZYKFmUA.text: My friends discovered this restaurant, and they love it. So much they wanted to take me there the very next day. Giada is very popular, after dining there I see why. After being seated, we met our server, Doc(duct) he explained the menu and our choices. My friends ordered a seafood tower, large selection. But I 'm not crazy about octopus so I ordered the Italian chicken, and oyster on the half shell and oysters Rockefeller. both oysters were wonderful. The chicken was just as good, while I was enjoying the food, we were treated by some of the best servers ever.  Bottom line superb dining.

HJohx4u7Ugk06tVWKjHQXQ.text: The first and only location in the US, owned by the famous chef and grand-daughter of the even more famous produced.Great food on a beautiful setting, right above the busiest Strip intersection. Place is upscale and beautifully decorated, mostly to my surprise by painting by Giada herself (I did not know she was multi-talented, which gives it an even more intimate touch),..Not your average Italian menu, mostly regional, and inspired by "Californian influences". I had the crispy baked chicken for two; I was not crazy about it, but everything else looked great and my friends loved their choices so I am not going to give it a 3 stars just based on what I had. You are served a nice small platter of different sauces and types of bread to start with. Service was pretty friendly considering how busy it was was. Not sure if I would go back seeing that I did not see much of what I like, but it is not for everybody and that;s what makes it special; the dishes are from different regions of Italy which makes it unique and a rich experience for food lovers...

himQL04Rjr_WT3EPlhACBg.text: The food was absolutely delicious. We did the tasting menu, which I recommend. The service was amazing. Ask for Nancie. She is so friendly and helpful! We definitely will be coming back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert cart for tasting menu

XTzvM6iRyYm2POiDcQWVcw.text: Wow. What a disappointing first date. 3.5 stars. Ok, so I am a huge Giada fan. I love, love, love her recipes on FoodNetwork.com, and I melt for her smile and personality. Naturally, a group of friends plan a trip to Vegas for a 50th birthday and so we book a late Sunday lunch for 10 people at Giada, the restaurant. This is going to be great! We show up on time for lunch and taken past the very attractive cold display case of olives and other menu items, past the long open kitchen, and we are seated at a large round table in the middle of the dining room. The space is open, with high ceilings, and huge windows that are canted open, allowing a lovely breeze through the room. To me the decor was fairly unassuming, kind of like being at home in your living room - comfortable, laid-back. After our initial seating the service became spotty. Our server was ok, but basically left alone to tend to our table she was less than attentive, not meeting expectations considering the menu prices at Giada. I had read all over Yelp and elsewhere about the Spaghetti with lemon sauce and shrimp. Well, primed to try that dish we were told that it was Sunday at 1:30, and they were serving only brunch. It was a different menu than normal, and the Pasta dish was not on the menu. And no. They can't go off menu. Hmmm... Plan "B". So we got Brescaola ($13) and Proscutto ($18) and cheeses to start. All decent. Flatbreads, or pizzas, were just ok - the sausage ($16) version much tastier than the Margherita variety ($14). Orzo meatballs ($15)are an interesting take on the traditional but while tasty, they didn't get "wow" reviews from the table. Between the appetizer and main courses the server came by to clean up plates and silver. Remember, we're at Giada, not Olive Garden. The server takes our plates, removes the silverware and places the silver back on the table for the next course. C'mon Giada. The Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese was unique and tasty. I added San Daniele prosciutto, and I think it was $24. Tenderloin Sliders were ordered by several of my friends, and these were probably the best sandwiches on the menu, albeit pricey at $30. The Lasagna ($24) was terrific. Get it. Several lemon souffles were ordered for the table, and they were delicious. All in all, I expected so much more from Giada. Service was meh. The plates and bowls were oddly chipped. We got one set of silverware for everything but dessert. Food was 3 to 4.5 stars. Sometimes first dates just don't work out. Sometimes you have to try a second time. Sometimes things get better in a relationship, even one with a restaurant. I hope that's the case with Giada. As a foodie who's in love with the celebrity I hope this doesn't have to end. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipped condiment bowls.  Take a close look.  How do these reach the table in such a nice place.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yet another chipped appetizer plate.  3 out of 10 were chipped.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chipped appetizer plate...  ???

YcA9L91hGumih1BxwQf-Gg.text: This pains me, but for the kind of money Giada's is charging, I feel it my civic duty to warn folks.  Preface:  My husband and I are huge fans of Giada.  We came from Southern California to Las Vegas to go to her restaurant opening week.  It was delicious, service was fantastic.  Second trip about nine months later, bad experience.  Chalked it up to a bad night.  Third -- and last -- trip was April 7, 2017.  We were meeting friends from Chicago and at our recommendation we ate at Giada's.  We ordered cocktails and were all cajoled into ordering the tasting menu, $120 per person.  HUGE MISTAKE.  The antipasti course was moderate tasting and very sparse for four people.  The Second course, we ordered the lemon crema spaghetti.  The spaghetti was stone cold, the two pieces of shrimp were tasteless and bad texture.  Third course Filet was tasty, chicken was tasty, the basil mashed potatoes were stone cold.  We complained, they sent us a fresh batch.  All four of us couldn't get over the green look and ultimately felt that basil and potatoes do not pair well as flavors.  Really regretted ordering the tasting menu.  There is no doubt the attention to detail, the incredible presentation and service that we experienced on our first visit no longer exists at Giada's.  I should note that after our complaint, the manager did comp our first set of drinks and added some extra dessert at no extra charge.  Our bill was over $500.  I expect, when paying that amount of money, that the food should be exceptional.  Our meal at Lucille's BBQ the night after far exceeded the meal we had at Giada's.  Save yourself the money and heartache and go somewhere else.  SO SORRY Giada, was really rooting for you.

TQ6TrqfCOLY7zaBNYt9LNw.text: The dining room looks great!  It is over looking Las Vegas Blvd with a great view of the Bellagio and Caesars palace no matter the time of the day, the place is bright and airy.  Service is good too.  We ordered 3 different dishes. The carbonara pizza,  the lobster roll and the muffuletta & mortadella sandwich and rigatoni from kids menu. The best one in my opinion was the pizza, then the lobster roll, then the rigatoni and at last the muffuletta, mortadella and finocchiona sandwich.  I'd definitely came back here to try their dinner menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert plate -  excellent choices Starting with monkey bread, raspberry Danish, sticky bun, raspberry lemon yogurt cake and chocolate bites
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smore&#39;s cookie
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Muffuletta &amp; mortadella and finocchiona

_28x2M3jRWwqoVUyOvnO8g.text: No body makes better pasta than Giada.  The fettuccini shrimp scampi is delicious.  The scallops are PERFECTLY cooked.  My only complaint is that the candied lemons was missing from the arugula salad.  I did ask for it, but got a tablespoon of lemon juice with pulp instead.

hHFG58S__NKKuwhre7e_5Q.text: Let me start by saying I had really HIGH hopes for Giada's restaurant & although it wasn't terrible, it definitely didn't meet my expectations.   We arrived on time for our reservation & were asked to wait at the bar, which is fine, but on a Monday night when they weren't packed? Yeah. I don't know.  The bartender was okay, but rushed & short. I ordered the Giada cocktail ($15) which was good but a little sweet. My husband ordered a whiskey they were out of so he had to substitute.   We were finally seated about 15-20 minutes after our reservation time. It took a good 5 minutes before the waiter arrived at our table, another 3-4 minutes for water & then who knows how long it took for him to take our order.  We were given complimentary bread & accompaniments - which in my opinion was the best part of the meal.   Here's the low down:  Bacon wrapped dates - they were okay, but I have had better.  Artichoke arancini - Flavorless. The best part about the dish was the gravy they served with it.   White lasagna - NO. NO, I am not exactly sure what spice (possibly cloves) they put in this dish but it was soooooo overpowering it made my tongue and lips numb. ABSOLUTELY the worst bite of food I have ever had!   Sorry Giada, we won't be back. Service was slow and the food did not meet the standards.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada cocktail
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White lasagna

_0vujRw1NpO2DzsQCkbqKA.text: Incredible brunch location.  Bottomless mimosas an super tasty bloody marys.  Had the lobster hash.  Tons of fresh vegetables and lobster chunks, thick slices of crusty Italian bread toast and house made fruit spreads.  Decor and atmosphere is luxe.  They just popped the windows open for some al fresco fun.  Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t wait to try out brunch!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking forward to some yummers brunch!

eQBmCql_FreT6pDaus5CbQ.text: I can safely say this was my first time even remotely being excited to eat Italian food on the strip.  Currently the hottest restaurant in the city, Giada is bringing in the masses nightly.  I thought 90 days ahead of my 7th wedding anniversary would be adequate lead time for a 7pm-ish dinner on a Tuesday, but we ended up with 9pm.  Not a big deal.  That meant more drinks at the bar!  I had a few tasty "Flash Gordon" cocktails that made me feel semi-invincible; the sensation was unfortunately fleeting as I felt like Ming the Merciless had pointed his stupid ring to my head in the AM.    If you do one thing above anything else with your time at Giada, my advice would be to wait for a premium table.  The hostess initially walked us to a less than favorable area with only a partial strip view.  Despite her warning that it could take half an hour or more for a better spot, we stayed strong and went back to the bar.  Luckily, she came back in less than 15 minutes and brought us to an excellent table with grand views of Bellagio and Caesars Palace.    Like Rod U. said in his excellent review, antipasti are where it's at.  If I could do it all over again, I would order more small plates of seafood, salumi, cheese, crostini, salumi, cheese, seafood and cheese.  The burrata was magnificent.  It was a creamy, mozzarella dream that tasted more heavenly as I got to the center.  Accompanying this glorious gift from cows with anything else more than olive oil, garnish and balsamic salt would have been offensive.    I had some serious doubts about the waiter's recommendation of the "Prosciutto San Daniele" since we recently had Carnevino's "Prosciutto di Parma Riserva", but that all went away when the first slice melted in my mouth.  As unimaginable to me as it could be, it was better than Batali's.  The waiter had tried Mario's as well and agreed. Not that he was biased or anything.....  Another highlight was Giada's signature spaghetti with 2 large shrimp, lemon and basil.  She really loves her citrus as it's all over the menu.  It was wonderful!  The handmade pasta was superb and the light cream sauce at the bottom of the bowl was well worth sopping up with the shrimp.  I am a huge sucker for fresh pasta.  Although the "Veal Chop Saltimbocca" was an impressive looking entree in size, I felt it was underwhelming and quite plain.  This wasn't the kind of place that had salt and pepper shakers at the table, but I would have reached for some.  The massive leftover we brought home will definitely be getting some seasonal treatment.  The sauce it came with took it nowhere.  I wished we had given the branzino a shot instead.  At least the asparagus it came with was outstanding.  The wood grill brought out a whole new dimension of flavor to the standard upscale restaurant vegetable.    The dessert cart they rolled out made final decisions tough but the strawberry tart, blackberry lime tiramisu and white coffee gelato (I'd bath in it) were great conclusions to an overall solid meal.  With dinner clocking in at almost 3 hours, Giada isn't a dinner before a show kind of place, this is the show.

uJNETVkhHANLMb8--FRrmg.text: This wasn't our first time here at Giada but it was just as great and pleasant as s we remembered! The salmon was cooked to perfection! And we love the strip view tables which have become our favs! Thanks to Gary our waiter who was on point and very friendly! Coming to Las Vegas and not enjoying Giada's would be a bad bet! LOL!

Hn5tByOgA_jfeh2UPpsHxg.text: Lunch at Giada's is about $15-$25 a dish.  Decor and ambiance is super warm colors with large window that view the strip and everything labeled with her name. I thought their service team all had adorable uniforms.   I ordered a little of everything to try but my favorite was the Tubetti (Carbonara) for its nice clean flavors (practically licked off the plate), Giada's Red wine sangria (yummy and great presentation) and the pasta of the day, lasagna.  Things that were okay were the orso meatballs and muffuletta sandwich. Meatballs just didn't have a wow factor and for the sandwich maybe a different bread would be my suggestion.   The overall look and feel is perfection. Elena and Eddie were a great team. The food came out slow but then again we did go on the Saturday after Christmas so it was packed. I would love to try more things so yes I will return!!

2tLlOQgjwju_yrmiRFkuWQ.text: Just had brunch here! Everything was delicious. Our waiter was Billy and very attentive and very nice.  We had the carbonara pizza, Waldorf salad with raisin walnut croutons and a frittata.  We also had their pastry sampler, a must try!  Giada comes here once a month and we had the opportunity to meet her!  Very sweet person and personable! I definitely recommend this place!  Presentation and taste were definitely 5 stars!!

qLlU1EmMaIfsEkMhiw3gvQ.text: My wife wanted to come here for her birthday, so once we arrived in Las Vegas, we hit the restaurant before the dinner crowds came in.  Amazingly, our lunch wait was only about 15 minutes.  The location is wonderful, with views of the strip and high enough to people watch from above.  It is at the northeast corner across from Ceasars, with parking in the rear Flamingo Hotel parking.  As for the food, I believe we made a good choice coming for lunch, as the prices reflect the quality of the location.  However, we pulled all stops for her birthday, and enjoyed a selection of various lunch items and desserts.  The ambiance is that of her studio on television, with a clean beach look with wood flooring ceiling and white walls, and a deli counter up front.  The pasta was done just firm enough and pizza with just enough spice and cheese to make me want more.  Desserts were filling with an Italian flair and rich taste to go well with coffee.  Next time, we'll have dinner...

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch at Giadas in Las Vegas

2qO3Vs7lxWic1fr2-7CnaQ.text: I just came here for the third time. Had a wonderful time as per usual. I am always surprised because although the dishes appear full I never have room for dessert.  Some highlights include our server Vichenzo The burrata appetizer, shrimp pasta and of course the bread and multiple sauces. If you want a fun dinner before a night out on the town stop in here.

FcErP1GvofG6UXgxoT2_1Q.text: This was my favorite restaurant in Vegas but our dinner last night was probably my last.  When you overcook a $100 steak, don't tell the customer that he is wrong and it's probably medium rare closer to the bone.  It was overcooked and we should have been more forceful about sending it back.  The food was just average this visit.  View and ambiance is still great.

MKS2CMw9eu8ftqO-ExRPNQ.text: Super cute ambiance! Decor is great. Strip view. Friendly service. Brownie points for the photo booth!! You can make reservations on Open Table. Our favorite was Giada's Fresh Pastry Assortment for $10. Great way to start the meal!

N_C2AqHaFqUchqPlFnvP5w.text: Tonight we were served by Nancy, a phenomenal representative of the hospitality at Giada. Our group shared a variety of small plates and cocktails, each with delicious new flavors to pass down the table, admire and enjoy. Ever bite is an experience, would recommend!
