YY8DvGx_kfUReMAP0aPowA.text: Brunch. Caprese frittata, light fluffy, tons of flavor. Waldorf spinach panzanella salad, amazingly flavorful. Thank u for the congratulations and happy bday cookies! Staff vey attentive and vey nice.  Thank you for such a great experience, in an otherwise iffy trip. Happy holidays.  Can't wait to eat here again.

vLjYXdf7ak6gMM0FO3Cn5w.text: I ate here about 7 months after it first opened. There was a lot of hype and reservations were hard to come by. There were 4 of us in my group. We shared 3 or 4 appetizers, each of us got an entree, and we shared 2 different desserts. Everything was just ... meh. We were all very disappointed. Service was fine. The only thing that we thought was worthwhile were the cocktails. The cocktails were the star of our failed meal. Avoid the hype. Save some money and go elsewhere.

rk75Rb1Ph1_dKVMuTbn8Gg.text: Horrible service! Very slow... manager on duty for Mother's Day brunch service didn't care when we addressed our issues with service and food quality! Never again...save your money and go elsewhere!!!  Send her back to hospitality training!!!

MNKzLJXgeeXRh2kEFVSVCw.text: Well, that was a let down.  We had a table of 6 ladies, yes, the place is beautiful but the service was sub par.  The bread served was not easy to share.  For 6 girls, they gave us 2 miniature cast iron bowls (burning hot) that was difficult to remove the bread from and difficult to reach center of large round table.  Six women need more bread than that?! We ordered two bottles of wine that didn't come until our dinners were being served.  The wine was also not opened at our table?! They missed the mark on that. I ordered the spaghetti which our server told us was the most popular dish. Really? nothing to write about and it tasted like jar alfredo sauce, which I hate. We told our server we only had two hours because we had tickets for a show, we barely made it out of there and we didn't have time to order dessert which was a real disappointment. I would never eat here again.

dZL0cngyKN2vvc955HZIxA.text: Wow!!! What an incredible dining experience. We were here the other night, a group of nine. First, the restaurant is beautiful, very nice ambiance.  We were seated at a round table, which I LOVE for larger groups. So much easier to converse. So that was a great touch right off the bat. Secondly, the chairs!!! Upholstered, with curved backs, really soft and incredibly comfortable. I don't usually notice chairs in restaurants, but I DID notice here how comfortable they were. Great back support. So even after a 2 1/2 hour meal I wasn't stiff or uncomfortable.  Our waiter, Greg, was phenomenal. I want to give him a special shout-out. And the wait staff uniform - white suit coat with a white shirt and black tie - so classy looking. He was super informative, relaxed, friendly, not overly pushy. He's the only waiter that I've ever had who walked slowly around the table as he was describing the evening's specials so that it was easier for everone to hear. It was a small thing, but incredibly helpful. There are so many small touches in this restaurant that really make it special.  The menu was insane. SO many wonderful sounding dishes it was REALLY hard for all of us to choose. Another great touch by Greg - my friend ordered the salmon. He said that the chef prefers to cook it medium rare for the best flavor but that she should order it however she likes it. Another nice touch. A lot of fine dining restaurants make you feel guilty if you say you want your fish cooked through.  All of the salads, appetizers, entrees and desserts we ordered were fantastic. Wonderful flavors, perfectly cooked. The pacing of the dinner was perfect. Oh, the cocktails were amazing, too. And the sommelier was not stuffy, very helpful and, again, no judgment on not ordering a super expensive bottle.  All in all one of the top dining experiences I've ever had, and I've had many. Highly recommended!!!

aJ77kxd_-oAJawkQMihq6A.text: So I went here for my Birthday dinner. Please try the bacon wrapped dates (amazing), the summer caprese salad (  Even more amazing) and the meat cheese platter. The platter has honey comb it's so so delicious.   So down side. I had a reservation and had to wait a very long time. When they gave us a table it was one that had a large wall that blocked any view of the restaurant or windows.  I love Giada, but the restaurant looks like it may not be taken care of very well. The furniture is breaking and cracking. And the bus boys had their shirts hanging out of their pants. They ust didn't look professional. I bring this up because it's not expected and for the $$$$, they should have things more better kept.  Pizza is tasty and my husband said his halibut was the best he has ever had.

l7gY4vp6r0KvSfU0H4sitw.text: Ambiance and decor were welcoming with nice vistas.  Cocktails,  bread service and appetizers were perfect.  Pasta was served warm, not hot,  pizza was ok and vegan option was difficult to eat because of the eggplant skin and avocado.

OEu4w0XlsLcEG9KbYnfhTA.text: I easily made a reservation for Giada on OpenTable so that was convenient. It's easy to find as it's upstairs at the Cromwell Hotel.  You're greeted by friendly host and servers. The servers here are notably great and personable. Our server Nancy was great, very personable and she answered all of our questions thoroughly and made some recommendations for us.  We ordered the bacon wrapped dates and the mushroom arancini to start with. Both were great. I love how the bacon was thick and crispy contrasted with the sweet and chewy dates.   For our main dish we had the branzino, bucatini with orzo meatballs and the crab and scallop risotto. All of which were very good. I was disappointed at the size of the main dishes as it seems like they are more of a tasting portion. So it would be best if you ordered a variety of dishes and shared family style. It works since you get to taste more than a few things. This of course will increase the price since you are partly paying for Giada's name.   All in all, I thought the food was good but with a celebrity name behind the food I don't know how it separates itself from any other fine dining Italian restaurant without a celebrity chef's name attached to it. I mean everything in the restaurant including the napkins, pepper grinder, serving carts all have the signature "g" on them lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

95w0u6PP9PCsJfMRg1wKKQ.text: Delicious antipasto platter! Amazing view and delicious desserts also... Rachel is the sweetest server ever and had great recommendations... will definitely be coming back!

NCu8yUpFeLOXgWxz88FEWA.text: It was only ok. We watch her on tv and like what she cooks. I expected more from Giada especially for the price. The chicken cacciatore was a fried chicken leg with a side of cacciatore. I could Make that at home. Nothing really stuck out that was worth the money especially with all the other restaurants in Vegas. I would say if you have a choice go elsewhere. Pricey!

i-byVsDyCBhYi5f6ETpGzQ.text: Went here for a friends birthday and I was excited because I'd been dying to try the food. The view overlooks the Las Vegas strip of you get close enough seats to the window. The best part about this restaurant was how amazing the service was. It was a large table so we ordered so many different items on the menu. From the veal to the parmesan filet to the lobster ravioli they all were pretty tasty. Oysters were fresh and came with a variety of toppings. The food overall was good but it's not on my top 5 places to dine at in Vegas but if looking for Italian food this is definitely a place to check out. Atmosphere was very relaxing with soft pop music playing in the background. Oh and the prices are not bad at all. For all the food we ordered with some drinks we guessed around $1000 but was about $500

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3ht9d0wtNa1dNR0Uhkwnpg.text: Self seated in the bar. The waitress was adorable. Served us cocktails right away. Had the burrata, the braesola  salami, and the eggplant parm appetizer. It was all amazing. However the highlight was the warm rosemary roll and Parmesan lavash served with salt, fried capers, crushed red pepper, a pesto, and a lemon butter.  The bread platter was amazing.   We were only pregaming for dinner but it was super satisfying and the ambience was amazing. Highly recommend!!!

HaodZfN30P3aSE2wwOTejA.text: A very disappointing meal.  Started with the bresaola which had a slight moldy taste.  Then had the veal chop saltimbocca that was heavily breaded and super greasy.  It was like chicken fried steak and I've had better chicken fried steak for under $10, the veal was $57.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is ALL greasy breading left from my veal saltimbocca.

EgscFGSUNUpgwqRSgJoCBg.text: Stopped by for an amazing brunch while vacationing in Vegas!  The hostess was very friendly. There were only a few people there on a Monday morning. We were seated right by the window with a great view of the Strip. It was lovely.  We had a pastry basket to start, with delicious butters and spreads. Especially recommend the monkey bread! I had the strawberry polenta waffles, which were a bit too crispy and not soft enough, but they were still super tasty. My daughter loved her Margherita pizza, which is definitely one of the less expensive items. My wife had the salmon avocado toast and arugula salad. The toast was absolutely loaded with delicious smoked salmon, which we all shared. We ordered juices and coffees too, which are overpriced at $9 each.  Food is quite pricey here, but we got a Groupon ($80 for $130 worth of food) so we didn't mind. We even had enough left over to get two boxes of cookies. They have chocolate chip, lemon ricotta, and double chocolate. All great, especially chocolate chip.  We stopped by the photo booth on the way out. Very fun!

RrwvdoX8ZAzXhHBHJ8mPog.text: We sat at the bar. Love this restaurant the bartenders Giovanni and Ricardo are so good, very friendly and attentive. Giovanni made some great suggestions and OMG the Berry Dessert. Is amazing  we are thinking of going back just for that. Haven't had the fresh pasta yet can't wait to try next time. The chicken Marsala meatballs were tender and tasty.

aRH-UGXTfEV1eXYz-ZGukQ.text: We celebrated my birthday with an amazing dinner at Giada.  I had requested a window table when I made the reservation, and was happy that one was available.  I had a nice view of Las Vegas Boulevard, with glimpses of the Bellagio water shows.  Rocco, our waiter, graciously explained the menu options, including the tasting menu, as well as the electronic drinks menu. Since I checked in on Yelp, I received a "splash" of Prosecco.  This now joins Asti Spumante as my sparkling wine of choice, since I don't care for the dryness of champagne. Hubby ordered an Amaretto Mule, and it came in the signature copper mug with a lime wedge.  Rosemary bread round and slices of olive bread were accompanied by small dishes of butter, pesto, sea salt, capers and red pepper flakes.  We went with the Tasting Menu and each dish was an adventure! Antipasti included caponata, sweet peppers stuffed with goat cheese, and bacon-wrapped dates with Gorgonzola crema. Hubby chose the Lemon Crema Spaghetti with shrimp, and I had the Rigatoni with vegetable Bolognese. Hubby's 3rd course was the Petit filet and mine was the Salmon. Our sides were the Crispy Brussel sprouts and the Lemon smashed potatoes, respectively. Lastly, the Dessert cart was wheeled  to our table, and we each got to pick 3 items! I selected the dark chocolate brownie with almonds (Amaretto?), the chocolate tart, and the tiramisu parfait. They were served on a plate with "Happy Birthday" inscribed. Hubby's choices were the peanut butter cookie, Napoleon, and the tiramisu parfait. My coffee was served in a huge cup.  Our delicious dinner was made even more pleasant by the nice staff: when I asked to take a photo of the entry, the 2 hostesses ducked down to give me an unobstructed picture of the Giada sign. This was a truly memorable birthday dinner!

1u-1VYB5sBjH6J-jsphziA.text: Oh my gosh GET THE LEMON SPAGHETTI. Get it. SO freaking delicious. That needed to be said first. Don't mess around. Also the focaccia bread that you start with is incredibly delicious and they give you options of things to dip the bread in like olive oil, capers, salt, etc that are equally as amazing. It's just so much better than a bowl of bread and butter and so much more creative. I was so impressed. Other appetizers we got included the citrus marinated olives, bacon wrapped dates, and peppers stuffed with cheese and honestly I can't pick a favorite out of those either. All equally as delicious as the next.   The ambiance is amazing, the decor is so creative and an awesome tribute to the De Laurentiis family with old movie posters etc. It was just such a unique authentic touch. The place is so warm and welcoming with an awesome view of the strip.   And if you can't decide on dessert, the cookies are ALWAYS a good option. It includes the famous  lemon ricotta cookies (which were perfection), a warm chewy chocolate cookie, and two peanut butter cookies with a little jelly on top! Honestly I am so ready to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The famous lemon spaghetti. 100% order this. Just do it
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus marinated olives, bacon wrapped dates, cheese stuffed peppers , ALL SO AMAZING

dwVLfdJoMojOdejGVm_ASQ.text: I'm a huge Giada fan so I had to come to her restaurant! We went on a Saturday night had reservations and had to still wait about 20 minutes. There's a photo booth in the waiting lobby which helps pass the time. When we got in the restaurant we had GREAT seats right by the window so we got to see the Bellagio water show go off every couple minutes. It was beautiful!   We shared family style and had the spaghetti (lemon and shrimp), meatball appetizer, Cesar salad, risotto (scallop), ravioli (lobster) and for dessert the fruit tart, lemoncello souffle and tiramisu cheesecake.  I LOVED the risotto. That was everyone's favorite! The spaghetti was delicious too! Perfectly al dente pasta and 2 HUGE shrimp. The meatball was so soft and melted in my mouth! Everything so good but those 3 dishes were the highlights. The lemoncello souffle was a yummy foamy cloud. It was very soft and foamy textures not very cake-y. The tiramisu cheesecake was good and the tart was pretty good too but i think the cheesecake was the table favorite. I would come back here. It was a nice dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert! Limoncello soufflé, fruit tart and tiramisu cheesecake!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That scallop risotto was my favorite!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad, ravioli, spaghetti (2 orders) and orzo meatball!

aV4U1uGq_jyXibti4MR8Qw.text: Came here to celebrate a belated birthday.  The restaurant has an open feel and a very clean look.  Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and very attentive.  We both opted for the tasting menu.  I selected the salmon cakes and my partner selected the burger.  The food was flavorful, but not worth the price that we paid.  I would love to give this joint a 5-star rating, but due to the price point, I can't.  Unfortunately, this is just another "celebrity" Las Vegas strip overpriced eatery.

MpiDvxUu0cdRPJzjYDB9cw.text: I decided to choose Giada's restaurant at the Cromwell to celebrate my 33rd Birthday. Our reservation was for 6:15pm, and upon arrival everything was ready to go. We were quickly seated and our server (I can't remember her name :/ ) went over all the different food and drink options.   To start I ordered the Orzo Meatballs and Chicken Marsala Meatballs. The Orzo were absolutely delicious. So much flavor! I really loved the taste of the marinara sauce. My only suggestion (coming from a very big Italian family) would be to try and bind the meatballs together a little better. When I poked my fork in they did fall apart, but not really a problem because it was so good. The Marsala Meatballs were decent. My partner and everyone else really enjoyed them, but I guess it's just not my thing.   The next thing I enjoyed was the lemon chicken soup. They bring all the goodies on your plate to the table, and pour the broth in right in front of you. A nice little touch :)  For dinner I decided to try the Pasta flight. My 3 pastas were the rigatoni in a vegetarian sauce, the lemon spaghetti, and the pappardelle. Hands down the pappardelle was the best of the 3. Paired with the braised beef OMG absolutely delicious.   I am giving 5 stars because all 8 of us enjoyed everything brought to the table. The service was excellent. Water glasses were always kept above half the glass which was great because the food has A LOT of flavor.   If you get a chance definitely check this place out. Bring your money though. It ain't cheap!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TxQDWUXnZQ29g1LLxCu44Q.text: Location: excellent Views: excellent Ambiance: excellent Service: not on par with the price Food: terrible!  And I mean it.  I ordered the 28 ounce bone-in ribeye which was listed as one of "Giada's classics" so I assumed that it would be nothing but wonderful.  I was wrong.  I don't know how to describe it but the meat actually tasted bad.  I have never had a bad ribeye in my life.  I didn't think this was something you could mess up.  Again, I was wrong.  The presentation however was superb as you can see from the pics I've posted.    If you like to spend money for the F of it then go to Giada's.  If you like to get your money's worth, don't go to Giada's.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bhfJCx-3b4yIMKbyH94qQg.text: We purchased a brunch Groupon and really enjoyed the meal and service.   We set a reservation and arrived 5 minutes early. When they sat us I noted on my watch it was precisely at the time of my reservation.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The food exceeded my expectations. The creativity and quality of the food was amazing. The portions were more than I could consume in one sitting.  Thanks Giada for bringing/sharing the food and atmosphere of an Italian brunch to Las Vegas for me to experience and enjoy.

B4l1k65IJ6jvuv1tkJWXxA.text: Beautiful decor. Very impressed with the rose gold and white theme. The food was tasty and the service was on point. However, they fired our entrees too early and brought them out while we were still eating our appetizers. When the kitchen server brought the food, he realized the error, and took the food back to the "pass". But it was obvious that instead of refiring new dishes, they just stuck the food under heat lamps as my Berkshire Pork Tomahawk was a nice medium rare on the bottom and well done on the top. Also, the risotto had started to break. The prices are reasonable and it is a pretty nice restaurant. The service made up for the food issues. We will go back again...

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W8ggJu543YqEeWfXf8niJg.text: Not worth the hype.  Food was good but not amazing.  We ordered 5 appetizers to sample - Brussels sprouts were the hit of the night.  I ordered the salmon and it was also good but nothing spectacular.  Service was decent.  As you can tell, didn't meet expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LBmAD0QeFXgmDhExG4JTFQ.text: My underwhelming Vegas food curse is finally over! Las Vegas is known as one of the food meccas in the U.S, but every time I visit Vegas, I usually leave broke and disappointed. My most recent trip started out the same, with a terrible and expensive dinner the night before, but at breakfast / lunch, Giada rescued me from food purgatory.   My friend and I both chose the lemon pesto grilled cheese, mine with the arugula salad on the side, and hers with the zucchini scapecce. The bread was perfectly crisp, the fillings plentiful, and the flavors were bold without being overwhelming. I enjoyed my arugula salad even though I'm not always a fan of arugula (it can be a little bitter without the proper dressing). My friend raved about the scapecce, which is like shoe-string fried zucchini. We both got The Palm juice drink, and that was refreshing and unique.   The ambiance was wonderful, with large picture windows that open over the main drag. The service was impeccable and pleasant. I'm not sure if this is the norm, but even the music was great - 80s and 90s, as opposed to stuffy, boring, and "fancy" music. I left feeling refreshed with a smile on my face.

zvyEZ3Kb1y7MFALCl7qQ2Q.text: Beautiful place.  Great service.  But the food was quite disappointing.  I've always been impressed by the celebrity's TV cooking, but this food was very ordinary and very expensive.  Veal chop and calamari were breaded and fried and tasted like you could get in most any diner.  The roasted asparagus was overly roasted-tasting with a funny after taste.  The whole chicken was presented then taken back to the kitchen to be cut up and the tomato/vegetable accompaniment put into a serving bowl.  That was probably the best tasting dish.  Lobster ravioli was good as was the Salumi appetizer - but for the price, none of this food met expectations.  Like another reviewer, the sparkling or still water options leave me feeling upsold.

2VqQROZ7h6vcRhLukXp8UA.text: Service was awful, our food took an hour (for 4!people), and the food was COLD when it arrived. We complained to the manager, and he only offered to reduce the bill by 20%. Wouldn't go again.

737WpE2r6NJ3h_5-eOoyIg.text: I had high hopes for this place as the complete package but the service was so terrible.This is not the place to come if your in a hurry. This was my last meal in Vegas before heading to the airport. I did not have a reservation so sat on one of the lounge couches. I waited for like 15 minutes and no one came to check on me, offer me a drink , or anything. I had to fetch myself a waiter, ask for water, bread, and a menu. The food here is really good though. I had the Orzo meatballs, Lemon Shrimp Spaghetti, and Choc Budino . The meatballs were just ok but a bit dry in my opinion.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and seasoned and the shrimp are two of the biggest prawns I had been served at an Italian Place. Very complex flavors although next time I would ask for a little more sauce on the side.  The choc budino had to be one of my favorite desserts in Vegas. It was so light and delicious with a small amount of the perfect finness and flavor profile. I love it and would come back here just for dessert despite the terrible service.  The atmosphere here is nice though and they make all the pasta by hand fresh. The vegetables are fresh.  They also have a photo booth to take pictures to commemorate your dining experience which is kind of unique.  Overall ,great food but terrible service.

B0jR0FyVOgUIp3FDeYAORA.text: After my long awaited reservation (I made 2 months ago!) I finally had the pleasure of dining at Giada's. From the staff to the decor to the food, everything was phenominal!  The restaurant itself was very warm and so well put together. There is a photo booth in the lobby. You can take photos and have them facebooked, emailed or printed right there for you.  Such a fun and cute idea!! The attention detail once you enter the dining room is obvious with beautiful booths, gorgeous tables and decor. We sat at a table next to the window, which is for sure the best seat on the joint! Our waiter was so extremely helpful and knowledgeable which is always such a nice touch!  Now onto the thing we all really want to know about: the food. It was sooooooo delish I want to go back now! We started with drinks. My husband ordered the barbarella, which was so wonderful you could forget it was alcohol! I ordered the savignon blanc which was so crisp and light.     -oysters rockefeller: amazing! They were fried I believe in a batter perhaps. It was so light though and melted in my mouth. -strawberry jam and feta crostini: the crostini was just the right crunchy and the toppings were amazing together. (Add the basil pesto to the top, you won't regret it!) -spaghetti with prawns: wonderful!!! The sauce is so amazing! Its light and lemony and the pasta is clearly freshly made and cooked to the perfect al dente. The prawns were enormous and cooked to perfection!  -lobster ravioli: stuffed full of lobster with a lemon sauce and chinks of lobster on the plate. It was delish! -side of peas: amazing! Peas with mint! One of my favorite things and it was so good!  Our dinner was one of the best I've had in a long time!! The servings are not what we in America consider normal (sadly) because everyone seems to want so much food on their plates. However, I think they were perfect and exactly the size a healthy serving should be. I actually ended up taking home some of my dinner.  DESSERT: NOM NOM NOM NOM There is this adorable dessert cart that comes to your table and you choose your dessert. We chose the lemon cookie, the chocolate peanut butter cookie, the white coffee gelato, and a chocolate tart with almond brittle. Everything was phenom but the chocolate tart with almond brittle was seriously orgasmic!!!!! I want to kiss Giada for creating it!! MUST TRY!! Our next favorite was her lemon cookie. Light and almost  creamy texture.  Ok so....bottom line: amazing experience and I cannot wait to go back!!!

jmuLV2PdCbzO_9rPN6bJIw.text: WOW WOW WOW. Giada has succeeded in opening a fantastic dining experience. Came here with six girls and everyone was impressed. They have this adorable photo booth to take beauty shots as you wait for your table. The restaurant itself is gorgeous (like Giada herself). The drinks are outrageously awesome. I had the Hannibal- wow what a concept. It was amazing. You just have to try it to see what I mean. The food is spectacular as well. The assortment of bread you get is beyond amazing. Warm focaccia served in it's own pot. We had the Marsala meatballs that were to die for, margarita pizza (good but not amazing), the famous lemon pasta with shrimp (wow, look at the size of those shrimp), the tortellini (good but not I would get something else next time) and the vegetable bolognese. Usually I'm against vegetable bolognese but this sauce was deep with flavor. Then we had dessert and coffee. Coffee was one of the best cups I've ever had and I had the blueberry like tiramisu- very nice adaptation to the classic. Shout out to KEVIN for being an AMAZING waiter! Will be returning when I'm back in Vegas!

jrIzgj__0QiEcMK5ayEmCA.text: Giada is a JOKE! I will NEVER, EVER go back. Overpriced, overrated, pretentious nonsense. Inflated prices, ridiculously small portions of sub-par food and bad service. Waiter forgot our drinks and waited until he brought the check to whisper a half-assed apology into my ear as he was setting the bill down. Save your money, your dignity, and your sanity by dining elsewhere. Anywhere else.

oyToXocuMSEX1dLTmTVwWg.text: The ambiance of the restaurant is wonderful but sad to say that the food was far from what we had expected.  The food was good but that's pretty much it, just "good."  The prices are extremely high for what you get.  Definitely nothing memorable about this place other than the view.

mIUixX6hTCgqfNqVwvED0A.text: Honestly not sure how this place is holding up with 4 star reviews on yelp because our dining experience was totally disappointing. The place is real nicely designed so props for not screwing up one of the best views on the strip.  We had a party of 7 for my engagement celebration, checked in and got the grand tour before we were seated.  Decided it would be best to order a little bit of everything, from the chicken meatballs to prosciutto and something else that wasn't worth remembering. Chicken meatballs were pretty dry and flavorless. However the mushrooms they were stacked were pretty tasty.  The items on the drink menu were pretty good. For the main course I had the rack of lamb and my fiance went with the filet. Rack of lamb was dryer than the chicken meatballs were which tells me that they had no clue how to cook or prepare lamb. Now the sad part was that my girls filet was super dry, over cooked and basically not a good cut. Our friends went with with porterhouse which was decent, some others got the lemon spaghetti and another pasta dish.  Ended the dinner  with the strawberry shortcake type dessert that was bleh, cookies were pretty good with the espresso.  Now despite the crappy food the place is real nice and I don't really mind that it sucked because we can't judge til we try it right? Being Vegas I would probably not go back because honestly Italian food is pretty bland in my opinion and there's always new places to try in Vegas.  The only real bad part of the experience was that they ended up charging me and extra $260. After I called the next day and spoke to the general manager he informed me that they were having problems and that his financial dept will take care of it. Said I will have a call back the next day and that if I don't hear back to give them a call. I've followed up and still can't get this issue cleared up which is a little annoying.  Hopefully this review will motivate them to take a closer look at their dishes and also fix the error on my check! :)

67Xe7hq2ZbRN0ACnrNstEA.text: The food was excellent. But the service raised the experience even higher. Our server Greg simply gave us the best service we had in Las Vegas. Friendly, courteous, knowledgable and smart. He answered every question we had with thought. No canned answers. He had command of the menu but also answered every question we had about Vegas as well. The Manager Kyle was equally gracious. A great restaurant elevated by fantastic service. I recommend the arugula salad, mushrooms, lemon spaghetti and lamb.

68RhyGDShUChkdKDTT9x0A.text: Great disappointment. Appetizers and desserts were ok but pasta entrees were terribly dry and tasteless.  Salads were barely edible because of overuse of lemon.  Service was good, but everything is overpriced.

zdW4MX_iXApfPDnWlqYhjQ.text: I was extremely disappointed with Giada. I was so excited for them to open, I checked their website almost obsessively. When I found out that reservations were available on OpenTable, I made a reservation right away for the first time slot available (11 am on June 4th, made the res in early May). I spent the next couple weeks obsessively looking for the menu and reading all of the news articles about this restaurant. In one article, I noticed it said that they would not be open for lunch for the first month... this was a red flag for me, so I called the number provided to confirm that we would be able to go at the specified time. I was assured over the phone that it was fine. Great. So we get to Vegas and I get a confirmation e mail from OpenTable for my res... I am so excited, but still a little wary, so I went to the Cromwell's front desk to ask about our reservation... they don't know anything and give me the number of the restaurant (which isn't the number on their website). I call... no answer. I call several more times and finally get an answer. I just wanted to triple check that my res is still good.... oh no, not open for lunch. 'You made your reservation when we THOUGHT we would be open for lunch, but then we decided we weren't going to be.' WHAT?!?! I had invested so much time and energy into going to this restaurant.... I drove to Vegas for this. I could not believe it. Not only that, but the manager, Nicole I think, was less than helpful. First, they offered us a 5 o clock res for that night, which I snatched with renewed excitement... only to get a call back a couple minutes later saying that actually they couldn't give us that res since they had a private party until 730. WHAT. Let down all over again. Who has a private event on their opening night? I thought this was the night for the public. At this point, the manager said she couldn't do anything for us, that we could 'try to come sit at the bar.' Are you kidding me? This was unbelievably ridiculous. She couldn't even just save us a place at the bar considering they were the ones who messed up? How hard do I need to work to give this place my business? I think the worst part was if I hadn't been researching, I would have shown up for our res and no one would have been there... how crushing is that? How many people did this happen to? I hope this place works on its customer service because right now it is garbage. That, and don't give out reservations you can't keep and never bother to call those people or contact those people to tell them that their reservation had been cancelled. After this experience, I don't know that I will visit Giada in the future and I would be hesitant to recommend it to anyone else. I know it's a new restaurant and all, but get your act together.

F4yyXRY5UDne-PupoduMjQ.text: Giada is the restaurant of famed chef Giada de Laurentiis. It's at The Cromwell, and there's a great view from the restaurant out to the Las Vegas strip. We arrived a bit early for our reservation, so I started out at the bar with wine. Great service at the bar and the Riesling was one of the best I've had. Once seated, our server was excellent at explaining the menu and answering questions. You get a platter of 3 types of bread. One is a parmesan flatbread, then there was grissini and focaccia, which is accompanied with basil pesto, capers, red pepper, and sea salt. The focaccia was great, but I wasn't a big fan of the parmesan flatbread. For a starter course, I had the bacon wrapped dates. These were great, and they came in a chili oil which gave them a nice kick and differentiated from the same dish at other places. For a main dish, I had pappardelle which had a pork ragout. The pasta was cooked perfectly, and then ragout was great as well. One execution error here: it took a long time to get a second glass of wine after finishing the first, but aside from this service was pretty good.

SCAxKF_WCBfiyuRDmPfHww.text: I don't know what their idea of family style portions are but to me, portions are fairly large to share with at least 2 people. I'm serious when I say this we ordered a family style of meatballs at Giada's new restaurant in Las Vegas and all we got was this dinky sized portion. It was not family sized portion! I have to say their pizzas were good but once again small in size. Their bread is freshly made which makes a huge difference. Would I eat here again? Probably not. At least we didn't have to wait that long when it was lunch time on a Sunday. We waited about 20 mins which was not that bad considering it was Sunday rush hour.

edfieFXVl99Q1Rqij641SA.text: Amazing! Great ambiance, service and food. Loved the cocktails, salads, and pasta courses. Chocolate tarte and banana sorbet for dessert were fantastic. Had a table by the windows at night and had a great view of the strip. Will definitely be back!

3LpSc_cRO8kJSoSg8tVH7A.text: Visiting Giada's was a mix for me. I really loved the look, feel and ambiance of this restaurant and loved the food and would go back for that reason. :) The food was divine!! Our waiter was efficient with bringing food out, but didn't connect with us--he didn't smile and seemed to be distracted by something. I opted to get the breakfast fritatta and had a cup of coffee with it. The coffee was largely sized and our waiter was really good with refilling it. I was disappointed, not in the taste of the food, but in that it came with no sides. Others in my family that ate had their plates filled with sides, but mine didn't come with anything and was told that the garnishes (pea shoots and some tomato) were the sides. I ended up ordering a separate side of toast to go with it. The decor in the restaurant is nice and I love Giada's branding on the plates, menus and napkins. What was lacking was sides with my meal and with a friendlier wait staff.

_3ESn9TpLcnHpj6LSwco0A.text: Visited yesterday evening for Christmas dinner. My husband and I were somewhat skeptical based on mix reviews and previous experience at "nicer" restaurants. I will admit, I fangirled a bit at the fact that I was eating at Giada's restaurant so I see this experience through rose colored lenses. With that said, it started with the seating being a bit behind so we took a seat at the bar to wait for our table even with a reservation. Once escorted to our seat, it was a pleasant surprise to be seated at the window adjacent to the strip/Bellagio fountains! Unfortunately, we were also placed near the waiters booth and a terrible draft from the window. If you don't mind getting bumped by wait and staff as they ring up orders, then carry on.  Next, the food was good. It was as expected.. small portions, big prices for someone who generally dine at restaurants such as Cheesecake Factory and PF Changs. My husband and I love tasting a variety so we shared the meatballs, a salad, the spaghetti, and potatoes. The spaghetti is actually a lemon based Parmesan sauce atop shrimp, which I'm allergic to so we subbed for chicken. My husband took one bite and refrained for the remainder of the meal. I enjoyed it even though the lemon was so strong. It was pretty heavy so we didn't finish it.  Overall, it was decent but no hype.  Lastly, if you are okay with smelling like you walked away from a bonfire, this is the place to be! It was worse than the cigarette/cigar odor from casinos.   Go for yourself! It's okay but look at it like a gamble... you might win. Or it might suck. The chance is yours to take.

o306DBQ1nZyioINJntW3_A.text: Last night I had the good fortune of dining at Giada's restaurant having made a reservation a month in advance through Open Table. During the reservation process, I requested since I was traveling for business and would be dining alone that I be seated with a view of the Bellagio fountain. Arriving early, I perused the waiting area and had fun at her signature selfie booth. Let me begin by saying  that the guest experience was over the top with kudos to Floor Manager Avi and the sever team of Nick and Brandon. Let's start with Avi - being in quality assurance in the food service industry, I observed how he walked the floor prior to the 5:30 seating thanking guests at the bar for choosing the restaurant for their dining and was very sincere with the dialogue that he had with each guest that he came in contact with. We spoke briefly at the bar where I ordered The G cocktail. The biggest surprise was after I was seated for dinner, Avi personally came over and recanted my request on Open Table for a view of the fountain. Well done Avi.   Nick, my server and his sidekick Brandon also displayed warmth and made me feel comfortable. Nick skillfully listened to what my taste buds were feeling and after much discussion, I ordered the Orzo meatballs which was composed of veal which I love, the candied lemon arugula salad and the signature lemon spaghetti all of which were spot on!  Food safety was also apparent as I observed a server reload individual cookies on a partial plate on the dessert cart which was being presented to me. The cookies were transferred by sliding them from plate to plate but in doing so this caused them to be arranged not as nicely rather than using tongs which she did not have. My point being - she could have easily used her bare hands to rearrange the cookies but she chose not to in order to avoid accidental cross contamination! Great job!  In closing, I failed to get the name of the female bar tender who waited on me but she was very professional and she gave no inkling of being upset that I decided to transfer my tab to my dinner bill.  Thank you Team Giada's for an outstanding dinng experience!

7GhwdZBbL1JIj0ryQZTnEg.text: After months of trying to get a reservation, we spent our anniversary having dinner. The atmosphere, the views and the waiter was beyond fabulous. Food on the other hand was not worth what we paid.  I ordered the salmon for me and glass of wine. After examined the menu, my husband discovered that the spaghetti dish he wanted to order, the sauce was made with Mushrooms.  He is extremely allergic to mushrooms, fish and will not eat red meat, so he ordered as his meal 4 side dishes and a glass of wine.  ALL OF THE SIDES WERE GREASY! Honestly, the best part of the whole meal was the Cauliflower soup and the 3 breads the waiter brought at the beginning of the meal.  At the end of the meal, I gave them a good rating and paid for the meal $150.80, but wished I hadn't by the time we both got home. We were both queasy and nauseous from the greasy sides. A suggestion: You should also offer an alternative that is just a plain spaghetti sauce with nothing added for your Rigatoni and other pasta dishes.

F0NIQA8qdsGe25E5hj-hjQ.text: I was very excited to try this place out.   I've been a huge Giada fan for years.  I own several of her cookbooks even!   I went to the desk when they opened and was told that the dining room was fully booked for the evening and that I could be seated at the bar.  I was alone so I figured that was perfect.   Only problem was that (what I'm assuming was) the head hostess stepped in and told me I couldn't enter because I was wearing opened toed shoes (designer sandals plus I had a fresh pedicure).   If I wanted to be seated I had to go back to my hotel and change shoes.   I did it, and came back (dragon lady was gone) and luckily there was a seat at the bar still available.     Food and service was amazing.   I had some wine and a couple of the starters as they're not yet serving from the menu at the bar.   I won't get into the food as it is discussed here but I was not disappointed.  Giada was there also checking on the tables.  What really made me stop was watching people get seated wearing flip flops, board shorts and tee shirts.  Yet I had to go back to the hotel to change shoes.   I guess Giada only wants the beautiful California crowd.  So, if you're in the 50ish bracket you better dress up or she won't let you in.   I was very disappointed in their screening of who they're trying to stop from getting in.

sI43oMPcpOpUFReG1n0YQQ.text: Sweet mother of God    I've died and gone to culinary heaven. I'm speechless. Every Damn thing is incredibly wonderful.  Simply a flawless menu. I literally embarrassed my wife and coworkers and tired to eat and drink everything they offered.  Superb location. Great views of the strip.  Expensive. Yeppir. But who gives a F..... It is worth every penny.  Don't skimp and try to eat some cheap meal. Be a man.  Eat like a king and your stomach will thank you. Please trust me on this one. Put this place on your bucket list Now!!!

ZgYrDp1y1S7maL5TQgjJ-Q.text: I've been here a few times and every meal is great with excellent service.    Most recently I had the fettuccine and it was fantastic.  There was a surprising amount of lobster in the dish and the cream sauce was delicious. The waiters usually say that their portions are on the smaller side, but after an entree and dessert I leave quite satisfied, and not too full.      For dessert I've tried the souffle, cookies and the black forrest cheesecake and they are all great but I'd recommend the cheesecake of the three

8JriGZySsTEzD1aAoDTTtw.text: There was one thing I wanted from her menu and that's why we came here. Cacio e Pepe Bucatini served in a CHEESE WHEEL! but lucky for us, after we were seated and ordered it, it was SOLD OUT... The one dish I was looking forward to. I was sad... and with that sadness I ordered the following:   1) Orzo Meatballs $15 - Incredible does no justice to how amazing these were. Soft, juicy, delightful and delicate. Yes, meatballs can be delicate. The pomodoro sauce was out of this world. We took a shot and we hit the bulls eye with these meatballs. A MUST. (pst, way better than Hells Kitchen)   2) Capeletti $34 - butternut squash, 3 cheese, hazelnut gremolata. NO. When the waiter asked me how everything was, I just couldn't smile and let it go, this dish was very disappointing. Tasteless, unexciting, slightly sweet and just boring. Because of this, I asked if he could order us a Risotto $34. He said if it's because it wasn't enough food, I said it was because it was terrible.   3) Risotto (Crab & Scallops) $34 - Excellent! this makes up for the pasta incident(s). This was probably one of the best risottos i've had in a while. Full of flavor, so much crab in the risotto and the most perfectly cooked scallops anyone can achieve. Sweet, fresh, meaty and simply fantastic.   4) Italian Fried Chicken (cacciatore style) For one $30 - Yes, you heard that right. two pieces of fried chicken for 30. I was curious. And I found out why. The SAUCE! Wow. Slow simmering vegetable sauce with pancetta. I almost ended up eating it alone, with the chicken on the side. So much flavor in such little container. A MUST TRY.   5) Side of Lemon Potatoes (Smashed and fried) $11 - There were so good. The lemony crispy potateos with the melting fresh parmesan on top. A bit salty but so hard to stop eating.   6) Panna Cotta $13 - Okay. I usually do not like panna cottas because they tend to be boring and no texture. This panna cotta was not only gorgeous but it had so many different flavor dimensions and yes! textures. See the picture. I was surprised and yes, I would get this again and again. It was deceptively light you could have the whole dessert and not even know it went straight to your hips. Twas' that good!  I was initially disappointed at the sold out cacio e peppe and the 'other' pasta dish (Cappeletti). This entire dinner consisted of no pastas. And that was okay because everything else blew my mind and I would claim Giada as one of the restaurants that one should go and indulge in Vegas.  Service: great. They took out the Capeletti from the bill. I didn't ask for that but I am happy they did. Also the waiter was very nice and helpful. He deserves a shout out and I hope those who are great at their jobs get rewarded accordingly. His name was Radoslav V.   We also got greeted by the manager who took out the capeletti. They really care about our dinner experience and I think the personal touch made it better.  *They have a photo booth at the waiting area, send these to yourself via email* reservations are a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto $34 - this is life changing delicious. Truly art on a plate. With crab and scallops
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Where are we again?
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Potatoes $11 - actually good. Little salty but hard to stop eating

8f1U5vM5gZcSXNYxAMbC7w.text: My fiance and I came to the restaurant last minute (45 minutes before closing) which we felt terrible about, however, our server and our server assistant were understanding and INCREDIBLE! Our main server, Lauren, knew literally EVERYTHING about everything! She was SO lovely and explained ingredients about dishes, wine notes, literally everything. She left a special place in our hearts! Attentive, incredibly knowledgeable, personable and went above and beyond for us! Our server assistant was Nathan who also went above and beyond to make our experience the best it could possibly be! At the end of the day, Giada's Vegas is a thumbs up! Thank you for this amazing dinner!

E91XlFJife1xElG-jjWxFQ.text: If you're in Vegas you have literally hundred of choices for where to dine- make one of them here! This will be a long review of a long, expensive, tasty meal, so buckle up.   We were in town for my friend's 24th birthday and made a reservation for 5 and they kindly obliged our request for a table with a good view. Located at the Cromwell hotel, the restaurant sits on a corner of the strip and is designed around that view. Our booth was positioned parallel to the street so that everyone could enjoy!  Girls at the hostess booth weren't very nice and gave us sideways looks when we walked in but our waiter was very kind and knowledgeable about the menu. We all got a complimentary glass of bubbly (thanks to the Yelp check-in deal ) and then ordered another bottle. Our glasses were topped off for us, which was great but also kind of upped the pressure for everyone to drink so we could all get more than just one glass!  Our good was OUTSTANDING. I had high expectations for a Giada restaurant and it did not disappoint! We ordered bread, oysters, two Caesar salads, meat and cheese board, then three of our girls got the lemon shrimp pasta, and my friend and I shared the Cacio e Pepe Bucatini, which was served in a small wheel of pecorino.   Bread was breathtaking and came with several accompany options: flaked sea salt, pepper flakes, capers, butter, and oil/vinegar, each in their own small dish. The oysters had a strange vinegar-y and chopped pickled-something(?). Not my favorite but I prefer mine only with a squeeze of lemon.  Salads had mild dressing, which is what I prefer, and I appreciate that the lettuce was in manageable pieces. Meats and cheeses were available at a per selection price so we were able to customize our board completely. Servings of each selection could definitely stand to be bigger- we paid $10-16 each and were disappointed with the portions.   Mains held to the standard set by the location, decor, and price of the restaurant. Portion sizes were appropriate for how filling the pastas were and they had great combinations of texture, flavor, and color.    The restaurant also offers an extensive wine list as well as Brunch, Dinner, Dessert, and Seasonal tasting menus; participation is required by the table. Next time I am in Vegas I will make this a must!

HdzdEb7LwjvCiRIwpykDxA.text: Visited Giada's again while I was in Vegas.  It's located in the Cromwell.  I still recommend getting reservations.    Service was its usual top notch.  Food was delicious again!  They had the spare ribs back on the menu, I also ordered spaghetti and added the meat balls.  Was too full to even consider dessert.    The price seems high for the portions of food you get.  I don't drink alcohol and the bill was over $120!  Come prepared.

buUoDnbCmo2QDqc24HRAVQ.text: I'll let others provide opinions about the food, but Giada's desserts are delicious. For example, check out this fun (and delicious) chocolate mini-cake: tripadvisor.com/Location... Giada is capable of more impressive creations. Check out this wedding-style creation from her Pinterest page: pinterest.com/pin/235242... Anyway, I can't justify getting a larger full cake while I'm there, you know they're robust (and again, delicious) when they can support a cake topper this beautiful: amzn.to/2lyHMdw

Ljm1UYkAOSHWubOTHvhPRQ.text: I recently had brunch with my wife at Giada's in Las Vegas.  It was the very best dining experience I have had in Vegas.  Everything we ordered was very interesting and flavorful.  I started with the Rise & Shine, which was a refreshing way to start the morning after a late night in Vegas.  Having fresh pressed juice as an option is so appreciated.  My wife ordered the Pastry Assortment, which exceeded my expectations.  Pastries aren't my favorite thing, but these were very moist and very flavorful, especially the lemon muffin.  I followed this with the Truffle Burrata, the Sopressatta, and the Buffalo Mozzarella.  The Buffalo Mozzarella was particularly good as it had been soaked in this chili oil that added a great contrast to the creaminess of the mozzarella.  The Burrata was also really satisfying, especially in terms of the ratio of cheese to bread.  We also ordered a caesar salad, which was delicious and very well balanced.  As my entree, I ordered the Salmon Benedict, which was really light and crispy.  The hollandaise was especially good as the citrus made it light while also being satsifying.  Hollandaise is often too rich, but this was really light and really complimented the salmon.  For dessert, we ordered this cake with espresso gelato between the layers.  They infuse the gelato mixture with whole espresso beans overnight.  It was really excellent.  I also recommend the limoncello souffle.  We did not indulge in the brownie cart, but it looked ridiculously good.  A huge cart of brownies, toppings, and ice cream is available for dessert if you have room after brunch.  Next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really excellent brunch

7-Y5cjsXanMb0emAFHbAnQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants.   I've thoroughly enjoyed everything I've ever eaten here. Whenever I am in Las Vegas, I do what I can to get over to the Cromwell for some Lemon Ricotta Cookies.   If you can, try Giada's tasting menu. This is a great way to try a variety of menu items. I did this on my first visit and was able to pass plates around the table and try a little of everything.   The wine menu is excellent. The in-house sommelier has great pairings for each dish.   Memorable items: Lobster ravioli, Spaghetti, and lemon ricotta cookies

i-vqGAr12KyGdxlMAs4PjA.text: Y U M M Y! Giada exceeded my expectations of her restaurant. First off, THE VIEW! There is seating right by the windows and your view is of the strip. I had a lovely brunch with sun glistening on my face as I stared out the window to a lovely strip while eat some amazing food. I didn't wait too long for my food either which is another plus. There's a photo booth as you enter to her restaurant in front of the hostess stand which allows you to take as many photos as you want while you're waiting for your table. I ordered a spicy sausage pizzete as my appetizer since it's fairly small. The dough pulled apart so well. The sausage tasted like something foreign. Just different and so well seasoned. I ordered the Cavatelli pasta as my entree and that was nothing short of delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Sausage Pizette
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cavatelli with Ricotta, Pancetta, Butternut Squash, Toasted Pepitas, and Parmesan Cheese

nnJSss4R7lmWcjCtbiPAGg.text: Good meal from start to finish.    Hard to mess up burrata and prosciutto, and they most certainly did not.   Really enjoyed the bread presentation here.  It's focaccia with accompanying pesto, lemon mascarpone, chili flakes, and fried capers (I could eat bags of these.. who knew.) These flavors combined to make quite a nice bite.   Our entrees were okay.  My steak was closer to rare than the requested medium.  The side of potato gnocchi wasn't as good as I'd hoped.  We've had better gnocchi.  Wife's pasta was simple and good, not great.    Thoroughly enjoyed the desserts.  I ordered the peach souffle, and my wife ordered the baileys gelato with espresso.  Peach souffle is one of the better desserts I've had in a while.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet with a mushroom purée and potato gnocchi
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread topped with fried capers, lemon mascarpone, chili flakes

WPvbUV1BO-68JOmwojyDcA.text: A place that I always wanted to try, unfortunately I went for lunch so I couldn't order off the dinner menu. The waitress was extremely nice and made sure my order was correct. The buffalo mozzarella was extremely soft and melts in your mouth. While the prosciutto compliments the richness with the saltiness. The burger was cooked to my liking and held together nicely. Overall a great experience and could only have been better if Giada De Laurentiis was actually there.  Food - 9/10 Cleanliness - 9/10 Staff - 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q48p78ZKr2O6hzeaaDYW6w.text: We went back to Giada again over a quick getaway to Vegas and were so disappointed in the service.  The food was a 4 like last time but service was a 1 or 2.    We arrived to a near empty restaurant at 1:30 on Saturday and were seated by the window.  We were given menus by our male waiter and proceeded to sit there for 15 minutes when a female waiter came and gave us water, apologized for our waiter and took our drink orders.    Our waiter eventually showed up and said sorry for being tied up with two large parties.  He took our food order and it arrived in a timely manner.    The food was delicious.  Pizza Carbonara and Cavatelli topped with chicken Milanese.  My husband had an Italian beer he's never tried before and my cocktail (G) was unavailable due to running out of egg whites.    So we're done with lunch and watch the table next to us sit there and going through the same motions we did.  Sat, waited, grew more and more impatient and finally received the check 20 minutes later than we should've.   2 hours later, we walked out.  I don't mind kicking back and taking time for a relaxing lunch but there's a difference between relaxing and waiting on a slow server.    It's unfortunate because the first 2-3 minutes of a patron's impression and experience are crucial for how the meal is going to be received.  Please train your servers to be more aware of their tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

u4qgPJQOYPXHfWiwf5bUQQ.text: I came here with a group of girlfriends for a dinner. Service, ambiance and decor was great! 5 stars.   Food, however, was disappointing. I forgot to take pictures of the food but it wasn't really worth to honestly. We shared the spaghetti, penne pasta, arugula and Caesar salad. Honestly, I'm bored writing this review because the food was that boring. Plain, simple, like I could have cooked the same food and I'm no chef. I guess I had high expectations because I love Gianda! But maybe I'll come back and try something different next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad

kjv1-x-E78Lqm-KbhoBfvg.text: I booked this restaurant the minute I knew I was going to Vegas. The restaurant is one of the few with female head chefs on the strip. Giada clearly put her all into this place from the decor which feels homely and yet lovely, to the food and wine options this is definitely an experience to enjoy. Great for all occasions and group sizes. They also have a section that can open the windows to make it feel like you're overlooking the strip outside while dining. The waiting area also has a photo booth which was a fun touch! Give yourself at least 90 minutes to enjoy your time here.   They have options for a price fixe meal as well if you're unsure or have a large group to coordinate. Nice bottles of wine could be found in the $60-100 range which is impressive for Vegas!  I strongly recommend the chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricotta
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside decor
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iFdzA_lDMRb4nKTd-lEPmQ.text: Came here for dinner on Saturday night after catching a show in the Mirage. Didn't have a reservation, had to wait for 15 minutes which is totally fine. After getting some bread, which was good, we shared two appetizers. The Buffalo Mozzarella Ciliegine and the Prosciutto di Parma. The prosciutto was great, didn't really like the combination of the buffalo mozzarella with the chili. It masked the natural taste of the cheese too much. As entrees we chose the Fettucini (with lobster), the risotto with scallops and crab, the Italian fried chicken and the Spaghetti with Shrimp, Mascarpone, lemon and basil. I really liked the fettuccini, the sauce was very creamy and the lobster was great, too. The risotto portion could have been a little more generous, but it tasted great. The spaghetti were very tasty, good combination of all flavors. The Italian fried chicken was good as well, but one of the two pieces was too dry. We shared the chocolate hazelnut crunch which is like a very fancy snickers bar with a little bit of ice cream. Our waiter was nice and recommended a great bottle of Pinot Grigio. Overall, great restaurant, prices are not too crazy, could just improve a little bit on small details.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate hazelnut crunch
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettucini with lobster
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto with scallops

ICFe1VBCCWQ0UePIx4XEFw.text: A different take on classic spaghetti and it was uniquely tasty. Looking over the menu, there were many dishes to choose from. It looked to have a lot of vegetarian selections. I am not a vegetarian, but it was nice to see that in a well-known named restaurant on the Vegas Strip.  FOOD I ended up selecting the spaghetti because for being my first time trying Giada's restaurant, I wanted to know what the most generic named item tasted like compared to other Italian restaurants. It didn't say that it had marinara, but described to have shrimp, mascarpone cheese, lemon & basil. None of the pasta entrees seemed to have marinara in it. Not sure if that's an Italian thing and marinara is not a thing over there or maybe not in Giada's pasta vocabulary.  DID I LIKE THE SPAGHETTI? For me, I felt it was dry with very little sauce. However, it did make taking the spaghetti with my fork fun as it would unravel from the swirl pile it was in. The shrimp were large and fresh in taste. Wish it had a little more sauce, but you know what? It was different from any other generic spaghetti dish I've ever had. The lemon and basil were there, the pasta you could tell was freshly made. It was good for $34. I would probably not order it again though as I like something not dry.  BRUSCHETTA My table ordered this for an appetizer. Came with 4. It was good. It tasted like any other bruschetta. It was crunchy.  DRINKS The server put a tablet on our table that had cocktails that we could order from the tablet. It described what was in each and how it looked like. We ended up ordering Frose which I didn't see on the tablet menu, but saw it from our table in a machine at the bar. THAT WAS THE BEST Frose I've had in Vegas. Smooth and perfectly strong for $17. I would order that again for sure!  SERVICE The service was good. I enjoyed seeing the dessert cart roll by but didn't order from it as we had to run to a show and were full.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti: shrimp, mascarpone cheese, lemon &amp; basil - $34

1_oOFz2BwOZ0afXkq-41Hw.text: UPDATE: I came again while in town last week. It's my must go to place every time I'm in Vegas. I love everything about Giada! The lemon shrimp is my fav always. Here's more pics :)

HXGtTRzHWXifroSZA6Qcmg.text: After eating dinner here last night I totally get all the mixed reviews. When we arrived at 5:30 the restaurant was almost empty yet we were still seated way in the back with no view. There were plenty of open tables with nice views. I immediately noticed the loud nightclub music which was a huge distraction from our dinner. Maybe Im getting old but I did not enjoy it at all.   Our waiter came over and was just going about his routine. He didn't seem too interested in providing suggestions or answering our questions. We started with the bacon wrapped dates and chose to share the 28 oz bone-in ribeye and the cheese tortellini.   The bacon wrapped dates were good but the bacon was cooked inconsistently. Some parts were crispy and some of the fat was undercooked that we had to cut away. After we finished our dates they sat another couple at a table right next to us. Keep in mind the restaurant was still pretty empty, including all the tables around us and they remained open until we left. I just didn't get it. Why? It was uncomfortable.   The steak and tortellini came out a short while later. The ribeye was cooked medium rare as ordered and had a great flavor. It was super fatty, even for a ribeye..I would guess around 50% fat. The cheese tortellini were okay but the sauce was really thin and needed to be thicker. It had a great flavor but was almost the consistency of water. At $32 for six tortellini I thought it was way overpriced.   We ended with the salted caramel panna cotta. I did not care for this dessert at all and I love desserts! The tart berries did not pair well with the salted caramel at all.   Overall a disappointing experience. We saw many people coming in wearing shorts, t-shirts and hats yet we were the ones who were sat way in the back of the restaurant. Service was average at best and the food was not what I would expect from a restaurant priced like this.
