Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside. We were seated way in the back for some reason

Kkd0lJKn2jkH99zefQdPAw.text: Nothing but fabulous here!!!! Giada deserves a "10" star review because EVERYONE & EVERYTHING was perfect.  You just need to come here to see!!!!

cIdT978wmNrTEJC63Crcmw.text: Girl's weekend in Vegas and we had a fabulous dinner here!  Our server, Nancy was wonderful and very attentive. We had the tasting menu and each course was better than the next and so much food. We had to take our main dishes home!  Highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino

Rk6FKFcc-DTplplbT8ud1w.text: So my girlfriend watches her cooking show and has been wanting to come here for dinner for sometime.  She finally secured a reservation for the right time and the right day so we were treated to a sumptuous Italian meal Giada style.   I like this restaurant a lot and would not mind coming back at all.  The service was great and the food was wonderful as to be expected from a chef of her caliber.

lsW8Fbmv4KBBFvv0VwAdhQ.text: Went yesterday lunch. Giada was there!!!!! Super cute!!! Missed the chance to photo w her :-(.  Super good taste in decor, wide open concept to awesome outside view, open kitchen, cute cute white lacy dress hostess wears, great bar lounging area. If your into decor, designs, Just by being there feels good, really.  I ordered Lemmon grilled cheese w prosciutto and sweet ricotta pizza(so Giada!). Very generous amount of good prosciutto, super light and crunchy good bread, good cheese, simply perfect. Can't get too much better.  Sweet ricotta pizza, sounds good, right? Tastes great too! Dough is so fluffy crunchiness to perfection. Ricotta's little sweetness n balsamic reductions tanginess with arugula's earthiness are simply awesome. Good size, too. I also got non alcoholic elixirs. Both great taste, not too sweet!!   Don't know why it's not rated higher, but as foodie and interior design lover as I am, I will give 5. Great date spot or great bite n drinks. You won't go wrong! I will def come back!! Love Giada!!

W7uiQTQxYdbS1PGF0DCp_Q.text: Giadas is a first class spot. One of the best experiences I've ever had. We decided to compromise. We would have an appetizer and dessert at Gs and shake shack after. We ordered the parmesano reggiano with honey infused with sage. For dessert we had the leaning tower of espresso. It was so amazing. Our waiter told us to give it a moment before eating the dessert and I know now why. But the best most awesome part of our experience was the small loaf of bread you get to start. It's in a small personal Dutch oven type of dish. It was sooooo good. It comes with 2 breadsticks and two cheese crisps. There is pesto olive oil to spread on the bread or the lemon marscapone. Omg now that is good stuff. Overall this place was top dog. I would love to have a full experience next time I'm in town. Well done Giada well done.  And guess what? Shake shack is not as good as in and out.

AcbsTgL70vOrVTrhQ47zpA.text: Place is nice. A little too noisy for a fine dinning restaurant. They have a free photo booth in the front which was cool.  Food was good, but small and a little stiff. Ordered a soup, an appetizer, 2 entrees and 3 sides with tip came out a little over $200. That is with no drinks.  Service was really good. They get an extra star for Giada walking around the dinning room floor for a short time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada!

qvo6gpFkHY_M9DMP6d8ItA.text: Absolutely amazing food! Phenomenal service from Nancy and Lane. Do yourself and two of your friends a favor and order the tasting menu and share. 3 is the perfect number to experience it all.

JxDY6jI26mar94ALVmEVRQ.text: I'm a Giada fan and watch her show on a regular basis.  But she needs to go Undercover Boss on her restaurant.  She would be mad and embarrassed at the service, food presentation and food itself.    We were greeted with a smile and immediately seated.  Was not crowded at all.  Maybe 8 tables had people seated. Now, that is the only good thing I could say.   We waited and waited for our waiter.  He finally came over after about 15 minutes.  He explained the menu and started to walk away.  We asked him if we could order our drinks (3 coffees and a water).  Took about 20 minutes before he came back with our drinks.  We finally ordered and waited a long time to get our food.  During this time we noticed other people waiting and one lady actually stood up at her table to signal someone to take their order.  Our food finally arrived about 1/2 hour later and was just OK...nothing to write home about.  I actually asked the gentleman that delivered the food for some salt and pepper and he said no problem.  He never came back.  So you know our group almost got up and left because the service was so bad.  Sorry to say that we will not be back and would not recommend this restaurant.  Sorry but this place needs help.  I don't believe they will see many return customers which will torpedo this place.

aq0q3n3mwyXAKdvYouzaKQ.text: I want to start by saying I would not have written this negative review if I could have spoke with 1 employee in a 2 week time span to work out my problem.  Instead I was given multiple numbers to call which were corporate people that referred me back to the restaurant.  The number that was suppose to be the hostess station at Giada's would ring 2 times and then go back to a corporate reservation line.  This happened no matter what day or time I called.    My fiancee and I went in for a pre dinner cocktail and app.  We ordered bacon wrapped figs, 1 glass of wine and some kind of cocktail drink.  The bill was 47 dollars.  I left a 5 dollar tip since it was just 1 round.  When I checked the bill on my credit card statement , the total was 97 something. The bartender had given himself a 51 dollar tip.  Now I'm not a math wiz but it sounds like he added a 1 after my 5 on the tip line.    For being a newer, high profile, celebrity restaurant, the customer service is a complete joke. I feel embarrassed for Giada and hope she takes a little more, 'hands on' approach to prevent any further criminal activity in her restaurant. Also, how about  making  some kind of management available to customers so they can deal with these types of issues over the phone rather than on social media.?  I did, dispute the charge with my credit card and they also quickly realized this was a scam and refunded me my money.

Ylxn4tB5QbsmcwMNVtc5NQ.text: Simply amazing!  The food is outstanding!  Lindsay waited on us and she could not be more professional and a first class waitress. . Came back the next day bc we wanted to try more food items.

ZzFS7KpPiStbxM2WZGIudQ.text: Upon arrival having a reservation for a party of 4 there was major confusion between the 3 hostesses manning the desk. After 15 minutes we were finally seated. Two of us went to the restroom when we returned we were told the waiter dropped off several items without explanation and left. They included menus, wine selection, an iPad menu and an envelope that consisted of a tasting menu. After 15 minutes the waiter came over . We asked him if we can have some water and he had explained that his bus person was a bit off. Then he proceeded to Inform us the size of the pasta dishes were only 5 ounces and that he recommends us ordering an entree and just sharing some of the pasta is in the middle of the table. Then he walked away. When he came back we ordered our food and he left I then went to the restroom and my husband texted me and said the waiter put down my food in front of where I was sitting even though I wasn't there. This was probably the worst service I've ever had in a restaurant!  However, we did notice the waiter behind us was more attentive and gave the people a much nicer experience that you would expect at a restaurant like Giadas. I would be reminded if I did not say that The food at Giadas  is very very good but the service and the ambience of the room lacks the quality of service expected at such an establishment. I've heard this from other people and would never ever go back to Giadas Nor would  I recommend it as the prices are quite high but you do get quality food! The service is more Olive Garden then what you'd expect from a restaurant smack in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. This is consistent what people have stated about Giadas since it opened. The selection in Vegas is too vast to waste time and money on an inferior experience. Thumbs down on this

5AyoPTkXG6e09iFMUDEAFA.text: We had a very enjoyable dinner. Everyone was very friendly from beginning to end. Fred, our server, was knowledgeable and made very helpful menu suggestions. We started with Giada's favorite antipasti. Very nice for sharing. Tried the Veal Saltimboca and Filet. Both well prepared and tasty. A must ending is the Limoncello Souffle. We highly recommend try Giada when in Las Vegas.

RUuUOo3J7PQlFxJjYvrQtA.text: Beautiful place, excellent waiter but service so slow,   Good food but so to small portions for the price, nothing special really.

tdo6WB7N-wuW0cGWC9R3XQ.text: Excellent service. Wine and cocktails were fantastic. Get the orzo meatballs, buratta, and mortadella from the antipasti menu. Then order the spaghetti with lemon basil and the biggest shrimp you've ever seen. Don't share. You'll want it all. And speaking of not sharing, Giada's lemon ricotta cookies. You'll know what I mean.

5mPrpdfM7gR6Y4FUyR3HqQ.text: We went to Giada's and found it to be disappointing. First of all our spaghetti was less than al dente. I could taste the raw flour. My sister has celiac and ordered an entree which was marked Gluten Free. However, when the meal arrived they had substituted broccolini for  a polenta cake. The polenta is Gluten Free however they typically put it in the fryer. #1- they could have fried it separately in a cast iron pan or #2- they should have asked her what else she would like in its place.  It was very pricey for a not so good meal.  Also, one of my dinner companions ended up with food poisoning. Thanks Giada!  Do yourself a favor and choose a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.

NNh4wdDoK4xEfzvQ2Nn6MA.text: Gosh why couldn't this taste  as good as it looks? What can I say. The hype is unreal. Everyone that ive spoken with has had similar experiences. The food was insipid yet I only got chicken strips, a waffle and latte. The chicken tasted like it had been out too long and there was nothing memorable about the coffee and waffle. HOWEVER! Absolutely lovely ambiance and restaurant. The view is lovely and so is the decor. At least they got something right. I will give this place a shot sometime for its dinner options... maybe.

afQRD9BLqJIR275vmVG3UA.text: Came to Giada for a bachelorette party and had a fantastic dining experience. We started with sparkling water and our glasses were never empty. Our sommelier recommended a fantastic Italian wine, Brancaia, and our server, Nancy gave us the perfect main course recommendations. The starters included bacon wrapped dates with Gorgonzola, ricotta crostini and kale and arugula salads. I contemplated a second order of the dates because the combination of sweet and savory  flavors was outstanding with the kick of pepper. Our main options included lobster ravioli, salmon, bucatini pasta and a filet. The lobster ravioli was phenomenal, with butter sauce and lemon that was exceptional. As Nancy said, the fried Brussels sprouts were addicting. The bucatini pasta tasted better than anything grandma ever cooked and the freshness of the noodles was unmatched. The filet was cooked perfectly and the salmon was seared to perfection. We also had a friend dining with us whose diet is completely vegan and Giada accommodated her with a vegan bucatini and arancini that even the meat eaters enjoyed. We chose espressos, tiramisu cheesecake, sorbet and Bellinis for dessert and the desserts were as impressive as the dinner. What an excellent experience from beginning to end and we can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli and fried Brussels sprouts
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu cheesecake

G_DWhdtYLS9BDIdfuNTEiA.text: I LOVED the sauce on the lobster ravioli. It was so delicious, and the quality was excellent. I tasted several of the dishes of my friends: the pea pesto tortellini, the prawn spaghetti and the rigatoni. The only one I didn't care for was the rigatoni. Nothing beats my great great grandfather's recipe, though. ;) Dessert was amazing.. especially the lemon souffle. The atmosphere was lovely and Nancy and Mark provided excellent service. The only thing that was slightly distracting was the music. It didn't really fit the vibe of the restaurant, and was a little loud in the separate  room for our larger party.

AfT2_75muLH0mFhpa1Vpcg.text: Best Italian food ever!!! The flavor combinations here are so unexpected but so good. The service was top notch and all of the dishes and menus were explained to us very well by our waitress Nancy. She was very sweet and took good care of us. The portion sizes are great, they fill you up but are not too over the top. Will be coming back!

yMMgrjzFxrGgMuy_pKM5qA.text: Tried the Sardinian Gnocchi as a room service order at the Cromwell. Described by the person on the phone as "our fluffy potato dumplings". The dish that I received was a shell shaped pasta made of semolina... Quick google search showed that Sardinian Gnocchi is semolina pasta.  Such a shame that the menu didn't include the description and the operator shared the same understanding of the menu as I did.  Flavor wasn't great.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sardinian Gnocchi = semolina pasta.

H3A3mHJWbt-8hBEc2m8_zw.text: Good place to come if you have a ton of cash to blow.  Came here last night and had the Brussel sprouts crudites. It was way too sweet with the cranberries.   My entree was the vegetable ragout subbed with pappardelle instead of the rigatoni. The portion was still small for what was being charged, but it was delicious.   Dessert was nothing to rave about. Had the chocolate tart which was like a giant peanut butter cup.  After entrees were collected, service seemed to just stop. We waited around for our check for while which was annoying.

LPpSoSdou49gox7hjKw16g.text: Decent appetizers. HORRIBLE SERVICE! Food is not worth the horrible service. Sbarro across the street gives you better bang for your buck

ePBwWz9Kw62HoVlL_qMbcA.text: Great food as expected by the amazing Giada. The service however was terrible! I won't go back for this reason. The waiter forgot half of our order, hit me with a serving tray, forgot drinks and even over charged us for two cocktails that never came to the table. There is a definite management issue so far with the restaurant.

8gyALxxDgv8jO7JW9Vz6Ww.text: Poor service and bad food. It wasn't what you would think. There are way better places!

2QlvvjxReOptx61ilGev2g.text: My wife and I live in vegas, so we've been to a lot of the restaurants around here, and we wanted to see what the hype about this place was. We both like Giada, and we walked in expecting a homey feel and huge portions of pasta like her television show conveys. It was a bit of a let down overall. All of the hostesses were nice and personable, but it was surprising to see them in the shortest dresses I've seen in a decent resturaunt. We actually saw one couple leave because the wife caught her husband staring one too many times :) We didn't have a reservation so we sat in the lounge area, which was nice but it again just conveyed a typical vegas restauraunt. As for the food, it was good but overpriced, and certainly not very italian. The oysters Rockefeller were $18 for four small bites, and the spaghetti was $34 for a child's portion of dry spaghetti with very little sauce. All in all, if you like Giada look up her recipes, make them at home, and invite your family over for a Giada experience and go to Casa di Amore for good italian food.

mPaCZsDvKBOtKOb0Pg-alg.text: We came here for lunch, and the place was packed. Luckily, we had a reservation. This review is only for lunch because the dinner menu is slightly different.  The food gets 3.5 stars overall.  Our table ordered the Gorgonzola pizza with kale and mushroom, the sweet ricotta pizza, the carbonara pasta, the tenderloin sliders, and the muffuletta sandwiches with the fried zucchini. The bread and pesto sauce that came with our meals were delicious, best part of the meal. The tenderloin sliders were very tender and flavorful. The other dishes were average.  Honestly, the pizzas tasted similar to California Kitchen Pizza's, except Giada's crust was much better.  The carbonara pasta dish is small.  I did not like Giada's version of this pasta dish.  The muffuletta sandwiches tasted good, but the bread was a bit too tough and chewy. The fried zucchini side dish that came with the sandwiches was light and perfectly seasoned. For desserts, we ordered the Italian donuts, the gelato, and the crostata. They were also average.  Maybe their dinner dishes will be better.

4IuKiB9PXDvwu9_cDbLD6Q.text: We were just there for lunch. Had a reservation and got seated early. The dining room is cozy and well laid out. The olive bar looked amazing. I could have sat at the bar, nursed a cocktail, and nibbled all afternoon! Instead, we had a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains, dined on delicious food, sipped a not too pricey glass of Italian red, and enjoyed good service and fun people watching. The prices are a little more than we normally pay, but we had to try it. And we're glad we did. Thanks, Giada, for a divine meal.

UPlTFuOAKQfdlHJrNm1n1Q.text: Saw pictures of this restaurant and also read some really good reviews about this place so my family and I decided to make reservations and check it out. We did breakfast just to see how it was pretty much get our feet wet to see if it's worth checking out for dinner. I like the location. Very nice view, and also it's up some escalators so it has that feeling it's away from the smelly, smokey casinos which is a nice change. Our server was I believe his name was Juliano (had had an accent so it was a little difficult to understand him) Juliano is what I heard. His approach was very nice and also made sure to give my daughter a children's portion breakfast due to Giada's restaurant not having a children's menu or anything on the menu that a young child would even consider eating due to it being so different,which wasn't a big deal because they made her eggs and bacon with some toast and gave a decent pricing due to it being a small side plate of food. My daughter enjoyed it. Our meals were amazing. Fresh, well cooked, and excellent flavor. Also our fresh squeezed juice was delicious. The orange and carrot juice seemed to be the favorite at our table. My husband got the hash and he said it was really good, and I got the American breakfast it to was very good. My husband and I have already talked about going for Dinner on our next outing so we can see if the dinner is also as good as the breakfast was. And what the heck we will for sure have to eventually check out the lunch too. Our only complaint would have been our service was somewhat on the slow side. It took the server a long time to come and clear plates and give us our check. Whoever was the busser was slacking. We had dirty dishes and glasses on our table for a long time. We gave the food on a scale of 1-10, a 10 and the service a 6. Also my husband showed how the silverware and glasses were not polished. I still give this place 4 stars our of 5 due to the fact the food and location of the restaurant was amazing. We look forward to going back for dinner and or lunch hopefully my next review can be updated with 5 stars and an even better review.

sgD8r1MsRzRPWHneeqz3vg.text: I was here on Thursday night with some great friends all the food was great, one or two busboys were a little clumsy but George the manager made up for it. I love this place!!

lgcSRImkKy8epz4UaYCT8A.text: The restaurant is beautiful. The hostess was friendly.  The food was ok & very small portions for the price & quality. I barely remember what I ordered... lasange.... & it was just ok not fabulous which it what I had expected. The service was disjointed and slow. One of our orders came 10" after everyone else's and another had meat on it when supposed to be a vegan dish. The waiter barely took time to stop by our table to check on us and we had to flag him down to point out our missing food & the vegan issue. We ordered desserts but again had to get the waiter's attention.  The check came about 20" AFTER having to get the waiter's attention and ask him for it. We wanted to do a lunch there, not spend the afternoon!  Perhaps it will get better with time but right now, it is over priced and under organized. I'm hoping it will as I love watching Giada  on the various TV shows and truly love her recipes. I plan to give it another try in a few months assuming reviews are positive.

fvvqei1pAA7OZYuu8K2NYA.text: Ok, so the facility is nice.  However, it is drastically overpriced, the portions are very small, and you needed a fur coat because it was freezing in there to the point of hardly being able to focus on the dinner.  And for an 'Italian' restaurant, the menu sucked.  Won't be back there ever.

CyWtPoGqctbxJUT41HjVxA.text: Eight of us went to Giada's in Las Vegas for dinner and it was a fabulous experience. First class all the way from atmosphere, service to food and drinks. Everything we ordered tasted so good and it was all we were hoping for. Highly recommend her restaurant, will definitely go there again!

1UIQbThejvBZd4bi_mGksA.text: Food was wonderful but the service was sorely lacking.   We went to celebrate my mothers 90th birthday.  My brother was slightly delayed as he dropped off my wheelchair bound mom and went to park the car.  Delayed only a few minutes but enough to irritate the waiter.  The entire evening the waiter was rushed, inattentive and down right rude.  We had to constantly try to get his attention when we wanted to order more drinks, get pepper, etc etc.  When we got the bill, the gratuity was included, which is fine for a party of 7, but you could tell he was trying to hide that fact and get more tip.   Every time food was brought out they had no idea who ordered what so we had to stop conversation and direct them. Ridiculous in a high end place. Go for the food but be aware of the service.

rAUH3G593GeilYc-T8MvCQ.text: Tried it once and would never go back for a long time.  Just had high expectations and they were not even close.  Food super over priced.  They call it tasting sizes and that's what they are at the full entree pricing.  Nice looking restaurant and service was good.  But most people are going for the food and not worth it.  So many options skip this one.

3kg2v1l4WFFRacBgPtJhZQ.text: My experience was amazing. The service was impeccable and the food was delicious and perfectly prepared. My wine was great too!

bufJWr9aM2f_y_u4qH5_OQ.text: My wife and I wanted to try this restaurant out for awhile. So I called to see if they have lunch spot open. The reservationist told us just come on over theres no wait, when we arrived the hostess told us theres a 45mins wait....The reservationist could of told us earlier save us a 45mins drive from Summerlin.

yBvTAlGIiVMeDSWiH3WqIQ.text: Great experience. Dinner at the bar with our great bartender Eric.   Food and cocktails were awesome and the service was amazing.  This is why we sit at the bar!!

9esWzpkP_pPm4ffHCRBP5A.text: We visited Giada's on 18 Oct, having made a reservation weeks before hand.  When we arrived, we were told that some guests were 'just not leaving' therefore it would be a few minutes before we would be seated.  Forty-five minutes of sitting in the bar on very low uncomfortable seats we were escorted to our table, in the bar, next to the kitchen door.  It was a high table with uncomfortable seats.  Then, we were ignored for twenty minutes, finally grabbed a waiter and asked for the manager.   Ten minutes later, a manager arrived.   We relayed our experiences and his reaction was reminiscent of Capt Louis Renault in Casablanca. He was 'shocked' at our experience.   Within a few minutes, water and menus arrived. After placing out orders, the manager returned to offer us a glass of champagne, I'm sure it was Chateau Thames Embankment. When the food arrived it looked interesting.  The interest waned as we tasted our food. All four entrees was dismal, and luke warm.   We discussed sending it back as we were fed up, instead requested our check.   No questions were asked as to why every dish was barely touched.  The check arrived with no adjustment.  The check 'folder' had a device attached, presumably for leaving feedback. It was disabled. Needless to say, we will never return and will tell our tale every possible chance. We had far better food at the Wicked Spoon, also at The Cosmopolitian.

yYphc9kxe3JSREYKOyBVMw.text: Fantastic lunch with the pain sandwich. Opt for the fried zucchini strings over the aurogola if you are feeling adventurous. The Margarita pizza was also tasty. Enjoy the view if the strip and order the Destroyer for your drink.

ZKaFRjLbmNKc-vKigGn0MQ.text: We had an amazing experience at this place. The ambience is fantastic and the service is great. Not many options for vegetarians but enough to keep you quite satisfied. We had the fennel with hazelnut and the artichoke arancini. I could not really taste the artichoke in the dish. The hazelnut dish was tasty but a bit too oily. In fact, a lot of the dishes had too much olive oil. As for the entree, I had the zucchini and mushroom couscous dish and it was delicious. I would return here for a special occasion. Be warned it is quite expensive.

vsHU43gnPpUkoAiSMFqFtQ.text: Where do I start? Where do I start? The bacon wrapped dates may have changed my entire life, the cocktails are amazing, the risotto is perfection, the veal is a game changer, and the lemon ricotta cookies with coffee gelato is by far dessert perfection. Giada honey....honey...you rocked my world.

FcGaMlTeeExdnYarhstyNg.text: I've been a longtime fan of Giada. Her cooking show on FoodNetwork was what actually got me into food and cooking! So imagine my excitement at the opportunity to dine at her restaurant during lunch!  Service: 2.5/5 Nothing extraordinary. We were celebrating our anniversary & was hoping they'd do something special for us but it felt like any other meal to me. We asked our waitress if they could make us crostinis (which we understood was on the dinner menu), but she didn't bother to ask the chef to see if that was even a possibility.   Ambiance: 5/5 They seated us right along the window facing the Bellagio so we got to see the Bellagio fountains show twice during our lunch.    Price: 2/5 Some items I see being overpriced (i.e. my Venetian panino for $18 - the most expensive panino I've ever had by far). We ordered the burrata, which did not come with any bread. A little bit of bread will cost you $6...  Food: 4/5 The food here was quite delicious. Burrata was very fresh and oozing when you cut into it. My favorite item was the Carbonara pizza with an egg on top. My Venetian panino which came with turkey, fontina, and gruyere was also good. However, the flavors didn't blow me away to warrant the extraordinary price.   All in all, it was a good experience. I probably wouldn't come back for lunch though. It looks like they have better options during dinner. At least the view was very beautiful!

hgDcMY6z67HQ0s2OW_DKZQ.text: Giada's sucked!!!!! For someone who is mighty full of themselves (which you can tell because she has photos and signs with her face and name all over the place), the food did not live up to the hype. She also has quotes of her diet philosophy up on the lamps-- really? We ordered the pastry basket, the carbonara pizza, the romaine salad and the pasta pomodoro. Really the worst Italian food I've ever had. The pastries came out warm to touch but when you opened up they were cold so really disappointing! The pizza had stale egg yolk and chewy pizza dough (much like her failed Ellen degeneres appearance-- Nicole Kidman was right!!) really unappetizing couldn't even finish my piece. The romaine salad was SOAKED in salad dressing and they didn't bring over their ridiculous pepper grinder which could've been more fun. The pasta was so boring- not memorable at all could get better from chef Boyardee honestly. Cannot believe this lady claims to be Italian! Restaurant was what I feared.. a tribute to a food network chef who finds herself more famous than she is and uses her loud personality to promote her restaurant rather than cook decent food. Really bad- soaking salad. Waste your money elsewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n0KcIXgDOG4qY5jQHgdSQA.text: There were 3 hostesses that was super awkward and unhelpful and told us to wait in the bar. Didn't show us where that was or let us know if they would come find us. We found our way to the bar where the cocktail waitress didn't even know what beers were on tap but was excited to show us their drink list on an iPad. We ordered our "sweet baby pepper" antipasti - literally 4 Costco sweet baby peppers stuffed with a teaspoon of tasteless pecorino and charred for a min (very tough and still raw.) The risotto balls were also very bland and surely rolled in Ragu. We ordered lobster ravioli and and the petit filet to share. Our Lobster ravioli was VERY fishy and the lobster tasted old. We each only had one bite of the dish. Our filet was ordered medium rare and came out way overcooked. The steak was paired with a basic spring mix with vinaigrette and three burnt croutons. The meal was a total flop. The server never came back to ask us how the meal was, and the busser would clear the dishes without saying a world. We finally flagged down the server to ask for our check so we could get to another restaurant to try and salvage our dinner.  We told him how disappointed we were in our experience and to please give the chefs our feedback. He offered to comp the dish and we told him that wasn't necessary and that wasn't why we were offering feedback. In my opinion, he should have comped the dishes we weren't able to finish. He said he hopes we will return to try more dishes in future. I don't think we will return. Our bill with cocktails was $200. The drinks were good, our server was nice and we had a table near the window at sunset. Overall, very poor experience for a celebrity chef restaurant.

obBdEo61GGFAXKL2qqRF4Q.text: Everything about this place is amazing! From the food, decor, customer service, everything.  Speaking of the food, it really tasted as of what I imagine if Giada was cooking in the kitchen, as if Giada was cooking for me personally! Food portions pretty good size. Also ordered the vanilla latte, it was probably the best I have ever had.  We experienced really good customer service too, she was very attentive, sweet, and made sure we were having a good time.  Overall great place.

U7eV6Qvi9sAyKU6J6wV9IQ.text: I completely and thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. The service was so professional and the pace was wonderful. We had the antipasti plate to share as our starter. The stuffed dates, beef bruschetta, and stuffed peppers were really memorable. Along with a great bottle of wine! My husband and I shared a beautiful and  inspiring plate of lemony pasta with beautifully cooked prawns. Wonderful al dente handmade pasta. Then, I had the most delicious herbed crusted lamb chops. Succulent, perfectly seasoned and cooked to perfect medium rare. Bravo all around. Can't wait to have an opportunity to go there again.

EX-4DZTcvYzM-Ut4uD-XKw.text: I kind of made it a big deal to have brunch at Giada for my last meal during my last Vegas trip. Especially since I was also treating my Mom here for a belated Mother's Day Brunch. The menu looked pretty impressive with selections from their Breakfast and Lunch menus plus a few brunch exclusive menu items. Because of the extensive menu, it took a little while to decide what to order. My mom ordered their Breakfast Contadina. I couldn't really help but order their Italian Chicken & Waffles because it really caught my attention when I saw it on the menu and I'm also a sucker for fancified versions of the classic soul food combo. Italian Chicken & Waffles -- bit.ly/1OOLJxm Cacciatore spiced chicken, polenta waffle, parmesan, cacciatore sauce Yeah, this was a serious plate of chicken and waffles for brunch. The Chicken was flavorful and had a nice spicy kick and the Cacciatore sauce gave it a tangy flavor that I enjoyed very much. And those Polenta Waffles were on point with a soft interior and slightly crunchy exterior. I just remember when they served it to my table, I was just shocked at how big the portion was for this. It was a very generous portion, but it was enough for me that I wasn't overstuffed after I finished it. Yes, I did finish this!! One thing of note though was that this platter was pricey at $28. That's just a few dollars more than Bouchon's Roasted Chicken & Bacon Chive Waffles. But it think the portion size and quality of the food was justified. I can't really say which is better though, because they're both great in their own way. Breakfast Contadina -- bit.ly/1TBBsqn Two eggs served any style, crispy polenta cakes, wilted spinach, oven roasted tomatoes & toast My mom also ordered a side of bacon to go with this since it was more of a vegetarian entree. From what I noticed, it was a very nice looking breakfast platter and it looked like my mom enjoyed it. So I've been to Giada for Breakfast, Brunch, and Dinner and all of them have been great experiences. It just proved to me that you can go there at any time of the day for any occasion and you can't go wrong. And I do intend to go back again since it's now become one of my must-go restaurants on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch at Giada

_sOkbo79uMmr7LDO5qfhwA.text: This restaurant really surprised us in terms of overall superlative experience. I am a foodie and did not have any high expectations aside that i knew of  Giana's cooking show a while back.  To put it simply, the whole experience , especially the food's careful preparation, stunning presentation and execution, well... just blew me away.   My favorite restaurant in Las Vegas from this point on.

jr7w_-QRQ1Gti5_BWzjDUQ.text: What a lovely restaurant. View is amazing. The food is good but the service is terrible.

chTQ3SRHF4cc3kBnCtHiIQ.text: The food was delicious! I wish I had a bigger stomach so I could eat more. A must get is the limoncello souffle. Yum yum!!! And our server, Billy was great.

KpRTyuJTdoaLWfU_fmw-Dw.text: We had a delicious and romantic here at Giada, and we were lucky to snag a table along the window. The view of the strip was cool.  I had the scallops - and they were sooo good! -but literally everything looked yummy!  The cookie platter for dessert is a must!

Zavaag2C0ZSiRFecczXu3A.text: This was one of the best meals of my life! I don't understand the mediocre to negative reviews at all. Every detail of the night was handled so well and it was a glitch free, very enjoyable evening.  I came with a party of eight to celebrate my husbands 30th birthday. We were seated at a great round table with comfy chairs in the center of the room with a view of the bellagio fountains. We were immediately greeted by the host and our server. The service the whole night was spectacular. We never felt rushed and we also weren't just sitting there twiddling our fingers for hours. My dad knew the sommelier Danielle and she was so sweet to our table, making sure everyone was well hydrated. She took great care with the expensive bottles of wine we brought for the evening and made sure everyone had drinks at all times.   The food itself was phenomenal! We started with the antipasti and omg the cheese and meat were so good! The complimentary bread basket was also so great. The warm focaccia and all the dipping sauce were my favorite. There were so many delicious options to choose from on her menu. It's a very well throughout menu.  Our table also split two of the pasta, the rigatoni and bucatini were excellent. I could eat that rigatoni all day! Both were top notch!  My husband and I split the Tuscan ribeye and the spinach and potatoes for sides. That ribeye looks and tastes perfect. It was fatty, flavorful and just as i had hoped.  For dessert I had the chocolate cake and tried the lemon souffle, and my husband received a complimentary lemon sorbetto for his birthday. All were good.  Of course the highlight of the dinner was Giada coming to our table and chatting with us a bit. She was just as genuine and nice as you would hope. She clearly cares about this restaurant and the experience of her guests. I was so happy to meet her as I've been watching her shows for as long as I can remember!  Overall I give this an A++ in my book. Sure it's more expensive than an average dinner, but it is so worth it!! The food and the ambiance are excellent! I can't wait to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wines brought for a great meal!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan ribeye

8Cqx5CA-n8sVmoSYZT4SCA.text: Meh describes it perfectly.  It is a beautiful location, but this pretty new restaurant has seen better days.  Only one word comes to mind with the furnishing, cheap.  Love the intention, but not well maintained.  ALL of the trim should be painted, the leather chairs are worn and the plates and other service bowls have seen better days (chipped bowls and the gold G is worn off).    Super sad, because this was a bucket list for me.  LOVE Giada. LOVE her show.  LOVE her cookbooks (expect the post divorce one, but hey I get it).  And I fully intend to buy her new book, but I will never come back to her restaurant.  The bill for this restaurant was almost more than we spent to stay at the Bellagio across the street for 2 nights.  And we eat out all over the world, so that isn't shocking for us except that the quality doesn't meet the price.  In a nut shell we ordered the La Strada cocktail for $15.  The menu claims it is made of Campari, Limoncello, lemon sorbet and Prosecco.  We called the bar and the recipe they gave was Campari, Sorbet, Prosecco, simple syrup and Sprite.  Sprite?  Really? In a $15 cocktail.  Someone is either lying, clueless or cutting corners.    For appetizers we had the orzo meatballs and the truffle burrata.  The meatballs were an average weeknight meatball $15 for 5.  The burrata was delicious, but they served it with out of season tomatoes.  This caliber of restaurant should not be serving bland tomatoes.  The dinner course for 4 of us was the fried chicken (OUTSTANDING), Ravioli (tiny portion), Risotto (nothing special), and the braised short rib pasta (very under seasoned).  Overall, it's nothing special and for the price it should be, or they should cut the price by 1/3 and call it Everyday Italian.

VgNPw7ClcDUyY1ZB3Z3pUw.text: Our first experience here wasn't the best, but our second time more than made up for it! First of all, the view was amazing. We sat in the dining area near the windows overlooking the Strip. It was a cool night so the windows were open and the ambience was perfect. Service was also much better! We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary and the waiter made us feel very special.  The food was in a word, delicious. I ordered the lobster ravioli (again). What can I say, I'm a creature of habit. My husband had the shrimp and lemon spaghetti and absolutely loved it! I enjoy a good bread basket and theirs is one of my favorites. The presentation alone is 5 stars.  This may have become our new favorite restaurant.
