cxjZkWalxfpd1PNWrwgBJQ.text: Oh my gosh! Love Giada's! Giada's is by far, the BEST Italian restaurant I have ever been to! 5 stars! Such a unique experience all around! Giada is actually my favorite chef and I have been watching her since I was 8 years old and I have made some of her recipes and have picked up tips and tricks from her as well as from other shows and just growing up around cooking from my mom and around family! I BEGGED my mom to let me come here for my 21st birthday two years ago and she delivered! Lol! :) I actually wanted to go to Vegas and this was the place I was most forward to going to being that I was excited that she announced her debut and me being a Vegas veteran, I had to come this hot new restaurant! :)   After exploring the lively Vegas, we arrived and I was so happy! I had a permasmile of excitement to celebrate my birthday here! I got dressed up and once I got inside, the decor and the interior was beautiful! From the sign to the marble theme throughout the restaurant, the panoramic view overlooking the Strip was beautiful! The service was excellent and we did a full course meal from the antipasti to the mains and my mom got me the best cake ever- polenta cake, which was so moist, had a unique texture and taste and was so delicious!   First, we had the delicious bread and breadsticks, then we had the bacon wrapped dates! Oh.My . Gosh! Delicious! They had a nice sweet, tangy flavor and I had never tried them before! I do not remember what else we had, but we had so many appetizers! Go for it and try as much as you can! This makes the experience really fun because you are trying new things you have never eaten before! It's awesome! Also, I remember I had this humongous dish which was so yummy! Molto bene! Yum! :) I believe it was the 7 oz filet It was so delicious and I was so full! Now that I just looked it up, our waiter offered us the dinner tasting menu which is family style, so very generous portions, and it was such a pleasant surprise! When you go, do the tasting menu! You will really enjoy it! :) For my first alcoholic drink, I had the limoncello cocktail which was delicious! It was sweet, yet tart, very nice! I had three and I was fine, lol. :) Also, when I went to the bathroom, I was so impressed! I could live in that bathroom! All marble and lit up and very clean and such a nice bathroom!    Thank you so much for a wonderful birthday Mom! I am so grateful to God to have you in my life! :)   It was such a special experience because I was becoming an adult, could drink too (lol!), and I took out time for myself to make an effort and just celebrate my life and give thanks to God for keeping me healthy and happy and thanking Him for all the blessings in my life and just enjoying myself! You have to give thanks in your life and enjoy it! You have to live a little and celebrate all you have! :)   I really hope you all enjoyed this review, more so article, lol! I put my heart into this, as with all my reviews and with anything I write! This was such a special occasion for me and I am so grateful I was able to celebrate my birthday at Giada's! I wish I could have met her, but I am very grateful for an amazing birthday celebration there at Giada's, in Vegas and with my family!   I hope I can inspire you all to be grateful for all you have and to celebrate it! Life is too short to not enjoy it! Live life, live it fully! :)   P.S. I hope to come back to Giada's for a romantic dinner on a date or for any other special occasion! This place is so special and I am so glad I celebrated my birthday there! :)   I don't have those photos anymore, but the memories will forever be in my heart! :)   Ciao ama (Goodbye my loves! )!   Busayo

0f31KbNlFgyI_4X2BOlWQw.text: My husband and I went to Giada's this past weekend when we were visiting Vegas on our anniversary. It was a very nice, upscale dinner. The food we got was delicious as well as the drinks. If you want a view of the Bellagio fountains you should make that request with your reservation as there are only a few seats with that view.

t6tuZZ01phdaeIAMc8Il6w.text: Disorganized, horrible foot print, over priced. I would rather have a crappy frozen pizza than eat her piece of bread with cold tomato sauce dropped on top. Very expensive. Staff seems in fear. Coffee not even warm. Place sucks. I think they are more interesting in selling her gift items than focused on food

JKHluimZtXSA_Br7HI2mhQ.text: ** Phew. I feel like I just gave birth to a review baby **  It's hard out here for a restaurant on the strip. People from all over the world are setting their sights on you and if you mess up in the least; the hungry huddled masses tend to hop on the haterade nipple. That being said, I had an amazing night at Giada. ** Not to be confused with Giada's Italian Cucina In Anthem ** (which a lot of out-of-owners seem to be doing)  I made reservations for my GF's birthday and requested a strip view. We arrived and were greeted with free glasses of champagne, which they do for everyone during the Friday dinner service. We were sat promptly, and immediately were taking in the amazing strip view at sunset. Beyond the amazing view outside, the view inside is great as well. I love the layout of the restaurant, which has a sunken dining area so people at the bar can view the strip without obstruction.  We ordered two glasses of wine off their digital menu and started the food train rolling'. Eggplant Parmigiana Fries with pomodoro & Parmesan fonduta, Mozzarella with citrus chili pesto, Prosciutto di Parma, Fritto Misto shrimp & calamari with shaved fennel & lemon aioli, Rigatoni with vegetable Bolognese, and a chocolate peanut butter tart with a raspberry sauce. The menu was limited, because a pipe had burst in the kitchen earlier in the day and full menu wasn't available.   The eggplant parmigiana fries were a amazing. Lightly fried, and dusted with Parmesan cheese; these were very light and crispy. They also came with a marinara dipping sauce that was nice addition to the plate, but wasn't needed. A must try.   The mozzarella balls had great texture with a tiny kick. These paired great with the prosciutto, which we only ordered with the server's recommendation. Thank you David! The prosciutto was so good; very thinly sliced and not too greasy. This stuff melted in your mouth. I could have easily eaten a pound of it.   Fritto Misto shrimp & calamari. Wow! This plate was an impulse order and I'm glad we did. The calamari was the perfect amount of saltiness and crunch, plus the added sweet peppers and fennel added freshness to the delicious fried seafood plate.   We shared the Rigatoni plate, because at this point we had already eaten all of the above along with a bread plate that arrives to the table once you sit down. Still... The Rigatoni was perfectly cooked, still firm, but not spongy. The sauce on this stuff was seasoned perfectly and the chunks of vegetables added great texture to the dish.  I used leftover bread to soak up the remaining sauce.   I'm not a sweets fan, but the chocolate peanut butter tart was very good, but also very rich! If you're a sugar fiend this one's for you. I just had a few bites of this and was good to go.   Beyond the food, the service here was fantastic. Very attentive and very willing to make sure your every need was handled.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasoning board.

wmUfEe_VcBhL04_Mpt4oEA.text: Tim is the bomb.com. Please ask for him. He's getting married in October. Send a nice gift! Also the pepper grinder is legit and deserves recognition.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gXg-2nJIDvm5M8KpGlaDyg.text: This was my second a probably final visit to this restaurant. I really do not see any value for the prices charged here.  The preparations are mundane.  The wait staff was adequate, but the hostess station was rude and uninterested in taking care of the clients. I arrived twenty minutes ahead of my reservation and was told our table would be ready at the reserved time. I had a drink in the bar and watched as several parties that arrived after me were seated first. When I questioned the hostess, I was shown to the worst table in the restaurant. I guess that's what happens when you allow a bunch of twenty years olds in short dresses to in effect run your restaurant without any supervision. Perhaps Giada should hire an adult to supervise these children. Done!

LTLv_yKr3ON9ijjRmgLlnw.text: The food was very good. We had the tasting menu for 85 a person. We started with the antipasto which was fresh and delicious. There are not many choices on the  tasting menu. I had the Italian chicken, fried chicken with a catcitore sauce on the side. Delicious. The two other guests had the pork shank, and enjoyed it. We were one of the last tables so I think we got extra desserts. They had a large variety of desserts. The service was excellent. One person in our party had food allergies and they did an excellent job of accommodating it. Top notch. It was pricey, but we got our moneys worth. I am not sure what the other items on the menu would look like, but the tasting menu was worth it.

jGlWFDm9_dbMwbr2KTpWBQ.text: Hostesses are in  serious need of training.  They are rude and unprofessional.  We had booked reservations months in advance and were looking forward to a great meal.  When we were sat at our table, the sun was glaring right at us. Since the restaurant was only 20% full at the time, we politely asked for a different table.  The look that we got was unreal!  She rolled her eyes, walked away without saying a word and after a while came back to move us one table over (which was fine, we were just literally being blinded by the sun shining through the huge windows).  However... our server Joseph was completely amazing.  Not overly solicitous yet made himself available whenever we needed anything.  Extremely knowledgeable and professional.  It went a long way to recovering from the rude hostess.    And the food - lemon pasta with shrimp is unbelievable delicious.  Still dreaming about it!

5kYc_Sl0324N37jNOUPiUw.text: The wait staff at Giada's are excellent!  I ordered the lemon shrimp pasta and it was good but the portion size was quite small.  The food is good but overpriced, especially  considering the amount of food you receive. The restaurant decor is very nice.

8qDDwXP3Z8xIc-EXUc5GwA.text: This was our big dinner for our first weekend Vegas trip. My other half and I were completely blown away. It was her birthday and they went above and beyond.  They gave us both special house blended martinis.  The appetizer was great.  And the steak was unbelievably tender and perfectly cooked.  They finished by bringing her out a special plate with 'happy birthday' on it and let us pick several desserts from the dessert cart. It was memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The appetizer
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with mashed potatoes and  grilled asparagus
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dessert

tQP7r_xKT7A8IsMmATt_0Q.text: This review is only for their lounge area.  Walked up on a Saturday night at 5 PM.  No wait.  Pick a seat from many open.  Live music in the bar which was fantastic.  (Two Gentleman on Strings covering pop hits that played extremely well on the Violin).  We ordered apps/drinks and everything was amazing.  Our Server Lindsey was great with drink recommendations and app selections.  I'm not a big fan of "Celebrity" chefs but I will say this restaurant had an eye for each detail.  The Glassware.  The Decor.  The Bread Plate.  Will Be back.

4o1ckdCDPT9n7NOQAKrMVw.text: Make sure you call for a reservation or make the reservation thru opentable.com request for a window seat. It's worth the evening and trip. I love everything about her :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 desert out of 5 - you have plenty of desert to choose from the desert cart.

yM6bXHRd86jcA-B75xvBRg.text: 2 stars becuase this is Giada!. You want to say "This meal was amazing! I want to go back there again". Neadless to say we will not be back. Tuesday night at 5 o'clock on May 9th- the pasta was undercooked (NOT al dente) and the shrimp were over cooked. The veal did not have any kind of flavor. When you go to a restaurant such as this you expect superior quality. This is why I give it a 2 out of 5. Extremely disappointed :(

ffnXI2jk2JNdLREhZUnzAw.text: My fiance took me here for Valentine's Day, it was between craft steak at the MGM or here but I'd already had craft steak so we wanted to try something new. I would NEVER  recommend Giadas to anyone. First our waitress took awhile to get to our table and one of the wait staff gave us some water and verbatim said "I'm giving you water because your waitress isn't going to be here for awhile." Bad start. Once we got food I was Totally sick to my stomach within 20 min and the guy at the table next to us got sick too. Worse than me I think because the paramedics came for him. Our very absent waitress looked very concerned so I asked her if he was sick because I felt sick too (and Im saying this after I ran to the bathroom) she said let me speak to the manager. She came back saying the other guy was dealing with something unrelated and that I'm a special, individual case but still charged us for our full meal. The meals which honestly werent good either. Extremely disappointed.

L0JUzhwhoaFv6R_c0ri9JQ.text: Don't leave LV without enjoying the Giada experience. Supplementing the incredible meal,  Valentino, Joe, Ponce and Diego took great care of our group and were so attentive!

yJjtOxKIHQaAKYPtKR5iHA.text: While my husband and I are huge Giada fans we were not overly impressed with her restaurant. The chicken Marsala meatballs were delicious,  but the muffaletta was disappointing. Not bad,  but not wonderful.  We were still hungry so we ordered the spinach and buffalo pizza.  I love buffalo mozzarella,  but it is relatively bland and needs other flavors to make it pop. This didn't work. We couldn't taste the garlic spread and there was very little spinach. Our waiter was a nice young man,  but didn't seem to have a good grasp of the menu and our wine didn't arrive until our meal was almost finished. We won't be repeat customers. There are just too many great restaurants in Vegas to settle for anything less than the best.

T3G9Y2Ob4MnpVp0j59gSuw.text: BREAKFAST ONLY REVEIW. This was our second time for breakfast at Giada. The space is bright and airy. After a night in Vegas, this is a perfect spot. Quiet, clean, inviting. The dishes, light fixtures, furniture, colors, artwork, and even the hostess uniforms are all well appointed. Because it's breakfast, I don't want - nor do I expect - to get too adventurous. But Giada made it clear that their eggs and toast are simply much better than others. It's expensive. It's supposed to be. And you should know that going in ($6 for a plain coffee). The staff is friendly with just a sprinkle of attitude, arrogance and condescension. It's an annoying tendency I've been noticing lately in the service industry: Example, A hostess at Chili's becomes quite affected, cool and proud of herself when she becomes a hostess at Craftsteak. You're a hostess, get over yourself and smile.

5s6YT3qK-9GN1fRXlAiEPA.text: Just had thee experience of a lifetime at Giada's! One of my daughter's dreams was to eat at her restaurant! We not only had a wonderful and delicious dinner, but we met Giada herself! She is so beautiful in person! She's heart-warming, kind, and you can tell she put her whole heart into her restaurant! The restaurant itself is welcoming, gorgeous and amazing. The food is heavenly and to die for! You have to try the Chicken Marsala Meatballs! The staff was so friendly and welcoming. Our hostess, Miss Zoe, was so gracious and made my daughter's dream come True when she found a table for us even though we didn't have reservations! We will never forget our time at Giada's! Truly an experience we will cherish forever!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So fun!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miss Zoe...you are the best! Thank you for getting a table for us! We are ever so grateful to you!

dl1JobHX-PBrk-WkUZsSkQ.text: Prior to coming to Giada, I was not a fan, and sadly it didn't leave me a fan either. We were there for a trade show and my fellow traveler made reservations and was excited about dining at Giada's. The first thing you notice is the over bearing Giada branding, everywhere! Nothing escapes the gilded G, or photos of her. The food was not special, memorable, yet rather expensive. The service was poor -- the server made us feel bad about not "ordering enough food" even when we had three different food items and a moderately priced bottle of wine. There was nothing friendly about his service either. I was not impressed on the decor (the entry looks like the home fashions section at a TJ Max) food (can't even remember what we ordered), or service, but it does have a fantastic view of the strip. With so many options in Las Vegas, and so many with better service and food, I would not recommend this place.

o87nrpYkhEACTyz4qU-x2g.text: This Saturday evening my amazing and fabulous 91 year old (a local and Cromwell regular) and I decided to dine at one of our favorite spots. We are SO disappointed to report that we will NEVER be returning. After many memories of family events when the restaurant first opened to when my girlfriends and I come to town- this place will only be a memory. The service was HORRENDOUS! Where to start..hmmmm. Although the pit boss called ahead for us and we were told we could go upstairs to dine they tried to put us in the bar area. Not really a place to enjoy a relaxing meal with my grandma. We moved and were treated by a lovely waiter, Amber. Unfortunately nobody was helping this poor busy girl! The bussers, runners, kitchen, and management must really not enjoy their jobs. We had Amber beg the kitchen about ordering our Burrata while we decide on some food (she's a diabetic and was starving). Lucky us because we were "allowed" to order one dish ahead of the rest. Then we asked for regular butter and it took about 5 minutes to get it. We ordered a couple appetizers and one entree to share. To our surprise we received ALL of the items at once! I have never seen such a bizarre set of events. We asked for another roll of bread right when we got the first round and that came at the same time as the food as well! I asked Amber if we could please take a couple items away so we could enjoy our meal and take our time. Of course she accommodated us. My grandmother asked for a plate from a busser because we were sharing. The Burrata was so cold it could make your teeth hurt! Interesting stuff. I was so upset because we had to ask multiple bussers and runners to get us the extra plate. By the time we each had a plate we noticed the octopus was room temperature and unimpressive. I asked the one guy for the manager. He never came. I asked another guy for the manager - who told me he's very busy and can't help. I got of my chair (for the second time to "help" the staff get things moving- but this time I was determined to find this manager. I walked up to a man in a suit and asked him if I could borrow him for a moment because I had been asking for him for a while. He came with me back to the table where my Grandma was and I told him how crazy our experience has been and that we are huge fans of this restaurant. George was rude and unfriendly. George, the manager, hardly listened to anything I was saying and made my Grandmother feel awkward. He never said I'm sorry this experience has been different than Jose in the past. She said she's been there at least 7 times without anything like this. I told him that I have worked at many different restaurants and in different positions in them. He literally said "congratulations" and after I looked at him funny he fumbled his words and it was even more weird and uncomfortable. I found it rude and offensive and I didn't was just tying to explain to him that I understand that there must be cohesiveness and people working together and that I've literally seen only Amber working and the other people are standing around. he said well what do you want me to do? I was like hmmm weird question. I said well I'm not happy and neither is she and I'm so sad because we love this place. He was silent and I said well maybe you could have them remake the octopus because she's 91 and never had it before! He literally took the octopus off the table and said ok. We never saw George again. He never checked on us and NEVER apologized or made us feel comfortable. We probably should have left at that point, and if I was with my friends we would have (but 91 year old). The rest of the food came and it was pretty good. We had the same plate problem because we were sharing. Asked a couple times and finally came. We also asked a couple times for more marscarpone butter and pesto olive oil and it took a reallylong time to get it. We decided we needed some dessert to spruce things up. The chocolate peanut butter cake was pretty mediocre. Not worth ordering. Anyways my grandma was getting tired so we quickly got the check and to our surprise not one thing was comped or taken off the bill by George. I asked Amber jokingly about him not taking the octopus off or the dessert. I gave her the visa and she was so cute she actually asked him if he could do anything to help our experience and got a big fat No.grandma told her that she's sweet to even do that for us! I told her that I think he was probably the most unaccommodating restaurant manager ever and borderline rude. I said I hope he is nice to the employees unlike the way he treats the guests. Let's just say I can't repeat what she said but I feel awful for the people who have to work with him! On the way out the door I saw many employees just standing around at stations and a couple big tables that were full of dirty plates and glasses. I watched as they were unattended to. Giada - your food is great but your employees seem lazy and unhappy, and George is awful.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snapped this filthy table on my way out. Too bad it sat like this on a Saturday night while employees stood around doing nothing.

hdoSpavXH1ihbDN1Tin7-Q.text: The breakfast contadina was horrible. The spinach was bland and the eggs tasted like they were from a McDonald's big breakfast. The orange juice says its freshed squeezed but tastes store bought. The orzo meatballs also lacked flavor. I am a huge fan of Giada and was disappointed with the food at her restaurant. I will not return. It is not worth the money you spend, too expensive for the quality. I think you pay for location and  ambience

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J0btiEI-00a69H8LAN--ZA.text: Nancy was our server and she guided us on point. Love the service and the food. We'll be back.

_ZkkSGEDc8hYNOIRUyAAeg.text: 5 stars does not do this restaurant justice. GIADA's restaurant is top notch, first class, all the above! I can try to describe everything about the restaurant but I don't think I will be able to articulate properly. The words that need to be used to describe it is beyond my vocabulary.  The very first celebrity chef restaurant I have been to that supersedes what you can expect.   Going here will be one of the best dinning experiences you will have.

PhMVfUfHLpgN3A4GMUzAfA.text: I wanted to go to Giada's because I admire her cooking shows.  I was by myself and sat at the bar.  Staff behind the bar was very helpful in ordering dinner.  I had a Italian white truffle cheese with dried apricots as an appetizer recommended by Martin. Never had anything like this before.  Would order it again!  I had lobster ravioli for my main course.  Portion size was just right.  I like the small amount of flavorful sauce.  Not a fan of floating pasta.  Top notch dish.    The service was very good. NO complaints on this part.   I had two glasses of good pinot noir with the meal and my only critique is that this was over $100.   Get ready to pay for Giada's name.

9QYniMeprr583gIp9OZDoQ.text: Last minute decision to eat here, not disappointed at all. Sat at bar, bartenders friendly and helpful. Salad, entree and desert were excellent, presentation, taste, all great. Next time may go with someone and sit at a window table, the view is remarkable!

ZOZoLF85uQc14_pQYaqcTw.text: Giada was an amazing brunch experience. From the views to the services the the food, everything was right on point. Billy, our server, went above and beyond to make this experience as great as it was. He was very knowledgeable and had great suggestions about the menu. When we visit Las Vegas again, there is no question that Giada is a must stop.

d-BEJTyUAREvNuB-al5yCg.text: Great food.  Portions are portrayed as small but perfect for a grazer like me :-) GIADA!

oIvRgtUS33Hg3QZY26fv5w.text: I enjoy Giada's recipes owning and using a couple of her cookbooks.  So when I found a Travelzoo special while planning our trip to Vegas it was an easy choice to purchase it and plan our visit.   The restaurant is very nice and the staff very friendly.  The food was very good - but small portions and a bit pricey.  Our waiter was very friendly and attentive while not overbearing.  My one complaint was that i like to arrive a little early for a reservation and enjoy a cocktail - but it seemed that the lounge staff was a little overwhelmed at that time and we had to wait a couple of minutes before the table we sat at was cleared and we were given an IPad to review the drink selections and our server promised to be back shortly to take our drink order.  We waited a good 10 minutes to place a drink order until the receptionist came over to show us to our table.  It was disappointing but probably saved me $90 as we were a party of 5 - all of age to drink.  Besides that blip - I'd recommend Giada on your next trip to Vegas.

H9b1sOkP_HbnWIOlYYu4bw.text: I absolutely love Giada, it's one of my favorite restaurants in town. I always choose Giada's for my birthday dinner. I always went for dinner but decided to go for brunch and it did not disappoint at all. We ordered a tasting menu which was $45 and brought pastries, antipasto, an entree, and dessert. For that we got salmon cake Benedict, and a Limoncello souffle (one of the best desserts ever!). We also ordered Strawberry Polenta Waffles, and Scrambled eggs with polenta cakes. Everything was so delicious and I think I could say that I'd rather go for brunch than dinner! They also brought out spreads for the pastries and toast which included almond butter. The almond butter was the best I've had. Not to mention they also have such nice and friendly staff. I cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Polenta Waffles that came with grilled pineapple, strawberries, Nutella, and vanilla-infused maple syrup.

EF14_F9KyfF0b3dYwJ9UWg.text: I want to like Giada Vegas. I really enjoyed my first trip here last year. However, things seem to have really gone downhill. My boyfriend and I were looking forward to a romantic dinner out. We didn't make reservations as it was only March and not busy. We were seated promptly, but put in a back corner near an aisle. The majority of the restaurant was empty and we were well dressed, so I'm not sure why we were pushed aside. Anyway, our server was very warm and welcoming, got us drinks and appetizers to start. We decided to keep our dinner light and share the "new" Chicken Cacciatore. I had this dish last year and really liked it, plus I wanted protein. To my surprise the dish was changed drastically from my original experience. The chicken is now fully fried and the tomato sauce is served in a gravy boat on the side. I was eager to try it. I took my first bite, the chicken skin was crispy but the inside was REALLY tender, I wondered what piece of chicken I was consuming. I sliced a second piece and took a bite, only this time it was cold and SOFT. I quickly looked at the piece of meat sitting on my plate and realized the entire piece of chicken thigh was dark pink and COMPLETELY RAW. I immediately spit my mouthful of chicken into my napkin and begged my boyfriend to not take another bite. Honestly, how the hell do you screw that up?! Giada, you served me raw chicken. I can't trust your kitchen. I can't believe your chef argued with my server about it and I really can't believe that I even ate the first bite. Please take this god awful fried chicken cacciatore off your menu and hire a new chef.

VtsELVIOKt8UzDZBT9yFWg.text: My boyfriend and I came for my birthday. I've heard mixed things, but wanted to decided for myself. We're local and love eating on the strip!! I'm not a huge Italian fan... But was in the mood to mix it up. So glad we came!!!!  I made a reservation about two months in advance via Opentable - asked for a table next to the windows so we can enjoy the view. They say us right away but at a table in the middle of the restaurant. So we went back and asked to be moved - said it would be 20 min. We had no problem waiting.. We wanted to take our time and enjoy the night. So sat at the bar and ordered drinks.   - Hannibal cocktail 5/5 This cocktail was so yummy, huge, and very potent. My boyfriend and I each had two and became reasonably drunk! 100% would order again. And again.   They sat us at a table next to the window. It was perfect! Great view and a little more private because you're not in the center of the restaurant.   Ordered a bunch of apps and pastas. None of the entrees jumped out at me.   - Orzo Meatballs 5/5 Delicious. Loved them    - Stuffed Dates 3/5 Good. But nothing special. They were pretty big but easily forgettable.   - Grilled Octopus 2/5 Easily my least favorite. Nothing special. Sad bc octopus is my favorite dish ever.   - Soup of the Day, Cauliflower 5/5 Wow! So flavorful.   - Beet and Apple Salad 4/5 Very bright and tasty.   - Lemon Spaghetti w/ Shrimp 6/5 This earns a 6 because it was just that good!! I'm still dreaming about it. And the shrimp were huge!! And cooked wonderfully. A must order!  - Risotto with Scallops 5/5 The scallops were out of this world amazing! Hands down the best cooked scallop I've ever had. The risotto was nice, but it's the scallops that earn the 5. I asked the waiter if I could order just a scallop entree next time, and he said they would try to make that possible. I hope so!!  - Cookie Platter 5/5 We were so stuffed but wanted to try the lemon meringue cookies I've read about. All the cookies were amazing!!!! You get six - two lemon, two chocolate chip, and two peanut butter with jelly. So simple and delicious.   We're already planning on coming back for more shrimp and scallops!!  *** side note: the floor around the bar is very slippery. Women, be very careful in heels!!! I saw two woman slip, including myself (thankfully my boyfriend caught me). The waiter saw and asked if I was ok and asked if I wanted to see the manager. I said no but a cocktail might help. But nothing! I guess I should of made a bigger scene... Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti with shrimp. Incredible!! Still dreaming about it.

txYDdm2NxS2WEwLtyAPFdA.text: I am a huge fan of Giada's I have been for years. I love her food and cook recipes all the time. So I was really excited to try out her restaurant. However, I was disappointed  the food  was Mediocre at best. We went for lunch because the dinner prices are outrages (even for lunch it's pricey) I got the pizza carbonara, my mom got the muffuletta sandwich and my friend got the lemon pesto grilled cheese. Everything could've been made better at home. For the price and her name everything should've been amazing and the food fell short.   The service was a bit slow and there were only about 10 customers in the entire  restaurant so I'm not sure why that was?   The restaurant is really classy and well put together like Giada herself.  The photo booth was really fun but when we tried to use it again the guest before us moved the camera and the photos were blurry and bright. (They broke it and the receptionist wasn't there to fix it)   The food was a let down. The quality, flavor and prices are could be better. I know we are paying for her name but if I was her I wouldn't put my name on lack luster dishes just for a profit. I won't go back to her restaurant, I'll stick to making my Giada dishes at home.

FUMHmBTvMFUBTGkLj6Fdyw.text: had a very nice lunch today with my 3 girlfriends~     Lets start with the host stand~ like most restaurants in LV, the hostess's are all young girls and wore adorable white eyelet type dresses. We were there upon opening so there where people apparently w/o reservations, however we were seated after them.....It all worked out just thought that was a little off~ The girl who seated us was polite, conversational and pulled all 4 chairs out for us~ slightly awkward however still a nice touch!    Our server Sean/Shawn was very attentive, conversational, polite, well groomed and definitely knew the menu ~ everything we ordered was quite good, can't say delicious.     The starters we ordered the roasted mushrooms, served cold (expected it to be hot, but I could have overlooked this on the menu) they were a very nice assortment of different types of mushrooms. Also ordered the Pasta Fagio soup, good but more like a chicken noodle soup plus goat cheese stuffed peppers, pretty presentation and good, not great.     Main courses also great presentations  on each, 2 Kale ~ Faro salads with goat cheese, the special pasta of the day eggplant lasagna & grilled cheese with prosciutto & pesto served with these interesting zucchini potato shreddings, which were quite different, interesting and a VERY nice change from fries, chips or salad~    Our issues came with desserts ~ we were celebrating a B Day ordered the cookie sampler, gelato selections, zeppoles, 2 regular coffees along with an espresso. The cookie plate had Happy B Day written in chocolate, very artistically done and the cookies were good......and of course they were on the bill~.we just questioned couldn't this been a complimentary B Day dessert? the price was $8.00 so not expensive, and yes they were ordered but REALLY GIADA???? it would have been a very nice way to complete the meal. I suspect that our server could have requested this as an option to be deleted from the bill, but for whatever reason he chose not to quite disappointing.Our bill was over $200 for lunch so again the money wasn't an issue, just seem like very poor customer service, and were LOCALS!!    You have a chance to rate your experience before you leave the restaurant, and we did and all the marks were excellent with A ratings, except the host stand which we gave a B. All in all it was a very nice afternoon, the restaurant is very nicely appointed and pretty with her name or initial everywhere, Hey it's her restaurant so why not? Will we be back? probably, however with sooo many options on the strip it could be awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EnIkX9iIFe30j5l_wvJR3w.text: We were off to a slow start, had reservations for 7pm but table was not ready till 8pm. However, once we sat down the staff was extremely efficient and personable. The food was very good, we were a group of 8 so there was plenty of variety to taste! The spaghetti was amazing as was the Surf and Turf!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salt and bucca
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Braised short rib

SJjcVmROKRdFTh3K_OD_XA.text: Great service! Awesome views of the strip! We had the bruschetta for an appetizer. It was delicious and wish we had more. The lemon butter that came with the complementary rosemary bread was outta this world. My spaghetti was good but not great. My Husband's lobster ravioli was ok. The tiramisu cheesecake was good and my espresso was delicious. Overall I would go back for a special occasion.

trqIUhaRAAq2suRrBN4XfA.text: I have to admit I make fun of Food Network chefs on a regular basis. I was pretty certain Giada was employed due to her giant smile and well... Chest.  I was dead wrong. 100% completely wrong.  We had the tasting menu. It turned out to be a little different than the menu we had looked at online prior to dining, but I have to say even with the modifications, it was basically within the top 3 meals of my life, and that includes 5 meals at Grant Achatz restaurants.  The antipasti platter was great. The focaccia in the cast iron ramekins that comes with the bread plate is something I want to steal and make myself. Sadly, we didn't get any signed menus with recipes like others have reported.  The pasta course was slightly lacking ONLY because I didn't think the quality of the pasta itself was on par with anything I'd eat in Italy. To be honest, the pasta was not al dente. It was crunchy. It could have used an extra minute or two of boiling, and I can almost guarantee it wasn't homemade (Edit: The chef reached out to assure me it was homemade). BUT the sauces were out of this world. I didn't even realize the Bolognese was vegetarian. It was AMAZING. The lemon cream sauce on the spaghetti was so good, I again want to steal it and make it myself.  The main courses were sublime. My rack of lamb and my brother's filet mignon were expertly prepared and couldn't possibly have been any more perfect. They were supremely high-quality cuts of meat, and they were done amazingly well. Surprisingly, the best dish of the night was one of the substitutions we didn't expect. It was the side of creamy polenta with sausage. After I tasted it, I almost wanted to tell my brother it was bad so I could finish the entire family style portion. No sharing.  We apparently got a special treat as far as desserts were concerned. I think it's because our reservation was for 10PM, and we managed to get the last tasting menu of the night. There wasn't a dessert cart to speak of, but they came over and plopped down a platter of SIXTEEN DESSERTS (2 each of 8 different types), explained what each one was, and said "Enjoy!" and walked away. We expected to be able to pick a few. We ended up getting all sixteen with whatever we didn't finish packed up in a nice little box to go.  I want the recipe for those ricotta cookies too. The second I tasted them, I knew I'd had them before... From a little Sicilian grandma who has a tiny patisserie in England. I was immediately transported to Italy, and that's a REALLY tough thing to do, as I'm a hugely critical judge of Italian food in America. I actually found myself trying to find little pieces of the cookies that were stuck in my teeth just so I could keep tasting them, and that's something I've never done with any food ever.  In all, it was an amazing experience from start to finish. I'm not sure if Giada reads any of these reviews, but if she does, I just want to apologize for everything I've said about her in jest. Now the things I've said about Guy Fieri on the other hand; I'll defend those until the day I die.

5klelsUVodhrnvahlgq-Nw.text: What a cool experience! Unfortunately with our reservation for 10:15 we arrived early to see if we could be seated earlier and were happy to see that the dining room was mostly empty. They said they might be able to seat us a little early. After a few minutes and another asking of when we would be seated, they said we would have to wait for our reservation time. By 10:15 we had been waiting for a while and were ready to get our seat. Unfortunately we weren't seated until 10:30 :( the place was practically empty, so that was disappointing. That being said we got seated. Service was average, atmosphere was beautiful. Seated right on the corner by the glass overlooking the strip, and they even opened our window to let in the beautiful whether half way through!  Food was good.  Our table ordered 5 pastries, all the gluten-free options. The chocolate muffin was the best. Very rich. I ordered the salmon Benedict but I wasn't feeling it and didn't love it after a bite. I switched with my friend next to me, which was the Breakfast Americana. Two poached eggs, lemon smashed potatoes, sweet meatballs, toast and tomatoes. This was good but nothing special. The really great thing is that Giada herself visited the place as we were walking out and we got to meet her and take a photo! Giada was so friendly and sweet it made the experience a lot more fun and made up for my picky eating habits. It was an unforgettable experience.

lHl2IVnvbWwp57m_Cup9ZQ.text: Service was exquisite.   We tried a variety of selections.  Starters - orzo meatballs, margarita pizza, and minestrone soup. All wonderful.  Entree - lasagna, carbonara, and chicken Cesar, equally spectacular.  Just a great venue. Great view overlooking the strip.  Nice, comfortable and not pretentious!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna and...
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita pizza

qILbDBVgz3vMKJKxN20nng.text: This was my first time eating here. This was my first time eating brunch lol. Three view assigns set up were both very relaxing and beautiful. The servers where excellent and very knowledgeable when asking questions about the menu.   My choice for brunch was the crab cakes. I was very disappointed. The only thing I could taste was lemon. It tasted more like a lemon cake. Thank goodness I could just eat off of my husband place.

CIhHUfCypQ07a7FPcAsN1w.text: Great experience, excellent food and service was top notch! Diego was wonderful!  The white shrimp lasagna was very unique, interesting and most of all delicious -as well as the bacon wrapped dates. Our cocktail were fun and tasty -The Barbarella was light and refreshing and the destroyer was deep in flavor. Good stuff

I1dW6oeeYarkxgtgRzUCMw.text: Nice restaurant with good views. Drinks are creative but at $15 each I would expect so. The free plate of house baked bread from a wood burning oven is spectacula. It came with crispy fried capers, an olive oil-herb sauce, lemon butter, coarse, ground salt and dried chili flakes. So yummy.  The bacon wrapped dates with gorgonzola creme and spicy sausage didn't measure up. Too much date and the tiny piece of sausage had the consistency of a hard lump of prosciutto.  The candied lemon arrugula salad was perfect as was the chicken lemon soup and lemon souffle.  Unfortunately I hated the veal. They call it a chop but it's really just a thin slice breaded and deep fried at a whopping $52 a la carte.  Wish I'd sent it back... was horrible. Total bill a whopping $175 with the tax and tip plus another  $13 for valet parking plus tip so $195. Yowzer

cXAThjuK5zEdrBd7zlmjFg.text: One of the best meals coupled with incredible service from Nancy!!!    Savored the burrata appetizer.    Entire family enjoyed both the lobster ravioli and spaghetti.    View fantastic with the windows open captured the energy of Vegas.    Thank you!

7MBIkSnTL00SMAMRDCf0Og.text: One of the most amazing tastebud holidays I've ever enjoyed.  The recommended chef's special was a meal I won't soon forget.  It is a pricey, however a worthwhile, must-eat if in Vegas.  Delicious, delicious, delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderfully delicious

9aEN4fDpuLxa0eZzlbc_uA.text: Spectacular. I wish I could give it 10 stars! Everything from the service to the food was outstanding. Great drink, delicious bread with pesto and a killer carbonara pizza. I will definitely return.

kZZ0RwEwYS_OAoR9VvE0cA.text: Expected much more from Giada. Don't even know where to start. The shrimp on my pasta tasted chalky, not plump and juicy. The sourcing agent here should ask Viva Arepas where they get their wonderful shrimp. Our pasta course was a tiny bowl of tasteless pasta for way too much money. Not sure what that was about. Prosciutto plate was also kinda bland and didn't pack a flavorful punch.  Service was great and the view of the strip was wonderful from the 2/3 floor.

aPZ6AjI_omXq_OKPn4RUHA.text: Absolutely love this place. We went for lunch on a weekday. Everything is delicately flavored and beautifully presented.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gyjS7zV5GEeBtzgFa2HnIg.text: We were in Vegas for my friend's bachelor party.  He goes to Giada's every time he is up there with his fiance, and he always raves about it.  So we decided that our big dinner night would be at Giada's.  We sit down and get our drink orders in.  The ambiance is nice, if a little too dim.  The waiter comes by and takes our orders.  After about 10 minutes, our appetizers come out. Taste: above average to delicious Portion: small, as expected from that type of establishment Price: pricey for the amount and type of appetizers, but again, expected.  We finish our appetizers and wait for our main course.  The waiter comes by once after 10 minutes to tell us that he checked in the kitchen and that the food is almost ready.  I finally get a refill on my water at this point.  After another 30 minutes, our food finally comes out.  During this entire time, our waiter never showed up once to give any explanation as to the delay in our order, or to refill anything.  I had an empty glass of water the entire time.  By the time our food came out, everything was lukewarm to cold.  My friend had the $30 spaghetti which was cold, and my $56 rack of lamb was barely warm at best.  To top it off, the only flavor on my lamb was from the seasoned crust, as the rest of the meat was bland.  By this point, we wanted nothing more than to get out of that place.  To try to save some dignity, my friend told us that we need to order the cookies.  It's $12 for 2 lemon cookies, 1 chocolate chip, and 1 brownie type of cookie.  Really????  You would expect some amazing cookies, but there was nothing special about them.  If you want cookies, go to Mrs. Fields.  Or buy some Chips Ahoy from the market.  It's money better spent.  The staff offered no apologies or explanation or anything.  We were given our food, our check, and that was that.  Needless to say, my friend (the bachelor) was extremely embarrassed by the service given, especially since he was the one who insisted we eat at Giada.  The remaining 6 of us were highly unimpressed with both the food and service, especially the service.  If you're gonna spend about $100 per person on a dinner, go somewhere else where they will treat you like a customer.  It's sad really, as we had such expectations, but I doubt any of us will ever set foot in that establishment again.

mfHPhX02xyxWZELf9oxGtQ.text: Within 2 days we had 2 dinners and a lunch here and all the food we ordered was amazing! Best caprese I've ever had! The pastas were so good I don't know how I can eat any other pasta from anywhere else. All the flavors are so well balanced. My favorite drink is the serpico. I can drink those all night long! And the service is so excellent!
