rsi5EyByvlKVfoEYD6Huvw.text: Molto Bene! Giada has outdone herself! The restaurant is so gorgeous with one of the best views on the strip, lots of windows!! You can see the Bellagio water fountains which is amazing, request a table with a view.  The restaurant is located upstairs at the Cromwell Hotel and Casino. This hotel is brand spanking new, extraordinary clean and sparkly! We walked in to Giada's and it was like we were in Italy. There  were beautiful cases filled with cheeses, olives and meats, a brick oven with breads and pizza's and a bustling fun open kitchen. The ambiance was very invited, warm with gorgeous soft colors.  The dishes were authentic Italian and scrumptious. We shared her chicken cacciatore and it was incredible. I am a super fan of Giada and have been following her for years, this restaurant is incredible. You won't be disappointed!

Tq-lQYSlZEzzUmi46cQGMA.text: Nice ambiance and bar with good service.  Every cook has their special tone and flavor profile and I just don't jive with Giada who I love on TV and at the Garlic Festival she attended last year.  The best charred Octopus I have had ( tried many) was in Pismo Beach at the Oyster Loft - and I have not found an "excellent" version since.  Giada was close but way too much of an acid profile - with a little sweetness from mandarin Oranges.  She uses Soux Vide techniques but the Octopus was still a bit rubbery for me and not enough char.  The beauty at Oyster loft is a glazed orange butter marinade during cooking and then various flavors of hot peppers, garlic and acid from blistered cherry tomatoes and the orange.  Anyway, Giada did not match up.

BOXcWRbZUEgoar81GmbdKw.text: This place started off shaky for me as we made reservations for a bday celebration and requested a window seat. When we got there, the person asked the couple that just came in before me if they had a reservation and when they said no, were seated immediately.  A party of six then came up and they overlooked me to seat them, again no reservations. So I then finally get asked and tell them we have a reservation. She looks it up and tells me it will be about a 10 minute wait. What???  I go sit down and a few minutes later she comes to get us.  We are seated at one of the worst window tables up against the billing ordering station and directly in the sun. We asked to be moved and it's like a major ordeal. The restaurant wasn't even partly full.  Then we open our cloth napkins and they have clearly been used.  No special service or mention of the birthday although this was noted in the reservation  The food was good and that's why they got the rating they did from me.  C'mon Giada, you need to monitor your namesake restaurant for better service and customer care.

9nKqiiaaj--NdwgRxyl1-A.text: I'm not really sure why so many reviews aren't so great. I had an awesome experience here, and I'm picky!  It's the perfect place for a girls dinner, or date night. Lively atmosphere, and loved the decor. So fun!  Here's what we ate:  Bread- they bring bread to the table that was amazing. Lots of nice enhancers like sea salt, red pepper flakes and basil oil. Yum! Sauteed mushrooms- nice flavor and good assortment  White trout crostini(nice flavor) Bacon wrapped sausage stuffed dates(order these!!!)  Lemon crema spaghetti with shrimp Brussels sprouts(out of sight delicious)  Service was spot on. We had a really fun and knowledgeable waiter, she was very professional and nice.   We also shared a bottle of wine, there was a nice wine list. Check total for 2 was $180, which I thought was reasonable.   In summary, it's a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trout( I think) crostini

5ssKQdC_0Dr91qUJKPoX_g.text: Delicious.  Valentino, our waiter was attentive yet not pushy.  The cheese board was perfection, and the Spaghetti and lobster ravioli were amazing. Also - the complementary bread was so delicious.  It completely exceeded our expectations.

xEXVWkYduiEYYVJoLW4N_Q.text: I was in Vegas on a business trip so grabbed a seat at the bar at Giada, honestly not expecting too much. I was totally wrong. The service was great and the food was fantastic. I had the eggplant parmigiana and the mushroom pizette - it was filling and tasted great. Topped off with a glass of red for a great evening out.

63T-_3GPA7Fy2Kc9Up9PJQ.text: Atmosphere is fantastic. I sat at the bar to eat but the view by the window seats looked awesome. Ordered the spaghetti, which was to die for and the chocolate tart for dessert. Definitely didn't disappoint! Will be back next time I visit Vegas!

8PHEuZZNSiT3us67BDruJQ.text: I would say Giada for brunch isn't particularly unique or special, but the food was yummy and the view of the strip was awesome. We got a table right up front with view of Bellagio fountain and Caesars palace.    I have the tasting menus and my husband ordered a la cart.  For the tasting menu I was not especially excited about the antipasti, I was a little disappointed but it was still good. However I absolutely love love loved the Salmon cake Benedict. The poached eggs were cooked perfectly. The sour toast was amazing for soaking up all the gooey goodness. Finally the souffle was a perfect ending.   My husband ordered the wood fired mushrooms, which was good, but again nothing special. The lobster roll and arugula salad were yummy and a nice entree.   The wait staff were very attentive and were fast and great when ever we had a special request (lowering the screen to block sun, bring lemon for sparkling water).   They also brought mini Brownies and pastry to munch on. We had so much food and didn't want to fill up on them so we just had a little taste at the restaurant. They bagged them up for us and made great morning snacks in the hotel room.   The one complaint we had was one of the glasses for the water had a bit of an eggy smell. The lemon fixed that, but it was a little annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Bellagio fountains.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of Caesars palace.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy yummy soufflé.

E10N0vb7GveTOTo2dVrNcg.text: The atmosphere and the view are the only reason this place gets two stars! The food was absolutely not worth the money! The scallops smelled terrible and the pasta was dry and cold, we have eaten in many restaurants in Las Vegas, so I can definatley say this is not a good place if you are hungry!!

WXdStEuLZU3ytkxHZUb3cg.text: Very disappointing My wife and the whole office is here today traveling from AZ. After searching where to get a dinner ad part of our party, whole office. The waiter spilled water to my wife soaking her to her underwear and all they say is "could I bring you MORE towels". They said it'a not a big deal it's just water. Sorry folks but you need to bring your raincoats to go to this restaurant.

6POV_wH1nEb3I9qY6oKuRA.text: We walked in on a whim on a Tuesday night and got a table within 10 minutes, even thought the restaurant was busy. Off to a great start, since we've been wanting to try Giada's for some time now.  THE GREAT: the FRITTO MISTO  (fried calamari and shrimp) was the most tender I've had in a restaurant, and the sauce served with it was delicate and complimented the seafood perfectly.  THE DUCK PROSCIUTTO melts in your mouth and comes with two mustards and crisp apple slices...it is amazing around the apple.   THE RISOTTO comes with two seared scallops and is cooked in a creamy seafood sauce, simply delicious.  THE RAVIOLI is stuffed with cheese and topped off with a great meat sauce; I wish I had that recipe!   THE MEDIOCRE: the bacon wrapped dates were good but a little too sweet for my taste ( I know, should've expected it by ordering dates).   The destroyer cocktail was more like an expensive tequila shot than a nice drink, you can't really taste any of the fruit through the tequila.   All in all, a great dinner and a wonderful atmosphere with bey helpful and sweet staff. We will be coming back and definitely getting that fritto misto again!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In the back- bacon wrapped dates. Then the plate of fritto misto AKA the best calamari you will ever have! Followed by the dipping sauces
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bread offering and a selection of dipping sauces and spices

xa6myr0l8JVqbllbU354Ng.text: Thouroughly disappointing. I love Giada's show & cookbooks but her restaurant is sub par.  The decor & location was beautiful but we actually like good food too! The bartenders were rude & did us a favor making our drinks.  The waiter was bizarre, a cross between Lurch from The Addams Family & Marty Feldman's character from Young Frankenstein.  That really wouldn't have bothered me had he been helpful & attentive but he was dismissive & aloof.  The table shared a meager pizzette that was good but way too small. When we ordered it at the bar, it never came.  The bartender blamed us for not telling him which one we wanted but the digital bar menu on iPads just stated Pizzette without explanation.  They finally brought the Pizzette Margarita to the table after we were seated.  My husband & I shared a Cesar salad, when brought I asked if that was the whole order or half because it looked like a three bite salad.  It turned out to be the entire salad & was just ok, nothing special.  My husband ordered the chicken cacciatore which turned out out to be a heavily breaded fried chicken (more bread, little chicken) which was over cooked & almost inedible.  I ordered the vegan eggplant dish which sounded great as described on the menu.  Turned out, the eggplant was chewy due to being under cooked & the flavors were heavy.  Our dinner companions order the branzino which they told us they enjoyed.  Bread & flat bread crackers were good. Dessert menu was lackluster. Giada.....get it together.  Hire wait staff who are actually helpful.  Supervise your kitchen. Maybe then you will have a noteworthy restaurant!

1znrHpmOyjxwnIqyHx737Q.text: Omg! A must go. My friend and I went for the "Brunch Tasting" menu. Well worth it. Deviled eggs are to die for, I got the chicken and waffles and this is not just your ordinary chicken and waffles. The herbs in the chicken makes the meal soooooo tasty. I just love the way everything was served. The waiter was awesome. We decided not to get unlimited mimosas but it is only $30 if you decide. Our meals each were $45 and its great cause you get the starters, meal, and dessert. The lemon raspberry macaroons are so delicious and so was the chocolate Eiffel Tower. The place is so fancy but affordable. Another great thing I loved is that there is a photo booth in waiting area and you get free photos!!!!!!! Loved it! Will definitely be returning my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZiVcqYswkbMAFEFb33kYQ.text: My wife claims this was the best brunch she has ever had. Okay, maybe not "best" for me, but it was definitely up there.  Amazing service (after a very short debacle with our reservations that was quickly resolved); fair prices; terrific, fresh ingredients; great view and location and overall a beautiful restaurant.   Not sure why this restaurant is getting so much hate from people because "Giada isn't a real chef" - who cares? How often do you go to an amazing restaurant NOT owned by a chef? A LOT. She's a hell of a business woman that employs amazing chefs, cooks and restaurant managers. You think Mario Batali is the one cooking your steak at Carnevino? Riiight...

LLhR7Ewd5hSoNyqhEqqAvg.text: I came even after seeing mixed reviews. I'm glad I did. Everything was delish. I had eggplant and lobster ravioli. It was a splurge price wise but worth it for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z02w3kpOxJiB9NdMWyASjA.text: Looking at this place from the outside, you already know you are going to get a classic dining experience. Coming in did not disappoint. First, they have a fun complimentary photo booth for customers waiting or after a meal. Such a great concept!   Second, the staff at Giada is pure quality. They take care of you while making you feel respected. They are so polite it's unreal.   Lastly, the food is so delectable. Most of the time when going into fancy restaurants you don't expect much from the food because it's just supposed to be good. Giada really tastes like home. The recipes,  tastes, and flavors that go into making this delicious food is quality.   If you're looking for a quality experience that will remind you of home, Giada is a must!

aN27HHwWDTkOEZUGH0udiQ.text: Loved the food and the atmosphere! We were seated with a very lovely view of the strip. The service was great! I'd highly recommend getting reservations because it gets very busy. It's a great place for a nice dinner.

x62C4N3iK5MqTTtMgvE2dA.text: Love love love! This restaurant is amazing, from the food to the service. Nancy was our server and was wonderful! This place is a Vegas must.

kp0Zb-8-xfXfxL664FCkpA.text: omg we waited months for reservations and we are not dissappointed the atmospher and staff are amazing,,   couldnt ask for more  thank you guys and gals for making a great night for me and my businesss partner, we havent been out for a long time because of opening our cafe

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all us

hxZixiL2YbywJcCxmJ8mag.text: It was delicious. The tasting menu was a little pricey so we made our own. Artichoke arancini, chicken and wild mushroom meatballs, homemade sausage and piquillo pepper pizette, white jumbo shrimp lasagna and spicy framed corn and sausage with happy birthday cookies at the end. The cookies were some of the best I have had and all the rest was very very tasty. $110 for two people with tax and tip. Great for a special occasion!!

v_-06AJ_tFijQ-WF_cJFvg.text: Giada's Clean decor & even better executed dining. Perfect your Italian enunciation! Sit at the window for the Bellagio fountain view. Comp basil, and make sure you check the crocks at the bread station. There's no question about it go with a friend, companion, cougar, groupie, sugar daddy or mommy. The tasting menu sounds good, but one should order the spaghetti lemon basil concoction whilst the other orders the ribeye with a pregame anchovies and ask for the pea pesto.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VJOpNk4xhlB1GJZ2ASK12g.text: I can't really judge on Giada's Italian entree food.  We wanted to grab a bite and drink early, so sat at the bar.  The bartender was great!  Super friendly, knowledgable about the food and drinks, made us some special crafty ones after our meal.  We were starting out the New Year with the Ol' eat healthy, but slipped in the drinking department.  We had the beet salad, very fresh and light, the brussel sprout crostini, good but not amazing. Also enjoyed the Giardiniera (marinated pickled vegetables and olives).  The place was pretty busy and like all restaurants in a hotel on the strip, expect a bit pricey.  I'd go again and hang out at the bar and grab a bite, but not sure if I would want to do a proper sit down dinner there.  It is a little over hyped.

_XBF_sSb7pa_cOdwXTg1Jw.text: The Worst. Just because it's owned by a so called " Celebrity Chef " doesn't mean you should charge such outrageous prices and serve less than an appetizer portion.  Will never go back. Olive Garden beats it by far.

7dfxsryJY68gFr1CIi1Gyg.text: Don't come here hungry. Not only is the service disappointing, but food is extremely overpriced and the portions are only a spoonful. Waited 30 minutes after our reservation.. sat down waited for our food for about an hour and finished my $28.00 meal in less than 5 minutes.

SbGD5BGG55KrnSQfTxv-4Q.text: Let me preface by saying I'm a huge fan.  She's really the only chef/FN star I've followed and  made many recipes from, so naturally was eagerly anticipating her restaurant opening.   First visit was one year ago (party of 2).  We were seated at bar even though we had reservations.  No problem.  Ordered a signature cocktail which was delicious and was seated a short time later.  The waitress explained the menu a bit and suggested we order "at least 3 or more plates", as we were thoroughly made aware each dish was for 1-2 people.  I had caught a glimpse of the dessert cart upon arrival and wanted to be sure to save room for some.  But since the waitress was insistent we order said number of plates, we obliged.  The food was good, however, as expected, I was near full and decided to pass on dessert.  Oh well, next time!  Second visit:  party of 6.  My daughter wanted to go for her bday, since she heard I'd enjoyed it the first time.  I made reservations (forgetting to request a window view, darn) and tried to recall the menu to accommodate for 3x as many people.  Entire party were family members, already knowing their palate and also knowing none of us were 'starving' and it being a later dinner (8pm) - I figured we'd order more plates than on my first visit and all would be 'okay'.  Wrong!  When our waiter arrived I immediately informed him I'd dined before but the rest of my party had not, and if he could refresh my memory and/or make suggestions.  He began to rattle off so much stuff, saying something about the menu changing from my previous visit... and now dessert was only offered with the....who knows what he said...basically he ended on the mention of their...I'll call it 'prix-fixe menu'.  At $120 a head! Uhhh...I was unprepared.  And now, totally confused!  As previously mentioned, none of us in the party were that hungry, especially for some of the items he'd mentioned....like lamb (yuck).  And since I was picking up the tab, I also wasn't prepared for that heft of a bill.  To make a long story short, he walked away, leaving us to quickly decide what we wanted.  It was obvious he was expecting that we go with his suggestion above and instead, we ordered  what WE wanted to eat - several appetizers, a couple salads and pasta dishes.  He seemed annoyed with us, saying it wouldn't be enough food, shrugged his shoulders several times and pretty much set the tone for the rest of our meal (can you say 'awkward'?)   I guess it wasn't obvious on my first visit that they really try to SELL each and every dish and drink at Giada's.  After this second visit, not sure I'll return.  The food is good, don't get me wrong, but unless $$$$ (and yes, you should really change that to 4 instead of 3) is no object to spend for a larger party, I suggest trying it as a party of 2 (if you're a really big fan and must fulfill your bucket list). Oh, and for my daughter's bday, they brought out a large platter with 'Happy Birthday' written in chocolate (3/4 of the plate) with 2 small cookies on the remaining quarter.  It was too embarrasing to take a photo of, so we didn't :/

dk7VVBnrZR_LRhhL7tVMow.text: Overpriced for less than mediocre food. The pasta at the Spice Market buffet at Planet Hollywood was better than this place. The Orzo meatballs were so dry and bland. Not good. The gnocchi wasn't any better. It didn't taste like anything. The grilled chicken that was added to the gnocchi was super dry as well. Save your money. Don't come here. You're better off making pasta at home than pay and eat here. The one thing that was good was the mimosa. I've wanted to try this place since it opened, now I just regret it.

RU_VDtd5wxawVmrK-LurNw.text: I dined at Giada's on Aug. 9th by myself and on Aug, 12th with my BFF who flew in from Nashville for the weekend. I am not a Giada fangirl but the menu and photos of the restaurant made it one of my must try in LV. On my first visit I sat at the bar and was lucky enough to have Katy as my server. I was a little overwhelmed because the restaurant was gorgeous and there were so many items on the menu I wanted to try. I started with a lovely glass of Prosecco and started with the Fritto Misto while I decided on dinner. I've read other reviews about the Fritto Misto and agreed: not very good. Seafood was ok but no flavor to breading or the aioli... disappointing. For dinner I decided on the Risotto with crab and scallops based on the recommendation from the gentleman sitting next to me...he ate the whole dish and said it was delish! I enjoyed it as well, although I prefer my scallops with a hard sear but that's just a personal preference. No room for desert! Second visit with my BFF, we had table reservations but went early and sat at the bar for a drink. My BFF went with my suggestion to forgo the table and to have dinner with Katy and Bo at the bar...we loved it! We chose the tasting menu and an appetizer to share since we wanted to try so many dishes. We started with the bruschetta with burrata, balsamic strawberry reduction and avocado. It was delicious! The bread service with dinner is one of the best I've ever had (and I was in the restaurant business for most of my life) with 2 types of breads and 5 garnish options. From the Tasting Menu: we enjoyed all the appetizers but the steak bruschetta was our least favorite offering. Second course we opted for the Bucatini with regular Pomodoro instead of spicy because my BFF doesn't like spicy. It was delicious but I would definitely try it spicy next time. Next course was the Filet Mignon with crispy polenta, lemon smashed potatoes and corn stuffing. The filet was cooked beautifully and we were having trouble finishing everything but it was so delicious we kept eating! Then came desert god Josh with a bowl containing one serving each of: peach Bellini sorbet, white coffee, and chocolate gelato. We loved every flavor but the white coffee was my fave. Then Josh came around with the dessert cart: While making each other laugh I choose the fudge bar, then he said "What else?" I gave my friend the next pick but Josh said to me,"You're not hearing me..what else do you want???" I seriously couldn't believe him but chose the raspberry chocolate cake. Then Josh turns to my BFF and asks her the same thing: she choose the raspberry tiramisu and the lemon mousse tart. I am a tiramisu connoisseur and hate when people mess with the recipe but I have to say...this raspberry tiramisu was spot on! Tasty, light, and creamy. We finished the ice cream bowl but had to bring the rest of the desserts back to the hotel. When I asked Bo for take out utensils he searched high and low for them but they were not to be found. No problem we said...then we were halfway down the escalator then Bo was suddenly behind us with take out utensils he was able to find. What a gentleman! So will I visit this restaurant again? Definitely... and I would give 6 stars for Katy and Bo's service alone!

i0k4FV7nFQOoiDlk8KFe5Q.text: Restaurant is amazing!. The view of the strip is incredible while you eat.   Request a window seat and go just before sunset.  We had the tasting menu. The bill came to $350 for 2 people and one drink each. That includes tip.    The food was good but not $350 good.  Service was incredible!.   The staff was very attentive and friendly.      Seating when we arrived was a bit slow and unorganized.   The hostess had to find the people waiting for a table.   That part  could have been smoother.  Overall a good experience but the tasting menu was overpriced.

i0COFUKBAqkMvzVv6I3q6A.text: Most of the reviews about this place are pretty accurate. The food is amazing. The wait time is a little long. The view, if you can get a window seat, is beautiful. Our waitress was so nice and extremely helpful.   My husband and I ate here on Christmas day and the place was packed. I doubt you will get in without a reservation. We initially got seated in the back by the bar but we asked the hostess to move us by the window and she did.   The wait time was a little long but I think it's because the place is crazy busy. It did take us awhile to get some bread.   We ordered some wine and the mozzarella to start. It was delicious! The appetizer menu is huge so there are a lot of options. My husband ordered the surf and turf and he says it's one of the best things he's ever eaten. I ordered the risotto with the scallops. The risotto was a bit too buttery for me but if you like your risotto creamy and buttery you will like it. The scallops were cooked just right though, seared on the outside but soft when you cut into it. Perfect! The crab inside the risotto was very flavorful but not too overpowering. I would definitely recommend it.   We would eat here again and I recommend this place but make a reservation! Also, order some appetizers because there are wonderful options and the main dishes are not very big so you will not get stuffed.   Enjoy!

ExyUgd3qWmzYyjadO133Gw.text: Food & waiter was great but didn't have a good experience with seating. We called for reservations & the only thing was after 9:30. We requested for seating by the window since the view was raved about online which we were told if we come 15 mins later (a 9:45 dinner) we would get it. Nope we walked in and was told they "would try" but we did not get window seats. We got the farthest seats with no so great of a view. The entire night we saw multiple good tables empty. I eventually was so frustrated I asked to talk to the manager who was not nice or apologetic. Annoyed.

WnS2g-y5m-d-HAfMzK1jJg.text: Stephanie, at Giadas The Cromwell... she's the bomb.  We had brunch over Valentine's weekend.  My friend has dietary restrictions.  She made sure everything was perfect and we both left feeling that we had a fabulous brunch. It's a must on your Vegas Vacation!

vCdH4KYkVtDxyb14OhZSXA.text: In terms of food quality, Giada's was highly enjoyable. The chicken Marsala meatballs to start were small in quantity but great tasting. I had the spaghetti and it was amazing, however I did not give 5 stars because the price was a bit much for a pasta dish and the serving sizes were not very large which was expected.

0DQRojoZZcQjj8vMVg8lnw.text: The server was incredibly stuck up and rude, treating us more like he deserved to be waited on than us.  We were seated for a late dinner around 9:45 and were rushed into ordering because the kitchen closed at 10:30.  For this price, why would you seat people when they cannot order at a comfortable pace?  They were also out of a few dishes that we very much wanted to try.  The food was unique and delicious, but not up to the level that the prices and atmosphere would suggest.  I enjoyed the food, but it was nothing compared to what I have experienced at similarly priced restaurants.

n_nCfXULYU4O_gAhUzVQUA.text: Came here for dinner. Fantastic food, superb service, great space! They happily accommodated my nut allergy by helping me navigate the menu and communicated with me about food preparation -- this level of service was so greatly appreciated. EVERYTHING we had was delicious -- some of our favorites are listed below:  Citrus Marinated Calamari Lobster Arancini Spaghetti Veal Chop Saltimbocca Tiramisu

HgTwh0anv_hRrAac8FdsmA.text: Good ambience and vibe... i was expecting more from the menu and more from the favors of the food.  I wasn't overly impressed.

CWcu_YjMq499Z3ftwom3mw.text: First and foremost: GET THE POLENTA WAFFLES.  The texture is soft on the inside, crisp on the outside, unlike some other waffles where it is so hard it cuts the roof of your mouth. The fruit is stunningly fresh. My husband got a traditional breakfast with outstanding potatoes (it was the only thing I could snag before he devoured his entire breakfast). The hours start at 8am at the bar, 9am dining room. Excellent service with Molly at the bar. This is a total rewards property, don't forget to show your card and get points!

UVih2XkfVfMBxf4xZfoJYg.text: I expected quite a bit more from a restaurant that has Giada's name on it. Our server made us feel more like an inconvenience rather than a guest.  He made no suggestions and was no help at all when it came to the menu or what we should order. The bread dish that they served had little dishes with condiments in them and they were all cracked and chipped.  They were out of the one dish my husband wanted to try, the lobster ravioli, and it was early in the night. The food was so-so, appetizers were good but the Veal Saltimbocca was just a large veal chop put on a plate that was brown, mushy and very unappetizing.  The plate had nothing else on it, no garnish, nothing. We left very unfulfilled and will never recommend or try any of her restaurantsin the future.

ezkzyq54jxWuhhOibQhYUw.text: I had heard that Giada De Laurentiis, the famous cooking TV personality, had opened a restaurant at The Cromwell and was mildly interested.  Then, when an article appeared in the Parade Magazine and both my mother and my sister became overly curious, I made a reservation.  And finally, weeks later, it was my turn to experience the divine.  We went in thinking we would get a few things and share.  Soon we were ordering the tasting menu and wine pairing complete with an autographed photo, souvenir menu and recipe cards.  I guess you could say we were "all in," in poker parlance.  We began with the Antipasti:  Bacon Wrapped Dates (with spicy Italian sausage  gorgonzola crema), Vitello Tonanato (veal loin, seared tuna, caper aioli), and Baby Sweet Peppers (with goat cheese and olive tapenade).  Second:  Pasta (Rigatoni with vegetable Bolognese).  Third:  Salmon (pan roasted with summer succotash & whole grain mustard).  Dessert:  Banana ice cream, Chocolate ice cream, chocolate chip cookies, etc.--the nice man brought the cart and I wanted some of everything!  And he was a willing co-conspirator.   The dining room is absolutely LOVELY -- fantastic in every way, maybe the best dining room in Las Vegas, and that is saying something.  Added to that, it sits kitty corner to the Bellagio and the dancing waters, which are magical to watch.  The table was a tad small.  A good thing for conversation but a bad thing for all the food and wine we ordered; we averaged three glasses of wine each on the table at any one time. Service was at a comfortable, relaxed pace. The whole time we felt like guests who were welcome to stay all night. The service was spectacular and the Manager went out of his way to greet every single customer.  The first salmon they brought me was stinky and overcooked.  They whisked it away and brought me another that was positively wonderful.  The wine-lady, Theresa did a good job, up until the point where she paired a $5 Nero d'Avala with the Salmon -- a total no-no.   Otherwise, her pairings were classic, just what you'd find if you consulted one of those phone apps.  The coffee was strong, but of good quality.  Seems that all these restaurants serve something called an Americano--espresso with some hot water added -- the stuff will stop your heart, after it races away.   All-in-all the experience was outstanding -- Andrew and Nick did a great job of keeping it all well-paced and us well-fed and well-attended to.  At the end of the meal they give you a mini-ipad with your bill to fill out a survey, I think that is a bad idea because the time that it takes to do the survey could be used to turn the table over and get the waiting guests inside.  This is the kind of place that you want to go to at 5pm, if your reservation is for anytime after 7 you WILL WAIT! I have seen a lot of very critical reviewing of this place out there in cyberspace and in print.  I get some of it, but I think a lot of it is just unfair.  If you want spaghetti and meatballs, this is NOT the place to go.  But if you want a meal of well thought out quality food, cooked perfectly and FOR YOU, then this is a very worthy place.  Good for you Giada I wish you well!  At $550 for two, out the door, I don't think I'll be back soon, unless I can find a sponsor!

Tw7MXb7r6KL24DRf29sCyA.text: Food was as expected: memorable. The warm homey feeling of the decor is palpable and the design details, from the silverware  to the open spaces, are really taken care of. Bar service needs a heads up. I had a sitting space at the bar corner because the restaurant was booked, so the hostess offer me this option and I said it was ok. But I had to ask for menu, wine list, water, dessert menu, etc... Bar tenders were never rough, but they have to work on a better personalized experience. Max, who brought me the bread, was outstanding and very thorough in his speech. He certainly set the mood for the rest of my stay there. Overall experience was very good.

GcTTVmAwJ5KX4imRROaRyw.text: We were super excited to try this place and went without a reservation at about 11:30am.  The polite hostesses told us to come back in about a half an hour, which was no problem - I assumed the restaurant would be crowded and busy, as it just opened.  When we returned, we waited a little longer, then were seated near the bar.  The restaurant has an amazing view of the strip, but we couldn't see anything from our table.  The restaurant was about half empty, leading me to believe this was more of a soft open - I know they haven't been open for lunch long.  Service was very friendly.  I had the Prosecco sangria, which was delicious, and we had some fantastic chicken meatballs.  The bread they brought out at the beginning of the meal was absolutely wonderful, though a bit greasy. I was very disappointed to see that there was only one pasta dish on the menu for lunch - I thought for sure Giada was famous for her delicious pasta dishes!  I couldn't order the baked pasta, as it contains pork, so I went for the lemon pesto grilled cheese, served with spiralized zucchini and potatoes.  It was quite good, but it took a really, really long time to come out.  Like, probably 40 minutes.  It's a grilled cheese!  We were getting pretty antsy - not to mention hungry - and we prefer spending our time wandering around Vegas, not sitting in a booth.  My husband ordered the muffeletta sandwich, a wedge of bread with various cured meats.  We later realized this sandwich is premade and is sitting with the antipasto items in the front deli case area.  Why did it take 40 minutes to put a premade sandwich on a plate with salad?  He found the bread somewhat soggy, likely because it's premade.  It didn't take long after we left the restaurant for my husband to start to feel ill and nauseous; he ended up out of commission the rest of the day.  I'm not sure how long the sandwiches were sitting in the case, but it might have been just a touch too long.  He had not eaten anything else that day save a banana, and he hadn't had anything to drink but water.  The wait staff was very kind and attentive every step of the way.  However, it appears that they just haven't worked out lunch yet.  I would not return.

PkuJt-ySnLxn7iZhlrtT7w.text: Great overall experience.  The bearer was knowledgeable and was able to help and recommend dishes when we were in a bind.  Starting from the sweet stuffed peppers and the burratta with balsamic salt,  we had the pizette, then followed up  with the soup and the the main entree before the dessert.  Every serving was delectable and tasty.    The espresso dessert was just awesome.

oUssM13k15VvhDAmGv6rNw.text: Don't miss this place. We will be back every time. The food was exceptional. The only problem is we wanted every menu item. If you leave disappointed it's not their fault, it's yours.

j0Os_VlSG_6psW87fNOZPA.text: Visiting Giada's restaurant was high on my list for my first Vegas trip.  Traveling by wheelchair, I was initially thwarted from the goal because floor level entry through the casino was by steps.  A tip from my hotel's bellhop sent me up the valet entrance where access was possible.  The restaurant was beautifully appointed and welcoming.  The views of the area out the big windows was spectacular (Bellagio fountains, Caesars).  A romantic and classy spot.  The windows were open but had to be closed due to windy conditions for those sitting near them.  (The bathroom was lovely, too!)  There was a high traffic volume for the restaurant making the seating and serving impersonal and infrequent.  There was some large party noise keeping this from being a peaceful retreat.  Menu looked yummy.  I chose a summer minestrone soup and a caponata for a light lunch.  The minestrone was divine--perfectly diced and equally sized veggies in a meat broth with a touch of parmesan melted as an accent.  Well-balanced flavors.  Sadly, the $10 soup was far less than a cup and gone quickly.  I guess you pay for the chef's name and not food volume.   The waitress described the caponata as a rough-cut hummus.  It was actually a rough cut eggplant with other little goodies like pine nuts and raisins.  It was good but served with only 3 small toast points.  There was plenty of the caponata left which I ate with a spoon.  I think Giada could've spared 2 more toast points (they called it "lavash") on this small tasting dish of $9.    While others had dainty desserts, I was never offered a dessert menu and left without.   While I deem the ambiance 5-star (my favorite location in all of Vegas) and the flavors 5-star, I left feeling a little jipped in service and still hungry after $24 of food/tip.  I would certainly go back for a second experience with her food and perhaps some meatier options on the menu.

cYoBuME8exbO-YaiV3Jv6w.text: Have eaten here several times since it opened. It was great!  Life got busy, second to last time was October. Wish I would of taken pics to compare what we were served on a few days ago.   Things have changed here. Not for the better. Now its become a tourist trap. The lobster rolls use to be huge here. I'm talking 'OMG that is all for me, pearl clutching, watch me inhale this sucker', kind of huge. What I was served the other day was half the size, regular white bread instead of brioch (sp). And they jacked the price up $6.00 to $35.00!   We were so disappointed in what the place has become we never got dessert. And we won't go back. Business takes us to the strip about once a week. We eat often down there. There are so many great places that like locals, it just became a little easier where not to go.

RM-xisnnIoSXzrszVkrkaw.text: First, let me say that the bacon-wrapped, sausage-stuffed dates were one of the best things I have ever tasted state-side. Also, all of the staff greeted us when passing when we arrived, walked around, and left.  However: 1. This is the first time I had to use a knife to cut shrimp. The texture was very rubbery as if it were not fully cooked through. I love shrimp, but I couldn't stomach it. 2. The photo booth was not printing out photos for some reason. The response of the hostess was, "It's out of ink. You can use the email photo." Then she walked away. She said this to us and one other couple. She didn't offer to change the ink or inform us that she couldn't change the ink. No solution offered. It would have been a nice souvenir for my girlfriend and I. And the camera had something wrong with it - the photo we did email has a big frosty blur, as if there was a smudge on the lens. 3. The server was very friendly, but I think that he was trying too hard. He seemed more concern with getting positive feedback for the restaurant that being sincerely friendly and helpful. 4. The desserts...left much to be desired.  Giada, I think you're awesome and we were so looking forward to visiting, so I was very sad to have a less than stellar experience at your restaurant while in Vegas. :(

G0FTWui2Za-H43ZsYbCnDg.text: Getting a reservation here was a little hard, but it was worth eating dinner at 10:15. The ambiance is great and very comfortable. The decor is classy as well, don't order too much!

qcNYPzdW8IqRgdAXL0vfCQ.text: My gf took me here for the opening and for our anniversary! It was amazing and we got to meet Giada the first time! The meatballs and bucatini were my favorites! She got shrimp and asparagus which was perfection as well! Definitely the best date place in town!

GJSVYT5oPuFYohJEVdtl4A.text: Let me preface this review with some commentary on a local "critic's", well, I guess, "pre-emptive" review in which he basically denounced all things Giada, pretty much predicated on her fame. I'd suggest the real motive behind it is her fame and his lack thereof, at least beyond the usual, incestual, self-aggrandizing LV "foodie" circles. My guess is he got to meet her (probably about three bottles into an early afternoon, knowing him) at any one of a half dozen food/ wine bacchanals across the U.S. and failed to impress her with his LV notoriety.  On to the subject at hand- the eponymous Giada at the re-opened and renovated Cromwell (formerly Bills, nee The Barbary Coast). While my not-so-esteemed hobby-critic non-professional is correct in his observance that the very affable Ms. de Laurentiis has never operated a restaurant, she does have a very real passion for food that her experience on the Food Network has translated into a somewhat new breed of culinary experience. As for how that translates into a commercial culinary operation, well, based on my experience, she's got the bulk of it figured out. Back to that later...  As far as the experience went, the room's very much like its namesake- beautiful, but not in the glamorous sense that pervades all things Vegas, more along the lines of the girl-next-door. Bright and airy, with clean lines, uncluttered space, and sparing us of overly-retro/ ironic furnishings and paint schemes, it's simply a breath of fresh air. The only knock here is the hokey "tour" of the counter space that fronts the open space of the kitchen. Better to let waiting guests explore on their own and have friendly staff ask them if they have any questions with an appropriate table-side follow up, which, based on the service I received, would be proficiently, if not charmingly, executed.  Beverage-wise (and all great meals' first course, IS a beverage, preferably somewhat strong drink), this place is in very capable mixological hands. My table sampled several of the cocktails which covered a broad spectrum of tastes and ingredients. Well-balanced and elegantly presented, they formed a great flavor canopy under which we stretched out, relaxed, and perused the bill of fare. Which, with much confidence, our server, whose name has, for the moment escaped me, handled ably as my dining companion proceeded to order from both sides of the menu (the left side being more small plate/ anti-pasti driven, while the right side features larger, heartier dishes), in the manner of a SWAT officer range-testing a new automatic weapon. As we awaited the various plates arrival, our sommelier approached. I informed her of the myriad and sundry plates on their way from the kitchen, and when she asked, "Do you want to go red or white?" , my response, hedonist that I wish I to be,  was, both.  As dishes arrived and were placed upon the table family style with well-enunciated descriptions, she returned with both, and they were perfect. A medium-light bodied white and similar red with bright acidity to keep flavors flowing and the flavors did just that- flowed deliciously. This is fresh, just off the garden style cooking, reminiscent of backyard-dining at family gatherings. Except this was Italian, unlike my family's tendency to flame-roasted flesh, potatoes, and fresh peas, regardless of season. Well, maybe the fresh peas regarded the season...  Anyway, from the charred octupus to arancini, the flavors were bright and straight-forward. The only miss was a soup that I'm quite sure had been the result of an improperly followed recipe. Call it the vulnerable moment that endeared me as I was happily overwhelmed by layers of excellence.  As the large plates arrived, I again beckoned the sommelier and asked her help along the same criteria, albeit with some bolder flavors and richer options, none of which missed the mark. I might add, she accomplished all of this with by-the-glass offerings. An aside- here's the True mark of a wine program- you should find every pairing you need for everything on the menu on their BTG list. It's really not all that hard. Anyway, the star of all those plates, and by "star" I mean Alpha Centauri compared to Vega, was the Lemon Spaghetti. Perfectly cooked, perfect texture, perfectly balanced, it resulted in much discussion at our table about our own recipes for such and a "throw-down" challenge, of which I am a part. I look forward to repeated research outings here...  Dessert too, was comfortable, fresh, and uncomplicated- a selection of great gelatos and some amazing chocolate cookies rounded it all out.  Which brings me back to my point about this being Ms. de Laurentiis' first go- it's all about passion and professionalism, only one of which can be learned, but both can be hired. This place is in very capable hands...

HCX4bgYGWMFJhrRW4T50cw.text: Location, location, location!   Had a wonderful dinner, at a cool, window seat al fresco, overlooking the Strip and the Bellaggio fountains.   The ambiance was smart and contemporary and while the food was delicious- it was not unique nor outstanding. The plates were all well dressed and delectable but all something we could find elsewhere.   Our server, Valentino, was well informed, fantastic and fun.    A smart choice but not the best contemporary  Italian experience for people from major markets with more Italian choices.

x5IM_XMgm9d6nxwqCp17mQ.text: So good....I know some reviews have been less than favorable but mine is all favorable. Outstanding service. The food....chicken meatballs were amazing. Chicken cacciatore...great. Dessert?  Oh my...so delicious. Can't wait to go back.

Hobx5ln1t_v9WpJTNQeV1A.text: Pricey, but all the food was delicious. Seemed like we had several different people throughout the night helping at our table. All were knowledgeable and kind. Definitely more for a special occasion. We went for NYE and it was $145pp for food and we did the wine pairings for $100pp just for an idea on prices.

O761GknYIRu77c-LJOr9Rg.text: We went for lunch. It started off shaky. We got to our reservation 25 minutes early, but they said they couldn't seat us until the time, so we left and came back on time. We still had to wait ten minutes after our reservation before we were sat. After seating we waited 10 more minutes and no one came by. No drinks, no menus, nothing. Not starting off to a good start. However they made up for it. The food was phenomenal!! The Gorgonzola  and mushroom anti pastas were amazing. The sausage pizza was good. The dessert, which was on the house for the wait was our of this world. Calling it the cookie plate did not do it justice. You get two of each: lemon ricotta, chocolate chip, and my favorite the chocolate peanut butter with blackberry jam.

oGgxgmgIZg8z3BTKRkrSww.text: The ambiance was a bit loud but the music was good. The complimentary bread was great and the side condiments were refreshing and delightful. The dank cheese platter was perfectly paired and was very rich and refreshing. The risotto was buttery, creamy, and had a great crunch. This place was perfect for a solo and group meal. The waiter was very nice and courteous to my menu changes and so were the chefs.

8khMG5HILcX-n-HtafV79g.text: Arrived on time, front reception staff very stiff, no smiles, not friendly at all, and did not explain there was a free photo booth there. Made us wait for 10-12 minutes in the front when there were many tables available. Waiter was friendly and helpful, a bit slow with service. Decor lovely, great view of strip if the shades are raised but at 4:30 they would not raise the shades claiming the sun or reflection would be too bright. We were there almost 2 hrs, no reflection or bright sun ever appeared (we could see under the mostly lowered shades) so no unobstructed view was ever made available.  Great selection of wines and interesting cocktail selections. Very good glasses of wine available in several styles. Now the bad news: the food. Restaurant had just opened for dinner and they were out of the grilled artichoke, which the waiter did not even know about until he turned in our order. How can you be out a dish on the permanent menu when you just open and the staff doesn't even know about it? Stuffed dates were dry, no sauce, 1st time in my 33 yrs of marriage my wife didn't love them! Salads were okay at best, pasta with vegetarian ragu was excellent, salmon okay, lemon shrimp pasta was 2 shrimp in house made spaghetti with a light lemon flavor. Not bad but for $26 way overpriced and only 2 shrimp. Not the knockout signature dish we were expecting or hoped for.  Lemon smashed potatoes were okay but would have been better had they been hot when served. Cheese plate nothing special. We are huge Giada fans and made 2 reservations here months in advance for our stay in Vegas, cancelled the 2nd after this meal.  Highlight of the meal: Limoncello souffle, we would come back for that dish alone. See my review on the best Italian meal we had at Mario Battali's place in the Venetian B&B Ristorante.

BSzt1iTxPPJNmwDcGeoDnA.text: I love Giada.  You can't hate her.  I mean, look at that smile!!  Major girl crush.  But, this isn't about her.  This about her restaurant.  I really gotta hand it to her.  Her menu and the setup of her restaurant reflects her consideration for her guests.  And isn't that what it's about? Treating your customers to something good, right? It's a beautiful restaurant and the food is pretty too.    We ordered a bunch of appetizers including proscuitto and the tricolor salad which were both very yummy.  We had also ordered a pizzette but it never came.  Apparently the kitchen lost our ticket, but we were getting too full to eat a pizza, so we didn't want it anyway.  The server handled it very well, apologizing to us for the mix-up, and was gracious enough to comp our dessert.  I ordered her signature cocktail, and I wasn't too into that either.  I'm not a drinker, so I'm not the person to ask for drink recommendations, but to me it was too strong and it reminded me of some type of cleaning fluid.  But doesn't all alcohol...?  I wasn't super impressed with the lobster ravioli or the rack of lamb.  There was no cheese in the ravioli! I'm not big on cheese either, but I think my husband assessed it fairly well when he said "It's like... a Chinese dumpling.  There's meat and juices wrapped in dough, but it's missing the part that makes it Italian."  As for the lamb, it was okay, but I think it could be less chewy.  For dessert, we had the little cheesecake with a blood orange sliver on top and the lemon cookie, chocolate chip cookie, and the chocolate brownie cookie.  The desserts were yummy indeed.  The man presenting the desserts, however, was a bit too honest when we asked him for his recommendation.  Here's how it went:  Us: Which one do you like? Man: Honestly? Nothing. After 8 months working here, nothing is good to me.  OOOOOOOK.  That guy should not be working there.  Although it was 11pm by the time we were ready for dessert, I wasn't expecting any of the staff to blatantly dissuade us from ordering anything.  But eh.  I still think the dessert was terrific.  Anyways.  Minus one star for the sad entrees, but I had a good time~!

IQJhe9ubXUgabH2hXx6E4Q.text: I really loved this restaurant.  It is beautifully decorated and the open air space on the strip was superb.  We had a reservation and were given a great table for lunch on good Friday.  I was excited to try this restaurant as I love Giada.  Hubby and I started by sharing the meatballs.  I gave them an 8.5, hubby a 7 (he felt they were a little drier than he would have liked and lacked browning).  Next we shared the margheritta pizza.  This we both gave a 9.  Excellent crust, cheese and the tomatoes were to die for.  Appeared to be sun dried in marinade and so yummy.  Unfortunately lunch had a turn for the worst, while eating alarms stared going off.  No one explained what was going on and all the guest were unsure if we should evacuate.  Finally they stopped and the dining area became very smokey.  I went and found someone to ask fearing a bit for our safety.  Apparently there was some type of water leak in the kitchen and the kitchen was being shut down.  The ventilators weren't working so all the smoke was billowing into the dining room.  Of course this can't be helped, but we were unable to order anything from the kitchen.  Which was disappointing as I was looking forward to trying a dessert.  The smoke was burning my eyes so I was ready to get out of there.  This is where my review goes from 5 stars to 3 stars.  We were not offered any type of compensation for this.  Our lunch was filled with smoke, alarms and disruption.  Had something been comped for our troubles, or perhaps a complimentary sorbet, I would feel differently.   I am torn about whether I would go back, while I loved the space and felt the food was really good and a great value for lunch prices, I am not impressed with management that would handle the dining crisis by charging diners full price for an alarm smoke filled partial meal.  Side note, iced tea 6 dollars for one small glass.  I would not order that again.  Perhaps a refill was possible, but our waitress was very inattentive, but benefit of the doubt because there was a lot going on.

l6KGUfrOmm4gg3S-6wAEJQ.text: I've been here a few times now, always ordering different items off the menu. The food is okay. Not great, but not bad either. When you factor in the prIce, the food leans on the bad side. The service is pretty good most of the times. Not of fan if the drink menu being on iPads. Ours died on us one time. Don't come here for the food...come for the view, especially when the weather is nice enough to have the windows open!!

NJXisRBfbijVrUZixiGs1Q.text: I have been to Giadas around 10 times now.  So why the three star rating?  The portion sizes are minute.  For pasta you get an ice cream scoop of spaghetti.  But their sangria is to die for. The room is beautiful with wonderful views of the strip.  Go if you are not very hungry.

3569mDQAMRjeNkJbJk_YeQ.text: Well I wanted to give the restaurant 5 stars but no can do. We had a reservation Saturday night 1/26 and we were seated pretty quickly. The restaurant itself has a really nice atmosphere. It is cozy, with  a very classy vibe there. I hope that Giada or the investors read the reviews here as it is important. Wine list is nice but bottles are pricey. Some nice signature cocktails on an iPad that they call an interactive menu. Enter our server Joseph. He had very nice energy and a big smile and was very friendly.  Bread came and it was delicious. Had condiments to go with it. A lemon butter, Calabrian chili, maldon salt & deep fried capers. First issue of the night, LOTS of bread and a TABLESPOON of lemon butter! This was the first skimp of the evening. If you are bringing that much bread then bering more butter. So we ordered Fritto Misto for an appetizer which is deep fried calamari and shrimp with a lemon aioli. The seafood was crispy but needed salt badly. We had to salt it. The aioli was delicious however a "smear" of it on the plate equaling maybe 1 tablespoon is not enough aioli period. I kept trying to get Joseph's attention but I couldn't. He was talking to another co-worker and didn't look up. By the time he came over we were pretty much ready for our entrees. We couldn't finish the appetizer because there wasn't anything to dip it in! While we were sitting at our table another couple was seated next to us. Their server kept standing between our table and theirs and his BUTT kept banging into our bread and condiments! This was repeatedly!! The servers have zero manners. His butt was literally a half inch from our table. Their was more room on the other side of the table but he kept disturbing us!  We both ordered the bucatini with tomato, Calabrian chili and fresh ricotta. I'm Italian, half Calabrian. I know Calabrian chili is hot, however when there is so much in the pasta you can barely eat it then we have a problem. In addition there was literally a 1/2 TEASPOON of ricotta on top!! A half teaspoon!! At least put a tablespoon on the pasta to cut the hot chili!! Talk about skimpy! My husband had a teaspoon on his pasta! No parmesan on pasta which I figured was because of the ricotta! Just could barely find the ricotta! I tried to get Joseph's attention but I couldn't! I was waving my arms trying to call his name....jeez. He finally came over and asked me if it was too hot. I said yes! He said you want some plain tomato to add to it! I said no! I honestly wanted to say how about another order made properly but I didn't. Just was over it. We had toasted marshmallow gelato for dessert which was the best thing we ate! We needed it to put the fire out in our mouths! Meanwhile, other server's butt against our table. The service was good and atmosphere really nice. I was disappointed in the food as the skimping on key components of each dish is NOT what a high end restaurant should do. Shouldn't have to ask for more aioli, more butter or ask where the ricotta is! Prices are moderate but not inexpensive. Wish it had been better.

B5Wup2ZBreP4YmYy4ZhZHA.text: This restaurant shouldn't get anything less than 5 stars! The customer service was superb!! Our waiters were Jesse and Christian and they did such an amazing job attending to us along with all their other tables. Everyone was smiling and having a great time and enjoying the food. The manager who was there the night we went was John and he was sooo friendly. He came and talked with us for a few minutes asking us what brought us to the restaurant and telling us a few things about himself. He gave his card as well so that we can send him an email that he would forward to Giada herself! I look forward to coming back the next time i'm in town and trying more dishes :)

V0B0kBWO-OItDSk-C78jOw.text: The portion size was a little small but everything I had was flavorful. My wife was disappointed in the pasta. The wait staff was amazing. The manager came by twice to check on us. I have been to several celebrity chef restaurants and I must say this is one that Giada can be proud of.  I had the bacon wrapped dates, and the branzino. We shared calamari, aracini, and capresi.

YAoxHhdo20X1QVETHBjZAg.text: So my fiancee made me come here bc she is a Super fan of Giada so my expecting were not high. I was expecting overpriced boujee food that wouldnt fill you up and would be mediocre. Man oh man was I wrong.  This was by far the BEST Breakfast I've ever had in my life. The food was so good it brought literal tears to my eyes. All I can say is everything we had was beyond exceptional. We had a fantastic waiter who recommended the best food ever! I wish I could give this place 10 stars!   My on critic would by the mimosas. They were okay and $14 a piece. Just get water and order as much as you can on the menu!!!!!

a9OYSZrqoiEnQuL6Vi5PIw.text: Lemon cookie was awesome good food. Manager was very attentive. Great atmosphere and the scenery was nice. I will go again.

7kHrgBNhiXaqfECPGij99g.text: Best meal of my life. Not one single thing I would change. Prices were not outrageous considering the food and the service.

x-X4_mtKC-9fTSDCBSH9ng.text: I highly recommend Giada's in Las Vegas.  The brunch we had was absolutely delicious.  The service was impeccable and the manager George delivered the best customer service to us during our time at Giada's.

Ehy4aQbJ-rVcfD2GY6vU3g.text: Five stars because the service was excellent! The manager came over and said hello before we even were seated. our waiter was really nice it was another gentleman that came over and said hello and asked if we needed anything. They were really nice the food was delicious I got the spaghetti and add it to meatballs. The meatballs everyone are the bomb! Definitely get the meatballs! Then we got the the favorite cookies which was a large chocolate chip cookie it was really good, my brother-in-law got the tiramisu cheesecake it was okay could have been a little bit colder, and my husband got the hazelnut crunch which was really good and really rich. So don't sleep on this place the food is good but people are nice to be with wonderful it was really nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu cheesecake stack! Tell them to make sure it&#39;s cold.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood fettuccine pasta!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and I ordered a side of meatballs! Get extra sauce!! Very flavorful!!! Get this!!

r0LpTCQXPj-RL7NxjyEVBQ.text: It's been 3 years since we've been here.  We've talked about it a lot.  My daughter was 10 when we were here last and she loved everything about it. Me too, except I thought it was just a bit pricey.   June 2018.  Now it is a dinner place, catering to an adult palette.  My daughter and her friend were the only ones there under 30.  Had a very difficult time reading a menu with  silver writing on white paper in 8pt font, but eventually we took pictures of the menu and enlarged it to read.   My daughter wanted spaghetti, but I knew that she wouldn't like the one on the menu.  Happily, our server was able to make one with red sauce and meatballs.  Also ordered the burrata and bruschetta.  For me, I got the risotto.   Bread came first, everyone loved it.  Next the burrata - the tomatoes were good, the cheese flavorless.  Bruschetta came next.  It was toast with cheese, tomatoes, guacamole and balsamic.  Odd and not very good.   After a long wait, dinner arrived.  The spaghetti and meatballs were as I had pictured, but for me the sauce was bland.  My risotto had plenty of flavor, but the scallops needed more of a sear and the risotto was very al dente, and I mean really al dente. Service was good, still like the restaurant space and it was full.  So, she has a good thing going.  Unfortunately, the changes over the last 3 years were not good ones for us.  We will always remember the older version and wish her success but, we will be looking for a new Italian restaurant.  Sad days.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

bt3ALthT-VoWHYIuh1vo-g.text: This was one of the worst dining experiences of my life. We were a party of 5 going for brunch with a reservation, four adults and one SLEEPING baby. As we were waiting to be seated a man and his wife were seated before us and he loudly said "Don't put me near them I don't want to hear that". The hostess said nothing and laughed. We were seated by a window overlooking the strip which was lovely, although the open air dining had a nice view I could have gotten it from a McDonald's on the strip and saved $250. The service was poor, rushed, and very basic. Refills were extremely slow and the menu was not explained to us at all. I ordered a small "pizette" and it was room temperature and watery. Everyone's meal was about $20+ a plate and all somewhat cold and bland. The WORST part of the experience was walking through the Cromwell my husband walked over to a slot and immediately a manager and security guard power walked to me and in a RUDE and STERN voice told me "YOU NEED TO LEAVE IMMEDIATELY OR IT WILL BE A $10,000 FINE". I was holding my baby in the middle of walkway, which I didn't know was such a large fine. I would have been happy to move along if I had known but her tone, attitude, and her standing in front of my and the security guard going behind my back for her to yell at me on the casino floor was one of the worst experiences of my life. Sorry Giada, you choose this Casino for your restaurant. In summary I will never eat at Giada again, visit the Cromwell again, or watch any of Giada shows again. Please save your money and stay away from this TV chef "restaurant".

SSLvl2qTIDK-kULcPoSd8g.text: If you happen to be in Las Vegas, do your self a favor and try Giada's Restaurant. Not only was the atmosphere amazing, you get a beautiful view of the strip mixed with an out of this world service and food. Our waiter especially made our visit extra special, Rocco M. Thank you so much Rocco M. for making our experience so special. If you end of ordering dessert, I highly suggest the lemeoncello souffle!   PS. If we don't come back for the food we would definitely come back for Rocco:)

8yDqpd3z4PfcV7LgwSXx6w.text: My fiance and I have been coming here since the first summer it opened. It is a Vegas favorite for us. We love the salumes and cheeses, appetizers and pastas the most. It's great to go with a group of four or more so you can order a lot of the menu. I love the pea arancini and the orzo meatballs, spaghetti, veggie bolognese, and the bucatini. Make sure to order a cookie plate, the lemon ricotta cookies are a Giada staple.

nexk3RGNZ9MReu12d3pVNw.text: We went here for breakfast.  It was our second time at this restaurant. We had reservations and arrive on time. We had to wait just a couple of seconds and then they sent us by the window.  I ordered hot chocolate and my wife had their fresh orange juice. My wife ordered an omelette which she said was amazing. I had the waffles which were with polenta in them and pineapple with strawberries the polenta was not overwhelming and the waffle was fabulous.  The pastry platter was so fabulous. It was really fresh and I love them. It is a must order. Overall service was good and the food was wonderful I would recommend this restaurant for breakfast or brunch anytime.

VmW_OtEq38s6V3FpF04ILQ.text: I was excited to eat here having been a fan of Giada On food network.   The service leaves something to be desired. After I sat down, took 5 mins to get water and then another 5 mins for my waiter to come who just dropped off a bunch of menus and said he will be back. When he did come back he was like "so basically we have pizza pastas and a prefixed menu" and then walked away. After I got my food I was hoping my waiter would come back so I could get some pepper, however he didn't check back in until my meal was complete.   Regarding the actual food, I think it was good--nothing that blows your mind, but I was satisfied with the taste and portions. Overpriced, but everything in Vegas is so you can't really complain about that.   Would I come here again? Probably not. Do I recommend it, sure, if you are in the area and are in the mood for Italian and have no other better option.

QJg8hHDSw1pWUSIYBIjsTg.text: My husband and I had a wonderful dining experience here. Our waiter Joseph was a big part in making that happened. We enjoyed the artichoke, Shrimp cocktail, spicy sausage pizza, lobster ravioli, and shrimp spaghetti. The bread plate was a pleasant surprise. Great place to celebrate.

FR7FHQL7GIRbF-pQe3Ac-A.text: My dinner was perfect! The lobster ravioli was delicious but the sauce was not heavy so it was satisfied without the guilt trip! But... I had the Tiramisu Cheesecake. That was very yummy but I couldn't finish it! I wish the dessert was smaller portion. I would share with a friend next time.  Definitely would return again!

fP2if99y8IVA_UKar028xg.text: There's a lot of good and a lot of 'wat,' when it comes to Giada. The biggest bias I think anyone here is going to push is that this is the first restaurant for a Food Network chef...and while most of them are fantastic chefs...when it comes to Vegas, you got Joel Robuchon and Twist by Pierre Gagnaire (maybe Guy Savoy...and Ramsey, but his flagship is London...)  Giada...by a fair margin, has the coolest looking restaurant I've been to in Vegas. Great decoration, great location...I mean, the view is killer. Go Cromwell for making this place happen.   The service was like...an awkward first date. Here me out here; they meant well, they were doing good for the most part, but they interjected at weird times to tell us about the menu while insisting there was no rush. I asked for water and the guy gave me a half glass (of what is essentially a lowball glass to begin with) and walked away after I asked for more :I. I got nothing.   Still, it was overall good service.   Dinner...we just sorta ordered whatever. Our server successfully upsold a cheese plate for us that turned out to be on the money (good on him), and he also suggested a pork shoulder ragu pasta that turned out to be quite good. We also did the ricotta crostini (really good) and a flatbread.  Now, all of these were good....but the portions were so spectacularly small that it was like going to a dinner party with models. No one got to eat shit, we just got to taste it. And hey, $  Main courses came out, I did a caprese to start with the short rib. Let me say that they caprese's mozzarella was the best mozz I've ever had in the US. Like, damn. Daaammmnnnn.   The short rib was also the best I've had, and I always opt for a short rib at any restaurant that offers it. It wasn't as completely tender as described (falls apart by touch...more like cuts with fork after some prodding), but it was still freaking amazingly savory. The polenta and accompanying veggies were a plus.   Edit: TOTALLY FORGOT. Holy shit those cookies are good. Buy them. The espresso tower was frozen solid, but dem cookies man...dem cookies.   Overall, damn good food and decent service. Wish there could have been more to eat.

aE9OA7c80hnuStfBf0zg3A.text: Went for Sunday brunch. Restaurant is so nice with a great view.  Had the meatball appetizer, crab cannelloni. Delicious. Yes, it was expensive but all the nice restaurants on the strip are.

h-Fiyv1KEd3mIXfObeyE6A.text: I went twice in one Vegas trip. The ambience is amazing- open, clean, bright. It definitely feels like Giada had a vision for this restaurant and had a large hand in making it extremely beautiful to look at.   On to the bad. Small portions. Everyday food, nothing special, exorbitant cocktail prices...I could go on. Service was pretentious. Our group was half from NYC and half from SF, so we know good food and service.  I agree with other reviewers that my favorite thing was the orzo meatballs. They were flavorful and moist. We ordered many of the other items and they were mediocre- pizzas, panino, tenderloin sliders, lobster roll, baked pasta etc.,none worth the price.  The kicker was that it was my 30th birthday. Our group had a large bill well over $1,000. As my gratis birthday dessert they brought over their 6 cookie plate... For 10 people! Would it have broken Giada's bank to scrounge for one more plate of cookies. If someone decides to spend their birthday and their paycheck with you, show a little love. That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1OEYOGdUrlVRTIZ8u3-Flg.text: The service was so terrible, we got up and left before even ordering.  Let me explain. We were told the restaurant was open for breakfast but it was in fact brunch.  There were literally 2 actual breakfast types foods on the menu...it was 90% lunch. It was 9am when we rolled in, so sorry not really brunch time. My stepdad is a diamond member and they said it was a 10 min wait. Diamond members usually don't wait. There were plenty of open tables and the one we sat at was empty the whole time. Not a soul left the restaurant since we had arrived. That was a bunch of BS  The hostess couldn't count. We said we had 4 adults and 2 kids and she said "ok so 7 then?" So the restaurant only hires pretty faces. There's no brains upstairs. The menu was just too fancy. We wanted breakfast, not some pretentious lobster hash crap.  Maybe that kind of food suits you and that's fine, but I was not impressed with the service whatsoever.

drAQ6eYcHqngc9pX_UXFvQ.text: The view from our table was amazing. We got to see the lights on the strip. Our server was very nice and informative. We opted to choose from the menu instead of from the tasting menu.  We got the truffle salami and Parmesan Reggiano. Both were really good. The bacon wrapped dates was a little too sweet, I was hoping for more of a savory flavor. I ordered the shrimp spaghetti which is delicious. We also ordered the risotto which was very good too  Overall a lovely dinner with friends

As7qt-g2BRdfcFKWX04LWg.text: We made it a point to go to Giada while we were in Vegas.  A beautiful room, great menu, ok wine list (bit pricey, but Strip prices I suppose)....what made the night for us was our server Lauren and her cohort Nate.  Lauren was bright, funny, engaged.  She steered us to some choices on the menu to ensure we got a great sampling of Giada's food ("you gotta try the ravioli).  She checked in, made sure we were doing well, and took the time to get to know us a bit.  It's always a joy to get a server like Lauren.  We watched her as she worked her section....taking time with each party.    Well Done.  Giada (or at least the GM), take note...you've got a real winner in Lauren (and Nate's not too bad either!).  Oh....go eat here.  Dinner was Great.

VnMINL2Ads7V4yIvN8zgMA.text: Was in vagas  12/2017 dined at Giada.Food was over priced, we asked for bread the waiter stated you only get bread if you place a order, when the bread came 4 people had to split one muffin along with some strips of some sort of bread. The pasta was gummy no flavor. This is a tasting menu if your hungry don't go. Very disappointed . All of Gordon Ramsay restaurants we visited was delish. Very disappointed

qAOEbG6J2R2KyKs8r4PXTA.text: I love watching the food network chefs.  When Giada opened her restaurant, I definitely had to visit. For my Bachelorette party, Giada's felt like the perfect restaurant for a large party.    Upon arriving at the restaurant which is located upstairs, we were promptly escorted to our private room.  The GM could see we were celebrating and sent us sparkling wine complimentary.  What a great gesture to start off our night.    As we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive,  our server explained the menu.  We aren't heavy eaters so our group decided on 2 plates of appetizers to share and we each got an entree.  I got the risotto which was cooked perfectly and the perfect portion size for me.  Can't go out to the club being overstuffed and bloated!  Friends got salmon, surf and turf and pasta dishes.  Everyone enjoyed their dishes.  Lots of reviewers have complained about large prices and small portions.  This is Vegas people!    We also had the pleasure of trying the dessert cart and it was quite delicious from the cookies, sorbet, gelato to cakes, everything was quite unique.  What a wonderful place to celebrate! On the way out each staff member greeted us. Don't forget the photo booth.  Love the experience!

ElcfN7fXngSQY5jz91qjGw.text: We tried this place on my wife's birthday.  We decided to try the sampling menu to get a variety.  I suggest don't eat here this way.  Way, way, way overpriced. The food is just ok, but there is no way Italian food should be priced this high.  You are paying for the name "Giada".  On top of the cost of the food, we were mis guided by our waiter in suggesting a wine that we though was $50 a bottle and when we got the bill, it was $150.  Be sure you know what you are buying here.  They will run your bill up in a hurry if you are not watching.  The service was just ok as well. This place was the highest cost restaurant we ever ate at and it was far from something you would want to pay around $500 for just one couple for dinner with tip.  We just felt ripped off!  Seriously for a famous chef, walk across the street to Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill.  Yes, it is not Italian food, but Bobby does not gouge you in the cost of his food and it is awesome!     Save your money and go elsewhere.  So many options in Vegas, and no need to put this place on your list. If you want good Italian at a reasonable price go right around the corner about 2 blocks, to Battista's Hole In the Wall.  It sure is a hole in the wall, but they have great Italian food for a good price.

xKRO03S50e6IokCcAXOqzA.text: Only giving it two stars because of their service. The food is amazing, truly delicious, but the service made it a shorter visit than anticipated and we didn't get to enjoy a bottle of wine or dessert.  We let the Manager know and he tried to offer us dessert, which was nice, but we were just tired of waiting to be serviced.  We started dinner with ordering a bottle of champaigne to celebrate our anniversary.  After our first glass, we had to serve ourselves, which usually isn't an issue, except for it seemed like the only time we saw our server was to give us that, and then take our order for apps and dinner.  They never asked us if we wanted more to drink and we had to go get our check.  The Manager also offered us a glass of Prosecco as well, but again, we just decided to leave.  To bad, it was great good and an amazing view of the strip!

PEt2NL4nVDGBOc14KujCSg.text: If you enjoy eating at the Cheesecake Factory but want to spend more money to pretend that you like eating at nice places, then this is the restaurant for you.

kWlXQg9owvuUmpfCp2JyPA.text: I was excited to come here. The ambiance and cool photo booth outside along with the modern decor and appeal was lovely. The whole place is beautiful.   I was impressed with the bread platter your meal comes with. It was brilliantly made and fun to eat! Delicious too.  However, all the other dishes we tried were not in any way exceptional nor worth the hype or price.  The lobster balls tasted nothing like lobster nor did it have any. Was it supposed to? I didn't get to read the menu fast enough but they recommended it. The orzo meatballs were straight up meatballs. No oomph. The big salad thing everyone is talking about was good, kinda salty but nothing great. The mushroom pizza was pretty good. Very strong cheese.  I can't say I would recommend this place for the food, maybe just for the experience. Definitely better places out there.  Sorry, G! You're still pretty.
