iqPB-GXchJiIKxwsGFfwww.text: I like this place but very expensive and ala carte. The service was okay but as a single participant I felt like I was somewhat invisible.  The waiter kept telling me how many ounces the food was which I thought was unusual. Great bread. The hostess did not acknowledge I had a reservation and I waited 15 minutes to be sat even though my reservation was at 6 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TfQqiuAufwxt0k0bg44ErA.text: I'm a little torn about this one folks.  I've always enjoyed watching Giada De Laurentiis' shows on Food Network so I couldn't be anymore happier when the chef decided to have her first ever restaurant in Las Vegas.  Too bad celebrity chef restaurants usually don't live up to the hype due to such high expectations and sadly, this one's no exception.  The restaurant itself has a nice ambiance. Despite of the tables being so close to each other, details throughout made it feel as if we were dining at home so it wasn't too awkward/uncomfortable being seated less than a foot away from other guests.  If I were to do it again, I'd certainly do what Phillip T. recommends on his review and request for a premium table overlooking Bellagio or Caesar's Palace no matter how long it takes.  Food in general was good.  Looking back, however, portions were relatively small considering of how much they're charging for each dish.  This surely isn't your rustic Italian joint where you can get large bowls of pasta that can feed a whole town!      Upon ordering, our server brought out a complimentary platter of breadsticks, rosemary focaccia and cheese crisps as well as several accoutrements.  Several antipasti plates then followed which quickly filled our table.  Few favorites include charred octopus, wood roasted mushrooms and Prosciutto di Parma.  The Parmigiano-Reggiano was also good especially when eaten with the wild-sage honey and rosemary focaccia.  I say skip the burrata since texture was quite unpleasant instead of that smooth consistency everyone has been accustomed to.  I opted for the risotto as my main entree since I'm a sucker for creamy pearls of rice prepared w/ tasty seafood broth.  Unfortunately, what was served was rather disappointing: rice was underdone and seasoning was lacking.  Although the scallops were perfectly cooked, I actually would've never thought the dish came with crabs if it weren't for the menu listing the item as one of its ingredients.  While my food was completely amiss, her spaghetti, on the other hand, was easily one of the few highlights of the night.  In fact, I'd pick this over your regular meatball and marinara pasta any day.  One thing that caught my attention as soon as the dish was placed on the table was how enormous the prawns were.  The lemon and basil sauce also went really well with the pasta.  If I could eat this everyday, I absolutely would in a heartbeat!  Service was great and staff knowledgeable of everything on the menu.  Forgot his name but I'm assuming our server was fairly new since he was getting plenty of complaints from other guests.  He even charged our card with someone else's tab; making us wait for some time and not even a dessert was given to compensate for his mistake.  Overall, Giada has become one of the hottest restaurant in the valley as people continue to flock to this joint even after several months of being open.  Having said that, nothing jumps out of our dining experience that makes me want to come back at this establishment anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary bread platter

tycnNjoESLOmQb3IwORjvw.text: Came here for a quick breakfast, but was unimpressed and would not go back for dinner or breakfast.    I had the salmon cakes Benedict which are a signature dish.  For breakfast they seemed to be leaving 1/2 the restaurant empty and only seating people by the windows or at the bar.  I sat at the bar to avoid waiting.  The bartender provided good service.  The salmon cakes had a lot of filler and were deep fried to look like a hockey puck.  Given the salmon cakes are supposed to be a Giada signature dish, would figure they make it like the recipes I see on the internet which look a lot better than what I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon cake Benedict

x2TKOLfNVfOHCcjXS9IZPw.text: Such a great dinner we had - 4 of us from the tasting menu. Our server ANDREW was gracious and funny. He got our humor and made our evening. The polenta was to die for. The breads yummy. The charcuterie tray was excellent.   All in all a nice wY to celebrate a birthday. Snaps to Andrew!

k4SnswlB1ZmcxzOUndp6Rw.text: As a big fan of Giada, I was really excited to try this place and was left severely underwhelmed.  The restaurant is located inside the newly constructed Cromwell and the space itself is loooooofffly. Bright, clean and spacious while maintaining a cute comforting coziness. I definitely want to live here, but I will settle for raiding homegoods to replicate my home into a cheap interior decor knockoff.   The food: Portions are tiny, as is expected with ~fine dining, yet the quality and flavors of these dishes didn't warrant such a high price tag. Nothing about the flavor combinations was innovative or spectacular; in all honesty it was quite plain and lackluster. Mushrooms with almonds were plain and seriously tiny, chicken marsala meatballs were dry, and the gorgonzola kale salad was good but.. I could make this at home. The rest of the small plates we got were alright but again, so unmemorable that my photographic foodie mind can't even remember what they were for this review.  Cocktails are delicious and strong. The bellinis are great, as is the drink with egg whites (can't remember the name, but I enjoyed it thoroughly.. including the "G" monogrammed on top in foam). Service is outstanding, and the wait staff is very attentive. There's also a photobooth where you can entertain yourself with while waiting, but unfortunately none of the pictures were printing while we were there.  Left kind of hungry and with noticeably lighter pockets. Next time, I'll spend my money elsewhere. Granted its Vegas, so what the hell *throws cash everywhere*.

fUYys6Z2XpkHJRUTGB6xnQ.text: Second visit - thought maybe the first experience was a fluke. Mediocre food at crazy prices. Sit at the bar, pay $30 for a pasta dish and not even provided bread. Will not give them a third opportunity.

zkjTDx6sOhuhE20u0H2h8w.text: Great service and we had a window view of Bellagio; water show. We had brunch and would recommend the antipasti and spaghetti w/meatballs or the cannelloni Gerson...was our waiter and he will give you GREAT advice, so listen to his recommendations

GiK-348NKKmJrXK6YB_U9w.text: Love this restaurant and must try the lemon sufflet desert. They only offer it on the brunch menu. Fine dining with a beautiful view of the strip. Thank you definitely keep coming back every visit!

DKbiEwzOvKOGnqqfRol4jQ.text: My SIL is a big fan of the namesake celeb-u-chef, so she made us a dinner reservation here during a long weekend visit.   The atmosphere and service are on-point.  We were seated at an arced banquette with a view of the strip. Part way into our meal, the windows opened to the outdoors, which brought in a lovely light breeze.   The food, quite frankly, nothing spectacular. Here's what our party of four shared: Fritto Misto app  Meatball app Bucatini Ravioli Fettuccine  Risotto Sweet corn and spicy sausage side dish   We all agreed that the entrees did not meet our expectations; they were just okay, we'd had better. The elements of the meal we most enjoyed were the basket of freshly baked breads, the meatball app and the side of sweet corn and spicy sausage.  I would definitely recommend ordering the latter, as it was particularly delicious.  It left us all wanting more!  Of course one outstanding side dish is not enough of a reason to return.  That said, we don't regret going -- it was an enjoyable evening -- memorable, but not for the food, which I'd give 3-1/2 stars if that were an option.

QI6-CM0K4uPrf3q2dwLSAA.text: I wanted to love this place.  I mean look at Giada, she is beautiful and successful and so cute when she takes bites of her creations and I mean it was spaghetti (have to say it the way Giada says it).  But as other reviewers mentioned the flavors were off and way more lemony than creamy for spaghetti.  Two giant shrimp on the plate it definitely was pleasant on the eyes.  I have to back up and say that I was dining alone.  I was able to get a reservation using Open Table and it was much later than I like to eat.  I had a few cocktails at a business networking event before walking over but did not snack on any of what would have been subpar food compared to what I was planning to have.  The bread that came was yummy as was the fritto misto.  Since the pasta was bland, I doctored it up with the pesto and red pepper flakes provided on the bread tray.  I felt like it was sacrilege but then again to waste the pasta would have been even worse!  The texture and presentation of the spaghetti were perfect so the extra flavors helped but it may have been better if there had been fresh parm at my disposal.  I didn't dare say anything to my server.  I was quickly filling up so I took the rest to go and kept it in my hotel fridge to finish off the next morning.  It was definitely a good experience but a little overrated.  If I had paid out of my own pocket may have left a different taste in my mouth (no pun intended) but since I was on travel and able to expense the meal, it was worth trying.  For now Giada, I will stick to watching you on tv : )

a8zqXXtMN7I-41-ORWyi9Q.text: Six people, dinner on a Saturday.  We were seated promptly at a large round table in the center of the room - a busy area but sort of fun to be in the middle of the action.  Extremely attentive service.  It's pretty spectacular when they open the windows and you have a view of the fountains across the street at the Bellagio.  Drinks were interesting - to be honest, I can't remember the cocktail I had but I loved it.  Three of six of us each had a cocktail and wine with dinner.  One had three beers.    We ordered 4 appetizers - I had the charred octopus salad which was outstanding.  Perfectly prepared octopus with a light dressing, potatoes on the side.  My daughter had the artichoke hearts and they were also excellent.  She devoured them.  She and I split the cacio e pepe which came in a small wheel of Pecorino cheese.  We both have waited a long time to try this dish and it did not disappoint.  The server was kind enough to come around and scrape the melted cheese from the side of the wheel - we'd already discovered how divine it was.  The dish was on the peppery side for my kid but not unpleasantly so (it is "e pepe", right?).  Others in our party had the lobster ravioli (my taste was rich, creamy and wonderful, cacio e pepe, and the Wagyu short rib and side of brussels sprouts (they were amazing).  Everyone was very happy with their entrees.    A couple of us shared gelato and the limoncello souffle which was just ok.    Overall, a delicious meal with exceptional service.  The bill was over $500 for the 6 of us.  It is overly pricey but it is situated in a boutique hotel in a prime area of the strip and bears a celebrity chef name so it is not surprising.  Frankly, everything in on the Strip these days is very expensive.

YYB-catxYwuNiXejsoeVmA.text: WOW! Thanks for fellow Yelper's, we asked for a table by the windows for the Bellagio fountain view. GORGEOUS! The wine was great, the bacon wrapped dates were divine, the entrees and sides were delicious and the dessert topped it off! I had the ravioli which is stuffed with lobster and they did not skimp out! My husband got the spaghetti which comes with shrimp and they were massive! We could've done with just 1 side since we received bread and ordered an app. Our server was attentive and the decor is beautiful. We will definitely be back to celebrate another occasion!

b3eSwekBItKNXDLS3tlT5A.text: What a beautiful setting, big windows exposing the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas blvd, and at sunset,  the whole room sparkles with sun kissed lighting :) I just want to say, the lounge is where it's at! It's social and comfortable offering the full menu designed by Giada. Just ask for Paige, she is ever so knowledgeable. She gave us an elegant and approachable tour of Giada's culinary creations and beverage offerings. I loved her recommendations. The champagne and wine selections were on point,  paired with Italy's finest meats and cheeses and tantalizing Pizzas or "pizette". I only wish we had time to graduate to the next course of pastas and entrees, but I promise soon we will! We were swayed into tasting a little Italian sweet tart lemon sugar cookie and also, what seemed to be a key lime pie tart sent from heaven topped with organic strawberry slices and little baby dollops of toasted meringue!!!  Just, wow. The manager John D. introduced himself and made us feel welcomed and even Alex an additional team member made sure we felt at home too. Thank you all, we can't wait to return and explore this awesome culinary path!

zRWaXm4ackvZm4IkR6yKMA.text: A great place to eat in Vegas if you want a nice dinner out. My family came to eat here when visiting my brother in town and we all really enjoyed our experience.   They start your dinner off with some amazing fresh baked bread, which was heavenly. I tried the ravioli for my meal and also tried the scallops that my mom ordered and both were spectacular. I highly recommend both dishes.  The service was also very good, they had great recommendations. And the ambience was great. The place was decorated very well and we got a table by a window with a great view of the Vegas strip. I can't wait to go back!

wfn_19r6JtaMrVZgRipR7w.text: this place is pretty mediocre. We started at the bar waiting for our reservation - we ordered the frito misto appetizer with the bartender, i asked if it was fried and he started going off about tiger shrimp and cocktail sauce and i was like oh great! Not fried. Then we receive the shrimp cocktail which was $10 more than what we ordered.. we realized this AFTER eating half of it. We confronted him and he acted as if he was confused and thought we ordered the shrimp cocktail... i never used those two words at all during our 30 minutes at the bar. Ended up paying for it... 60$ later (1 glass champagne & shrimp cocktail).   Then we get seated 10 minutes after our reservation time, we brought our own bottle of wine. We had to keep refilling our own glasses throughout the dinner because service was so bad. The food was VERY mediocre... in a place like this with prices like this you expect the BEST. it was very mediocre, each dish was well over done and had either too much sauce or was over cooked. The service was sloppy. When we got our soup they poured it into the bowl at the table and spilled it all over the floor between us... no one ever came to clean it up. The pasta noodles were over cooked and the meal was overall regretful. It was a mess. I will never come back, rip off and seems like bartender was trying to get a better tip and/or rip us off by ordering us something 10$ more than what we ordered. It's bullshit and I'm very disappointed as i love Giada and her cook books.

Wc5iYVMR64qF0BmjtZnSpw.text: Ate here for my birthday dinner, cinco de mayo weekend 2019. We arrived at Giada's 15 mins early so the host said they'll seat us when it's closer to our time. They let us know there's a bar inside if we want to hang out there while we wait, so we did however we walk back to the front because it was 5 mins passed our reservation time and havent gotten called yet. When we got back to the front they called us 5 mins later. I honestly think they forgot about us till they saw us the 2nd time. When I made the reservation I asked to be seated by the window but at first they didn't so I reminded the host and we had wait even longer till there's an available table. Smh. Other than that everything else was great. Our waiter and food was awesome. We love the oysters, the steak, lemon potatoes and even the lemon butter!

16rERbcc6MAz7Z4jUGNqjA.text: Review is for brunch.  Ambiance: 5/5 beautiful setting and the view is very lovely.   Service: 5/5 our waiter was so attentive and knew the menu very well and we loved his recommendations  Food: 3/5 the food is so so. Everything was either a hit or miss. We started out with the pastry basket which was delicious and the antipasta was delicious. I ordered the Salmon Benedict which was alright. Not the best not the worse I've had. My husband got the hash and it was way vegetable then meat. No real seasoning as well.    Overall I think the place is beautiful but food is lacking

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pastry
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict

K9Rgx1OxxNWAFcClCgdQkA.text: It's not easy for me to write this review since I have been a long time fan of Giada. But that being said, I had very high expectations for this restaurant and ended up walking out so disappointed. I couldn't even give this place 2 stars. The only positive thing I have to say about this restaurant is the bright and beautiful ambiance. So if you're coming here for the aesthetics, then be my guest! Other than that, stay far away.  We started with some drinks at the bar while we waited for our table. Service was lacking, as in there was only 1 bartender (on a Saturday). I asked for water as soon as we sat, and it arrived ten min later. We then had to flag down the bartender to order our mimosas. We felt completely dismissed as soon as we got here. When our table was ready, the hostess asked that we close out our tab and even getting the check took some waiting.  We started with an antipasi board which was a let down. Instead of bread, they gave us very thin parmesan crisps. When we tried to cut into the burrata, we realized it was very tough and when we touched it, it felt frozen! We sent it back and asked if they could warm it up. Moments later, it came back and was still cold. How is this acceptable?? We also asked for extra mustard and our server forgot about it and didn't bring it to us until we were already eating our entrees (20 min later).  I ordered a half order of the spaghetti which tasted mediocre and guess what, it also arrived cold. My friend ordered the Salmon Benedict after her first bite, she also wondered if it was frozen. She couldn't even finish eating it. We were both at a loss for words. Is Giada serving frozen food?! That's what it seems like. If I want frozen food I'll go to my grocery store and pay a lot less than what Giada is charging.  The food was very disappointing to say the least. I am honestly questioning the food quality since multiple dishes of ours seemed frozen. The service was just as bad. Our bill was over $100 (before tip) and in my opinion, not worth it. I wish I read the other reviews before coming here but I didn't think I would need to at Giada's restaurant. I honestly wish we left after the first round of food (with the frozen burrata) but we wanted to give this place the benefit of the doubt. That was a mistake. From one foodie to another, save your time and money and go to Spago across the street. The food is incredible & top quality, and the customer service is top notch.

FIqxjiQz6Qu4WX-sTqTLaQ.text: Giada Was the best Italian meal on the Las Vegas strip! The service was wonderful Christian helped to keep the meal on track with his recommendations.  This was the first time we ate everything. Christian answered all our questions and keeper the drinks full my husband and myself will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked Alaska and Ricatta cheese cake

66VOJwnFqn_o__NJScnuUw.text: First off, this place is beautifully designed!! I felt like I was transported to a fancy restaurant IN Italy- with the wood fired stove and seafood, meats, and cheeses on display.  We had a reservation and still had to wait about 15 minutes for our table, but the staff was friendly and we just scoped out what we wanted to drink on their iPad menus...this place is high tech!   We were a party of 4, so the waiter (who was awesome, extremely helpful and funny!) suggested that we split one of their platters. We chose the meat and cheese platter which was accompanied by fresh bread with a variety of accoutrements. The chef chooses the cheeses and meats and they vary- everything was SO SO good especially the fresh honeycomb...oh.my.god.   We also ordered the truffle burrata which was too salty and we didn't finish, the shrimp cocktail which came with HUGE shrimpies, the grilled octopus (also a plentiful sized tapa and was my personal fave- so light and flavorful!!), and the chicken Marsala meatballs (also YUM!)  We were pretty much stuffed to the gills but ordered entrees anyway :P I had the lobster ravioli which had large chunks of lobster and was delish but very rich. Ravioli was cooked al dente. My coworkers had the shrimp spaghetti (looked amazzzzing) and the salmon (huge portion!!)  This place was quite the treat and culinary experience and definitely a place you don't go to ALL the time. I'm giving it 4 stars solely because it was unbelievably pricey and if my work wasn't paying for it, I may never have gotten to try all the things we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vQSSnUIwO96KZ1pVAYb5Hg.text: Love this place! It's pricy and the meals are light,but that's the awesome part- the dishes are so light and well made that one can not resist.  The ambience is the only qualm - for such a pricey place, it is pretty noisy.   Not complaining though. We loved it!

zacmbrv8_gxNnxlU5OB4Uw.text: Giada has made quite a name for herself and a following of patrons as well.  We experienced a half circle table facing the always beautiful  Bellagio Fountains.  Service is friendly, helpful and spot on.  Highlights were the wheel of cheese filled with Giada's homemade pasta.  Cacio e Pepe Bucatiini was delicious.  The stuffed dates were another show stopper.  The fried chicken could be shared between two guest.  The Branzino was prepared with an array of vegetables and very good.   In all, I would come back again and let Giada cook for me.  She is a very talented woman who knows her way around the kitchen.

RLmSli0O_sraSGB321qV_A.text: Here's the breakdown -   Food - *** Value - ** Ambiance - *** Location - *  Met some out of town friends here for dinner. First time being in the Cromwell and first impression is... this place is ghetto. I'm pulling into the parking garage entrance and find a guy pissing on the side of the road. Not a homeless guy but a visitor to the hotel. Getting past that, I'm finding a spot to park and this garage is treated like a hangout for people, smoking weed, changing clothes, getting drunk. We make our way into the hotel and find our friends and go to the restaurant. We are seated in the middle of the restaurant and am glad we didn't get seated at the open windows. It's difficult to enjoy an expensive meal with the roaring sounds of traffic and smell of weed wafting by you. The server was trying to push a higher priced menu on us or looked down if we decided to share an item. All in all, food did t suck but wasn't worth the value we paid. Definitely other Italian places that provide way better food and value.

lv15wtTuto5AXSyjMfNOrw.text: My first time there and everything was amazing. The service is superb, never had such attentive and friendly staff and their cheese wheel is to die for!!!!!! Says serving for 2 but seems like more

u0bKwgFIM0CTXOQwzxhlsA.text: OMG, this was the highlight of our trip! To start the restaurant is very nice, the dining room has large windows overlooking the strip, with a peak of the Bellagio fountains. Even without a window seat, you still have a nice view. The rolls and Parmesan they bring out to start was my favorite part of the whole meal, it was SO good, I would go back just for that. My friend and I shared the lemon potatoes, roasted broccolini, and the Cacio e Pepe Bucatini. I can't explain just how AMAZING the potatoes were. SO GOOD, if you eat here you HAVE to try them. I was a little disappointed in the pasta just because it wasn't as cheesy as I would have expected pasta that was served in a wheel of cheese to be, but it was still very tasty! We finished with some lemon ricotta cookies for checking in our yelp, AMAZING!Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D4gy8IH_U9PcrdZDzW5Aog.text: Food was okay. It was standard fare and the pasta was good but it's similar to corner restaurants you'd find throughout Los Angeles.   The value is very low as there's not much magic about this place.

9epkUoqQKgCt8b82txLVPg.text: the moment i stepped onto the escalator as it took me to Giada's restaurant i was feeling excited...the moment has arrived!! all those years of watching her shows and finally i get to taste her food!!! of course a part of me wish to meet her in person at the restaurant.  reservation is a must! we reserved a table at 5:15pm on a saturday. it was perfect timing. not crowded and because of the pace of service, by the time you finish dinner you still have time to do things in vegas (ie: watch a show).  i thought it wasn't going to be kids friendly but they do offer high chairs for little ones.   we were seated by the window which allows us to enjoy the las vegas strip view and the bellagio fountain. This was a plus as it helped entertained my toddler throughout the meal! They dont offer kids menu but they have pizzettes that are suitable for little kids. And with their delicious complimentary breads, that totally can fill up a toddler's tummy! my daughter ate so much bread and breadsticks, by the time the pizzette arrived she was full. as a matter of fact she preferred the complimentary bread basket over the pizzette!!  the complimentary breads were SO good. what really was the star was the condiments that you can pair with the breads! the mascarpone butter was so good, the fried capers was well executed, normally i dont like much capers cuz it's too sour, but this fried capers was different and it balances the sweetness of the mascarpone butter. The basil pesto was mm mm mmmmmm!!    we ordered an appetizer, a sampler of salumi and formaggi... everything was delicious. i didn't know that parmaggiano reggiano would be sooooo delicious with honeycombs! I'm totally going to recreate this at home.. the only problem is getting that type of honey.  i ended up ordering the Short ribs Agnolotti and i thought it was just okay. i don't recommend this dish. the agnolotti was not piping hot, i felt like it was sitting at the kitchen for a long time before it arrived on my table. The pasta was hardening too. The taste was nothing spectacular and the portion was extremely small. I'm so glad we ordered the appetizer and that there were complimentary breads. My husband ordered the white lasagna and that one was way better than my agnolotti.   overall i think the appetizers and the breads outshine the main course. Till this day i am still thinking about the appetizers and the delicious fresh breads and breadsticks!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White lasagna
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short ribs Agnolotti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampler (small)

I5ZCiMdCKEZFkj611PeNMg.text: Four of us did the tasting menu here while visiting Vegas. Walking in, the first thing you notice is how beautiful and airy the restaurant is. The decor details are great (as is the playlist) but the quality of food and the service is lacking.   The portions were a mess. As I said there were 4 of us so for the first course we got two normal sized pastries, a teeny salad to split off a single teacup-sized plate, and a tiny shared plate for the antipasti. We should have each gotten a teacup- sized salad. Why are we sharing that tiny plate? If it was just one person doing the tasting, are they given half a pastry, a slice of cheese and ham, and a leaf of lettuce? It was bizarre. At least give more salad - that is super cheap and was super delicious.   The second course - we all got the pasta- was amazing. So so good and no complaints for me. But my friend did ask for hers with no peas (which the waiter said no problem to) but then she still got peas. It wasn't worth the effort to send back. Service was pretty slow/ inconsistent.   The final course was good but SO BIG. Kind of like a Cheesecake Factory dessert. Why are we each getting giant desserts in our tasting menu? I would so much have rather had a bowl of salad in my app instead of a giant slice of chocolate cake and espresso ice cream. It was good but just way too massive. Definitely not in line with what you all have engraved on the lights there - eat a little bit of everything and not too much of everything.

m_HXUZN_goU0dswTrSNB9w.text: Wow. That's the first thing that needs to be said. First time dining here. Anniversary dinner for the wife and I. Beautiful views, very attentive staff and delicious flavored food. All staff was on top of thier game. I never had to ask for a refill of our water. They had a check in special on Yelp for a free spritzer and they didnt make us feel at all uncomfortable about using it. We had The house special dinner. And what a great choice. Appetizers, our meal and a choice of three of thier desserts. We were stuffed. We had the porkchop and the pecan encrusted salmon. The porkchop was a little fatty but the flavor was amazing. Veryyyyyyy pricey but great for a special occasion. I'd love to revisit it one day. Yum!

VB3Wclj-H3kiBnP6bQXfpg.text: I don't mind paying top dollar for a wonderful and memorable meal and this was neither. I was really disappointed with what we had.  We ordered the cheese dish, bacon wrapped dates and about 3 pasta dishes. We had the lobster ravioli, the agnolotti, and the rigatoni.  They were all bland, just nothing special. Our server was very nice.  I would suggest they control the temperature in the restaurant a little better. It was a little too warm for me and the rest of the group.

JH7HyLP4PBDBrlBItaVXiA.text: Great food, amazing and attentive service and beautiful restaurant. Dined for brunch,  pretty packed with beautiful lighting throughout with most diners looking happy. Goat cheese was amazing and the sampler was great for sharing! Everything taste fresh, presentation was also very beautiful.  Actually lookin forward to returning to Giada in the near future!

wUg5E_-5FshHJ7eh11fF1w.text: Okay you guys. This place is totally worth the hype. I'm seriously trying not to gush.   First of all, I had the most awesome table with the most awesome view of the Bellagio and the fountain show from a window side table overlooking Las Vegas Boulevard.   Then, my waiter, Nancy was awesome. She was gracious and attentive but never made me feel hurried. She answered all of my questions about the menu and gave me excellent recommendations. And then, I really feel like she actually respected me as a customer/diner. I wasn't just a table that had to be turned. It was truly a pleasure. Thank you Nancy.   And then the food. Omg. The food. I know this sounds cheesy, but I actually felt like I was eating Giada's food. The chicken Marsala meatballs were to die for. And the crostini were good too! And I LOVED the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. I like closed my eyes with each bite I took lol.   I wanted to do dessert, but I was so full. Oh, before I forget, the lemonade that was made in house was sparkly and so refreshing. It really worked well with all the salty/meaty flavors of everything I ate (eloquent) I know!  Finally, Frank the manager came to check on me and gifted with me with complimentary cookies. It was such a great way to cap off my memorable dining experience. (Especially since I was too full to order desert.   From a Mom of a two year old who doesn't get out much, this meal was such a pleasant and wonderful experience. Thanks to everyone at Giada's!  Update: I walked down the stairs and almost out of the Cromwell in a food haze and one of the hostesses chased me down to the first floor so she could give my shopping bag I forgot. Bonus! So awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Setting
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala Meatballs

x0m1j2YSR6BGzj8KyV89ow.text: I have to say this was surprisingly our best meal in Vegas.  Not surprised the food was great, but I didn't expect to be blown away.  The only reason the 4 stars instead of 5 was it was extremely warm in the restaurant and I am usually freezing.  Not sure if there was a problem with the air but the food definitely overcame the temperature!  First lets start with the bread plate OMG it is food porn!  The bread literally will melt in your mouth!   Hubby and I like small plates so we did a tapas style dinner.  We started with the bacon wrapped dates with spicy sausage!  I usually do not like anything with heat, but this brought the right amount of taste without overwhelming me with the spice.  Finished with a Gorgonzola  cheese it was pure heaven to my taste buds.  Next we had the Tricolore prosciutto di parma, gorgonzola, dates, walnuts, Tuscan kale, yellow endive & radicchio.  All of the flavors combined to make this a light but incredibly tasty bridge from the dates to our entrees.  We ordered spaghetti and ravioli as our main dishes.  The ravioli featured lobster that tasted like it just came from the docks with a creamy butter sauce....perfect!  The spaghetti had a light lemon taste making the dish taste light instead of the heaviness you sometimes get with pasta.    The vibe was trendy (music was just a tad too loud) and upscale without feeling pretentious.  Hubby wore jeans and a dress shirt and I wore a dress (hey you gotta dress up in Vegas) but i would say the code is dressy casual.  This will definitely be one of our must have dinners when in Las Vegas.

dnjELv066EFsympU6hDA-Q.text: What ever happened to communication. I wanted to do enjoy my experience with my friends at Gianna's. Unfortunately the staff, especially showing desserts were so rude. I would never spend this money for such a rude display off customer service.

ybFJJghBNfaeWYMaP5yY3Q.text: Came here with a party of two this was my second dinner of the evening (read my review on lago amazing) so we were kinda full and came more for drinks but we did order  the bucatini to share it was good quite spicy it had a flavorful sauce with fresh ricotta on top but what really made the dish stand out was the texture of the pasta many Italian restaurants claim to be al dente but I still find most of them to be too soft maybe it's the difference between fresh pasta vs dried but this was perfect   The atmosphere was trendy and the lights are dim the service was excellent and the view is also amazing as you can see the strip and the Bellagio fountains (however there are far better views in Vegas especially on patios)   Overall I would return but not as a must every time I'm in Vegas everything was great but nothing blew me away except maybe the service

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GS_vdV8-Jq9DFRz8U-hwpQ.text: I was waffling between 2-3 stars, so I'll share my pro-con list  Pros: - OpenTable reservation was supz easy (allowed for a drop-down selection of special event and request for window view was fulfilled) - Yelp check-in still works, prosecco (or amuse-bouche on the receipt) was bubbly and on the sweet side. Did not work for the whole table (it did in another review) - cute photo booth  - you can pay with Total Rewards/earn Total Rewards points - the salmon was good  Cons: - butternut squash soup is NOT delightful. (yes, the waiter will tell you everything's delicious and delightful, but I'm still a bit salty about this, and my mom is not the send-back-to-the-kitchen type so she just sucked it up and ate it... which it was her birthday dinner, so... sorry, mom) - the bread plate was good but also weird. no one touched the salt. were we supposed to sprinkle?  - we ordered proscuitto and burrata. and that's all that came. I guess that's just how they eat it in Italy? when I asked the waiter, he was kind enough to bring additional parm crisps and crostini, but it was just one more feature of the dinner that rubbed the wrong way - despite the OpenTable drop-down menu and the hostess double-checking that the special occasion was my mum's birthday, they forgot or maybe they just don't do anything for birthdays? based on the other yelp reviews, I figured they were just going to write Happy B-day on a plate with chocolate with two cookies. Nice sit-down restaurants usually do... something, but at that point of the dinner, I was at the "screw it" point - photo booth options (two options: no-filter and black and white; plus I may have sped-read or the instructions may be unclear, but we had to retake our photo as the email button logo was below our photo and easily looked over. i've been in other photo booths where it was more clear; ugh, complaining about a free service, I know)

EgYR_QQIWcoKK5vM0p_GjA.text: Overrated and expensive just because it's on the strip. Definitely a disappointment. I was really excited to come here, and the food was like Applebee's quality. :( Just didn't taste good.

-yyeXaKStwWz11MAGity8A.text: This is my second visit. The first time ranked among my top 5 restaurant meals ever. Thus one was only behind that because of the limited choices for my taste. That said, the bone-in Filet was outstanding as was the broccolini. Even the sorbet was great - made from real fruit with not-too-much sugar. Treat yourself!

YmKyFMpq42CWadQiSXtvLQ.text: We came here for my sister in laws birthday and it was a nice sit down restaurant off the strip. It's a busy area and the directional signage was great in trying to find the place. You get a nice view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. With the yelp check in we got a free splash prosecco. It was a decent amount and delicious. The food was small portioned for the price therefore, you get enough food without feeling too over stuffed. Our server was great, very attentive and professional.

xGv8Kps2n4Sct5xXkJHiCA.text: Eat first start off to say how amazing the view from this restaurant is!   The bottomless mimosas were wonderful, our waitress even let us have one to go.. cause Vegas! The food was okay, we had higher expectations for the food because it was Giadas restaurant. But all in all it was a wonderful experience!

FbDwI1_IVuB4DOhpMB63JQ.text: This place has nice ambience. The rosemary bread they serve in the beginning is very tasty with all the condiments with it. The food itself was not as great as expected from Giada's restaurant. My husband ordered lamb chops which were way too salty. They did replace it but as he took the first bite, the salt messed him and he got bad acid reflux with that. So when they brought the replacement, he was not able to eat it bcaz it had already messed up his system. So I feel like we wasted our money. It was not cheap, that dish itself was $60. Didn't expect this from such a place.

PhjkkGWGbdK52AHyo3n-KQ.text: This is one of my favorite places for Breakfast Must come to see the elegant Decor and the unique menu. I love the ambiance and the service is always good and fast. The food is very delicious and always fresh. My favorite is the parfait and my husband love the Breakfast pizza. Must visit when you come to Vegas !

aPiUDFjnQa748xxpG6j5kA.text: Amazing-all 5 stars  Huge open air windows overlooking Las Vegas Strip. Impeccable service Extensive menu Flavors of Italy Desserts to die for  Don't miss the opportunity to dine here!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WLJL2MZerFQmgbFRqxo1sg.text: We found both the food and service excellent. Many choices for appetizers, not as many for main courses.   The meatballs were amazing. Juicy, and very tasty. The mortadella also excellent. Just mortadella slices on a thin pizza crust but it melted in your mouth.   Main course for me was the salmon, cooked perfectly, not overdone. The side, parmasean encrusted broccoli also excellent.   One thing to note is this restaurant is very expensive. With a bottle of wine, your bill will easily exceed $200 for two people.

soAdQdE1q4aHnz47W4BLLA.text: I'll just start off by saying I love Giada so I was really nervous of being let down. Clearly not with my first 5 star review. This was our first dinner stop in Vegas, what a great start. The best part is that compared to other dinner spots this was more on the affordable side.   Food: I. Was. Not. Disappointed! My coworker got an arugula salad with the chicken meat balls. It was fresh and just what she needed after a long day. I got the sausage pizza and lemon potatoes. This was probably the best pizza I've eaten, it was fresh out of the oven, perfect one person plate and so delicious. The potatoes were nicely fried and seasoned, wish I had enough room in my belly to eat it all. When you check in you get complimentary cookies, the lemon cookie was incredible. The perfect way to end a meal. I wanted to save the best for last, freshly baked bread. I'm a sucker for bread and this was mouth watering-ly good. It comes with this cute plate of butter, pesto and some other sides.   Service: Of course there was an over hour wait so be sure to make reservations ahead of time. We just got really lucky to find a spot by the bar/ lounge which was perfect. Our waitress Lindsey was really nice,the best part was how she'd give us her personal favorites which gives it a really personal touch.   Atmosphere: it's a great dinner spot, a little on the dinner lit side but worked. Has a great view with open windows and the music choice was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Susan&#39;s pizza
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad, bread plate &amp;a lemon potatoes!

ZrQUN9gJSSR6xsMoQk2Cbw.text: Oh Ms. Chef Giada, how I love the location you have picked for your fantastic restaurant. The gorgeous view that Las Vegas provides is key to having a delicious dinner with a love one!  The minute you enter to the entrance of Giada resturant you are immediately greeted by a photographer that wants to snap some shot next to the icon signature of the restaurant. I guess the photo booth is no longer there (based on previous Yelp reviews).   You go up an escalator and ARE NOT immediately greeted by the 5 young women standing around gossiping about what they did the night before. WHY, does it take 5 young women to even check you in?? Giada, please look into this because i'm sure you overhead expenses can be spent else where.   After hearing the gossip of the 5 young women standing around, one of the woman noticed us standing there and asked if we had reservations, yes we did.   We were asked to take a seat at the bar since our table was being set up. After a couple of minutes we were seated with a breathtaking view of the Bellagio dancing fountains. We were immediately greeted by our waitress, who was a great joy! In which I forgot about the 5 young women gossiping in front of the check in desk.    The menu was descriptive and sounded delicious! I would recommend the Surf and Turf which was outstanding! Also, Giada signature cocktail was something I would order again and again, until I'm Vegas ready!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage pizza
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spah-geh-tee

iR6pSNxyLb-Emc9EJr8VhA.text: Excellent atmosphere and food was excellent! Dessert was amazing. Try the yummy Caesar Salad. Best I've had in a long time!

KwT2iy_v2pPQ4zeu8wWC7w.text: For my first trip to Las Vegas, I was adamant about making Giada's one of the places I ate at. I've watched her on TV for years and am I huge fan of Italian food, so my expectations were fairly high going in. I was going in the middle of August and made reservations online in July for just myself on a Friday night at 5pm. A week before my trip I was called to confirm my reservation, which was nice. I arrived about 20 minutes early, and was told that I would have to wait since they weren't open yet for Dinner service, which was fine and about 10 minutes til, I was the first person let in and seated giving myself a view out the windows down the strip.  The restaurant was clean and the staff was very attentive and polite, and explained everything very well. I ordered the Crab Salad Crostini and Mortadella Pizzette for Appetizers to give them a try, and I was blown away by the crab salad. It was fresh and a large serving size. I make it home now on a regular basis but its not as good as what I got. The Pizzete was good, but Not really anything special, felt like it was missing something to make it amazing. For my Entree I got the Spaghetti which came with at first glance not that much food, but once I disassembled it to eat it was quite a large serving and portion, and was one of the best pasta dishes I have ever eaten before. The Shrimp were absolutely massive and I had to cut them into quarters to eat. The Pasta was as I'd expect and cooked perfect with some kind of magical cheese lemon sauce that was just incredible.   The prices were no different than the city where I live, I expected them to be a bit higher to be honest so that was ok as well. Overall having been one of the best food experiences I had while in Vegas, I would almost go back to Vegas just to eat there. If you have the time and like a good atmosphere, I would highly recommend eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Salad Crostini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Spaghetti

7UByC-Bonk_XAIekH2o40w.text: At this rate .... I'm ready to leave. We sat down at 8:45 with an 8pm reservation...  ordered food at 9:10pm and it is now 9:58pm.... still no food. I'm saddened to watch people around me eat and enjoy their food + dessert but yet, I'm being filled with excuses like "sorry, there's a party of 40 and the kitchen is running behind." Personally, I'm only here because my cousins wife has watched Giada on the food network and originally scheduled a reservation for us, this was more mandatory... but for the price and experience it was ok...

1qXVc2j0B7sQGtheAPgEag.text: Giada far exceeded our expectations as far as ambiance is concerned. It is absolutely beautiful inside from the moment you climb the stairs to the hostess stand. We were fortunate enough to get a window seat and the view is amazing. I just loved the experience...the tableware, the open windows, the lighting. It was beautiful!   The food wasn't as good as I wanted it to be. We got the caponata which I was very excited about because it's my favorite part of Christmas dinner. It was MUCH different than our family recipe and I actually much prefer ours. We did receive a lovely bread basket with options to top our breads with. The lemon butter is delicious!   I got pasta which was described as being served with lemon, basil and shrimp. I opted to have it without the shrimp. My server asked if I preferred chicken. I told him I preferred no protein. He seemed annoyed which annoyed me. I did receive it without shrimp, however, it was served in a cream sauce which I was very upset about because I wasn't feeling well and was purposely staying away from creams and cheeses. I feel like a cream sauce should be announced on a menu. It was good but VERY al dente. We like al dente pasta but it was on the verge of just being uncooked. We got Giada's favorite cookies for dessert which were great because we could take the leftovers with us!   Our server was ok. He got the job done but he wasn't warm or welcoming. The atmosphere at Giada's is worth a visit alone! So many delicious things on the menu that I would want to try in the future. We would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another beautiful view from our table!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bellagio fountain show from our table!!!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Modern day bread basket...

_PJOrlDqPl1eflXkbj0SKw.text: A group of us went here for a work dinner. I'm a huge fan, so I was really excited to taste Giada's tasty treats. We had everything that came highly recommended by our waiter: Chicken Marsala Meatballs, Tomato Arancini, Bacon Wrapped Dates and Bucatini. The taste did not disappoint! everything was so yummy. I left thinking I couldn't wait to return. So why the 2 star rating? Well the next morning, I woke up with a massive, itchy rash on my backside. I really thought it was just me, but I was not the only one. Rashes on different parts of our bodies. Leading me to wonder, what was in the food that caused a reaction???

FTkCZEKfmlCdrJdPDrhytQ.text: My Husband and I were visiting friends in Vegas for his Birthday. I am a big fan of Giada's cooking style and wanted to go for dinner. Our friends made a reservation for Tuesday evening. We arrived and were immediately seated at a lovely table next to the window over;looking the strip. Our waiter promptly brought us water and menus. The menu was beautiful, many choices made it difficult to decide what to order! The wine list is extremely impressive as well. We ordered a bottle of the J bubbles and an order of the stuffed dates and artichoke for appetizers. The artichoke was delicious and perfectly prepared, as were the dates. For entree's I chose the Lobster and Kale ravioli, it was one of the best , flavorful ravioli's I have had.  The sauce and the pieces of lobster were delicious! The Risotto with crab and scallops that my friend had was also amazing. All of the dinners were exceptional! The highlight of the evening was the great service from the Sommelier, He was personable, knowledgeable and truly made the night a great experience!  Giada's will definitely be a destination for us whenever we are in Vegas!

IjlRm4Q5QgIu2ajLiNUj0w.text: So excited to be at Giana's restaurant. It's an airy and open kitchen venue. We had a little issue finding the right table at first but the hostess with a little extra effort eventually found us a table that was suitable.  Our waiter,  Valentino was very personable and professional. The menu starts with either a tasting menu which consisted of antipasto, pasta, entree and desert or an ala carts menu which for one who has a hard time making decisions seemed overwhelming. With the help of Valentino- we went for the tasting.   The antipasto was tasty olives, spicy cheese stuffed figs and a small meatball. The crackle bread/ bread with pesto, salt, butter and hot pepper was to die for. My angel hair pasta with shrimp small plate was delicious. My husband loved his penne bolognese.   By the time we got to the entree, I for one was full. My salmon was cooked to my liking but not particularly special and spoiler alert....My husband's lamb entree was quite dry. When we told Valentino he was truly saddened and offered to get a new one. We explained there was no need but felt it important that the chef know. He promised to share our critic.   Not being dessert lovers we skipped the beautiful dessert cart and instead we hade a cappuccino which was creamy and delicious and  delivered a large bowl each of natures perfect sugar... berries which were fresh and very satisfying.   Without prompting  the manager came over to our table to express his deep apology for the disappointing lamb and gave a generously large discount off the cost of one dinner. That was never asked for but greatly appreciated.   Oh and we made sure not to miss the photo both on the way out.   All in all I think it was a great experience and we would do it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel hair and shrimp tasting menu.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread assortment
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasto from tasting menu

e7Ud15s2Kz1xu98ak6mjWw.text: Sorry Giada. I'm going to compare my experience here with my experience at the lunch you hosted in Los Angeles several years ago (which was perfection). Some things just fell short this time around... Like your photo booth. Don't forget to fix that =)  I visited Giada's restaurant and tried the tasting menu. This menu was made up of some of Giada's favorites. Service and food was good. Not mind blowing, however. Giada is pricey and I can't 100% recommend it to everyone. I'd say, check them out for brunch if it's your first visit. You'll invest less money and those chicken and waffles look amazing.  TASTING MENU Bread platter - cool presentation. *Tip: put this aside and eat it if you still have room later. Practically everything else they will serve you is more worthy of your stomach space.   Rigatoni - pasta cooked right. tasty sauce. good dish  Grilled squid - this one was a disappointment. This dish seemed pretty ordinary. The flavor just wasn't right.  Even the texture wasn't what I had hoped for. I had this dish before at a lunch Giada hosted and it was AMAZING. I'm guessing that it is usually better as i have also heard how great this is from others.  Corn Side dish - really tasty. At this point, however, i was getting full and i couldn't enjoy this as much as i'd have liked to.   Crispy Potatoes - good but not as good as the corn.   Wagyu beef short rib - very tender. ok same problem here as the corn. I was full at this point and couldn't enjoy this one that well. Don't get me wrong, i finished every last bit of it haha.   Dessert Cart - Three is a great number Giada.  In fact, it's my favorite. But when you bring such a beautiful cart around, you can't limit us to JUST three items. One of each item sounds appropriate, right?   **COFFEE - After I finished dessert, i was asked if i would like coffee. I assumed this was included so i just went ahead and ordered. Had i known that it wasn't, I definitely would not have ordered this. The drink itself was fine but i had been full three plates ago. Plus, the coffee isn't cheap. Careless on my part, but putting this in case anyone else has the same situation.   SERVICE I like how they let me customize a lot of my order. After looking at the regular menu, I saw some things that I really wanted to try. These weren't options on the tasting menu but they had no problem substituting them in. I even modified the cocktail I ordered.   I also appreciate being seated at the table with the best fountain view. *Note: the restaurant is still only on the 2nd floor and therefore part of the view is obstructed by a bridge.   PARKING I ended up parking at Flamingo's parking structure. Parking is free there and it is a very close walk to Giadas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bellagio fountains across the street
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gH6O5cT9DleCivBNtRM4Kg.text: Went here recently while in Vegas, and I'm so glad we did. We went for dinner and had a table overlooking the Bellagio fountains during sunset; absolutely beautiful. Our server was very knowledgeable with the restaurant and very attentive. There wasn't one time my glass was half full nor not having food on my plate. We ordered quite a few things; the bacon wrapped dates, ricotta crostini, meat and cheese platter (amazing), romaine salad, shrimp spaghetti, lobster ravioli, limoncello souffle, assorted cookies, and rose. Overall, everything was delicious. I would definitely come back and recommend it to anyone.

mbRQcpStialsgwJBOEUpGw.text: I love this place!   I've come 3 times on 3 different trips to vegas and order something different each time.....   except for one thing.   The bacon wrapped dates stuffed with sausage.   Probably the best little bite of food I've ever had!

x2Mn4IPy3wOSeobC6zdX-A.text: Brunch review.  Let me just start off by saying that I have waited and always wanted to try her restaurant, because who doesn't enjoy a good Italian dish? I know I do!  If you're planning to visit, reservations would probably make your life easier. We arrived for late brunch, around noon and there was still a 30 minute wait. But we actually got seated at around 45minute mark. Now that's well and fine things happened, but at least acknowledge your guest that things are running late. No they don't have a mobile messaging system to let you know that tables are ready.   Service was a fail for me. If you claim to be a higher end dining place then the level of expectation is obviously different. We were seated and wasn't acknowledged for about 15 mins, no menu, water, hi hello how are you, nope none. We were invisible people. Mind you our table was still a bit dirty from previous service. Ugh.  And then our server finally arrived, she was nice.   We ordered Burrata, they ran out. Ordered another dish.  Timing was off, just when we were served our bread & cheese platter. A server comes running in wanting to serve entree. Uhm. No.  Food was underwhelming, my heart was so broken I was expecting more from Giada. It's her only restaurant so I figured she was on top of her game with QC control  App: Mozarella with chili pesto - was bland there was no heat and the basil was non existent  Orzo Meatballs was average  Muffalada, lacked olives was bland  G's baked pasta, I kid you not, the Rao's bottled pasta sauce tastes way better  Sangria, white was one dimensional  Lemonade was tasty the first time we got it, it had club soda and maybe basil in it the refill was just plain lemonade.  Both $6. Beyond pissed when we saw the bill. Oh and it took forever to get a refill, yes we knew it was not bottomless. Our server just disappeared over yonder somewhere  Paying our bill took another 15-20mins  Interior design looks amazing, minimalistic chic and modern. That's the only star otherwise they'd get 1.  If ever you're in LA, try Osteria Mozza, Italian food done right and spot on service

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YZSPmVD1H8HnrUC151T8Gg.text: My meal was amazingly flavorful and the view of the Bellagio fountains was spectacular, especially when they opened the windows to the strip. So worth it!

aG0x9GTT66Dzl4UYJo3Beg.text: Food and service was good. Beautiful restaurant.  Wish the Groupon wasn't so limited but worth a good start to try.  Cromwell charges for parking, not a fan of that. So on top of everything I had to pay $10 to park and walk.  Groupon I got is per person Incase u try the same deal.  Do recommend a reservation

yAdqthuehmRPBSNaOBKMfQ.text: The Branzino was amazing and worth every penny. The bread starter was great and so was the cacio e Pepe, but would come back for the branzino!

fryfZ8WacjwhnGRwI6H9QA.text: I was surprised by our experience at Giada's at the Cromwell.   We were greeted at the top of the escalator to the restaurant and invited to take a pic in their photo booth.   It was a cheesy photo booth that just appeared to make the beginning of our dining experience questionable.   The waiting area had dirty furniture.   We were seated fairly quickly in the dining room where my husbands couch/booth style seat was too low, so the table was at his mid-chest area, so he looked like a little kid at the table.  He is 6 ft tall, so it was just odd.   I was in a chair on the other side, so the table fit me well.   Our server, Carlos, immediately attempted the up-sell with full dinner experience and menu cards that we could take home, but we did not see the need fo that much food.   Once we ordered, we never saw him again, but received good service from who I think was our water glass filler.   I don't think Carlos was too interested since we didn't order the expensive dining plan.    We started with the bacon wrapped dates.   We received about 5 which was ok, but they were much sweeter than I thought they would be.    I wished the sweet and salty had a little more balance.   I share pics of our complimentary bread plate with olive and rosemary breads.   The breads were good, but pairings were odd.   The pesto was good, but the rest seemed like a waste.   The parings included salt, crushed red peppers and fried capers.   Our dinner pasta plates were good.   My husbands food was a little too spicy, and the portions were small, but a good size for one person.   The atmosphere was so noisy that we could not hear each other.   I guess I had expected more of an upscale calm dining environment.   We laughed as we watched the couple at the next table try to talk to each other and gave up, too because it was so noisy.   In the end, I do not regret going, but would never recommend it.   Feeling disappointed as i watch Giada cooking shows so much.   I probably will not watch as much now.   Oh, and there is no view of the fountains at the Bellagio even though that was in the summary on the webpage for the restaurant.   The view is blocked by the walkway that goes over the Vegas strip.

pp9oBZZvSvjTwI_v38LN5g.text: We enjoyed a wonderful meal here. We arrived early before our reservation, so we were able to have a drink at the bar while we waited. It gave us a chance to absorb the atmosphere and observe the beautiful dishes going by. We started with the meat and cheese platter - delicious! I had the spaghetti and my boyfriend had the eggplant stack - both were delicious, but his eggplant stack was truly incredible!

u0PE99lQ-noaLyG1BgCjOg.text: giada excels at presentation. restaurant is beautiful - even outside the restaurant, there are beautiful images of giada and info about her. there's a really cool photo booth. giada also excels at customer service, our waiter explained everything, checked on us several times, folded our towels every time we got out, bathroom and the interior immaculate. food is really really expensive. portions are small, and to be honest, don't taste very good. it's too heavy on cream, and not bursting with flavor. i enjoyed mesa much more. in terms of presentation, it's incredible. rockefeller oysters served on top of a bed of salt, spaghetti whirled up, the ribeye was a tomahawk, but the meat itself was surprisingly small (14oz for 28oz tomahawk)  cool experience, but if you're hungry, you better have really deep pockets. go to mesa and thank me later

7ZQkQoQ9TLnd__aP1Ew2vg.text: Sat at the bar and was served by Beau the bartender. Great customer service! Food was great and so were the drinks. Definitely coming back!

4DNyAJOT1vFDpBx0x2HUZg.text: Horrible experience tonight, embarrassing to say the least as I recommended this place and invited my father here for his birthday. After eating the appetizer ,bacon wrapped dates,I became very sick, I ended up throwing up in the handicap stall in the bathroom. I couldn't eat one bite of my dinner that I had ordered. I have been here several times before but the waiter Diego was not compassionate towards us at all. It wad evident with his body language and lack of communication I tried to put myself in his shoes what if he was having a bad day but he really was just awful. I should of complained to the manager but I didn't. Hope Diego stops acting snooty and all high and mighty. Worst night ever.

d3B__Nc9KPikLwzkYB0zCw.text: I must live under a rock, but I didn't know this was a celebrity-chef restaurant until we were already there. The branding was a bit much: "Giada" on the napkins, the plates, the walls, the light fixtures, I could go on. Even the after-dinner espresso drink featured a cocoa-powder "g."  We decided to eat here before seeing Absinthe. We had another restaurant in mind, but the wait was an hour and a half, so we changed our plans. We were seated right away at Giada, which we appreciated.  For both Italian food and the best service, I prefer Nora's or, if you want to eat on The Strip, Osteria Costa in the Mirage.   That said, my husband did say that the meatballs were pretty good--which is praise from my Italian American honey--and he said his lobster ravioli were excellent. I think he enjoyed his food more than I did, but I have some dietary restrictions.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RRLI70UyBJUaPKcEI3fx4w.text: Amazing!! Best brunch I've ever had period. I have been wanting to go since it opened but finally got to go two years later. Everything was so good. Great service! Giada has a great staff and food was amazing!

igjhZLD4Or11VB7L-Tkixg.text: We went there a year a go and the food was good so we were excited to go back. This time around was good but service was slow and un attentive. Seems like they are understaffed

6Tf3jcHVmcZ19gdp7OJNzg.text: I think I had a one-off experience this round because my mom raved about her experience in January and she was not impressed this time. Our service was terrible. We never got water refills or asked if we wanted more wine. Our server was hard to flag down and get to our table. He finally dropped off our check and disappeared for 20 more minutes. I finally saw him, had to get up, and asked him to come to our table.   The food was delicious. We got a lot of apps because we didn't want a full stomach before going out. Most notable-- The Chicken Marsala Meatballs were great but my mom said the portion size had shrunk since she had them a few months ago. We also had the spinach buffalo ricotta pizette. YUM!!   The ambience is great if you're sitting in the main dining area. The dessert cart was a little much. It couldn't fit through the tables and kept hitting my chair. Really annoying.   I'm giving this review 4/5 stars in hopes that this isn't normal service.

zIAPtDIR7D9qu5oav5CZ_w.text: I was disappointed by the food.  As a fan of Giada's on the food network, I expected a lot more from it.  The cheese platter I ordered was good and the bartenders were friendly which is why I have it 3 stars , but the main course I got was pretty forgettable and overall just not good.

2issd6brXqb2hjIUjKx2DQ.text: Best meal of my life!!! The restaurant is beautiful! The staff are so nice and so helpful..... And then the meal!!! Everything was amazing and the portion we're perfect!!! We had the dinner tasting menu and it amazing!!! We were able to try so many things and the dessert was the icing on the cake!! We got to choose 3 dessert options each!! Beyond amazing and I will definetly go back on my next trip to Vegas!!
