4UEFuMCGTTLgWUiutyWLww.text: For years, my husband and I have been using Giada's recipes for holiday dinners. We love her cookbooks and were very excited to try her restaurant while visiting Vegas today.  The hosts and wait staff were very personable and the decor was nice. However, I was extremely disappointed with the food. The orzo meatballs were just okay. They weren't hot and lacked flavor. My gnocchi also lacked flavor and I couldn't finish it because it was so bland. I tried my husband's carbonara pizza and it was good, but not spectacular. We decided to order the donuts for dessert, though I was disappointed by this point and didn't expect much. Surprisingly, the donuts were good.  I really, really wanted to like this place! No, actually, I wanted to walk away from there confirming that Giada was the awesome chef I had envisioned, but sadly it did not live up to my expectations. (And it's not cheap).

Q-O9HKa5UX8YoAVPdJ_Pog.text: Service from host and waiter was excellent. Front desk was friendly and accommodating. We have our 9 month son and they provided us with a clean high chair and set us along the window with a view. The waiter recommended their version of the Old Fashion and definitely one for the books. For entree I ordered they Spicy Sausage Pizza. You could tell all the ingredients were fresh and made in house. Full of flavor and very good! Must try for all pizza lovers. It is on the pricey side but well worth it.

hdy71hgBb6xrrJpvyLJC7w.text: Definitely 5 star dining!  We couldn't decide on what we wanted so we chose from a special menu which pretty much allowed us to try several items off the menu and everything on the dessert side, making it a memorable evening.  Also can't forget the service.  Everyone was super nice .  Paul was outstanding!

P5mzKCkZ98ACVoP1NlRbAg.text: The service was delightful.  The restaurant was beautiful.  The food less than good.  Have a drink and dessert and skip the dinner.

aZj78qHbNEbAwVPmjhpVqw.text: The restaurant is beautiful and walking through the restaurant to the window table was special.  The magic ended there. The servers were trying to be nice, but they struggled. The portions, like lovely Giada are petite and cute but for me, lacked imagination and ultimately satisfaction. If i find myself in Vegas again I would go there, but I would sit at the bar and enjoy the dried meats, cheeses and olives.  And, more bread please.

jWfezJmoiqj2QXwfb_SlkA.text: Reserve a table if you want to come here & if you can request one by the window for a gorgeous view of the strip. Unfortunately our party was too big for a window seat but they managed to give us a table close to the window with a great view regardless. Also make sure you're on time for your reservation because they will give it away if you're late. There's a free photo booth you can snap some cute pictures in while you're waiting for your table to be ready.  This is a very nice restaurant so you have to realize the prices are high ($30+ for a plate of spaghetti) & the portions are small. Don't be fooled though, despite how small my meal looked when it arrived by the end of the night I was full. Our waiter was very friendly, they bring you a drink menu on an ipad & after your order drinks you get your food menu. Constantly refilling our water glasses & making sure we had everything we needed. A bread platter with different types of bread & spreads is brought out while you wait. I ordered the risotto with crab & scallops & I was in heaven. Perfectly cooked, flavorful & rich. I tried to savor every bite & was sad when I got to my last forkful. For dessert I tried their fresh fruit tart which that night was made with glazed apricots. TO DIE FOR. We ordered 3 different desserts & out of all of them the fruit tart is the one I'd recommend to anyone.   Can't wait to come back here whenever i get the chance to vacation in vegas again !

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto, a glass of wine, &amp; one of their signature cocktails.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apricot fruit tart

ukwhUFOeT09NgjtuDoIE0A.text: I came here when they first opened and all I remember is the service being absolutely horrific. Fast forward a few years and I decided to try again. Service this time had greatly improved; we had an attentive and friendly waiter.   Wine list selection by the glass is just OK; the brunello vintage was that of a poor year but yet overpriced per glass ($24).   Food was OK. We started with one cheese, the mushrooms, and the romaine salad. The cheese was fantastic, paired with the bread. The salad was great (romaine) with a fantastic lemony Caesar dressing. The mushrooms were very cold and had a weird flavor with slabs of cold cheese on top. Next, we had the rigatoni, risotto, side of potatoes and Brussels sprouts. The rigatoni was pretty great and I loved the risotto. But the sides were both cold, and lacked flavor. The Brussels  sprouts were so fried they were completely black and limp.  For dessert, we had the cookie platter and limoncello souffle. The cookies were ok. The lemon were great, and that's about it. The souffle didn't really have any sort of limoncello flavor - it just tasted more like a vanilla souffle.  All in all, I appreciated the refined service from last visit, but I probably wouldn't return. The food is just too inconsistent.

8PUd-Iyudf3imjFC9QPNpg.text: I felt very fortunate that during a very busy week of business in LV, I was able to dine at Giada's. The atmosphere is cozy, we were seated at a window seat with an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains. Our server was helpful, however I wasn't crazy about the drinks being presented on an ipad. Perhaps more volume is gained with this presentation, but it took away from the atmosphere for me. The food was great-loved the octopus, Bolognese, charcuterie, wine list was good. The giant red pepper grinder and photo booth were just plain FUN!

6YpYLg_CRo27yNetUQCBLg.text: Went there for Valentine's Day  Brunch.  The restaurant decor itself and all of the service ware - linens, stemware, plates, etc are GORGEOUS! It must be fun to have a BIG Budget!   Photo booth is a fun distraction when waiting for your table - and a smart little marketing tool to boot!  Orzo Meatballs were delicious as was the Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese. The buttermilk gelato with raspberry sandwiched between lemon cookies made for a simply divine dessert! A highlight of our weekend's culinary escapades! I will say, however that the plate could have used a bit of decoration/garnish - maybe a mint leaf or a raspberry drizzle. Just a little extra effort.   When it came to service and pacing of our meal, they really came up short. The staff were friendly but scattered. The meatballs seemed to fly out of the kitchen / and everything else after just crawled. We were in vacation mode - and it was still jarringly slow! My coffee - that I ordered once I realized the Prosecco Sangria was just sparkling wine poured over under ripened fruit - no infusion, macerating or flavor imparted by the fruit whatsoever - was Never refilled (despite a very slow meal!) it was overpriced but that kind of comes with the territory. And I know they are going for a minimalist vibe but if you are serving egg dishes, I think you should have salt and pepper on the table.   Of course I would go back - because it Is such s well decorated spot - and I love Giada!

gCJFmViEvjezZOSJPBBiaQ.text: I was expecting amazing and got average at best.  Went for a final meal in Vegas for brunch.  I had the brunch sampler which started with an assortment of cured meats, mushrooms, and pastries.  All started well and tasted great.  Next course was the main and I chose lasagne.  My other diners chose the chicken and waffles.  Unfortunately this where it really fell,short.  The lasagne was flavorless and had zero depth. It tasted like a deli lasagne at the local supermarket reheated. I was very disappointed.  The others who had the chicken and waffles liked the seasoning buy the chicken was extremely dry.  The desert was the souffle.  It was good but not great.   Service was fairly attentive but the speed of our meals was at a snail pace.  It took at least an hour to get our entrees.  Got the price and quality I would pass.

c4ocNn66Zrr181w5y99eLA.text: Great meal.  Group of five and we did our meal family style.....outstanding!  The pastas, especially the risotto were fantastic.

HJ78c2isFpVYdYovqp3LRg.text: Very disappointing.   Salad and bread was good as was service.  Did the flight of three pastas .  The spaghetti was the best of the three but  nothing to write home about .  Second one was called bucatini ... the pasta was over cooked and the sauce was like a Franco American canned pasta I remember as a kid ... yuck.  The last one Pappardelle had a very watery sauce with no flavor .  I am being generous giving this place two stars .. mainly for service and like said the salads I tried were both good .   If you go do not go for Pasta ... YUCK!

L1bVRK6gDNsS7K4GHtr7yA.text: What a great experience! From start to finish. Went in with some friends to celebrate my birthday and Giada did not disappoint. Everyone was really nice and they made me feel like i was at home. I want to thank my server Ron for guiding us through the menu and giving us great recommendations. The surf and turf was my favorite so I posted a pic. I can't wait to come back and try some more food!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf

yAjLP_XcSUwOlR3zz5zDuw.text: How could anyone NOT give Giada's a 5 star...this place is AMAZING!! I've had the pleasure of dinning here on two separate occasions. The first was for my birthday in which my honey called to inquire if they had a table with a view he could reserve. His wish was their command. The manager, Michael and the entire serving staff were incredibly gracious in accommodating his request and making me feel special! Our view was SPECTACULAR!!   Another SPECTACULAR element?...anything and everything you eat here. Seriously! The food is beyond flavorful; its rich without being too much or overwhelming. Everything is balanced and included with a purpose. My honey and I tried a couple appetizers...the calamari (oh mah gawd) is a must, the meatballs (yes please) are uniquely her (Giada) own. The pasta dishes are delightful! All of their pasta and bread are freshly made in-house.   In my second experience I was able to try their polenta waffles from their brunch menu. Talk about scrumptious. The texture and flavor was way beyond what I was expecting. Home run with this one chef!! I decided to continue my sweet craving by sampling the Lemon Ricotta cookies...these were perhaps one of the most delicious cookies I've ever eaten in my LIFE!!!   There are so many wonderful aspects of this restaurant. I can't speak highly enough of all of the staff, from the beautiful hostesses to the servers and chefs, to their incredibly friendly management. The ambience is chic and classy, not at all pretentious for being located on one of, if not the hottest corners on the Strip! I understand that the prices may seem a bit overwhelming for some, however, its VEGAS...on the Strip!! You get what you pay for and that is a beautiful dinner, awesome dinning experience, and exquisite food!!

2m9zRT8v7iaaVXZ8KFel8A.text: $6 for a coke! Don't walk... run!!!

8SXEqMSdWgH79JbWCBItCg.text: So disappointed!! Came here for Mother's Day and what a joke. We heard that the food was good but we're obviously expecting something this place doesn't understand or care about. With all the competition in Vegas, we won't be back

Y_qX5bhcCCmbswNN8tTWgw.text: Restaurant was nice, waiter was a bit condescending but we were a bit fiesty ourselves so I guess you have to expect that in Vegas. I would have given it 5 stars based on the food alone, because it was very good but the drinks were extremely overpriced without much to do -even for Vegas (again expected.) Overall a very nice experience, great views of the strip as well!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli, rich and tasty!!

krLcWIMYPT2Gj7HxF3LZQg.text: Forget it. Hugely disappointing.  Everything bland. Sent back a cold pasta. Lamb chops came out raw. Then over cooked and bland. Bent fork, doesn't someone check these things? Chicken catcatore bland. Salad came with the entree, even after mentioning it while we were having our other appetizers. Veal saltimbocca came out more veal parmesan. Forgot to bring us our sides. They apologized by taking off the messed up items, and bought dessert, but still not right.  And Giada is even here!!!

aP1QrMrnqlU2d86wWang3Q.text: This place was great my husband was a little hesitant about coming here but we decided to come on a Tuesday morning around 930 for breakfast we were seated quickly out on the patio we had a gorgeous view except it was a little windy but it's OK we were still able to enjoy our breakfast the food was pretty good, I have the strawberry waffles with the meatballs on the side that were actually pretty good I thought it was a little weird to pair meatballs with the waffle LOL but I guess that's what giada is known for overall it was pretty good I'm sure we will go back next time we're in Vegas

CtOGTtDRgivQ4j6BiODJaA.text: We had Lindsay as our server and she made the experience a memory that we will cherish. I took my mother to the restaurant and have always wanted to eat there. The food was fantastic, but when you have service like Lindsay provided, it takes things to a whole new level. Thank you so much. And every time I go to Vegas, Giada's will be a must.

Hq9zKINmKAYZhWVM4LLBcw.text: A co-worker and I came here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  The restaurant is nicely decorated, modern but warm, and it has a nice view of the busy strip if you get a table next to the window.  Overall, we enjoyed the dinner but there are misses.  We decided on the tasting menu and have them do the wine pairings.  From the tasting menu, we enjoyed the tortellini and spaghetti.  The filet entree is also decent.  The appetizer is not anything special.  We ordered a plate of cheese and salami which they bring out a slice of Taleggio and some Cacciatore Tartufo.  I liked it but my co-worker did not.  The desserts that came with the tasting is a selection of their desserts.  The wines that they paired with the tasting is a miss.  We ended up ordering a bottle.  The Giada and Hannibal cocktails are tasty.    Our server was good and tried hard to give us good service.  The manager came over to introduce himself.  I'll come back to this restaurant for specific items and drinks/wines.  I'll reassess my rating if I get a chance to come back.  Their wines list are low to average wines so the prices are less expensive with some good labels.

DioIMDvNFPPpsQRsIa1Dpw.text: We made reservations but had to wait for 40 minutes despite arriving on time.  There was a lack of contact and follow up by the staff.   After we were seated, we waited again until at last our very competent waiter arrived. The iPad Menu we were given was dirty and at only 5% power, displaying the "charge needed" message.  It was also confusing as we wondered was this the entire menu?  How do we do this?  Do we order directly thru the iPad?   No, this was the more pricey appetizers and drinks menu.  Later we were given "real" menus and a wine list.  OK!  Now we know what to do!   Time goes by....at last we order and also order wine.  (We had no show to attend afterward so we weren't in a hurry.  Good thing.) Before our appetizer arrived we finally received the bread tray.  We were wondering..... (Why is there flavored salt included when clearly everything on the tray was already salty except the pesto?  I mean really salty. Oh well.) The single freshly baked rosemary roll was delicious and we split it.  The very salty lavosh (sp?) and grissini were also nice. Our appetizer, salads and entrees were outstanding, except for the Rigolotto which was dull.  THIS is why I returned and brought a new guest!  We shared tastes and then enjoyed our dessert and coffee. Yes, I will probably return but will bear in mind that it's the squeaky wheel that may get the attention here.

-sT6nxLAK_tskROEmN-k2A.text: Had breakfast here.  Food was ok, not great.  Overpriced for what you get, but you can expect that in Vegas.  Underwhelmed.

wkjUnYYe3dJQqu4EXcHDHQ.text: Incredible gluten free pasta!!! A must try for all celiac and gluten intolerances out there! Service was excellent and charcuterie board was top notch. Definitely recommend!

BtzApul725dxnKYFNi9V8g.text: I was hoping for a better visit but unfortunately the customer service left me quite disappointed. I made a reservation for 215pm awhile before my visit to Las Vegas as I didn't know how long it would take me to get here from the airport. I figured it better to be early rather than late.   I arrived to the restaurant well ahead of my reservation around 1pm. I checked in with the hostess and asked if it were possible to get seated right away or if I should come back closer to my reservation. She told me to take a seat on the sofa and that she could get me seated within 30 minutes. I saw that the restaurant was pretty empty so I figured I would get seated soon. After about forty minutes the hostess came and told me it would be another minute. A few moments later a different hostess came out and said it would be about another 5-10 minutes. At this point it was basically my reservation time and I wish they had told me up front to just come back later. However they gave me a window table which was nice.   My waitress came pretty fast and gave me a menu, however I informed her that I had a Groupon. I placed my order and the waitress suggested a souffle so I decided to get that as well. The food came out after a bit of a wait but seemed to taste good so I was impressed at first. That is until I started to get halfway through my plate and noticed egg shells in the dish. I informed the waitress who simply laughed and said she would go yell at the chef. There was no apology or sincerity towards the matter!   I wish I had a better experience here as I has high expectations. However their service definitely needs improvement.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fyn1DVZzvQfAFewSSn9n_A.text: Being a fan of Giada for years, my husband and I visited the restaurant during his birthday weekend recently and sat at the bar to enjoy and experience some of the offerings at the restaurant.  Once we were seated, Beau greeted us warmly and asked if we would like to get anything to drink.  We took a few moments to review the drink offerings. We each ordered a drink ( my husband had a Bellisimo and I an Aperol Spritz) and then a few minutes later ordered some appetizers to start off (Bacon wrapped Dates and Margherita Pizza).  We enjoyed both of those appetizers as well as the bread and condiment toppings that were provided.  Towards the end of enjoying our appetizers, my husband and I had realized that other customers around  us (two gentlemen to my right, a single lady to my husband's left and three sets of couples/ or friends along the other bar) were being asked by Beau and his co-workers if there was anything else they wanted while only our water glasses were being refilled on occasion.  We tried to get his attention at times but to no avail finally gave up after about 20 minutes and asked for our check in hopes that he would have asked if we were interested in anything else, which he did not. With the check in hand to sign I asked for the dessert menu to see if he may ask if we wanted to order anything. After mentioning we wanted to see what was available for ordering and mentioning how I would have liked to try the tiramisu, he made no acknowledgement or effort to see if we would reconsider not closing the bill and trying a dessert dish.    At that point we were a little disheartened,  I signed the check and we left.  Unfortunately it felt as though we were not appreciated at the time because we had only ordered drinks and appetizers and not a larger order.   I did manage to get in contact with management to express our disappointment at the end of the dining experience. I must say that Stephanie was very gracious in listening while I described the situation and provided appreciation for the candor.  It was a welcome experience to speak with restaurant management that showed concern and was willing to go above and beyond (which was unnecessary) to help rectify the situation when all I wanted was for my experience to be heard.

EjMFqvr1AJla-IeacLpTPw.text: So good, very nice dinner spot in Vegas. Went on Saturday night, pretty busy, but the staff was great and the food was amazing. Had some drinks in the bar, bartenders were super nice, the drinks were great.  Dinner was so good, food was top quality, everything we ordered was great. Bread was good, pizza was very fresh and tasted so good, the calamari was fresh, my scallop risotto was amazing, so yummy.  Prices were average for a nicer place on the strip. The food portions were fine, and the presentation was great.  I cant wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hhp450VRaAt_MFkgiHpOhQ.text: This was a culinary delight from beginning to end. Forget strip shows or escorts, the bacon wrapped dates are the real sinful treat in this town. Baby sweet peppers, marinated olives and an addicting Caesar salad. No one believed the rigatoni was vegetable bolognese - so rich and satisfying, they swore it was meat. The spaghetti was spicy and hurt later, but worth it!   The salmon with English pea and salumi calabrese ragu was a hit with everyone. The rest of our table enjoyed the filet and fried chicken. The lemon potatoes and sweet corn with spicy sausage complemented the entrees perfectly.  I started out the meal with a refreshing cocktail (with aperol, strawberry and basil) and a Cab the sommelier suggested that enhanced our meal perfectly.  A+ night.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hLTKON1HHmELMc9-CSz-wQ.text: Stunning affluent Italian dining experience by Giada De Laurentiis. Amazingly delicious menu to try and enjoy. Loved every single bite of my appetizer platters, entrees and lemon cookies at the end. The place is so elegant and stunningly decorated. Everything is perfectly appointed, from glasses to decorations, from napkins to the way you are being serviced. Everything has a purpose and carefully situated. Very Giada. :) Everyone is attentive and committed to high quality dining experience.   The food is 5 stars. The place is 5 stars. The presentation in 5 stars. You totally feel how your celebrity chef cooked the meal for you. I enjoyed my olives and antipasti starter a lot. Beautiful selection of wine. Service was just as wonderful as my server. What an elegant and tasteful dining experience. My kind regards to Giada. Beautiful!  Prices: $$$ Ambiance: dress up and feel like celebrity. Reservations: highly recommended. Bonus: Take a photo with Giada's signature in the photo booth while waiting or after dinner.

E4wkXfas4gwABs4MQHZzvg.text: There was a hair in our salad. We paid $55 for 3 course meal and found a hair in the salad.  Otherwise food was good but we don't expect to see hair in such fancy and expensive restaurant  Update: Nobody replies when you send email to the email id that they provide in review response. I sent email twice to the email id mentioned but nobody cared to reply. Its been more than a month now.

OTb9SBCqUSq-AAX0zNDegQ.text: We had such an amazing experience here! Our waiter Gary was so wonderful, great at recommending and made sure our celebration was top notch! The drinks were great, the oyster crudo was so fresh, and of course the pastas were delectable! Thanks for a wonderful and memorable dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
