bNYov3rVdxvqzGQGVGZQXw.text: I was apprehensive about coming here because of some of the reviews.       We were told we would need to sit in the bar are due to the reservations at the dining tables. It was 530 on and no one was actually really at any of the tables unless they were invisible.    We sat at the bar and were pleasantly surprised at the hospitality of Bo and Ricky. A) They were adorably handsome. B) Exceptionally polite and amazing customer service. My mother can be a pain in the butt, but they were so sweet.  C) Great recommendations on food.     I feel like if I died tomorrow, I'd be ok because this would be an amazing last prison meal. Super weird description, I know, but everything was impeccable!    I think next time I eat here, I'll wear super stretchy pants, because I'm so full and might slip into a food coma.

cOXl41oIe5EZ0V_yU6pDEQ.text: I went on a girl's trip to Vegas and we wanted to try out Giada's. We had a reservation and were seated very quickly by a very friendly hostess. This is notable because we dined at Hell's Kitchen another night and waited 40 minutes beyond our reservation time and the hosts were less than hospitable. After looking at the menu, we all decided on the tasting menu. The courses were hit and miss. We started with the antipasti platter and went off the tasting menu to add an order of arancini. The antipasti was excellent. The bread was warm and soft and I don't know how they did it but the butter was miles better than any butter I've ever had. The pesto was also fantastic. The arancini were a disappointment. They were flavorless. For the second course, I had the lemon cream spaghetti. The shrimp was cooked perfectly and the spaghetti was delicious. My third course was the petit filet. This was probably my least favorite course. The steak, ordered medium rare, was over cooked and lacked flavor. The salad was supposed to be a panzanella salad. Every panzanella salad I've had in the past was comprised mainly of day old marinated bread cubes. This salad was a pile of seriously overdressed mesclun with a couple of croutons. The family style sides accompanying this course were fine but forgettable. Dessert was small portions of several of the desserts from the menu. Keep in mind this course is family style and there isn't enough of each dessert for everyone to sample. The lemon ricotta cookies were delicious and the only item I remember from dessert. I ordered a cappuccino with the dessert course and it was delicious. All in all, I'm glad I tried the tasting menu but I likely won't be back.

En4rLb2I432QBboElK8xYw.text: Giada is amazing and I didn't expect her restaurant to be anything short of amazing!  Everything from the impeccable decor to the customer service was great. The mushroom crostini is a must to try (if you like mushrooms and goat cheese)!  We also had the bucatini which shrimp and scallops. The pasta was perfect and the sauce was flavored perfectly. Tasted soo fresh and robust! We also had the bone in steak which was excellent. Definitely will be returning to try more next time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wJIv0H4y9nL65ZCtj6BSiQ.text: This experience was very disappointing.   The food descriptions were inaccurate.  - Our salad said it included "olive tamponade" , when it arrived there was maybe a teaspoon of chopped olives on the side.  - The "lemon" pasta with prawns has zero flavor of any kind, and the 2 small shrimp on the plate were under cooked and bland.   My salmon was as good as I could have gotten at Denny's no better. It was cooked on such high heat that most of the salmon flavor was missing.   The Gelato described with a word we had to google that turned out to mean chocolate chips, had no chocolate at all and zero taste of any kind - not even vanilla.     The person delivering our meals couldn't answer any of our questions about the food. Why?  Our waiter seemed to recommend things only because he was told to. Like he was told  "tonight we recommend the lemon pasta" that he never tried.   To top this off, this below expectations (being polite) meal was $120 without alcohol.  We voiced our thoughts to our waiter twice, and we were very polite, asking if he'd like some honest feedback on the food. After we told him our thoughts he just shrugged it off. No apologies or mention that he would tell the manager, nothing.   This experience felt like another Vegas broken promise. We were prepared for a nice Easter dinner on our weekend away, but received a very underwhelming meal.

3Yw-wV6DA6gZ3C6ah48Ilw.text: I went to this amazing restaurant last night with 5 of my friends, and absolutely loved it! The views were amazing, and the food was delicious (especially the cheese wheel pasta-- forgive me for not remembering the exact name). Most of all, we had an exceptional waiter. Radoslav took care of us from the beginning, taking the time to explain the menu options and answer questions, and always making sure our drinks were filled. We ordered a bunch of different entrees and shared it, and he actually took the time to divide it up for us. As a bonus, he kept smiling and you could tell he wanted to be there. Thank you, Radoslav, for making my first experience at Giada amazing! I'll be back.

EQ-EotA0ZtmQHIfDU4fkGQ.text: Really enjoyed my brunch experience at Giadas! I thought the space itself was super open, pretty, bright, and in general what I would expect from Giada. The food was delicious, particularly their scones, the spaghetti and then the pizza carbonara. What I was most impressed by was the size of their portions and their relatively cheap prices. If you want to ball on a budget but get a great meal that will fill you up, I would recommend getting a pizette (much larger than you'd expect) and then a small portion of one of their pastas, both the spaghetti and the cavatelli were delicious. Staff is great also, very friendly.   Would not recommend getting the frittata, pretty basic. Nothing spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O-XSh7_1tErZt_PG1mYPjQ.text: We spent the first two nights of our week long trip to Las Vegas. We had dinner reservations at Giada's for 7:30 and couldn't wait for this meal!! I highly recommend reservations. Even for a Monday the place was packed. We also felt a bit underdressed, but no one treated us any differently which was nice!  We began our meal with a bread board that every table is given. This is NOT the time to skip on bread with the meal. It's two different kinds, one of which has olives in it. Worth every bite.   We followed that with wine and crab arancini. It was delicious and the rice cooked inside was done to perfection. Gary ordered the Cacio de Pepe Bucatini. It tells you on the menu it is enough for two, but he still wanted it for himself. They serve the pasta in a cheese wheel which is totally cool and also delicious. I ordered the rigatoni which comes with a vegetarian sauce. My portion was small, and I say that as a lot of people expect massive dishes when ordering pasta. You don't get that here and it's okay. It was very filling and a appropriate size. The winner of the meals was hands down the Cacio de Pepe though. The noodles were amazing, the sauce you pour over is incredible and you dig into the cheese wheel to have a little piece of cheese with every bite. Absolutely in heaven with it.   We were surprised with a lemon and chocolate peanut butter cookie at the end and what a delight it was! Service is incredible. Definitely a place we will visit again for a special occasion as it is on the pricier side. But absolutely well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jw6i0PlXrUbVhNzSClNFJQ.text: Firstly, I'm a huge fan of Giada, so I was very excited to try her restaurant. I'll go for fresh pasta any day. We knew we were in for a treat when the complimentary bread came out- a large puffy ball of warm rosemary focaccia and Parmesan flatbread with lemon mascarpone butter, pesto, chile flakes, pink peppercorns, and salt. I especially loved the pink peppercorns and the lemon mascarpone butter. I also enjoyed my artichoke appetizer.  Here's where the night took a turn for the worse. I had made the server aware of a food allergy and then ordered a dish that did not include that ingredient (the server double checked). Now, I was really surprised when they brought out a completely different dish because they were nervous that the dish I ordered contained a similar but completely different ingredient that I had explained I was not allergic too. I was shocked they didn't ask me if I wanted to change my order as opposed to bring me a simple pasta dish that wasn't at all the same flavor profile I was going for.  I tried my friend's dish, the Cacio e pepe bucatini which was phenomenal. I'd highly recommend it. They also bring out a larger-than-life peppermill which was hilarious.  If it hadn't been for the weird surprise of bringing me out a completely different dish I didn't ask for without asking or warning me ahead of time, I would have given it 5 stars. I also like that they are taking food allergies seriously, but when we double check the ingredient list and I clarify that everything in the dish is safe for me to eat, don't not believe me? It went from a delightful evening to a disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh cracked pepper
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cacio e pepe bucatini

UyxvQWqyICeBJbqRSeJAfQ.text: Ate here on a Thursday night and was able to sit right up against the windows which gave us a great view of The Strip and the Bellagio fountains. We were welcomed to have a seat in the bar/lounge area as our table was not ready when we arrived but we were quickly helped by a very nice waitress. Once we ordered drinks, our table became ready and we moved over to the main dining room.  Our server was good but not great as he would keep disappearing for extended periods of times and simple requests would take a while to fulfill. That was probably the only negative of the entire meal.   When it came to food, the bread service was great and the assortment of sides that came with it really added onto the bread. For an appetizer we split the mushroom crostini which was good. I had the lobster ravioli as an entree and it was amazing - the raviolis were filled with lump lobster and the sauce was a light lemon-cream sauce with more lobster and some kale. My friend had the scallop and shrimp risotto which she said was amazing even though it was too creamy for my tastes. We ended up taking a cookie platter to go which we  ate later that night after hitting up some of the clubs.   Overall I would definitely recommend this place as it has a nice homey vibe to it even though it is a super fancy restaurant in the middle of the strip! Prices aren't as high as some other celebrity restaurants in Vegas but isn't cheap by any standard so be sure to look at the menu beforehand

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom Crositini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Kale Ravioli
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop and crab risotto

52gFCeDYXTW24vD955wBuw.text: Excellent service. Average food for the price.   We've  been a fan of Giada's cooking shows for years.  Maybe after watching her on tv for so many years, our expectations were too high.  Take away the Vegas glitter of the beautiful restaurant, we thought the food was good but not deserving be high end Italian cuisine The ingredients were fresh but we found the dishes lacking in flavor.   We started our meal with the:   Crab Arancini - $19 -  Rice balls stuffed with crab, parmigiano - reggiano , fried then served with a pomodoro sauce.  Fun Italian street food style dish that's been elevated. The interior had a wonderful blend of rice, cheese and crab. We thought the exterior was a bit mooshy which took away the anticipated crunchy texture in a classic arancini.   Charred Octopus Salad - $19 - Charred Octopus served on a warm potato salad with a cucumber - lemon vinaigrette. This was definitely a winner. The Octopus with a wonderful charred smoky flavor was so tender, it melted in our mouths.  The light cucumber vinaigrette with a touch of acidity complemented the Octopus well. The warm potato salad was perfectly cooked to a tender interior.   Main Course:  Branzino with mussels in a romesco sauce $40 - The fish itself was fresh and perfectly cooked to a flaky moist interior but it could've used more seasoning. The mussels were outright uneatable. They were overcooked, dry and rubbery.  The romesco sauce was indistinctive.  It did not have the rich nutty flavor of a romesco sauce.   Salmon with spiced fregola sarda $39 - The salmon was fresh and perfectly cooked to a reddish pink interior. The fregola sarda had a nice nutty flavor.  But once again, we found the dish under seasoned and lacked any distinctiveness one would expect for the price.   The service staff was excellent. The team regularly checked in on us without being intrusive.   A photo booth in the front by the hostess stand is a fun touch.   We will come back and try the pasta dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bKDA0th9GIxj1LKJOWHkXQ.text: So delicious and we had the best server! Make sure you ask for view seating! Definitely a must in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

aIW8WYV3uRzbNbTcggIZWQ.text: Came to Vegas for a business conference. I'm not a huge gambler but was excited to try any of the amazing restaurants. Giada's wouldn't be my first choice but I was invited by a client so I didn't want to pass it up. It's not every day you get to eat in a celebrity chef restaurant.   The atmosphere is nice. We were seated in the back in a private party type room that had one other table. It was nice but I would have preferred the main dining with the view.   The service was so-so. They were semi attentive but mainly to one side of the table only. A couple ordered cocktails, another few a bottle of wine to share. It took forever for me to get a glass of wine of my own though and never had the opportunity to order a second.   The appetizers were delicious. I believe we ordered a tasting menu that included marinated olives, mushroom toasts drizzled in honey, bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese stuffed roasted peppers, and caponata. I'm not a date fan but these were amazing! I honesty couldn't find a single complaint on the appetizers if I wanted to. The focaccia bread they bring out is to die for (don't bother with the blah olive one) and is especially good with the caponata on top of it.   For dinner I ordered the spaghetti with lemon and basil and shrimp. I chose to add the scallops. The scallops were delicious. The shrimp was good. The spaghetti tasted of nothing but lemon. No basil flavor, no seasoning, just lemon and cream. Very disappointing. I wish they would have at least offered fresh cracked pepper from the mills I saw around.   The table also ordered some sides of Brussels Sprouts and roasted potatoes. I did not try the potatoes but the Brussels Sprouts were good. I also tried a bite of the salmon someone else ordered. I was almost tempted to get this and glad I didn't. It had a very off putting bite to it.   Overall, Giada's is ok but the food is about as welcoming as her fake smile, looks pretty, but isn't as good as you would expect. If I were to come back, it would be for brunch (the photos look pretty good) or just happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L_iG-49yPWQqz0Wl9JMsdw.text: Food: artichoke hearts appetizer, arugula salad, spaghetti with prawns, scallops, hazelnut dessert. Everything was just ok. The bread plate that they give you was really my favorite part of the meal. It had two kinds of bread (olive bread and then a round loaf of rosemary focaccia) that came with little dipping items (pesto olive oil, sea salt, crushed red pepper, lemon butter and capers).   Service: our server was professional and efficient but a little weird in the personality department. She reminded me of Joan Cusak. I also felt the menu was presented in a passive aggressive way, like saying that the pasta was small so you might want to shore it up by purchasing additional proteins or the whole would you like bottled water or tap water routine. I'm a local so Las Vegas' finest regular water is just fine. She must have referred to it as "tap" about 3 times. Plus the pasta size was just fine given everything else we ate.   Ambiance: I requested a window seat in my OpenTable reservation and also mentioned it at check in so luckily we were able to get a window seat. The wall of windows is very nice with the natural light and strip views of the Bellagio fountains. The decor was very soothing in tones of brown and red.   Nit pick: their silverware, particularly the knifes were really annoying me! It wouldn't lie flat on the plate.   Location: upstairs in The Cromwell.

z-PlNks0SapcOrNHC4mPJw.text: I've been wanting to go to Giada's since the grand opening when we couldn't get in. This visit to Vegas, we were able to get reservations during the very busy CES week. The restaurant is located in The Cromwell on the strip.  There's a bar area upon walking in with display cases full of fish, pasta and antipasti ingredients. The restaurant is nicely decorated and the wait staff is on top of everything. Our server Paul and his assistant Nathan did a great job of taking care of us.  The best part of my dining experience, believe it or not, was the bread service with accoutrements. The focaccia was like a light and fluffy popover and the olive bread was delicious. Little dishes of crushed red pepper, salt, fried capers and pesto cane along with the bread. It was amazing!  My husband and I shared the ricotta honey crostini and the grilled octopus antipasti. I make better ricotta crostini so I was unimpressed. There were four very small pieces of crostini served. The grilled octopus, however, was grilled perfectly. Two large tentacles were on the plate along with a finely diced potato salad. Very good! My husband ordered the fried chicken cacciatore, which was disappointing. Two pieces of fried chicken with a cup full of the tomato sauce on the side. The chicken was pretty greasy on the outside, but had a good fry and was tender and moist on the inside. I had the salmon which was cooked to a medium and moist and flaky, but I've had that fish at 100 other restaurants. Nothing notable with the dish.  We shared the brussels sprouts with pancetta side dish, which was plentiful and crispy. The sprouts were cooked perfectly with a nice char, but was very salty. Overall, I'm glad I finally dined at Giada's to say I went, but I don't think I would go there again for a full dinner. I would go back for an antipasti and drinks at the bar, though.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread service....yum!!

0w-h7iaLHCXHYPKtI3tAdg.text: My husband and I decided to come to this restaurant for our Valentine's day / Anniversary celebration and we could not have been any happier with the choice. Nancy, I believe was our waitress, and her service was spectacular. The food was honestly one of the best dinners I've ever had. We had the Fresh Ricotta Biscotti appetizer and all I can say is... I wanted more and more and more! The Spaghetti was delicious! I didn't have the shrimp and substituted with Chicken but it was amazing either way, I'm sure! And of course, we couldn't leave without trying the decilous, lobster ravioli.  If anyone is looking for an amazing romantic, and beautiful dinner with a view, come here. I know we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YN_Wlj4kuwIfTzG8GsDXlA.text: Giada is located in the small but lovely Cromwell in Las Vegas. Not my favorite Italian in Las Vegas (that would be Scarpetta), but a terrific restaurant in its own right. Service and the experience are excellent. And while prices aren't cheap, you're going to have a terrific meal.

rpV4L5QHE7mFfhCg2lMOPw.text: After watching Giada on Food Network since I was a child and absolutely adoring her, I was so excited and eager to have the chance to finally eat at her restaurant. The location and ambiance of the restaurant are great! The music is good, our view was amazing, the decor is beautiful. But the food... I can't say I would recommend anything we ate tonight to anyone in good faith.  First off, it's worth mentioning that if anyone in your dining party has an allergy or sensitivity to dairy, STEER CLEAR. Almost the entire menu contains dairy products and there are very few dishes that can be altered without removing an integral part of the recipe. My family is familiar with this process because we are all allergic to dairy and have been our entire lives- we understand this is difficult sometimes for restaurants to accommodate. But to be limited to one or two choices on every single section of the menu is just sad for a restaurant of this caliber.  Once we were able to choose between the few options that we had, the food was thoroughly underwhelming.  The best thing we ate was easily the focaccia bread that came out before our meal, and the 5 of us shared the two small rolls we were given. Thankfully our appetizers came out quickly. However, the Fritto Misto was too salty and the sauce had a very unsettling metallic taste. The charred octopus salad was decent, but the octopus was cold which made it a little bit chewy. And we could taste a significant amount of cheese in the chicken Marsala meatballs which the waiter did not mention to us when we ordered them, even though he knew we had dairy allergies.   The entrees were even more disappointing with the exception of the scallops. They were perfectly cooked, though they too were extremely salty. The spaghetti we ordered was too al dente to the point that it was almost a bit crunchy, and was so bland. It had no detectable flavor at all.  I've read a lot of other yelp reviews which listed complaints about service which we did not experience, thankfully. Hence, the two stars. Our server was attentive and friendly and was one of the only redeeming qualities of our meal at Giada's.   If you're looking for an excellent Italian meal which leaves you full and satisfied, I am sad to say that you should look elsewhere. Giada's was truly disappointing.

yFOm1nOd14mdM9_uEp5BIA.text: Thank you to the amazing staff for a great night.  We came to celebrate some birthdays.  The dining room is open with great views of the strip.  I had the veal chop and it did not disappoint.  I highly recommend the short ribs.  The only negative comment I have is the lemon smashed potatoes are nothing like the ones I have made in the cookbook, they didn't have any lemon flavor at all.  The staff was extremely accommodating and attentive.  Truly a night to remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FFvlhk2I00D41oxBvzKxCg.text: Giada you have failed me.   I've never wanted to BALL OUT at a restaurant during a Vegas trip and left THAT disappointed. Not for me, not for my crew. I thought I was the cynic but everyone hated it as much as I did or more. I felt so bad because it was my idea to go since they had Frose on their yelp pictures... guess what? Frose is only seasonal and April is apparently not hot enough for them to add it to the menu. Hmm, April in Vegas is already low 90's so not sure how much hotter is adequate for them to bring it on.   The food was rather lackluster and left me hungry that I went back to our resort and ended up eating an entire bag of hot cheetos over the crappy leftovers from their pasta sampler.   Sooo... nope nope nope & nope.

PC5FrhPS6llJql1Qwg7pZw.text: Just checked in at Giada @ the Cromwell and we had reservations at 11:30 AM for a family Brunch. We checked in with the hostess (extremely professional) and got a beautiful table by the Bellagio Fountains precisely on time exactly sharp at 11:30 AM. Our server name is Billy and he is absolutely amazing!!! He is extremely professional, honest, nice, trustworthy and cares about all his guests. When we checked in on Yelp, there is an offer for a comp glass for a drink but we told him we don't drink alcohol and he was so nice to substitute for coffee at no charge. Wow, that's so nice of him! Extra kudos to Billy! He wants everyone to have an amazing experience and have a great conversation. We love him so much and always ask for him when we dine here. The atmosphere of this restaurant is extremely relaxing and beautiful views of the strip and bellagio fountains. The food is amazing and portions are generous. This is truly a 5 star restaurant. We ordered the brunch tasting menu and has a great selection everyone can enjoy. Everything is excellent and the food is very tasty! Thank you so much, we are locals and will be coming back over and over again. Truly A+ and 5 star VIP service. Kudos to Billy and the whole team! This is one of the best restaurants on the LV strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_aQQXUUPN5Saec-1uQ-KhQ.text: A wonderful evening out to splurge affordably! The bread plate was phenomenal- soft and very unique tasting breads. We enjoyed the spread of sea salt, chili flakes, capers, lemon butter, and my favorite the basil pesto! The orzo meatballs melt in your mouth, the sauce was perfect on them. We ordered lobster ravioli and seared scallops, and let me tell you... I have never had a better cooked scallop in my life. Cleaned my plate! We were too full for dessert but they all looked amazing. Everything was plated beautifully and our waiter was so detailed and so great at his job taking care of us during our meal. The whole house staff makes a well oiled machine that made for a positively memorable first night in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ciTDZwnnYNDwvXBoitHuUQ.text: Absolutely the greatest.   Every bite was fantastic.   Service excellent.  Worth the extra cost.  Small meat and cheese. (Charcuterie) was fantastic.  Spaghetti and scallops were the best.  Spicy corn sausage was delicious.   Lemon cookies and cappuccino rocked.

vxY5GxbyrzE0YW1ETkyK8g.text: Expensive!  The food and service are both really good but definitely not worth the price; especially in Vegas with so many great places to eat.

eOUdguPcuIboBZCfZjMGDw.text: I am finally getting around to writing this review! My sister and I went for a girls trip Nov 2018 and had dinner at Giada. We had brunch the year before and had such a great time, we decided we needed to try dinner.  Giada is a very special place in Vegas. Everything from the atmosphere, the decor, the staff, the views, makes this restaurant a standout. Our server was Lauren T, she was hilarious! She has the best personality for working in the service industry. She was super helpful with giving us tips on the menu and side dishes that might go well with what we ordered, but didn't make us feel like we were being pushed. She was super attentive and described every dish brought out to us. You can truly tell the love and time put into Giada.  All of our food was INSANE. Our favorite dish we ordered was the Pecorino Romano wheel with Bucatini. Hands down the best pasta I have ever had. It's definitely a fun dish to share, if you're in Vegas it's a must!!  After our meal, I believe it was the manager, John came to our table. He thanked us for choosing Giada and showed appreciation for our time spent. He asked us about our trip, our last visit to Giada, and our plans for the rest of our visit. He was so kind!! He truly made us feel special. You would think people with a big party would get special attention from management because of a high bill.. but it was just my sister and I! It really meant a lot to us. Coming from LA, it's rare to come across such hospitality, so to us it meant more than just a thank you. Vegas has some of the best customer service in the country, and Giada is the perfect example of it. I recommend to everyone and am excited to go back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CJ0f9iYongqWg_KS8d-7QA.text: Straight up we did not actually have dinner here, so if you are looking for a review of the food, you'll have to look elsewhere. We would like to relate our pre-dining experience.   We made our reservation through Open Table a few days prior to going to Vegas for a work trip. We specifically asked for a window seat, as it is typically quieter than the middle of the restaurant and there is of course an obstructed view of the Bellagio fountains.   We decided to stop in the afternoon of our reservation to reiterate our request with the front of house staff, and to also have a look around at the space. We asked what we had to do, short of bribery, to assure a window seat 5 1/2 hours later?  We were taken aback when one of the two young ladies said that there was a way to assure our window seat! All we had to do was provide a credit card imprint, and commit to spending at least $200 USD on a dinner for two, with no tip or tax included!  Having dined the previous night at Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill in Caesar's Palace (reviewed later) and spending $200 USD with a generous tip, all in spending that much again did not seem out of reach.   However, to be committed to a number, and to have to provide a credit card imprint smacked of gouging, and greed to us, so we declined to GUARANTEE our requested table, and chose to take our chances.   We arrived a few minutes early for our 8:30 reservation and were told our table was not ready and offered a seat at the bar. As we walked into the bar I watched a table at the window getting up and gathering their belongings, which lead me to believe that we may have lucked out and got our requested window seat without being hijacked to a number determined by the restaurant.   I went to the washroom to wash my hands while the lovely K went to the bar to wait for our table to be available. When I returned to the bar she was looking at an iPad. I asked what that was and she said the bartender had dropped that in front of her without speaking a single word. I asked "you mean he didn't welcome you to the restaurant and ask how you were doing this evening?" Her reply was "he didn't say a word to me."  I of course was quite surprised, but not really given our earlier experience, at the lack of customer service. I pushed past the obvious poor customer interaction and had a look at the wine list on the iPad.   Now I know this place is trying to be high end, but it does show $$$ on the rating. The food itself is not crazy expensive, but the wine list prices were enough, along with everything else, to cause us to question why we were there......  Now we love Giada, her recipes we use often, and we were very much looking forward to our culinary experience with her food as well as Bobby Flay's.   As we left the restaurant prior to being seated at our table we remarked to each other "does Giada know about the SEAT TAX that they have in place?"  There are so many culinary choices on the strip with Chef's that have much more accomplished resumes than Ms. De Laurentiis. We found another great place to enjoy dinner without the minimum hanging over our head.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not sure about the average Yelp user, but this wine list seemed to be a little on the expensive side for us common folks!

pQNezPoGBWTrR3N-8tArFw.text: If u wanna wait an hour without anyAnyone acknowledge you please come and make a reservation.  we have been around for 45 minutes and no one has come they just serve you water.  Water service is all u get here.   Lol

cZEcMcmP45vXF6SQAMZcww.text: Service was great. My husband ordered the Petit Filet and I ordered the Lobster Ravioli. We were both extremely pleased with our meal.

_4KbbSJEPazBK9H25RIQgg.text: Did not have good experience.  Made a 7:15 pm reservation well on Open Table well in advance as we were excited to try this restaurant, but it was not a good experience.  1.  Service was poor - Andrew was slow, too busy and gave a horrible recommendation on the dish I ordered. I asked for a cheesy baked pasta with red sauce and got the Bucatini, which had NO cheese and tasted liked canned tomato sauce poured over spaghetti noodles  2.  It was so very noisy and we sat in a small, tight space.  Although the Super Tuscan wine we chose was excellent, it was costly!   3.  The value is terrible - my husband had the scallops which he enjoyed, but he received 4 scallops at the cost of $40 for the dish.  We will not return and cannot recommend this place.

TE-ap6VRL_BKLlANeLMGIA.text: I'm # 2,591 to review - wow...impressive. When you have an oustanding server, the meal is definitely better.  Ask for Lauren.  She is very engaging, is very knowledgable and confident. Truly a professional.  Beautiful restaurant - do your best to get a seat by the windows. Watched the sun set as we drank a beautiful bottle of The Prisoner wine.  If the Truffle Burrata with Campari tomatoes and micro basil has been written in invisible ink, I still would have found it...zeroed in on that right away - outstanding, savored every bite.  Halibut - perfect for a blazing hot Vegas day - with braised Swiss chard, grapes, almonds and fresh herb sauce.  We had a 6:30 dinner reservation and there wasn't an empty seat when we left - wonderful testament to a fantastic restaurant.  They do offer a tempting bread service with numerous spreads and oils. Trying to do the "low carb" thing, we declined although I think I had tears in my eyes. Outstanding wine list and that alone is enough to get me to return. Cena straordinaria!!

pUH-kw1QAG8R0nWU1_CSHA.text: Arrived 5 minutes early for reservation and waited 20 minutes to be seated.  The wait staff deserves five stars and are really good at what they do.  Now for the food.  Don't remember the name but it's basically calamari and fried shrimp.  This was really bland but you could add some flavor with the condiments that came with the bread.  3 stars. Chicken Marsella meatballs:  These were pretty good. 4 stars. Risotto:Excellent.  Would give 5 stars. Scallops:  3 stars here.  They were cooked right texture wise, but once again no flavor and kinda dry. Fettuccine: 3.5 stars.  A little above average. Lemon potatoes: Hard, dry, slightly burnt and not mashed.  Sent back but still charged for them. Spicy corn and sausage.  Good flavor but didn't see any sausage.  2 stars. All in all, if you are going to drop over 200 bucks you would expect something better. I still tipped over 20 percent because the waitstaff was great.  Expect to spend up to 2 hours here as the main courses come out slow. This also in more of a hustle and bustle than an intimate setting.  Really loud.

yuOtGLVeXvHJkuwqXDj3VQ.text: We went here to celebrate three people in our party turning 21, and while they acknowledged that when we arrived they did nothing special for our table. The food was good but for the prices and the serving size, overpriced and a little disappointing. With as many choices as there are in Las Vegas there are plenty of better choices for less money. Too bad, we had hoped for more.

VP60zY7N4xEO9w3UxBKEmg.text: Been thinking of perhaps giving Giada restaurant another try.  We go to Vegas every year and when Giada first opened, I was so excited to try it as I have several of her cookbooks.  What a huge disappointment I have to say.  I sent my meal (prawns) back twice!!  They were cold.  And to top it off it was a milestone anniversary, which they were advised but never acknowledged at all!  Huge disappointment!  When we left the greeter at the door asked if we enjoyed our anniversary dinner....I said they never acknowledged it...he was surprised and offered us some cookies from the dessert cart, which was kind of him.  The photo booth was not working when we entered either.  I have told our story to so many foodies as I was so disappointed.  I did write a review at the time, but never heard any feedback from the restaurant.  So still not sure if we will return or not with so many fine dining places we do go back every year.  Just had to vent a little.....sorry Giada!

iv817VeSBN82xaosRFAyOg.text: Beautiful atmosphere. Great service. Flavors of the food were great. I can't say anything bad...great job Giada!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MDut2F-DF71Komo6dlsupw.text: Wanted to go here since it opened - she is a favorite of ours on TV and we so disappointed!  We had to wait in the bar for almost 30 minutes before we got service and then at the table we waited almost an hour between our appetizer and entre.  My risotto was very good but hubby's halibut was dry - but the sauce was good.  Our dessert course was so late, and we were tired of sitting there, we took it togo and ate it at home.  The hostess and our server kept apologizing but we have taken it off our list.  As locals, there are just too many other Italian places to eat that will treat you better for half the price.  Typical of a chef owned restaurant - they give it their name and forget about it.  Reading the other reviews I see this is typical of Giada's to serve food late and having grouchy, hungry patrons.  Good thing I had a Travelzoo coupon to soften the price for such poor experience.

aOZ94wXbiQ4s9uQU7fpDSg.text: Review for their lunch menu.    We came nearing the end of their lunch reservations for my wife's birthday.  We were seated promptly on arrival at a window-side table overlooking the strip and the beautiful Bellagio fountains.    I ordered the Chopped Tricolore salad-  prosciutto San Daniele, tuscan kale, endive, radicchio, dates, walnuts, Gorgonzola dolce.  So freaking delicious.   Our server suggested it stating that it was her favorite and I can see why.    Our appetizer was the Orzo meatballs w/ parmesan pomodoro sauce.  Good, but not amazing.  It came with three medium sized meatballs.  When I stabbed my fork to grab one of them, it kind of fell apart.    Lastly, we had the Gorgonzola, wild mushroom and kale pizza.   Lots of kale, but lots of flavor.  Some might say the cheese can be overwhelming, however I'm a fan of Gorgonzola.  The pizza seemed to be drizzled with some kind of sweet vinaigrette or sauce but I forgot to ask what it was.  It was very good though.  Our server was very pleasant and very helpful.  She kept our waters filled and was very knowledgable about the food that was being served.   She even offered to take a family photo of us before we even asked her to do so!    4 stars for the food and another 1 star for great service.  Also, on your way out, be sure to try the photo booth where you can take photo booth pictures that you can email to yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orzo Meatballs w/ parmesan pomodoro sauce.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice view of the Bellagio Fountains.  Worth it to ask for nice seating here.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopped Tricolore salad - prosciutto San Daniele, tuscan kale, endive, radicchio, dates, walnuts, Gorgonzola dolce

EKiXsVp1BieQTNXgJ8W5uw.text: My husband and I got married in Vegas last night 12/8/2017 and then had dinner at Giada's and. . . . It. Was. Perfect.  Everything was perfect. Every single employee interaction was superb. All warm, friendly, helpful and showed a genuine pleasure in their work. Nancy was our server and she could not have been more delightful. She was so super helpful, sweet and kind and extremely knowledgeable in all aspects of the menu and process. And the food was marvelous. We chose THE perfect place to eat especially after such a wondrous occasion. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED and please please recognize Nancy for being so darn fabulous

TjUkcogGh-zTMAEpMUDExg.text: Dinner reservations are hard to come by. I booked online 3 weeks out and could only get dinner for 2 at 5:15PM.  It was totally worth it.  The pasta in the lobster ravioli was perfect - thin, not rubbery. There was no shortage of lobster, and sauce was light, fresh, and didn't overwhelm. It was very well put together. Cocktails were tasty. Service was attentive but not over the top. The view is great and it was nice to have some of the windows open.  About the only thing not very well thought out was the photo booth off of the lobby. 2 people can't fit into the seat and you can't reach the screen to operate it. It's a nice idea, but it doesn't quite work. Once you get into the restaurant, everything else clicks. It's worth booking early and eating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli

Yd9Zl7yFPyM1563uv8N5PQ.text: My mom and I had dinner here recently and really enjoyed it.  I did make a reservation several weeks in advance but easily got the time I wanted.  We were sat in a back corner near the windows but it was actually nice back there.  More quiet than the main dining space.  The view of the strip is awesome.  You can see the Bellagio fountains right next store.  We started with drinks.  I just had a basic Ginger Ale but my mom had a Bombay Sapphire and tonic.  I think they make their own ice or get it from some place special as the ice was perfectly square cubes.  Really cool.  My mom's drink was strong so that was good too.  For our appetizers, I had the Tricolore salad and my mom had the minestrone soup.  My salad was delicious.  Lots of great flavors on it from different lettuces and toppings.  Nice vinaigrette on top.  My mom really enjoyed her soup.  It had a parmesan crisp on top that was her favorite part.   For our entrees, I had the scallop and crab risotto and my mom had the lemon shrimp spaghetti.  We both enjoyed our entrees.  The scallops were perfectly cooked.  The crab was mixed into the risotto.  My mom thought the shrimp were a bit over-cooked but she liked their flavor.  I would say though that for the prices you pay here, we should have gotten more scallops and shrimp in our entrees.    Prices are very expensive but Giada is a celebrity chef so you expect it.  I would say portions are a little small for the cost but the food is tasty.  I definitely will be back.  Our waiter and assistants were very attentive and came around often.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon shrimp spaghetti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallop and crab risotto
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three types of bread - rosemary focaccia, cheese crisps and breadsticks.

LXXoiwHleKCztuNK8jyEoA.text: Probably the worst meal I have had on year. The scenery was great if you faced the windows. We had a party of 8 and no one enjoyed their meal Our server was absolutely horrible.  Food was cold and drenched in lemon juice otherwise would have been very bland. I spend a lot of time in Las Vegas on business and I will never take customers there again. Very disappointed.

nUaiAQs4BWH27hdwve9NZQ.text: Wonderful place for a lunch with lady friends! (Ok... great place for breakfast, lunch or dinner with anyone period.)  Service was a bit slow... or rather ... it was leisurely (I should say to make it more positive sounding)... so definitely good place to go with friends and gab. OR... if you have business to deal with... good place to go to have a lovely meal and have time to discuss business.  We tried the White and Red Sangria.  The Red Sangria seemed a bit on the sweet side whereas the White was refreshing and I honestly could drink it all day.  Their Wine Menu is impressive.... lots of sparkling wines and still wines.   Don't be intimidated... ask for a recommendation.   I highly recommend a sparkling as a starter with your antipasti as well as with their zucchini scapecce (shoestring fried zucchini... so good!)  My mom and I shared the Chopped Tricolore Salad. Kale, dates, prosciutto, radicchio and all sorts of yumminess.  The Gorgonzola dressing was a bit heavy so if I were to order this again, I would ask that they go super light on it or serve it on the side. It's a great salad.  The freshness of this salad hit the spot.  I'm not a kale person... this salad could change that.  I particularly love the prosciutto and date combo. Oh Yum!  I had the Muffuletta sandwich and Mom had the Venetian sandwich.  Both were good.  But the Venetian was way more decadent than the Muffuletta.  I  thought the bread on the Muffuletta was a little tough.. so I ended up eating the insides of the sandwich which were very good!  My girlfriends ordered the Faro Salad and the Tenderloin sliders.  I got a taste of the Faro Salad.  I'm totally ordering that one next time.  The faro was tender ... not like other Faro salads I've had where it's more "grain" like.  And the light, citrusy dressing was perfectly light but loaded with flavor that enhanced the salad rather than distract from it.  I did not taste the sliders but they looked damn good.  :)  My mom finished with the Mocha Mio.  I highly, highly recommend this.  It's hot dessert in a cup.  I took a sip and it was heavenly.  Espresso, Chocolatey Goodness with a hint of Orange Citrus flavor.  I didn't think it sounded good on the menu, but oh how wrong I was.  Right now (through the end of March, I think)... Locals get a 20% discount for breakfast and lunch.  So... if you've been meaning to try Giada's... and you're a Local... Go Now!  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sangria (almost gone)
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Windows were open today!  Beautiful!  You can see the Bellagio Fountains!

zKFlsfEf4LlP4TFIeGSZFg.text: Had lunch at Giada on a Friday.  We had a reservation, but the place was nearly empty, so that wasn't needed.  It's large and it's appointed nicely.  I wouldn't think I would have liked the setting, but I did.  It has a large view of the strip, as it's right on the corner of Flamingo and Las Vegas Boulevard.  There is a lot of seating on the outer edge of the room, so if you want a view of the Strip, you should ask.  They can open the large windows, but I found that when you open the windows you pretty much just get traffic noise.  So, the views are interesting, but I didn't love having the window open.  Our server approached us very quickly to take drink orders.  My buddies ordered specialty cocktails, including a bloody mary with a ball of mozzarella and a slice of sausage.  I didn't sample them, but everyone liked their drinks.  To start, we decided to go with the gorgonzola with pear honey, the orzo meatballs, and the goat cheese stuffed sweet peppers.  My favorite was definitely the gorgonzola with honey.  The honey was thick and difficult to spread, but it was fantastic.  The sweetness of the honey and the saltiness of the cheese was excellent.  The meatballs were a little disappointing.  We'd heard such good things, so we were surprised.  The orzo challenged the integrity of the meatballs, they kind of fell apart.  They weren't bad, but certainly worse than we were expecting.  The peppers were fairly straightforward.  No heat at all, I could have used more goat cheese.  To eat, I had the Venetian panino.  It comes with turkey, gruyere, fontina, mustard, and peppedew peppers.  This is one of the best pressed sandwiches I've had in a long time.  The bread is lighter than typical panini bread, and it was crisp, but didn't cut the roof of your mouth.  Often paninis have bread that is too thick or too crusty, but Giada's was near perfect.  The ingredients went well together.  The turkey was a tad on the dry side, but the mustard helped that.  The cheeses were fantastic, really tasty and melty.  This sandwich just worked.  My buddy ordered the lemon pesto grilled cheese with added prosciutto.  I had a bite, and it was nice and caramelized and very cheesy, but too lemony for me.  The citrus was overpowering.  For dessert, we had the chef's trio of cookies.  I can't remember the other two  cookies, but the winner for me was a large warm chocolate chip cookie.  Slightly crisp, gooey, and packed with chocolate.  A little sea salt on top would have put this over the top, but it was a very good cookie.  I would come back, I'd like to try dinner at Giada.  But, we were very pleased with our lunch and I absolutely would re-order that Venetian panino.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef&#39;s choice cookie dessert.  Chocolate chip was as good as it looks.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Venetian panino.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat cheese stuffed sweet  peppers.

VO_DChqNY12uFdKtUi7MIw.text: Service - Impeccable. A solid 5 stars. The waitress was friendly, attentive, and thoroughly knowledgeable of the menu.  Ambiance - First class and tastefully done. Our party of five was seated at a semi-circular table overlooking the strip and the Bellagio fountains - a truly spectacular view at night.  The menu - many appetizer choices, but honestly nothing on the menu was a standout. Meatballs were tasty but small portions. Burrata was salty, offered as a tiny sample. Gorgonzola and honey - maybe three bites worth. Fritto calamari - overly browned and about 5-6 pieces. The risotto with charred scallops were delightful, but as a main course I could have eaten 2 or 3 more servings. My other dinner guests seemed to enjoy their veal, lamb, fish and pasta dishes, but I didn't hear anyone raving about their meals.  Overall - a very mediocre meal that was overpriced and skimpy. I went home un-fulfilled and hungry for breakfast the next day. Nice date place to impress, but not to satisfy your hunger. Also, was disappointed Giada was not here and we couldn't see her. I'm not in a hurry to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two crusty seared scallops with crab risotto

OXAo_NmKObJrpmiJnoqPLQ.text: I love the decor of Giada's new place.  Wide open space, great views from the 2nd floor of Caesars, Bellagio and the construction going on at Bally's LOL.  The restaurant is very homey and welcoming.  The smoke of the wood burning oven adds to the ambiance.  If going, I would recommend going for dinner as the lunch menu was limited.  I wanted to eat pasta, this is Giada's place isn't it, but no pasta on the lunch menu.  The lunch menu consisted mostly of small app, salads, pizza's and sandwiches.  We had prosciutto, olives, meatballs for starters.  All were very good and tasty.  Our party had 2 lobster roll, grilled cheese lemon pesto sandwich and lasagna.  The lobster roll was excellent.  I had a bite of the lemon pesto sandwich and it was good to.  My friend loved the lasagna, although it was quite small of $24.  This place is not cheap, for what seems to be a casual lunch. Apps and entrees (no desserts) came out to $200 for 4 of us.  I definitely want to check this place out for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lD8O64LqRdj0t-OUhC8SMg.text: I was very disappointed in my experience at Giadas!  I mean, it's Giadas, so I was expecting a lot!  It being on the Las Vegas Strip and a bit more pricey, I was expecting TOP NOTCH service!  Didn't really get the best customer service.  Our waiter seemed like we were a nuisance to be served right from the start!  I mean, we didn't even look at the food menu, he asked what we wanted to drink and I said tap water and from then on, the experience went downhill.  I was a bit insulted....I don't go to a restaurant like Giadas to drink....I go to EAT the food she makes!    Well after we looked at the menu, asked our questions we had on how certain dishes were prepared, I began to order.  I ordered two appetizers and a main entree for myself and my friend ordered an appetizer and main entree.  When we were done, I saw that the expression on our waiter was more attentive, seeing that we were spending our money on food instead of the alcohol.  But really?  One should not base their service on how much a customer is willing to spend, but that's how I felt we were being treated.   Another thing was the waiter that served us was terrible in explaining how dishes were prepared.  I ordered the Lobster arancino after asking how it was prepared.  The waiter did not state it was "deep fried" and instead said "pan-fried" now there's a difference between the two....well let's just say, the fried rice balls were MUCH better at Macaroni Grill.    I was however, thoroughly impressed with the Lemon Spaghetti, Giada's signature dish.  Now if it wasn't for that this, I would be giving it 0-1 stars....but because of the lemon spaghetti, I may actually decide to go there again JUST for that one dish.   Forget about dessert, it just sits out on a car in the restaurant UNCOVERED, becoming dried up in the LOW HUMIDITY of Las Vegas....terrible idea!  What they should do is have a cart for decor purposes only, and use only that, have the customer's order and prepare it fresh in the back kitchen.  I mean cmon, for the price you're paying, customers should at least get some freshly made desserts to end their meal!    Well that's my rant...and I RARELY give negative reviews....just did not have a good experience here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute menu I must say.

NchWDfN80uyjLuf3vMdcsA.text: Giada has been one of my favorites from Food Network. Everything she makes seems so good. I'm so glad she has a "home" in Vegas. We tried to make dinner reservations for my birthday but their soonest availability was a month later. Don't expect to be seated if you're wearing very casual clothes/ have no reservations. We witnessed a bunch of people getting turned away.  The bread service was pretty good. The interior is very beautiful, modern, sophisticated but still comfy. We were given a tour of the restaurant. Our server was fantastic and the manager checked on us.  The menu items all seemed delicious. They have a dolce cart: chocolate, cherry, sorbeti, gelati, cookies, berries, eclairs, tart, etc.  Orzo Meatballs: Very tender and juicy beef balls with orzo in pomodoro topped with grated Parmesan. I didn't want to share and I'll definitely get this again when I return. 5/5  Chicken Cacciatore: For 2 people. They'll show you your pan-roasted chicken with veggies before they bring it back to the kitchen to fry the chicken. The chicken is crisp but not oily, bursting with flavor, tender and juicy. I've had cacciatore from other places and Giada has the best I've had so far. 5/5  Lemon Potatoes: Smashed and fried potatoes with lemon and grated Parmesan cheese. This was a good side dish for the chicken cacciatore. 4/5  Spaghetti: Lemon, basil, shrimp and capers. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the sauce was creamy but not heavy. However, my large pieces of shrimp were a bit overcooked. Otherwise, this would have been perfect. Flavor profile was superb. 3.5/5  Chocolate Tiramisu: Topped with candied hazelnuts and gold leaf. Creamy, light, airy and mildly sweet. 4/5  Blueberry Eclairs: The eclair itself was wonderfully flaky and blueberry filling just oozes out. The top has glaze and fresh blueberries . 4/5  Chocolate Amaretti: A chocolate cake covered in dark chocolate topped with good leaf. You can definitely taste the amaretto. 4.5/5  Overall, I was very satisfied with what we had and the service. I'll come back and try a few more dishes...or even get the spaghetti and maybe ask if they could not cook the shrimps too much.   They're currently open for lunch and dinner. They'll be open for breakfast October 2014 and weekend brunch beginning of next year. Something to look forward to.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced tea

485fez28Vrb6_5L_1ChY1g.text: This was a real disappointment from beginning to end. First off, and if the restaurant is listening, please take note..... We don't need our hostesses to be young and beautiful. We need them to be polite, insightful and welcoming, qualities that these (albeit young and beautiful) women did it possess. It's almost as if they were trained to be distant and aloof to -- I dunno-- give off an air of exclusivity that the restaurant clearly doesn't possess. We had an 8pm reservation. Lots of empty tables. Told to wait. Why? "They're clearing your table". Now, baring an earpiece or telekinesis, this (albeit young and beautiful) hostess had no way off knowing if they were clearing our table or not. Five minutes go by. "They're checking on your table." Again, she's checked with, nor communicated with, no one since the last time. Just seemingly threw that one out there to keep the dialogue open. Five more minutes. "They're clearing your table." Okay, so we've looped back. Now I'm getting upset, if for no other reason than my four year old could clear and set a table in less time than the young and beautiful hostess with the earpiece and/or telekinesis claimed a trained busboy could. With that she decides to give in and offers up an expectedly robotic, "Right this way." I was hoping from here on out the experience would be somewhat enjoyable, if not slightly special, but nope. Service was disorganized and poor (despite a little more enthusiasm from our waitress), and food was so unmemorable that I could barely even tell you what I ate. In general, there was just this feeling that nobody was running this ship.... not a maitre d, not a manager, and certainly not Giada who's name was thrown around quite often, but who I suspect has long been there in nothing but name only. Giada -- if your listening -- your name is on this place, your image is present wherever we look -- stop by once in a while and see if this so-called gourmet restaurant is still worthy of your brand. There are so many great restaurants in Vegas. This one definitely deserves a pass.

QGHVpwbthIdh6y0gj2fyVg.text: Me and my bestie went here was good the drinks were so yummy!!!!!   Sadly my friend had the risotto and was EXTREMELY disappointed!! I had the spaghetti and it was super yum!!!   Our favorite part was the dessert   I would come again just for the dessert lol

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qDFFwB12WwJu6wg5CHqkSA.text: This was my second time here. I came for breakfast after flying in from San Diego.  I asked for a window seat even though I was alone and she acted as if I had committed a crime.  I waited patiently after she seated two groups that arrived after me till she would seat me.   My server was very friendly and he really made my experience better.  The food was good and I really enjoyed the frittata. The decor was beautiful.    As I was leaving, I wanted to check with my lunch reservation later on in the month and asked the hostess if I could request a certain area.  I received the same treatment as when I first got there that I was asking for too much.  I really wish they would train their hostess better, I know it's Vegas but can you try to act like I'm welcomed.

Tn8YYAaUpLajpOILyFZSkA.text: Everything was amazing.  The minute you walk up the stairs, it is a WOW affect.  The food was absolutely amazing along with the wine pairings.  I highly recommend Giada's for an outstanding dining experience.  We will definitely go back.

TWJc7umvIIG6Gljhk7zjmQ.text: We were coming to Vegas for just three nights, and this was number one on my list for where I wanted to dine, so I didn't take any chances and made reservations almost three months in advance (June 20th for a September 12 experience).  To say I had high expectations is putting it mildly, so honestly I didn't think there was any way it could live up to them.  I'm happy to report they managed to EXCEED them. (and that was sans Giada herself)  We  arrived about five minutes early for our 5:30 reservations and were greeted warmly by the gals at the top of the stairs, given the brief tour and led to a two-top overlooking the Bellagio fountains.  sigh, it pays to plan ahead, folks.  :) The table was just the right size.  Small enough that we could easily converse and share food, but just large enough to handle all the food we ordered!  Service was at a comfortable, relaxed pace. The whole time we felt like guests who were welcome to stay all night if we wanted.  They aren't about turning tables, which might be why they stay booked up.     I had to try her Signature Cocktail!  I still don't know what was in it, other than egg whites and a cool G.  Very delicious, with enough body to it that the G stayed in place for a long time.  Meanwhile Husband had the most incredible iced tea ever.  Made right in front of us, he was given his own little pitcher with some agave syrup.  I ended up ordering one later after coveting his.  ($6 each and worth it).  As we perused the menu, I was trying to get Husband to give me an idea of what he wanted, but honestly I was very okay with him letting me decide, as having read reviews and the menu online (happy to report also that they have the updated menu with updated prices on the website now, by the way), I pretty much knew what I wanted to try!  We started with the Orzo Meatballs and the Lobster Arancini, along with their fabulous bread service.  Loved the spices to kick up anything we wanted to! Now I can make some good balls, but I gotta say, these were excellent...both the meat ones and the rice ones!    Next we shared the Romaine Salad, which they brought to us split.  It was light and refreshing. Then we did the Spaghetti with Shrimp, Lemon, Basil and Capers.  Pasta & Shrimp perfection...yum!  And so was the Crab Risotto with the BEST Scallop I have ever tasted in my life.  Period.  Don't know why, as it appeared to be simply seared, but it was so rich and light at the same time.      Full, we still couldn't resist a sample off the dessert cart (after all, they were so small).  Husband wanted to try a nipple truffle...they gave him three.  I wanted to try the blueberry eclair...oh it comes with a cream puff too.  Plus, somehow two lemon ricotta cookies and a chocolate chip one landed on our table as well (thanks!).  I don't know if it was an oversight, or we had already spent enough or what, but we were not charged for any of the desserts. Again, made to feel like welcome guests.    Meanwhile, we got to watch the Bellagio fountains, both in the daylight and after the sun went down, very cool!  I might also add that while this experience was more than we normally pay for a meal for two...for a total experience for two, it was just under $200 and well worth it!   The view outside plus the full experience inside, it was a truly magical evening that I will never forget!  (which is why I chose this to be my 600th review).  Thank you Giada for taking your years of culinary and world experience and creating this place! And extra thanks to your hard-working so-polished staff....True culinary gems, in the kitchen and in the front!  That being said, where was the infamous photo booth everyone talks about?   We never saw it!

-jbVHawi2RNo-UXzltdzJw.text: Wow. Can't believe I have to downgrade from 5 stars to 1. Everything about my last visit was very uncomfortable but the cherry on top was the PORTIONS. They were running out of so many dishes but we didn't think anything of it. When they brought out our food, it was like there were legitimately 6 or 7 pieces of rigatoni in my friend's bowl and maybe 2 or 3 more in mine. 2 people in my party ordered the shrimp spaghetti and one got less than the other.  Very unacceptable for any restaurant, especially one on the strip and at this price point.   The server made it awkward by telling me it's "always like this". No, it isn't. This was probably my FIFTH time dining at Giada and I've never had such bad service and little food. Needless to say, none of us will be returning.

1tyaPZz6EYeVjp4kr5NUfA.text: This is a great place for business power lunch and brunch. Most recently I came here for Easter brunch. $30 bottomless mimosas are pricey but I was able to use my $100 dining credit through Total Rewards so it added value to the meal.  The food here is delicious. My favorite bites:  -meatballs -lemon grilled cheese -salami pizza  -salmon cake Benedict   Service was slow but it was very busy. Every table was full. All the staff was very nice though. I'll be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely Easter brunch

HuFf6XPuVF5WaBH0iILQRQ.text: Items Selected: Coffee Pastry Basket - Polenta Muffin, Savory Bacon Corn Muffin, Chocolate Croissant Monkey Bread Chicken Marsala Meatballs with Roasted Wild Mushrooms Pecorino Tartufo with Apricot Preserves Gorgonzola Dolce with Raw Pear Honey ANTIPASTI PLATTER - Eggs Benedict Deviled Eggs, Mini Pizza Di Pasta, Brussels Sprouts Crostini Mortadella Bianca Pizza Baked Sausage & Eggplant Lasagna in Pink Sauce Sardinian Gnocchi al Pomodoro Italian Chicken & Waffles with Cacciatore Sauce, Polenta Waffle, Parmesan Cappugiro - Lavazza Gran Riserva, whipped with ice and layered over warm milk and chocolate sauce Limoncello Souffle with Buttermilk Gelato Leaning Tower of Chocolate & Espresso  From the moment Giada De Laurentiis opened her well-branded doors at The Cromwell I knew the day would come when curiosity would finally get the best of me to step inside, but with friends overwhelmingly underwhelmed while Pete Wells basically shredded the place it was not until the opportunity for "Media Brunch" presented itself that I finally sat down at a table...to almost entirely predictable results.  No doubt a luxurious room, the posh banquets and enormous windows with a view of Bellagio some of the perks offered from a place whose prices speak to celebrity Chefdom and Strip-side surcharges more than perhaps any in town, rest assured that one will not forget they are dining at Giada during a single moment of their meal, the name of its proprietor found on everything from menus and napkins to the artwork...small cursive Gs outlining many service pieces, as well.  Humorously handed a card suggesting #hashtags and @handles to tweet with during the stay it was from the full brunch menu as well as a prix fixe tasting that invitees were left to decide from, the service exceedingly pleasant if not a little overbearing - though the special coffee menu did have to be requested while refills of the houseblend drip were infrequent to come around.  Inexplicably targeting every writer in town at once, a PR move I'll never comprehend as a steady stream of positivity would seem far more beneficial than an obvious en masse lovefest, it was nonetheless in in three courses that our 130-minute stay would take place, some dishes far better than anticipated while a few were no better than those found Off-Strip for less than half the cost.  Beginning with a pastry basket offered as part of the prix-fixe, for our purposes self-selected but usually Chef's choice, only the Monkey Bread was particularly memorable as both cornmeal-based options were far too dry, and moving on to appetizers suffice it to say that aside from stingy portions none of the Antipasti "platter" showed as well as it sounded, the better bites found in a la carte options including the moist chicken meatballs awash in spices and a duo of cheeses that were well aged and portioned to fit the double-digit pricetag, the accoutrements and crisp lavash also faring well.  Acknowledging the import status of their Artisan meats, but hardly ever to pass up Mortadella whenever it is found, it was an intermezzo "pizza" that would be far better described as a flatbread which seperated appetizers from entrees and with a pleasantly pliable crust and a good sapor to the meat the quality was just fine aside from the $15 tab, particularly compared to dreadful gnocchi that may as well have come from a box, the bowl going unfinished despite being no more than four spoonfuls of limp noodles laid in a watery and insipid sauce.  Turning next to entrees, a porcelain crock featuring layers of eggplant and noodles separated by spicy sausage undoubtedly a highlight of the meal, those interested in tasting Giada's signature cacciatore without going all-in at dinner have their chance to sample alongside crispy polenta waffles - recommendations to combine sauce, bird, and syrup not worth the time or effort as separating the plate as two-halves is far more successful, though neither is likely to make anyone say "wow."  Finishing up with dessert, the options scaled down from dinner and lacking in seemingly obvious bombolini for reasons unknown, the go-to dish is undoubtedly a pudding-soft citrus souffle served with buttermilk gelato while the leaning tower is no more than a Cold Stone quality ice cream cake, an "inverted cappuccino" entitled Cappugiro from the specialty coffee menu a far more intriguing proposition and the sort of thing for which I could almost justify a return visit, if only to sit at the bar sipping while enjoying the view.  **Told by some that Giada has improved since opening while others suggest they have locked in their core clientele and no longer need to try, I'm sure the truth lies somewhere in the middle, an experience worth having once if only to say "been there, done that" but not the sort of place warranting return visits for those who truly care about value or great food.

nsoWBPs7stjHxgVRqKjd9g.text: Came here with my boyfriend during a quick trip to Vegas, and while the food and drink were absolutely wonderful, the service of a particular person in this establishment has motivated me to write this review.  Lindsay in the lounge was amazing! She was prompt, professional, and really made us feel welcome. Her personality elevated our already high spirits, and she set the bar rather high for the rest of our evening, and even our trip!  We'll for sure be back for the drinks, the food, and for sure the service!!

y9UDhA4LZUcrkEaIq75N5A.text: Loved my Giada experience. Beautiful restaurant and wonderful service by Valentino, Joe and Diego. Highly recommend the verduri, salumi e formaggi especially the parmigiano reggiano with honey. For pasta loved the rigatoni vegetable bolognese.

Duc2JehPz1Mk2asK2_k0xw.text: I was extremely disappointed with our dinner at Giada. The ambiance is nice but that's it. Its ends there. I expected delicious food, and impeccable service and unfortunately received neither. The margherita pizzette was subpar. It tasted like an average personal size pizza you can order from any bar. The bacon wrapped dates were served room temperature and didn't taste very fresh as if they had been sitting out for awhile. Orzo meatballs were ok. Salmon was blah, the best part about it was honestly the small pieces of broccoli served on the plate. Lemon spaghetti with jumbo shrimp was bland, sticky and dry. Wagyu short rib was average. The best part of the meal was the bread that was served complimentary with all the accoutrements. The service was not what I usually experience at a $$$-$$$$ restaurant. We sat for 30 minutes between appetizers and main courses with nothing on the table. Our waiter forgot to put in our main course orders after insisting earlier that we order all appetizers and mains together. Sorry but I will not return and I don't recommend it.

zZclaAzWw3MW81E5OkCVXA.text: The best meal experience I've ever had.  The special is expensive but so worth the price.  The level of service is amazing.  The homemade pasta is out of this world and the desserts.  Oh the desserts.  My kids really enjoyed the experience too!

Fal4fE5r7OgcNQL63tkuig.text: Was so looking forward to having birthday dinner here with my BFF. Atmosphere five star. Service five star. Food three star: Bread and the spreads was really good; calamari was good; salad was really good; Giada's Signature lemon pasta was not good. We had the order split so I can only think that was the problem. It was bland, no taste of lemon, no basil on dish at all. When I mentioned bland to Waiter, he said "the pasta probably soaked up all the sauce!" Huh?? He brought me some sauce in a cup that was like nonfat milk. Also, why no parmasean? That would of given the pasta some taste. All in all very disappointing meal. I have her cook books and make her lemon spaghetti all the time and it never tasted like what's served!!

q6jFYictqziaSeLqyS0qSQ.text: This review is very late better late than never. Came here with my family and friends for my bday. Uhhh we ordered almost everything that was suggested on the menu. Pics below!! Well how should I put it. Presentation,  service & ambiance  was excellent....but the food is the most important part & everything lacked flavor. Every time I took a bite I was not impressed I wanted to taste something great but I was let down. My entire Party agreed there were 9 of us. We had high expectations for this place. The dessert cart was great! How can you mess up dessert. All and all I've had much better tasting food !
