ZNedxKbgxXbP4hY2S1dZ8w.text: What a dramatic event our dinner was. My bf and I booked this restaurant because at a glance, the reviews on Opentable are amazing - 6k+ people and still 4+ stars. We were excited for a treat. We show up in time for our reservation, casually dressed. If this matters, we're a young Asian couple who dress 'poor' (sneakers, jeans, hoodies). The host ladies were very friendly and quickly lead us to our table. From there it was downhill. My bf went up to quickly to use the restroom. During this time, our waiter (Asian) stopped by with menus. He didn't even say a word, just briskly asked "do you want the drink menu". I was a little taken aback by how snarky he was. I answered yes, and also requested an additional food menu for my bf's seat. This dude plopped down a wine menu and an ipad, and then returned with a menu and handed it to me without a word. Phew. I was still thinking, maybe this is fine... Until another couple was seated 2 tables down. I was a little curious about a fancy envelope that was also given to us. That's when I hear our server detailing how to use the ipad menu (for drinks) to the other couple, as well as explaining what the envelope included (a tasting menu). I whisper to my bf that the server was treating us differently, but we were both still interested in staying for dinner. The waiter finally returned to get our drink orders, in the fashion of standing at our table and staring at us while acting like we were wasting his time. What? From cheap diners to 3 star restaurants, never have I been treated with such blatant disrespect. I guess it showed on my face, since the waiter asked tartly: "Is something bothering you?" That's when we decided to walk out. I told the hostess how unacceptable the server was. The manager was brought out, and convinced us to stay. The new waiter was amazing and the manager treated us to dessert, but we couldn't get over how horribly we were treated initially. Unless you wear your money, these waiters can be pretty judgemental.

qBit3srJYwRWRy9E9vgjOA.text: I loved everything I ate. The portions seemed small but it's definitely quality over quantity. Very rich, very filling, very Italian.

NY0Y8IipYEIi1G5LO_frLQ.text: Lobster roll was delicious!  Nice ambiance! They have the best coffee! I think everything was just great . Thank you Giada!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uRQCpFB2fTFKVE3kCBZZwQ.text: My wife and I have adored Giada for years from afar and eagerly anticipated eating at her restaurant on the strip.  This was one of the worst meals we have ever had. It started with the bread then the appetizer course of bacon wrapped dates was just nasty.  Thank god I didn't order the $83 bone in steak as the guy at the next table ordered and proceeded to eat about three bites of it.  I ordered the signature spaghetti with prawns and while it looked beautiful, the shrimp was rubbery and tasted like it was old. My wife had the rigatoni and the pasta had been way over cooked, to the point of just being a mushy mess.  We passed on dessert as the couple next to us ordered the tasting (at $125 per person) and tried a bunch of the desserts and said they weren't good.  (We saved our sweet teeth for Carlo's).  Service was mediocre at best.  Save your money.  There are way too many Great Italian restaurants in Las Vegas!

LKPs5FHusRDNt0gGm-NDsg.text: Excellent Service, and almost perfect food. A big fan of Giada as well since I watch food network A LOT.   Arrived at Vegas and this was our first stop due to our reservations. A remodel hotel that has Giada right at the 2nd floor. If you wait outside the restaurant, there is a photo booth for you to take pictures. Yes I said it, They so ballin' that they have a photo booth to use(too bad i hate taking pictures or else I'll be all over that haha).   ANYWAY, when you first walk in, you can see all their different kind of homemade pastas and it's kinda an open kitchen sort of way. Greeted by our server that thoroughly explain the items on the menus and cocktails. You have an electronic(ipad) menu. We decided to order the tasting menu(I forgot the name), two appetizers, two pastas, and two entrees. The manager came up to us and check on us which was awesome. We were also given complimentary drinks which was an extra +. It was a sweet wine drink that was given to us topped with lemon. Sooooo good. Not sure why they gave us the drinks(maybe cause they're barely open)  I love the hot bread that they give you. Although, I can't eat too much of that because it's such a heavy filling bread.   Grilled Broccoli Rabe w/ calabrian chili vinaigrette - nothing too special but I do like the chili oil sauce on it. Plus, it's good to have some kind of veggies.   Finocchiona - the salami. It was enriched with flavors. Topped with grapes and apple. Goes wonderfully together.   The sampler came with Chicken Marsala Meatballs w/ roasted wild mushrooms, Citrus Marinated Calamari salad w/ sundried tomatoes & olives, Lobster Arancini w/ calabrian chili pomodoro & basil aioli, and shrimps. We ordered the medium size one.   I don't know if it's me personally but I was really disgusted by the Chicken Marsala meatballs. I thought it had a really strange flavor to it and this is probably the thing I don't ever want again at Giada + the Lobster fritter thing. The lobster thing was so so. I felt like it tasted better than it looked. I liked everything else after that. They had this shrimp that was marinated in a salad sauce that was really good. They give you JUMBO shrimps because the shrimps were fucking huge. It was really tasty. The cucumber frittes/fries were addictive and so was the calamari.  Personally, the two things that I loved the most was the two pastas. Ravioli (rah-VEEOH-lee) lobster, asparagus tips & tarragon  and the *Spaghetti (Spah-geh-tee) shrimp, lemon & basil. The Ravioli was Godly good. The skin was perfect and the inside was filled with lobster. I recommend eating it as a whole bite because if you tried to eat it piece by piece, the sauce comes out from the ravioli making it less flavorful and tasty. The *Spaghetti (Spah-geh-tee) shrimp, lemon & basil was really amazing. It seems so simple but the spaghetti was soo good. It tasted fresh and they had fresh shrimp that compliments it well. The lemon and basil wasn't too strong which made me love the dish. I recommend people to get their pastas...it was heavenly.   The two entrees were lovely as well. The waiter described the salmon as one of the best salmon you can get and I think he was right. It was so juicy and it was cooked perfectly. It seemed like it was still a little raw but i think it was meant to be like that because it just add another layer to the dish. I could do without the succotash.   The veal was really good as well. It was fried perfectly. if you cut it, the juices flows out. Look at pictures and it is topped with cheese on top. A really heavy dish.  Oh and the other thing I didn't like about GIADA was the side dish Sweet corn & spicy sausage . I think it was a personal thing but I thought the corn wasn't cooked all the way. the sausage tasted fine and all but the corn had a nasty texture to it.   BEsides that, I recommend GIADA to all people. I can't wait to come back again the next time and trying more of their pastas and hoping to meet Giada herself. Excellent experience with amazing food and service! Cheers

jpTmiBbsNmrN7eHR25-EwQ.text: I was so excited to spend my 30th birthday dinner at Giada's with my husband. We made a reservation ahead of time (two months in advance) and were disappointed when we were seated at a small table where the sun shone directly into my husbands face. Because the waitstaff could not lower any sort of blinds, we asked to be moved. We ended up in the bar area (which was fine). Our waiter convinced us to order multiple plates of food (smaller portions meant for sharing). We decided on three plates. We were very surprised when our food arrived and it was enough to feed four people. I can understand wanting to sell dinner, however, it was such a waste of food.

C9u1jPtFuDSWUAt8DkG1mw.text: Giada, you have a problem.  This dining experience was a near disaster with the number of errors, communication errors and short comings of the staff and restaurant.  Our party was seated and drinks were ordered (a Birdie, iced tea, coffee and water) to start. First the Birdie arrived, followed by the iced tea, and finally the coffee as water was provided when we were seated. The iced tea was a light amber color and tasted more watered down than a bootleggers bottle of whiskey during prohibition. When I asked the server about it, she stated that it was white tea and was more mild. This however is FALSE, it is in fact black tea. FAIL. They brought me a raspberry tea in it's place which was fine.  The coffee arrived, and it was cold - really this is inexcusable unless specifically ordered to be iced or cool. Additionally a cup of green tea was ordered and a cup of black tea was delivered to the table. This warranted a visit to the manager who did what she could to rectify some of the issues.  My wife and I ordered the brunch sampling menu which featured a plate of pastries, appetizers, choice of entree, and dessert. One of the appetizers featured salmon which neither my wife or I wanted so we asked for a substitution (which they would happily do). When the appetizers arrived a single plate of pastries arrived and appetizers with salmon. The salmon was sent back and a plate was returned without the salmon. I asked if the pastries we received was a single serving or for two, and the server wasn't sure. She finally let me know that the plate featured one additional pastry for both of us.  I selected the chicken & waffles (roasted chicken with cacciatore sauce and parmesan crusted waffles). The chicken didn't have much flavor by itself, the cacciatore sauce was watery and featured more peppers than anything else, and the waffles were brittle and dry. Take this one back to the kitchen Giada... it's not ready.  The Tower of Chocolate (three layer chocolate cake) and the Lemon Ricotta ice cream cookies with raspberry sorbet. The ice cream sandwiches were superior to the tower of chocolate, but really neither one made a lasting impression on me.  For the price point of the restaurant and experience avoid this restaurant. Giada you have quality control issues and considering your name is practically on everything in the restaurant, I expect more. My first visit was a pleasant experience, but this one shows the deterioration of the quality and service level.

oCjYfhhlPjdVuOy0OHq_Aw.text: I have to say that I was incredibly disappointed this time.  The food wasn't very good and the service was terrible.  We arrived at around 9am and were really excited.  We were told by the hostess that we had to wait an hour.  There wasn't anyone in the restaurant.  She literally made us wait until 10 to seat us in the same table that had been available since 9.  We should have left, but I honestly thought she would come to her senses after about 15 minutes, she didn't.  My fault, next time we will go somewhere else.  Giada's food was a lot better when she wasn't trying to offer healthy twists on everything.

pZClQuKHrPBWXZAsuWChFQ.text: I love this place but this visit has me doubting when or if I'll be back. Food has always been good. Some portion sizes are still tiny compared to other items on the menu. Service less to b desired. Going down hill. Servers were way more attentive the first few months of opening for us. Our waiter took our order & we didn't see him again till he brought the bill. Never mentioned any specials or checked to see how things were. Hope he splits his tips with the people that actually waited on us. Plus we felt rushed the whole time. We hadn't even decided on an entree and he kept wanting us to order it with apps. Glad we didn't because both appetizers came out at the same time as the complimentary bread seconds after our drinks. Wasn't relaxing. If I'm going to spend $$$$ on dinner I don't want to be rushed. Giada has been there on the previous visits & things seem to run more smoothly when she's there. Can't count on that all the time.  Side note. We asked for a table by the window when we made reservations. They wanted $100 a person to guarantee a table. Although most will probably spend that while there, I'm certainly not paying in advance just to look out a window.

GovewfDc8jItkhxq8v5BRA.text: I rarely write a negative review, as I know the restaurant business is not easy, and everyone thinks they can do it better.  We visited Giada for the first (and probably only) time Saturday April 23.    Here is the good - Giada is a TV celeb, so some people like that.  The decor is very nice, and the restaurant is bright with large windows on the corner of the Strip and a side street.  The staff, male and female are all younger and attractive.    Here is the so-so - the menu is not terribly inventive, a Mediterranean survey of pasta, risotto, and other fairly typical italian/mediterranean dishes.  Nothing really jumps out as a "must order" item.  It is very pricey, and the wine list is high (sure, as are most of the nicer Strip restaurants).  The two appetizers we had (chicken meatballs... 4 small ones, and 5 bacon wrapped dates) were ok, but not worth the approximate 30 dollars we paid for them.  Here is the awful - We made an early reservation and announced to our server we had to make a 7:30 show.  We were assured that nothing we ordered would be a problem for our time frame.  After over an hour, and several assurances that it was "on its way", we gave up.  We announced to the manager on the floor that we had to leave, and offered to pay for what we did receive - two appetizers and a bottle of wine.  At that moment, our entrees arrived and the staff offered us... to go cartons!  They accepted our offer to pay for the wine and the two appetizers, and we left, furious.    To the manager's credit, she did invite us to return after the show to try dinner again.  Even though the concert was outstanding, we were in no mood to so quickly go back there.  Don't be dazzled by a TV personality name... there are many other nice places to try on the Strip.  I look for an interesting menu, food well prepared and presented, and good service.  Didn't find it at Giada.

YbaTz10jof69PO00Z83hdg.text: How incredibly boring the food was. I really thought the service was pretty sold but the food really was bland and unimpressive.  For this kind of money you should look elsewhere.  We had the risotto, it was small and very tastless. My girlfriend had the spaghetti. It was better but still lacking in flavor.  I've had much better and in a town like Las Vegas I don't figure this place can last without a real revamp of their menu. I recommend you pass on this restaurant.

8yefGNmvdf4wn-VwvB4fEg.text: I'm not in love with Giada's.. but my review truly reflects a 2.5 as the food was very good..   There were so many things that just took me out of enjoying the experience fully. We arrived at 715 on a Wednesday night so it wasn't terribly busy but it wasn't empty by any means. We are locals and ae familiar with convention schedules and whatnot, so we chose to go on a quieter night.   My date and I had a nice array of items. We started with the 'Spicy Italian Sausage Arancini' served with parmesan fonduta & pomodoro sauce. As well, we enjoyed the 'Fregolotto' (fre-go-LO-toh) with roasted rainbow cauliflower, garlic puree, parmigiano, kale pesto, crispy prosciutto. We shared them both as appetizers and they were both great. Rich, delicious flavors and good portions, everything very shareable. The pasta was split for us in the kitchen as well, which was greatky appreciated. Bread offering was also good but i saved room for dinner so I didn't really have much of it.. though it was delicious.   For the mains we shared the 'Surf & Turf' 7oz filet with two large prawns, port wine sauce, creamy gorgonzola gnocchi & baby carrots, and the 'Barolo Braised Australian Wagyu Beef Short Rib' served with soft polenta, & garden vegetables.   I ordered my filet medium rare and it was perfectly cooked, and one of the better steaks I have had recently. The Creamy Gorgonzola Gnocchi were also delicious. Again, nicely portioned and really perfect texture on the cooking of the filet. Just so good. The Short Rib wasn't my favorite. Although I do really like short rib and I do really like polenta. The flavor profile fell short for me personally,. The wine component was great in my mind, but maybe it just didn't translate well to my palate after having things like the rich gnocchi or the port wine sauce ont he steak. The polenta also came across a little unseasoned.. but again maybe it was me. My date didn't care for it, so it was pretty much uneaten.   We had a couple of cocktails and some California red blend wine.. and everything was good. No question when the food was being cleared as to why we didn't eat the short rib, but we wern't looking for any other food so it wasn't a huge deal. I would have appreciated it if they had asked though.   Now, a couple of thigs that I want to mention are in the interest of constructive criticism.   Mainly, our server was so blatently intent on upselling us on everything.. which is part of his job I realize, but it was a bit rushed and short of quality service. Not staying with us at the table in terms of presence, constatnly looking elsewhere while we were asking questions and looking for suggestions, (based on how we wanted to manuever the menu nicely without over-doing it but still getting a few items to try.)   Every request for guidence was met with short, curt responses. Pointing at the menu seemingly going for the priciest options was the answer to everything. The money wasn't the problem, we knew what we were geting into.. but, I would have liked a bit more personalized service based on our cocktails and wine.. and just not so hurried. It may be asking too much. I was fully aware of the other tables and how he was being sat so I wasn't intending to take up time, but it felt rushed and I just didn't care for that.   Another thing - the backwaiter or server assistant, was really a big distraction.. and I honestly don't mean to be rude.. but when you are trying to have a nice quality meal -  the sound of silver being loudly set onto tables, and clanging together while being polished and then tossed into a drawer or sideboard of some sort - is not cool. Also,frequently we were asked if we would like water botlle refills, and forgotten.. and then asked again and forgotten. Not the biggest deal but it made me feel like it was a turn and burn situation. I didn't like that at all.   On top of that, the 'back of the house' conversations and opinions of other guests from the backwaiter and the servers - were just inappropriate. Finger pointing and crude remarks that were clearly meant to be offensive. The guests being spoken about may not hear you, but we heard every word. It's something I may not have even noticed, were I able to stay int the moment and just enjoy myself.. but that silver clanging had me hearing and noticing everything else that was going on.   So overall, food 5 stars.. but service was like 2.5 stars. I'd go again, maybe sit at the bar.. I do like quality food and they have it.   Well.. Happy Eating To You!

rGgbRDEARtkgkUagj5fX4w.text: Not very good for breakfast or dinner. Had the lobster mash, lemon chicken pesto sandwich, and sunrise waffle. The eggs were both over and undercooked in every dish.  The lobster mash was very plain. I could make it at home. It's simply chopped Vegegables, pieces of lobster and chunks of potato. Probably cost me 12 bucks. Don't pay $34 for it. It's very uneventful and not exciting.   The pesto sandwich was decent. Nothing special, pretty strong lemon flavor.   The waffle was decent. The flavor of the syrup was the best part. The waffle itself was soft, but light. Not necessarily crispy... The way I would've liked it to be.

QjbgzgN5FsFYwyccnY6TKA.text: ********************* 1102 ********************       Chef, author and television personality gorgeous Giada De Laurentiis opened her very first restaurant at The Cromwell, the first standalone boutique resort on the Las Vegas Strip by Caesar Palace Group.         Located on the second floor of The Cromwell, overlooking one of the busiest intersections in Las Vegas, with the space's incomparable views, this is the only restaurant at The Cromwell.       Breathtaking Views- The terrace  showcases priceless views of the Bellagio fountains, Caesars Palace and Bally's Las Vegas through seven giant remote-controlled windows wrapping around  the restaurant, allowing for a uniquely al fresco dining experience.         Hand-selected by Giada - GIADA is completely inspired by Chef Giada' personality and style, with its modern, yet sleek design featuring clean lines and pops of color.  Chef Giada has even included design elements such as Italian tile she has encountered throughout her worldly travels.      The first feature guests experience and smell as they enter the bar/lounge space is a custom antipasti bar which encompasses separate pizza and bread ovens and a pasta stand where chefs will be rolling homemade pasta. Chef Giada wants the guests to experience as they were coming home from work/school and smell the aroma of food, welcoming home.  The open kitchen and bar, let you view the work from the dining area, really cool. Check out the floor tiles, those are hand picked by here and her husband from Italy.       Giada them is Rose Gold-Chef Giada loves rose gold. You can see it through out the kitchen and tableware, as well as the food cart.       Family Touches- GIADA features framed family portraits and a selection of movie posters from Chef Giada's grandfather, Dino De Laurentiis' career. Chef Giada even paid tribute to her late grandfather by naming many specialty cocktails after movies he produced, such as the Jane Fonda classic Barbarella.       As her 1st ever restaurant, you can see feel that it's all about her. This is her baby, and she hands on every single little detail, amazing work by this little beautiful petite chef.   FOOD:  *******Appetizers are $8-$12, there dishes below are yummy *******  Wood Roasted Mushrooms w/ toasted marcona almonds & ricotta salata   Tre fagioli w/ green, yellow, edamame & toasted fregola   Baby Sweet Peppers w/ goat cheese & olive tapenade  ******* Cheese and charcuterie are $11-$15 *******  ******* Pizzas are $10-$15, try these *******  Margherita, herb roasted roma tomatoes, basil & mozzarella   Salume Picante, mozzarella, tomato & oregano   ******* Seafood dishes are $13-$18, these dishes are delicious *******  Citrus Marinated Calamari salad w/ sundried tomatoes & olives   Charred Octopus w/ potato, fennel & olive salsa   Mascarpone & Tarragon Shrimp Scampi w/ crispy polenta   ******* Pasta and main dishes are $26-$55, a few must try dishes   *******  Farrotto morel mushrooms, fava beans & pecorino tartufo  28 oz Bone in Tuscan Rib-Eye finished w/ lemon, a sunny side up egg & arugula   Veal Chop Saltimbocca, milanese style  Branzino, w/ tangerine vinaigrette         Price point is fairly reasonable for the strip, you got to see Chef Giada there a lot now since the restaurant just opened. She said that she will split her time here in Vegas and the East Coast. We lucky enough  got to meet her, she was warm, personable, passionate, and extremely beautiful.       I highly recommend you to check it out when you are in Vegas next time.

gwwcx4El_yvEH_vOr3jySQ.text: I went back to Giada last night to give it another try.  Thanks to Laurent, who is the General Manager, he was able to accommodate a last minute reservation, as I was in town for work, and previously had a bad experience.  I can say that this time was much better.  The food is amazing.  We had a party of 9 and went fairly big.  The table ordered quite a few appetizer platters (all delicious), 4 pasta dishes which were just outrageously delicious, main courses for everyone, and dessert.  Each course was fantastic.  Giada has done some amazing work here.  The pastas were my favorite, and in hindsight, I wish that I ordered that as my main course (maybe 2 pasta dishes?).  For my main course I had the lamb, which was also really good.  It had a mint flavor, and was cooked perfectly.  Most others at the table ordered the Branzino, and they did seem to enjoy it as well.  Dessert was amazing.  Many choices on the dessert cart, and we tried quite a few.  My favorite is probably the White Chocolate Gelato.  I have not had that flavor before and I was blown away.  My only complaint about the evening was that service was pretty terrible.  We had to complain multiple times about the slow service, forgetting of orders, and incorrect dishes.  I think that it is mostly due to us having a bad waiter.  Giada herself came out to say hello and help rectify the situation.  Giada did not apologize for the service, and chalked it up to being open for 6 weeks.  I found it understandable.  Giada took a couple pictures with us, and was there quite late. They helped rectify the bad service by providing free dessert (and even telling us before we ordered it).  I found the fact that they accepted the criticism well, and responded appropriately very good.  Giada is def. worth trying if you come to Vegas.  Plus, Giada is even more pretty in person!  I hope that they serve pasta at the bar in the near future so that I may return on my own and have a quicker meal.  Everyone deserves a second chance, and I'm glad that I gave Giada one!

eSYoMVD6J2_CPcSTNzHLCA.text: Horrible service and mediocre food...not to mention overpriced fare.  I suspect the good reviews are from staff and management.  "One of my favorite restaurants In the world" says one reviewer.  Babe have you no taste buds or does your world expand outside of the Cromwell????  Horrible.

xktgrOchl-LhtadtYQb1Dg.text: Wow! What a fantastic meal. From start to finish the attention to detail was incredible. The staff was well trained for the soft opening, the kitchen executed beautifully and Giada was in the house to see everything was up to par. It did not disappoint!  Cocktails are well thought out and the Hannibal was a crowd favorite. We sipped on those while we gazed over the huge selection of anti-pasta items. It's a bit overwhelming to choose, because they all sound delicious, but eventually we decided the table would share the dates ($14), burrata ($12), orzo meatballs ($13), rollatini ($12) lobster arancini ($18), salami and cheese platter. Bite after bite was utterly delicious. However, the dates stood out as a favorite, like most these were sweet and salty, but what set them apart was the spice from the Italian sausage. They had some serious kick, which I loved. The aged parmesan from the platter was dreamy, as well.  Next, we shared a variety of pastas: Giada's signature spaghetti ($28), tortellini ($26), ravioli ($34), and farrotto ($26). The spaghetti's simplicity really shines with a touch of lemon, basil and three jumbo shrimp. The ravioli was delicate and filled with wonderful flavors from the lobster, asparagus, and tarragon. The farrotto had a wonderfully chewy texture and earthy flavor from the morel mushrooms and distinct richness from the pecorino, we really enjoyed it. The manager brought over an order of risotto ($30) for comparison. It too was delicious, it oozed with bold seafood flavors from the crab and scallops. You cannot go wrong.  We had already enjoyed a feast, but the main course was still to come. We had the veal chop saltimbocca ($43), rack of lamb ($45), and Tuscan ribeye ($68). The veal chop and the ribeye were straight from the Flintstones. These were extremely large portions even for the heartiest of appetites. Every bit of it was stellar. The lemon potatoes were the perfect accompaniment. They are smashed and fried and topped with cheese.  Meat and potatoes never tasted so good.  Dessert selections were chosen for us. There was a trio of gelatos, the espresso and chocolate really stood out. The banana was the least favorite. Then, there were assorted cookies, tart and other pastries. To cap it off they served a scrumptious nutella espresso that was simply sinful.  The dining room is gorgeous. You can spot Giada's special touches all over. The retractable windows are impressive though it got a bit warm when they were open. The photobooth is fun and sets the mood for the playful evening that lies ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the destroyer

WWqyzQL-zQbIMDWVrcdzUw.text: OMG, if there was ever a reason to give a restaurant a perfect 10, then Giada gets it!  THIS IS MY VEGETARIAN DREAM!  Through all of my travels around the world and back, Giada of the most fantastic restaurants I've ever experienced, hands down.  From ambiance to food to service, no detail has gone unnoticed.   I'll start by saying that this restaurant is a ray of light in the dark underground-esque-walk-through-a-casino restaurant scenes in Vegas.  As soon as you enter the space, you're greeted by the aroma of delicious food, an antipasti bar, a wood burning oven, cooks in the kitchen and food & friendliness all the way round.  It's like walking into Giada's personal kitchen!  Then, after checking in with the host, you'll walk into the dining room to find a GORGEOUS, sexy, ambient-lit space with a killer view of the Bellagio and that part of the strip (mind you, you're several floors up and the restaurant faces the Strip).  You'll get an interactive cocktail and drink menu, from which I would HIGHLY recommend starting with one of Giada's signature cocktails.  I already forgot what I had, but it's a refreshing summery whisky something.    OK, now I'm getting onto the food, which is still calling my name days later!  The first and foremost delicious thing:  they start with a freshly baked crucible (?) of focaccia bread, fully loaded on the side with any topping you would need.  For your courses, You gotta go for a little of everything.  It's all meant to be shared.  So I'll ramble off some of what I had...the compilation vegetable plate, flatbreads, a side of potatoes, two types of vegetarian pastas and DESSERTS.  Cookies are a must, especially the lemon Ricotta, one of my fondest memories.  Then try the polenta cake.  It has a delectable strawberry topping with a dollop of cream.  MMMM HMMM.  ****FINALLY:  Can I just give a shout-out to my server Nathan and our Sommellier (I forgot her name).  They were just so stellar and they're the kind of people you'd want to invite to your house to have dinner, chat, and treat really well b/c of how nice they treated you.  REALLY FIRST CLASS!!! *******  I gotta go back to Vegas in a month for round 2 so more to come then...

Xk7-iUVd4uE-p5u3caM9sA.text: Great place to enjoy great desserts and coffee! As someone who lives in Las Vegas I don't make a habit of spending much time on the strip but if you are in "The Cromwell" I would highly recommend stopping in and staying a bit. Molly was our server at the counter we were greeted with a smile and very attentive service! She is A-1!

QH5L5WYj5OFtgPeX_odCDw.text: Wife wanted to go to Giada......Had the Veal chop and after two bites realized something was wrong. Tried a 3rd bite but it wasn't getting any better. Wife (who never complains about any thing) tried it and immediately said it was "bad"!!! They did take it away and took it off bill but I was sick and hour later and haven't really felt right since therefore the review. Waiter was good. Apps were good.  No excuse for putting out a bad piece of meat in any restaurant especially one with these prices and reputation.

rKHdZ6Oic3g8siev1EHMOA.text: This review is personally for Giada.  Upon arriving to Giada, I was met by at least 8 hostesses standing there all wearing the same maternal looking black dress and ill fitting heels.   Then we were met by eclectic decor and wrinkled table clothes.   Shortly after we were seated we were greeted by our waiter and another girl saying she would also be helping. The waiter told us that all the appetizers and drinks were on the iPad. Using an iPad cheapened the experience for me and the authenticity of the restaurant. Just because restaurants are starting to implement iPads does not mean it works in a fine dining setting. And to make things worse the iPad froze multiple times. I also thought it was a little tacky when the waitress put the price fix menu on our table. It's okay to suggest it but to have a whole folder that takes up half the table is too in your face especially on ones first visit. We decided against the price fix until we knew the food was worth the price.   15 minutes after sitting down there was still no bread brought to our table so I requested some from our waiter. He comes back with three different bread choices and a side of toppings. I was surprised that the one topping I did not see was Parmesan. The bread was very underwhelming but I did enjoy dipping the breadsticks into the pesto.   I ordered the caponata and the spaghetti with shrimp lemon and basil. My dining partner ordered the bucatini for her main.   Before the caponata came our waiter said caponata is usually served with bread but Giada's is light enough to be eaten on its own. While the caponata was not heavy it was still a little much eating it on its own. The spaghetti I ordered was solid even though it could have used a little more seasoning. The shrimp was some of the largest I have scene however it was sitting in what seemed to be a small puddle of blood and this turned me off. I tried my friends bucatini and ending up like hers more and she liked mine more so we traded. The bucatini pasta was well cooked but the sauce was undeveloped.   We ordered the cookies to go for dessert and they were great. My favorite was the palmier.

OWAxHmkSPKAYPheJVKPy4A.text: I love watching Giada on the Food Network, and was really excited to try her restaurant in the Cromwell Hotel & Casino during a weekend trip to Las Vegas.  I came with a girlfriend on a Friday around noon for a light lunch to celebrate her birthday. The restaurant is gorgeously decorated with a homestyle-chic feel to it. It is spacious and well lit with natural lighting. We were promptly seated in a U-shaped booth with a window view, which we requested. We both had the penne carbonara pasta dish and the birdie drink. The pasta was amazing. I loved how the pancetta had a perfect flavor and crunch to it, and balanced perfectly with the al dente penne pasta and light creamy sauce. I also really enjoyed the birdie, which was refreshing, sweet, and not too tart. It was garnished with a strawberry that was fresh and sweet.  The presentation was clean and beautiful. We each had a placemat set at the table with her signature napkin, fork and knife. Each dish was served on sleek white plates. The drink even had a little signature cocktail napkin, which was a nice touch.  The service was okay. They seemed a little short-staffed, which is understandable since they had just opened for the day, and the restaurant was less than a quarter full of guests at that time. It was a little difficult to flag down a waiter to order drinks.  We had fun in the complementary photobooth on the way out. You can select to print out a photo strip or email the photo to yourself, which is super fun and makes the experience special and memorable.  Overall, we really enjoyed dining at Giada. The food, drinks, and atmosphere were great. I can't wait until my next trip to Vegas to dine here again.

NIJoTmdWfCaI0mAqw0PDHw.text: 5 stars to the food, 4 to the service.  It was last night (dec 24th) when we went for the 1st time. Pretty place, nice and warm, excellent view. The food was amazing, (the portions were REALLY small, so be prepared).  The waiters were okay; it could have been better. It wasn't that crowded, so we were expecting a better service. We would definitely go again for the food!

zSsvGmLVe8clx3tXgmnRzg.text: Great food and amazing service. Always a pleasure to come when in Vegas! We ordered the lasagne and the lemon grilled cheese! Billy is the best, very attentive! Thank you Billy!

4osY_y0lQsG6B2wX5ZhF3g.text: High expectations.  Limited brunch menu. Overall antipasto, entree items under seasoned. Ambience is classy and not over the top, given Las Vegas glitz. Check it out once and be done with it till they change the menu and chef, again. ..

MyMCRj1ajESlyjSXmV4G3g.text: We had our first experienced Giada's a few months ago and absolutely had one of the greatest experience from a restaurant on the Vegas strip. We had the lobster Brussel sprouts ravioli and the amazing blackberry Moscow mules. It was so delightful!  So we decided to reserve a table for my spouses  birthday and deployment to Iraq. He was super excited to come back and enjoy the ravioli and blackberry mules he indulged on during our first experience. I reserved a table for four and window seating over a month in advance.  Now speed forward to our dinning experience. We showed up 25 minutes early so we could enjoy a cocktail and a blackberry mule only to find out that the blackberry mule was no longer on the menu. Which we totally understand but he was so looking forward to it! It's to die for! Then we were seated at a table that was no where near the windows! So that's strike two! Then to put the icing on the top of the cake, you no longer have the Brussel sprout lobster ravioli. I could see my spouse was not pleased and a little disappointed. Now with all of that said I know you change your menu and seasonal drinks; that's to be expected. But not having a window seat, when I reserved one over a month in advance is troublesome. So this was not anywhere close to our first experience. Also there shouldn't be a commit section when you make a reservation if it's not going to be acknowledged.

hwSD-yyimvj_jxjaDpYw5Q.text: My 2nd visit proved to live up to my 1st. Truly unparalleled hospitality from each crew member from the hostesses, each staff member as you walk to your table & the waiter. A real Welcome To My Home, Let Me show You Around & Feed You My Best Dishes experience.  Among all the antipasti platter choices my favorite is Giada's. Although I think I might ask to sub the pesto crostini for something else. Among the pasta selections the Lobster Ravioli is still my favorite but now I'll also add the Bucatini to that list.  For dessert the Polenta Cake, Strawberry Tart & Chocolate Chip cookie were worth the calories.  Tomorrow I will give the new lunch service a try....... Safe to say I won't be weighing myself this week

7FsjcT33x7NW_Pw2GFPmdA.text: Best Italian food on the strip. Great portions for sharing with the entire table. Try it all you can't go wrong. Nancy our waitress took great care of us, attentive without being overbearing. Great recommends as well.

bfv9f6ij0OdLCizxdCdzsw.text: My favorite place to eat in Las Vegas.  The food is excellent, the beverages are fabulous and the service is first class.  I even got to met Giada.  First class place to go out to eat.

jk1qRxzNmZuVtfsRaflSNA.text: I went based on a friends recommendations and had high expectations. We we were greater and seated smoothly in a prime location- the window seating has a beautiful views and the top half open to present a beauty autumn evening al fresco.  The bread service had a lot of care in a beautiful product with sea salt, basil pesto, red pepper, lemon aioli and capers on the side; yes we got a second plate.  Appetizers- I would not have ordered the meatballs but the were the star. Succulent and a very interesting sauce. Frito misto was a little different- the lemon and fennel were served as a relish it was good but not memorable I should have gotten the regular aranchini instead of the one with crab. The crab just did not work although they are well cooked  Entree. This is where the wheels fell off. A half order of bucatini was embarrassing. The pasta was over cooked until it actually reminded us of a can of chef boyordee.  Also it was overpowered with red pepper.   The short ribs were very good but note that it is a small serving.   The lemon cream shrimp pasta was well prepared but very little flavor. The saltimboca was well cooked but the best part was the side sauce.  A minor hiccup was the coupon for a free plate of cookies I got for checking in.  Server said sure but then billed us for them.   Overall it was a pleasant evening in a beautiful place but I would not return for the food, especially at the prices

RGCUA6L_xt8-_ZmQ6d-x6Q.text: It's rare that I would write a review like this since our dinner was comped due to our casino play, but if I actually paid for my meal, I would be sorely disappointed. We arrived right on time for our reservations, but were not seated until 20 minutes later.  As a warning, if you are looking for an intimate date spot, this is not the place. It was loud, and the view of the strip is nothing to get excited about. Try Mon Amu Gabi instead.  Now about the food, the meatballs and the shrimp cocktail were good, but our spaghetti, including the shrimp, was so over cooked that the pasta was gluey and chewy. The scallops was over-doused in capers, and again, scallops were overcooked. Amateur mistakes that should not happen in a restaurant at this price point.  No notice of the less than 1/2 eaten spaghetti by our waiter either, and when we brought the overcooked items to his attention, he was just as dismissive as he had been the entire evening.  We skipped dessert because after the food quality of the pasta and the main, the calories for subpar dessert didn't seem worth it.

1yMx5JeK4VlvOgTGGwnCoQ.text: I was so looking forward to this restaurant on our Vegas trip. It wasn't horrible, just not nearly good enough for the price. The quality tasted like a casual dining establishment not a highly rated fine dining experience. Our waiter was unpleasant and the food had little flavor. The bread was good and we were late for our reservation and they still seated us as well as the cleanliness of the restaurant earned the second star. I personally think the giant pepper grinders were tacky, but that's just a preference.

A9MdzkP_GD96x0NoF7E8EQ.text: Ordered the crab and scallops risotto..., no crab to be seen and only 2 scallops for $32? And sick few hours later for an entire day. Save your time and money (and health).

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zlMU6ZpskA963dBNHOW3Tg.text: Delicious food!! I ordered the lemon spaghetti and it was Heavenly! By far, the best pasta dish I've ever had! We also ordered the pesto ravioli and it was excellent! They give you fresh rosemary bread and Parmesan crisps paired with seasonings and dipping oils! If your a coffee lover, you MUST order one of the espresso drinks, sooo smooth! Also, Don't forget to order dessert; coffee and hazelnut gelato was so delicious! It is a bit pricey, but worth every penny; I can't wait to go back! Overall, great staff (Rocco was our server and he was friendly, knowledgeable, and all around one of the best waiters I've ever encountered), great atmosphere, and a beautiful casino! Don't hesitate if looking for a fine dining Italian restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti...excellent!!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Niccolo ...so smooth!

qb0sDP-0gU0-yYCvlDqYsQ.text: I had a reservation here and when I came they did not have a seat reserved and my girlfriend and I had to wait about 15 to 20 minutes before they could get a seat for us.    The service was really good and our waitress was amazing.  The food was okay though and I would say not worth the high price.  We have had the same food at other Italian restaurants that we thought was a lot better.  I got the tomahawk steak which was good but like I said earlier for the price it was not really worth it.    The restaurant was beautiful and has a very good view of the strip and maybe the food just wasnt to our liking and will be to other so I would say not to try it out because maybe the food will be amazing for you but that was just my experience.

K3VIMn9cDrN1wJBLb8IZYw.text: We've dined around the world and have never been made to feel so unwelcome in a restaurant!   The hostesses have so much attitude, it may just knock you back down the escalators! My husband has the top tier players card with Caesar's properties; which customarily grants you priority seating at most restaurants. The girls at the front rolled their eyes about this, produced painfully fake smiles, gave us the run around and made us wait waaay longer than another couple with no reservation and no tier card.   After being seated we waited 20 min to get menus and when the waiter also had a shitty attitude; we walked out. Guess who was also walking out at the same time?? The couple who had been seated just ahead of us had eaten their entire meal in the time we'd only received a menu!!   We are big believers in the tipping economy here and take great care of wait staff. We went over to Mon Ami Gabi, where we were seated immediately, had a delicious meal and our incredible waiter Jeremy took great care of us.   Don't care how good Giada's food is; that's no way to welcome some well traveled foodies into your space. We'll spend our winnings elsewhere!!

odNJlLErSGWCQVsDi0N40Q.text: Love this place!!! Always make a visit here when ever I'm in town! This place has a great view of the city and the food is excellent. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good meal! Rocco M. is a fabulous waiter. He really made our night!

D_HTXDDUS0IQc3dTuI7Tng.text: Special dinner for my special sis. We were a table of 4, the entrance is quite dramatic with the very high escalators up and down into the restaurant. They have a fun photo booth you can use before during and after your meal and we had such a hoot. It's all digital! We got the table by the window in the corner and I would say the ambience is really fun because they've got modern music playing at a moderate level and it's just so big and airy inside but also warm. Our server was beyond incredible he was very busy but always funny and attentive when needed. He made our birthday celebration very special and also didn't make us feel so bad that the table adjacent to us asked to be moved. We were just having fun and taking selfies but as my sister said. They just wanted a different experience. Haha. Ok to the food -  bone in rib-eye, arugula salad, lobster ravioli, lemon pasta, octopus, mushroom bruschetta. Omg. Everything tasted delicious!  Our drinks were perfection, I got the cosmo Blanco and the amaretto coffee after. Yummmm! So Giada, simple and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f9INISYZda3ZpJdExJEQIQ.text: The dining space is tastefully decorated.  The chairs are uncomfortable though.  Greeters and staff are friendly, warm and very efficient.  They're also knowledgeable about the wine, food preparation and had great recommendations for us during our visit.  People get 5 stars.  The dinner entrees were salty (pappardelle, lobster ravioli).  The spaghetti is available in red sauce and seemed to be the winning entree at our table.  Wish the food was warmer too.  The primary reason for only 3 stars is pricing.  The dinner was extraordinarily expensive (about $150-$200/person).

w2p-7IBkIK1RB_pgcdrQxw.text: My son and daughter-in-law were here visiting me, and we wanted to try Giada's. While the food was good, service was so-so. We don't normally order dessert after a meal, but we wanted to try a few of them. We each ordered something different so we could share. My son ordered an dessert espresso beverage. Our other 2 desserts arrived and we were told his was on the way. We ate about half of the desserts, and flagged down our server to ask about his espresso.  We were told it was on the way. We finished the other desserts. Still no espresso.  45 MINUTES went by, and still no espresso.  We asked to see manager, who said she would comp a few things and would recerse original amount chargedto by account, as by this time I had already paid the bill because we just wanted to leave. I've checked my bank account and no reversal has been processed.  I've called and spoken to 2 different managers at the restaurant, and still no changes to original charges. It's been well over a week now. So, time to call my bank and argue the charges. Very very disappointing experience, as it was our first (and last) time dining at Giada's.

UFDBn4kE33NDAddAWv31nA.text: First time coming here and the place is lovely. Dave was a wonderful server and the food was amazing! 10/10 would recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KXZMbaBQlWlW7tPL4-_tWg.text: Woah. What a let down. Made a reservation for 14 people on a Saturday night for a birthday dinner, I must say that this is hands down the worst service I have ever received at a "fine dining" restaurant. My server was completely unhelpful, disengaged and seemed bothered that he had to serve us. The food was mediocre, appetizers- bacon wrapped dates and the charcuterie and cheese were great. The main entrees that we got- the signature spaghetti and scallops were bland and lacked flavor, the wine that we had was good and well priced. The server didn't offer any recommendations, and while the ambiance is great paying a higher price for poor service and mid level food overall felt like a waste of money and would recommend trying somewhere else.

B9Q7GGNaCL480r1vNKmljQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for quite some time but probably not the best choice for my husbands bday.. we got arancini balls, oysters, seafood tower to split... I got the fried chicken, he the seafood risotto. The balls were ok, oysters were decent... seafood tower was sad for the price. My fried chicken was ok just no spice or flavor which was a common theme at giadas. My husband hates his risotto. The dessert was very good though -- cookie platter + the Nutella one. Very good. Service was great but the food was just lackluster.

6azUrlctjduBUgc2Ccxupg.text: The food was good. The service wasn't a good as I expected. We went for my wife's birthday and I told them this when I made the reservations. The hostess acknowledged this by wishing her a happy birthday- great. After being seated, it quickly became obvious that ensuring that we had a nice meal was the last thing on our server's mind. And, as I expected, he didn't mention her birthday.  He delivered our drinks and food okay, but, at a restaurant like this, the service should be outstanding.  The place was extremely loud, which they seem to supplement with garbled background music.  It was a nice place to try out but I doubt if we'll go back. Not with all the great dining options that Vegas has to offer. Back to Bouchon!

2EXQKp_UjPOPa_QLEXD25g.text: I've been a devoted Giada fan for over 15 years so I was so excited to dine at her restaurant. Giada did not disappoint! Amazing freah bread with awesome toppings such as mascarpone butter, sea salt, fried capers, and red pepper flakes. Our favorite sides were the artichoke appetizer and brussel sprouts. For entrees we had the lemon spaghetti with shrimp and the risotto with scallops. Both creamy and delicious. For the finale we the dessert tasting menu. Some of the best desserts I've ever had- raspberry chamomile sorbet, limoncello cheesecake, hazelnut brownie, and polenta cake with fresh strawberries and mascarpone frosting, followed by Giada's famous lemon ricotta cookies.

HLoGzHblRMxHjfDM8_gmdQ.text: We were so excited to try Giadas, but the service was very disappointing! We arrived for our reservation and were promptly seated at a nice booth with a great view of the strip. Then it was downhill fast! I waited and waited must've been 10 plus minutes and No One came to our table, no greeting, no water etc... I had to ask who our waiter was. Well then we wait longer still no water etc... We finally meet our waiter he says he will be right back, still no water even though we asked for it. He comes back eventually and we order drinks, he forgets two of them but blames others. Problem continued throughout. Too bad because food was great but service is terrible! We told him it was a birthday celebration and no acknowledgment at all of the bday! We will not be returning! So sad! Not worth it at all unless you want to be ignored!

U2dqHGKc_LSgIjzcW_2cXw.text: We ate at Giada's last night at the Cromwell. My wife and I shared the Crab Crostini, which was excellent! We then shared a pasta dish, Bucatini.  We were advised that we could request that it NOT be very spicy, which we did.  It came to the table and was very spicy and when we inquired about it,  the waiter said "it depends on the cook".  We each took 2 bites and were unable to eat it. We then shared a $57 Veal Chop Saltimbocca that was marginal at best. Needless to say we were very disappointed and would not recommend it to our friends.

ajR0F4JKxX2HfoSAgs-pLQ.text: Back to Giada with my adult kids, Thursday 8pm reservations for 6, wife requested a window.  At reception table is ready but we are told there are no window tables for 6.  Offered them a $20 for improvement that will satisfy the wife.  5 min wait to move things around.  Given a 6 person booth, across the isle, between 2 windows.  Can see the Bellagio fountains from 3 seats.   Sun set is pretty amazing tonight.  Its not too loud.  Dress is all over the place, wearing kakis and Tommy Bahama silk shirt.  Ordered a round of drinks, shrimp and calamari and 2 orders of Arancini to share.  Checking out the wine list and finding Tomasi Amarone is the winner.  Drinks are slow, appetizers arrive before the drinks and are taken away.  Major kissing up for the slow drinks.  All fufu drinks except for my scotch. wtf?   I go for the veal chop that looks like bone in wiener schnitzel, daughters share the bucatini in a cheese wheel, its huge.  Wife the shrimp spaghetti w mascarpone, lemon, basil. son and GF had the lobster ravioli (too much butter) and fettuccini w chicken.   See pics.  Will be back next time, one of the favs.  $644 for 6 including cocktails/wine, after the tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lemon spaghetti.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Ravioli swimming in butter.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Veal chop that looks Wiener Schnitzel.

AQy98W-6yK6byt53V0CohA.text: Giada probably has never stepped foot in this place. She just gets paid to have her name on the door. There's a million places in Vegas to grab a great meal, this just isn't one of them.   We consider ourselves foodies, eat fine dining all the time in Denver, Seattle, Vegas, and New Orleans. Started out good with an interesting bread plate with fried capers and some yummy pesto dipping oil. Ordered 2 apps, mushroom crostini (which was excellent) and also the calamari. Bit Into the calamari and it was seriously the fishiest calamari I've ever had. Informed the waiter and he said we were the second folks that evening to send it back.  They Sub'd our calamari with a fried tomato/cheese dish but they must be sharing the same oil, because it tasted like rank fish as well.  Kind of ruined the rest of the experience for us. Pork chop was OK. Short rib Parpadelle was only borderline, not as much flavor as expected.   We left disappointed.

d4uMgTRLQOG00_wwhSc32Q.text: Is Giada worth the hype? Yeah...personally I think so. The ambiance of the restaurant puts confidence in me to know this will be a good experience. Also, the food was fresh and well-presented. Service was attentive throughout the night.  Wish I knew about the photo booth by the hostess desk. I would love to have quality photos of our night instead of taking a selfie by Giada's marquee at the bottom of the escalators...lol. So don't forget to check out the photo booth! Our candlelight table was by the window with a great side angled view of the Bellagio fountains and LV Blvd.   Along with their complimentary assortments of bread and its corresponding condiments, Boyfriend and I decide to order a few appetizers to share. We got:  Bacon Wrapped Dates: with spicy Italian sausage & gorgonzola crema $15-a lot of flavors going on here. You get a mixture of the sweetness from the dates and all the savory goodness from the bacon and a small hint of Italian sausage.  Spicy Italian Sausage Arancini: with parmesan fonduta & pomodoro sauce $16-this tasted like a fried mac n cheese ball to me. Don't get me wrong, it was freakin amazing!!!!!!! Didn't really taste any Italian sausages though.   For our entrees, we ordered: Fregolotto: with roasted rainbow cauliflower, garlic puree, parmigiano, kale pesto, crispy prosciutto $28. This is in the pasta section and it looks and taste like couscous. I enjoyed this very much. The flavoring could be a bit more, but once I added some crushed red peppers, boom! the flavor and the added spice was perfect!  Barolo Braised Australian Wagyu Beef Short Rib: soft polenta, garden vegetables $52.-Boyfriend was obsessed!!! He's a big short ribs fan so when our waiter introduced a few of the dishes to us, this caught his attention and immediately had his heart set. However....he's someone that doesn't bother looking at the price so when our bill came, he was a little taken back by how much this dish was. Granted, even though he enjoyed it...he didn't feel like short ribs should cost $52. He said at that price....it's worth getting a prime rib!!! By no means does this affect our experience and this review, but just an observation.  Portions were on the small side. I'm a really small eater but I was able to finish my entree....along with the appetizers and bread I ate before that!!! I couldn't believe it!! LOL!! To me, the fancier the restaurant, the less likely I'll have leftovers for the next day...and this girl loveeeesssss her leftovers!! Great restaurant and we will definitely be back....there were a lot of other dishes we wanted to try. Good job Giada, your restaurant is well worth the hype!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fregolotto. Kind of taste and looks like couscous. This was a good dish!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Barolo Braised Australian Wagyu Beef Short Ribs
