2mUnXsHh_BdROeMk8z66rQ.text: This is my new favorite restaurant!  It's beautiful and the food is amazing.  All the recommendations our server made were so good.   I love that it was fine dining without feeling stuffy or uptight.  Have the spaghetti.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Start with a glass of champs

DrcmoxLpOsQBUemxqIe2ZA.text: We had a party of 10 and made reservations. We were seated almost immediately on our arrival, but it took an additional 15 minutes for anyone to even give us menus. We didn't receive our drinks until 40 minutes after we arrived. In the meantime, we were offered water. Our choices were distilled or sparkling. Beware! Everyone is charged for water. Even distilled. $9! Also, if you're hungry, don't go here. Small, overpriced portions.

_5Y1HZbovIKRcRpFUFOUPA.text: I recently had 5 fantastic days in Vegas with my bff's! Dining was magnificent! However, I was disappointed by the pretentious air of Giada's. Since the decision to have lunch at Giada's was completely spontaneous we did not make reservations. On arrival, although the restaurant was half empty, the Hostess refused to seat us at a table, allowing bar seating only! The hostess made it very clear that without the "requisite" reservation only bar seating was allowed. This makes no sense when a restaurant is only half full and it is obvious there are not enough reservations to fill the space! The food was delicious but the pretentiousness left a bad taste.

ioMWsDVG6eQPeXmX0jsc_Q.text: First time at the Giada. We came for lunch on my birthday. We started with couple cocktails, barbarella and the white sangria.  The Barbarella was fantastic and I'm not much of a ginger fan. The white sangria was just okay. I probably would skip that next time.  We ordered the tasting menu from the appetizer which came with an array assortment of salami, cheese, lemon honey, olive, bread and vegetables.  I would highly recommend. It was $24 and big enough platter to be shared by four people we took half of our left overs home. For our entrees we had the salumi pizza and the muffuletta sandwich. And finished our meal with the Zeppoles italian donut for dessert.  Everything we ordered had wonderful presentation and was delicious. Service was outstanding also.  Overall, We enjoyed our experience very much, not to mention the beautiful view you get with your meal. Will definitely be back to bring family and friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tasting platter from the appetizer menu.  Delicious!! Highly recommend! Enough for four
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qEmS_K_7iX3KPSZcQUnkTQ.text: My wife and I went for our 30th wedding anniversary on evening of Sep 6, 2016.  Service, food, vino, desert, coffee and ambiance where super.  Great dining experience- 5 stars!

_CAHzuz5tPph7f_uLQm0Jw.text: Service was great, the wine was great, the ambiance was great, and the food was great! I had lunch at the bar and ordered the grilled cheese with a Tuscan white wine.  The best grilled cheese times 20!  The wine was different and unbelievably good!  I tend to shy away from touristy spots, but this Giada's was fantastic! I recently moved to Las Vegas, and I definitely will come back to Giadas. Good job to everyone involved in this restaraunt!

DBHGUFGSq2rEGtJYVLHCSg.text: We were there on 2/18/2018. I would have given Giada a 5 Star review BUT our hostess was not professional at all for the price this place commands. It's an expensive restaurant and you should expect the best service. Our servers were great and the food excellent. Please Giada train your Hostess on Sunday 2/18/2018 to be more courteous as expected for a  5 Star restaurant. We were there with a party of 11 and she was really rude. Her attitude when we were told to wait was really bad. A simple "I'm sorry your table is not quite ready" would have sufficed . Instead she made us feel really like we were bothering her. We will tell our friends about this experience. With so many options in Las Vegas, spend your money at other restaurants.

VHOrLr13zZ-xFfTgmTT11Q.text: What a great experience.  From the fresh focaccia baked in the wood fire oven to the amazing menu with so many options to select from.   The Prosciutto platter with Prosciutto do Parma, Duck and Lamb - so good.  The charred Octopus also tasty but it certainly is charred.   Had the Veal Saltimbocca, Milanese style...so Good. The Crab and Scallop Risotto was also tasty, very saucy though.   Enjoyed a nice Peju and Bridesmaid Cabernet! Great service and wonderful ambience...a definite stop when in Las Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Saltimbocca Milanese style
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charred Octopus

o_NmhabIQmylQyuh0cxtJA.text: Best meal I have had in over 10 years everything was cooked to perfection. Had the veal stuffed with cheese and Italian ham.  Pasta was al dente and red sauce did not over power the noodles.

G-buON4jIw0aP6uNDTo6Hw.text: Came here with boyfriend and I on our anniversary. There is a cute photo booth upon arrival that you can take pictures in. We tried it several times and were pretty disappointed that it was broken. The decor of the place is amazing. We get seated and everyone there is so friendly. I love that about a restaurant. Our waitress was extremely helpful and she was always there when we needed.  When waiting for our dinner, you get complimentary bread. The Rosemary bread was delicious and warm. The perfect bite for me would contain a decent amount of butter, a spread of pesto, capers, and salt and pepper. Haha I honestly enjoyed the complimentary bread a little better than dinner.  Here's what we ordered;  Risotto with crab and scallops. 3.5/5. Scallops are my favorite. It's sad when you order it at a restaurant and it doesn't live up to what you think it's going to be. The dish was lacking salt and pepper. Any seasoning really. I mean it was good. But it definitely needed a little help. I wouldn't spent that much and order that again.  Three cheese tortellini with braised beef and Genovese sauce. 3/5. This dish was super salty. Super super salty.   Whole roasted chicken cacciatore style. 3.5/5. Some of the chicken was really dry.. And also hard to chew. I almost spit some out. The tomato sauce was served with very delicious though. The fresh tomatoes inside of it helped me to not notice how dry my chicken was.  Dessert; Chocolate Tiramisu cake. 4/5. Pretty good! It was very chocolatey though we couldn't finish it.   We also got cookies on the house served on a plate that said happy anniversary. It was so cute! I didn't really care for the cookies at all though. We also got served some espresso from Caitlyn at the espresso bar. She's the best!   I would come back again to see how my new experience would be. If it weren't for the great service I had, I would give the food 3/5. But overall 4/5 :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JqQ8n4Hdjce6Xk2B-nwJAA.text: Liked Giada for the food, nice cocktails, friendly service and great ambiance. Posting this review since I saw one or two really bad reviews and want to balance that out. Great place and would go there again. Decent, but not super cheap prices. About par for the course IMO for a nice night out on the LV strip

cAFRVsNBSOHiTiB9MkXxwg.text: Just ate at Giadas restaurantt for Valentines Day and I was so impressed with the food service and the ambiance of her beautifully managed restaurant. My waiter Ron was outstanding with his knowledge of each item on the menu. I highly recommend Giadas restaurant in the Cromwell rght across the street from the Bellagio

XGIGt8jGM4aat5eus5y1dQ.text: The view is amazing ...the food is was decent.  A beautiful restaurant.

PYX41L6nBqMQZSbdvSnaGQ.text: I had the perfect 50th bday dinner at Giada with my husband. Great drinks and service and our dinner was spectacular. We NIH got the four course dinner with antipasto, lemon spaghetti, I had salmon and hubby had tenderloin then an assortment of desserts. Everything was delicious that I can't say I had one favorite. One surprise at the end was a peanut butter chocolate cookie with blackberry jelly-so unexpectedly delish!!  Our server Rocco and other server made us feel special today. Thanks Giada!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7f7QOqQwSEL-zVehaFNNvA.text: Celebrating my friend's birthday and i decided to try their chicken waffle. The chicken was the bomb, so crispy and so delicious but the waffle is not making sense to me nor not a good pair at all. Overall, I give it as a 5 star for their awesome view and the waiter exchanged our drink to something else without a charge coz my friend didn't liked the one he recommended. I would love to come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffle

B9F7cCf4RYr69T3foHXXOA.text: Service was exceptional. Food very delicious but portions are very small, especially for the price. While I'm at it, I will not complain about prices because it is a fine dining restaurant on the strip, with a beautiful strip view, so you get what you pay for definitely. Took my wife for her birthday and we both loved it, will definitely be coming back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned

hD_iQKlQReFKfZHGVUqk8g.text: My wife and I had previously eaten at Giada's for dinner on our last trip to Las Vegas and it did not disappoint. Someone told us that breakfast was even better, so guess what?  Breakfast it is.  I had the Sausage, Egg & Spinach on Brioche with Lemon Potatoes. My wife also had the Sausage, Egg & Spinach on Brioche but with the arugula salad. We also shared Berries with Lemon Yogurt Sauce. I ordered the The Palm to drink. It contained pineapple, apple, lemon & mint. My wife ordered the Rise & Shine which contained spinach, carrots, apples, celery, lemon & ginger. For desert we shared Zeppoles. Which are Citrus Infused Italian Doughnuts. We both preferred my drink even though my wife had no complains with hers. The service was awesome. Great view.   As with everything in Vegas, be prepared to spend some money but I would not even consider going there without making a reservation at Giada's. It is a must stop.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zeppoles--Citrus Infused Italian Doughnuts.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FsCPDKkJRFZGWdina2nSZQ.text: Firstly Giada you are an amazing chef! This is definitely the best meal I have ever eaten anywhere! As a former Opera singer and traveler of numerous countries and have truly eaten at many amazing restaurants in San Francisco, New York, ant Italy I can honestly say this restaurant has the most delectable and mouth watering food I have ever tasted! I went with my family and we ordered the tasting menu. Every item on the menu was delicious. Giada, please open up a restaurant in Los Angeles. I will come every week! I look forward to eating here again soon! Giada truly knows how to blend ingredients together to create food from heaven!

Hl09FMmriERgBFo-lrxkPg.text: We were in Las Vegas for Easter weekend. Giana's did not disappoint. They had a nice Easter brunch that included a pastry, an antipasti appetizer, an arugula salad, a main dish of crab cakes Benedict and a dessert. Absolutely wonderful experience.

PRbIZOyWKauj8eTSKJSXPA.text: Beautiful fun and casual restaurant for lunch. Love the corner view of the strip. Service is good but  too formal for me with all the music playing. Sausage pizza was one of the best I have ever had. Delightful!

a3M9z5Ne9R7-7LXmhmfIjg.text: 2/5 stars for food: I got the risotto with scallops.  Portions are TINYYYYYY.  And for $30+?!?!?!  No.  Flavor didn't make up for that price point either.  Now, for the good stuff.  Service was definitely 5/5.  We were there with a large bachelorette party.  We didn't get seated for a good 30+ minutes after our reservation, but we were late, so our fault.  BUT!  There's a photo booth tucked in the waiting area with FREE photos.  HOLLA!  Needless to say, you can have a little too much fun with that.  Once we were seated, we had a couple of guys (wished I remembered their names!!!) who waited on us and were super awesome.  They gave us complimentary champagne and kept it flowing all through dinner and even brought out a surprise dessert for the bachelorette.  The whole night was just a lot of fun, thanks to our wait staff!!  We had requested to be seated near the windows, so we could see the view, but unfortunately that did not happen....but the restaurant itself was really pretty and classily decorated.

wyrDqnGJUqp6T-s4sNn4Hg.text: Slow, Expensive and Rude.  Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how did you like the play?    I have been there six times, my bad.  Every visit has involved some experience that left us unhappy.  Last night will be my last.  It was over 1/2 hour before we got wine (we brought it, but that's another story).    It was 1 hour 45 minutes before we got entrees.    The manager's head was somewhere dark and warm.  An aggressive jerk who not only lacked empathy, but was combative.   He acted like we should be happy to be there because of "the lady's name who is on the restaurant."   I have to think that lady would be appalled at the horrible service, lack of compassion and bad attitude.     The sommelier was colder than the chardonnay.  She was a pretentious and bitchy millennial.  We brought our own wine, happy to pay $35 corkage for wine we know.   But our party of 8 was surprised with an unpublished 'rule' of two bottles per table maximum.    On a previous visit, we had two servers continuously circling the table, topping off our red and white wine with $150 bottle Italian wines like they were playing duck duck goose.  I expect this restaurant to be around for a while.   Millions of housewives pilgrimage to worship Giada's apron strings.  So the demand is inelastic for $30 spaghetti from a celebrity chef served slowly with wine you have never had at $100/bottle and up.   But I, and you, do not have to be another lemming.  Vegas has too many great options.  Caio Giada!

0oSTw7sMcSQ72y43nI_R2A.text: Oh Giada. You let me down...  My friends and I came here for a late dinner earlier this year because our friend Crystal W. is a huge fan of hers and really wanted to try out her restaurant. We got there a little before our reservation time so we could use their photobooth. I love photobooths, so I was so disappointed to find out that their printer was out of ink/paper so we would only be able to email ourselves our photobooth pictures. But guess what? If you do the email option, you do not get a strip of photos... you get just ONE. We asked them how the printer could run out of ink and/or paper on a Saturday night because it seems logical that they would have stocked enough for the weekend, but the hostess said only that they ran out and she did not have any more. What makes the photobooth experience even worse is that the camera is horrible and unable to focus, so the two pictures that we took came out completely blurry.  We were finally seated about 20 minutes after our reservation time, at a half moon table facing the window so we had a view. The restaurant interior is very dark, which is good for ambience I suppose but horrible for pictures, at least on my cameraphone. Luckily my friend let me borrow her phone for pictures since her phone's camera does better in low lighting than mine.  Our group of six shared the following appetizers: -- EGGPLANT PARMIGIANA FRIES: with pomodoro & parmesan fonduta The fries were pretty soggy, but they tasted pretty good. The marinara sauce complimented them well. -- ORZO MEATBALLS: with parmesan pomodoro These were just okay. Nothing special. -- BACON WRAPPED DATES: with spicy Italian sausage & gorgonzola crema I love bacon and I love dates, so I thought this would be a pretty amazing appetizer. It was good, but not that good. -- LOBSTER ARANCINI: with calabrian chili pomodoro & basil aioli We all liked this one. I think this was RF's favourite appetizer. Pretty good! -- FRITTO MISTO: shrimp & calamari with shaved fennel & lemon aioli There was barely any shrimp in this appetizer. It was mostly calamari... normal calamari. The aioli was good but they gave very little of it. This dish is basically overpriced calamari.  While the appetizers were mostly just okay, we all loved the complimentary breads spread. Long thin crispy breadsticks, flat crunchy bread of some sort, along with freshly baked bread in a crockpot came out with lemon butter, fried capers, pink salt, basil oil, and red pepper flakes. That was really fancy and delicious! They definitely get points for that.  We then had the following pastas: -- RISOTTO: crab & scallops We ordered two of these. JQ had one and Crystal and I shared one. It was pretty good flavour-wise, but it was not as well cooked as I would like. I like my risotto really well cooked so that it is nice and soft... and this was not that. But it still tasted good overall. -- FARROTTO: creamy porcini mushrooms, brussels sprout leaves, pomegranate, pecorino tartufo RF got this one. The grains were larger than we expected. The mushrooms are the dominant flavour of this dish and I thought it was just okay. -- PAPPARDELLE: pork ragout, parmigiano reggiano We ordered two of these as well. KB had one and Crystal and I shared one. Following the theme of the night, this was cooked too al dente for me and I thought the flavour was just okay. Crystal likes her pasta al dente though so she enjoyed it. -- BUCATINI: calabrian chili pomodoro & fresh ricotta JP got this. Despite having chili as an ingredient it wasn't very spicy, as least according to her. She also found it to be cooked too al dente for her liking.  While none of the desserts called out to me, our group ended up getting two: -- HAZELNUT CHOCOLATE TART I did not try this one because of the hazelnut, but Crystal was the one who ordered it and she liked it. -- LEMON BUNDT CAKE Thank goodness this cake comes with creme fraiche, because it is dry! You definitely need to eat it with the creme, and it tastes pretty good when you do.  Overall I found the food here to be pretty mediocre. Add in the high prices and it goes from OK to MEH and becomes a place that I cannot recommend and will not return to. Sorry Giada!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pappardelle
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orzo Meatballs

HvO3UsHHAB66HluP1intzw.text: After trying unsuccessfully to get dinner reservations anytime in the next few months.  I made plans to try Giada for lunch.  We arrived a little early and checked in with the hostess.  She said they were running behind on reservations.  The whole hostess area was crowded with people waiting so we decided to leave and walked around for a bit.  We were told they would call us when our table was ready.  We were a little worried about time.  My friend had to work later that day and I had seen reviews about being seated late and service and food being slow.  We decided to not wait for the call and just go back to the restaurant to wait.  To our surprise we were seated right at our reservation time.     I ordered the Birdie for my beverage, it is Giada's version of an Arnold Palmer, while it was good I wouldn't order it again.  Nothing special, esp for $9.  We started with the Chicken Marsala Meatballs and a Margherita Pizza.  For our entrees we had the Tuna Sandwich with Arugula  salad and Lobster Roll with Zucchini Scapecci.  Both sandwiches were excellent.  I think the Zucchini might be my favorite part of the meal.  I wasn't sure what to expect but it was delicious.  We finished the meal with Zeppoles, Assorted Cookie Platter, Mocha Mio and Cappugiro.  Everything was so light and refreshing we felt great after lunch.  Not tired or sluggish like you sometimes get after such a big meal.  I'm looking forward to coming back for dinner or their new breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappugiro
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala Meatballs
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Sandwich with Arugula Salad

3JYV9_c67tTmY3-0HlzefQ.text: Don't see the personality of this restaurant. Got window seat without paying extra $100. Server is nice. Bar tender has poker face. Not impressed with the food at all. We ordered giada Classic sandwich ( not available after we ordered, an Italian restaurant out of sandwich just unthinkable), salmon and pizza. We wanted to try all giada Classic but waiter insisted we mix with some non giada Classic..so what's the heck. We decided to give it a try..Anyway not impressed in any shape of form and will not go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer at bar while waiting for a table. Bar tender not so happy about it.

_W8z4-luhMwX_wcJheppQQ.text: I am a hardcore Giada fan and could not miss going to her restaurant while in Vegas.  Right from our drinks in the lounge to dinner's end, I was so pleased we had time to fit this gem in!   Oh...there's also a photo booth at the entrance.  We wanted to partake with a group shot to end our perfect dining experience. ..unfortunately for us this older couple were getting it on behind the curtain!  Seriously?!!!  Do you not have a room?!  Anyways. ...don't let that deter you from a GREAT place to relax and experience fine dining. Message to that OLD couple. ..."Get a Room!!" Ew

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E01Q-QG5MaeH-_sxRrJrKw.text: Giada's was one of the most pretentious restaurants I have been to. The food was cold. The service was slow. Overpriced to say the least. Portions were sized for kids meals. With so many other choices in Las Vegas, go somewhere else.

4Nt_w78cV-Sp525kTV9JTg.text: It pains me to write this review because I went there for the first time in December and then promptly raved about it for 2 months to anybody who would listen.  Had I written my Yelp review then, I would've given them 5 stars from the impeccable service, perfectly executed food, and beautiful ambiance.  My friend and I were seated in the main living room and still had a great view of the strip. We ordered the burrata and charred octopus dishes to start, and then I had the branzino while she had the crab and scallop risotto.  I ate every single bite. Our water glasses were never empty and the waitstaff was very attentive. The wine recommendations were spot on.  I left deciding it was new favorite restaurant in Vegas.  I waited to write my review though because my experience with new restaurants is that the consistency isn't always there.  I just went again this past weekend and was appalled at what a completely different experience we had.  In all fairness, I wouldn't say it was horrible and the food was still decent, but relative to the high bar that was set from my first time around, it was a drastic change.  I had no issues with paying $100 per person the first time.  As for the second time, I would've been happier at Maggianos.    First, the wood burning smell was incredibly stifling this time and since the initially tried to see us in the little back room with seemingly no ventilation, it was difficult to bear.  We moved tables, which helped marginally, but it wasn't until they opened the windows later into dinner that it was back to normal.  Second, our waitress was sporadically attentive, disappeared for long intervals, and told me things that I asked for before on my first trip (like plain grilled bread to eat with the burrata) didn't exist.  (When she checked with the kitchen though, it did materialize.) She also cleared our apps without asking if we were done because our entrees were ready.  Third, the food execution......the orzo meatballs were tasty and the burrata again delicious. I did a repeat of the branzino because I loved it so much the first time, but this time it lacked seasoning and was the skin was crispy in parts and soggy in others. My friend got the rack of lamb, which was a pretty tiny portion to begin with, which wouldn't have been an issue if 1/3 of it was big globs of fat.  We didn't even bother with dessert.    I have no issues with portions sizes and inflated prices on the strip because usually you get what you pay for from a reputable restaurant.  This was a major disappointment.  I may one day try it again, but it'll be for breakfast or lunch if anything.

sz4tVFYU-wFxMsd9DnDWOw.text: Great place for breakfast.....sat right at the windows over looking the Vegas strip. The food is great and the vanilla mocha is the bomb

dJEX2ahBriRhgVD1SZM1uw.text: Giada was absolutely perfect, and that's a lot coming from me. Even the salad was mind blowing. Giada will be my last meal request if I ever make it to death row

t-IElflsTK63RtVxEgHZyA.text: Sat at the couches in front of the oven. Service was excellent, especially Brooke! However, the inflexible menu choices in this area left me disappointed as we were not allowed to order off the big boy table menu..

m45UzyfNzHvtk10lyvHvSg.text: Amazing service, with short wait times and food was cooked to perfection! The filet is worth every penny!

B6L_8aRBv4neoQfA-Y9W2w.text: The service is great but the food was very basic. We had the bake pasta and the Margarita pizza. Based on the price point and reputation we expected more :(

YIPWO7FH_6Hn9VlVZivncQ.text: BEST meal of my life. Server explained small portions so order a little of everything and share. We were not disappointed with portions because it was explained to us up front and it gave us room to explore the varied options. Great service. Delicious food.  Yes the little butter and pesto dishes were chipped so that was a little odd but not a big deal. Can't wait to return!

H9QdpaF218mIpxVHI88RiQ.text: We arrived without a reservation and on a busy night. The bartender, Jason I believe, moved several couples around so as to give us 4 seats so we wouldn't have to wait an hour. His service was awesome! The 4 of us have picky, specific diets. He accommodated all of us and ordered most of our food for us after hearing our likes and dislikes. We were disappointed with the dessert, so at no charge, he brought us another one which we liked much better. But, I still think the dessert portion of the menu needs to be readdressed. Add a classic Tiramisu please! I would have given a 4 star, but Jason did such a good job, I gave a 5. The best food we had the entire week in Vegas. Nice ambience, casual cool. Great view of strip. Decorated well. Not pretentious, just right for us.

-YPa6m6QCjle4xYB-pHrcA.text: Service was perfect! Menu was pretty impressive with options. My friend had the risotto and didn't even eat it. My salmon was good but not the best salmon ever and it was the most expensive salmon I have had. The side of corn with sausage was actually NOT impressive at all. The cocktails were impressive. Service impressive, view impressive, and beautiful lighting. I watch Giada show a ton and really wanted to eat here but dinner took 3.5 hours and the delay between courses was not appreciated at all. The Lemon souffle was the best thing we had!!! Truly amazing and I will crave it for years to come but everything else I can make better at home. I had the mozzarella tomato salad. It was colorful but not full of flavor!

Gu7hHPG08CS2XcdZf5kkpQ.text: I am a Giada fan and watch her show and make her recipes.  Her instructions are easy to follow and, as a self-described average cook,  I'm usually happy with the results.  That being said, this is a high-end restaurant (yes, that means pricey) and I knew that going in. So I'm unhappy to report that the food is perfectly fine but hardly worth the price.  When you are paying high $20's for pasta, you want the dish to be spectacular.  It wasn't.  It was just fine.  As were the appetizers.  And try finding a bottle of wine that you want for under $60.  I certainly don't mind paying over $100 per person for a  great meal.  But that wasn't what I had here.

-8sbmBSTBug5VAeT7fCsGg.text: The view is breathtaking, the service is impeccable, and the food is delicious.  I was extremely impressed with the design and detail of the menu.  I hope to visit again soon.  Anytime you get up from your seat, your seating area is quickly cleaned and a fresh napkin is promptly laid out for your return.  You'll never had to wait on refills, they are constantly making sure that their guests feel at home.

q40oWcsvozcOrHUsE4LfhQ.text: Well la de dah!. Last time we came to Las Vegas we couldn't get a dinner reservation, so we went for lunch. The food was very good, and the restaurant was very attractive, and modern. This timeI made a reservation 3 weeks in advance, and when asked for special request, I asked for a table by the windows. I was contacted a few days before, stating that the only way they could follow up with our request, was to guarantee that we would both spend over $100 each on food and drink. I stated that I wasn't sure on how much we were going to spend, so our table was in front of the bar. Loud, had to keep requesting to have water filled, and food service was not very good. I had better service, and food at "Olives" in the Balagio. Love Giada, I hope this is forwarded to someone who cares.

y_WlN9k4QV37CxEPvkJE8w.text: After a good friend & fellow foodie told me of her great experience at Giada's, I put it on my short list for my next visit.  I now wish I had kept it on the long list.  Upon entry it smelled like a log cabin with a roaring fire (fine if I'm camping).  Hmmm.  And that smell permeated my outfit for the rest of the night...sadly we had just started ours (pre-theatre) so that was a bummer.  Dry cleaner..here I come. Sat down and noticed chips on the plates & glassware...and as the meal progressed, more chips.  Our entire meal was luke warm at best (not piping made to order hot as it should be), Calamari was charred and dry (big ick!), meatballs super tiny (should not be allowed to call them meatballs), Bugatoni lacked flavor and character and my husband's white lasagna over cooked. Our waiter was a nice kid, but not guest service oriented.  We clearly were not impressed.  Anyway, walked away smokey smelling and hungry.  Have written in to express my disappointment and hope to hear from the restaurant.  Not holding my breath.

z1l-Bx_TBh0Br_xyy9uQAw.text: The service was okay (I shouldn't have to get up to find the waiter to get our check), food was okay (not great and I don't consider myself a foodie) and it was hot (sweating the whole time). Handing out a hard menu and an iPad was overwhelming and confusing. I wasn't overall impressed, better Italian in Chicago! I just expected more from the experience.

rzEIKZVwlgfoByG_2pwo9Q.text: The ambiance and decor were great.  The food was quite a let down.  The lemon pesto grilled cheese was delicious along with the complimentary bread served at the beginning of the meal.  We also ordered a pizza that was less tasty than a frozen Red Baron Pizza.  The tricolore salad had more blue cheese dressing than even a blue cheese lover could stand.  The lasagna was a uniquely prepared however the flavor lacked the taste that the server described. Surprisingly many items seemed very oily.

-gruZs_wJkMdYZiKyorE9Q.text: It was with much anticipation that we came to Giada for dinner.  Unfortunately the hype was not as good as the meal or service.  The food was not very flavorful and we had to send back a meal due to it being cold.  Disappointed.  If Giada was there personally tasting the meal, she would have been disappointed with the meals with her name on the sign...herself.

hLzIGvvAhftbNUDjahVlDw.text: I was so excited to come for dinner and unfortunately did not have anything that I need to come back for. The server needs to spend more time with all of the recommended items, and make sure that the customer has an amazing experience. In all places you can go to eat at Vegas, this is not one. I'm sorry but I'm completely honest.

bsmNu3OtOCgT22tRQzvTLQ.text: Just OK. Waited two months for the reservation so perhaps my expectations were high. The food is tasty but my appetizer and main were served cold. The lobster ravioli was a little overdone but the sauce was delicious.  Overpriced for the portion size. Great service. Ambiance was perfect.

NUE3poQKFkqMo996w-m0cw.text: Walking down the strip wondering where we would have lunch, we snapped up a last minute reservation at Giada's. Started with a glass of champagne at the bar in the Cromwell, and made our way up to the restaurant for one of the best meals I have ever had! Yes, the lobster roll was $35, but it cannot be topped. I know because I have had my share of lobster rolls. All ingredients were fresh, the decor was beautiful (great view) and the service was outstanding. I will definitely come here again if the opportunity arises.

vh29lFhDEOV-A-XBtv-rwQ.text: This is my new favorite chef's tasting menu in Vegas!  They give you some of her recipes in a signed envelope when you do it. It's also not as expensive as most other places - $125 a person.   The ambience is so airy and beautiful. We sat by the windows which open! The service was some of the best I've ever had at a restaurant. They were always on top of our drink orders, waters and courses and their knowledge of the menu and different foods was impressive.   They start you off with an assortment of breads, oil and seasonings. Here's what I loved most - the lemon spaghetti with shrimp (the shrimp were HUGE), the vegetable bolognese, the smashed potatoes and grilled broccoli rabe, bacon wrapped dates, goat cheese stuffed peppers.   Here's what we also tried but I wasn't totally in love with - the third item on our antipasti platter (Giada's favorites). I can't remember what it was so it wasn't memorable. The salmon wasn't as great as I had hoped, the lamb was good but I didn't completely love it and the farroto was ok.  On to dessert - WOW! They bring a cart over and let you choose whatever you want and as much as you want. I had a chocolate torte with a scoop of banana gelato and a scoop of the coffee gelato at the waiters insistence. My husband had a cheesecake with strawberry gelato. The deserts have gold flakes on them!  One thing irritated me - there was a guy sitting at the table next to us with a baseball cap on. He was super annoying. Not Giada's fault at all but I couldn't believe he would eat in such a place without removing it.   This is one of my new favorite places in Vegas. We will be back next trip!

W-7B6pOwAlpSGth5azmYHA.text: The food was alright. The toast was thick and buttery with a hint of butter, but the service by Jhovanny was spectacular. That's what made the place-personal service, attentiveness and personal charm at the bar. Jhovanny is a gem!

2Iv56ygoXw6uJyyicgDf3Q.text: Disappointed from the first 10 seconds.  Why? Because that's how long it took for the hostess to acknowledge us standing in front of her.  We were on time for our party of 4 reservation, which was set 3 months ago.   My boyfriend and I went to dinner with another couple and we were looking forward to this dinner for months, as no one in our party had been there ( we all live in CA) before but had all heard great things about this restaurant.   She tells us they are readying our table and that we could wait in the bar.    We wait in the bar...5 minutes...10 minutes....15 minutes....20 minutes.  All the while, the main dining room that wasn't filled when we first arrived, was completely full.  People kept being seated while we were waiting our turn.  After patiently waiting 20 minutes, we go back to the hostess to see where we're at with our table.  Then she says that she'll have us seated right away.  Another hostess takes us into the main dining room and then leaves us in the middle of the floor while she goes to "check something".  She comes back and takes us to a BACK ROOM, with NO WINDOWS and only 4 small tables with even smaller chairs.  NOT the dining experience we were waiting out the 3 month reservation for!    We kindly ask to speak to the manager, who apologizes and offers to break up a larger table for our smaller party.  The table we are taken to is still OFF the main dining room, still behind a small wall with blinds in the windows blocking most of the Las Vegas view.  The food was above average, but in Vegas, there is no shortage of superior food.  I do not feel the need to ever come back here.  What irked me even more was that there wasn't any attempt at service recovery. Meaning, no effort was made at all to recover the situation other than moving us CLOSER to the main dining room.  Keep in mind, this reservation was set 3 months ago!    Dinner was good, but not mind blowing.  At the end of our meal, my boyfriend wanted a pastry off the pastry cart, but was told he couldn't have one because those were for the special Tasting Menu only.  THEY COULDN'T EVEN LET HIM HAVE A COOKIE FROM THE DAMN CART!  We were not offered comped dessert, drinks, or ANYTHING.  Not that we were looking for freebees, we spent close to $500 on this dinner.  But I just feel, that being in the food/service industry myself in the past, that MORE could have been done to make up for such a bad start.  I was left with a bad taste in my mouth for the majority of the experience.  This dinner was going to be our big splurge for our Vegas weekend with good friends and it was very quickly ruined.    The hostesses are the FACE of any establishment, they create that initial impression.   When they don't acknowledge your presence or at least make initial eye contact with you when you walk up, that sets a bad tone for the whole establishment.  The manager did not even return to our table to check up on us to see how we were doing.  I was dining at Sage at the Aria the night before and my boyfriend only had to look over his shoulder and someone QUICKLY approaches our table asking if he can be of any service to us.  THAT is PHENOMENAL and SUPERLATIVE service.    Other restaurants I have been to (in CA) would have a manager come to the table to see how we were enjoying our food. I mention that the steak I ordered, at the server's glowing recommendation, was overcooked and not at all how she described.  8 minutes later, we have another steak cooked to perfection and the manager returns AGAIN so see how we like this new steak AND she comps us a dessert.  She easily recovered the whole situation!  And we were left highly impressed by this restaurant and we continue to recommend it to our friends and family based on their phenomenal service.  GIADA'S COULDN'T EVEN DO THIS!  Not asking for much, only some simple consideration for our dining experience.    I'm returning to Vegas again in 3 weeks and again, my girlfriends and I have a reservation at Giada's.  BUT if this is what I can expect for my money, then I am taking our party SOMEPLACE ELSE.  SUCH A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!

rvvbYzr1v2fx17ReN4u8kA.text: High quality food packed with several different flavors. Our server Cliff was a nice guy. He had the perfect balance of serving us when needed while allowing us to take our time with the experience.  The atmosphere was awesome and the view was spectacular. Also, the wine and cocktails were excellent. Overall, I enjoyed the entire experience. Is it pricey? Yes. Is it worth it? Yes.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Assorted bread platter

siR4_lYFZEzoeDrqJweIuQ.text: We traveled to Vegas again so we decided to hit up Giada's for lunch since our dinner was so outstanding!    The lunch was really good, but not as good at the dinner.    We had one app that was the roasted sweet peppers stuffed with goat cheese.  That was a pretty good starter.    Unfortunately they did not have their signature lunch dish, the Lobster Roll.  So we went for the muffaleta and the lemon grilled cheese sandwich.  The muffaleta has a great flavor, but the bread was too hard in my opinion.  Plus it was a tad small.  The grilled cheese was very tasty.  Plus we added prosciutto to it to make the sandwich more savory which was really nice.    The best dish we had was the dessert which was the tiramisu with lady fingers.  The flavors just exploded in our mouths and definitely elevated our lunch to another level.    Overall it was a nice lunch, but nothing special.  It was solid, but not spectacular.

0jH6IdXAiQ1N80uNeHhJOg.text: Wonderful food!  Amazing service! Brunch is delicious!  Will definately be back! Thank you Giada!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q1QBdC-dT7i-fpJJqc-D-A.text: I am a big fan of Giada's  recipes and shows. I was very excited to try her restaurant for lunch on Tuesday.   We ate at a lot of wonderful restaurants in Vegas and this was not one of them . I was extremely disappointed .  The burata and  crackers were the only memorable part of the meal . The Marsala  meatballs were okay . my sister had a salad with chicken Milanese .  The chicken was raw in the center and the greens were bland and pale.  My greens were pale and my two shrimp were large but they had no seasoning whatsoever.    No pepper was offered on the salads.  White sangria was good but nothing special for $15 .  Two drinks , two appetizers , two entree salads (they took the third one off of our bill)  came to over $140.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marsala meatballs

RuhPx5M03bHxFgw9qRzRFw.text: Everything starts with service, and the wait staff here is top notch.  Knowledgeable, friendly, and there when they need to be with attention, and absent while you do not.  The food...wow.  We had the chicken Marsala meatballs, the romain salad, the linguine with pork ragu sauce, lemon smashed potatoes, and the stuffed veal.  The portion sizes are generous and practical for a high end restaurant.  The above meal was a bit too much for two people to split.  The meatballs were yummy.  Well balanced...the tomatoes added much flavor which was pleasantly unexpected.  The salad on its own was quite good.  Boldly flavored, and the flavors were completed with the croutons.  But using the included cheese "breads" added another level to the taste.  The pasta with pork ragu sauce...delicious.  Savory and boldly flavored...we wished the pasta was a bit firmer...but even that did not distract from the flavor.  The portion itself would be enough for a light eater.  The stuffed veal...was perfectly done.  Crispy, savory, with a bit of salt from the cheese and prosciutto.  It was nicely complemented by the pasta and the lemon potatoes we had ordered.  The iced tea was a very lightly flavored with peach...and perfectly complimented the entire meal.

N68px75UkC--uTz1MMBw_w.text: First impression of this place was amazing. I almost had a heart attack as I was being walked through there 5 corse meal menu. Everything at dinner is very expensive, but very worth it! The atmosphere is amazing. We had the eggplant appetizer, I had the lobster stuffed ravioli and my date had the steak. Every plate they brought out was plated to perfection whoever expos here does an amazing job. I had a bloody marry which was also presented very nice and my date had some specialty cocktail not my thing. All in all an amazing experience and I will be back for there legendary breakfast menu I here so much about.

r19Vn7B3gzn9JR7jdAM4AQ.text: So a group of us decided to try Giada's for a friends birthday celebration.  First of all, if you don't want to valet, it's a pain in the ass to get here. I won't get into our ordeal with trying to get reservations for a large group, that was another pain in itself. My most favorite part of the Giada experience was the bar; Flash Gordon was playing on the tube, the bar staff was friendly and informative, and they served an awesome drink called The Flash (Yes I'm a huge Flash Gordon fan).  The restaurant was beautiful. Our waiter was okay when we started the evening out but once he found out one of our table mates worked in a restaurant in Caesars, our side (not his side) of the table was almost ignored. The complimentary bread was great, loved everything in it.  For my meal I ordered the Spaghetti (with lemon and shrimp).  It was very average, the pasta was a bit over cooked. I expected it to be al dente, it wasn't. And the pasta was all stuck together with whatever they used to dress the pasta.  We also tried the Margherita Pizzette. That as well was very average and small. Another starter we sampled was the Bacon Wrapped Dates, they were okay, they were spicy as described, I have had better. My husband got the Filet. Another disappointment. The steak was done as ordered but it came with a clump of maitre d'hotel butter that was ice cold and did not melt.  They brought around a dessert cart after our meal, the waiter was unenthusiastic about his job. We asked him multiple times to repeat himself because he was so quiet. For dessert my husband got the Chocolate Zabiaone, it was just alright, not quite what we expected. I tried the Chocolate Chip cookie, Peanut Butter and Jelly Cookie. Both were good cookies.  We spent a lot of money for a very average experience.  I doubt I'd go back but if I did I'd get the Rib-Eye, we had a bite of a table mates and was pretty darn tasty. But good steak restaurants are all over Vegas, don't go here just for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And on the TV at the bar... Flash ah-aaaa, he&#39;ll save everyone of us!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flash Gordon drinks....awesome!

K9-BdKITbJxmk8dddsDvng.text: I met a friend from out of state for dinner there.  We got a large bottle of Perrier water, some crostini for appetizer and a bowl of house soup & salad. We spent $75. No dessert. The staff was attentive and the ambience was decent enough. I was disappointed with serving sizes-we had 4-5 spoons of soup. (seriously). We both laughed our heads off after we left. We stopped at the food court in the hotel for dessert and it was so delicious ($15 for the two of us). I will not return. Might be awesome for a special occasion that you save up for so you can have a decent meal for 2 around $60 each person.

3Ha6h_j19fUVeFdps0LUeg.text: A group of us had dinner here and really enjoyed it.    Make reservations weeks in advance.    The view of the strip is awesome and we could see the Bellagio fountains.  We started with Veuve Clicquot Rose.  Later we had mixed drinks which were strong and good.    I recommend the Tasting Menu.   We tasted a little bit of many different dishes.   If you don't pace yourself, it is easy to fill up on appetizers long before the main courses arrive.  Everything from drinks to dessert was delicious.  Prices are expensive but Giada is a celebrity chef so this is expected.  I definitely will be back.  Our waiter and assistant waiters were very attentive and came around often.  We also had fun in the Giada photo booth.    Hours  Mon 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Tue 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Wed 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Thu 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Fri 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Sat 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am   Sun 8:00 am - 2:00 pm 5:00 pm - 12:00 am

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gMpnS-OYTuoTneV-SdPLng.text: So so good. We had a groupon for the tasting brunch and it was delish. Bottomless mimosas are truly bottomless and the "mimosas fairy" is very attentive. Can't wait to come back!

OiMWgQEWRWQ2WNPOojiA_g.text: Our reservation was at 9:30pm, we arrived early and saw some people enjoying the photo booth so we took some fun pics and upload it to our email.  They sat us at 9:30 and our waiter, Rocco, was prompt in serving us water and bread. They serve us with 3 different types of bread, all of them were fresh and flavorful especially the focaccia dipped in olive oil. We ate em all!   We both ordered the Tasting menu and Cabernet wine. There were three antipasti, crostini carpaccio and dates wrapped with bacon and red bell pepper with goat cheese. The first two were really good but I didn't care for the goat cheese. For the second course, I had the lemon spaghetti with fresh jumbo shrimp which was amazingly delicious and my wife got the veg bolognese which was very tasteful but not comparable to the spagetti. We end up splitting the spagetti and taking the bolognese home.  The third course, I had the Sicilian roasted lamb and my wife had the seared Salmon with succotash. Both came with smashed potatoes and sweet corn with spicy sausage. All were excellently done and beautifully served! with every course Rocco replaces our plates and silverware.  And finally the dessert cart! We get to pick 3 items each, but the waiter let us taste everything since it was late in the evening. My favorite was the choco truffles.  Overall, the food was amazing and the service was excellent! I would highly recommend Giada to everyone who visit LV. Just make sure you load up with cash since it's very pricey!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp lemon spaghetti. So delicious!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9g-aYtArr4RafOZ7cdr2LA.text: It's just ok. If you're looking for good Italian, there's plenty other places in Vegas. You're paying for name and view from your table. I'm only giving it 2 stars because the service was good, but the food was not.

AV1ifCAKJjJByMvlSgsGLQ.text: Let me start with the caveat that I have eaten much worse meals than my meal at Giada in my culinary adventures all over the States and all over the world. However, relative to price, this was one of the worst meals I have had. Food was ok at best.  Our server Joseph was charming. Our 8pm reservation saw us waiting in the bar until 8.30pm with no communication or updates. We were only seated when we asked how much longer it would be. Salad starters arrived and chicken had been added to the wrong one. When this was pointed out, the salads were taken away and all but one piece of chicken moved to the other plate. They could at least have tried to cover their tracks and move every piece of chicken! No consideration for the fact that I could have been pescatarian and might not have wanted chicken on my plate. Main of pistachio salmon was fine but the arugula salad on the side was wilted from being under the lamp for too long. Lemon shrimp spaghetti was just not very good and shrimp were very firm and over cooked. Wine and spirits list was extremely uninspiring. They seemed short staffed. This is a restaurant pretending to be higher end than it is.

_sW9I2S5t279C_6x-rpkiA.text: Other than Giada being my all time favorite chef, I can honestly say this was the best dining experience I have ever had. My boyfriend surprised me with reservations here knowing I had been dying to go and from beginning to end it was a delight. We got the tasting menu which our server informed us about aside from the original menu and everything was amazing!!! The appetizers were so unique and delicious, the lemon spaghetti was out of this world! And the salmon was perfection. The dessert choices we had topped everything off!  We couldn't stop talking about our experience here and I will sure be coming back many many times.  So good!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t forget about dessert!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti

o_DKMfnQyvslBnZsUoAJaA.text: I really like Giada and I was so excited to try her restaurant.  The restaurant is nice and clean and that is why I am giving it one star.  I ordered a simple lasagna and I was expecting to get a nice, delicious meal but after waiting for 45 minutes what I got was a lasagna swimming in water or basically a badly unfrozen lasagna, I showed it to our waiter, he apologized and quickly took it away.  They asked me if I wanted something else instead but I didn't want to wait for another 45 minutes.  I shared small portion of my friend's meal that was semi decent and we asked for the check, surprisingly they didn't even deduct the lasagna from check, I didn't want to argue with them so we paid the bill and walked out with very bad experience.   I really wanted to love this place but sadly food quality is not as good as even Italian chain restaurants like Maggiano's or Buca di Beppo, what a shame.

Ji4wijQM7JoGJODEB1nJ-A.text: Food was was pretty good but ruined with bad service. Unpleasant people should not work in the service industry. A group of 6 of us were having our last meal before saying our goodbyes before taking off on our flights, and the server made the experience so unpleasant! Brunch is supposed to be filled with laughter and mimosas but instead we were all dead silent and sulking because the waitress was so unpleasant. Not just rude, but intimidating--"are you done? Can I take it?" We hurriedly shoved the food in our faces and got the hell outta there. Yeah not going back. Sorry, Giada--- get better servers.

IiqvL1rLj_x-fCeVXuJnkw.text: My boyfriend took me here for a special occasion. Me being a huge fan of Giada I was hoping for something better. I ordered the Veal Chops and the BF ordered the Lamb. Both were mediocre in flavor and size. They had pasta dishes but only in appetizer size...for a Italian restaurant you would think they would have a pasta entree.

HumNKMw3GWpMoDIOD65JbA.text: One of the best meals I have ever had!   We decided to give Giadas a try before going to see a show and were blown away by how wonderful it was! We were immediately seated in a booth by the window so we could see out, and we had incredible views of the strip. We had multiple servers so we were never in want or need of anything. We ordered a bunch of small plates to share and they were all incredible. We got the brussel sprouts, meatballs, pizza, cesar salad, prosciutto and cheese, and breads and butter. They were all cooked to perfection and just the right amount of food.   The service was flawless, food was delicious, and atmosphere pleasant and elegant; we will be back!

g6jOqQ40V8Y6R5TIMpfcIQ.text: Love this place and find the service to be wonderful.  Came for brunch and left stuffed.  The food was delicious (especially that souffle) and the portions were plentiful.  Chris provided 5 Star service and Chef Eric came to my table to check that all was good.  I assured him (as I assure you) it was divine.

h0srYhmAzasdg6xMHRPyVA.text: I wish I could give it another half a star. I loved this restaurant. It is VERY pricey and I would say over priced. However their bread is served with salt and seasonings I've never had. The cheese plate was amazing. The caccio e Pepe was also delish. I felt like I was discovering new flavors I had never experienced and that is pretty awesome. Our server was great and we had a great time there. We really had a pretty great experience. It was paid for because it was a company dinner so I don't know I would personally pay those prices myself, but really good.

ZQfu2zyUrmEPp5JEaTNaaw.text: This review is strictly based on Brunch at Giada's and I would say that I would never eat Brunch at Giada's ever again!   It is very offensive & horrific to charge $9.00 for small orange juice and $6.00 for coffee and most of the dishes were unreasonably priced for small amounts of average tasting brunch food. Please ($18.00 for a two egg plate with bacon and less than 3 oz of potatoes, and toast are you kidding me!!!! And No I didn't get any Golden Eggs with this!!!  Yes I am a worldly traveler and Vegas does have finer brunch options for more quantity & quality for the asking price!! The brunch dining was very slow and there were people sharing plates as I am sure they were also offended by the price points and what was being presented. Our server was very attentive & gracious but  did mention that other guest are unhappy with the price points and quantity & quality for pricing!   Giada does offer also $45 Brunch Buffet~~~~ That should be a joke, but it isnt. Please Giada & staff reevaluate your Brunch menu, as for what you get & pay for is ~~~ABSURD!     NO GOLDEN EGGS at Giada's!!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Okay so this is a Muffuletta Sandwich $18 or doesn&#39;t this look like a half sandwich to You!!?? Giada you ought to be ashamed!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Polenta Waffle-$17.00 seriously haven&#39;t dined at at Waffle House in years but I bet I can get something more creative from them!

OgZ6NxrzOUA5w0H5cwm2Ow.text: In town for Rock 'n' Roll half marathon and had to come to Giada! I adore Giada and learned to cook from watching her shows! Her restaurant is so stunning and classy like her. Not only was the menu fresh and vibrant, but it felt very farm to table which I am not sure is a thing in Vegas.  Little to no wait and we didnt have reservations until about 10 mins before we walked in. Service was very nice and timely. We really like the decor and the windows with the breeze and the view of the area. I would have loved to sit closer since the restaurant wasnt full.  We had fresh juice and lobster hash and I had salmon. We both had a grapefruit mint juice.   We loved it so much we came back the next day got brunch again! I got the same juice and a spread of meat and cheese. I am a grazer so this hit the spot.   I wish Giada was in Seattle so I could eat here all the time! We loved it.   p.s. the photo booth and art gallery walls were awesome too

EOTDEaNRx06naKXcLhS-nA.text: We attended the brunch and it was amazing. Billy was our waiter and he was incredibly attentive and met all of our needs. Billy was the True MVP! Thank you for the fantastic experience.

1GfXZ4gLeZH1hLCnEQyseg.text: I was expecting robust flavor, but I was severely disappointed. The risotto was bland and inconsistent, along with the spaghetti lack spices and richness and small meatballs overpriced(I am aware it's Vegas on strip, but $56 is extreme).   I returned nice day  for lunch hoping the previous evening was just an off-night for the kitchen.  But the salumi pizza served lackluster as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HF2O8_N2OtPT883bBCMB3g.text: Had lunch at GIADA'S at the Cromwell. It was a cool restaurant to try in the spring when it wasn't too hot and all the windows facing the strip were open. I had a pineapple/lemon/mint drink that was outstanding, some charcuterie, and the baked pasta as my main dish. We had some lemon ricotta cookies to top it off.   Portions are small, but the food was beautifully displayed and tasty. Not really my style but it was delish.   4 stars!

0KyaOm6ErdaPHt396NapqQ.text: My sister-in-law and I had reservations for dinner at Giada for our last night in Vegas.  It was our second time here for dinner, we had been here 2 years ago and wanted to return since we previously had a great dinner.  We began with the Blanco Cosmopolitan cocktail, it was a tart lemon and vodka concoction that was refreshing with a sweet cherry at the bottom of the tall glass.  Different breads were served with lemon butter, pesto olive oil, capers, salt and red chili flakes as we relished our cocktails.  We ordered the bruschetta - a totally different bruschetta with buratta cheese, avocado and balsamic strawberry vinaigrette.  Delightfully flavorful.  My dining champion also had the arugula salad, which she really enjoyed.  The sommelier stopped by our table as I examined the sizable wine list.  I said we were looking for a Pinot Noir to have with our pasta entrees.  He suggested a California bottle from Sonoma that was very good.  We then were served our pasta dishes.  I had the ravioli which were filled with lumps of lobster and served with a light lemon butter sauce.  I savored each bite of this dish!  I also had a side dish of artichokes - artichoke hearts roasted with lemon and topped with shaved Parmesan.  Also very good.   My sister-in-law had the rigatoni, the pasta had a vegetable bolognese that she said was rich and hearty.  She noted eggplant and mushrooms in the sauce.   For dessert we shared Giada's favorite cookies, the lemon was our favorite.  A delicious dinner with attentive service in a lovely setting.

qh-jvrnutX2hxND5Vnuj4g.text: Brenda at Giada's wine bar is amazing, she was so friendly and knowledgeable about the drinks and menus and meticulous at making drinks. Will definitely come back!

MtGKqr8yX9-ApkUZ52ynuw.text: Giada's is my absolute favorite restaurant in Las Vegas!!! I have had every menu there (breakfast, lunch, happy hour, and dinner). Breakfast is very simple. Lunch is FABULOUS!!! Please try the sandwiches and fried string zucchini! Happy hour- the burger is drool worthy. Dinner- please keep in mind this is the most expensive AND heartiest. We had the chef's menu which has multiple courses, and they are deceiving since they come out on small, white plates but will have you full by the end with no room left for dessert. I always order no matter what time of day, cookies to go! They are so soft and not overly sweet. Giada's is a MUST for any foodie in Vegas!!!   PLEASE NOTE!! Some reviews complain the pasta is doughy. It is FRESH, made in house!! Having been to Italy, real pasta is not tough. Giada's shows you how fresh their meals are the minute you walk in and see their pasta counter and fire brick oven for breads and pizza. No complaints here!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple desert. Cookies and a small parfait but the perfect way to top your meal no matter what time of the day! Light but delicious!

AXolkY8U65PqMgxG_Xff5A.text: - rounded up 3.5 star review - recc pasta: lemon spaghetti. Expected it to be hotter (temperature) but it was still very tasty - recc appetizer: grilled octopus - bread was interesting. Kinda wish it was bigger (for party of 4) - service was friendly, but quite slow. - complimentary birthday cookies were tasty (lemon ricotta and super choco)

QbyOMaKfT4ORqFwU4MaxRg.text: Nice place with good view to vegas. Good appetizers and wine. It's goof for business dinner

VODJl17vd26eevrMq5aDYw.text: Just ate an amazing meal at Giada's in Vegas. First let me start with the ambiance, the restaurant is located in a boutique hotel which makes it all that more spectacular versus the large resorts. The service has been right on target. Our waiter was very Attentive but not overbearing. Very well versed in the menu. The Manager John was very welcoming and informative on the restaurant, Giada and the expectations of the staff to meet the clients needs. The food was spectacular we both had the crab and scallop risotto. Cooked to perfection and so filling! I highly recommend making this a top spot on your visit to Las Vegas.

UDYyUXaD4Mrf8OxvsdJeBw.text: I have eaten here two times and it is definitely a restaurant that we will continue to visit during our annual Vegas vacation. I travel once a year with my mom and sister for a girls trip to Vegas and we love to try out new restaurants as well as return to some of our favorite spots. Growing up Italian and still visiting my relatives in Italy, I am very selective when it comes to Italian dining experiences. Giada's restaurant is such a warm and authentic experience and the food is absolutely delicious! Many of the dishes are very light and fresh using lemon, white wine, and herbs rather than heavy and thick sauces.  Our waiter's name was Rocco S. and he was absolutely the best! I'm sure everyone is great, but he made the experience extra special and he is from a nearby town of my family in Italy so it was comforting to hear him speak in Italian to us. If you are able, I would suggest requesting him!  Make sure to check-in on Yelp during your dining experience for a fun free treat! We had the option of choosing between a glass of Prosecco each or an assortment of cookies. We took the Prosecco and started the meal off right!   The cheese board is seriously delicious and so are the homemade honey and jams that accompany. We also ordered fritto misto to share before our entrees. This included fried shrimp and calamari -- the perfect appetizer!   I also ordered the lobster ravioli and I would highly recommend!  We also enjoyed drinks and dessert, but I would warn that the drinks are very strong (not a complaint, just a heads up :) )  There is also a pre fixe option for $120 per person, but the entire table has to select this option. This includes an autographed photo of Giada and access to the dessert cart. From my observations the dessert cart offered a few additional sweet treats that were not listed on the menu, but my suggestion would be to nix the pre fixe option and order multiple shared plates for the table. This way the experience is truly customized to your group and for the same price or less you can try a bunch of items in a very fun way!   At the end of the meal, or while you are waiting to be seated, make sure to take some selfies in the photo booth!   Overall, I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. Honestly, the only thing that could have made the experience better would have been meeting Giada herself. Maybe next trip back!  I would also suggest making reservations ahead of time because the restaurant does get very busy. Make sure to request a window seat to enjoy a perfect view of the Bellagio fountain!   Happy eating!  Samantha Giacobbe

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect girls night at Giada&#39;s
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. save room for dessert!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. latte

BJ2lWyB404q03EoPSeIQfw.text: Being a fan of Giada's cooking shows on the Food Network, when I knew I was coming to Vegas I immediately booked a dinner reservation at her restaurant at the boutique hotel Crownwell about a month in advance.  We went there on the Halloween night and it was surprisingly quiet that night. My girlfriend and I were probably the most dressed up there and the patrons were definitely not the 20 to early 30 something partying crowds.  After looking at the prices on the menu I understood why, but what do you expect from a more refined, celebrity chef restaurant at a hotel in Vegas?  I enjoy Giada's style of cooking; Italian with her southern California twist; elegant, rich, flavorful yet not too heavy. The small bites (appetizers) menu is extensive: you might get full and not need the main course if you pick a few dishes. We only had the chicken marsala meatballs and roasted eggplant parmigiana with smoked scamorza cheese; both of which  were delicious. The eggplant dish tasted like a vegetarian lasagna dish.  We also had the scallop and crab risotto dish and the lobster ravioli, both were delicious but the portions were very small.   I wish I was hungry enough to try some of their meat or fish dishes, which by the way were a little pricey.   For dessert we only had room for a tiny cake, which was a special for that night and I can't remember the exact name but it contained some nuts like almond or hazelnut. It was good but a little too sweet to my taste. Maybe we should have tried their chocolate tiramisu instead?  The service was very good and prompt. The ambiance was modern and nice. Good place for a nice or romantic dinner night if you don't mind shelling out a little more from your wallet and not looking for cheap eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. almond cake
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crab &amp; scallops risotto

pGcUZZ_fwzfzntwNZCtNjg.text: I had the pleasure of dining this evening with family and had Nancy has our server. We decided on the tasting menu and we loved it!  Great service and varied menu, something for everyone! I especially loved the strawberry polenta cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yHQpdFfqq7cJXrnd36IIsw.text: The best meal I've had in Vegas!   We ordered the lemon pesto grilled cheese, strawberry pineapple polenta waffles, and classic gnocchi. Each dish surpassed my expectations! The grilled cheese came with some fried veggies with a garlic aioli and all of the flavors just worked so well together. The polenta added a cut of a crunch to the waffles, and the pineapples were grilled to perfection. The maple syrup and Nutella paired quite nicely.   Located in the Cromwell, Giada designed this restaurant to feel like you're a guest at her home. It's elegant and simple. Soft music, big windows with lots of natural light and pretty views.   We arrived a few minutes before 2, and the hostess said we missed lunch but could order from a bar menu and only the lounge/bear seating was available. So while we waited, I searched for a menu and saw that lunch was actually until 2:30. The bartender was nice enough to let us order, but the situation was a bit of a disappointment.   While we were there, Giada was also visiting, so it was cool to see her. Apparently she comes once a month, and seemed to know and interact well with a lot of the staff members. She changes up the menu pretty often and gets quite creative from what I've heard.   By the host stand there's a free phot booth! Be sure to stop in for a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh noodles
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GIADA made an appearance!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and veggies

dObkU_66OblDaORX0jX7nA.text: Well I am going to try to give you a quick rundown.   Atmosphere: 5 out of 5. Romantic and decorated perfectly.  Food: 5 out of 5. Prince Edward mussels were fantastic, cooked well, and balanced flavor.  Finocchiona was wonderful and well seasoned.  Ricotta Crostini with a drizzle of honey Burratta was amazing.   Seevice: 3.5 out of 5.  First we made a reservation for 8.15 and arrived at 8.16. Told hostess I was there. She said give us a few minutes. Finally seated at 8:45 after asking. No communication and she was stand offish.   Server: Out server seemed uninterested in us. He explained the menu and then took drink order and food order. We never saw him again until dessert.   Our backwaiter was amazing. He refilled our glasses, asked how everything was and made us feel very welcome.   We had to ask for a dessert menu and then our main server showed up to take the order. Overall I was annoyed by our server.   Drinks: 4 out of 5. So I ordered a Grey Goose and tonic and my husband ordered a Cosmo. His cosmo was 19$. I know we are in Vegas but good god. We have been other places in the strip and the prices were not this high for drinks.   Overall it was good but with a few tweaks could be amazing.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut Carmel tort
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ricotta Crostini

njEeXRf-NjMdJ6mjc8oH1A.text: Wow! What a disappointment!  I love Giada, watch her show, have her cookbooks.  I came here last weekend and was totally disappointed.  You can tell it is just phoned in!    The service was great!  However, the location is crowded, and sort of just run down.  The drinks were good, the food was just ok.    We had the Chicken Marsala meatballs, they were ok nothing special.  I ordered the risotto which was crunchy and undercooked.  My friend had the shrimp scampi fettuccine and it was just ok.  The flavor was just blah.    Both were so underwhelmed we opted to not have dessert.    Honestly neither of us were impressed and would not rush back to pay for a very expensive dinner that is just not good.

Khq_j_Q1CmzjT8tYJJqYAg.text: This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. It has every thing you want to experience. My recommendation is to make an evening out of it. Get ahead of your reservation and enjoy the bar with a tapas before dinner. If you get there early enough before your reservations make sure you request a fountain view.  Just one of the most outstanding culinary experiences in Las Vegas.

_nx26htBSrH4URmYSCuPsQ.text: The service was excellent despite the volume of customers. The pasta is incredible and you can taste the freshness of the ingredients. The server even brought me a complimentary dessert for my birthday. Overall it was an amazing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arancini

l5fcEIREVnngf-vWqUMmzw.text: I dined at the bar early in the dinner period, so it was not the normal bustle that this establishment experiences. This actually made dining more enjoyable  The martini was expertly prepared by my attentive and knowledgeable bartender Katie, and she had great suggestions on the menu items that I might be interested in sampling. Her advice was well appreciated and was spot on. I had the arugula salad and the bucatini and could not have been more pleased with my choices. The salad was just the right amount of spicy and acidic to entice the appetite and the pasta was firm enough to support the sauce but tender enough to be supple in the mouth. Both great! You can't go wrong with the food or the service at Giada.

fPfuYqkKaImom8wIBll2ww.text: Date night for sure! Try the tasting menu, it is well worth it. They were able to do it gluten-free for me and the lemon shrimp pasta will be on my plate again next time. The salmon was cooked perfectly as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2VEn4xp0qn1WLL7k_b_GAA.text: I wasn't impressed by the food, but my friend left a happy camper because this is one of her favorite restaurants in Vegas! Giada is very easy to locate as there are multiple signs pointing you into the right direction throughout the Cromwell. Bummer that the photo booth was not working this time around. It is located in the lounge/waiting area. You will not miss it because it says "Photobooth" in large print against the wall. So make sure you reserve some time to take pics before or after your meal to capture the memories.  The space in the restaurant was plentiful and open. High ceilings and tall windows adorned the restaurant. Giada is located on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd so you can get a great panoramic view of the strip. Everything was very clean and fancy; I didn't expect anything less from a $$$ restaurant.   We ordered the Dolce Vita and freshly squeezed orange and carrot juice as our beverages. The Dolce Vita was sweet and flavorful. I opted for the orange and carrot juice which wasn't as flavorful or sweet, but was an excellent healthy alternative.  My friend ordered the lemon pesto grilled cheese with a side of zucchini fries. The grilled cheese is one of their most highly requested dishes, but it wasn't memorable for me. The pesto cheese oozed out of the panini so if you're a huge fan of grilled cheese sandwiches, you should give this one a try.  I ordered the giada burger with a side of cacciatore chips. The chips were flavorful and crunchy. The giada burger was very tasty but I wouldn't say it was worth the price. I felt like I could've gotten the same burger elsewhere for a fraction of the price.  I probably won't come here again for brunch, but would definitely give it another try for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon pesto grilled cheese with prosciutto
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada burger
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dolce vita (left) and freshly squeezed orange and carrot juice (right)

7UKwimZl23mzTAvrI8TXuw.text: My friend and I just had a very enjoyable brunch at Giada's.  It was our second visit there in two years and both times were great.  Christopher, our waiter, was very friendly, personable and accommodating.  The bottomless mimosas are wonderful!  My friend's "Giada's white sangria" was very delicious.    She ordered the Breakfast Contadina and I had the Chicken with Polenta Waffles.  Both entrees were delicious and served with interesting condiments including lemon mascarpone spread and vanilla bean maple syrup.  Nowhere else will you find this!  Highly recommend a visit here.  The food and service were outstanding.

iRPKYsMY9xWvQrqz9nzTJA.text: This restuarant was a great experience thanks to our server Nancy.She made us feel so important like we belonged there.She made us feel like we were already friends.This was my wife's birthday and this was a memorable experience  Gary &Jeanne

BGaju8nCT38xFVyzRkE7Mg.text: When my mom was in town, my daughters, mom and I went to Giada's at the Cromwell to celebrate my birthday. What a classy place! The ambiance was excellent. We were seated in a round booth facing the strip. It was an amazing view and a nice breeze coming from outside.   We ordered the bottomless Peach Bellinis which can be interchanged with the Mimosas. Both were delicious.  We ordered the pastry assortment tray and each pastry tasted amazing  and at a very reasonable price.    One of my daughters ordered the Strawberry Polenta waffle which was very crispy and the berries were very sweet . My mom and I ordered the Lobster hash which was a good size portion and very tasty. My other daughter ordered the Caprese Frittata with Prosciutto which was very delicately flavored with fresh basil.  Our service was excellent.. attentive but very leisurely.  I will definitely be returning to Giada's very soon... it was a True dining experience!

Gx-BmoCyo3pSR52_pbbbrQ.text: Located inside the Cromwell, Giada is one gorgeous restaurant.  The biggest feature of all is the open air view of the strip.  The whole place has a classy ambiance.  I tried to make reservations for Giada for the night, but they were booked solid.  That's OK because the hostess said we could try the bar.  We came in and there were a few spots open, but they were filled up pretty quickly as well.  We got a few beers and ordered the mussles and Pappardelle.  The mussels tasted very fresh and had an excellent broth.  The Pappardelle is a pork ragout with parmigiano reggiano.  The pork ragout was excellent and tender.  I would definitely order that again.
