5sZRhT2kJgXXReSRi4pWkg.text: I was so excited to eat here today until my husband told the waiter and the hostess it was my birthday and they completely forgot and never brought out a dessert. My husband was really disappointed. Also, my food wasn't that warm when it came out. The bread is amazing there though!

MPEgGCa5LT9EZt8sPwbgxQ.text: My friends and I came here for a friend's birthday  celebration and when we tried to make reservations, our party (13 people) was too big and had to get a pre-set menu, which we didn't want because it's expensive and we weren't sure that every person could make it. So instead, they let us reserve 2 separate tables.   When we were seated, our tables were nowhere near each other. In fact, they were pretty much on opposite ends of the restaurant. On the upside, our server was extremely professional and very helpful! :) they were good at refilling our drinks and answering any questions we had on the menu.   I ordered a seared tenderloin crostini as an appetizer and the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. The crostini was decent and the spaghetti was okay. I did not enjoy the sauce, the portion was super small for the price ($34), and the shrimp was so overcooked! I was so disappointed.   Overall, overpriced and overrated. It is very fancy and professional, but I don't recommend at all, spend your money elsewhere, like a buffet. You'll get more bang for your buck. They also charged us for gratuity, which was okay with me, but they did not tell us. In fact, they gave us the option to tip more, so be careful when you tip! Make sure they didn't charge you already.

sLhn7nU407Ievf9kzbgZ3w.text: Giada fan so had to try the restaurant. Location was very nice. Decor was as well. Great view of the strip. Went for brunch on a Friday at 11:30. Had the carbonara pizza with a sunny side egg on top and the lobster hash.  Other were good for the first few bites. Halfway through they seemed to start lacking flavour or were missing something. Also ordered the assorted bread/pastry board. Had 4 items all sweet. A muffin, a danish, a scone and a chocolate croissant kind of sweet for before brunch but great for after a meal. Only thing I didn't like was the danish ( only cause it was filled with a lemon creAm and I'm not a fan of lemon flavoured sweets). Overall good ambiance but not sure I would go back for the food. Wasn't bad just wasn't great.

6oDzyeMbP3rR2CSgiFuQAg.text: Enjoyed a brunch tasting menu for two. Overall our experience was great. Seated promptly and waitress was over to help right away. We left lacking nothing we asked for. Top notch service on behalf of Rebecca Sass who was very professional and provided an excellent customer experience.

v-xQLOIdB4iIMg4cqaxL-Q.text: Wow! Starts with very Beautiful decor and ambiance.  We came here for brunch and ordered the Salmon Benedict which was divine! I got The house pasta which was Lasagna. It delicious but I've had better.  The lemon spaghetti was recommended by many but they serve it only for dinner so, bummer! I'll definitely come back for that. Staff were so friendly and attentive.  Will definitely keep in coming back here when we visit Vegas.

zBSNW9IQtg6pTGau2C7sHg.text: Nice enough. Atmosphere was appealing although they do not enforce a dress code. Was surprised at the lack of oversight on any attempt to have guests properly attired.   The food was good, chicken meatballs we're good. Service a bit subpar.   Overall, not great for the money. Better options abound in Vegas.

WGfwB7IaSyceOb4b9dYHzw.text: This was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had in my life! From the moment we walked in and we're greeted by the kind hostess, I knew this was going to be an incredible experience.   I booked online through Open Table and received a call the day of confirming. We made a change to the time and amount of people and they were super accommodating.  We started off with the crostini which is an absolute must. That burrata and honey, oh my it is good!! We also ordered the bacon wrapped dates which the men at the table loved!  We then moved on to the main course. I had the cheese ravioli which was so incredible and really melts in your mouth. We also ordered the lobster and crab tortellini and risotto which I heard were also great dishes.   As it was my birthday, they brought out a lovely plate of lemon cookies and another delicious chocolate dessert. You MUST get the lemon cookies here, they're amazing!  I give the service, ambiance, and food all a 10.  Can't wait to visit again next time we're in Vegas!

NPNiXLbVzrggVsS3aBXYow.text: I'd been daydreaming about dining at Giada since their doors first opened 2 years ago. She's one of my favorite celebrity chefs because of her take on Italian dishes with a healthy and fresh Southern California twist.  We made our reservations via Open Table which was a completely painless process. I originally had us set to go for brunch (when the prices are a little cheaper) but knew I couldn't possibly go home without trying a pasta dish, so dinner it was. Plus it would give us the option to try dessert as well. I've had my eye on the cookies, especially her signature lemon ricotta ones.    The restaurant itself is absolutely stunning. Gorgeous light fixtures, chic decor, and floor to ceiling retractable windows with spectacular views of the both the Paris and Bellagio fountains.   Because we were there in the evening, it was candlelit too making it very romantic. I would have loved a window seat but we still had a nice view from our table.   Our server was knowledgeable and had great recommendations for us first timers. I really liked the idea of her tasting menu, but at $140 a person we couldn't justify it. Had it been a special occasion maybe, but not for an everyday dinner.   We started with cocktails ($15 each) which were both great. Mine was the La Strada and had Campari, homemade lemon sorbeto, Bertagnolli Limoncello, and Proseco. Tart, a teensy bit sweet, and refreshing. I don't remember which one my husband ordered, but I believe it had orange bitters and egg whites in it.   The complimentary bread plate is interesting and we enjoyed the different flavor and texture combinations. You get thin breadsticks, crunchy Parmesan chips, and a small loaf of an olive oil bread with rosemary. Alongside is finishing salt, red pepper flakes, capers, pesto, and the most phenomenal lemon mascarpone butter in the world. You must try it! We couldn't get enough.   We wanted an appetizer so we agreed on the fried artichoke with orange hummus. We weren't expecting to see a whole artichoke come out. We figured it would be individual breaded and fried bits. It was messy and annoying to eat, but at least the flavors were there.   For my entree I chose the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. Our server warned us about the small portion sizes because the pasta dishes are not meant to be a main course. It actually ended up being a perfect amount, though I don't feel was worth the hefty price of $34. The shrimp were fishy and over cooked resulting in an unpleasant chewy bite. The lemon pasta however was perfection.   My husband ordered the spicy sausage pizzette and it was comically small. He said the flavors were okay but nothing to write home about.  We decided to skip dessert to avoid any further disappointment, and as soon as we asked for the check our once attentive server went awol. We sat with empty drinks and cleared plates for nearly 20 minutes until he arrived back with it. It ended our meal on a more sour note than I had hoped.   Overall, as long as you realize that what you are paying for is mostly the experience then you won't be let down. Should we make a return visit, I wouldn't mind opting for brunch next time.   They even take a photo of you downstairs before the meal, and try to get you to pay for a souviner copy on the way out. It all seemed gimmicky to me, but I suppose that's merely Vegas.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu

RELJ87bz8FXnsvekYg5dfA.text: A very nice overall dining experience with a very complimentary and thoughtful menu.  The Bucatini Pomodoro pasta was pretty amazing - pasta was perfect al dente and the sauce was fresh and light but with a ton of flavor.  Only issue was the very typical Vegas style celebrity eatery.

HrNL5n2FYr5_Ti5zQBT0UQ.text: Easy to locate in the Cromwell hotel casino very nice server. The restaurant had a million dollar view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain show

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HM5AyTLHQpgSEVMY-T4Kyw.text: I was so looking forward to trying breakfast/brunch here, but I was let down drastically. Ok I am going to talk about every aspect about the restaurant, let's start with the waiting area it has a faux leather tan couch that is soooo dirty and beat up and probably has not been replaced in the three years this restaurant has been open. Now let's move into the indoor decor...plates, napkins, doilies has her name on everything. The view is nice it overlooks the Bellagio water fountain and the windows were opened in 98 degree weather a lot of us asked to be moved because of the heat and they finally closed the windows when enough of the patrons complained. Our waitress Becka, I believe, was really nice though it's not her fault the food ...  Ok food, if you look at our profile we are foodies and eat at upscale restaurants all the time...with that said how can you go to an Italian restaurant and mess up meatballs, we had the chicken meatballs, it was either that or the orzo so we had the chicken and it has no seasoning and just did not taste like anything. The cutting board or charturie platter was good but it was $24 and then they ask do you want bread????? Uhmmmmm you normally eat the meats and cheeses with crackers, crostinis or bread well no....that was an additional $6.   Ok so I ordered the gnocchi... disgusting. It was chewy instead of fluffy they don't use potato they use flour and the sauce tasted like Ragu nothing special and the portion was small and gnocchi is the cheapest thing to make so you would think it would be a big plate. My partner ordered the frittata and he said it didn't taste like anything again and had to ask for pepper and salt when you go to gourmet restaurant like this if you ask for pepper or salt it means to chef they are not doing their job. But I tasted his plate and it was just not edible. $100 later for a breakfast/lunch We left hungry and disappointed. And to top it all off there was another frame of Giada every corner like her ego isn't big enough. Also being local this is the first time I go to a celebrity chef restaurant that has a freaking gift store Giada shirt, sweater, cook book, etc. I will unfortunately never come here again.

rTm6RY-eAk37QtDAxcAJmQ.text: Beautiful atmosphere for sure and the waiter was excellent but the two star is on the food. We were a party of 6 and our bill was $1003.63, yes a thousand dollars for what everyone called an "ok" meal. Not the best steak by far, Ruth Chris steak is way better, out of 6 people only 4 ordered a drink and only one drink each. Would not recommend this restaurant unless you want to go for the atmosphere and an appetizer before heading to a good restaurant for dinner.

6Gb3v8XxfL5gpP5nQySU8A.text: This place was amazing! The service was phenomenal and the food was so delicious. We enjoyed the risotto and the ravioli. I would recommend this place and plan on coming back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The risotto

l07i9GAZi6EtKloYSYZR4w.text: This place was way good!  I'll start from the beginning of our experience.   When we first walked in you picked up a very classy vibe which I liked a lot since a lot of time in "Sin City" you feel a little gross so it was quite refreshing.   The staff was very nice and accommodating and the tables and chairs were comfortable. The restaurant as a whole was very high end. Everything from the placemats to the mugs was personalized with the logo. A lot of thought was put into it and it was successful I thought.  Now I will go onto the food. It was very good. Nothing to jump around and dance about, but it was solid Giada food. Just what you would expect from the famous food network star. I got the Margherita pizza and I loved it. I also got a cappuccino which was very good, but, let's be real, how can one go wrong with a cappuccino? For desert we got these yummy fruit infused donuts with a chocolate dipping sauce and they were to die for.   The only complaint I have about the place was that they had this big beautiful windows open which would be lovely anywhere else except the smoky, busy streets of the Vegas strip. You would get random whiffs of cigarette smoke which really ruins your palette while trying to eat and enjoy food with new and exciting flavors. Also a really loud motor cycle or type of car would speed by and It was very startling. I dropped my fork at one point because of how creeped out I was.   Everyone at the table was content with our meal at Giada :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious donuts :)
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino :)

UiEHlYSZ1Wc4nKThJDpSkA.text: Gorgonzola cheese with raw honey and sliced pears were the start of a truly amazing meal. Life changing for sure! !  Then the chef had a lunch special of polenta under grilled shrimp and a chili oil that was to die for.  The piece de resistance was the dessert. .. heavenly lemon ricotta cookies, chocolate chip walnuts and chocolate peanut butter cookies with a raspberry jam. I also had the orange mocha mio which was perfection.  I can't wait to go for dinner. .. except for the next reservation is late October.   Well done Giada.

VMIZ-sd2eBwlNCALHtb8bA.text: Absolutely phenomenal.  Given the extreme hype my wife and I had high expectations, which would have been so hard to live up to - and Giada delivered.  Items selected:  - Lobster Arancini w/ calabrian chili pomodoro & basil aioli $18 - Pea Pesto Crostini, prosciutto san daniele $14 - Artichoke Soup w/ mint, tomato & focaccia croutons $11 - Tricolore gorgonzola, dates, walnuts & prosciutto $16 - Spaghetti w/ shrimp, lemon & basil $28 - Tortellini w/ pea pesto, pancetta & mint $26 - 7oz Filet w/ salsa verde & crispy polenta $42 - Trio of Tiramisu - peanut butter & jelly, chocolate, and blackberry lime $8  We realized that it's going to be too much for two, but really wanted to sample a little bit of everything and take home the rest in a box.  In a word, Giada's taste should be described as "light".  Or "lemon", as most of items above had some sort of citrus flavor. Even from the lobster arancini and pea pesto crostini, we sensed fresh aroma of lemon, and it was amazing.  The contrast between the homemade spaghetti (light) and tortellini (rich) convinced us the versatileness of pasta dishes. No simplistic marinara / alfredo are provisioned here at Giada, which is what exactly we'd expected.  And the Tricolore salad with gorgonzola, dates, walnuts and prosciutto... perfect balance of bitterness, sweetness and crunchiness.  By the time we get to the dessert we were completely full, but were unable to resist Tiramisu per the waiter's recommendation - glad we ordered!  It's a great idea for Las Vegas to have a fantastic restaurant like Giada at the most prestigious intersection on the strip - what can I say? Life is good!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From Outside - facing the Strip and Bellagio fountains
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From Outside

7kd3UZ5v1YijBCJ0b-NUSg.text: Very disappointing.  We had reservations, but were treated very rudely by the hostesses today. After checking in, then waiting 15 minutes we asked when our table would be ready. The hostess stared blankly & asked us if we had a reservation! We sat next to her 15 minutes after checking in! We are well dressed, polite, and hungry! Why not not offera warm welcoming service instead of a cold as ice brush off?  Giada should be embarrassed her name is associated with this place. This place DOES NOT reflect the quality you would expect from Giada, a celebrated chef.

vefjikKfjrVh5cnADQhWUw.text: Our Vegas experience continues with a stop to visit Giada's with a great view of the bellagio water show... Much to some people in our party's joy, Giada is on site (Monday night at 9:00 pm) Our server, Frederick, is amazing... he explained the menu and gave excellent recommendations.  We also get a stop - off from  the GM who wants to make sure everything was going well. and not 5 minutes later, Giada strolls in, making JG go crazy. We ask our wait staff if we can meet her, and Giada walks over, saving my arm from an eminent bruising from getting hit by my friend and her repeating "Giada's HERE!!!! Giada's HERE!!!!" After the chef siting and picture taking we were treated to Giada's best and a very pleasing appetizer round. This meal is in rounds... A marathon, not a sprint, so pace yourself if you want the full experience.   We had one each from all the appetizers from each category, and for dinner had the porterhouse for two, spaghetti, tortellini. Margaretta pizza, calamari, meatballs, prosciutto, and bruschetta and mushrooms were all wonderful. All offerings were perfectly prepared, tortellini was perfect sauce, not too too.. just right and porterhouse was seasoned just right.  If you make it to Vegas, stop by Giada's and have one of the best meals you will ever have in Vegas! That's amore!!!!

1B3MuCxKCXLsN4_c3gfkuw.text: Great view! The food is very good. Make sure to order the Giada cocktail. The pasta dishes are scrumptous, and the appetizers are wonderful. The meat and cheese platter is very good and serves a number of people. Portions are just right, not too much. The service is professional.

ie7_ugUh61NHFmEmw7syYQ.text: Very trendy and nicely coordinated.   Cocktails were good.  The spaghetti is the signature dish and is worth trying.  The tortellini was also good as was the meat and cheese plate.  It is a bit pricey and portions are small for being pasta but it is all homemade and delicious.  Just the kind of food and lovely atmosphere I expect on the strip.

J-q_vqoXBd6lmRRzSnFolg.text: I eat here whenever I can and in the past have given it 5 stars. They have made some changes that have taken it down a notch for me. It's still terrific in many ways. Service and food is mostly good, but atmosphere has changed.  6 of us had dinner and we started with the large party Salumi and cheese platter. Everything on this plate was good! I order my favorite appetizer, the octopus, and it was tender with a nice smokey flavor. The yellow tomato soup had nice flavor.  Now for the entrees and some small plate pastas. Seafood risotto was a little bland and a little watery. The salmon and Branzino were perfect. The lobster didn't come with drawn butter until we asked, bucatini good, and the spaghetti lemon shrimp, a signature dish was gooey.  The big change for me was the atmosphere. The music is now so loud we had trouble talking at our table. The Cromwell seems to have become much younger and the restaurant seems to be trying to follow.  A side note, we left something at the restaurant  and found it impossible to talk to anyone there. The hotel nor the reservation service were able to connect us with anyone.

ZdrKPE7UkUO-W3V9HoX9Dw.text: Extremely happy from the service to the food to checking out!  We got an extremely warm welcome at the bottom stairs! I had made the reservation for the wrong location but the hostess was very accommodating to us. As soon as we were seated we were greeted by the server Joseph, he was very knowledgeable and help us with whatever questions we had. We ordered out food, came out in great time and was absolutely AMAZING!!!! Once it came time for the tab, Joseph went ahead and split all of our checks for us. Definitely not disappointed!! We will be back!   I reccomande the salmon and the tricolor salad!

aBvCmJDPDaFj48WfZ8Tx6g.text: This is a "Dance 10, Looks 3" review.  Food was, admittedly, wonderful. Setting, gorgeous. Most of what you heard is True.   The bad: Don't expect the servers to listen and actually know anything about their food.   This might not be an issue, but if you have allergies, BEWARE!    Lovely thing about smartphones - you can see the menu even after they remove the real thing. We both ordered the brunch tasting menu, and noticed that several items had hazelnuts and almonds.  Admittedly, mine (hazelnuts) aren't generally life-threatening, but almonds trigger my husband's asthma. Not pretty in any case. I specifically asked our server if a particular menu item contained hazelnuts, or almonds, as WE ARE ALLERGIC to these items. We were reassured that they weren't in the items we had selected.  She must have a short memory. We were not give the opportunity to select our pastries, and out comes a lovely plate with five breakfast pastries. Two were beautiful chocolate mini cupcake looking items. I didn't think about it at first, because we had pointed out our allergies. Two of the five were hazelnut chocolate muffins. HELLO? Also on the plate were the rosemary berry scone (texture indicates more than just plain flour and butter as noted in the online recipe) and what I believe was the gluten-free blueberry muffin. If there is no wheat in the muffin, was it almond meal? I don't know, and I don't think the servers cared.  The busboy seemed to be new, too, and in boxing our leftovers, may have been neat in his placement of the items in the fancy plastic takeout boxes, but we won't ever know. He then put them on edge (not flat) in the smaller Giada bag, because "sorry, we're out of the larger bags." Luckily, the fancy boxes did not leak!  I was really disappointed in the level of training, given the great attention to the details in all other aspects of the restaurant. The food, the "G" elements EVERYWHERE, and of course, the high end price tag. It was amazing how much attention the half-shaven, tattooed hipsters with their Giada-esque ladies got, at the table in the middle of the room, while it took half the meal for me to get a single cup of coffee. Dad is 92 and on a rolling walker, but he certainly couldn't understand what the hoopla is about this place, and I can't blame him.   Be ready to fight for your rights, or your allergies. They might just kill you with their attention to detail.

w4am5o6oYmd1M7XNw1DGHw.text: Wow! What an experience. I was part of a huge party of 25 people celebrating a special event at Giada's.  This was truly a special evening with no expense spared.    That being said, the staff and kitchen at Giada's did not disappoint.  The only regret I have is not being physically able to try every single item brought to our massive table.  I did give it an honest effort but, unfortunately I ran out of room.  Dessert was insane! The roaming dessert cart just kept unloading selection after selection at our table....it was hilarious.    Food was excellent.  Staff was very attentive.  Recommend fully!  Good luck getting a reservation :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a party...

PbKDJacInstqFb0hcHxeYQ.text: Have to wait a little for your table? No Problem, they have a cute little photobooth!!!  This place screams out Giada! From the moment you walk up the second floor to when we walked and were explained about each different prep stations I was quite impressed.The design is very cute and clean and I think it represents Giada to the tee. We came on their 6th day of opening the service was EXCELLENT. Our server Radoslav was really attentive and good at explaining the menu though it was quite lengthly. He explained that the portions are designed to be small so that you can try many things on the menu. My boyfriend and I had to beg to differ. We ordered 2 plates too many but they were all tasty. I did not know what to really expect but I was PLEASANTLY surprised. Here is what we ordered:  Drinks: La Strada: Campari, homemade lemon sorbeto, berognoli limoncello, prosecco         very good, pretty and on the fruity side Riso Amaro: cucumber, celery bitters, 2nite vodka, fresh grapefruit and lemon          pretty, fruity but on the too much of the bitter side for me  Appetizers: Bacon Dates: very tasty, just the right amount of crisp on the bacon Octopus: lacking a little salt, the only dish i wouldn't order again Arugula Salad: simple but yet very refreshing  Entre: Tortellini: if you don't like peas you probably wont like this dish but i thought it was very good Spaghetti: PERFECTION. BY FAR MY FAVORITE DISH. spaghetti and all pasta dishes are made in house. this dish was so refreshing and was just perfect with the large shirmps. I WANT MORE!!! Filet: cut of meat was very good and cooked to perfection Side Corn: with a kick of spicyness and charr.   We had no room for desert but did have the Espresso Nocciol and Lemoncello Berta for a drink after our meal.   The Espresso Nocciol was velvet in my mouth. SOOO good. it has nutella in it. Need i say more??   The Lemoncello was a nice palate cleanser  Overall I would HIGHLY recommend that you try Giada. If you call and try to make reservations you might not be able to get the reservation but if you walk in and have a small party i'm sure they can accommodate you. Rumor is that they are "fully committed" until October.  I almost forgot the VIEW!!!!! Giada in located in the new Cromwell Hotel. She totally lucked out the the view. because its just beautiful up there with the view of the strip.   Good lLuck and Good Eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Bill!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limoncello Berta
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso Nocciol

Fq8t8UZ8zY6EJFkaAProcA.text: It was a little more expensive than what I would normally pay for a dinner but it was really delicious. We had our dinner from the tasting menu and it was pricy but we got to try several things which made it great. At the end you get to choose 3 desserts from the dessert cart and those were exquisite!

d0hZNwFdz_wTiIxreq5I6w.text: Excellent designed restaurant. I sat at the bar. Drinks are well made from the ones I had (old fashioned). Make sure to get the orzo meatballs.

j58YbQwMK56R1qzPj9I78A.text: Giada's family is in every detail of the restaurant! All the movies played are produced by her grandfather, the drink names are inspired by her family.  Food presentation is amazing, portion sizes are perfect to enjoy a 3 course meal and not be over stuffed.  Service is top notch! She's one of my favorite chef's, so glad I got to dine at her restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh ricotta, honey and pink peppercorn crostini!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate tiramisu, creamy, crunchy, light &amp; yummie!!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada.

IaDAOLd6gF4Q1CzZhOtvJA.text: Finally got to try this place! Excellent ambiance, dined here for lunch. Very good service. They were very busy. We had Waldorf salad to share which was very good. My husband had the tenderloin sliders which he claims is one of the best, came with fried zucchini crisps. I had the margarita pizza flatbread which was HORRIBLE and that's why 3 stars. First of all it came so cold, I had to send it back. Even after that it was barely warm. The tomatoes on it were so sour and mozzarella cheese was not even melted. Dough had no salt no seasoning. We had tiramisu for desert which was perfect, not to sweet and light. Portions are small but it was just right for us. I had heard about their famous bread which I learnt they stopped serving for lunch :(  I hope dinner is a better experience.

dF1Sxy5IJ-SxeJe--bcRKw.text: Wonderful food, service and atmosphere. A little loud , wonderful views. Prices are VERY high for what you get but what can you expect on the strip. You go for the name and experience my favorite dish was the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. We also tried the appetizer sampler all of which were really yummy. The tenderloin was delicious as well and I loved the smashed potatoes. The corn was a little spicey  for my taste. The gelatos except the banana were delicious and I love the chocolate ganache bar and the lemon cheesecake as our table got a variety of desserts we were able to try a bunch of items

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La strata drink

q0jqF5nhvWPvsZhgh-9-yA.text: Started out with a White peach Bellini ,had the Tasting Menu which was Fantastic like Giada made it herself.  Food was outstanding,our server  Daetwanshey was Outstanding as well so pleasant and on top of her game, Giada's is fortunate to have her. All the servers we encountered including the Hostesses were so pleasant that it was a pleasure to Dine at Giada's. Atmosphere gets an A as well very well done. Highly Recommended !

d7FWgtbAJKvuuHY1Az818w.text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas about a week ago.  We had dinner at Giada's.  First, make a reservation.  We are glad we did.  Our waiter was attentive and new the menu well.  We started with the meat-cheese platter called prosciutto de parma. For dinner, I ordered the lobster ravioli and my husband ordered the crab and scallop risotto.  Everything tasted fresh and delicious.  The only disappointment was the photo booth, that it never emailed our picture to us.

vHOHDqPGPq1wV6wEQgNkHA.text: I enjoyed my meal at Giada. Currently there is a Travelzoo voucher so you can save a bit of money with that. There are a ton of reviews so I'll just focus on what I haven't seen mentioned. We got the cacio e pepe for two in the small cheese wheel. First off, this can definitely serve more than two if you're eating anything else with it. We ended up taking about half home. I do think the cheese wheel is a bit of a gimmick, but the good thing is they do give you the cheese wheel to take home if you have leftover pasta. So even if you don't I'm assuming you could take it. There was still a lot of parmesan left so we've been enjoying pasta dishes out of it at home. As far as the quality of the cacio e pepe, it wasn't the best one I've had. The bucatini wasn't al dente at all, and aside from that it tasted just okay, not amazing (I've had amazing cacio before). It's a nice restaurant but if you want cacio e pepe I'd suggest saving your money and getting it at Eataly. Service was a bit off as well, as we only got our bread moments before our main course.

_8VROMeY9yR8yIfe1I7IwA.text: My wife and daughter had a great experience here in August. This time I joined my wife since they had such a great experience.  Saturday morning 10:00 AM.   Was spur of moment so we did not have a  reservation.  Hostess quoted us 25 min wait.  Here's the catch. Only 5 tables where filled.  What is going to change in 25 minutes other than more tables would get filled.  There are infinite dining choices in vegas.   Went to Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris Hotel, and the food AND service is outstanding.

W4KgoRs7uk4YH77tKYcN5Q.text: After seeing so many friends recommend Giada, I had to come by and try her restaurant for myself. This place is so classy and I just love the atmosphere in the restaurant!  Definitely get a reservation ahead of time if you can. While we waited, there is even a little photobooth for you to take pictures in! It was super cute!  I wish I could remember our waiter's name because he was so fantastic. He was super attentive and made my party feel like we were so taken care of which I totally appreciated! My whole party was impressed with his service.  We had the lemon potatoes which I would recommend if you're a potato lover like myself. I ordered the pappardelle which was pretty good, but I tried my friend's order of the lemon spaghetti and wish I had ordered that instead! I love the presentation of all the food as well. You can tell that Giada really put a lot of thought into presentation in the entire restaurant!  Can't wait until my next trip to Vegas because for sure I will be back!

eq1vq5FcHPxdYEcyY9upKg.text: As a Las Vegas local it says a lot when I say "the trip to the strip is worth it".  Giada's is a must try. Request Joe as your server and allow him to guide you through an amazing dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spah-get-tee

MQGmo0KHg14SgEXt3yiibg.text: The place was pretty pricey. The service wasn't always but I came with a large group and I don't know if that contributed to it. Other than that, the cocktails were good, the food was delicious and super filling. I don't know whose idea it was to order the assorted meat and cheese plates but it was both a good and bad decision - yummy but by the time my entree came out I was stuffed. The steak was amazinggg. If I hadn't been so stuffed I might have appreciated it better. Overall a beautiful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s2O1D6PORLr9gc0zGdLfUA.text: This is a must when I come to Vegas.  I'm a fan of Giada and a fan of Italian good so it works. I love the salad. I try something new each time. It A bit pricey BUT it's Vegas so everything is pricey. Brunch usually is full or close to it so we sat at the bar this last trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula Salad, Breakfast Contadina with a White Peach Bellini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula Salad and Orzo Meatballs!

WO9uChLgavWj-m4QCyUlzA.text: Oh my goodness, finally had a great meal on my Vegas business trip. The waffles with Nutella on the side were nothing short of heavenly. I sat at the bar, and not only was everything attractive with decor, but the service was superb. Such a wonderful and happy find on my trip. All the customers sitting at the bar, were enjoying other meals as well, and we're all raving over their choice of dish. And just from looking at them, I could tell they were amazing. Presentation was beautiful and flavor was on point. Thank you so much for making a wonderful last food stop on my trip. The staff is A+.

2W4TFzqOkfxF7vNJfPO4kg.text: We were supposed to have dinner there tonight.  But we left very disappointed with the manager.  We did not eat there and will never eat there.  So we went to Nora's Italian restaurant.  So much better!   We did not have a reservation but still got seated in less than 10 minutes.  Giada is overrated and the manager do not know how to conduct business. I won't be surprise when they go out of business in 6 months. I hope Ms Giada is reading this because her staff is not working in her favor.

IkJKby6fucSK0H1ZtAskjw.text: Amazing!  I've been here several times, and each time has been wonderful!!  The last visit was with a very large group of people, and we couldn't have had a better experience.  The food was plentiful and delicious.  I imagine how hard it can be to serve a very large group, but the food came out promptly...and it was amazing!  The service was attentive and responsive...excellent!  Highly recommend for an intimate date night, a very large party, and everything in between!

kN7u6wF83RPWWFRtBA4h3Q.text: One of the worst dining experiences of my life and by far the worst I have experienced in Las Vegas and if you look at my reviews you will see I spend a lot of time in Vegas. We arrived 10 minutes before our reservation time, didn't get seated until close to 30 minutes after reservation time. The first time I dined at Giada  about a year and a half ago they screwed up my reservation as well(see previous review), must be a theme here at Giada. Once seated we didn't get greeted by our waiter for 10 minutes. Drink order took 10 to 15  minutes to arrive. Waiter disappeared again. Comes back and we want to order first round appetizers and he tells about a chefs tasting menu but he has to disappear again for 5 minutes plus to retrieve menu. At this point we have been seated over 30 minutes and still have not placed an appetizer order. We finally order a couple appetizers and waiter disappeared again. The appetizers took an hour, keep in mind we still have not ordered additional courses or our main courses yet. I finally wave down waiter and ask about our appetizers an he seemed surprised that appetizers had not come yet....well if you did your job and checked in on us once in a while you would know they have not come yet. Between being seated 30 minutes late and the hour wait for appetizers we decided to skip additional courses and go straight to main based on limited time. Main course took another 20 or so minutes. At one point we needed a straw for a drink and there was nobody around I attempted to wave the waiter down a few times but he didn't see me so I had to get up and walk across the restaurant to the bar and grab a straw myself.  My fillet was not cooked to temp I requested(not even close), I ordered medium and it was rare at best and was cold(cool) probably from sitting after it was cooked and plated. it was a poor quality piece of meat as well, it was tough, not sure how a rare piece of meat can be tough but it was. We arrived at 7:20, got seated at 8 and finished main course at 10:05ish, we decided to skip dessert because we didn't have another hour to waste.   This was a special occasion anniversary dinner, they removed an appetizer charge from our bill and brought us a couple free cookies but that was absolutely meaningless to me, it was not about saving $15, this was supposed to be a very special evening but it was ruined. It was not about getting a free appetizer I would have gladly paid double the price to have an enjoyable evening or get a redo on the night. Thanks for ruining what was supposed to be a special evening...  This is an honest review, my first experience at Giada a year and a half ago was decent but this time it was a disaster. I will never go back and will never recommend it to anyone. If you read my other reviews you will see I rarely leave 1 star reviews, this was a situation where I wish there was an option for 0 stars because Giada earned 0 stars last night. The waiter should not be in the service industry, he was terrible. The place has security cameras everywhere so I hope management reads this review and goes back and reviews the tapes from 10/20/16 between 7:20-10:05pm and they will see exactly what I described above.   Stay away from this place, you have been warned!!!

vt7_iP-w0JPMfJFeE5yLBw.text: My wife and I celebrated a late Valentine's Dinner at Giada. We have been underwhelmed at some other celebrity locales, but Giada has obviously done her homework and has an absolute winner.  From the moment we sat down, were felt like VIP's. Radoslav was knowledgeable, helpful and absolutely attentive to our needs. We started with drinks - the Barberella for me and a El Note(?) for my wife. Both were refreshing and delicious (my wife ordered a second). The Rosemary bread was fantastic, and served with red pepper flakes, shaved salt and dried capers, as well as herb olive oil and lemon butter to compliment. Next came a trio of Bacon wrapped dates, rib eye crustini, and baby sweet peppers, stuffed with goat cheese and an olive tapenade. We both agreed that we could eat a small SUV filled with the dates, and my wife loved the crustini, while I favored the peppers (a little shaved salt really brought out the flavor).   Next came the entrees - she had the Red Wine Rissoto, while I went for the Veal Chop Saltimbocca (as an aside, I typically do not eat veal because how they are raised, so I save veal dishes for special occasions - first time in nearly 20 years), which was highly recommended by Radoslav. Both dishes were presented simply, without excess garnish. My wife loved the risotto, saying the red wine gave a distinct flavor and did not interfere with the creaminess of the dish. I'm not a big risotto fan, but I appreciated the flavor and texture. My chop was, to put it mildly, was huge. I knew the minute it was placed in front of me, that I would be taking most of it home. the chop was cooked to perfection - breaded and topped with a bit of Parmesan, and with a grilled lemon to drizzle. IT was flavorful and satisfying (and satiated my veal craving for another 20 years).  As my chop was off being boxed up, we were surprised by a gift - a sampling of more treats - Orzo meatballs, Chicken Marsala Meatballs, and Lobster Arancini. All three were exquisite, and we tried desperately to finish them all, but had to cry mercy.  We did decide to order the assorted cookies to take home - Salted Peanut Butter, Lemon Ricotta, and Chocolate Chip (they did not last, once we got home). Although all were good, the peanut butter were "Slap your mama" good.  And, as we were paying the bill, another surprise - A "Happy Valentine's" gift of more desserts. All were delicious, and ensured that we waddled out completely satisfied.  As for the price; because of the occasion, price was not a concern, as we figured a top tier restaurant would be pricey. Before the bill, we had decided that whatever the price, we were very satisfied and believed we got more than our money's worth. Some people get upset at high prices, especially when the food doesn't live up to it. We got our bill and realized that we have paid much more at other "celebrity" restaurants for food that was not nearly as good as we had just enjoyed. This is not a "dinner every Friday," place, but for special occasions (and we will be inventing a few - first day of Spring, Smarch, that day after some Tuesday), this will be our go-to place, as well as when guests come into town.  Thank you Giada, Radoslav, Chef Colleen, and everyone, for a wonderful experience.

DsSfm_xSFUnWp7q__eu23Q.text: Service and food was excellent!  Loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. Highly recommend the orzo with crab and the meat and cheese platter as an app. Everyone in our party said it was the best meal they ever had.

lQer2RJmA7uTAewcGuhv1Q.text: We started with a couple of cocktails while waiting for our table to be ready, and I'm glad we did - they were very good, though a bit on the strong side. We chose the Serpico and the Giada Cocktail.  For dinner we we started with the orzo meatballs and the bacon wrapped dates, both were very good. The latter was a bit spicy. Great if you're like me and enjoy spice, but it could catch you off guard if you're uses to more mild flavors with bacon wrapped dates.  For our main courses we has the lobster, white asparagus tips and tarragon ravioli, and the veggie rigatoni. Excellent dishes.  We skipped dessert, but did get a couple of orange mocha mio's after dinner, and they were amazing! Easily one of the best coffee drinks I've ever had. It consisted of Lavazza Gran Riserva, steamed milk, chocolate ganache, and house-made orange syrup. I think I'll be dreaming about this drink tonight. ;)  UPDATED 12/13/15 - Came back again the same trip, this time for brunch. The chia seed parfait is amazing!! And of course I had another orange mocha mio. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Orange Mocha Mio...a fresh one in the foreground, and the empty one I just finished behind it. :)
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chia seed parfait
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Serpico cocktail

Azd8m7rXvLP8wrEeLFd8RQ.text: I visited Giada for a quick bite before a scheduled concert inside The Cromwell. I can only rate my brussel sprout crostini. It was very tasty! For some reason I thought it would be warm, but the bread was toasted and the sprouts were more like a slaw. The mix of sprouts, cheese and sweetness of cranberries was fantastic. I ordered the Giada....and posted a pic. Very chic and the type of eloquent touches I appreciate when ordering a cocktail. The bartenders were very attentive and energetic. I loved sitting at the bar! Now,behind the bar was the sexy table seating. The large posterior windows were the perfect frame to the intersection at Flamingo. The grand bridges were the focal point but the Belaggio water works were the backdrop.  I would come here again for a special ocassion.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada cocktail

Un71rh0TFUGl9pf-_OIlcA.text: Although the Giada everywhere is a bit much, the view and the food is solid. The pecorino and Apricot preserves was amazing, the ricotta crostini devine. My friend and I each had the pasta sampler and other than the fact the pomodoro was very spicy and not described as such (I loved, my friend doesn't like spice) it was fantastic.

NerHV-AhFZM3Iyjm2PMKUw.text: This happened to my son and daughter in law on Valentines Day 2018. A bus boy right in front of them dropped a tray of dishes/glasses right in front of my daughter in law. A dish " shard" stuck in her foot and caused minor bleeding when she pulled it out. After all the chaos their waiter asked if they were ready to pay their bill. The hostess did come over to see if she was ok. My son had to ask if he would be compensated for the injury/ embarrassment / ruined evening etc. She did cover the meal upon my son's suggestion. Mind you not one word/ gesture/ or apology from the manager. He/she never came to see what the chaos was or find out if my daughter in law wAs ok. So be careful if you dare go to Giada's.

YfBg-Z4Dt0M40LomJ4hXGQ.text: I have to say that I was extremely excited to visit Giada's even with such mixed reviews and unfortunately it turned out to be very disappointing. From the beginning, the hostess kept ignoring us while we were in the waiting area as we stated we were ready to be seated and there was no genuine response or interaction. Once we got seated, our waiter happened to be walking by and elbowed my brother in the head. Instead of a sincere apology, he made a joke as if we welcome you with an elbow to the head. Really not appropriate for a venue such as this! The uniforms were sloppy, wrinkled and surprisingly messy on the waiters. Our waiter wasn't really friendly and seemed more annoyed that we didn't want to do the tasting or dine they way that they suggested. The food portions were very small relative to the prices and some of the dishes were bland. Others were very spicy and lemony! And when we gave feedback, our waiter said, well Giada does like her lemons! Really??? My sisters appetizer dish was removed and they took her fork but didn't get her a new one to eat her meal with. We had to ask a busser for one finally after waiting to get our server's attention. He was too busy counting his cash tips with another waiter besides him doing the same thing in front of all the tables seated by the stairs. This is classic bad behavior in the service industry and really should be addressed by management! Needless to say, there are many other restaurants that have amazing food and higher quality service that I would prefer to patronize over returning to Giadas!

R4q7JQSqyA-w2NMvmrLlFw.text: Delicious food and magnificent ambiance, we will most definitely be returning!  We visited this past weekend, celebrating a friends birthday.

xvZM0YiU9vfLvfyuy6RU9A.text: What an amazing experience! Went to Giada's this past Wednesday to celebrate my birthday and both myself and my tastebuds had such a wonderful time! Starting with their drink menu, there was no shortage of whiskey love, which sings to my soul. From there, the bread/cheese plate was a perfect start followed by the Oysters Rockefeller. Easily the best Oysters Rock I have had- super moist and juicy! The Scallop and Crab Risotto was my main meal and it was seriously perfect. As full as I was, it's not a birthday celebration without something sweet so Giada's cookies were the best fit! The lemon ricotta cookie can keep any sweet tooth happy for hours!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who doesn&#39;t want to start their meal with this!? The pesto was ridiculously flavorful!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sideways Oysters... you get the drift. They were the best part of the meal! I&#39;ve never had juicier Oysters
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey &amp; ginger, sunlight and gorgeous decor.... I&#39;m in a happy place!

vuD3ytCWCLbr7oupNWZawg.text: Exceptional food & service We come here for brunch, lunch or dinner whenever we can find an excuse to. Being locals we try to avoid the strip as often as possible, but Giada is one of the exceptions!!! We frequent Giada about 10 times a year with so many great choices here in Vegas. We love it because the service is always a 10 and you can taste the carefully thought components of each dish.   -The brunch menu is small but mighty. The hunters waffle & breakfast constantina are favorites. We also always order a pastry basket. Brunch is probably our favorite meal at Giada.   - Eating a casual dinner at the bar is fantastic.   - I will chose the tasting menu if it is a holiday tasting menu.   Our must get dinner items are: parm cheese w/honey, Ribeye, lemon spaghetti, & branzino. The sides change seasonally but my favorite side is a fall side with spicy sausage and corn. The bread 'basket' is awesome. Make sure along with salt, pepper, and butter they give you the fried capers (they normally do but just in case as they haven't a couple times w/o asking). I am one for trying new things but I get so hooked on my favorites that it's hard to try something new.  TIP the pastas are a course and not entree sized and can surprise some as I read prior reviews.

ILyXgyqYGI2ZKPwi0UlTiw.text: Beautiful and spacious restaurant. Attentive service. Love the complimentary bread.   Ordered: Oyster crudo: fresh  Orzo meatball: so flavorful but dry Wagyu Salame: good Gorgonzola: usu I can't bear blue cheese at all but this I couldn't stop eating  Tartufo Cheese: Truffle flavor Spaghetti Shrimp: so refreshing with nice flavor. Huge and succulent shrimp. But pasta was way too dry.   Lobster Ravioli: good Crab & Scallop Risotto: good Expresso Noccioli: great after dinner.  Before coming here, I've always hated dishes with lemon. But the pasta here completely changed my mine. Who knew it could be so refreshing?

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tarfuto
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orzo Meatball
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oyster Crudo

a9cxNondW6VEVN4H1if-xQ.text: Full disclosure, this is a celebrity-run restaurant, and suffers that typical celebrity-run restaurant pitfall: a certain detectable disdain from the wait staff for its clientele. But Giada Vegas rose above almost all the celebrity-run restaurant pitfalls with excellent food, wonderfully prepared cocktails, a warm welcome from the hostess, and an elegant aesthetic. Dining at Giada Vegas was an overall positive experience that would have us return. Speaking only for my meal, it was a delight from start to finish. I had a great pour on my Blanton's on the rocks. The salumi y formaggio was plentiful and filled with tasty cheeses, cured meats, and fig paste. Our table shared the bruschetta, chicken Marsala meatballs, mushroom arancini, and the olive sampler. All were delicious and not too plentiful, leaving us ready for our entrees. For my entree I had the creamy and tasty crab and scallop risotto. Presentation and flavor were both beautiful. Dessert was a decaf cappuccino and the fresh fruit tart--terrifically delicious. In all Giada Vegas earns high marks. I'd recommend it--do make reservations--as well as dine there again.

MdImJOQ8gzR4amdRr9zOGA.text: Not worth the money, really. Nothing special about the lemon spaghetti even if they tell you it's Giadas signature dish. It was dry and a small portion for $34; spaghetti is super cheap to make so I expected amazing flavor for that price. Salmon, stuffed dates, and orzo meatballs were all ok, nothing amazing. Save your money and go somewhere better.

5wDu927gW7pmaMYK14pH6Q.text: OMG- the restaurant is beautiful! Just the entrance itself feels grand and the inside is spacious, chic, and modern. Every last detail is fancy and luxe (down to the personalized toilet paper in the bathrooms!) and there's wraparound views of the strip. Now this is a Vegas restaurant. Great job Giada! I didn't expect anything less.   The food is delicious, but be warned, the portion sizes are small. Just look at Giada. You don't look like that by eating much. There's even a quote from her written all around the restaurant, "eat a little of everything, but don't eat a lot of anything". If you need more food, do what my sister and I did and share a few plates.   The meal starts off with a complimentary bread plate. So.Freaking.Cute. Like I said, every single detail of this place is impeccable. The bread comes on a wooden board with several little serving dishes of lemon butter, capers, salt, and the most delicious olive oil and vinegar. The bread is a little ramekin of focaccia (my fave!), breadsticks, and Parmesan crisps. The entire spread really only feeds 2 and you get 1 per every 4 people, but like I said the servings are small. You can be like us and ask for more. By the way, I know I just dedicated an entire paragraph to the bread, but it's so good, it more than deserves it.   As far as the food, there were some really delicious dishes and others that left much to be desired. Standout favorites include: rigatoni with veggie bolognese, surf and turf, salmon, and artichoke arancini.   Things we suggest skipping: Brussel sprout crostini and lemon souffle.   Service was fantastic. Very attentive and friendly.   Overall, if you're a Giada fan or not, this is great dining. (Disclaimer: I'm a huge Giada fan so my review may or may not be a bit biased. It was probably 3.5 stars, but yelp doesn't let you do half stars so 4 it is!)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Artichoke arancini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom soup
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon soufflé, beautiful, but unfortunately NOT delicious

nYtHNQMLDLptrUZk2Lkdfg.text: I had REALLY high hopes for Giada but it just doesn't compare to other celebrity chef and top calibre dining options. The restaurant itself is picture perfect inside the stylish new Cromwell. The dining room is washed in white and curves out towards Las Vegas Boulevard with windows that open up so you can watch the Bellagio fountains - if you're seated in the right direction. We went on my birthday which was a Tuesday and I was SO excited. As we ascended the escalator we were greeted by the hostess who quickly dampened my excitement. We had reservations but still had to wait about 15 minutes at the bar which was probably good because the bartenders were actually the friendliest people in the entire restaurant.  Almost as soon as we sat down in this gorgeous, not cheap, restaurant, our extraordinarily unfriendly server tried to upsell us on some tacky package that came with an autographed picture of Giada. I've eaten at a number of "celebrity chef" restaurants and have never experienced a similar upsell. It felt very tacky and kind of ruined the vibe of the nice restaurant. This isn't Disneyland, this is a fine dining restaurant!   In addition to cocktails, we started with the Charred Octopus and it was delicious. It wasn't too scrawny and was very flavorful - I would highly recommend it. For my main entree I got the Risotto. The risotto came with two scallops and had two asparagus spears woven through it. The dish itself was delicious but at $35, a bit pricey for the portion. We also had some unmemorable sides. I do remember the bread basket being pretty top notch, though. Our waiter was rarely seen and when he was, he wasn't particularly pleasant.   As I mentioned before, it was my birthday and while I'm not a huge birthday person and definitely hate people singing to me in public, I found it very odd that no one even so much as mentioned it when we'd indicated that it was a birthday celebration in our reservation. In my experience most fine dining restaurants would at least say something... I don't know, maybe it was an off night but I doubt we will be back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto

HoXxPZ70KJZzL2aJxGdRbw.text: Last night was my second time at Giada and like the first time, it didn't disappoint.  I made a reservation well over a week ago to take a friend to dinner for her birthday.  Reservation was made through Open Table and was quick and efficient.  I requested a window seat via Open Table and of course was told nothing was guaranteed but a request would be submitted.    I was called about 3 days prior to our reservation to confirm and was told (rather bluntly but I get it - money talks) that a window seat is only guaranteed to guests who "commit to spending $100 per person."  I thought that was a bit strange but told the restaurant rep that I couldn't commit to that (I couldn't eat $100 worth of food anywhere and I don't drink so getting to that figure wasn't feasible for me) and she politely said that she understood but would put in the request and do their best to accommodate me.  That's all I could ask and while it was a little strange to have been told that, in some weird way I appreciated the honesty.    Forward to last night.  We arrived on time and were seated right away at...wait for it...a window seat!  The caveat was that it was a window seat on the south side of the restaurant where they have these rather large and cumbersome wooden blinds that don't offer the best view but if we craned our necks just so...we'd get a partial view of the Bellagio fountains.  Suggestion: If a window seat is your thing, get specific and ask for a seat on the west side of the restaurant.  It's a less obstructed view (although I'm not certain you'd be able to see the fountains) but there are no wooden blinds at all on that side so the view is far better.   For dinner, we decided on a couple apps and then a couple pastas and we shared everything.  We started with the arugula salad with candied lemons, pancetta and shaved parmesan.  No kidding - I could have stopped there and been completely content.  It was so good.  Light but satisfying.  We then shared the crab and artichoke dip.  I was worried at first that it was going to be too heavy but in True Italian form, it was light but packed with flavor and incredibly delicious.  The lemon and spiciness of it made for a completely different taste than what you normally think of as a crab and artichoke dip and the herb crostini, while slightly over-greasy, paired perfectly with it.    We HAD to go with pasta for our main entrees and one out of two was amazing.  We settled on the risotto with king crab and scallops and the white lasagna.  The risotto was seriously out of this world.  It was so flavorful but again not heavy at all.  The scallops were grilled to perfection.  Absolute and total perfection.  We were a little less impressed with the white lasagna.  It just seemed like it was lacking something.  It was bland and not anywhere near as flavorful as anything else we ate.  The one bright spot was the jumbo prawn on top - it was delicious.    Dessert.  We had to.  I mean, when in Rome...  We had the Limoncello souffle and it was wonderful.  The perfect end to an (almost) perfect meal.  It was light (oh I'm so overusing that word!) and lemony and tableside, just as it's served, they put a scoop of vanilla gelato smack dab in the middle and it cools it off just enough so that it's ready to eat.  Be prepared to wait a little bit for it - our server told us it would be about 15-20 minutes and it most definitely took at least that long but it was well worth it.    Our server, Rocco, was smashing.  Italian, personable, funny, helpful, professional, knowledgeable and all around fun.  He made the entire experience more enjoyable.  The femme maitre ds were satisfactory - but nothing to exclaim about.  Matter of fact, when we left around 10pm we asked if one of them would take our picture.  She seemed less than thrilled (and I get that it's late and she was probably tired) and barely acknowledged us other than to grab the camera, take a few pics and hand the camera back.  With that said, the behavior (however bad or good) of the front house staff doesn't make or break my opinion of a restaurant but had the ladies been just ever so slightly more friendly and enthusiastic, it would have made the entire experience even better.    Overall, fantastico!  Really.  It's pricey but it's the strip and it's Giada.  I'm a local so I can't see myself going here any more than maybe a few times a year but I will most decidedly be back and when I have guests in town I'll make it a point to recommend Giada.  Cibo eccellente!  Ciao!

TesJ4DEtjkbs2F0HLmiBgg.text: Awesome Birthday dining experience! Wow it was amazing from the time we arrived. The staff was friendly and welcoming. Appetizers to dessert just to die for. Every bite was delicious. Giada's  Is a must. I highly recommend. It's one of the better restaurants here in the valley.

gkMU5fWBQqXyGTMlTQJxFg.text: Back again because i absolutely love this place! Again i got a great table by the window..although i loved what i had the last time i was here..i want to try something different..i tried the caponata croque madam..sandwich filled with eggplant, olives n onions and a sunny side up egg on top drizzled with balsamic vinegar with a side of lemony potatoes..all so very delicious!! eeZk_lC8uXdXJ3pwMJjQtw.text: All those times I watched her on TV and was starving... now I get my chance!! The decor is beautiful and exactly what I would expect based on her personality and show. Service is very attentive and the waiters are very friendly. We had the starter platter with the chicken marsala, lobster arancini, fritto misto. It's a good way to try various dishes, although it wasn't my favorite. The mortadella pizzette was just so-so. The dough was good but the mortadella topping was a little plain. I would order a different one next time.  My favorite dish, hands-down, was the lemon spaghetti. It was so lemony and delicious. In my mind I had already thought it would be a regular spaghetti dish but it was 100% better. The ravioli and salmon were satisfying runner-ups.  Only downside is the $$$. It's probably just a special visit here and then because it is heavily overpriced. Make sure to stop by the Photo Booth (by the hostess) before you leave!  P.S. Yes, I saw Giada, but she was too busy (and I was too nervous)! Now I regret it...

_vwsHspz8BM8rGazgxLiMA.text: Food was good "EXCEPT", my dessert had hair in it.  So they give me another one and GUESS what, that piece also had a hair inside it.  I go to the bathroom and left my puke in the waste basket.  Enjoy and dump the dessert for that batch.  Hair experience ruined my meal, although it was great tasting, but the hair, twice.  Nope.

rdstsGEMTeeUr_WExVQ8Hg.text: Flavorful Italian food with a twist! Coming from a long time fan of her television show, I was delighted to find out on OpenTable.com that Giada had a restaurant in Vega$! What a great surprise and the food was amazingly delicious. I started with the mozzarella with citrus chili pesto. I never had mozzarella cheese served this way, typically served caprese style this was a nice twist, but considering the price $11 seems quite pricy considering the size of of the appetizer portion. I will say also, that while good, the taste of the mozzarella did not come close to the taste in Italy. While I was not up to eating a full five course meal that night, I opted to have the pappardelle with pork bolognese. The pasta was made fresh, you could tell. The flavor of the sauce was very good and while at first the portion size seemed small especially for $32, I must say it was the right amount. For dessert I opted for the limoncello souffle which was out of this world good. If you find yourself at Giadia's, do not miss this gem of a dessert. It is well worth the $14 and time it takes to make fresh. Let me also say the service was very good too. Our waiter Rocco was from Southern Italy and he was very attentive and went the extra mile to make sure that every aspect of our dining experience was perfect. I think the fact that price vs. portion size is what was the disappointing factor in the overall experience, considering the uniqueness of food parings and quality of ingredients and knowing the restaurant is in the heart of the Vega$ strip in a high rent district - I get it. $122 = modest dinner for two without alcoholic beverages.

6a_KxnbyBGT6b_dtbuUWzQ.text: This was a complete let down. The food was overpriced and underwhelming. The best thing about this restaurant was the bread. But as one of our party said "Olive Garden also has good bread." The staff was terrible and the food left the majority of the table feeling ill. Nothing special here and I regret going. Definitely a place to skip.

FSTnUwTodb3BF23Wh4levQ.text: The ambience is unreal and the view if you're lucky to sit by a window is UNREAL. By the window, you can see the Bellagio and at night it's especially amazing! Our server was really upbeat and helpful, we also got our food and drinks fairly quickly once we ordered. The actual food was okay. Nothing to write home about. If I do go again, it will definitely be for the atmosphere and vibe. I had one of the pastas and we had a pizzettes for an app - both mediocre.

pYr02EDLmjTyqkrDaIgmwg.text: Y'all know Giada...and now she has her own resto in Vegas!  ** GET - Fresh ricotta crostini [honey, lemon, pink peppercorn] = oh. so. good. * AOK - Wood roasted mushroom pizzette [baby kale, gorgonzola dolce] = didn't really like the overwhelming cheese on this pizzette. * GET - Artichoke soup [mint, tomato, focaccia crouton] = creamy * GET - Tricolore salad [gorgonzola, dates, walnuts, prosciutto] = light salad ** GET - Rigatoni [Giada's fave, w/ vegetable bolognese] = suuuch good pasta & flavor * GET - Ravioli, lobster, asparagus tips and tarragon = not bad * GET - Dessert cart = we went with the 5-tasting choice (vs. a la carte)!  Lemon cookie and Nipple of Venus was memorable.  Giada's fave, the blackberry-lime tiramisu was delish.  Would skip the polenta and strawberry crostada next time...  * YES - Beautiful restaurant with open floor plan * YES - Waiters/waitresses in white coats * YES - Dessert cart at the end of the meal  * YES - Offers pre-fixe menu   * WOA (words of advice): - Make reservations (pretty booked at this point given new hype) - Good for groups or small parties - Located on 2nd floor of Cromwell Hotel (take escalators up) - When offered water, do note they offer bottled ones first (I wish we'd known and skipped $8/bottle waters...we had so many, it was price of a good entree!)

4dVzU1YHR0AnWp6RQnovlA.text: Central reservation at Caesars got us in for 7:15 on a Saturday night before our show. We were seated on time and the hostess gave us a tour of the food prep area. The complementary bread is amazingggg!! My daughter and I were able to split the roasted broccolini, gluten free rigatoni with veggie bolognese, and the summer caprese salad. Salad was refreshing- had watermelon. Pasta was so fresh and yummy! Service was great.  For dessert, we also split the hazelnut crunch and wow. Best dessert ever.  We cleaned our plates. There was no leftovers!!  Also ordered an assortment of Giada's cookies togo  The only thing I was disappointed in was that the cookies didn't come boxed in a cute, fancy little box that said Giada's. For $12 we got 5 cookies in a plastic to go box...  other than that it was great!

fL00GJYzslEjWvz8-Ge4IQ.text: I dined at Giada back in 2014 and loved it so I was happy when one of my friend's suggested it for brunch during a Moms' trip to Las Vegas.  We easily made a reservation online on open table for the next day.  Our party of six was seated at a large round table in the dining room.  I loved the natural light, warmth, and chic atmosphere of the restaurant.  Out of habit, I checked in on my Yelp app and found that Giada gives a complimentary "splash of prosecco" when checking in.  Of course I made everyone check in as well and we had a nice toast to start of our brunch.  For brunch, you can either order a la carte or from the tasting menu.  I wanted a little of both sweet and savory so I chose the popular Sunrise Polenta Waffle - pancetta, chives, noble maple syrup, bechamel, and two sunny side eggs.  It was delicious and I enjoyed the texture the polenta added to the waffles.    Our service was excellent from start to finish and we had a wonderful time dining at Giada!  Make sure to stop by the selfie booth before leaving!

pY_s6-SB08KhmcYIikVxXA.text: Sat at the bar since it was a last minute decision to come here. The bartender was extremely nice and helpful when i asked for advice on what dishes are best if i don't eat red meat. Ended up ordering the rigatoni and the crostini as an app.  i was blown away. The portion sizes are great.. not too big and not too small. I'm so happy i came to check it out! Plus, the wine list is wonderful. Highly recommend!

Vrnerl7JCfbTqbxnPqYSSg.text: This was such a nice place for brunch. I had the Salmon Benedict and it was outstanding. No bread, poached eggs were on a salmon cake - crispy and so tasty. My friend had the spaghetti and meatballs which was also delicious. The fresh pasta was perfectly sauced and the meatballs were very  tender. And the bread was the best I had in Vegas- crusty, flavorful. Will definitely be back!

Rn_6KIRdv7haDcNnlgmC9A.text: Our meal was excellent - the chef bent over backward and our great Italian waiter "Rocco ", went out of their way to offer (2 ) types of sauce for the wild salmon ( perfectly cooked per my req)  Since I have dietary issues and couldn't eat the sauce that was to accompany the salmon.  Baked  Alaska - perfectlay made and flamed at the table.  My friend had the Vegetarian dish - it was excellent as well!  Will be back, for a repast soon :) and will recommend it to friends & colleagues that visit Vegas.

8jSE0Y9LLUp62B4vt9OV0g.text: Giada is a great place to celebrate with a great atmosphere and amazing view of the strip! I have celebrated two birthdays here now and the service is impeccable. One birthday I dined for dinner (elegant & romantic) and another birthday I visited for their weekend brunch (fun and bright atmosphere!) I love their salmon dish! For cocktails they have a great selection and I really enjoyed the Barbarella drink with Tanqueray and topped with basil! Their brunch was excellent and the staff are trained very well, knowledgeable, and are helpful in guiding you through the menu if you would like. They really know how to make you feel special whether you are celebrating or just dining for fun. Overall I felt the experience, quality, and service exceeded my expectations for a fine dining establishment.

mtdJ7Mvb-JXYhz6nd9ditQ.text: Undoubtedly the best brunch I've ever had in my life!   Also undoubtedly the most money I've ever paid for brunch, but it was definitely worth it.  My boyfriend and I went around 2 in the afternoon, there wasn't a wait but all the tables were taken so we sat at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and took very good care of us.  We ordered the chicken and waffles and the lobster hash. The lemon butter for the chicken and waffles was mind blowing. Actually, everything I had there was mind blowing...   I recommend getting the bottomless mimosas, it's a bit pricey but trust me, you will regret ordering only one drink in the end (as I did). Plus, when in Vegas...!

mcZnPZsAJyYyrDp9NhdghQ.text: Who knew a "Tasting Menu" brunch could be such an amazing experience?  First off, I bought the Living Social package, without the alcohol. Had I been staying over, I would have wisely opted for the alcohol. When I "checked in' on Yelp, I was awarded a "splash" of prosecco- flute is more like it. I also ordered the White peach belini. If everyone, everywhere, started every day with this drink, the world would be a happier place. Where to begin ( at the beginning, of course): The service was attentive yet not obsequious or fawning. Obviously a well-trained staff of professionals! They move, en mass, as though there are choreographed.  The ambience: Is there a better view in LV that doesn't require an elevator? I think not. The room is large yet feels cozy. The chairs are ultra comfortable; the table is set immaculately, and I am entranced by the cutlery. I want to know where I can buy a setting for eight?  The food: We began with a cheese & salami plate, a salad (how do they manage to make capers luxurious?), and two pastries. That, at most restaurants, would have been the sum total of a brunch tasting--not so here. We were just starting.   My husband had the salmon cakes with poached eggs. He is a stickler for the poached egg breaking correctly on an entree, so it was great to see his grin when that golden orb oozed all over the hamburger-sized salmon cakes. I had the Giada Burger. Oh my goodness! The meat was a melange of sirloin and panchetta ground and cooked perfectly medium rare-- served on a brioche bun with an heirloom tomato, peppery arugula, sweet onion, and tangy baby gerkins. To make things even better, on the side there were these potato/zucchini straws. I want the recipe! I couldn't eat it all and still manage the dessert, so I, wisely, had it boxed up at the halfway point. I am so glad I did because the close to this cullinary sojourn is the stuff of memories. My husband had the Chocolate Tower cake and I had the warm-from-the-oven, fluffy, limonchelo souffle with a creme Anglish. We also ordered double espressos which arrived simultaneously with the sweets.  I am stuffed, I am content. I may nap until tomorrow. Thank you Julian C. and the wonderful team at Giada's for a fantastic afternoon!

pXirkaV6LVEV4y0WvFvSQw.text: Very nice ambience with great views of the strip, but I'd stick to just the appetizers.   Likes: octopus appetizer/salad, meat balls, corn side dish  Pass: almost any pasta... I was sad that they had no linguini ala vongole.

19iqAH8jGjaIPSEpfM0eLw.text: Was craving to visit this restaurant 4 years ago and finally had a chance to visit this year. Overall experience were spectacular. Very nice and bright restaurant and server were knowledgeable. Lots of great wine and only show the price per glass. Should add half bottle or full bottle selection.   Arancini. Best arancini I have ever had. Presentation was nice and attractive.   Pork tomahawk. Perfectly made, nicely seasoned very juicy and flavourful.   Fettuccini. Size was quite small but executed perfectly. Noodles were made to al dente and shrimps were cook just right. Sauce were creamy but not over powering with a hint of spiciness. With this portion I think it's slightly overpriced.   Too bad I didn't see Giada :(
