fx8sCAx_cw8-qpLyp9vyYg.text: Service by Dave was excellent.  Very knowledgeable about menu items and recommendations.  We ordered a smorgasbord of food from the Lamb, to the Risotto and scallops and pasta.   Honestly the food was just ok but the dessert (blonde brownie) was extraordinary!  Ambiance is nice and we also had great service from another waiter who was also very professional and attentive.  Overall I'd give customer service a four star and foot three stars.  A must try when in Vegas.

k0D1tYUl9jK9Nc1IZgvxNw.text: Whaaaaaaaaaaaaat. a. BUMMER.  Man, I really, really wanted to like this place! I had been wanting to experience it since it opened and was so excited to finally dine here for my 29th birthday but it was a bad experience beginning to end.  First, against what had been requested, we were seated in a very odd area which seemed to be out of sight. It was extremely hard to get anyone's attention. We had questions regarding items on the menu and the waiter-- not sure if he working a double or just having a bad day-- was very rude and passive aggressive. We asked a question and point blank he asks "Well what does the menu say?" Hmm. We know what the menu says but I'm sorry, I'm not a Chef. If I were and had an idea what every single item on the menu meant I wouldn't be asking.  We ordered the carpaccio but asked if the carpaccio could be placed on the side since my friend is vegan. He said absolutely. It wasn't...it was actually placed underneath the salad and some pieces in between the lettuce and she wasn't able to enjoy it. Then it took about 15 minutes for anyone to come back so that we can order more drinks and place our food order. Again, my friend reiterated that she does not eat meat and I specified that I am allergic to fresh mint. We also asked that our spaghetti flights be cooked thoroughly...neither ones of us a fan of al dente (spelling? again, not a chef!) pasta. One of the pasta dishes was beef when we were told it was mushroom and though the basil in my pasta wasn't MINT, it took 10 minutes to get the waiter's attention to make absolute sure I wouldn't die if I bit into it. Did I mention I'm not a chef???  It felt like one hassle after another and now I can see why I've heard people say that this place is overrated. I wouldn't pay to dine here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone based on my experience. I'm sure others have had a blast here. Unfortunately for us, my 29th birthday dinner was a bust.

1oG-lTg9p-2vY9PhBz-_Lg.text: Beautiful atmosphere, excellent food, and top notch service! The lemon pasta is a fresh, summery dish, and the Cacio e pepe bucatini is amazing - it's pasta served in a cheese wheel! You can view the lights on the Vegas strip and the Bellagio water show. Request RADOSLAV as your server; you won't be disappointed! His knowledge and friendly demeanor enriched the experience. We'll definitely be back!

esdKXUJJIDN3wWH5FGwaXw.text: My wife and I had a big breakfast at Aria - The Buffett, so by the time we were getting close to our 1pm reservations at Giada we were not hungry. I told her we should cancel our reservations. She had been to Giada twice before from a previous Las Vegas visit and recommended that we still go. I agreed hesitantly.   We ordered Chicken Marsala meatballs (appetizer) and Lobster Hash. Both were INCREDIBLE! The meatballs melted in my mouth. It was so tasty!!! The Lobster Hash had lobster in every bite.   Our server, Rebecca, was also great. She is the one that recommended we try the Lobster Hash.   Although we were full from breakfast we finished all of our food. It was an exceptional dining experience!

o6FF96q4EjyoTQ5BQGNuwA.text: Service is great!  We were impressed especially having terrible service at Blue Ribbon at Cosmo. The bar at Gordon Ramsay's Pub and Grill within Caesar's was even better than Blue Ribbon.   I was sold on the Lemon Spaghetti from all the reviewers and personal friend of mine. House bread spread was warm and delish. Also enjoyed Burrata and Artichoke plates there. Yum.  Chicken Marsala Meatballs - I'm not a fan. It's nice, but it reminds me of Swedish Meatballs. I see great reviews though so it might be a personal preference.

eI3in8cQQgq_5xOYO6U9KA.text: A Perfect Bite Every Time  What a fantastic experience. My husband has been here before but this was my first visit. My husband and I sat at the bar and he says that Giovanni at the bar is always very friendly. After having him serve us I agree and he even remembered my husband and where he sat 3 months before during his last visit.   The artichoke appetizer is completely tender with a wonderful range of flavors. The charred octopus salad was amazing and could not have been prepared more perfectly. The veal chop saltimboca was a big hit (and is huge as well) and the bone-in filet was one of the best my husband has ever had. Excellent choices on the wine list - many at quite reasonable prices. We don't often eat dessert but the dessert tasting was too good to pass up. A great value with something for everyone and enough for two people to easily share.

he8CPDMMYINRoENcE7zBPA.text: I tried to go to Giada's restaurant years ago when it opened but it was booked, so I was pleased to get a reservation this time! The restaurant is beautiful. It has an open layout, lots of light inside, and nice windows opening up to a great view of the strip and the Bellagio fountains. Everything is labeled with Giada's name. The signs, the placemats, the napkins, even the paper towels in the restrooms!   They first brought us bread which was delicious. I am a huge focaccia fan and the focaccia muffin was so fluffy and had a great herb flavor. They also gave us a thin crispy bread as well that tasted like parmesan. The bread came with salt, a pesto sauce, ricotta spread, capers, and red pepper flakes. The ricotta spread went perfectly with the crispy bread and the pesto sauce was delicious with the focaccia. I do have to say we had to ask for more bread since for three people they just gave us one focaccia muffin, while another table with two people got the same amount. It was just too good to share!  We ordered 2 drinks as well. They were both pretty strong, you could taste the alcohol a little more than I like, and the one with limoncello was too sweet for our liking as well.  For our entrees we got the cacio e pepe for two that was served in a pecorino cheese wheel. This was great! The pasta was fresh and creamy and you could even eat the cheese wheel-which we did! I would definitely recommend this entree, it was fun, unique, and delicious! We also ordered the branzino which was perfectly cooked with crispy skin as well.   It was my birthday, which they acknowledged multiple times, and even gave me a plate with 2 cookies for free. There was a lemon cookie and a chocolate peanut butter cookie, both delicious!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

12PeZAEo6mQkutTu5KmRPQ.text: Went here for brunch and wow did it surpass expectations. The vibe was awesome and they did a great job with decor. The view is also great looking up the strip. We shared the hazelnut pancakes and the breakfast pizza and they were both out of this world amazing! The pizza was soft and flavorful with two sunny side eggs and Italian bacon on top. The pancakes had a ton of amazing flavors and a honey syrup that was the perfect addition. We also did mimosas and they were as good as you can get. Can't wait to come back.

zNONhCMeyktLSf0U_BaItg.text: This might be the best pasta place in the world, I've never been to Italy but I'm still standing by my statement . From the lemon and basil spaghetti with shrimp and mascarpone cheese to the cacio e pepe bucatini for two served in a pecorino tascano wheel, yes I said a Pecorino tascano wheel!!!! They say two but it feed three of us perfectly and was hands down the best pasta dish I have ever had in my life. We also had the Italian fried chicken which was just ok and the seared scallops calabrese with parmesan mashed potato which was delicious. Come here for the pasta and make sure to order an extra dish for the ride home. Lol

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared scallops with Parmesan mashed potatoes

IRgyjPIUDElDysAaMx0O4A.text: I came here for brunch with 2 of my girlfriends and had a lovely time! Billy was so attentive, charming and suggested options based on what we wanted, explained to us how to enjoy our choices. We were put in great hands! I got the Giada burger, and it did not disappoint! My friends tried the Chicken and Waffles, and Breakfast American, both as delicious. I wasn't in the mood for a cocktail, so I enjoyed the Birdie while my friends enjoyed mimosas and sangria. The decor is polished and modern; I have this thing with floors and the tile was enchanting. Absolutely, 100% recommend for an unforgettable experience!

8PFwygCCVSaRVad905510Q.text: We waited at least 10 minutes before the waiter even acknowledged us. The service was absolutely horrible, very disappointed. The food was good but over priced. We asked for a little bread and got charged for it. The music was really loud and hard to hear. I brought my friend for lunch for her Birthday and was so embarrassed by the service. Never again.

GWEHIBiH94MXOaSaYnbSlg.text: Something to be said about the food. I dined here this evening 12/19 and was wondering what all the hype was about. The food is what the hype was about. I enjoyed with the table the buratta, prosciutto, and octopus apps. All fantastic those were. Entrees included mustard crusted rack of lamb and lobster ravioli which were both to die for. Dessert I had the molten lava cake which was good as expected.   Now for what was to be desired was the service. We were seated promptly and the wait staff at first was very helpful in letting us know about the restaurant. We had our reservation for 5:00pm and failed to realize on how much the service standard declined when they were busy. The entire dinner took almost 2 1/2 hours as a result. We placed out order apps took around 20-25 min then entrees around 45-50 min. I actually caught myself checking the time on how long it had been since we had placed our order. The only other thing I noticed is that when the place got busy our waiter seemed to disappear. I waited for 20 min for my drink to be refilled and then the last time I asked for a refill they didn't even bring it back by the time I left 20 min later.  Point: Food is good as I expected it to be. The kitchen is doing it right. The FOH however has left little to be desired. This is the reason for the 3 stars.

xKGjTTMWF4i4V6MlHEQQGQ.text: If this review was about the food at Giada it would be a 5 star review, in fact I'd be petitioning Yelp to add a 6th star because the food is that good. However due to the absolutely abysmal service I received today at Lunch Giada is getting 2 stars. I hope my experience was an outlier & from what I've heard/seen that may be the truth but the service ruined what would have been an amazing meal for me & has probably made it so I won't return any time soon. As I said the food was amazing. Everything came quickly from the kitchen (other than the bread which was a little backed up), but everything was plated beautifully & tasted amazing. We started with the Orzo Meatballs & Prosciutto Dan Danielle to start. The meatballs had a great flavor profile & were cooked to perfection. The Prosciutto was a perfect balance of meat & ham & paired nicely with the warm bread & pesto. Our Entrees were the Venetian Panino & Lasagne, both were delicious & while the portions are a touch small I was happy with them. For dessert we had Zappole which were served with a chocolate sauce G & were a perfect end to the meal. & thus ends the glowing part of the review. Let's discuss the Service: I had a reservation that was made on Open Table, which was a great idea because even at 12:45 on a Wednesday there was a line to get seated. We checked in & were seated within minutes by a very friendly hostess, who informed us we were seated in Christopher H's section & that he would be by with menus in a moment. 10 minutes later, we still haven't seen or heard from Christopher, the busboy notices that we've been seated for a while & brings us over some water, apologizes for the delay & goes & flags down our server.  About 3-5 minutes later he came over & dropped off the menus. He introduced himself & then went on for about 5 minutes explaining the menu in full detail. This would have been great however he was talking in a very hushed mumble & we could barely hear every 5th word he said over the noise in the room. He then said give us a minute to make our decision & he'd come back. Another 5 minutes after we had closed our menus & set them on the edge of the table he finally came over & took our order.  He hurried off & entered our order, the apps came out before the bread which is fine, the runner explained that the bread oven was a "little backed up because everything is made fresh" but it came about 2 minutes after our apps got delivered. No big deal, it was delicious when it arrived.  The busby then came by & cleared our app plates & brought over some silverware for our main course. Our waiter came by moments before our entrees arrived & asked if we would like some more bread, to which I replied, "Yes the bread is great we'll take another".  The entrees made their way to our table & they were great, the busboy came by & topped off our beverages, but our server is nowhere to be found. No "hey how's everything tasting" or "hey would you like some fresh cracked pepper" nothing. He is bending over backwards to cater to the 5 top a few tables away from us & the couple seated right next to us, but he never  comes over to our table. We finish our entrees & the busboy scoops up our plates. My aunt wants to check out the dessert menu, however our waiter is nowhere to be found so she gets up, walks over 2 sections & asks a different waiter for a dessert menu. We then place a dessert order with the busboy because we haven't seen our waiter in a good 20 minutes, even though he's been to the table directly next to us no less than 4 times.  Dessert is delivered & our waiter brings out plates & a fork for the dessert course after the food has arrived. I immediately ask for the check as the 90 minutes we've been there was longer than I planned & I need to duck out quickly for work.  He brings the check by & moseys off. I have worked in the industry, I've waited tables in the past & am a majority of the time a great tipper however the service I received at a White Table Cloth Celebrity Chef Spot was not worthy of my usual 20-25%. The bill was about $70, I paid $75, & our waiter took the check & went back to the wait station.  I watched as his eyes got about as big as dish plates & he looks right at me & comes back with the bill to our table. He asks, "Did I take this too early". To which I reply, "No we're fine." He then says, "You do know that here at Giada Gratuity isn't included in the bill?" To which I say, "I know, there was nothing about your service that deserved more, maybe if you had actually acknowledged our existence you would have got a better tip."  He just shrugged his shoulders & walked off. On the way out the busboy once again apologized for the wait, but once again the server didn't say a word other than to complain about his tip.  I really enjoyed the food & it's a beautiful room, but that service was so bad that I probably won't be returning anytime soon.

E0mStfkJYP8yU84l5GrPWw.text: I am writing this review based on two dining experiences for dinner about three weeks apart.    I will start off by saying that I am a HUGE fan of Giada and frequently use her recipes and cooking styles in my own every day cooking.  I consider myself to be a great home cook and have been told by many at my dinner table that I am a great cook.  Thank you, Giada (and some other Food Network Stars) for the years of training from the other end of the tv.  EXPERIENCE #1 The first was on 10/24/14 and we were there to celebrate my mother's birthday.  We were a table of three.  I made reservations for this dinner months in advance and stated it was my mother's 70th birthday and on the day of I needed to downsize the reservation due to half of our party not arriving to Las Vegas until later due to flight delays.  We arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation and were seated about 10 minutes after our time.  I felt as if we were being punished for changing the number in our party because as we were walked through the restaurant there were MANY (at least 5) four top tables available and we were seated at the table directly next to the entrance/exit to the kitchen.  We spent our entire time hearing the servers and runners yell "corner" as they darted in and out of the kitchen.  One of those yells didn't work out as a collision occurred and plates went flying and crashing to the ground.  Our server was excellent, he was completely educated about the menu and very attentive to our questions and needs.  He checked in with us almost immediately after each course was delivered to our table.  I wish he could be my server every time I dine out!    The food was very good with all of the courses devoured.  One issue with the food was it was inconsistent between two orders of the exact same dish, the Lemon Spaghetti.  Two of us ordered it and each tasted different (one had a good amount of sauce and the other had hardly any sauce and flavor on the pasta).  Overall experience for this visit would be four stars.  EXPERIENCE #2 The second visit was on 11/16/14.  We were a party of 8 seated at what looked like the only big table in the center of the dining room.  Being seated there was incredible because we could get the full impact of the ambiance of the restaurant.  We were greeted promptly by our server and food service assistant (not sure about the title).  Shortly after, we ordered drinks and then ordered our food a short while after that.  Bread was brought (which by the way is AMAZING) and we were enjoying our experience.  Our food was brought out in courses.  The appetizer course was fantastic.  Next came the pasta and main courses, all brought at the same time.  The sides were brought out about 5 minutes later except my side which was brought out another 5 minutes after that.  Of the pasta and main course dishes, 5 out the 8 were great (especially the risotto which was ordered by two of our group).  Unfortunately, three of the dishes were not good.  We had to send back the lamb because the meat was spongy and two of our group ordered the Bucatini pasta (one of the two vegetarian options that are not a side dish or pizza) and it was completely flavorless.  After one guest sent back the lamb, the server was no where to be found and never checked in on the rest of our meals until 30 minutes later when plates were being cleared.  The two that had the Bucatini talked to the server and sent back their pasta.  The server asked if there was something else that he could prepare and my friend, a vegetarian, asked what was on the menu (other than the Rigatoni with mushrooms which he is allergic to) that he could have.  The server made a very snarky comment..."I already reviewed the whole menu with you".  The manager never came over to talk to us about the problems with our meal.  The food service assistant never brought the additional bread that we asked for and when we asked again, his response..."oh, sorry" and nothing further.  I have to say that for a restaurant that categorizes themselves as fine dining and for the VERY EXPENSIVE price points, this type of service and the lack of caring that three of the five entree/pasta dishes had to be sent back is completely unacceptable.  When I shared my experience with my friends who are locals in LV, they told me that the buzz around town with the locals is that the restaurant is just average at best.  Overall experience for the second visit would be 1/2 of a star, which is being generous.  I am truly unsure if I will ever return to Giada's restaurant on one of my many trips to Vegas.

2U8CheaxwPhPknz4GkCJHw.text: Not worth the money. Food had good taste but not a lot of it. You will leave  and will definitely not say I'm full. Our waiter was extremely rude and very arrogant. We had a group of 13, mostly customers and the waiter's attitude and arrogance made for an uncomfortable evening, there was never even an offer of dessert, which was good because after 3 hours, we were ready to go. Will never go back as well as the 12 other people with me. Much better values in vegas, this was the worst place I have eaten in vegas and I am there 5-6 times a year for business.

a_6mX6v4hL6p_h3LZcmZXg.text: My husband and some friends and I were interested in trying Giada's restaurant since we are fans of her show. We were able to get reservations for 8:15P on a Sunday. We waited about 10 minutes before our table was ready. We thought it was such a cute idea that she has a Photo Booth for patrons to use while they are waiting for their table. We ended up getting the tasting menu (everyone is forced to get it at the table, unfortunately), which costs $120 per person. You get to select 4 courses and get an autographed copy of the menu signed by Giada.   The waitress was really nice and they were on top of refiling our waters. My husband and his friend were iffy about the tasting menu because they wanted to get the surf and turf and the waitress offered to see if they could add that to the tasting menu instead. Everyone gets the same first course which is a variety of appetizers. I wasn't a big fan of it because one of plates uses goat cheese and I hate goat cheese. My friends thought the goat cheese was really "goaty". One of the other dishes on there reminded me of throw up so I wasn't too keen on it. My next course I got the lemon spaghetti which was not too bad and my husband got the charred octopus (which was substituted by the chef because we asked). The octopus was really good. The portion for the spaghetti was a decent size and I was already starting to get full. My next course was the salmon which was good as well. I enjoyed it and my husband got the surf and turf. We were extremely disappointed by the description of surf and turf. You get about a 6 oz. filet mignon and ONE lobster ravioli. Yes, only ONE. Finally for dessert, the waiter brings out a dessert cart and you get to pick 3 desserts. I picked the nipple of venus (really rich), the tiramisu (awesome!), and the strawberry sorbeto with fresh fruit (so light and refreshing).   By the end of the meal, my friends and I noticed that Giada loves to use capers and lemon in all her dishes. We were kind of sick and tired of it. Capers and lemon are used from start to finish (from the bread you eat to the lemon in the dessert). So 3 stars for lack of variety and for paying $120 per person for a tasting menu, not really worth it.

fXNdlOqELdGzWpGtP8QJQw.text: I was hoping to really love this restaurant since I love watching Giada's cooking show. I made reservations for the Saturday after Thanksgiving 2 months prior for 5 people. They asked if it was a special occasion and stated it was my nieces bday.  First things first the self parking is limited it is shared with the adjacent hotel n a timeshare. So you have no option but to valet. This was at 5pm. We then get to the restaurant and we still had to wait for 15 min for our table and when the hostess sat us we stood their like idiots bc they were still prepping the table. Epic fail!!  When we finally sat our waitress was unprepared.. Trying to give us a menu that was empty so she had to go get another one.. 5min later she comes back takes drink order. She looked disheveled n had no personality.  Food was mediocre for it being a fancy restaurant. I ordered the crab n scallop risotto which had bits of crab shells in it. I told the waitress and her response: oh that happens sometimes n walked away. The scallops were very salty as well. The appetizers were good we had the octopus, calamari n shrimp and some cheese thing which I can't remember the name of. There was nothing special on the dessert menu which I was so surprised about bc Giada makes awesome desserts on her show.  So the occasion was my nieces bday that was acknowledged by 3 people at this restaurant and did nothing special not even a piece of chocolate?? Why acknowledge the occasion if they plan not to do anything I thought that was really weird. The one memorable thing was the photo booth in the front entrance.  In conclusion: reservation service fail, food mediocre and service fail;(

Du_vvFbuZK1WUIIgF3IhAQ.text: Very middle of the road food for the price. You are paying for location & ambiance but not for tasty food. Breakfast was forgettable except the tab at the end. Might go there for just drinks. Giada should visit her restaurant and try the food again, cooks might have watered down her recipes.

KFKsLurj5uEV1Y4LOKyUqg.text: We sat near the window. Amazing view. Our server Cliff was great. We ordered the prix fixe menu - appetizers were good, I wish I had just gotten pasta because the rigatoni bolognase was amazing. The desserts were disappointing.

4lK0GM91wPWapSginUCDSg.text: I was very excited to try Giada's as her recipes are amazing. I hate to say the experience was extremely disappointing. We are trying serveral restaurants for brunch kinda a bucket list thing. Don't mind paying for great food and service but this fell short on both. First we had a party of 8 and had made reservations so we didn't just show up. Several of us ordered  the bottomless mimosas.  Which only came with 2 refills. Then 3 of our dishes came out undercooked and not warm. Then when we brought it to the manager's attention our item were replace somewhat. The eggs I was given were still under cooked and my meatballs that were raw never got replaced. The manager sent over some desert as a compensation which was nice. Unfortunately I left hungry and still don't know if the meatballs are any good. Our server only came over a few times. This also was brought to the manager's attention and she said she spoke with the server.  Then we asked to see the wine list and that took 30 mins. Needless to say at this point I was very over the whole thing. So I paid the 65.00 for my latte, toast, some berries, and my husband waffle. Won't be back anytime soon hope this feedback will change future experience for someone else.

_LfMpXy4lsrBNWsB-feIAA.text: How could anybody give this restaurant anything but five stars. The restaurant is very clean and pretty, the view of the strip is great, and the food was amazing! I ordered the Sunrise Polenta Waffle with pancetta, chives, noble maple syrup, bechamel & two sunny side up eggs. It was amazing! For a drink I ordered the palm juice which had pineapple, apple, lemon & mint, it was so cold and refreshing. My friend got the Breakfast Contadina with two eggs served any style, crispy polenta cakes, wilted spinach, oven roasted tomatoes & toast. We both shared the Berries with Lemon Yogurt Sauce, and they were amazing! We loved it so much we came back the next day for breakfast again. Over all this place is amazing and I recommend it to everyone!!

YiOAIXLoymLfBOag9JQ3eg.text: Maybe I had high expectations but it was just "OK". The ambiance is pretty generic and feels more like an airport than chic vegas eatery. Also more casual than expected, I would maaaaaybe try this again for lunch but not for a fun weekend dinner.  The tricolore salad and tortellini (with mint, peas) were both good.  The spaghetti with lemon and shrimp was super heavy and gummy, had to send it back.   Nice antipasti selection.

BLtMUS6EJ6ifyETbVvmg9w.text: I have been wanting to go to Giada's since it opened. I finally went and loved it! The menu has a lot of options but we decided to go with the tasting menu because it had their best dishes. The tasting menu is $120 per person but you get a lot of food. We started with the antipasto of crostini, dates, and peppers. All were just ok but not anything I would choose to order again. Then came the pastas, you get the lemon shrimp or the vegetable bolognese rigatoni. Since there was 2 of us, we got 1 of each and we added truffle shavings on the rigatoni. Both were amazing! The pasta was perfectly cooked and deliciously flavored. I can't even decide which one I liked better. Then you get the main course and we choose the salmon and rack of lamb. The salmon had a light flavor but was good. The lentils that were in the sauce were bland and added really nothing to the dish. The lamb was delicious! It had a mustard crust and was just melt in your mouth good. And lastly you get to choose desserts from the extensive cart. I choose the chocolate tiramisu, lemon ricotta cookie, and white coffee gelato. All 3 were awesome! Overall, I very much enjoyed my experience at Giada's. I only knocked off a star for the antipasto and bland salmon sauce.

0N2fdFG0gFc0XxS2QLHS9g.text: Had high hopes for this restaurant considering... But i was pretty dissapointed. Even the fruit drinks were bad. If you go here just order the appetizers. You'll probably leave happier. Don't get pasta dishes!!!, they're not good at all. Meatballs were also insanely salty!  I'm so sad. Had high hopes too! Maybe my expectations were too high.

6kO2eqrypm19pYShE_YEug.text: I don't know what previous diners are talking about...our experience has been stellar! The young hostess was a little "unconcerned" but once inside I could not ask for better attention at the bar while waiting for my husband to join me. The bartender crafted "special" drinks for us both and each was superb. Bryan our waiter is excellent, explaining the tasting menu and offering suggestions from the main menu and the options are vast. We settled on the artichoke arancini which were fried nicely with 2 sauces and the dry-cured salumi which was simple but exactly as expected. The TriColore kale salad was delicious, lightly dressed and the yellow tomato soup was yummy with fried mozzarella balls. The veal chop saltimbocca is Huge-you better be Hungry-lightly fried with a simple tomato salsa on the side. The Swiss chard with tofu is underrated-it packed a lot of flavor. We ended the meal with chocolate and roasted banana gelato and Giadas's cookies..so yummy. From start to finish this was an excellent meal-not to be missed while in Las Vegas

L4AWZKHCPlGwAaj5rd56vQ.text: My wife and I recently spent our 12th anniversary here. Giada is an inspiration for my wife and cooking.  We were excited to try it. We each decided to order the tour of Italy dish. Came with an excellent assortment of appetizers to share, followed by a lemon jumbo shrimp spaghetti, and a vegetable Bolognese pasta. Both dishes were good. We preferred the spaghetti. That was followed by our main course. She had the salmon, and I had the best rack of lamb I've ever had (Giada wins the throw down with Bobby Flay! I've had his at Mesa Grill as well). The main dish was accompanied with really good cheesy potatoes and fresh broccoli. Lastly we were treated with a wonderful dessert cart. You really can't go wrong, but the no flour dark chocolate cake, the cheesecake, and tiramisu are excellent choices. The service was exquisite. Very enjoyable, great atmosphere, and decadent yet comfortable. Bottom line is you will pay for a great evening, but it's well worth it! Thanks.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vino!!!!!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert cart

aLjcjZAp6ezc8jBJDnlA6g.text: Pricey!  The really only negative thing I can say. I dined by myself at the bar - 3 tapas, 2 glasses of red, dessert and coffee. $100 tab. Regardless of such, the food was excellent and most importantly the bar staff were personable and friendly. Glad I can say "been there done that" but with so many other great dining options likely won't be back soon.

JtU40o45qH0xRfqexim94g.text: I wanted to like this place.  No I wanted to LOVE this place.  You see, the year was 2006 and I desperately needed a break from studying.  I happened to come across a woman cooking Italian food on TV.   She was young, hip, beautiful, and I was just mesermized.  I wanted to know what hair products she used, the name of her polish on her perfectly manicured hands and where she got her unique home wares from.  I was hooked on Everday Italian.  It was 30 minutes of total escape from grad school each week.  When I found the time, I started to cook from her recipes.  They were always a hit at home.  I've been a huge fan since that day.  When I found out Giada was opening a place in Vegas, you can believe my excitement.  So fastforward to Dec. 23, 2014.  I was like a little fan girl about to go to my first One Direction concert.  My Sigoth (significant other) didn't get it but he went along.  But it was excatly like going to a One Direction concert and finding out Zayn was no longer a One Directioner.  Complete and utter disappoinment.  It pains me to even admit it, but I must.  I didn't hate it but I didn't really like it either.  Neither did the Sigoth.  I don't know if I was being hyper-critical because I was eating at Giada's!  I mean these were the select recipes she chose to showcase herself and her brand.  The best thing I had was this signature cocktail, charcuterie and the meatballs.  That's it.  We got a pizza thing that was meh, a couple of pastas (one was the spagetti with the shrimp), it was over salted and terrible.  Just one note, salt.  There was something else we had that we had to send back because it tasted off, don't remember what it was.  I think my experience was a shock to my system so I've blocked off my memory from dining there.  I'm giving one star for the ambiance/decor.  It was beautiful in there, I loved the decor, a lot.  And the second star for the courteous services.  *sigh*

-egQWsL4J8pM6WyZZNTCKg.text: love the view and decor  pizza was bland and not crispy for thin crust  gnocchi was ok, nothing special  not worth the price  Christopher , waiter, was AWESOME, best service in a long time

LaCYgxDKGU65U0EuwfeE2A.text: Went because my mom really wanted to go. Definitely not cheap eats - expect dinner to be closer to $$$$ vs $$. Giada does Italian Food her way - don't expect a traditional spaghetti. We each had a pasta and an appetizer. I tried the mushroom aracini - tasted fine. We each tried a different pasta. My husband wanted more sauce on his spaghetti and expected red sauce instead of the lemon sauce that Giada's serves - still tasted great. I enjoyed my lobster ravioli and my mom was pleased with her risotto. We all enjoyed the flavors. Don't expect to get full at Giada's unless you're willing to shell out for a four course meal.

kwYuzncGZI5L5G1hlD2LCA.text: Let me start by saying that I've been to Giadas before. The food and service was great.  That said, I called 2 weeks ago and made reser-vations for 3 of us. 3 days ago I received a message from a hostess in regards to my reser-vations and to call them. To my surprise, I was told that if I wanted a window table (to be clear, I asked for a booth 1st and said, if you have a view that's great as well,) ok....now, I was told that if we wanted a window seating we would have to guarantee that we would each purchase $100 minimum per person. I am not cheap. Nor do I like being told how much food to stuff down my gullet. I let the hostess, a snotty, condescending and eye rolling thru the phone little girl name Farell, know my opinion.  I called back and spoke with an assistant manager. I live here in Vegas. I've never ever been told I had to promise to buy a quota of food, much less by a child hostess. If you're into being told what to eat and how much to spend, go for it. There are so many other wonderful places to eat here in this town that I will be enjoying.

T7dSMYrVi2-2Y-l7Lx7Chw.text: We loved the decor in this restaurant. It was open and airy with lots of space and tables. We also loved the outfits of our servers, classy and cute. The hostesses were very accommodating as we were using a breakfast voucher bought from Gilt at around 1pm in the afternoon  For an upscale restaurant however, the service was pretty slow. It took a long time for us to get water and our menus, which detracted from the experience.  I ordered the salmon cake Benedict which came with 2 salmon cakes, 2 poached eggs, toasted sourdough on a bed of sauteed spinach with a side of hollandaise sauce. I though the dish was quite well done, the salmon cakes were flavorful, the eggs were poached nicely. However, since it normally costs 21 dollars, I was expecting a little more from both the service and the flavors. It was good but not amazing.  My friend ordered the polenta with bacon bits. She said it was ok but not amazing as well. Maybe we ordered the wrong things, the polenta waffles looked really delicious.   We also ordered two glasses of freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. I really enjoyed my glass, but my friend found it to be too bitter and sour.  Overall, this was worth it for the 44 dollar voucher but I would hesitate to go again and pay full price.

2X7hwXU_5Ry8G73jMccrng.text: I would literally drive to Giada from San Diego just to get the lemon souffle! It is a must if you are ever in Las Vegas. The drinks and main dishes are equally as impressive and to top it off, the view of the Bellagio water display is amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing limoncello soufflé at Giada!

lJdsTT9vG4YZo0KljvaknA.text: OK, so I usually am very picky about Italian food and feel many of the celebrity chef restaurants in Vegas are completely overrated, but the wait to get a reservation for this place is completely justified....one of my new favorite places period. Went for brunch, had the lobster Benedict which was cooked perfectly with a very light sauce. Also had the Pannetone French toast which was undoubtedly the best French toast I've ever had. They have a very interesting cocktail menu, I had a drink w/ Tanqueray 10, ginger beer and basil foam which was absolutely fabulous ( can't remember the name).  Service was on point and the decor was simple, beautiful and comfortable. can't wait to go back for dinner!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Benedict
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

voO5mKbMimndvSUbDloR5A.text: Once you're inside the Cromwell Hotel - be sure to follow the signs to Giada through the casino as you have to take a specific escalator to get to the restaurant. The ambience of the restaurant was wonderful from the moment I entered. The decor of the table is beautiful and I liked how the tables are placed far enough from each other that you aren't able to hear others conversations. When I visited Giada, they had a special where if you checked into yelp you received a free pour of wine, which was a rather large pour! Be sure to check if they're still offering this deal when you visit. The service my party received was impeccable and you could tell they we going above and beyond to ensure you had the best dining experience. The food was delicious!! I opted for the Wood Roasted Mushrooms pizza with baby kale and gorgonzola dolce which was a great item for only $14. I'd highly recommend to anyone in the Las Vegas area.

YOiLBbRMcEZycP7K5sGGrg.text: Very Meh.  Service at the bar was good (as it should be for $19 cocktails), but the food- and that's why we go out to eat- was less than mediocre.  I had the seasonal bruschetta to start.  The avocado was perfect, but there was no real flavor or seasoning, despite the epileptic drizzle of balsamic.  Poor quality balsamic?  No seasoning?  Four little toasts for $18?  They should be four little bites of fantastic flavor.  Fell short.  Oompa loompa short.  The tricolore salad.  Prosciutto was delicious, but I couldn't even eat the rest of the salad, it was drenched in gorgonzola.  Dripping.  The server took it away and never made eye contact or asked why I had not eaten it.  It's vegas, they don't care.  Turn your table and they are on to the next.  Here's your check.    Such a bummer.  I had high expectatons.  Oddly enough, this experience tarnishes her whole brand for me, which I did not see coming.

jOvbX92XfL_Qqrz774rxkg.text: Best dining experience in most recent memory! This place has it all! The decor, the great drinks, creative and delicious food, and location! A perfect place for a special occasion or just a treat with that special someone! Attention to every detail has been thought of in this place! The specialized drink menu for instance has drinks named after Giana's grandfather who was movie producer Dino De Laurentis. All the drinks have names of some of the movies he produced. To start, they bring a lovely bread assortment with dipping sauces, don't miss the rosemary roll! The cheese dishes are various sizes and assortments, depending on the size of your table. The only thing I will warn you of is that they tell you the portions aren't large enough to share, but they are!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hannibal drink!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli... Good  but lacking something and a tad too chewy for my likings!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable rigatoni was my favorite!

eHLSbdqoM1s9Ar2iQJ4gcw.text: Yes, five stars!  Giada de Laurentis' signature restaurant is the real deal, a complete package and incredible experience worthy of the price point and a reservation!    From the moment you top the escalator arriving at the hostess stand, every detail transports you.  Hostesses wear smart white dresses and the ambience of being in a cool home like atmosphere envelopes you.  A fun extra is the complimentary photo booth for a souvenir to email or print!  With a beautiful view of Las Vegas Blvd. and a nice breeze thanks to the open windows, our server welcomed us and offered 5 star treatment, as did the manager.  Salmon Cakes Benedict won the prize for the presentation and incredible fresh taste!  Polenta waffles with grilled fruit came in a close second as the grill treatment elevated the pineapple to a new level of deliciousness.  Even the caprese omelette produced fresh herbs on top with extremely memorable mozzarella!  Just don't leave without bread and butter (lemon butter that is with three other spreads like almond chocolate and others I can't recall except for the memory of each bite!)  Every tiny aspect literally from the napkins to  the glassware to the decor accessories are obviously hand picked to reflect Giada and her style!  We learned that she visits a couple of times each month and makes sure to interact with guests and take photos with them.  The other chefs in town could take this cue!  We loved this dining experience and cite it as the best meal we enjoyed in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Polenta waffles with grilled fruit and nutella topping.  Delicious!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mocktails that were refreshing and delicious.

URD0goevxFPnTZzfLmFgkQ.text: I have been here 3 times I used the groupon, so we got 2 glasses of champagne love the grilled cheese with pesto, and the fried donuts are amazing. The pizza and salad were delicious the Salas was fresh totally worth the price.i would definitely  be back for more

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

EIr4JYyPlLVXSPDfn4BgAg.text: Went here for dinner and this place was THE 5 STAR EXPERIENCE.  If you're in the mood for Italian, make sure your choice is Giada.  We ate off of the dinner tasting menu, which was a four course dinner.  It was $120/person and so worth it.  The apps came out first which was a couple of sweet peppers with melted cheese, some bacon wrapped spicy sausage, and a few other items.   The bread plate was also great with a large assortment of toppings.   After the apps, I had Bucatini bolognese - delicious.    For the main course, I had a 7 oz filet which was like butter .  We had roasted potatoes and a spiced corn as sides and for dessert we had 3 items each off of the delicious dessert cart.  My gf had the salmon for her main course which was perfectly cooked.   Our server, Luis, was top notch.  Our drinks were terrific.   I honestly can't complain about one thing here.  From the moment we entered, the staff was fantastic. The ambience was great.  The food amazing.   Definitely coming back. Oh yeah, and don't forget to check in on Yelp while there for your free splash of Prosecco.

pD8_43cXmxjfKWZo20AOkw.text: In our party Giada is amongst a favorite Chef, so we came to see if her restaurant could meet her reputation. We were happy to find that it not only met expectation but exceeded. The staff was specifically impressive. We felt at home from Bree (sp), who guided us through our social time to the sommelier to our waiter. Great experience great time.

ITJQpf-3x49I8Fg_3sUDTA.text: The brunch experience was absolutely wonderful. We had a group of 9 and they were extremely accommodating. The highlight was our server, Billy, who used his scientific theory of Mimosa making to deliver some of the most satisfying Mimosas I've ever had. Also, the Lobster Hash was amazing. I ate mine... and half of my friends. I highly recommend this place!

YJejLfbd6Y1HHJa9ZlpjlQ.text: Despite Giada De Laurentiis being on Food Network, I've always admired her as one of the few chefs on that channel who prepare dishes on TV that aren't replicas of something you'd find in the Better Homes & Garden cookbook.  Likewise, her restaurant at The Cromwell on the Las Vegas Strip is not a cookie-cutter "celebrity chef" restaurant on the Strip, eschewing the formulaic darker ambiance, and instead embracing lighter colors, ample lighting, and soft wood accents. However, Giada's best design feature is that, unlike other Strip restaurants that you'd actually eat at, Giada has an entrance directly on the street so that you don't need to walk through a casino to get to it.  The food was very good. Giada De Laurentiis' fingerprints are on the menu, as I recognized most of the entrees as being featured recipes on her shows.  The complimentary bread service was impressive-looking, featuring a focaccia-like bread baked in a ramekin, with accompaniments including garlic puree, mascarpone lemon cream, pepper flakes, fried capers, and pink salt. Anywhere else, this would be ostentatious, but this is a restaurant in a Vegas casino after all.  Lobster Arancini was the first plate I ordered, featuring four small fried arancino balls. Do you love creamy risotto? Fried food? Lobster? Parmesan cheese? Great, you'll love this. Served with a pomodoro sauce made of Calabrian chilis that impart a small bit of heat and a slightly fruity taste. Given the diminutive size of the arancino balls, this appetizer was a bit on the expensive side at $19 -- but worth it.  The Pan Roasted Salmon was another winner. The 7 ounce filet of salmon is mild, wonderfully seasoned, and richly browned on its top, accompanied by a mustard sauce spiked with garlic and thyme. A summer succotash of corn and cannellini beans completes the plate. Again, smaller portions than what you'll generally find out on the Strip. At $39, it is a dish I'd re-order.  I finished my meal with a Chocolate Honey Almond Tart. I've made this myself based on Giada's instruction on Food Network. Here, the preparation and presentation was different, as they don't pulverize the almonds and instead slice them thin and layer them on top of the tart, creating a crunchy texture.   I dined solo at Giada and I was told by the dude who sat me at a half-empty bar at 8pm that they don't serve their dinner menu at the bar, and that I'd need to ask the head bartender for a favor to order anything that wasn't the limited antipasto selection on their iPad bar menu. This was all done and said with a straight face. Once we got past that bullshit, the rest of my experience at Giada was fine.  There are a plethora of "celebrity chef" restaurants in Vegas, and Giada is a worthy entry into a crowded scene. If this restaurant was not tied to Giada De Laurentiis, it would still be successful.  Food/Decor/Service: 4.1/4.4/4.0

BndeBV106q9-p73YrljcXQ.text: I'm leaving one star because I can't leave less than that. I have been to many restaurants in Las Vegas and I have to say I have never felt so disgusted at the level of customer service as I have at Gaida. She must really not know that's going on there. Couple of things to point out:  1) Food is extremely over priced for the portion and quality you receive. Nothing special about the plates whatsoever ordinary caprese salads and pasta dishes with tiny portions and no taste.   2) The waiter was something out of this world and so was the management. The waiter asked if we wanted a bottle of wine and I said yes so management brought us a bottle of a white wine we had never even heard of and asked if that was ok... Umm no it's not ok let me see the wine menu and select myself. The fact they didn't even ask us if we wanted to see one from the get go blows my mind (mind you I was in a party of 6). The waiter also took our dishes without asking if we were done with the plates. Can you say rude? You could tell the waiter does not belong serving in a place like that. I also overheard the couple next to us who was eating say they did not like their plate and would like it returned. I literally watched them return it and just finish their two drinks and leave (wish I had been this smart from the start).   The only reason I stayed through it all was because it was my girlfriends birthday and that's where she wanted to go. With reservations and all I still had to wait at least 15 minutes and when they brought my girlfriend a dessert for her bday it was 2 lemon cookies and some icing on a plate that said happy birthday... No small dessert with a candle or anything. Seriously? I wish I could go back in time and had gone to eat somewhere else. Only reason I didn't run out was because I was trying to satisfy my girlfriend but our whole party was appalled by the quality of that establishment. Never again will I go there and I'll make sure everyone I know doesn't waste their hard earned money on a place like that. Hope this review helps someone.  I strongly believe some of these 5 star reviews are people paid by the establishment or people who have no idea what fine dining is really about.

xnbhaCfrxKIiyFrnPhTsIA.text: I must admit, I am a fan of Giada's shows and recipe books - so my opinion may be skewed.  We ate here on a Monday night at 9:30pm.  We were seated at 9:45pm, and because we had the tasting menu, we did not leave until about 12:30pm.  I called about 2-3 weeks in advance and had about 2 or 3 time slots to choose from in a span of a week for a party of four for dinner.  So if you want to dine here, call well in advance.    The restaurant is very nicely located in the Cromwell, across from Ceasar's Palace and kitty corner from the Bellagio.  The view from the windows is fabulous, but you'll have to request a window table when you make reservations.  Since we had to wait for a bit for our table, we had some cocktails at the bar. The service was a tad slow, but since they gave us an iPad that acted as the menu, we just played with it and explored the different drinks. Overall our cocktails were okay and cost $15 each.  The tasting menu for the night was spot on with Giada's style.  If you have cooked from her recipes, you know what I mean. The flavor profiles were aligned with what I have made from her books before. Here's the overview:  Bread selection - all of it was very yummy, but the rosemary foccacia was the star. We knew we had a lot of food coming, but we still had to ask for more bread JUST BECAUSE!  Antipasti - a selection of four items.  I forgot the names of everything, but I ate everything but the stuffed peppers with goat cheese (not a fan of cheese).  The other three items were perfect, and I especially loved the eggplant mix.  Second course - my friend and I ordered one each so we could try both.  She ordered the Vegetable Bolognese and I ordered the Lemon Spaghetti with Shrimp.  The Lemon Spaghetti was surprisingly good and the Shrimp were "ginormous"!  I personally liked the Vegetable Bolognese more, but both dishes were great.  Again, the flavor profile is SO GIADA.  Third course - I chose the Sicilian Roasted Lamb.  I love lamb, but I must confess that I was SO stuffed because everything before this was so good that I could not truly enjoy this.  It was good, but if I had more space I would probably rave about it more.  I was so full that I could not even try the family-style sides of Smashed Potatoes and Sweet Corn (sniff sniff).  Dessert - as stuffed as I was, because they roll to your table a big cart filled with all types of temptations, I had to try a few.  The gelato was good, especially a coffee flavored one. My only complaint was that it was melting too much.  The cookies were good, as was everything else. Again, I was too stuffed to truly enjoy it.    I wish I had a second stomach for the Third Course and Dessert!  Along with the Tasting Menu, you also get a nice folder with some recipes, the tasting menu you had, and a signed copy of Giada's photo.  The only sad part of this dinner was that I brought my copy of Giada's book all the way from California...and she wasn't there to sign it. Boo hoo. But at least I still got a signed photo.  If I get to come here again with my husband, I'll be making reservations here as soon as we book the trip!

qeciz8y0ocE3CKpnwxZvtQ.text: Spectacular Thanksgiving prefix menu complemented by incredible service from Rebecca and team!  Thank you Giada and The Cromwell for making our Thanksgiving so special!  You guys ROCK!

pd5A378KspDsiMJw-Tpvsg.text: Reservation at 8:15, went to the bar first. Few minutes go by when bartender shows us a digital cocktail list. We order 4 cocktails. 10 minutes later we finally had them. Cool... Single big Ice cubes for rocks drinks and fun egg white foam for clever cocktails. Hostess sits us at about 9. No menus given [i get it they want you order wine before dinner] ok. But we had a long while to look at the menus at the bar. The server comes about 9:15 and asked for wine and cocktails order. We Order a bottle of wine. Takes about 20-25 minutes because it wasn't "chilled". Finally wine is served, it's a Pinot ... Could have served it to me right out of storage but anyway.... The entire service from sit down to water service to wine service (both times) to waiting for the dessert cart to roll around was a 3 hour experience. Way to long for this type of restaurant.   The veal was fried.  The bucatini was mediocre at best.  The spaghetti was an amazing house lemon sauce instead of red sauce... Which blows my mind. You can't have a spaghetti on the menu with a lemon sauce. Just breaks all the rules. However the fish was beautiful and light.   Asparagus soup was bland but the tricolor was yum  Octopus was to die for.  Aracinis were not my favorite.  And the dates, well.. I would have expected more.   This place is booked out for a long while and I know they are just getting the hang of things so I'll try it again in a month or so.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Water glass

M0IJ7y6U6nZLzyZZLKCseA.text: Like a lot of reviews here, we loved the ambiance/look of it. Great view of the strip that's hard to get anywhere else. It's location is the best part. The food was underwhelming and the service felt slow for the prices you're paying.   The lemon spaghetti was surprisingly good but everything else we had (tenderloin and salmon) was just ok and repeatable or better at other Italian places on the strip.

mPWLgEt74uScaa3LP0EAew.text: Came here for my birthday with my sister and best friend about a year and a half ago and am still mentioning to my other friends how amazing the service was. The food was great (we did the 5 course meal that came with the signed menu) and the view of the Bellagio fountains weren't too bad either ;) I recommend this place to all my friends who are going to Vegas all the time!

i7TV8GkCU0yu4mw2MXtdIw.text: Visited Vegas this last weekend for a bachelorette party and we came to Giada because of all the good things we'd heard about it and it definitely exceeded our expectations! The inside was absolutely beautiful with large windows overlooking fountains and perfectly lit buildings. We had exceptional service and multitude of delicious Italian fare choices. We started with several appetizers including the calamari, and drinks from their extensive menu. I personally had the spaghetti with shrimp and my only complaint is I wished it had a bit more sauce! Other than that everything was perfect! I even made the mistake of leaving my  credit card at the table, and Gary, our waiter, ran my card all the way to me downtown in the hotel lobby! Talk about exceptional service

K5DkJSsqxFbqfSmyDcwpzg.text: Wanted to try this place as my GF is a big fan of Giada's. Reservation at 8:00, had to wait an additional 15 minutes for our table. After being seated with no menus, water or anything to occupy ourselves, waited another 5 minutes to be greeted.  Joseph made the evening much better, and he and his trainee, Kathy, were very attentive and pleasent.  The food was amazing, delicious and what a great presentation.  We'll be back, definitely. One thing about the waiters uniforms, however.  The white, ill-fitting jackets looked a bit stuffy and too formal for a Giada style.

Cg6T9ttFaDBXhZPyNSjXew.text: If you're looking for an Italian place on the strip with the potential for a view, Giada's is worth trying out!  Really nice for a date spot but even good for groups. I was here on a Wednesday night, but it was still pretty busy. The person I was with made a reservation for 7:30 PM but I don't think we actually were seated until about 8.   Service was great, but I am mostly referencing the server and the busser. Our server was extremely knowledgeable, as he had been there since the opening. The busser assigned to the section was definitely on top of it for refilling water, which is always so appreciated.  The price is pretty standard for a place on the strip (average about $30-$50 an entree). They did have other options though for more of a set "tasting" type of menu. You could choose an appetizer, a side, an entree and a dessert. We didn't go with this option but it was nice that it was available.  I still give a 4/5 because I wasn't completely blown away by the food. I thought it was great, but maybe there wasn't anything particularly spectacular about it for me. I got the scallops and it came with veggies.

H8bU4ffiOLjPUEWRkRYUPg.text: Giada De Laurentiis your Giada Vegas used to be a family favorite, well guess what? No more chica.    1.   Hostesses are the worst, so rude, condescending and why bother confirming and asking where you want to be seated to not seat where you asked AND seat us in THE WORST seat?  2.   Your servers are great, however the rush job like drive thru dining where the bussers toss the food on your table it so tacky.   Ruins the moment, esp at the worst table.  3.  Your food quality is excellent, however your pricing is hysterical.    4.  The desert cart was one of our favorite things, tonight we learned it only comes with the tasting menu? Ewe, no, horrible idea honey bunny.   5.  Your GM is ASLEEP at the wheel, this has been a hot mess like this the last 18 months.    We have tried and tried, it used to be a family favorite and business first choice for entertaining (we live in vegas).  Tonight was my last time in your used to be awesome but now is horrendous place.   There are so many excellent choices in this small town packed with top tier chefs.   You should shut it down.   There's no fixing a hole in the boat this large.  ciao!

Gf63JzWoICk-LTgEb2n6cA.text: We had dinner on 6/23 and there was two of us. We like the decor and the ingredients of he dishes. But......... The small tables are too close to each other. The execution of the dishes needs work.  Salad had too much dressing. Noodles were cold. Shrimps were over cooked. Breads were not even warm. Bacon wrapped dates were over cooked. Looking back to the negative reviews, these problems have not been addressed. John D, do you see that the restaurant only has 3.5 out of 5 stars on Yelp. This is not good for a celebrity chef restaurant. What is your plan to improve the rating?  p.s. we did not order dessert!

5mhIqBTgAErUvKfCxPgidw.text: Fan of the tv show. Not of the restaurant.   If you get a window seat or close to it there is a great view of the strip. The complimentary bread platter is good, and customer service is mostly top notch.   Why did I give it 2 stars?  I think I expected more flavor?  The portion sizes are what you'd expect of a fine dining restaurant, so no surprise there. But it's not your typical Italian. Everything is lightly seasoned (no garlic, if that's what you're looking for).   I have mixed feelings about the decor- it's sexy chic, but I also felt like the entire place was just a shop to buy some branded merchandise, including the napkins in the bathroom. We get it- we're eating at Giada's.   Now for the real reason I gave it 2 stars:  my meal was underwhelming to say the least.  After the food was served to our table, our waiter stopped by only once, if he had come by again I could've told him that something was off about my meal- the chicken cacciatore.  I did mention this to the man who cleared our plates, virtually the whole dish was untouched- there was a "scent" to the chicken.  Regardless I tried to be a good sport, but I've been throwing up since eating that meal. You guys might say--you're in Vegas, come on. But the reality is that I don't drink, and I didn't have anything else to eat after that meal.  I guess I expected more from such a popular chef, but I won't be returning or recommending to anyone else.   For that kind of money, you have a million other options for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken cacciatore

SFDtGPFpGC4yAinxCexLtA.text: We had an amazing experience here. We were seated on time. The dining room is definitely upscale with great views. Our cocktails, a cosmo and a destroyer were wonderful. We started with bacon wrapped dates and shrimp cocktail (huge). Both were very good. Next were lemon spaghetti with shrimp and ravioli. Outstanding! We topped it off with lemon ricotta cookies, which were out of this world. Can't wait to go back!

ZveaXDC8Du1493gyN5fmFg.text: This was a True 5-Star experience despite no Giada sighting....HaHa just kidding. Me and a co-worker came over here for dinner and was a very short walk from our hotel the Elara by Hilton. When we arrived and this is a little secret we learned. The wait was well over an hour and just as she told us I saw a couple getting up from the bar and yes it's open seating. So that was a huge score and you can order the full menu at the bar. After immediately being seated our super duper friendly bartender Katie greeted us and got us going on our drinks. After a short wait with drink in hand we knew exactly what we wanted. We started with the fresh assorted olives and marinated grilled artichokes. Both of these were so good and the fact we were hungry these didn't last long. Now I am not much of a bread eater but there hot bread served with assorted butters and dipping oils was outstanding.   For dinner I had the Italian fried chicken served cattoire style and best way to say it is basically deconstructed chicken cattoire and this dish was amazing. I ate every last bite of it and cleaned the plate. Has to be one of the best fried chicken dishes I have ever had. My co-worker had the lobster ravioli's and said the same thing about how delicious they were. We also split up some crispy brussel sprouts that were also so delicious and I am sure if you are reading this all the way through the theme of delicious. That's really it in a nutshell this place was amazing hands down an excellent meal all the way around.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Theses artichoke hearts were amazing
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lo6IjpG2Bhh0_5-1Mhsgtg.text: Have been trying to reach out to John as requested over the past week and no luck on getting a reply unfortunately. I was really hoping that when I got a reply it would mean I would head back after sending a lengthy "thank you for taking the time to reach out about our awful experience" review, but no such luck.

d7AbMFzxPnrjUXg7M5YvRQ.text: THE best Italian on the strip! Almost never give 5 stars, this will be the only 5 star in my 10 years coming to Vegas. Every dish has Giada lemon zest you see on her shows. Lobster Ravioli was filled with minced lobster, claw bits cooked aldente. Perfect Italian service. Bread is like a olive oil roll with oregano. Arugula salad had 2 shrimps that was succulent and full of flavor... without heavy dressing.

J5xxTrh6CK24rlBvfQ7QhQ.text: On my previous trip to Las Vegas me and my girlfriend decided we wanted to celebrate our valentines day dinner at Giada's. After walking and seated by the window with the view of the strip, we both fell for this place.   The servers were all very nice and made a great wine suggestion. Now the food, if there's one word I could use to describe the meal we ate it's simply: UNIQUE. The quality of everything is great, and 5 star. But the flavors you're experiencing are something you've never had before. Bacon wrapped dates and chicken meatballs were both very great in their respective ways. The pasta was amazing however, didn't enjoy the lemon contrast with the cheese. And that lamb chop was more like a filet which was outstanding. All in all it's a very fun dining experience that I recommend to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb chops
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti with prawns

_NB8FAAPZtORmEtxLrHEjA.text: I have always been a fan of Giada, and couldn't wait to try her namesake restaurant.   My boyfriend took me to Vegas for my birthday since it's one of my favorite cities. We've been many times, and have dined at many places on and off the Strip. For my birthday meal I chose Giada since we haven't been and it has been on my list for while. I really would love to give 4 or 5 stars, but I just can't. I think perhaps Giada should revisit the restaurant and make sure that everything is still running to standard. Because if my experience is the standard, then maybe I can't say I'm a fan of hers any more. I'll start with the cons so this review can end on a somewhat positive note.   The areas of opportunity: I ordered a half dozen oysters and they were borderline gross. I love oysters in all forms and these were large and didn't taste fresh and had toppings that tried to mask the state of the oysters. I didn't enjoy the jelly stuff they called "mignonette pairings". It was straight up a waste of $23. I couldn't even finish them. And I inhale oysters. Maybe I should have orders the Oyster Rockefeller instead. For my entree I chose lobster ravioli. Also a waste of $36. I guess I was picking all the wrong dishes that night. It was oily and coagulated so quickly. The pasta was undercooked and was hard. The lobster filling was not particularly memorable. And I found a lobster shell that I almost swallowed.   The things I enjoyed: the decor was lovely. The bread course was good. The butter was nice and soft. Nothing worse than hard cold butter. The ricotta crostini was ok. My boyfriend chose it and he loved it. He also loved the seared scallop dish that he selected for his entree (but $40 for 4 scallops?!). The side of broccolini was the highlight of the meal. So that should help sum up my feelings about the food.    It was my birthday and I noted that on my reservation. They didn't encourage us to order any desert or offer a birthday treat. Only when I redeemed my yelp check-in, then they gave me two cookies and wrote happy birthday on the plate. Perhaps my worst birthday dinner experience ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoyed the bread course.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half dozen oysters. Overpriced and not good.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broccolini was the only thing that was outstanding.

4tREH7nHBUYPGEKUWHDROQ.text: Food was decent, but only decent, not great. Shrimp was so hard and over cooked, pasta was far from al dente more chewy and mushy, everything was just lukewarm despite them telling me the plates were "really hot", i moved the plates with my hands while they looked at me terrified, not hot at all, i could go on and on but mainly the worst was that the service severely lacked.  I was very sad that our waitress seems to be annoyed the entire meal.  Not sure what her problem was, but she should have stayed home or chosen another job.  Because of her, I'm not interested in returning. Sorry giadas, there's so many great restaurants to choose from and service literally is everything, you lost me. I was embarrassed for bringing anyone there, embarrassed for Giadas and the namesake and embarrassed for wasting my time.  Who is in charge? Why? Change or shutter.

jFQo_zvXkZ3AlpBJPYSAeQ.text: Glad I got to try but no need to come back. The wait was long even with a long standing reso and it was not that busy. The photo booth at the front was cute but took terrible, grainy pics. Good for a laugh though! Limited menu for lunch. I think they really push the pre made, costly tasting menu but I cannot eat that much at a time and I never eat dessert. So, not worth it for me. There is a limited other menu so we both ordered the cannoli (crab). This was incredible.  The plate and serving dish were nice and hot. Took forever to come out though.  Our server was beyond bad.  Now, he did bring out the Yelp check in prosecco. That was good, better actually than my $ peach bellini! No bread plate that I had been so looking forward to from pics. No water refills.  No offer of cheese or anything to grate onto the pasta. C'mon! This is a beautiful, higher end spot! As we were on our last bite, the waiter did offer to take care of us with a few little pieces of flat bread to eat our sauce with. Then, he had the nerve to later charge us for it!! Man.. it was indeed tasty bread though. Well seasoned and fresh bits. The view though... we did get a window seat and a great view of the strip. Service will keep us from returning but I will be remaking Giada's cannoli dish at home! Love her tea towels too and have to figure out a way to order a couple of those. And her plates. We had been really looking forward to this and due to service, it was a bit of a let down.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canelonni (crab) 5/5! Service suffers a bit though
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute tea towels! I want!

CvCZ01Mneuzga2zqMsE23Q.text: The best scallops I ever did have.  Service was pretty phenomenal from the get-go. We made a reservation but arrived a half hour early. The table wasn't ready yet, so one of the waitresses had us chill on the couch and took drink orders while we waited.   The scallops were $50 with tax and tip included. The plate came with 4 scallops and some mashed potatoes smeared in between. Somehow, I found the meal quite filling, like perfect portion. I don't know if the price gave a placebo effect but I thought the scallops were SOO GOOD. Flavorful but not over-flavored, with a pinch of something spicy. The aesthetic of the restaurant also made me feel so pampered and fancy.  I would definitely recommend the experience!

GiqSArEgwIFQEvaJ7oupgA.text: What to eat: the charcuterie platters are very plentiful, the fried chicken cacciatore. Skip the gigantic cacio e pepe-- it's visually appealing but not the best version I've had.   This is a very pretty restaurant with a nice view of the strip. It definitely sets a Vegas mood: opulent and big. The prices are extremely high.

jizFMnCnl4qYt2PZ60Ycmw.text: Horrible service !  Salad full os spring mix ! Not worth it . Took like 20 minutes to get a waiter ask for a server they walk away i had to go to the bar to get someone's attention seem that she didn't care not an apology from noone !  I guess its not a five star restaurant !

JYkPJQw9GJlTQNEeyg4-4w.text: Overall it was pretty good and my party enjoyed their meals. Server was friendly, but took a while to check on our table for drink refills.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian fried chicken

5Pb_7Vb2qR0VjXL7VBnlNg.text: Although the food was okay, my total experience at this restaurant was horrible.  We had reservations for brunch at noon and were seated promptly.  I should have known something would go wrong as we were seated in the back in a narrow hallway going to the private room.  However there was a window so I thought it was okay.  We ordered the tasting menu which included the pastry cart, salad, entree and dessert. The pastry cart came, we made our choices and after we finished the salad car came to serve us our salads.  Then we waited...and waited....and waited.  About 30 mins later our waiter came by and said he had checked on our order and it should be out soon.  "Perfection takes time" was his comment.  15-20 mins later I waved hum down and asked where is our food?  It as more than an hour after we had started.  He said he would check again and that he had mentioned it to the manager.  A few minutes later the manager stopped by and apologized and said they couldn't locate our tickets in the back.  Something about 2 of the 3 printers not working.  At any rate, they were now making our food.  He also said that he didn't want the customers having such a bad experience so he would pay our bill.  We thanked him and our food eventually showed up.  After dessert, our waiter brings our bill and leaves it.  Imagine my surprise when I looked at it and they were charging us our full amount.  We tried to track down the waiter and/or manager but either were to be found.  We gave up and just left a tip ( hopefully they share tips as the other servers were courteous) and left the restaurant.  Overall worst experience ever at restaurant.  Would be no stars but at least food was okay.  Serious communication issues with wait staff, kitchen, and management.  Not recommending to anyone.

p7-Ww5Ii4kAzn6BpAE5_Sw.text: The food was absolutely delicious and the service was top notch! Our server, Andrew, made us laugh all night and provided awesome service. The food was unbelievable.  I had the fried chicken with a side of broccolini and ...wow! Delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken and broccolini.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buccatini

mSjf8bH60PKEOkl0JZJZjQ.text: This was our first time dining at Giadas.  The last time we had visiting Vegas it was still being built. I've been looking forward to this night for over a year!  My first impressions were this place is absolutely stunning! The open air kitchen with all the cooking stations really showed you how authentic her food really is. The decor and everything was incredible!! The window view was worth every single penny!  Our server, Cliff- I cannot being to tell you how fantastic he was. He has great menu knowledgeable, he answered all our questions even as odd as they were. He spent time getting to know us and what brought us to Vegas. He genuinely cared for us ever step of our meal. This was the best 2 hours of my life.   In talking with Cliff, he knew how excited I was to just be there, and on our way out he provided us giadas favorite cookies to go AND a signed copy of the menu. I literally couldn't tip him or thank him enough for this. The only thing that could top it, is meeting Giada herself.  Cliff--you're absolutely amazing and probably the best server anywhere in the world I've ever had!! Thank you again!

e9peuMc-NKwT8efOuJQSng.text: Foodies will love this restaurant because of the different flavors and textures. Service is very good...except (could be funny). I asked for extra bread and our buser(Andre) went to check and said no more bread tonight. So, upon my cousins insistence to ask our server.  Well, our server told the buser and the buser came over and said...sir I said there is no more bread tonight.  Woooooo, we laughed but thought wow scolding huh.   Funny but kind of not.

-m8KIhX_K5syLUfDXS0Vmg.text: I had high expectations for Giada's given her success but I was extremely disappointed with the restaurant.  The ambiance was the only nice thing about the place.  The calamari was HORRIBLE. The batter on it was disgusting and dry, and I did not like the sauce it came with either.    I also had the seared tenderloin crostini, quite disappointing as well.  Not fulfilling and small portion.  Was not a fan of the rock salt on it either.  I would not come here again.

bjhbMDn9ZzpXMU-zanRigg.text: The first time we came to Giada was about a year ago and we ate lunch. We got small plates like the orzo meatballs and ricotta flatbread. It was delicious and I highly recommend.   Last night we came for dinner and it was just alright. I would recommend a lunchtime visit instead. I got the beet salad which was beets, a little green and not much else. Hubby got pasta that was again just so so. The best part of the meal was the drink which was a champagne and Campari mix. Not sure how, but I ended up drinking three.

QmNdWjb1jD5TPOZxHDgzZg.text: I've had my eye on this restaurant for a while, and finally got to go tonight - it exceeded all expectations. We usually only get to go to "fine dining" establishments on special occasions, so this was such a nice treat. The entire staff was attentive, friendly, and helpful. I cannot say enough, how friendly and amazing everyone working there was. Our waitress, Nancy, was just awesome! She really made a great experience for us, from start to finish. To start, we had the gorgonzola dolce and the prosciutto de parma. Both were so delicious and presented very well. There was much more prosciutto than I expected, which was a nice surprise. For an entree, we shared the chicken cacciatore, which is plated for 2 people. It was 4 large pieces of chicken, so we still had some to take home. The chicken was so juicy, and the skin was just crispy enough to complement it perfectly. Our personal favorite part of the meal, however, was the side dish of potatoes. We were absolutely hooked after one bite, and would highly recommend them to anyone going there. Overall AMAZING experience with not a single complaint to be had.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies we received complimentary for checking in on Yelp!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left to right: chicken cacciatore for 2, potato side dish
