Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m2WSOLPDV2PtsYfVXy1qGA.text: Beautiful restaurant and excellent service, but mediocre food and slow kitchen.   Came here for brunch and was immediately struck by the beautiful, airy, gracious atmosphere. I loved the furnishings and decor. It felt like we were in Giada's extra large sitting/dining room.  Took awhile for dishes to come out after ordering (maybe 30 min).   Ordered the Sunrise Polenta Waffle. The sunny side eggs and waffle were speckled with pancetta and chives, but they were quite flavorless without syrup.The bechamel sauce added nothing flavor or texture wise. Felt a little sick after eating this because I literally had to drench everything in syrup to flavor it.   Tried my companion's blueberry muffin. It was grainy and tasted nutritious. Not my favorite muffin, but better than the waffle. Also tried a bit of the lemon cookie and chocolate cookie. The lemon cookie was too sweet. The chocolate cookie had a nice dark chocolate after taste, but I wouldn't pay money for it.   The plating for everything was lovely. The service was attentive, really loved our waitress Erin. However despite the beauty of this place, the food isn't worth the price or the calories.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flavorless Sunrise polenta waffle - with pancetta and chives sprinkled in the waffle and the sunny side eggs.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NMtwkKAMJDupFj9Ct_TkLA.text: I visit Las Vegas for work every few weeks, and Giada has become my go-to dinner spot. Never have I had an experience less than stellar.  The service is wonderful and the food equally as impressive. The servers give honest recommendations, from which the Orzo Chicken Meatballs have become my favorite. I also love the Bucatini.   The restaurant space itself is very beautiful and welcoming. Dining here is great!

QjT_i3HCNsVw2XJStHFLuw.text: The customer service here is amazing, especially Valentino! He knows how to make someone feel at home. Please ask for him because you won't be disappointed! Great environment as well! Awesome music, warm and inviting decor. You can really feel Giada's hospitality in this place! I love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IXzZ_ASfMSKljxNgz0prSw.text: I normally ramble on in my reviews but for this one I'm keeping it short and to the point.  This is the absolute worst meal I have ever had in Vegas or anywhere else for that matter. It was such a disappointment because I love Giada's shows and I was looking so forward to eating there.   The menu selection wasn't impressive!!  The portions were small!!  The prices were outrageous!!  The food was horrible!!  The service was forgettable!!  Don't waste your time or money

rGNyW0X12vkpMDATJR0r5w.text: This is a very nice restaurant.  The food was good and the selections were good too.  It's a bit on the noisy side.  Our waiter was very efficient but could smile a bit more.

PWb4_j8fMNm1prEizoDy7A.text: I wanted to be completely blown away by this restaurant, but sadly we weren't.   First things first, the view is amazing and the restaurant itself is very well appointed. Definitely 5-star worthy there.  Where it starts to go downhill right off the bat is the service. SLOOOOOW. And not friendly or knowledgeable. I know it's supposed to be a slow Italian dinner reminiscent of the old country, but our server was really nowhere to be found on several occasions for long periods of time. Not helpful when you've dropped your fork on the ground and need a replacement while your food sits and gets cold.   The food itself was good, but of course, the portions are small and very highly priced, which wasn't a surprise....just don't go there when you're ravenous.You'll leave ravenous.  We had a party of four and were able to taste test each others meals. Nothing that blew our skirts up, but it was definitely worth trying. My husband and I had the Pesto Pea Tortellini and Bucatini Pomodoro. Finished off with a cute Hazelnut Espresso.   Three stars is all I could muster. Will not be returning, but glad we tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LpIHN0c2dgTb7siy6dXblg.text: We did not have reservations, but were nicely directed to the bar/lounge area and told that we could order meals there. The bartender was extremely nice and attentive. The bread board was yummy and hit the spot, along with our specialty cocktails. I loved the scallops with Brussels sprouts on the side. It is a really beautiful space with nice, friendly staff and good food. I did not find the prices exorbitant. On our way out, we stopped by the free photo booth. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

n2d8Nx9warhiZ6RCXE1xgQ.text: Went here for Mother's Day brunch with my daughter. We where able to secure a seat by the open windows - definitely a must on a warm day. We ordered from the standard menu and everything was wonderful. Loved the light salad dressing, pizzette was the perfect size with very tasty sauce. My daughter loved her frittata. But the best was the roll around cart where you build your own brownie dessert - for only $5.  Overall the food was awesome. Fun specially drinks. And a great ambiance. Can't wait to try it again on our next trip to Vegas!

WEnemgFuS3zG2NaUoreLGQ.text: After watching Giada on food network I was excited to finally try out her food. The price was very high for the smaller tapas style but to be expected.   The waitress was very attentive and explained the menus well. She told us to have fun with the menu which we did. We ordered plenty of food a good variety as well and definitely weren't disappointed!   Ended with ricotta cookies and they melt in your mouth!  I highly highly recommend trying this place out. Don't be afraid of pairings or price. Just go for it and you won't be disappointed.

-zKXaBPlnu1hGlYeBSV4ug.text: Definitely the highlight of our trip. Amazing service, location, and food. If I even considered dropping a star it would be for a the small menu selection, but everything I tasted looked and tasted outstanding.   I had the Sunrise Polenta waffle (a must try). Crispy waffle, with slightly savory taste and served with house infused syrup and beschamel. My wife had the salmon eggs benedict. Both were filling and so flavorful. My wife also had the Dolce Vita, a great breakfast cocktail with elderflower.   Our server/barmistress, Molly was bright, cheery and made recommended all the dishes we had. 100 points for knowing the menu, and great service.   They had these comfy seating, too and a great view of the Bellagio fountains.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise polenta waffle.

TLb1HyqHtkSCtcpcY1Pkog.text: First trip here... our entire experience was basically ruined by our completely terrible server (Turley). We sat down and he walks by, doesn't introduce himself, slaps down an iPad and says "appetizers," and walks away. He never offered to explain the menu, we had to ask for water refills multiple times (different servers pitched in, they probably felt bad for us), didn't offer to show us the dessert menu... I think it was just him because other tables seemed to be enjoying their service. The food and atmosphere was excellent but the entire experience was tainted by how poor the service was.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QecvF_KkZwG8Va89oZriiA.text: Came for brunch and food tasted good, I had the grilled cheese that was a bit lacking on the cheese part and mostly bread. The thing that really got me was I ordered a diet soda that came in an ice filled glass and a splash of soda...when the bill came I was charged $6, I'm sorry but that's a bit ridiculous for a mouthful of soda. We had a seat near the window and the view was nice but probably wouldn't go back here

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese, little stingy on the cheese part
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6 soda

9o-RsSzdK4qiEElYoTtuSQ.text: We visited Giada for my daughters 21st birthday! We had 14 in our party, with a reservation at 7pm on a Sunday. We had no issue walking right in, the ambience is gorgeous. The staff of hostess', waiters and food runners were all extremely friendly and attentive. I wish there was a bigger word than phenomenal to describe it, because that's what it was! Everything from the cocktails, appetizer of cheese and meat plates and our dinner were to die for! We will definitely return. Thank you for having us, and the wonderful experience my family and I had!

BC9X7IDDdLL8P3sfnGi0JQ.text: I have nothing but praise! From the moment we walked in, the staff was outstsnding! We arrived about 20 minutes early so we had time to get a drink at the bar. My wife had a glass of Pinot Grigio that she liked.  I ordered a specialty drink called "Serpico'. If you like Manattans, you will love this drink. It was $15.00 but was generous and lasted halfway through dinner. It was a great drink.  We both ordered frito misto for appitizer. It was the best we ever had. We should have ordered just one and split it as it was a lot to eat.   Entrees were Lobster Ravioli for her and Rigatoni Bolognese for me. Both were outstanding!  We skipped dessert but they all looked amazing. I would definitely go back!

0BWayPJaJXGhCEHshLR22Q.text: Me and the wife were looking for a place to have a nice dinner while out on the town.  We went with the dinner tasting menu which was good but I don't know about $300 good.   The best dish was the lemon spaghetti.  I definitely wouldn't get the tasting menu again. I would have preferred to choose my own appetizer vs the tasting menu which offers an anti-pasti platter to share but they decide what comes on it. Its hit or miss. Ours came with bacon wrapped dates which I would never have ordered for myself and I didn't really like it.  The filet I got was the tiniest steak I have ever seen in my life. Not that I was expecting a 10oz portion but still. My wife had the chicken ciacciatori style and only ate half. She didn't seem overly impressed by it.  Service was excellent. Nice ambiance and an awesome view.

12x8IBmPvLUK7H1V-N_2AA.text: Tonight we had dinner here at Giada , we order there set menu, food was great , service was great , only disappointed with the reservation request ,we requested window seat for celebration my birthday, but the hostess didn't seem like care , they put us a none window seat and doesn't even let the food server know that is a celebration, when we were done , walking out of the restaurant, there were 3 hostess standing there , but no one will greet you good bye or have a great evening

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LbUe16MeFwwraKsa3dSUBw.text: Fair warning this review is about customer service:  Being an avid foodie... I was so excited to have purchased a groupon for Giada -44$ voucher for 65$ breakfast, dinner or lunch for two with complimentary champagne. I am a huge food network fan- and this venue was on top of my list of places to visit in Vegas-so purchasing a groupon was a great idea.  Located on the second floor of the Cromwell, the exterior entrance of the restaurant is beautiful!  My colleague canceled on me due to a medical emergency. So with 2 days left for the groupon expiry, I decided to head for dinner here alone. Upon making a reservation in advance, I was told by the manager at Giada that the voucher could not be used if there was no second person. Am I really going to eat 65$ worth of food? Reality check , probably not. There was no attempt to make up for customer service, or even try to work out an alternative! Lastly, no apology! But she said  I can dine at Giada without the voucher..IF I WANT to. Why would I dine at a restaurant when I have already prepurchased a voucher? Name me one person who will have an appetite after this quality of service.   It's too bad -these celebrity chefs should be aware of the poor management that goes on with their business -especially considering this is Giada first resto in Vegas! I have been to many other food network restaurants- this venue is by far the worst rated in service-especially lack of accommodating clients that will actually spend money on food. I politely left and said I would deal with the matter with Groupon.   Too bad and no thank you, I am very content as a foodie to try out restaurants that actually care about their clients enjoying their fine dining experience! the restaurant manager, not the servers (who were great Btw) has a lot to work on if they want to earn a better reputation on the strip!

qJYQjYYf7jMHKsnmmdwMww.text: This is normally one of our favorite places in Vegas. This time was disappointing. Nothing worth taking a picture of! The lobster ravioli is normally delicious but tonight it was too sweet. Not sure why they added sugar to the sauce. It would have been better just with butter and lemon. Also the bar tender must be new. The signature cocktail, the serpico, is usually amazing. Today it tasted like a cheap Long Island iced tea. Also it took 20 minutes to get bread. Definitely get the crispy Brussels sprouts. That was the best. I'm sure I'll be back, but today was pretty disappointing.

F92TIBHm8GzrXaFDBqG_Yw.text: Everything from champagne to our brunch was fantastic. The view of the strip is by far the best of any restaurant on Las Vegas Blvd. I would highly recommend Giada for any meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fnGvdp0I0DaduMkDFrhWog.text: We dined here last month.  The hostess was very welcoming and seated us right away even though we were 30 minutes early.    Our server, Luis E. was very professional,  helpful  and informative.     We ordered... Prosecco La Marca (2)-Crisp and delicious! Caprese salad-Delicious! Corn Arancini  Spaghetti lemon with shrimp  Branzino   Spaghetti lemon was too al dente and there was zero lemon flavor.   The shrimp were huge, fresh and delicious.   But since the pasta portion wasn't good, I doubt I'll order it again.   Branzino was a bit too fishy (not very fresh).  We took couple of bites but that was it.  If it was fresh, I would have gobbled it up as I love Branzino.   The service was great but the food wasn't good enough to come back.

V6pNx8ZLY4eluc5_d8jUkg.text: Well it is a good thing my husband brought me here on my birthday to sit at the bar and enjoy lunch. I would have given the place a 3 star review for my previous few dinner stops but this lunch session bumped it up a notch!  Giada has alway been one of my favorite TV personalities. Fast forward through a turbulent dinner when the place first opened up and "Bam" you have a four star wonderful review.   The bartender was super attentive and brought some fun drinks out for my birthday lunch. I told him I like tart and refreshing drink and he got creative! He also brought me a yummy dessert to celebrate which was very thoughtful.  The best dish? Grilled cheese with the crispy zucchini side. I was so happy that the husband told me that zucchini was amazing because it turned out to be my favorite food item of the whole trip!   If you are trying to decide on a lunch spot on the strip, stop by here and eat at the bar... You should not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. G drink special
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with the amazing zucchini side. Seriously, get that side!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday treat-thanks!

Yo71vzvb1K4ZgkOTZw9AnQ.text: This restaurant is always delicious and the view is spectacular. So far I've always had great service.

GzLmpEvIs42M4vNrQP6rZw.text: Before coming here I was a bit scared because there were so many mixed reviews. I'm glad I didn't allow them to sway my opinion. Excellent food and drinks! The flavors were magnificent and drinks were great!  I started with Oyster Crudo which was just a really refreshing dish. The fresh oysters here you will love if that's your thing. A bit on the pricey side if your trying to budget but you're in Vegas so no need for that. I followed that up with a romaine salad. Tasty and crisp. Exactly what you want in a salad!   For my main course I had the lam chops and lemon potato. (could be wrong on the name of the potato) Best lamb I've ever had in my life. Melt in your mouth with a beautiful succulent array of flavors. I wanted to order three more chops but figured I should pace myself. If you like lamb or want to try it for the first time do it! You will not be disappointed!  The only "bad" part of the service was the server was a bit slow but they were busy so no big deal. Also wish Giada was there but maybe next time I can only hope and pray lol.

gJKVNYnxbsgLFtLCer9l9Q.text: I normally don't do something like this but our experience at Giada's was so disappointing  We were there on Sat evening July 6th to celebrate my granddaughters' 21st Birthday  We had 7:30 reservations & were seated without 2 of our guest. To start out our waiter was extremely rude. Our guest arrive at 8:30 because of traffic on the Strip. When I asked our waiter for menus & place settings for our guest he approached the manager. The manager came over to our table & said they could not be served because they needed  the table. The table next to us was empty & we had already ordered our desert. He proceeded to ask us to move into the lobby with our desert. I was never so embarrassed. We continued to discuss the situation but after ruining my granddaughters' dinner we just walked out. I will never go back to a Giada Establishment again. I have never been so embarrassed in all my life

qmyQ6VQK5TtWuMABC6O7CQ.text: Wow.  I wasn't expected to be impressed, but I definately was.  The service was impeccable, but so was the food.  We shared an arugula salad and the the tomahawk steak.  Both were well seasoned and a mouth of delight.  My only caution would be tge antipasto tuna.  It was very very salty.  We could not finish it l.  Other than that I would say definately eat her.

xCMvWLFQsZ9tRcIWocaFmg.text: I took my mom and grandma here because they love tv personalities but their taste in food is pretty questionable. Giada was supposed to be a sort of compromise so we didn't have to go to the Guy Fieri restaurant.   We came for lunch on a Sunday and the space is beautiful, we were able to make a reservation day of- though the place was mostly empty, and they had a yelp check in offer... but unfortunately that only made things awkward as the server then made sure to sort of pester us about writing a 5-star review and then mentioning him but then seemed to give about 65% effort in actually earning that rating as our waters remained empty for most of the meal and our dessert took about 35 minutes and was basically stale cookies.   We each got one of their boozy juice drinks. Mine was good, my mom's lemonade strawberry something was wayyyyy too sweet.   I got a salad because I wasn't super hungry. It had kale, faro, and some other healthy stuff but overall was just fine. My grandma got yogurt bc that's basically all she likes to eat bc she's obsessed with eating healthy even though she probably weighs 75 lbs. My mom got the pre-fixe lunch, which was 3 courses and a dessert. I tried a bit of everything and was super underwhelmed. Her pasta was room temperature at best and nothing was really a standout beyond the beautiful view of the Bellagio fountains and the photo booth you can take a picture with at the entrance.   Maybe they're better for dinner but for what we had I was glad I didn't bother with putting on make-up or effort for the day because it was not meal worth a lot of to-do.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tasting menu
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Setting
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies

XbcieBtMn3oiNYTsXp7bZw.text: Everything ordered was delicious!  Our server, Rebecca, was outstanding.  She was funny, attentive and accommodating.  The items on the charcuterie board were yummy and the waffle (served with syrup and bechamel) was crispy but also melted in your mouth.  After having such a great experience at brunch, we returned for dinner the next day and I had the best scallops EVER (on a bed of creamy crab risotto).  Even the bread (served with mascarpone, capers and other condiments) was mouth watering.  The attention to detail was noticed.  Highly recommended!

0Go6GSSzr2Jrlch2wTb-IQ.text: I was really excited to try this as I'm a fan of Giada but the food was just okay... especially compared to other places on the strip. I was here for brunch so maybe dinner menu is better?  The toilet seats in the bathroom were up and they touched the rim of the glass when pouring water. This stuff is relatively fine for a normal place but this is supposed to be fine dining? Very disappointed

E1fd8_C_7TvH9MkAbgcBQQ.text: I WAS Excited to be Finally Going Here...   I have been wanting to go to this restaurant since it opened but was never able to get a reservation. This time I planned in advance.  The place is beautiful! And, I had a nice window view of the strip.  The hostess was friendly as she chatted with me as I walked through the place.    The server introduced himself and gave me the menu. Later his assistant/ busser introduced himself and asked if I had questions. I did... he vaguely answered my first and then walked away.   The options here are good with portions on the smaller size.  I was craving some pasta with a steak. They said no pasta sides or half orders were available. So I switched to pasta as an entree with a very small pizza (perfect for me) and a salad.  They then swooped in with a bread board with lots of accompaniments (if I'd known that was coming I probably wouldn't have gotten a different appetizer).  The focaccia was fantastic!  The Romain salad was good too.  At first I thought it was underdressed but as I continued to eat... I found it perfect.  Good so far... the pizza was satisfactory but I found the crust underwhelming.  Again, it was the perfect size as an appetizer.   The pasta dish though was not good.  I ordered fettuccini with lobster, bacon and a lite tomato-cream sauce.  The fettuccine pasta was fresh (not dried). The sauce, however, was smoked... and I mean SMOKED. So much so, I couldn't taste the morsels of lobster and never saw any bacon.  I ate about half and could do anymore... even though I did want something more.  I left before dessert.  Service here was good... my server was very attentive.  Food: underwhelming especially for the price.  So, now I've tried Giada, on to other places.

J9gEENYxYNVPe5_-xkpAmw.text: Omg so amazing! Great view of the strip - bellagio water show!!!  The anti pasta appetizer was delicious. The olive bread and specifically the focaccia bread  was amazing!  The risotto with scallop was perfection!  we had the pasta served in the cheese wheel...amazing (but add a protein to accompany it as it's a lot of cheese and pasta!). The arugula salad...amazing!!  The desserts...well we had them all!  AMAZing! Especially the chocolate hazelnut cake and the lemon ricotta cookies of course!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the antipasto platter

4PMwszTijsgrrQ9Tm2CFZA.text: Our Open Table reservation was honored an we were promptly seated by a window overlooking the Strip and the Bellagio fountains.  However why look outside when the inside of Giada's restaurant was so attractive and decorated in the classiest of ways.  We chose the Prix Fix menu, my wife choosing the salmon filet and I, the tomahawk pork chop.  Both were excellent.  Side dishes were a bit skimpy, but delicious. We were given a very small portion of rigatoni mushroom pasta that was also delicious, but you needed an electron microscope to see it.  Seriously, it was served in a big white dish with a small bowl center that contained about one cup of pasta. (Just one to share!) LOL!  The little desserts, (selected from a rolling dessert cart), were awesome as we could choose three each between the two of us.  Our server, Rocko, (from Italy), was undoubtedly the most helpful, knowledgeable, and nicest gentlemen we have had the pleasure of meeting.  You will truly be lucky if he is your server!  He seriously did everything to make us happy.  Giada's is not your bargain-basement restaurant.  It is classical fine dining, so don't be surprised at the bill. I believe our prix fix selections came to approx. $85/each.  Add pre-dinner cocktails plus beer and wine added to the tab and we were well over $200 for the two of us.  Rocko was so good he received a 25% tip!   We highly recommend Giada's, (AND ROCKO)!    P.S. - We liked it so much, we came back three nights later with the rest of our family.  Rocko's wing-man, Vincenzo (Vinny), took care of us and did an equally fantastic job.  Don't ask what the bill was!   We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Petite desserts
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocko, the best server ever!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk porkbchop

bc_hpp-WInb-Ljawi0DAfg.text: We were very excited to dine here. Unfortunately it did not meet our expectations. Food was mediocre at best. Likelihood to return 0 out of 5.

bbHg-N5z-HfT4NrjjFFw9Q.text: I had my first meal at Giada's a few days ago. I was treated to brunch by my family. From the moment we stepped in, service was wonderful. Our server Rebecca was so friendly and personable and had a wonderful attitude. It was very refreshing. The food! Everything we had was superb. We enjoyed our experience so much, a couple of us came back for dinner the next night. The dinner menu was different from brunch. More options. But the level of food and service was still extraordinary. I will definitely be back.

S6BXmY9iMEQHYn9_k2FNGg.text: Everything at Giadas seems to have been thought of. We had reservation but there was a 20 minute wait. When we walked into the restaurant, you felt a great vibe. The decor and placement of tables were great. We were lucky to get a table overlooking Bellagio and it was awesome to since it was at nighttime.   You can either order a pre arranged 4 meal dinner or get the different options you want individually.   We ordered a platter from the antipasti that had orzo meatballs, sweet peppers, marinated olives, and bacon wrapped dates. Their orzo meatballs had really great flavor. I also really liked their bacon wrapped dates but then again everything is awesome wrapped in bacon. The olives had amazing flavors.   I ordered spaghetti and some kind of meat sauce. It was the most incredible spaghetti I've ever had! Thick spaghetti with lots of awesome flavor. The meat sauce was also really good with some spicyness to it but not hot.   As the main dish I tried their rack of lamb. Very good, just enough seasoning yet still lots of lamb flavor.   We sadly didn't have any room for dessert of all this. This was the most amazing dining experience I've had, the service was superb and every detail was perfect. This is the only restaurant I've been to where they let you use an iPad to look over pictures of their dishes, how cool is that!  This place is quite popular, if you have a big party it's advisable to book at least several weeks in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best spaghetti I&#39;ve had such good flavor
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rack of lamb was very good.

yRq9UD8z4CZXAQGbbF0cuQ.text: I was here a year ago, it was awesome so I took my friend about 3 wks ago on a Sunday, our waiter Billy & all the staff we encountered were exceptionally friendly, knowledgeable about their menu & seemed genuinely happy! I love eating at upbeat beautiful restaurants & their seating with views of the strip are spectacular My son & I went for brunch on Sunday, our waitress Rebecca seemed rude & struggling to give the service that I received in my past visits. I was glad Billy was there, because our desserts arrived & our table had not been cleared, he came to help clear our table. I asked if Something was wrong with our waitress and they said, her help staff was not doing their job, still that's not an excuse for poor service & upsetting your customers. We had the brunch, everything was delightful! I can overlook someone having a bad day.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n0fVLAzecHZpt9kMU6eHmw.text: Really amazing experience. I read a lot of bad reviews so I was skeptical especially because I'n very picky, especially with 5 star restaurants. I'm a local and went with my girlfriends to celebrate publishing my first book. Really enjoyed the food, and our waiter was Tim, he was so nice and even wrote "congratulations" in chocolate sauce on my dessert plate. I got the bacon wrapped dates, Tricolored Salad, and the lemon potatoes. My friends ordered the Salmon and some Indian dish. All extraordinary! Yes it's VERY expensive, but typical for this type of venue. Our bill came out to $215, not including tip. That was for 3 people with 1 glass of celebratory moscato and a dessert to share. It's just as much as one would spend on the restaurants in Bellagio, but the view was beautiful, the decor was very clean, modern and beautiful as well. Wish some of the dishes were a little more resonably priced. But eh. It was all delicious and a very good experience. So much better than the other reviews made it out to be.

dRLxINn1wyUtDUUuY24GNQ.text: If you can get in it is worth the wait and the price...The charred octopus was a highlight appetizer and the mediterranian sea bass called bronzino is fantastic...Try some of their cheese plates too...Terrific strip view and our waiter Brian was top notch and made us feel like we were family...

LlHcljoRCAxan6Ar0bDeDg.text: Really bad experience at Giada.  We were excited to try the new breakfast menu. We arrived at 11am, were seated at a beautiful table with a fantastic view, asked about breakfast and were told they stopped serving breakfast 10 minutes ago.  First of all, the restaurant was not busy at all. They couldn't have made the tiniest exception for us and handed us a breakfast menu? We probably should have asked to see a manager but we were too shocked.  Second of all, Giada management hello... this is LAS VEGAS. We checked out of our room at The Cromwell at 11am (normal check out time) and walked right over to your restaurant, literally steps away. Why don't you at the very least extend breakfast until 11:30am to accommodate Cromwell guests who check out at 11am and would like to enjoy breakfast at Giada before starting their day?  Seriously poor service in our opinion. We won't be going back.

EztcyGQN6KlKPH9qd0isdQ.text: My husband and I are on our honeymoon here in Vegas and we ate at Giada's last night. I enjoyed the ambiance, it's very cozy and warm. We were seated as soon as we arrived, plus. It took a solid 10-15 minutes before a waiter came over, negative. Service was kind of slow from there on out. I didn't realize until the waiter told us that most of the items on the menu are designed for "tasting" which basically means all the portions are small as hell. My husband joked that's how Giada stays skinny but I digress. We decided to order the small antipasti platter for an appetizer which was exactly as follows, two bacon wrapped dates, two tiny crostini topped with a slice of beef tenderloin, and two different stuffed peppers which came to a total of 4 items on the plate and it was $26. My husband then had a mortadella pizza, which seemed to be the best value on the menu for $13. He had the tomato soup also. I had the tricolore salad consisting of arugula, prosciutto, dates and some other things that weren't overly memorable for $17. We then each had the Brazilian wagyu beef short rib dinner which was very delicious but we should've ordered one meal and shared it because it was a whopping $56 each and we both couldn't finish it. The bill came to $205. It's probably the only expensive meal we will have this trip. I just can't see spending that much money on portions like that and had I realized in advance it was a small portioned menu, I most likely would've skipped this place even though I love Giada.

eKFPbd9da_X73IG_NsrRsg.text: Although we showed up late for our reservation, the host staff greeted us kindly and seated us immediately at a beautiful table with a view of the strip. The wait staff was equally polite and professional.  We enjoyed the Contadina, Italian hash and pizza carbonara, each dish had a creative presentation, fresh taste and Italian style. We will be here again and next time will try for dinner.

mW8Przvz52os-MDPlIbLiw.text: Came here for breakfast on 4/23.  Party of 2 in a nice booth facing the strip.  The breakfast was very good, a bit expensive, but very tasty!  We both had the fresh squeezed juices, which although pricey - were delicious!!!  I had the sunrise polenta waffle.  Very big, egg on top, and filling.  Portion size was just fine for me.  I left full, but not stuffed.  Husband had the Italian hash - just OK - would try something else next time.  Not sure if the dinner menu is something I'd splurge on, but give it a go for breakfast!

9rROHoSH4ojyzIo5BjQisw.text: My wife and I recently went to Giada for our anniversary. We had requested a table by the window three months prior. When we showed up for our reservation they put us in a corner with barely any view. We informed the hostess of our disappointment, but were essentially ignored. That was by far the biggest complaint. A restaurant of this caliber should have been more accommodating. Our server was really good and informative, but I didn't like the way the server had to push a special three course meal that came with a pic of Giada and an autograph. Really?  Is this standard at a celebrity restaurant?  The food was very average.  Not the bang I was hoping for. Do yourself a favor and avoid the celebrity tourist trap restaurant. Not worth it.

rfsbHD_vhcMSLpprCOzblw.text: We sat at the bar for a late dinner. The hosts were welcoming and showed us to the bar. The restaurant is beautiful and has a wonderful view of the strip at night. The bartenders were nice and offered multiple suggestions and house favorites. The pappardelle was great and cooked to perfection. The roasted beet salad was super fresh and light.

QD7yGOA-xvZQkp5DvIWgfA.text: I would love to give this place at least 4 stars but there were a couple of problems that are hard to overlook.  I am a huge fan of Giada's and booked her restaurant 2 months ago, so looking forward to a great meal.  The hostesses were great and did honor the request for a window table, but it was half an hour after the reservation time.  No biggie because the room is comfortable and the view was fantastic.  The waiter was very good and tried his best to push the tasting menu, but we already knew what we wanted.  Here is the breakdown of dishes.  1.  Lobster Arancini- 8  Very good... red sauce was the best part. 2.  Shrimp Scampi- 8  Marscapone made this dish, but shrimp seemed of a lesser quality.  Polenta cake was perfect. 3.  Artchoke Soup- 10  What an amazing soup, great taste and texture. 4.  Pasta Fagiole- 10  My partner loved it. 5.  Lobster Ravioli-10  This was too delicious to describe, perfect dish. 6.  Rack of Lamb- 3  The pictures on Yelp make this dish look great, but our lamb was incredibly fatty.  The waiter said it was because it was Colorado lamb and I felt intimidated not to send it back.  Never again; there were only 4 tiny bites out of the whole dish.  The spinach served with it was delicious, though.      The worst part of it was the half hour wait between the soup course and the FAT of the Lamb course.  Way too long of a wait.  The server did say a couple of times that it would be right up, but never apologized for the wait.  That lamb dish was $45 for nothing... I want my money back!  Overall it was a decent experience, but not worth $240.  The bottles of wine start in the $50 range and go up from there.  There should be more reasonably priced options, especially in the Italian categories... been to Italy several times and even good wines are a bargain.  They are trying to hype this restaurant as more casual dining as if you were having dinner in someones home.  Somewhat pricey for a home cooked meal.    Probably would not return for dinner, but might try lunch sometime if Giada has some amazing paninis on the menu.  One more item of interest- We saw tank-tops, tee shirts, tennis shoes, shorts, midriffs, sandals and every other type of dress here.  Not sure there is a dress code.

nSBsJOGUEjPkYXg7PCE6zA.text: Six teachers from Orange County, CA, came in for a late lunch on Tuesday, July 14, 2015, at 2:00.  We shared the mouth watering Orzo meatballs, the flavorful mozzarella, the tasty olives, the delectable margherita pizza, and the heavenly chocolate tiramisu.   Our experience was excellent in every way and a highlight of our visit to Las Vegas!  The food was delicious, the atmosphere was calming, the decor was beautiful, and the service was awesome.  Thank you to our server, Stephanie, for making our afternoon at Giada's so wonderful!    Our only complaint was that Giada wasn't there!

d7suBXviFQbqe4np_3YMIw.text: Food was great. Can't bring your drinks in is reminiscent of 1950s Vegas. No other high end restaurant has similar restrictions - it's the little things that set you apart. I'll never go there again.

FBQv8NZ46eVZnT2zrXApjQ.text: The decor was wonderful...delightfully modern Italian, but very comfy.  The food was ok.  The bread disappointing....where was the REAL Italian bread?  Our waitress, Lauren was ok...a bit forced in her service... The food good but not spectacular and very pricey.  The wine by the glass was very good.  Would I go back? No.

tHkTWLCGIJuOBE6CGxsKUg.text: You're paying for the view - that space certainly can't come cheap. Food was fine - consistent. Nothing wowed me, which is troublesome at that price point. Great, knowledgeable staff but can't remember a single dish I ordered.

uMZ4vO9r04GLmCGOpsxy3A.text: Love Giada and love her place. Food was incredible. The ambiance was perfect for dinner. I need to try lunch there because I have heard its great. If its anything like dinner I am sure its amazing. I would recommend this to anyone looking for classic italian food with modern flair

od4Nc5uBFGhlGG466T8CWA.text: Was not able to eat here for lunch, they closed seating. Asked for next day an same thing happened despite perfect planning.

IZzXv3Arn-mlt5AEL_L8wQ.text: I came in for a late lunch at 10:30 Wednesday. After being asked to wait for 25 mins I was finally sat to an empty restaurant. Possibly three other tables.  They sat me without a menu so I sat for another 25 mins after asking a server within the first few mins. I was ready to walk out but wanted to try her food so I sat and waited. Finally my Italian hash arrived. The ingredients were fine but it had no seasoning. I never ask for salt n pepper but I def needed salt n pepper on this dish. Not a great meal. Terrible service. Pretty unimpressed.

HUAlBCxKrdQvvlQXK_kBWg.text: Very disappointing in every respect except service. We had a 7:30 pm reservation on a Tuesday night. We did not get our table before 8. The appetizers were average, the eggplant fries were way too oily. My friend's shrimp pasta was bland and the shrimp evidently not the freshest. My salmon was burned and the lentils and puree were simply confidential. All in all, not worth all the hype and the money we had to pay. There are way better restaurants in Vegas.

mICtr4gq5v9ClZWpQYeU1Q.text: Rude and unprofessional staff- hostess could be friendlier and server was downright unpleasant- (serious training needed)! Although appetizers were good they very small portions for the price. We waited over and hour for entree's. Lasagna left much to be desired, pizza average, sandwich and zucchini strings good but at the end of the day not enough to raise the rating. In the middle of lunch an alarm to leave premises was announced yet no explanation from staff. As we left we overheard that the kitchen was shut down because something exploded- restaurant only open for pizza. In the end 3 hour lunch for 3 people over $120- hmmm.

ZayW7ScB3w31OGyPAMZtTg.text: The most amazing dining experience of my life... Started with orzo meatballs and prosciutto plate and shared bucatini and lobster ravioli with the husband. Accompanied with an amazing Italian Pinot Grigio. The best part was Giada. It is so refreshing to see  chef come and take pride in her restaurant. She was super down to earth and took time to know her guests. I know the chances of seeing her here again are slim but we will be back again!

AfudgZFcDa4vwm0qWWI-qA.text: This place is my first and last time coming waited thirty minutes for drinks and a hour for food . Over price food at that , food not so good customer service sucks so bad OMG!!!! I mean who hired these people . The sad part is it was durning lunch and the place wasn't busy at all . Three tables for up and left because of the service !!

amEKAq5xRm4BeU-k7lNxbA.text: What a great surprise.  The rating for this restaurant should be much higher.  The decor,  view, and service were awesome.  Our waiter (John) was spot on and attentive, while having fun. Food: the wife and I had the meatballs (Marsala) and watermelon caprese salad.   Both were good.  We then split eggplant stack which was absolutely delicious.  I'm not a vegan but this was wonderful.  To offset that, we had the sweet corn and spicy sausage. Yum yum. Side note, a table nearby had the Cacio e Pepe Bucatini and it looked sooooo good. Maybe next time just before bed because it would knock me out :-)

oGVjYk15exOeA9T-dm5EKg.text: We were here as the official birthday dinner for my husbands 50th Birthday celebration. It turned out to be on the most unforgettable dining experiences we have ever had. Admittedly we are fans of Giada's food  from watching her on TV, but the evening and food surpassed all expectations. Our servers name was Lauren ( she seemed like less of a server by the end of the night, and more like a great friend ) her passion for the food, the restaurant and her enthusiasm was incredible.  My hubby and I both had the tasting menu - we couldnt have made a better decision.  We started with the shared antipasti - which worked for both of us ( I being vegetarian. The next course was epic - David had Giadas famous Lemon Spaghetti with Shrimp and I had the Vegetable Bolognese - easily the best pasta dish I have ever eaten.  Our mains-  for me - an amazing Eggplant Stack - with an incredible tomato sauce.  The Eggplant was cooked in a style that seemed almost deep-fried but wasn't - not sure how it was done - but it was delicious.  David had the amazing Salmon - and the mains were accompanied with an amazing corn dish - creamy and spicy and roasted lemon potatoes. The dessert - was equally divine served from a traditional dessert trolley - where you could pick as many as you wanted. Giadas restaurant is on a great corner overlooking - Las Vegas Blvd and Flamingo Blvd.  The interior is relaxed and chic.  The service is impeccable and the food incredible.  The tasting menu - considering the courses, as well as the special tasting menu that you get to take home - it comes complete with recipes cards as well as a signed photo of Giada is well worth the price.  We loved our evening - and we loved how special Lauren made this for us.  We will return.  Thank you to Nate and Anthony too for your great service.  Giada is wonderful.

bnBpjzob3P4zhOSjOuHNug.text: Excellent decision for any celebration. We dined at this location for my daughter's 26th birthday. The food, service and atmosphere was Awesome!  Our waiter was great and he knew the menu well. I like it when your server can make recommendations. While I had dined at Giada's in Baltimore (Horseshoe Casino) and enjoyed it. This location was more fine dining with a view of the Vegas Strip.  We were surprised when the manager came over and welcomed us to the restaurant and provided additional information in reference to the menu and the restaurant. He was very personable and friendly. My daughters thoroughly enjoyed the level of service and the overall experience.  I would highly recommend this location, not only is the food delicious but the ambiance is upscale.

8U_Z3hiTmTbpVqRdj7AIhw.text: This place is really pretty overrated, especially considering the price.  First of all, we were pretty disappointed by the service. We got there at our reservation time and there was no hostess at the entrance. When we finally got seated, everything took extremely long. We ordered drinks, and it took so long for them to come that we were wondering if they forgot about them. We all pretty much ordered the same thing, and when the food came out, all the plates came out except one. They probably forgot it, because we waited and waited and we had to ask for it before they went back to check and bring it out.  The food itself was pretty tasty. I had the lobster hash which the waiter highly recommended. Good portion of lobster and vegetables. Toasts came with jam, mascarpone cream and nutella. Yum! My friend and I had some non-alcoholic cocktails. Wouldn't recommend it for sure, not much taste to them. Stick with the juices if you want something non-alcoholic.  The atmosphere was amazing and the decor was beautiful. Would probably not recommend this though unless you have a lot of time to spare and nothing planned for a while after your reservation.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster hash

xlW6PhFGHUPImpX8b6I6vQ.text: Visually stunning place! Our group of 4 (with reservation) was greeted and seated promptly for brunch. We were seated by the windows so it was a perfect view of the strip.   Our server's name was Billy & he was just fantastic! Very attentive, detailed with the menu, & gave the most polite service. My group loves pictures & he was patient to take multiple & redo's. Can I just say... the best with angles & lighting!   We were drawn to the $55 brunch menu. It included  an anti pasta, pastries, cut meats w/ cheese, 1 of 3 entrees, & lastly 1 of 3 desserts! It's a great deal & the appetizers were served family style. Your entrees & desserts are served personally.   Entree's we ordered - salmon eggs benedict (eggs perfectly poached) and the Giada burger (added egg + bacon) Dessert - lemoncello souffle (not too tart w/ just the right amount of sweetness), leaving tower of chocolate & espressos (intense flavor of espresso), lemon ricotta cookie ice cream sandwich  (the tiniest of the desserts, but refreshing on a hot day)  Heads up! This is located in the Cromwell, which is paid parking, but I believe they are working on validating parking :)

n-RgzzjlEE3mat0NbODiig.text: Had a reservation and we were seated promptly. Our server Lauren was phenomenal. Her knowledge about the menu, pairing of flavors, and history of the restaurant was extensive. She really made our experience a night to remember.   The drinks were delicious. Our favorite was the Bellismo. It was out of this world! Must try!  Food was spectacular.   "Eat a little bit of everything, and not a lot of anything"   Recommend the Cacio e pepe and the Fried Chicken!

z-oqvMOFgW05MCZHEnHl1Q.text: Came here an hour before the Paula Abdul concert.  We told them we were on a time crunch n they were very accommodating.  We got to the concert on time...brownie points!  Food was delicious.  They do know how to flavor their food. The spaghetti was my favorite.  I love the lemony light cream sauce, the noodle was el dente, n the shrimp large n taste like lobster.  Loved it. We ended our meal w the peach souffle. If you love souffle or never had one you must try it.   Looking forward to coming back n eating the spaghetti...BEST SPAGHETTI EVER

UU8pSSheYOBElrtD-8B7yw.text: Super fun experience!  Who doesn't want to try at Giada's?!  I noticed that Giada was participating in the Vegas Restaurant Week, so I made a RSVP for my cousin and I. What ended up happening is we didn't even order from the restaurant week menu because everything sounds so good.   What did we order:  - Dolce Vita [non-alcoholic drink ~ blood orange flavored] - American Breakfast - Cavatalli with Salmon [great recommendation by our server] - Antapasta [small size]  It doesn't hurt that we got a table by the window so we can see the strip, amazing!

Nvz96OEs0Pdr3XIKhwSnLQ.text: Lovely dinner!  I took my 79 year old mother with me on a work trip to Vegas and we had a blast.  I wanted to take her to a nice restaurant on our last night there and told her we could go anywhere she wanted to.  When she found out there was a restaurant in Vegas by Giada she was 100% sure this is where she wanted to go.  This was a real treat for my her.  I am able to dine in some pretty nice restaurants when I travel, but she has never had this kind of opportunity.  The service was fabulous and as my mother put it; "so professional"! :-) We truly enjoyed the meal.  We shared everything and it was perfect.  The appetizer of bacon wrapped and stuffed dates had a little kick to them, but loved them.  We had the lemon spaghetti with shrimp and it wasn't heavy like so often a pasta dish can be.  It was light, yet layered with lots of cheesy, lemony flavor and the shrimp were plump and cooked to perfection.  Finally, we ended with a peaches and cream souffle and let me tell you - this was one of the best desserts I've ever had.  It was decadent, but again light and airy.  We were full, but didn't have that "ugh, I'm stuffed" feeling afterwards. Aside from watching my mother have such a great time, I believe one of the main highlights was the view.  With it being up on the 2nd (or maybe 3rd) floor, you had a perfect view of the Bellagio Fountain.  It was a magical night and I will not soon forget seeing my mom truly enjoy such "luxury".  I kind of get choked up thinking about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Preaches and cream souffle.  Exceptional!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Views of the Bellagio Fountain
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemony spaghetti!  Delicious!

IqP-IlYh0GXrTsKdPtiutA.text: Went here for brunch with a few friends on a Friday morning!  Setting: located inside the Cromwell, it's only a short walk from the garage to the entrance and the entrance to the escalators leading to Giada. Beautiful gold, cream, and peachy pink accents! The dining room has a very nice view of the Las Vegas strip from the south to the west (you can see the Paris Eiffel Tower, Bally's, the water fountain show at the bellagio, and the strip!)   Service: Billy was our server and very nice! Being a school teacher, I'm very impressed by his way of explaining the menu to us and giving us suggestions for our first time-thank you! My friends and I were a bit much-taking photos of food and asking for photos to be taken of us 4. Billy was patient and took some great photos-thanks again! (The hostess out front was also very gracious in taking our photos in front of the Giada sign and taking them with her known "optimal angles". Girl was right, those photos were awesome!)  Food: absolutely delicious! We came from brunch and did the set $55 brunch menu which came with an antipasti of the day (Giada chosen appetizer), pastries/baked goods, romaine salad, 1 choice of 3 entrees, and 1 choice of 3 desserts.   Appetizers: salad, cheese/meat charcuterie type plate, and assortment of baked goods Entrees: 3 of my friends chose the salmon Benedict, and I had the Giada Burger with added egg and bacon.  Dessert: Lemon ricotta cookie ice cream sandwich (came with 2 that are slightly large than Macarons with a hefty sorbet type filling) , Leaning tower of chocolate & espresso (tall slice of cake with 4+ layers!), and two Limoncello souffles with creme anglaise (very large hot souffles in a mug in which a server pours the creme on top!) honestly, the limoncello souffle can be shared because each of us getting our own dessert was hard to finish even when sharing!   Overall delicious and the decor is beautiful! Do be advised that it is a bit pricey, not overly, but still a more classy brunch with tip and all since you are paying for the view, ambience, AND Giada's food. (And Especially if you are like us and want everything!) I'm sure if you ordered just entrees and a dessert to share, you'd save a pretty penny!   PS. The Cromwell does charge for parking and unfortunately there is no validation at Giada's. (11:30am to about 2pm cost me $12)   PPS. If you check in on yelp, you can get a "Prosecco taste" or a dessert cookie! Obviously...we opted for the Prosecco

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada Burger entree with added egg and bacon!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Benedict entree (not seen: jams, Nutella, butter, salt, and pepper for the toast!)
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting, Full menu in the back, and fixed brunch tasting menu in hand!

AI6rfp296bIH_glvIz5UKg.text: It was a bummer when I found out that Giada would be visiting next week instead of this week, during my visit! I had a ray of hope that she'd make an appearance.   As a huge Giada de Laurentiis fan, I was so excited to finally come to the restaurant. I was thinking about getting the prix fixe menu but decided against it when I realized the menu was different from some of the yelp pictures. I also believe the portions are smaller.   We received olive bread and rosemary facaccia along side mascarpone butter and olive oil pesto. The bread could have been served warm but nonetheless was delicious  We ordered the Romaine Salad and Smashed Potatoes to share and I ordered the Bucatini for my main plate. Even though the Smashed Potatoes we're drowning in Parmesan cheese, I enjoyed everything. The spaghetti was al dente as Giada always speaks of. It wasn't super cheesy but the little bit of ricotta was the best topping to the dish.  Our server, Rocco, was super helpful and very suggestive. I appreciated his knowledge to all the questions we had regarding the dishes.  The one downside to this restaurant would be that we mentioned it was our anniversary and we didn't receive anything in return; honestly, I just wanted a bag of lemon ricotta cookies as some restaurants either comp your dessert or provide you with a tiny gift like chocolate truffles (or in this scenario, lemon ricotta cookies); which you can get for free with a Yelp check in at Giada's Pronto location. No big deal. It was just the little things I wanted to jot down

XPEm42scebgtv-SaKX-12g.text: Dear You,  It's worth it! The service is impeccable and professional. The dishes out outstanding and presented tastefully. I've been here twice so far and Giada did not disappoint. Our server, Rocco elevated my experience with his grace and sincerity.  Since I'm a kick back local Hawaiian boy, let me tell you, the Bacon Wrapped Dates could be a meal by just adding white rice...if I were to dine at home of course. But hey! I can be sophisticated when needed.  I'll update my post soon with pictures!   Best,  Me

bGCpS1kssAC0BAvtl5lpWg.text: Located in Cromwell. Check into Yelp for a free glass of Prosecco. Book your table through OpenTable.   I had the lobster ravioli, a friend had the crab risotto, and my other friend had the bucatini (excuse my spelling). Bucatini was spicier than I imagined and wouldn't recommend if you can't handle the spice. Highly recommend the crab risotto.   Tiramisu baked alaska was good! I missed the part where kahlua was added and would've let the fire burn a little longer for less alcohol flavor.   We were lucky to be assigned to a window seat overlooking Bellagio and Casear across the street. Wonderful way to spend a night with white wine and view.

CNr6VhHvUhzyiIJ9RehKWw.text: I enjoyed visiting Giada so much on a recent trip to Vegas. I came in with a group of six. We made a reservation before coming in -- as you always should do when in Vegas. #IYKYK  I really decided to treat myself and ball out. As a group, we split several dishes, including the Orzo meatballs which were DELICIOUS. I could have eaten the whole plate by myself but ~sharing is caring.~ We also ordered two Cacio e Pepe Bucatini (pasta in the cheese wheel) and WOW. So. Dang. GOOD.   For my meal, I ordered a Caesar salad and the Veal Chop Saltimbocca. Both were incredible, but the Veal Chop specifically was to die for. I'm so happy I decided to splurge for my meal, because every bite was worth the costly check.  I highly suggest making a reservation to Giada for your next Vegas trip and really enjoy the amazingness that is Giada De Laurentiis.

ZuM9XtNMe-EjZr3jQU8ckg.text: In for a treat. We ended up getting the tasting menu. It was 120 per person but included an amazing variety of the dishes and was full after the first course. Attaching the pictures of our food.  The service was phenomenal- from the moment we walked in until we walked out- it was stellar. All the food was delicious! My only downfall and the reason I gave it 4 stars is that my main course was an fried eggplant and avocado dish. It looked beautiful but it was not good. Being an amazing chef- its exhausting at every Italian restaurant eggplant parmesan is the go to vegetarian dish- there are SO many more options! Wish that was done a little better and the eggplant was chewy and the avocado did not compliment it at all.  Otherwise,  will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas- Salud!

8Rafb5dNXv2uLC90adRucg.text: Love love LOVE Giada! Wow. What an amazing meal with incredible service and a delightful atmosphere.  There's nothing like a good meal with friends-sharing memories, laughs and having good conversation while eating quality food is one of my favorite ways to spend time with my loved ones. And that is how I'd sum up my experience at Giada.  The bread they put on the table is incredible-it comes with salt, pesto olive oil, and mascarpone butter. One of the best bread plates I've ever had. I also ordered Parmesan with honey and prosciutto di Parma as antipasti. Guys, please please please do yourselves a favor and get the Parmesan with honey. I know it may sound out of the ordinary to some, but it's honestly the absolute BEST way to eat Parmesan. When my friends tried it they all were shocked at how much they loved it because they said they would've never thought to pair Parmesan with honey. The prosciutto was also INCREDIBLE. So, get that too.  For the main course, my husband and I split the cacio e pepe in a cheese wheel (pecorino toscano I believe). Now, about half way through one of our servers came and told us to make sure we scrape the cheese out of the wheel and eat it with our pasta because the entire cheese wheel is edible (besides the rind obviously). Omg y'all. IT WAS SO GOOD. Like, it was warm and slightly crispy on the edges and had the most delectable flavor. I'm so glad our server mentioned this to us because I would've been so upset if we missed out on this part of our meal.  Speaking of our server, the service was top notch. Everyone we encountered was incredibly professional, friendly and informative. Without a doubt, I'll be back at Giada the next time I'm in Vegas. Thanks for an amazing dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread plate
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto di Parma
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cacio e pepe. The cheese wheel is edible (besides the rind). Don&#39;t forget to eat it with the pasta because it&#39;s a game changer!

9kbfPfgJnDmsLkXCCc1JDg.text: Giada's during the daytime is a brunch lover's dream-- decor wise, that is. He large glass ceiling to floor windows allows for a lot of natural sunlight and a nice view of the Bellagio fountains. They also have a photo booth in the lounge area for waiting parties.  We ordered the lobster hash, cavatelli, cannelloni, burger, and chocolate chip pancakes. The best dish BY FAR was the cannelloni. It's filled with crab and is not too heavy but just cheesy enough. The cavatelli and burger were pretty bland and we had to ask for extra salt on the side.   I'm pretty sure the waiter also forgot about the lobster hash because we had to remind him and it came out 25 minutes after everything else. There were maybe 5 pieces of lobster in the entire dish- would not recommend.   Overall, not sure if I would come back to Giada's, maybe for the lemon ricotta  cookies, aesthetic, and the hope of maybe meeting Giada in person, haha.

GjkN21J5S4BMF-9X6P4e2Q.text: The food didn't disappoint! We sat down and they brought us bread. I thought the bread was a little dry but my wife thought is was perfect. Guess it depends how you like your bread. But we totally agreed on every dish we ordered!  The octopus was amazing. Very tender and had a great smile flavor. Perfectly prepared and paired with a citrus salad. So good! We also had the orzo meatballs. The red sauce with the meatballs was out of sight!  The main course, my favorite- cacio e pepe! This was amazingly prepared and well balanced. It is easy to go over board on this dish but it was perfect. My wife got the mushroom flatbread which was also good. But I wanted something unique and different.   Then the desserts. Need I say more! We left perfectly full with the proper portion size and amazingly fresh food.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GMX8qVPCGX9BU8AhuA3gEg.text: So my husband and I come here approximately once a month for our favorite entree, cacio e pepe. Handmade bucatini in a pecorino cheese wheel. The first time we had it was 9/2/2018 (according to my Instagram) and it was incredible. They brought it tableside and tossed and turned it and we saw the cheese melting inside the cheese wheel covering each strand of bucatini.  Since them, each time we've come to order it, it has not been as amazing. It usually comes out lukewarm and not hot enough to realllly melt that cheese. However, this visit last night, it appeared to already have been stirred up and the food runner plated it immediately after bringing it out, no tableside show.   My husband took a bite and said it was room temperature to his dismay. We were starving and did not feel like waiting but we did want to tell our server Vicenzo about the lack of heat and how it's served completely changed from the first time. He was great, offering to bring us a new one, which we declined because we had to get back home.   We told him we did not blame him one bit but just wanted to provide the feedback since we do visit so often and order this each time. He was great and said he would definitely speak to someone about it which is appreciated. I really hope that feedback gets to someone who can fix this. I truly feel that expediting it immediately after the pasta is cooked would make it perfection.    Overall I love this place. I love the food, the beautiful view, and the decor.   Our go-to order is usually a bellisimo (rum, strawberry puree, basil and I want to say aperol) and my husband really likes the cosmo blanco.   We ALWAYS order the orzo meatballs with the pasta. They're so good and if I'm feeling particularly fat, I'll scoop cheese from the wheel and slap it on the crunchy bread that comes out with the cacio e pepe and then dip it in into the leftover sauce from the meatballs. I highly recommend!  This particular visit I tried the octopus salad and I'm definitely getting it again. It was so tender and delicious, not rubbery one bit which can easily happen. I'm very glad I tried it.   One more thing I noticed after we left, we always have our cheese wheel boxed up and given to us. We did not this time and to be fair, we didn't ask for it because it's usually just given to us. Which we've always appreciated because it's fun to continue eating cheese the next day.   All in all, many thanks and a shout out to Vincenzo for taking care of us so well. We had a great time minus the lukewarm pasta.

YIOPP_xLtuF8K1lVOLeJmQ.text: Amazing food and service. One of the best pasta meals I've ever had. The wine selection was great and the broccolini was to die for

sjc5Ip7ctxOJZx68m5YPWw.text: Great space, attentive staff... now to the food and drink for our brunch. The signature prosecco sangria was sour due to too much lemon (you will see a trend here).  Appetizers - we tried both the orzo and chicken marsala meatballs. Both plates had 4 quarter sized meatballs for $12 each. The chicken balls and mushrooms were good, but nothing to write home about. The orzo meatballs might have been ok... if not for copious amounts of lemon!  One of us had the polenta waffle with fried eggs... it was decent.  The other two of us had the "lobster roll"... this was not a lobster roll.  This was a crostini with a lot of celery, some small lobster scraps in a sauce that had way too much acid in it (could it have been lemon?).  The side dish of fried zucchini was not greasy, but it was cold and was sliced so thinly that you could not get it on your fork.  Price - including tip and not including one of the lobsters... $150.00  Looking around at other tables around us... a lot of very small food for a lot of money... see ya!

Otu29Joq3S4v9ghWRx1sag.text: Ask for Billy - he may be the best server I've ever had. Food is good but service is incredible. They definitely know how to take care of you.

p13NeP6ymw9rmMp0q5wJdw.text: Fabulous!  Although it's loud, the food and drinks were absolutely delicious. Love the small plates concept. We ended up ordering four courses to share and each dish was better than the one before!  Sat by the window and watched the water show at the Bellagio. Don't miss the cookies for dessert which we took to go since we ate 1/2 at the table & 1/2 in the plane on the way home.  We were surprised with the interesting and tasty condiments which arrived with several complimentary bread choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nnQKMeks9bkV39d0BWoc7w.text: We had a wonderful dinner experience at Giada's Las Vegas.  The dinner was delicious and our server Nancy helped with wine pairings as we were unsure which wine went with each of our courses. I'll definitely return.

St7_2mqrJn4EXyFl_iN5CQ.text: I had a wonderful experience dining at Giada.  The food was fantastic.  Our server Brianna was attentive,  and could. It have been nicer.     I would definitely return the next time I am in vegas.    Thank you Brianna for making the dining experience at giada's so memorable.   MK

JIjUDt4SHwURs26U7yQbNA.text: Walking along the strip around lunch time on a recent trip to Vegas I thought I'd venture out to try Giada. As I walked up the stairs and was seated in the rather bland ambiance of what looked like a big hotel room, I quickly realized that my meal and experience was on par with my walk...totally pedestrian. Leave your Lamborghini at home because you won't want to waste the valet parking on this passionless restaurant. Yes, you will need to ask for salt and pepper for this flavorless fare. I was pretty surprised that the red wine by the glass was served warm. It wasn't the right temperature at all for high end restaurants and I sampled two before I chose the better. Believe me they were both pedestrian. I think I decided on the Chianti because I had ordered the spinach and prosciutto pizza with ricotta cheese. I told them to leave the meat off as I am a vegetarian and there weren't many options for me. The server steered me away from ordering a pasta when I asked her which she thought I would enjoy more-the pizza or the pasta? She actually shook her head when I asked about one of the pastas. I can't imagine how bad the pasta would have been. This pizza had the stingiest weak flimsy crust with absolutely no flavor. The spinach was decent (the only tasty part of the pizza) but it was if someone had barfed ricotta cheese all over it. It was so goopy with the ricotta that you couldn't even hold the pizza up with your hand. Sorry to be so graphic but it was that bad! There was no seasoning and I had to ask for salt and pepper and quickly. Reading other reviews, they should hand them out to guests as the walk in OR maybe they should cook food with flavor and passion. When you play in the big leagues with big prices, and a famous celebrity chef named Giada expect guests to have an expectation. Giada does not deliver. Literally...joking but Giada doesn't deliver on any level. Keep walking right on by this jam joint! Even Pedestrians deserve better!

MC8UQYmx-Lplqx69a_PB6w.text: Believe the very moderate reviews.  Had my third dinner at Giada this past Saturday and it will be the last, as one does not need to spend money on mediocre restaurants in Vegas.  The problems are that the food lacks a degree of care in ensuring that what is put on the plate is worthy of a high end restaurant.  Shrimp Cocktail starter:  Nice large portion, but the shrimps were originally overcooked, and then either frozen or held for a long time in water, as there was minimal flavor to the flesh of the shrimp.    Lobster Ravioli: Very bland, slightly overcooked and just not something one would look forward to.  Lemon Spaghetti:  Again a super bland shrimp is used as the protein in this dish and is of the quality you might expect from an Olive Garden.  Dessert (can't remember name but it is like a Pavlova with merengue):  Really chewy merengue and did not have that crunchy consistency one would want to have.  In each of the three times I have been in three years, the quality of the food has consistently decreased.  Unless the owners of this restaurant take steps to improve quality and change the menu around a bit, as it is getting stale, this restaurant will likely not be here much longer.

HmDtTWwzwZc9NA2EwkaD6A.text: I was recommended this restaurant by someone and let me just say it's worth 5 stars! Hands down the best service I have had in a long time! The entire staff was great from the Hostess to the Waiters. Everyone was so friendly and so knowledgeable about every single thing on the menu!! If you had any questions or doubts about something on there our server was there to answer all the questions. He constantly checked up on our table to make sure we were doing good and if we needed anything. The food and dessert was absolutely AMAZING! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy a fine dining Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. I know I would definitely be back again!

hxGdN6g05xN9PeaeyG_1cw.text: Love this place. The flavor balance is perfect. Classy but not super fancy. I like how you can walk in and have a seat at the bar or in the lounge without needing a reservation. Love the focaccia bread and Parmesan crisps that come with the meal. I'm vegetarian so I got the wood roasted mushrooms and red wine risotto. Delicious!
