ZUpZKdPTcimn593M9LffvQ.text: The food and service were awesome!!! The sweet corn and spicy sausage was to die for!! I also tried the salmon, it was a nice sized portion and was served on a bed of corn, lima beans, and peppers which is nice since you have to buy the sides separate.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon! Yummy!!

zvEJ0PlnylKygmAk27ZDpg.text: A must! From the moment we arrived until the time we left, perfection! Server Rocco took great care of us as one in our party had food allergies (gluten and dairy). He assured us that the meal would be specially made (we hear this often at many places only to later get sick) and he was right! My wife enjoyed her 39th birthday...at a restaurant...without cross-contamination illness. Thank you Giada Las Vegas! We'll be visiting again soon since we live in N. Las Vegas!

HCnB0wsuvb1IumtTv6a8Pw.text: Cappuccinos, juices, and boozy drinks are great. We tried every waffle and loved all of them. G's pasta was the star though. Salmoncake Benedict was whateva; skip that. Staff was also great and very accommodating. I'd go back!

jnLrk4kjTvp_62ll7OM3PQ.text: first time at Giada's . Great tasting food, but the portion size was ridiculously small. It could have been 3 times as much and still to small. If you're hungry don't go eat here.

uVMg_uDm-0l58Qef5ie-kw.text: Love Giada, but her restaurant not as much. I had the spaghetti. It was too salty and the shrimp was not mild. The prices and atmosphere was certainly more pretentious than the main course deserved.   Let me tell you where the stars come in. Dessert and coffee. The hazelnut chocolate tart was the best desert I've had in memory. Deliciously sweet with a savory crust. The coffee was very high quality and made fresh to order. If I had only had dessert and coffee this would be a five, but the main course was lackluster.

9XYwS-U5v-jdy7tNQilIMw.text: This was my second visit to Giada's restaurant. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary there for dinner.   We were excited to be returning as it was about a year ago that we ate at Giada's. We enjoyed the experience-both food and level of service. We even ordered the tasting menu and ordered a bottle of wine. It was definitely  worth the splurge.   However, our second visit wasn't what we expected. We were seated at a window location, which we appreciated. We decided on ordering off the menu this time around. But also chose a bottle of Pinot Gris to go with our dinner. Our appetizers came quickly- we ordered charred octopus and grilled sweet peppers. Loved every bite of it. However, our entrees did not quite arrive in a timely fashion. I think it was about 25-30minutes before our server had informed us there was a mistake on the restaurant's side. Our bill was paid for by table next to us, and therefore closed out. So that explained the delay, but we still waited another 15 minutes or so for the food.  I ordered  the spaghettini with shrimp. The noodles were cooked al dente, but the sauce was to creamy and overpowered the taste of the dish. Not as great as my first experience (especially for the wait). My husband ordered the Branzino (grilled white fish). Which he enjoyed and I also liked the seasoning and flakiness of the fish.    The dessert we ordered was a chocolate espresso cake. This was decadent and probably the best part of our meal.   We were offered a 10% discount on our meal for the delay. We were appreciative for that gesture.    In total we were there for about 2-1/2 hours. I wasn't really impressed this visit and may not be visiting agin the next time we are in town.  Especially Not for the amount we would like to pay for fine dining.   The opening was excellent and it set the bar high for the restaurant.  No matter what, I still love Giada and her cooking.

nV1rAk-Ncwj_l-RKOl7D7A.text: My friends and I came here for Brunch.  The restaurant is just beautiful.  However, it stops there.    1. Food: We ordered a variety of dishes.  The biggest disappointment was the pasta! A kid could make it better, to be honest.  It was beyond bland, lacked any flavor and not even served hot.  Olive Garden serves better pasta and you can buy a grocery store pasta sauce that is much, much more flavorful.  This came as a shock as this is the Giada's restaurant!   2. Service: Incredibly slow.  We waited over ONE HOUR for our entrees to be served! No waiter came to give us any updates. Once they did arrive, a few dishes were not even warm.  We ordered 2 cocktails which took so long to serve that we finished eating our meal in that time. After no word from them about our drinks, we inquired about them only for the to remember. We proceeded to tell them to just cancel it because we were already ready to pay our bill and leave.  After he acknowledged that, a few min later, someone came running with our drinks...probably so they could still charge us for them.  But we again told them no, we already cancelled them because we are done eating now.  Overall, very disappointing experience.  If you want good Italian food, do not come here.  However, if you want average/below average but to be in a place with beautiful ambiance and views, then come and enjoy your time here.

-fKIkBuuPwuN3KBDxLFBAg.text: I wanted to like this restaurant. The positives: decor, view, and service. Not so great: the food, I had the caprese frittata; and $13 valet parking at the Cromwell. The locals should get a pass otherwise we will be going to better restaurants off the strip.

p69TPYuTu97vqBpexwXp6w.text: I was excited to eat here but what a big disappointment... First of all, I had a reservation at 12:45pm and we weren't seated until 1:10pm.. The smell of wood burning fireplace can be perceived from the first floor, at first I thought that it was a nice touch but the smell was so powerful that it was all I could smell through the meal. Also my clothing was impregnated with the smell of smoke for hours after eating there.. It really needs a better ventilation system. Now, the experience.. While walking to the table I noticed rest of food on the floor that stayed there until we left. The table had crumbs when I sat down.. I had to ask to change my cutlery since it was also dirty, glasses with water spots.  Our server Bill was very attentive and nice, however, during the course of our meal we had several other people delivering our food with less than qualified skills to serve. The menu was very basic, disappointed for such a renowned chef. We ordered some cheese to start that was pretty good, for my main course I ordered the lasagna with arugula salad on the side and my friend the lobster roll with zucchini scapecce (that tasted like oil and nothing else..). Lasagna was very bland.. I asked for salt that took forever to get to the table.. The lobster roll? same, no taste at all. What ashamed! I didn't finish my plate.. Then I decided to ask for dessert so I can have something in my stomach for the rest of the day. "Someone" (not our server) cleaned up the table and I noticed he didn't pick up some arugula leaves that fell from my plate to my placemat.. So when he came back with the dessert he put the dessert IN THE MIDDLE OF THE TABLE instead of in front of me (since my placemat was dirty)!! My friend started laughing at the situation and I was speechless.. The tiramisu was nothing extraordinary.. And my friend's coffee was ok... I looked around and although the place itself is pretty the little care with cleaning and attention to detail was not to the standard of a famous chef's restaurant  .. Food on the floor, dusty.. I never thought I was gonna listen to Aerosmith (which I love) in an Italian restaurant?? For a moment I thought I was eating at the Hard Rock Cafe..The music selection was like they picked someone's Ipod and played it! Overpriced for the whole experience.. For that price? I rather go to Nora's on flamingo!! And I won't smell like CAMP FIRE when I leave..

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e-8ZdTcC4I9lpZsxMjhfiQ.text: I really liked Giada's - and to be honest I am not a huge fan so I almost wanted not to like it. But I was very pleasantly surprised. Probably the most difficult part of the dining experience was getting a reservation - My husband called two weeks prior to my birthday and they told him only thing available was after 10:00 PM - not acceptable - He did manage to get in a bit earlier that I would have liked (5:15) but was glad that we got to try it.  When you walk in you see a plethora of fresh foods in a spotless glass refrigerator case and as well  an open wood fire stove with several little red pots inside.  Humm I wonder what those are? Fresh pastas are also hanging in view ready for their 3 minute hot bath before serving.   Service starts with a bread plate...Here comes the little red pot of hot freshly baked rosemary bread served with savory bread crisps and sticks and nice dipping and sprinkling assortment that includes pesto and lemon butter.  You will want another pot o bread for sure.  Nothing better than fresh pasta - My daughter had one of Giada's signature pastas, a nest of angle hair pasta flanked by two tender jumbo shrimp - She did not leave even a speck of pasta on the plate.  I had parpadella with pork - fresh - sauce like my grandma used to make and wonderfully tender shreds of pork.  My husband had the surf and turf -  The turf was an excellently prepared fillet of beef cooked to perfection - He was less satisfied with the turf that was a crab ravioli.  He wanted a more traditional surf maybe more substance than a single ravioli.  His was also served with sauted asparagus and snap peas which he really enjoyed.  We were very full from our meal but did indulge in some lemon icebox cookies and peanut butter and raspberry cookies - a satisfying end to a very nice meal.  In addition service was excellent - Wine list was very nice and appropriately priced for the overall price point of the restaurant.

_JyTexjGljVLPtV0_mCDbA.text: I've seen the Food Network shows, I've thought incessantly about how she could eat pasta and olive oil all day long and stay thin, and I've read about her too many times on celebrity blogs/sites.   I'm never excited to dine at celebrity chef establishments. Guy Fieri, Gordon Ramsay etc...are douches. Michael Mina (see me review of his namesake restaurant at the Bellagio) was a total waste of time. The track records of celebrity chefs are not exactly stellar.   Finally, after months of not looking at Giada's, I decide to go for a date night with the hubs largely because I absolutely love how the place looks when you drive towards the Cromwell with the green vegetation. Since then, I requested to come back with friends for my birthday dinner here as I loved it so much. Giada has proven the TV cook curse can be broken.   Firstly, the place was outstanding due to a wonderful waiter (that we got both times we were there)! Diego...a wonderful man from Italy who was attentive, polite, hilarious and just literally the best waiter I have ever ever had in my entire life.   Then, the food...Giada likes to squeeze citrus on her dishes. Normally, that would have generated a barf response from me. But you know what..it was done right. Just a smidgen of citrus was beautiful. I never thought I would say that.   I've ordered the following:  1) Artichoke Arancini - I could eat like 18 of these. So freaking good. Fried rice, artichoke balls. Oh loveliness 2) Bucatini with a tomato - citrus sauce - so simple and delicious. You just don't feel like you ate a bowl of spaghetti...feels so much more sophisticated and just...different. I thought that the noodles here was even better than the famous Scarpetta spaghetti 3) The vegan main was chard wrapped brown rice and tofu with a curry seasoning (?). Made no sense and sounded so awful on the menu especially at an Italian place. My husband made the order and I was seething with anger at having to pay good money to eat something that sounded awful. Why they would describe the dish that way on the menu is beyond me? Because it is one of the MOST DELICIOUS things I've ever eaten! So savory, so smooth and just wonderful.   I never did try the desserts but the dessert cart was pretty impressive. When we had our friends with us the second time, our friends ordered the lamb, octopus and a bunch of other carnivorous fare and enjoyed it with glee. So I'd say the full menu is pretty darn good.   But the special icing of Giada - our wonderful Diego.   This is one of the places I think it's worth spending money on a meal for. Giada, you have me as a fan.

gnZYSBhdPRGqjc28ESDUhw.text: We love Tim and Giada! The pepper is epic, ask for it on everything. Napkins in the bathroom are on point, Giada is the ultimate homegirl.

ODuN1CHAfJSMF0OMwfTDrw.text: Giada may be many things, but subtle isn't one of them.  Her eponymous restaurant juts out over the Las Vegas Strip more prominently than her cleavage juts out of my HDTV whenever the boob tube is tuned to the Food Network.  (See what I did there?  "Boob tube"!)  Anyways, now that I got my requisite joke about Giada's cleavage out of the way, I can finally talk about my brunch!  It was pretty great, actually.  I was joined by a few friends at Giada on a Sunday morning.  The place is right off the casino at The Cromwell, with a dramatic escalator entrance that takes you up to the hostess stand, which doubles as a gift shop selling mountains of Giada-related paraphernalia.  (Like I said, Giada isn't subtle.)  We were quickly whisked into the dining room, which was gorgeous and has a stunning panorama of the Strip.  Lots of light and cozy furniture make you want to sit back and relax for a while.  Pretty much everything from the napkins to the dishes is a shrine to Giada -- her name and image are ubiquitous.  Some might find this tacky, but, it was just tasteful enough that didn't bother me too much.  Brunch started with drinks.  My friends had mimosas but I decided to forgo the booze and had a cappuccino instead.    Next, we shared an assortment of breakfast pastries.  They were fine, but nothing in particular impressed me.  The donut-like pastry was dry.  I think my expectations might've been too high.  The real star of brunch was the salmon cake benedict, which was totally fabulous.  It was served with wilted spinach, piquillo peppers, poached eggs, prosecco hollandaise, and two thick slices of toast.  I don't think I'd ever had prosecco hollandaise before, and it was a light and delicious alternative to a heavy, run-of-the-mill hollandaise.  The salmon cakes were fresh and juicy, too.  I also enjoyed the assortment of spreads and sauces (including Nutella!) that came with the toast.  That was a unique touch.  All in all, I enjoyed my brunch at Giada.  I look forward to my next brunch here -- almost as much as I look forward to seeing her cleavage bursting through my television set.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. salmon cake benedict
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spreads and sauces
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pastry basket

5ZMTs8AqT0hc1gZGkxG8gg.text: Amazing dining experience. Nancy, our server, was upbeat, friendly, accommodating and terrific at her job- exceeding our expectations.  The food was superb!! Hands down- best Italian fare with so many choices and palate experiences.  Definitely recommend the tasting menu so you can sample and enjoy almost everything on the menu.  Will be back... with lots more people!!

rl4C1nm3Tqi2ANaU__Malg.text: I've watched Giada cook in her V-neck boob shirts on Food Network since Day 1. (So did all of my guy friends, but I don't think they were watching the cooking.) I was hoping for a great meal, but this place is one of the most disappointing ones I've had on the strip.  We weren't very hungry, so we kept the food small. We both had a different cocktail, both of which were tasty and strong. Standard Vegas-priced for $15 each.   Artichoke soup for $12. The soup was lukewarm and had a mealy- not creamy- consistency to it. Neither of us finished the soup. I felt disappointed.  I got the Tricolore salad ($17), which I didn't finish. Sounded delicious with pancetta, dates, kale, and a mess of other things... it just didn't taste good at all. I can't even put a finger on why it was not good, but this fatty did not finish this meal.  My friend got the spaghetti with prawns ($32, I think). That actually looked tasty, and I think other reviewers recommended it as well.   Atmosphere is quite nice here with subtle lighting, and the restaurant is broken up into a cocktail lounge area, bar, and actual dining area. For some reason they had the windows open when it was 60 degrees outside at night, so it was incredibly cold in there.  I'm sad to say this place is just overpriced and overrated hype.

cEWXr2FEF-wAuD5gjeh15w.text: First time to Giada's. Great ambiance and nice decor. View of the strip was even better with open windows.  Menu for brunch was so interesting. I got the Farro salad with salmon bottomless mimosas. Love the flavor combo of cucumber and mint and salmon on the salad. Husband got the salmon cake Benedict . Generous portion, amazing flavor. He would get it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farro salad with salmon! Amazing. Cheese, cucumber and mint came together for a great light dish.

4ydAQwLw6zxzfrWk4aG-Xw.text: We had a great experience with Lauren & Michael as our server & assistant for the evening. We want to thank them for making our dinner experience on  the last day of our anniversary trip more memorable. The tasting menu was a great recommendation. Thanks again!

J9hg059YOSykcOXHqJI4VA.text: Celebrated my birthday here with my family! Absolutely adore the photo booth by the check in desk. It's a great idea, you can print the photo strips, and it's completely free!  The service was good and everyone was friendly. Our food was flavorful and delicious, although I was expecting something different of the Risotto. I tried the Rigatoni which was great!! Everyone was satisfied with their meal.  I like how this restaurant is small with more of an intimate feel. It has a great view, being on the corner with huge windows. The interior design is unique, well put together, and intriguing. I would love for my future kitchen to look like parts of the one in Giadas.  Ended my birthday dinner with a Nutella espresso, chocolatey perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bellagio fountains from the windows at Giada

iEfMoaFIsb_5JLUwocILkw.text: Fancy smancy ass place with a nice  modern ambiance and views of the strip.  So if you're trying impress someone, definitely come here but expect to pay top $$$ for some slightly above average food.  Lobster Arancini - Tasty but it could have been hotter.  This tasted like a potato cake in ball form with lobster bites in it.  Had lots of potential but I wanted more of a hot crispy bite   Mashed Potatoes Side - It wasn't bad but come on, how great can mashed potatoes really be.  If you're debating between sides, try something unless you're really craving mashed potatoes   Veal - No complaints here, exactly what I expected a veal cooked Milanese style to be.  Nice and crispy with a sauce that's boss  Had 8:30 reservations but didn't get seated till 9-9:15 which was pretty annoying.

QCYiaKaVwgTJGwHNWd4alQ.text: Giada your employees at the bar do not care about your restaurant, I'm a huge fan an we have been here before. Now we are feeling rushed to order after visiting you from sf

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pwZyO5dp1ZUJwADuPMxb6Q.text: I went here because I am Giada fan. I had a Groupon as well. This restaurant had the most amazing decor. It was just beautiful. Even the hostesses wore these fancy white dresses. Everything was amazing except our waitress. I wonder if it was because everyone had a Groupon and she was grumpy about it.  We don't drink, so we asked if we could get another drink besides the free champagne. She said no, we asked her to give our champagne to the table behind us, she said she would, but we never saw her do it. She just seemed annoyed and impatient.  Anyways, you get the idea- now I'm gonna talk about the food. We went here for breakfast. For drinks, I ordered the Dolce Vita, it was sparkly and tasty. My mom ordered one of the juices- it tasted fresh. For my meal I ordered the frittata. It was delicious. It had tons of cheese and fresh tomatoes. Yum! My mom ordered eggs and spinach. The spinach was amazing, it was sauteed perfection! Her meal came with toast, so we got this adorable spice tray (that I want to buy). It had  coarse salt and ground pepper, along with Nutella, lemon butter, and raspberry jam. I tried them all and the lemon butter with jam was my favorite. I wish that we could have gotten a little bread basket since the frittata doesn't come with bread. The frittata is pretty huge and I was having a hard time finishing it- you could definitely share it. We also got a pastry. It was monkey bread made with a croissant and had chocolate in it. It was to die for. I kind of wish I had tried all the pasties for $15 instead of ordering the frittata!  Overall, this restaurant is beautiful, the food it's impeccable, and it feels like Giada could just walk out of the kitchen at any moment.  I took one star off because of the waitress, what a bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frittata. It doesn&#39;t come with toast. My mom gave me a piece of her toast.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spice tray.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful table settings

t6qzK977wL-GE1nP-h-G4w.text: I came here for lunch on my birthday with my mom and brother. I made reservations via Open Table, so of course, it was simple.   We had a moment before our table was ready, so I was excited to check out the photo booth. It's a very cool set up of having a built-in complimentary photo booth, except it is a very tight space and it's difficult to reach the screen and be situated when the session starts. It was also unfortunate for us that their printer was out of service that morning! Sad face! They do allow you to send the photos via e-mail, but the pixel quality is atrocious.  The restaurant is beautiful and the view of The Strip (and Bellagio fountains) is great. I love the open kitchen and the antipasti bar. We were given a table next to the floor-to-ceiling windows, which was very nice. The chairs were comfortable, too.   We started with Orzo Meatballs with Parmesan Pomodoro ($15) and Burrata with Balsamic Salt ($12). The meatballs were tender and flavorful; very satisfying. The Burrata was also delicious; really creamy and great with that balsamic salt, EVOO, and micro arugula. Both fantastic Antipasti dishes. They also offer complimentary bread that appears to be baked in a similar fashion to pizza (it may be their pizza dough). It's served with a yummy pesto oil.  Lobster Roll ($35): Lemon Basil Aioli and Fried Capers. All sandwiches are served with Arugula Salad or Zucchini Scapecce. I chose the Zucchini Scapecce, but was served the salad, so our server graciously brought a small plate of scapecce to the table. It was a great error because I truly enjoyed the salad AND the scapecce! They were delicious alone and with my sandwich. The sandwich is open-faced and stacked with scrumptious lobster meat. The mixture was so tasty!  Venetian Panino ($18): Turkey, Gruyere, Fontina, whole mustard, and Peppadew. This panini sandwich was also well-made and delicious. It not entirely exciting, so I probably wouldn't order it over all the other menu selections. My mom really enjoyed it though!  G's Baked Pasta of the Day ($24): The lasagna had layers of eggplant as well as your usual suspects. This was really, really good lasagna. I love the addition of eggplant layers to make it a bit more healthy.   Chocolate Tiramisu ($8): Chocolate Zabiaone and espresso-soaked ladyfingers. Tiramisu is one of my absolute favorite desserts and this is seriously one of the best tiramisu I've ever had the pleasure of eating. They also wrote a very nice "Happy Birthday" message on the plate.  Espresso Nocciolato ($9): Lavazza Gran Riserva, Nutella, whipped cream, toasted hazelnuts, and a light dusting of cocoa powder. This was really tasty and a fun way to drink a shot of espresso!  The food was all delicious! The service was wonderful and we had a very pleasant experience. It was a fantastic birthday celebration. My only complaint: Why is everything so petite??! You pay quite a premium on the dishes that I didn't expect from Giada. Also, beware that you are charged for "still" water! I thought they meant tap water when I was asked (they only offered still or sparkling), so I was surprised to see the charge on the bill. Oddly, they only served us the one bottle, then switched to tap water without asking us if we wanted another bottle of still water.

fu9MrSKmTlyUOcpz_19x3Q.text: Went on Saturday noon and sat at the bar instead of the 1 hour wait. The restaurant is beautifully decorated along with the panorama views of LV Blvd. Now that's the good....the rest of the dining experience went downhill very quickly. The bartender was clearly overwhelmed and most likely needed some help.  Menu's were presented promptly and took our drink order (just ok ice tea).   We ordered the mulfetta and Giada hamburger which comes with thin zucchini fries.  The really bad - we waited and waited over 45 minutes for the order to arrive. The bartender told us several times it was coming soon and the kitchen was backed up because of a large group - I didn't see the group in the restaurant but perhaps it was an imaginary group?  Order finally arrived and the burger was dry along with cold zucchini fries. The mulfetta was nothing close to what you might get in New Orleans. The bread was not fresh, seasoning was lacking (come on - where's the olive spread and crushed garlic). Size was half a sandwich along with, you guessed it, cold zucchini fries.   The meal was mercifully coming to an end and finally paid for the bill. He did not charge us for the ice teas but if they had someone really managing the place, they would have not charged us at all. By the way, everyone at the bar (packed to capacity) had the same complaints.  The ultimate insult on the way out was seeing the piled high pre-made. mulfetta's stacked behind the counter!  Maybe Giada should spend some time in her 'named' restaurant or perhaps find some competent managers. Would expect much more in one of her establishments. I also see quite a few other reviews complaining on service and rather pedestrian food. Lots of fine dining establishments in LV - but not here.

9VplLXNLL8PJJDcA2skiUg.text: My husband and I went to Giada's for dinner. From the moment we walked in to the when we left was one of our most special experiences.  Our waitress was Nancie who was spectacular !!  She encouraged us to try the wine pairing meal and it was fabulous. We were celebrating our 60th birthday's and this dinner was the highlight of our trip. We bought a cookbook and enjoyed every course of our meals.   Thank You !!!!!

bWghjMxw1xl_akRB7nAKjQ.text: Loved the service, the ambiance and the taste! Mm...mmm. Stayed at Cromwell for a couple of days and ended up eating Giada's multiple times. Now ordering two baskets of pastries.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View was amazing. I honestly thought I couldn&#39;t have dessert after her breakfast but Got two pastry baskets for me and mine!

vgHu3wqvOD5TP1nMm9Hs2A.text: I don't understand how anyone gives this restaurant a bad review. I absolutely loved it here. My date and I were in a hurry and the waiter was very accommodating. He made sure we were in and out of there in 30 minutes. The food was so fresh and tasty. I've always loved Giada and her restaurant did not disappoint! The view of the Strip from the tables were spectacular!

RXctS9u5JkY-bIRU6uHzog.text: I really liked this place. Our server was great (not constantly hovering but always there when you needed him) and the nearly floor to ceiling windows were perfect for someone like me who slept till lunch and needed all the natural light I could get. Before ordering, our server went over the menu and described our options as being "designed" for the time of day, which "duh" it's lunch, not dinner, different options, everyone does that right? Nope, after I finished eating, I got it. Like the natural light, everything I tasted helped me to come alive. The recipes were subtle, cool and refreshing, almost rejuvenating, and while I never felt any one thing was amazing, it just all worked.   For appetizers we tried the caponata $8, baby sweet peppers $12 and orzo meatballs $15. Interestingly enough, the cheaper the better here. The caponata was excellent and came with enough to cover about 10 crostini (it came with 6, we asked for the extra.) The baby sweet peppers stuffed with goat cheese and olive tapenade came with three and fit the theme of this review perfectly--not amazing but somehow still perfect. The orzo meatballs were probably my least favorite of everything I tried, as paying 3 to 4 dollars (per meatball) for a relatively small and un-compelling dish is not something I would advise and this is coming from a guy who falls for the aidells samples at Costco on the regular.   For lunch, I had the Waldorf Panzanella salad, which included a unique crouton-like raisin walnut bread I really enjoyed. I also split three other options: the Lobster Roll, Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese w/ prosciutto and Tuna sandwich. Getting back to the idea of refreshing, the lobster roll (served cold) included a lemon basil aioli, which along with the lemon pesto grilled cheese contributed to the overall feeling of zest I felt at the completion of our meal. Of the three, the grilled cheese was my favorite, followed by the lobster roll and then the tuna.   Try it or Diet Final Word  If soup taste 10x's better to you on a rainy day and/or there's nothing better to you than a ice cold beer after mowing your lawn, this is the place for you at lunch. It's good food served in the right atmosphere at the right time. Try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dad&#39;s Venetian Penino. I was too full to try it but it looks good.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caponata
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed sweet peppers (someone snatched 1 quicker than I could snap this picture) backed by the orzo meatballs (skip)

YZBRmrEYY0_rTokMcgBKjA.text: I just went back to Giada for the second time, and it was even better than I remember. I go to Vegas a few times a year, and this and Mizumi (in the Wynn) are the only restaurants I always *have* to go to.   We got the Giada's favorites sharing plate, which was delicious. The bruschetta has a thin slice of avocado on top, which really kicked it up. The bacon wrapped dates were divine. We shared the lemon spaghetti with prawns, it was so light and delicious, I'd highly recommend it. We also got the short rib with potatoes, which was incredibly tender, and some ravioli. Everything was delicious, but the lemon spaghetti was everyone's favorite. For dessert we had a lemon hazelnut tart that was just delicious. My drink was called The Destroyer, and it was delicious.  You have to be willing to drop about $150/person. It isn't a cheap place, and you won't enjoy it if you try to skimp out. If that's above your price range I'd go somewhere else instead of trying to eat here on a budget.   Overall, would recommend! Plan to go again and again!

IvkvNIVA9V-3UPy0fDiruQ.text: came here after staying in the Cromwell high-end suite for 4 days. The Asian receptionist was rude. She first told us the coffee from The Cromwell is not accepted. We waited for 10 minutes after watching at least 30 seats completely open and available. Never got a seat. So we left. Would you fire that manager that watched it go down?

LaN5kavt8in_Mk-j1dTN_g.text: The food here is pretty good. The portions are what I assume Giada would have herself. The prices are pretty high though, but I guess it's cause she is a celebrity chef.  We had: orzo meatballs (soft and not too heavy) -shrimp spaghetti (a little bland) -salmon (had the most flavor, a favorite of my fiance's) -cookie platter (lemon ricotta melts in your mouth, while the chocolate chip was soft on the inside, but the raspberry peanut butter was eh) -cappuccino (milky)  Our server, Tim made the experience as great as can be. He was very accommodating and awesome. If he is your server, he'll take care of you well.

LsbzFzrlEJPHulPZdLdq9A.text: We've been wanting to try giada's for awhile, my wife being a huge fan of her on tv.  The positives were that the service was great.  We never waited for water or food.  There were plenty of wait staff making sure you didn't need anything but they weren't intrusive where they interrupted your conversation and dinner ever 2 minutes.  The service was efficient.   They give you the option of eating the dishes family style which seems like a great idea and fits in line with giada's style and her philosophy.  However, I feel she would be better off having a separate menu for those interested in a family style serving of the food.  We thought it would be a great idea but some of the dishes are on the small end to be served family style with 4 people so I don't think you can get the full essence of the dish with just a couple of bites.    The food itself was clean and fresh but it didn't necessarily stand out for me.  I enjoyed it don't get me wrong.  The one dish I did think was cooked well was the charred octopus.

aWQdN04XyZaTG86qbuvWEg.text: "eat a little bit of everything and not a lot of anything" - Giada De Laurentis  Giada did an excellent job; great location with stunning views of the Bellagio Fountains and the Strip, swanky ambiance, stylish decor, an overall inviting and comfortable dining experience. The effort was extended to the tiniest details of her quotes written on every lampshade hanging from the ceiling - everything was seriously top-notch. The best part of dining at Giada was her complimentary photo-booth; What a beautiful touch: a perfect way to make lasting memories. I give her team 5 stars for making the restaurant shine like her gorgeous brand. Regretfully, I wish the same could have been said for the food.  The bread-service was decent; I enjoyed the parmesan crisps the most, the freshly baked rosemary bread was warm and fluffy - but extremely oily for my preference and the simple breadsticks weren't touched. The seasoning tray was a welcomed addition to our meal; we used all of the seasonings offered, since most of the dishes needed the extra kick. Yet, my favorite was the crispy fried capers - they were incredibly flavorful and texturally exciting.  My boyfriend and I kept it sweet and simple and ordered three dishes - crostini, pasta and seafood... Surprisingly; the crostini was the highlight of the entire evening. We were concerned three small dishes wouldn't be enough food for both of us, but we were wrong! We ended up uncomfortably stuffed, so keep that in mind as you order.  Unfortunately, these dishes weren't all memorable. There was only one dish that left us wanting more:  - Crostini: Pea pesto with prosciutto san Daniele $14 was mouthwateringly delicious, perfectly seasoned, with bright flavor and texture. The pea pesto had a similar flavor profile and texture as smashed avocado and the prosciutto was the freshest. Flavor rating: 5/5  The other two were only a notch above average. They were well executed, but lacked any real depth of flavor; I mildly tasted some sort of citrus ingredient and plain old salt in both dishes. However, the seasonings and flavor were mostly muted:  - Seafood: Lobster Arancini with Calabrian chili pomodoro & basil aioli $18 was actually a highly recommended dish from our waitress, so we thought we had a winner. The rice balls were fried very well, light and crispy, however the promise and essence of lobster was nonexistent. The filling was mushy and lacking complexity and the pomodoro sauce was leaning more towards the watery side, lacking bold flavor. The best part of the dish was the bright, inviting flavor of the basil aioli, but there was a minuscule amount offered on the plate. Flavor rating: 2/5 - Pasta: Risotto with lump crab meat and 2 scallops $30 were enjoyable, but we had some seasoning issues with the overall dish. We enjoyed the expertly cooked scallops and crab meat, both juicy and moist. Yet, while the risotto was under-seasoned, the scallops were aggressively seasoned. In retrospect, I understand now that I needed to eat a bite of risotto with a piece of scallop all together for "the perfect bite" however, I failed to do so; therefore the over/under seasoning caused a poor taste for the dish. Flavor rating: 3/5  Although I had some issues with two of the dishes, I'm confident that there are more delicious hidden gems offered in her large menu and I would definitely return to Giada to give something else a try.

sytAsd2PcoEHk4oUFhh3vg.text: Dined here 7/3  A longtime fan of Giada and lemon zest, I was excited to try her first ever restaurant in Vegas of all cities. I was curious to see how rustic family Italian recipes would transcend the lights of the Vegas strip.   The restaurant is a huge establishment situated at the top of a beautifully lit staircase in the boutique Cromwell hotel. The open kitchen with its abundant display of freshly made pastas, charcuterie and breads entice you as you walk to your table. Keeping up with the 21st century, you receive your menu both in a beautifully bound text as well as a detailed iPad.   I settled on the appetizer trio and enjoyed the chicken Marsala meatballs most. My significant other managed to elegantly divide and conquer his Tuscan ribeye so much so that he received accolades from our Joseph Gordon Levitt doppelganger waiter.   Dessert was rich and exactly as advertised. Rich chocolate ganache over rich chocolate cake. No more needs to be said. As we were celebrating an anniversary, they sent over a trio of gelato and some delicious cookies.   We left with our bellies full and our hearts happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweets to celebrate a sweet occasion!

OvawTCW8ISwr_B2qGbQTzw.text: Was the worst experience I've had in a long time. The hospitality group was unprofessional and immature. The side waiter was so rude, my daughter asked politely for a spoon and the reaction was appalling! The portions were ridiculous for the prices, food was tasteless ! I was very disappointed The only good thing I could say about this dining experience was the waitress was very informative and sweet. But would I recommend to anyone? Absolutely not! Very unprofessional with my transgender friend. The manager told him to his face he obviously looked like a man so was not welcomed wearing the dress he had on. He said he would go change but decided not to join us. We made the mistake right there of staying but just because my friend insisted we stay and I didn't want to make it any more awkward then it already was.

bJsXM6L5myruh5g63LQ9eg.text: We made some dinner reservations and were seated in a clean nice restaurant. Service was good but I am writing a two star review solely on the food. Caprese salad was ok and calamari the same just ok. When it came to the pasta both mine and my wife's were flavorless and completely disappointing. I got the spaghetti, which was served cold and it really had no flavor to it. My wife's fettuccine was the same way although it was served warm, the flavor was really lacking. Won't be back

2RLus7VqxPzncHN82fuCBQ.text: Great atmosphere and brunch menu. I came here for brunch and enjoyed everything we ordered. I shared the arugula pancetta salad and carbonera pizza with a friend and thought both were delicious. The arugula salad is fresh and light and balanced out the heavier carbonera pizza.  The chicken and waffles and salmon benny were both pretty good too. I would say that their portions are quite big and worth the price.  My friend and I initially ordered the chopped tricolore salad to share, but didn't realize it would be served with a heavy blue cheese dressing. If you're a big blue cheese fan, this is the perfect salad for you. Our server offered to switch out our salad for another one, so we ordered the arugula salad. I really appreciated our server for doing that for us.  I would come back next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chopper tricodore salad. Creamy blue cheese dressing for the blue cheese lover!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara pizza with egg on top. Delicious!

2ki79hgrE4jQrR3Dtkhxsg.text: Dinner was great and the food amazing. Our waitress Lauren was super knowledgeable and friendly. Would go back just for her. Now why 4 stars. The location and some attributes. The Cromwell is a smaller hotel casino and unfortunately in her restaurant the smoke comes up the escalator and into the restaurant. Thinking better ventilation would fix that. We got there early and ordered wine at the bar. When our table was ready we had to pay separately for the bar tab and had to walk our own wine bottle and glasses to the table. Not something we do in Los Angeles. The tab should be able to float over to your table but that's no bi deal however having to carry our own wine bottle and glasses we ordered at the bar is unheard of.

1KpSo-WWZwETSncv4C6chg.text: Pretty expensive with a wonderful view. The food was good, not exceptional, but better than some other overpriced stuff we've tried in Vegas. The bacon wrapped sausage with Gorgonzola was tasty and had a little bite to it. The ricotta honey crustini we were most enthused to try was a little bland, which was disappointing, but we used the salt and crushed red peppers which came with the bread to jazz it up. For dinner we split the tortellini which was pretty good, but again, pricey for not being awesome. I'd like to offer 3 1/2 stars because the service was good but maybe a little too attentive? If you see people engrossed in conversation, and repeatedly interrupt them, maybe consider backing off until the party makes eye contact or signals for attention?

7hG08CpCJ0lTSEe2VxRfWQ.text: Attention to Detail.  That would sum it up.  I am sure if Giada herself walked into this restaurant on the same day we visited she would have been pleased.  We were greeted with smiles.  Whisked to our table.  Our server was very inviting and informative.  The two couples all ordered separate dishes.  We were well taken care of.  Oh, the hand towels (paper) with the logo on them in the restroom, nice touch!   This restaurant was our favorite of the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Upstairs from the casino.  Friends recommendations

ukIRBZmhEqJP4l0nQbwcsA.text: With literally hundreds of restaurants to try on the Strip, Giada's was a priority. For time management, easy reservations, and budget reasons, we decided to go for breakfast. It was amazing! When you can choose meatballs as your choice of breakfast meat, you really can't go wrong. I find myself wanting to return to Vegas just for this breakfast again. If you go to the Strip, you've got to check it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast American: two eggs served any style, lemon smashed potatoes with your choice of sweet sausage meatballs or bacon &amp; toast $18.00
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Polenta Waffle fresh strawberries, grilled pineapple, accompanied by Nutella $17.00

jGfqC98y9x2z6eyP0wdAXw.text: If I could give zero stars I would.  Booked reservation MONTHS in advance and about 2 weeks prior we had a change and needed to change from party of 3 to party of 4 and they said no.  All tables have 4 sides so the fact that they did not accommodate with 2 weeks notice is unacceptable.   I've known many people that went here successfully too and they all said it was good but not for the price.  Good but over priced from what I hear.   Go to Golden Steer or Gallagher's!!!

2DyN4X511O_dkL5u3P584g.text: Very nice!  Elegant but not formal. Laid back but not cheesy. Has all the ambiance required for a romantic dinner. All the scenery and fun background music for group get-together. And food of a quality to satisfy any pallet.  This place is almost inherently a tapas restaurant. It begs you try several smallish items rather going for one of their few larger mains. We had 6 different items and the weakest of which was above average. I'm a bit prejudiced to anything wrapped in bacon since bacon is so damn goon it can make anything palletable and thus I tend to think of it as a wrapping for something g weak. Not the case here. The bacon wrapped dates were great. I'll probably never say that again.  Pasta dishes were flavorful but light. Southern style. Portions were just right considering we had three dishes each. I've seen reviewers complain about portion size but I think might not understand this cuisine. And the pricing is appropriate.   Great location. Excellent service. Creatively traditional menu, if that makes sense. All around great experience. I will certainly be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I dare you to find this dish&#39;s equal in Las Vegas. Flavorful yet light.

pvzMjlCnwVkPVtiPskaA2g.text: I spent my 27th birthday at Giada's, and I'm so glad I did.   I booked a table for 7 at 8pm. The evening started off with drinks at the bar before being led to our private room with balcony! I know 7 people is a lot, but I never expected to get a private room. Truly appreciative! My friends and I were able to actually hear each other and spend the evening relaxing.  Our waiter was amazing.  We tried just about every appetizer on the menu. Make sure to get the bacon wrapped dates and the ricotta shortbreads. I had the lobster ravioli for my main course and saved room for all of the desserts. My favorite cookie is the peanut butter and jelly one. I took some home for breakfast the next day.  The evening ended with people watching and photos on the balcony. I would highly recommend booking your birthday at Giada's.  This restaurant has become one of my favorite in Vegas. Headed back for breakfast this weekend!

zlLIPJowrJYSx-IEYv5FIg.text: I liked the ambiance of the place.   The service was good though the waiter stated the main dishes were small.  That was not the case with the dishes we ordered.  He did not let us know,  therefore, we got way too much food which wasn't cheap.  I have dined at a lot of nice restaurants and the food was just okay.  Not bad but not very special either.  I had the octopus salad, the veal Milanese and the lobster ravioli.  I have been at several of the celebrity chefs restaurants, such as Bobby Flay's in NY.   The food always seems just okay at these restaurants.  Perhaps the celebrity chefs are spending more time on the TV shows and less on the quality of their restaurants.

t8rzuw_F9xoYwwmUyhrKog.text: I was in Vegas for a motorcycle auction last weekend and as luck would have it one of my good friends was there at the same time.   Her days are not filled as much as her nights so she joined me at Bally's for the auction and we decided to go off and get some lunch.   It had to be close (didn't want to miss too much of the auction action) and it had to be fun.  Giada's fit the bill perfectly.  We were both very impressed as we walked into the place, it was absolutely beautiful.  The hostess seated us at their best window table overlooking the strip and Caesar's Palace.   As I was treating I was thrilled to see that the prices were more than reasonable for lunch.   You can actually have lunch in this amazing place for under $20 per person.  Of course we didn't but still it was much less than I would have expected.     I had a Bloody Mary and my friend had a Prosecco to start us off and for our lunches she had the Sardinian Gnocchi al Pomodoro ($16) which the waiter explained to us is not your traditional Gnocchi but one that is more of a pasta than a potato flavor...he was right and it was still delicious.   I decided to enjoy a pizza, the Salumi Piccante spicy dry sausage, san marzano tomato sauce, mozzarella, oregano (also $16).  Delicious and generous... a table of four could share one as a hearty appetizer.   Our server was exceptional, nice and very helpful in steering us to other places that we should try during our respective Las Vegas vacations!   My friend thought the hostesses' dresses were adorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our Premium table at Giada.

j6z29KlJ_timgY3VBBDKOQ.text: Food was great, however service was lacking. It was a birthday dinner that was acknowledged at check-in however the waiter never mentioned the occasion. It was rude.  Also, waiters seemed to have more tables than they could handle. Vegas is all about service & Giada's missed the mark tonight. Sad.

9jth43YEooO5EM-RxnmN8A.text: I love Giada. The woman is amazing with her work in the kitchen and her work on television. So... I had to try her food in her restaurant and it did not disappoint.   We came for brunch which served a sampler meal for $45. BEST. $45. SPENT.  It came with a three taster appetizer - benedict deviled eggs, quiche, and like a brioche. Anyways... it was good.   Then we got to get a meal - which I got the Salmon Benedict because... I eat everything Benedict... (Hello, Cumberbatch). The benedict was really good. The eggs were perfectly runny and you mush it and put it on the piece of bread provided. So good.  My husband got the chicken and waffles and it was SO seasoned. So well. I don't usually like chicken, but damn. This was good. That butter you put on the waffles was amazing too.   The dessert provided was the chocolate espresso cake (which was ICE CREAM) and the "limon" souffle. They were both delicious and I am usually not a fan of lemon.   They also gave us a basket of pastries that were so good.   SERVICE: Very attentive and fast.  AMBIANCE: Very pretty and the view is amazing.  OVERALL: I loved this place. I

zhaVSnBu9kfCNBf2SN8ZhQ.text: I have been here three times.  The first time was during brunch as soon as they opened and it was ok.  The second two times I was very impressed.  Last night I had charred octopus, which was seasoned and cooked to perfection, and rack of lamb - very delicious!!   The portions are generous and everything is well seasoned so I think it's worth the price.   Our sever Valentino was very attentive. Thumbs up!

YCHXKfMznA0jooeIjToUTg.text: Giada is here today. Looking forward to brunch. I'll write the review after our meal.

HMLJ0rA1H9N3dCzCMiuISg.text: After my fifth visit to Giada last week, I realized that I still hadn't written a review, so here it is, #100 for 2015.    I've been here for breakfast, lunch (twice), dinner, and a wedding reception brunch.  Each visit has always featured excellent customer service and tasty food.  Of the meals that I've enjoyed the most, dinner is my favorite because I love the Lemon Spaghetti with the huge shrimp.  Yes, the restaurant is everything Giada, from the plates to the paper towels in the restroom, but it IS her place.  I love the decor, wide open spaces, and views of the Strip.  I also very much enjoy the free photo booth in the lobby.   If you go, ask for seats next to the window so you can see all the hustle and bustle on Las Vegas Blvd. This is one place in town that's always been consistently satisfying for us and I look forward to having dinner here again soon.  Mangia!

5N_tEPdRKVZGjG9sZo9Wbg.text: Meh.....Grandma is still still yelling at me from The Grave "Are you still hungry, eat bubbe eat"  Call me Crazy but $480.00 (tip not included) for 3 people having a Sampler dinner with only one glass of wine (just me) makes me feel foolish.  Pros: *The view is wonderful of the fountain show across the strip *The food is very good to say the least. *The decor and style is AWESOME *The Lemon Cream Spaghetti is to die for But why so friggin small-2 Tablespoons of Pasta  on my plate with a beautiful Shrimp. I want more dammit. *Lamb Chops and Salmon-Superb!! but... (see below) *The Dessert tray and Gelato is A+  Cons:  *Service: Nice people but inattentive occasionally. Should have brought road flares to get some service. Note: One waiter tried to take my dish while I was obviously still eating. Maybe he has a date waiting outside. On Occassion we waited a long time for attention or for the food to arrive. *Noise Level: Sucks. Why do restaurants need to blast loud music? I hate yelling at the table during normal conversation. Geez, Why not add a Costco Hearing to the menu selection. *Portions: are fu fu small so make sure you bring your high school microscope; sorry I am a hungry American who works hard and likes reasonable portions.  If I order lamb chops give me more than 3 oz. total meat in 4 minuscule chop slivers.  Honest Conclusion: It's probably me. Even though I was a guest I can't understand leaving a restaurant still hungry and having my host pay more for the meal than my first 2 cars  (A Chevy Corvair and a explode on rear impact Ford Pinto) No comments Please:-)   Great location and obvious excellent food but this is not a great value for a Hoi Poi guys like me. I just don't get fancy restaurants with low value and high prices.  Like I said it's just me.........

6kXSlvIuKh9Cof1lZ-ku6A.text: Came in for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. I suggest  valet parking  best option at the Cromwell if visiting as I was. Head thru the casino and up the escalator were  breakfast is served at the bar from starting at 8:00 am to 9:00  and then the dining room opens up at 9:00 am.  I had a conference call so it was kind of awkward setting up and ordered breakfast at the bar. But my  friendly waitress was very accommodating and helpful. On the way  I  met the head chef and I got to speak with him briefly about the prior Yelp event put on here which looked fabulous. The staff was very accommodating and enabled me to take pics prior before they were open at 8 a.m.  Heart the attention to details here - from the napkins,  plates, condiments to the presentation of entrees.  The decor of the  restaurant is stunningly beautiful.   I ordered the Contadina breakfast which included spinach, tomatoes, two eggs over medium, polenta cakes and toast. In addition, much to my surprise - chef of cuisne Bruce M.  brought me over another entree -  eggs & waffles. Everything here tasted so fresh and delicious.  I would  highly suggest making a stop here at Giada's signature debut restaurant, I'll certainly  be returning for lunch or dinner in the future.

UFNbutvRdJIP--yM-8ZuUw.text: We've been here twice and each time it was a disappointment. I really wanted to love Giada's but the food is sub-par. It's not the best nor is it the worst. It's just okay. For the amount of money you're spending, it's NOT worth it.   The first time we came here was during the grand opening week a few years ago. Then we went again Nov 8 for my mother-in-laws birthday because she is wanted to go there. We warned her it wasn't going to be worth it, but we had to go w/ what the birthday lady wanted!   FOOD   Margherita pizza: herb roasted Campari tomatoes mozzarella and basil. This was ok. Portion is small. The dough is good, but I wanted more tomatoes.   Spaghetti made w/ shrimp, lemon and basil. if you enjoy lemon, then you'll enjoy this dish. But that's all you really taste. Pasta was cooked well. Eat it fast or it'll begin to get clumpy since it's a creamy sauce.   Salmon: this was the worst dish we had. The salmon was over cooked even though we asked for medium. The salmon tasted fishy so it was low-quality. Don't get it!!!  SERVICE   The service was great during the grand open. But when we came back earlier this month you could tell all the employees were not getting along and they were understaffed.   The hostess was friendly. But we were not seated right away even though we've made a reservation. We had to wait at the bar for at least 10 minutes past our reservation time.  Once we're seated,our server did not realize we were there in till 15 minutes after. It was as if they had forgotten about us because they were so overwhelmed and busy. When the server took our order you could tell he was agitated.   The table next to us received their food late. We also witnessed the food runner and a server get into an argument in front of us too when they served the food to the table next to us. It was hella awkward and unprofessional to see.   PRICE   For the portions that we received I really feel like we overpaid. Everything was very small and I don't believe the quality or the taste warrants a $40 dish. I would've been OK with the price had we experienced excellent service. Sadly, that wasn't the case. So my opinion on the value and price is this place is way overpriced!   Overall, I wouldn't come back here again. I rated them 2 stars. The food I would rate three stars because it was OK and edible. But because of the price and service that's why I give them an overall rating of two stars.  Happy Dining,   JT

KOu7tKlyGtMeuqS8d4f7Nw.text: Well, when you're in Vegas and want fine dining you know what to expect: high prices, small portions, and a whole lot of chic.  And Giada gives you exactly that.  The main reason I don't rank it higher is the service is fairly lacking and the food, while good, not particularly memorable.  We were a larger group of 6 but thanks to a reservation we got seated pretty quickly.  But after being seated it was a solid 15-20 minutes before anyone came back to take our drink order.  After our drink order was taken, service was a little more on point although it still took quite a while for our drinks to be delivered.  The food was good if not mind blowing. I ordered the pasta flight which is a pretty safe option.  I liked the different pastas (spaghetii is probably the highlight) but the portions were small.  Plan on eating something later cause you will not be full.  There was complimentary bread (unless one of my group pulled a fast one and got it) which was tasty.  They had the thin cracker style as well as a nice fresh herb loaf.  The garlic butter was tasty as well.  I did like my dirty gin martini so the bartender did a good job with it.  My gf ordered the buccatini pasta which she enjoyed. As an app we ordered the sausage pizza.   A solid option but again, nothing particular memorable and literally handsize.  Bottom line, Giada is a beautiful venue with solid food at top prices.  Typical Vegas.  I was a little disappointed overall with the service and lack of anything special or memorable.  But there are worse options for dining out in Vegas.

0PWoRZZXWJWUMTxEfZBP6w.text: Manager reached out to me after reading my first review and our pretty poor first experience and offered us another dinner. Well the second time around was like day and night compared to our first time. Food was amazing, seats were amazing, wine was amazing, and our waiter Duc (i believe thats how its spelled) was one of the best waiters we've ever had. Overall a truly great meal and we will back in the future, also a big shout out to the manager Greisy for reaching out to us and making things right!

Utz1-ftw-Z9L88--GmKBhw.text: Decor and location is great, and it just about ends there. We understand the cost of doing business in Vegas but at least deliver good tasting food, to begin with the bread basket was a joke and not tasteful at all. Appetizers were ok, the pasta dish we all ordered since it was homemade was just terrible, a supermarket packaged pasta tops this any day. They even charged us for the wrong dish that we sent back and was corrected later when we pointed out. Overall, it was not a $400 dinner for party of 4 with 2 beers and 2 cocktail drinks, I'd say it should've been around low $100 for the experience... Coffee was great though. I would recommend this place to people I don't like...

hTMJveDvaOzSImiYq2iuXg.text: This is a tough one!! Restaurant is beautiful! Food is amazing!! However the service really lacked. We have eaten at many high end celebrity restaurants and this was by far the WORST service! We had to ask for things over and over, we had to ask to order even! The waiter only became attentive when the bill came. People that got seated after us got their food quickly, ours came so slow we thought the waiter forgot to put it in. So this rating is based on food alone!

YBdaifT4xV4w1zqez_qfcA.text: I feel guilty for not loving Giada's restaurant! I've been a big fan of hers for a very long time (I've even attended a wedding with her!) Giada was the first person that inspired my passion for cooking and love for food!   My husband and I have dined here twice for dinner, both on weeknights. I love the location, and I agree with others that the design and feel of the place is beautiful and represents Giada perfectly. The restaurant seemed less than half full, and their primo view seating area half empty as well. Leading us to our table, the hostess walked us past beautiful art, beautiful lighting, beautiful tables with people enjoying beautiful food- only to veer us to this dim, obscure, weird corridor that leads to the private dining room at the right of the restaurant. This was probably my biggest qualm of the evening. They have about 4 or 5 two-person tables here. I unfortunately sat with my back to the whole restaurant. And we were the only party back there! (Another couple was sat at the table across from us and moved after 2 minutes) The area felt too isolated and segregated from the main restaurant. Might I add that the second time we came here (several months later) we were sat at the same table! (With the same total number of guests) I know that it's on me to request a different table but we had a show to see that evening and didn't want jeopardize the timing. It's just a crappy thing spending all that money walking out feeling like you haven't even dined at the actual restaurant. I found myself taking my time exiting only so I could take in all that I missed out on.   The table settings we unique and pretty. I loved the little "g"s everywhere. I did feel however that the utensils were dull, used up and needed to be replaced, and my place mat and menu could've been a little more clean. Both times we had a male server who was pleasant but very unenthusiastic and dull. Personally, I feel that a good portion of the people choosing to dine at Giada's restaurant go for fanatical reasons, perhaps like a type of pilgrimage! And dropping some major bucks to do so. If the staff doesn't match that demeanor it can cast a completely different light on the the whole experience.   Their cocktails were delicious! I agree about the service overall- very slow. As for the food itself, as much as I love Giada and Italian food, I felt it was completely overpriced for what you get. The flavors were great, pasta fresh, but really nothing spectacular to write home about. I literally have made half of the items on her menu, which is why I was so surprised that as I was actually eating her food, it didn't really stand out any better than my renditions. The ambiance and cocktails might be enough for me to stop by for a quick drink and appetizer at the bar (somewhere where I can feel included and actually see the restaurant!), but I don't see myself dining here again. Grazie, but no grazie.

25wuLURtRiDh355rPF09WA.text: First time here. The view is nice. Service was great. Food was fantastic.  We ordered an appetizer & 2 main dishes, enough for both of us. Highlight was the Rack of lamb, melt in your mouth delicious.  It was a little pricey but totally worth it. We enjoyed our dinner very much !!!

LWKgQF-DnWz_LT4KJved6Q.text: Giada is now one of my most favorite restaurants in Vegas. I only go to  Vegas 2-3 times a year, but I know where I will be going.  - As we came up the escalator, my party of 10 was greeted by two friendly young ladies at the top. We only had to wait about 5 minutes prior to being seated. They have a cool photobooth setup which was great for bringing some fun to our short wait. Business side, I love that they had that booth there and a great way to capture emails for future marketing.  - Inside, as we all sat down I took notice of all the artwork around us. Beautiful and unique artwork all around. As for the rest of the restaurant, very great ambiance and very tidy and clean. Of course it is though, right?  - Staff was very friendly and completely sharp and on point with making our experience there the best through and through.   - Food, OMG! Don't even let me get started on the food. Superb dishes. My party mainly did big family style dishes so we had an opportunity to try most of their top picks. We didn't know too much of what to pick, so we put our trust into the staff and it was phenomenal.

C436_ezlbMZ45O-Wj707vw.text: I can imagine the pitch meeting for this restaurant...  "Listen Giada --  We're gonna do a place in Vegas with your face and name absolutely EVERYWHERE..."  So yeah, that's what it's like.  Still, we got a Groupon for $40 for breakfast or lunch plus champagne and it was a heck of deal.  I highly recommend you use the Groupon for breakfast for the biggest bang for the buck - which is what we did.  Website says they open at 8 AM but they don't.  They open at 9.  So know that.  We had built our schedule around an early breakfast and we were stuck waiting for them to open.    EVERYTHING here has Giada on it.  From the napkins to the pictures to the TV playing her shows to the bathroom towels.  It's a little weird and comes across as so heavy-handed.  I think Anne Burrell is way hotter but I like women chefs that like women, so that's just me.    Once you get past the ego trip, the place is pretty.  It's actually lovely.  And if you show up early (at the time they actually open, not the time they claim to open) you should be lucky enough to get a table by the window with a nice view.  But don't believe that you'll have a "perfect view of the Bellagio Fountains".  You can maybe see them if you stretch.  It's obstructed.  More PR.  Giada must have an awesome PR team.  I'm not someone that likes a big breakfast.  I'm good with coffee and a muffin so I did the Giada's Fresh Pastry Assortment ($5 for one pastry).  I got what they call Monkey Bread but which is essentially a chocolate croissant.  It was good and just the right size for my breakfast needs.  The coffee BTW was excellent.  As was the champagne included in our deal.  I was very happy.  My vegetarian SO got the Breakfast Contadina - two eggs served any style, crispy polenta cakes,wilted spinach, oven roasted tomatoes & toast ($17).  It was very good and satisfied her - she likes a hearty breakfast and this was perfect.  Service was just spot on.  We really enjoyed our breakfast here.  I can't imagine they offer Groupon deals that often but if you see one, GRAB IT and absolutely plan a breakfast here.  It's a steal of a deal and quite the scene.  Worth it.

jsAuh2464as7vNvIwPhCRw.text: Mediocre.  I know there are better Italian joints in Vegas and beyond, but a good friend of mine really wanted to go and since it was his birthday wish, so be it.  First, this woman is a brand.  I'm not a big fan of her cooking show (mostly about the boob) and I'm not a big fan of the cooking show either.  That being said, her establishment has a fantastic location that makes use of the glitter and neon lights of Vegas and I must admit, I had my share of fun that included the photo booth in the reception area.    The lunch menu here is limited and uninventive.  Since I was not in the mood for pizza, I opted for the Muffuletta sandwich, which was not even a full sandwich.  It was half a sandwich and served with deep fried zucchini strings.  While the sandwich was good, the bread was dense and overly hard, which made me question the freshness of it.  Second, while the zucchini shoestrings were good, the chef may want to rethink the concept since every time I went to pinch a few, it snapped a lot of the strings.  By the time I was finished, most of the zucchini shoestrings had been reduced to a series of broken matchsticks.  Pretty on the plate, not practical to consume.  Perhaps larger shavings?  My other friend ordered a pizza and she did say that the dough was very good, but the price did not reflect the single layer of prosciutto on top.   While the experience was a pleasant one due to the simple and pretty interiors as well as the waitstaff (trained, no doubt, to tell us that Giada's family prefers to eat the pizza in one manner or Giada prefers you to take a bite of this etc etc), I will not return for a second visit.  Thank you, however, for making my friend's birthday a good one.  The two cookie presentation was nice too and the Lemon Ricotta cookie was very good.

73f4R4-GyZt9nqA7seVmeA.text: So... You know when books have these very intriguing visually pleasing covers with eye-catching graphic design, well placed lettering, and a fascinating synopsis on the back? But then you actually read the contents of the book and find yourself bored? Almost feeling tricked? Yeah. Maybe a little harsh, but that's how I feel about my recent dining experience at Giada's inside the Cromwell.  I have to say I absolutely loved the ambiance. Such a beautifully decorated restaurant with warm coloring, soft lighting, and gigantic windows with a breathtaking view of the bellagio fountains & Caesar's palace -- the venue is a perfect scenario for a girls night out or a fancy date night. Our server was also very charming & friendly, not a single negative thing I can say about the restaurant itself or about the service... and that's where my 3 stars come from entirely. Like I said, the cover of the book was very intriguing.   The food? Same thing... absolutely beautiful presentation. But portions are very small, and I was disappointed by the taste of almost everything. Giada's Italian cuisine definitely has its own twist with Californian influences -- so it wasn't exactly what I was expecting. But for small portions I expect big flavor. Again, beautiful cover with a boring read. Nothing was noteworthy about this place to be honest... other than the strip view, enjoyable music playlist & chic ambiance. You're really paying for the experience, not the menu.  Ordered: - ORZO MEATBALLS: $15. Four small meatballs in marinara sauce & parmesan pomodoro. (Very bland & unremarkable) - BACON WRAPPED DATES: $15. Five gorgonzola creme filled spicy sausages. (Only thing I semi-enjoyed out of our whole meal) - SPAGHETTI: $34. Two shrimp with a lemon & basil white sauce. (Decent dish, very citrus based) - RISOTTO: $35. Two large scallops with red king crab merus & peas/asparagus. (Scallops extremely salty, risotto extremely bland) - RAVIOLI: $36. Six small lobster filled ravioli with asparagus tips & tarragon. (This resembled a microwaveable dinner, so disappointing) - WHITE LASAGNA: $35. Two jumbo prawns on top of lemon ricotta & spiced tomato broth lasagna. (Very small portion, square slice)  *We also tried to order the OYSTER CRUDO appetizer, but they were out of it... as well as the SALMON main entree. Womp womp.

BAJ7mayrldmsHZKr4O_prg.text: One of the best meals we had in Vegas and we went to several of the famous chef named restaurants. Giada's had attentive wait staff and great food. The marguerite pizza appetizer was a little too dark so my husband and I only ate half, the other half was burned. The 6 top next to us had an obnoxious drunk talking loudly and using profane language regularly as he entertained his party. I can get that atmosphere at Chili's. He even dropped his drink, he was an embarrassment and made us uncomfortable. But the food was great, scallops cooked perfectly and hubby's filet was spot on. All in all, good experience. The dessert tasting platter was amazing as was the bread to start. I can't wait to go back.

6Ox26JZ3V5nBj-Ar_hkPdQ.text: You don't hear as much about Giada being a restaurant chef so I was definitely interested to try her food. Happily, I can say I was very impressed with the brunch we had this morning. Before I get into food though, I will say there was a bit too much branding. There were "Giada"s and "G"s everywhere. Like don't get me wrong a little advertisement is good, but we knew we were eating at her restaurant without having a huge "G" on our plate.   With that said, I ordered the sunrise polenta waffle. Now I don't normally order waffles when I brunch because I'm not really into the super sweet breakfast foods. This however, was sweet and savory to the max! The base of this dish was the delicious polenta waffle studded with crispy, salty pancetta and laced with chives. It was topped with MORE crispy pancetta nuggets, 2 sunny up eggs-perfectly cooked and runny. Team Runny Yolk for life, ya know what I mean? On the side for your pouring pleasure were two sauces: maple syrup and a bechamel. Again nailing the savory and sweet.   For dessert we ordered the pastry basket (technically not a dessert but sweet enough to work). You can order one or five, I don't think it's any surprise we went with 5. In reverse order of delicious here were our choices:  5. Gluten free brownie bites- Betty Crocker proved to me you can make a bomb gluten free brownie so I know it can be done. These were not it though. They were hard, dry, not very chocolatey, all together a fail.   4. Banana muffin- This was ok, nothing memorable but I liked the mascarpone butter and caramel topping.   3. Rosemary Scone- nice play on savory and sweet. The scone was crumbly with a liberal amount of crunchy sugar on top adding a lovely texture. The rosemary added a pleasant woodsy note that I really enjoyed.   2. Chocolate Croissant Monkey Bread- I think the reason this didn't clinch the top spot was because of the name of it that I found misleading. When I think monkey bread, I think cinnamon and butter. What we got was pull-apart chocolate croissants, like 3 croissants baked next to each other so they were touching. There was nothing reminiscent of monkey bread other then the pull apart action. Naming aside these were delicious chocolate croissants. The chocolate was still melty when you bit into it, exactly as it should be.  1. Cheese Danish- this was one of the best versions of a cheese Danish I've ever had. The pastry part had layers on layers of flakiness that crackled as you bit down but melted in your mouth. The cheese center was thick and sweet-but perfectly balanced with the sharp tang from cream cheese. Home room pastry for sure!

nwcMOwHG1jsfFY5YthPfPw.text: We had 6:30 dinner the day after Christmas. Seated on time. Joseph A. was our server and was very good. I had the risotto with crab and scallops, petit filet and lemon smashed potatoes. My companion had artichoke starter, scallops on mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables. We had a Stag's Leap Chardonnay. Too full for desert but we did have coffee.  This is my second visit. Food was very good. Again.  The bill came and I supplied my CC. By the time Joseph came back I had an phone bank alert for the charge. I completed the check and we left. I have not had an alert for the tip amount. I owe Joseph his tip.  And now my gripe. I cannot find a business office number so I can call and correct the situation. I called the reservation number but they did not know what to do. A supervisor was supposed to call me. I have heard nothing yet.  Please let me tip Joseph.

-HZpsVUxn0Dwi4gg8ytX2A.text: My wife and I and 6 of our friends went to giada last night, we arrived at 8pm for an 8:15 reservation and were sat right around 8:15-8:20 in a nice center table that was round which made for a really nice group dining experience. We have been to many upscale restaurants in LV and I must say I don't understand the negative comments. The food was amazing, we had the antipasti platter for the table and everything was very very good the bacon wrapped dates were awesome. My wife and and shared the vegetable Bolognese rigatoni and the eggplant parmigiana with avocado, and broccolini as a side. Everything was great we cleaned our plates. The desserts were life changing and an after dinner espresso just topped the meal off. Our server Fred was extremely attentive and had very good suggestions. We will definitely be coming back! Great job giada!!

YNnDHjR4sjsO6tklKMC0lw.text: Highly disappointed, the second time around. We had a Groupon this time, and difference is the level of service from the waitress compared to the table next to us was unbelievable. It was our anniversary and we were hoping for a nice experience and to be catered to. We did not even get plates for the shared appetizer. My butter plate was chipped. I would not expect that at her place. The sauce which accompanied the ravioli was not hot. None of the dishes were. The arancini were the best part of the meal.

qDHyW6pV_jkMWqQATnMbKg.text: Vegas Insider Heaven!  One of the top Italian restaurants in Las Vegas.  Giada De Laurentis has the restaurant business to new heights.  Grilled cheese with prosciutto and lemon is truly a dish that sets the innovation here to new levels.  The pizza, and olives were a great combo.  The orange cappucino, and zeppole's are something you will not find at the feast of San Gennaro.  The food at Giada's are very flavorful.  The lemon grilled cheese allowed you to distinctively taste the lemon along with the sandwich.  Italian, Innovative, Iconic, Las Vegas--A True Culinary Capital!  Thanks to my Las Vegas Hoya friend for recommending!

vLmGeiwMQsmUzeAHJXFaVg.text: I cannot believe I have not yet written a review for Giada. I visited her restaurant over a year ago and it was seriously one of my favorite dining experiences I have ever had. I may be slightly biased simply because Giada is my favorite cook on the food network but the food and atmosphere really did impress me. For starters, I probably had the best arancini in my life from here. I also really loved the bread that they brought out too especially the foccacia bread. Of course we had to go with her signature lemon spaghetti shrimp and it was so incredible yet so simple. I honestly don't know how they make it taste so good. Overall, I was super pleased with just about everything and I really want to make another visit.

ZzxXjpNmmNpkaGP-G8GdIA.text: DELICIOUS DELICIOUS DELICIOUS! Been here several times and the food and service are ALWAYS on point. Drinks are amazing and food is over the top scrumptious. The staff is just as amazing. Water glasses were never empty and the server was there to get my next drink as soon as my wine glass was empty. The restaurant itself is very intimate and if you have the right table it overlooks the Bellagio fountains. They have both formal dining and a lounge area although I haven't tried out the lounge area yet. I suggest making a reservation as they always seem to have a full house whenever I do go !
