Zt_mpdQ7MLtCQ9YJFza_hw.text: Ahhh Giada! I wanted to love this place but thought it was just OK.   First, the decor of this place is amazing, it fits Giada's personality/image really well. My wife loved it!   Next, the location is great. If getting a table for 2, request a window seat to get views of the Bellagio Fountains.  Finally: the food. We went for brunch and got the brunch tasting menu. I really enjoyed the pastries and salumi plate that came out. That was probably the highlight of the meal to me. I got the Lasagna and my wife got the Italian Chicken and Waffles. Both were solid, but nothing special. Just good. For dessert, my wife got the sherbert ice cream sandwich deal and I got the Espresso Tower deal, which was basically an ice cream cake, cut large enough for 4 people to share!  If you are a Giada fan, you will like it and pick up on the vibe and atmosphere of the place. The food ranges from pretty good to really good but nothing was special.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xNEUlj00hypbAfhm-47z9Q.text: Discovered Giada after Center Cut at Flamingo, thankfully, stopped serving 30 minutes early one day.  Started looking for a nice place to dine that I could still charge to my room at Flamingo and someone recommended Giada; they're also open later and apparently don't cut new patrons off early, even on a slow Monday.  My first experience, and only thus far, was excellent.  Sat at the bar and received fantastic service from Jhovanny.  He was attentive and a pleasure to talk to.  Drinks: decided to make myself a sparkling wine flight.  A Yelp check-in got me a free glass of prosecco; well technically the check-in offer was for a "splash" of prosecco but it was sufficiently large that we'll just call it a glass.  Moved on to a CA-based sparkling wine blanc de blancs which was quite good.  Wrapped up with a glass of Moet.  No hint that any had been sitting out for long, excellent temperature.  Food: the shrimp cocktail was great.  The shrimp are the size of a baby arm, but were perfect in texture and flavor, not over or under cooked, easily eaten by hand if desired.  The cocktail sauce is supposed to be an in-house specialty; it was good, but I'm not sure I'd be as braggadocious about it as the restaurant seems to be.  Don't get me wrong; the appetizer was great, they just make a big deal of the sauce and I'm not sure I'd go that far as it wasn't a difference maker for me.  The scallops & risotto entree on the other hand; that is an entree I'd shout about.  Perfectly prepared, even at what was 10:20p on a Monday night.  If you're looking for mega portions, it isn't that, so you may want to go to Dennys instead, but it was otherwise perfect.  Will definitely be back on my next Flamingo work trip, and sorry Center Cut, but closing early let me find a much better option, so will likely never be back.

jzO_gf5Bnxwhvqsrccszsg.text: Excellent service and probably the best salmon I've ever had. Cooked just right the outside had a nice crunchy texture and the inside was juicy and very flavorful. Our water cups never went lower than half full and all the waiters were very attentive. I had the destroyer off the cocktail menu and it was good but not great probably wouldn't order it again but wasn't bad either. The food however was all very delicious. Also had the mushroom crostini appetizer and the crab arancini. Just right. Definitely bring your wallet full because this place isn't cheap but it's definitely worth every dollar. I'm bad at taking pictures but here's a screenshot of a video I did you can tell the salmons texture is just perfect

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

Im8w5r9ZTBEGS33e_rKkrA.text: I am very disappointed to say this but the service here was so bad last evening that my party decided to actually get up and leave before we placed our order. It's unfortunate since I've been to Giada many, many times in the past and enjoyed the food but service is key in the restaurant business and it has consistently declined over the past year or so.   To begin, we arrived 20 minutes before 8:15  PM reservation and were told that our table would be ready in about 15 minutes. That time came and went as did 8:30 PM and 8:45 PM., with nary an update from the srafff. While I suspect many tables were being held by diners who wanted to watch the Independence Day fireworks, there is simply no excuse for not at least telling us that we hadn't been forgotten. Many parties between two and eight came and were seated. Given that the lobby space was so crowded, I happened to be standing right next to the hostess stand and heard patrons arrive and announce their reservation time. Mind you, this was not a one hostess situation or two. There were five employees working the hostess stand. Finally after my third attempt to find out what the delay was, I lost it because the hostess didn't even seem to be able to find my name.  We were immediately seated at a table next to the bus station in the corner. Speaking to the manager was a total and absolute sham. He told us tyhe other people who would been seated before us had reserved with a credit card. I have worked in restaurants long enough to know that the credit card reservation ploy is... Absolute BS as a way of avoiding being in more hot water. I have made many reservations online and in person and on the phone at Giada and never once have I ever been asked for a credit card.  To placate us the manager said that when they opened the windows for the fireworks we were welcome to walk over and take pictures. That was the absolute last straw. Not only do they keep repeat customers waiting for an hour on a reservation while others were seated in front of them, they chose a corner by the waiter's station and then had no good reason for it.   Yes there was an offer to comp dessert. I specifically told the manager I wasn't looking for comps, only good service and a nice table for having waited so long. By that time the evening was truly ruined and I decided better to just leave because I really don't like making a scene.  On the way out the hostess tried to apologize and say they were finding us a better table. I simply told her that the evening was ruined, I wouldn't be back and the staff at Giada has a lot to learn about service.

9kfWW8TGekMzbQ7Qvvhbkw.text: Wow! Just.. where do I start?! Amazing ambiance! Our server, Billy, greeted us with a big smile and made my wife & I feel so welcomed. Especially since this is our first time dining here. He recommended the Palm which was such a great & refreshing juice drink. My wife ordered the from the brunch tasting menu & everything so far has tasted delicious. I ordered the "pizza carbonara & it was just as good. We will definitely be coming back next time we are in town. Most likely bring the in-laws for their birthday in August :)

F5qsIfFn4Pgruq-kSu0fcg.text: I pulled onto the Las Vegas Strip and the first thing I see is the word "Giada" lit up on the side of the Cromwell. I think to myself, "that can't be Giada, like the chef can it?" I'm a huge Giada fan and have several of her cookbooks, I was intrigued. Well I go about my trip and finally, on a Saturday night, we find ourselves with no plans for dinner. I jump at the chance to call up Giada and get a reservation, which was a cinch.   Let's start with decor...it is amazing. It is sophisticated, modern, and a bit Californian, just like our beloved chef. It is decorated with lots of white furniture, natural wood, clean lines with the occasional pop of color. The ambiance is great with lit candles everywhere and dim lights, I was instantly relaxed.   We decided to head to the bar and order some of the custom cocktail creations before our reservation. I opted for the Giada take on a Pisco Sour, I can't remember the name. So dang good and frothy. At dinner we each ordered our own meal but ordered a couple of starters to snack on and share before. We shared the Arugula Salad that had this huge piece of parm laying delicately across the top, so yummy. We shared a Crostini, some other cheeses, and some salamis. In all honesty, that is all we needed we were stuffed. But I got the Lobster Ravioli and it was so rich and delicious. I only needed three bites and I was satisfied. We decided to ditch dessert and get glasses of Proseco that were perfection. The server's recommendation was on point.   So why a four star review? I felt a little blindsided by the server. Look, I get the upsell, I was a server for many moons. But to totally embellish about the dishes was shocking. Our server said we would need to order 2-3 dishes as the restaurant was tapas style. So that's what we did. Um no, our dishes, including the apps, salads, and entrees were a full size. Now were they chain restaurant sized portions? No, but they were a full dinner plus some to take home sized. I felt like she did this to make the bill increase, and we walked out spending about $50 each more than we should have.   Overall the food was fantastic: fresh, light, full of flavor, and not over the top. I would definitely come back, especially as the menu is seasonal and is consistently changing!

A6Y_-yqlJKBhphPsHT5vug.text: Everything was delightful! From the hostesses, servers, food, drinks, ambiance, & the view. Our waiter Andrew was very quick in making sure our dining experience was successful. He was funny, knowledgeable with all our question, honest with his suggestions even with things regarding the strip and great with getting our dishes. His partner was very quick in making sure our drinks were always full. We had a groups of 5. We ordered the Orzo and Calamari appetizers, and they were so good! Our group ordered Scallops, Salmon, Spaghetti, Lobster Ravioli and Broccolini - we shared everything and loved everything! It was all so very tasty! We ordered 2 desserts shared as well: souffle, hazelnut brownie. We love coming here! Always such an enjoyable dining experience.

They either don't know what they're talking about or are holding a grudge for some reason.        Do yourself a favor and visit this place if you're in Vegas.   I don't believe you'll be disappointed.

yOlrWYI-gXarj9hGjEESMA.text: I came to Giada's with high expectations because she's my favorite food network chef. Have to say I was a little bit disappointed. The food overall was okay, I think it really depends on what you order. The top dish would probably be the lobster ravioli, I HIGHLY recommend (there were humongous chunks of lobster meat and no fillers). The disappointments were the burrata, nothing special just a piece of cheese on a plate, the arugula salad sounded good on the menu description but was highly highly over salted :( and I had to force myself to finish because I felt it was pricey, another disappointment was my bucatini--I found a string at the middle of the plate. The good news was that our waiter was extremely apologetic and gave it to us on the house. I wasn't too unhappy about the string, especially because it could've been a lot worse (a hair, or something more gnarly lol). The dessert ended things on a sweet note I do have to say! The white coffee was probably the most interesting flavor of the night, never tried anything like it. Would've been cool if Giada had made a special appearance haha

m-l_LE388TRACYGQUL6aDQ.text: The complementary bread before our meals was the most impressive part of our experience. I had the lobster ravioli that came swimming in a lemon butter sauce. As a result, I was up until 4am extremely sick...equivalent to food poisoning symptoms.

1gcQmPAE4QIBnkQ67gZI9Q.text: The lemon shrimp spaghetti I had was just perfect!!! I loved the ambiance, you get a beautiful view to the strip if you are lucky enough to snag a window seat. This is definitely a romantic spot. It is pricey, but I guess that's the norm when it's a celebrity owned restaurant. A definite must try!

jxyxcHHcOD9v6J3sPk9E3A.text: 70th Birthday party for 19 people.  We were not disappointed.  We had a private room with a special dinner menu.  Everything was served family style.  The staff was super attentive and on top of their responsibilities.  Cocktails first of course.  Bread and cheese arrived first with pesto and butter and other side dishes.  We needed more pesto!  First course was a meat antipasto and salad.  Second course was pasta- bucatini and veggie rigatoni which was exquisite.  Third course was salmon, fried chicken and filet.  All were perfect.  The dessert trays were amazing!  We had two really fine red wines poured throughout the meal.  We finished with espressos and coffees and everyone agreed it was an amazing birthday celebration.  If you are bringing a large party ask for the private dining room.  You won't be disappointed.

CjjMPEWlYFgCkGfkxKbMGg.text: Had a fantastic time at Giada today with the crew!  I ordered the parpadelle (braised short ribs with arugula and peppers on a bed of noodles) and a side of brussel sprouts.  Both were absolutely amazing.  As a table we also tried the bacon wrapped dates (picture not included as they were inhaled), the lobster ravioli, the lemon potatoes, and the short ribs.  All were very tasty and we finished the meal with a small cookie plate!  In addition the view from the table let me watch the Bellagii fountains show multiple times!!!  Great atmosphere and excellent service

ImComVU4FXzLZl5T1MYxZg.text: We were so looking forward to this place and we were rather disappointed.  We ordered a number of small plates to sample and share. Many of them were so greasy we could not enjoy them (eggplant, arancini, and others).  Atmosphere was beautiful.  Wine was pricey but delicious.

aQl4e7odGRdHezj8RZtJsQ.text: Overpriced and overrated. The restaurant was so uncomfortably warm that we were sweating. Seating uncomfortable. Pasta dish tasted exactly like spagetti o's but 20x more expensive.  Definitely would save my money and go to margaritaville next time. only positive is the view out the window of the bellagio fountains.

HP61TteycSL9EpGwMSq6Vw.text: I am a huge Giada fan and had been dying to try her restaurant. My fiance and I went for my birthday dinner, and it was everything I hoped it would be. We asked for a table with a nice view, and were sat by a window overlooking the Strip. The ambiance and service were great.   As for the food, my fiance ordered a meatball appetizer, arugula salad, and risotto with scallops. He particularly liked the salad and risotto. I had an eggplant parm appetizer, beet salad, and vegetable Bolognese. All were good, but the vegetable Bolognese in particular was so delicious. We ordered cookies for dessert, which came with a lemon ricotta cookie, a chocolate peanut butter cookie with a raspberry filling, and a brown butter chocolate chip cookie. I was also given a plate with an extra lemon ricotta and choc peanut butter as a birthday treat. All were tasty, but the chocolate peanut butter one was definitely my favorite.   The best part of our evening came in between our salad and entree course. We noticed a bit of commotion at the table next to us and quickly realized that Giada was there, chatting and taking pictures with every table. When she got to our table, we got to chat with her for a few minutes and she wished me a happy birthday, congratulated us on our engagement, and took a couple pictures with us.  I would've been completely happy with my experience at the restaurant even without Giada being there, but it definitely made my night. I'm so glad we were able to try out her restaurant, and would love to go back in the future.

gDsRSgAVFudY3rPgXFPOsg.text: It was okay. Was expecting more, since it's so hard to get a reservation.  Nice ambience.

s2S-GL7ntSaovlLYthDayA.text: We had the special 5-course menu that included a signed photo of Giada  and free recipe cards to go with it! This was last year and if they are still offering this then I highly recommend it. Just plan on staying for several hours because it is a True culinary experience! The dessert cart was divine! This is one of the few restaurants on the Strip that I wouldn't mind going to as a local who prefers to stay away from the busy tourist traffic. Did I mention the great views?!

E6SSHxMzDQFfKI29pxhZ4Q.text: Ice cold air conditioning to start on a over cast no sun day. Out of 30 people dining for lunch 20 of them were complaining about how cold it was and we're moving tables like us.. then get a crappy attitude waiter , can't smile once , asked for substitute , wanted grilled chicken sandwich instead of unhealthy grilled cheese , chef basically said we can only do it one way , great attitude when chicken is very easy to change up and make guest happy , turn off.  Had to order something I didn't really want...3rd time here so disappointed,  prob won't return,  that's how easy you lose business. . Management ?  Love giada tho ..

EF5IY4313kBEjadnd9mAfg.text: Ok to start reservation made for 4 at 9pm. We got there and they said they had 3 people for 915pm.   At 945 pm still had not been seated  MGR paid for drinks and finally sat us.  We live in Las Vegas and can tell you the atmosphere is pretty good. The food better than average.  The management a little lacking.    Would we go back.  Probably if there was event there but I doubt we would make a special trip as we would not want to wait 30-45 minutes after reservation scheduled to eat.   I mean if the food was a 10 maybe.  But it's better than average so there is no reason to wait that long.  I think once the "new factor" wears off they will have to step it up to compete in that market against stiff competition.

g6IoFwC-KNWeG4p6dkE-dg.text: We had breakfast at Giada's and it was underwhelming. Our eggs were mediocre at best - they were dry, and not very tasty. The frittata that I ordered didn't even come with a slice of toast. It was pitiful. And my aunt had scrambled eggs which were unseasoned and bland. The lemon smashed potatoes didn't taste like lemon at all... they tasted like dried out potatoes that had been left out all day. yuck. don't go here. save your money.

KoF2BoeMwfY_GFcfDuE1Kg.text: Fabulous experience. Sat by the window and over looked the strip! Service was top notch and I will be returning again soon.

O7x5PPah4eD18GMHlaziGQ.text: Awesome food, over-the-top friendly staff (including the GM who stopped at every table to thank customers for coming in) and amazing views of the Strip and Bellagio fountain. I'm looking forward to returning with a large group and utilizing the private dining space by the bar. Order the sparkling sangria, it is delish!!

H3TzjtcizoLX2naPmlpbJQ.text: Hands down the nicest dining experience I have ever had!  My wife and I went for my 40th birthday dinner. From start to finish was exemplary. Upon being seated we were greeted by the manager Laurant, and invited to a table which had just come available.  It was a wonderful window table with an amazing view.  We started with two outstanding signature cocktails and four appetizers. Orzo meatballs, marinated olives, a blue cheese plate with pears and honeycomb and a crostini. By the time we were done with the appetizers we had gotten into our bottle of wine which was suggested to us by Darius, the master sommelier. He nailed it.  Next was a kale salad and it was fabulous. Our last dish was a truffle barley pasta. All dishes were genuinely flavorful and delightful.  To finish it all off we had a couple of little desserts and coffee.  Our server Kevin allowed my to enjoy my dishes at my pace. I eat slow and savor my meals. I felt comfortable to enjoy the ambience, my wife, the view, the wine, and the food for all it was worth.  Thanks to all at Giada!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HBD dessert plate.

g2z1NaWgPEP3GUYCfOSivg.text: This was our first visit to Giada's in Las Vegas, and we were not disappointed.  We started with Giada's Favorite antipasti platter.  The assorted items were delicious.  Then came the entrees--I had the salmon and my husband had the Rack of Lamb.  Both were perfectly cooked and so tasty.  This was among the best lamb we've eaten (yes, I ate one of the pieces).    Did I say the service was also top notch?  As busy they were tonight, our waiter Ron was on top of things.  His suggestions for my wine was spot on.  His assistants kept our glasses full and diligently cleared the plates when done.  The manager even came over to greet us and see how things were for us.  Although Giada wasn't in the house, the staff certainly made us feel at home.  Finally, they also serve complimentary Parmesan lavosh, rosemary bread, and breadsticks with the dinner.  Eating it with the pesto or the marscapone butter, which they provide as condiments, really makes a great addition to the meal.  This is certainly a celebrity chef restaurant that lives up to its reputation.

EGY6Q2Wg6joWOQuVkRPNHQ.text: Wonderful meal! The rack of lamb was perfectly cooked and so tender. The crab and scallop risotto was delicious. Started with a fab Giada's Fav antipasto. Nice Tuscany wine selection, reds were tasty. All that was left of the lemon bundt cake dessert were crumbs. This place met our expectations, a bit pricey, but worth every bite! The service was great, especially from Ron and his crew. We will be back!

DRX5Up4x0MhZ1dWVv0n07A.text: We had a table with a view which I would say makes the experience just that much more memorable!  We started with the Olives, the roasted mushrooms and the Orozo Meatballs. All very tasty, but by far the mushrooms are a must if you enjoy mushrooms. The Meatballs were good, but a little lacking in flavor which seems to be the consensus with other reviews. Nothing a pinch of salt won't fix, better not enough salt then to much!  The sauce from the meats balls in the other hand we all wanted to eat with the bread and everything else!    I orders the Hannibal as a cocktail which was way to much ice not enough Hannibal, but the taste was good. Not my favorite , but still tasty and great with my meal.  We had the risotto with scallops , the spaghetti signature dish, salmon (which believe it or not in my opinion was the best dish of the night)  and the 7oz filet!  For sides asparagus which was delicious , potatoes were super tasty and my all time favorite the corn!  I ended up adding the corn the the spaghetti which made the spaghettini a super delicious dish because of of all the flavor in the corn that it added to the pasta.  Deserts we  all amazing and the lemoncello did not disappoint.  For sure a good place for a date or a special event as it was easy to carry conversation and the views of the stop are good .

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! Lemon cookie good, but for sure need coffee to help ! cheesecake soft and very tasteful and chocolate bar amazing!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hanabal

3qRLB7_jVTkBlHyvWejFVA.text: Food was good but the menu offered was not all available which seemed very poor considering the price and venue. They had a handful of cocktails on the menu and two I asked about were unavailable because they had run out of the ingredients. I ordered the Tubetti Carbobara which was delicious but came with Penne instead of Tubetti when the sauce would have been much better with the menu listed pasta. When I asked why the pasta was different from the Tubetti I ordered the waitress told me they had run out. I think I should have been told about that beforehand rather than being given a substitute with no warning.  The sandwich ordered by my dining partner was taken from the deli counter at the front of restaurant which was a shame: you want to feel that your food is made fresh at a restaurant, especially when you're paying $18 for a sandwich! The venue is great though, with a bright open space that's refreshing in Vegas. The only pity was when they opened the expansive windows and the noise of the Strip and the smell of smoke from the Casino below started taking over the ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy cocktail. Second choice because the one on the menu I ordered first  wasn&#39;t in stock. Menu update Giada?
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tubetti pasta on the menu was delivered to the table as Penne pasta instead. The recipe needs Tubetti. Shame.

iKkDB7IeSvIVv-4abWUlkw.text: One word can describe our experience ..... Incredible. We took two friends and our two small children in the mid afternoon and did not have one single negative. The furniture was the most comfortable I have ever sat in at a restaurant.  The staff was wonderful and accommodating (especially with 2 small kids).  Monkey was throughly pleased by every aspect of the restaurant. Outstanding!!!!!!!!!!

cCRQSwpc8Itp0v5f4nOmdQ.text: After watching countless T.V Shows with Giada's cooking, along with her prestine hair and perfectly polished makeup (not to mention killer body), I was convinced her food was good for you and probably super tasty. So for my birthday my husband got us reservations to Giada. Even though we had reservatons we still had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. That was annoying, but not even close to as annoying as our wait staff! After we were seated, they provided us with menus. The waiter then went into his sales pitch about buying the 'all inclusive three course meal for $199. He went on about how you are getting 3 courses and its specialty items that Giada hand selected. I'm like "woah, an appetizer, entree, and dessert for $199??!!!" we said no and asked to look over the menu for a minute. Well it didn't end there. Another server came over to attempt to talk us into purchasing the major expensive meal deal. I felt like I was at a car dealership. We said no and then ordered the entree's we wanted instead (which were still at least $40 per entree)... The portion size was barely enough to feed a 4 year old. I couldn't believe it. But the worst part was the flavor. There wasn't any! I had been salivating at the  mouth just thinking about trying one of Giada's dishes. And this is what I get? I could have literally had a better meal at wolf gang pucks! What a let down. Then for my birthday they offered a special dessert for free. I literally starting laughing when it arrived. It was a small butter cookie the size of a half dollar. Gee, thanks Giada.

pbddWoqrTW-NyE1DpvQB4g.text: Average experience MADE EXCELLENT BY THE GENERAL MANAGER, Laurent Ertle.  They need time to figure things out, go in 2015.

k8M6LnHviluo3w846MWJIQ.text: The food was amazing and the service was top notch!  It was a nice balance between attentive and yet unrushed.

oSXHwxfHZvFkIHhyv12uPw.text: I am a huge fan of Giada, so I was very excited to support her and her restaurant. I had made reservations in advance for 11 am on a Sunday morning and was told that it would be breakfast time when i arrived. Not wanting to waste any time i looked up in advanced what i had wanted to order online. My friend & I ended up arriving 30 mins late due to the rain and having a very hard time finding the parking structure to the Cromwell hotel. Needless to say, we didn't make breakfast & it was already lunch time when we had arrived. We had to take the long way thru the flamingo hotel, and it was a bit of a pain in the ass.  Anyways! We were seated right away and i loved how cute the hostesses dresses were. it was very "giada" like. The service was def up to par, the managers checked up on us three times asking if we needed anything and if the entrees were delicious. Our server was very knowledgeable and very patient with us, while we decided what to order. We didn't order her recommendations but what we got were delicious! The complimentary flat bread and pesto was AMAZING. So fresh & delicious. I ordered the Arugula salad with pancetta, candied lemon peels, and freshly shaved Parmesan cheese. I thru on an order of the shrimp and got two HUGE shrimps. the salad was one of the best salads i have ever had. It was very simple but tasted SO good. I do think however, it needed some kind of crunch.. maybe some walnuts or pecans perhaps. I also ordered a vanilla tea which was also good but was rather on the cold side. my friend ordered a pepperoni pizza which she enjoyed but it wasn't necessarily amazing... I wasn't really feeling the decor on the inside but the outside of the restaurant looked nice. Towards the end when we got our bill... it was around 50 dollars, which i thought to be pretty cheap.. but then again i paid 22 dollars for salad.. Lol.  All in all I will be back in August to try dinner!! (:

y9RJmB_WPrbK5OJxRF5_hQ.text: Well this is a first for me this year. FIVE STARS!   Giadas in the Cromwell hotel across from Caesars is the place. After a warm welcome and we were shown to our table overlooking the strip and a view of the mountains which was a beautiful setting. Beautifully appointed restaurant. Fred was our main guide through the meal along with Joshua, serving. Prefect service!!   We started with an array of appetizers. Orzo meatballs, bresaola, arugula salad, chicken Marsala meatballs. Good portion sizes. VMain courses included the petit fillet, the Mediterranean white fish call branzino and mine, mine was the risotto with crab, scallops and asparagus. Perfect. We all split the dessert...thanks Diego for convincing us we should indulge. A dark chocolate amaretto something. Wow, don't let the small size fool you, its richness was easily enough for 3 people to share. Bene! A+ food, A+ service. Also, thank you Scott for stopping by to see how are meal was.   Everything was fresh, house made including the pastas, bread and more  Recommendations: make your reservation well in advance. Consider dining earlier in the evening as its a bit more quiet. You could wear casual, but hey, dress up. This is a elegant restaurant.   I will certain be back to enjoy their many choices and a real taste of Italy.  Mille grazie!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xTC8JiD6OnQtYycxmGsLLg.text: We had 13 people for dinner last night and everyone raves about the food, wine, and service. Great private room and we loved it. Lots of appetizers and we tried every main corse and loved them all. Will definitely go back on our next trip to Vegas

NnG0SJNxlmBK9LgO4L_hCQ.text: One would think for a celebrity chef, the food would be incredible. I am telling you it was a huge disappointment and not worth the price.  We ordered two salads and 2 pastas to share with our party. The pasta sauces lacked flavor of any kind. It needed some salt, fat, pepper, herbs, and spices. It just tasted like mushed veggies. The salads were delicious, though. Crisp greens and perfect amount of dressing. You don't really come to an Italian restaurant for the salads though so the disappointing pastas really were just a huge let down for the entire experience.   Our server, Tim, was incredible. He was very personable, professional, and attentive. I commend him for all of his hard work for our party. As for the bartender, I didn't get his name, he could really use a lesson in personality. He was so dull and seemed inconvenienced I wanted a separate check from my manager for our two cocktails. La Strada was an incredible cocktail regardless.   This place has a lot of potential with a great location, view, and ambiance but needs to work on their recipes to really invoke Italian flavors and iconic dishes.

S-moCziLAfpViED80a-FsQ.text: I've always been a fan of Giada's.  She's one of my favorite Food Network celebrity chefs.  I've met her twice and own Giada autographed cookbooks.  She's also a UCLA Bruin which is pretty cool.  When I found out that I'd be in town for a family event, I booked a reservation at Giada on our free night via Open Table.  I had to adjust the reservation slightly when we booked a show on the same evening which wasn't a problem.  We arrived at the Cromwell and the valet asked if we were dining at Giada which we indeed were.  He even offered to give us directions to the restaurant.  It was pretty easy to follow the path and signs within the Cromwell.    Our reservation was at 5:30 pm and we arrived at 5:15 so we took advantage of the free photo booth and took some pictures.  There's an option to print them right there, send via email or post on Facebook.  We opted for the print and received 2 copies.  After the photos, we sat and waited until they were ready to take us into the restaurant.  There were a few parties ahead of us who arrived at the time of their reservation and they were seated before us, no big deal.  I did notice that all of the hostesses seemed to be wearing very short LBDs.  No judgement as it is Vegas, but according to my boyfriend, my LBD was modest compared to theirs.  We were escorted past the big window and seated against a wall.  It would have been nice to have been seated by the window but I could see the view just fine from my seat and the bright lights of the Bellagio signage.  Our waiter was fantastic and he brought an iPad for us to peruse the different types of antipasti, cocktails, wines, and beers they offer, while he went to get us some water.  We opted for two of the film inspired signature cocktails ($15): Serpico and Barbarella.  Of the two, the Serpico was my favorite with the smooth bourbon and the fun ice sphere with a "G" inside of it.  The Barbarella was fruity but not too sweet and gin based.  It was also made with ginger beer so it was like a Moscow mule but with gin.     For our meal, we decided on the spinach & buffalo ricotta pizzette with roasted garlic puree & porchetta ($14), mustard crusted rack of lamb served with braised beluga lentils, roasted rainbow cauliflower & vincotto ($51) and the Barolo braised Australian wagyu beef short rib served with soft polenta and garden vegetables ($52).  They brought out a spectacular complimentary bread tray.  It came with parmesan bread sticks, cheesy flat crisps, rosemary garlic roll along with lemon butter and pesto sauce.  Can I just say that Oprah's "I have bread everyday" came into my head as I ate this?  Because if I could have this bread tray everyday, I'd be a happy girl.    Our pizzette came out and looked amazing, until we tasted it.  It had an overwhelmingly fishy taste to it.  I had a slice and so did my boyfriend.  I asked him if he tasted the fishiness too and he confirmed my suspicion.  There was nothing on the menu that indicated it was seafood based so we could only assume that they cooked the spinach in the wrong pan.  When our waiter asked how everything was, we asked if the pizzette was supposed to taste fishy.  He immediately offered to take it back and asked if we wanted to replace it.  We felt bad since we had eaten half of it but he assured us that if we didn't like it, he would take it back and take it off the bill.  That was an amazing gesture and I applaud him for his hospitality.  Our entrees arrived shortly after and I have to say, the braised short rib is fork tender, delicious.  The lamb chops were perfectly cooked too.  The lentils were savory and had an amazing flavor.  Normally, I'm not a fan of lentils but I was a fan of these.  We were impressed by the meal, ambiance, and service at Giada.  We didn't have time for dessert, but I did take a look at the dessert menu and I would have ordered something chocolate hazelnut.  Buon Appetito!

-Nglfrbz4minkuzwuEMEcQ.text: FYI, our experience here took place in late 2014.  So this review may be pretty useless to everyone, but I am writing it anyways because we had a fabulous time at Giada!!  We were very lucky to have lunch at Giada.  It is highly recommended that you make reservations months ahead of time.  We had no reservations.  My wife called and lo and behold, there was a cancellation.  She said that if we arrived there within 30 minutes, they would have a table for us.  The folks at Giada were True to their word.  We only waited about 10 minutes before being seated.  While we waited, we had fun taking selfies inside their photo booth.  The ambiance of Giada is exquisite and charming.  The view of the Las Vegas Strip from our table was lovely.  The table settings were beautiful and unique.  5 stars for the atmosphere!  Service was excellent.  From the hostesses to the busboy to our waitress, the customer service was polite, efficient, and professional.  5 stars!!  Now to the most important part.  The food was 4 to 5 stars delicious!!  All of the dishes were served tapas style so portions were smaller.  Note that some of the items we had may no longer be offered on their current menu. Here is a quick rundown of what we had:  Birdie was a refreshing drink with strawberry and basil. Dolce Vita was another very refreshing drink.   Muffuletta Sandwich is one tasty sandwich. The combination of the porchetta, provolone, and other ingredients was so flavorful! G's Baked Pasta was delish!  Pancetta Egg Pizza was different and yummy! Orzo Meatballs were really good! Chocolate Tiramisu looked beautiful and tasted wonderful too. Cookie Platter had 3 different types of cookies.  All were quite good. Zeppoles are citrus infused italian doughnuts. Hmm...Hmm...good!!!  Based on our very good experience here, Giada rates 5 stars from me!!  Thanks for a wonderful and memorable time!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada is everywhere
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some table settings

cKEGhjkXfA7RYzxcwTBbFg.text: Our dinner at Giada was outstanding.   We were promptly seated at a table with the most incredible view of the Strip and lovely Bellagio fountains.  The tables are spaced far enough away from each other that you can easily converse with each other and noise level is very acceptable.   We did not have the dinner tasting menu because the entire table must opt in.  Our salads both arugula and romaine were perfectly dressed and each enough to share.  The grilled octopus was tender and moist...just divine.  The crab and scallop risotto and pasta sampler of all four pastas was perfectly cooked.  We also ordered the Branzino was flaky and moist with perfectly crisp skin. Our table of four split the Tiramisu cheesecake...it was rich and just enough.    The service is efficient without being overbearing.  Nancie our server deserves a shout out for being so pleasant and accommodating...we never felt rushed. We all thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience at Giada and we look forward to our next visit.   Do not miss the photo booth on your way out...a fun finale.

q7UBsGh7UCrhs2ZjqCvQXg.text: Had a wonderful lunch here yesterday. Its actually become somewhat of a ritual when visiting LV. We started with a round of fabulous drinks (the Frose, red sangria and bellini) ...then shared a burrata...followed by some delish (pasta only...no potato) gnocchi, the pesto lemon grill cheese and the mortadella pizza.  Service was excellent...as usual. Definitely going to keep this tradition going!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria, Frose and Bellini...in that order

bZeZWV6KG1EQI92zHfEh1Q.text: First off, I did not know how pretty this restaurant was and did not know what to expect. .Went here in a party of 5 to celebrate my sisters birthday and was amazed with the experience. Yes the food was great, the view was priceless but what I was mostly impressed about was the service we received.  Turley was our main server but all the other servers were so hands on that it seemed like we had more than one server. Turley was so welcoming and hospitable. As a group of 5 girls, yes we were a bit needy. We asked him like 50 questions then annoyed him to take 50 pictures but he was super nice and answered everything very politely and with his knowledge. Turley definitely deserves 5 stars.  *do keep in mind that the Cromwell started charging for valet services*

7tsG1H4HqgGzhtz3JhCUrA.text: Date night was a success we finally made it!not quite:( I'm sorry we both were not that impressed just another overpriced celebrity chef restaurant. The view is nice though.

-zyfFU80yKwxSB4au4Gthw.text: I was so excited to eat here and it did not disappoint! My husband and I shared the mushroom arancini as an appetizer and they were delicious! I ordered the rigatoni with vegetable bolognese and my husband chose the bucatini. Both were scrumptious and we would order them again! No room for dessert, unfortunately, but when we come back we want to try the tiramisu cheesecake! Oh, and our server, Rocco, was truly fabulous and made the experience all the better!

V81tvKrChdJDu3NufwQ3Pg.text: Amazing amazing amazing. I am admittedly a Giada fan (recipes from her cookbooks always turn out great), but despite my bias, this place is awesome. I took my mom out for a fancy dinner, and it was incredible.   The wait for reservations is at least a month out, so reserve early on open table. Don't forget to use the photo booth by the waiting area!  Filet was perfect, lemon salad was amazing, orzo meatballs were good, desserts were great. View of the Bellagio fountains was awesome. I will come here every time I'm in Vegas.

yiKsfPkOolgDKUm42VHJKA.text: I will start with the most alarming fact- the waiters told customers that if they went on YELP while in restaurant and gave highest rating that they would get two free glasses of champagne or cookies to take home. This practice undermines the value of Yelp!   Just ate there last night and came away very disappointed. Food was okay, but overall experience was bad. Typical celebrity restaurant in Vegas. Giada should upgrade the staff to match the price point.  Hostesses were clueless and chewed gum the whole time. Waiters/others never made eye contact with you and were generally impersonal. Collected our payment before the rest of our expensive  bottle of wine was served to us from the chill bucket located from the table. We had to ask if there was more wine left to pour. Prices VERY HIGH for experience, and we are used to high priced restaurants, so that was not the problem.  We love you Giada and hope you get more involved with this operation.

HoV0OoKIeVkBsYeDDAPnzQ.text: Food and service were excellent.  I ordered the bacon breakfast sandwich on the biscuit  (forget the exact title). It was fabulous. Never have I ever had a biscuit that was that good. It's not just a plain buttermilk biscuit either. I have no idea what the correct name for it would be but whatever it is, it's good.  My husband got the sausage egg sandwich.  He loved it.  We both got the potatoes with our breakfast sandwich and we both loved them.  We spilt the polenta waffle with strawberries and grilled pineapple. It was mouth watering good.  All the sandwiches were so big we only ate a little less than half.   My husband and I also ordered cappuccinos. They were fabulous as well.

nd4nkYNGJHmEFzh_DzRe5w.text: I thought it was going to be better what i expected and unfortunately it wasn't. The food was ok i was expecting more out of her restaurant just because she's know as the Italian queen of food. The photo booth was fun and cool. The staff was really nice, i just wish the food was a little better it just lacked flavor especially for the price.

EDFhXuxiU-HrM1cuysEo-g.text: Pretty good.  The pasta flight was tasty but the portions were very small.  My wife and I split it as an appetizer but as a main course probably wouldn't fill you up.  My main dish,  branzino was not really branzino, tasted like a trout of some sort.  Wouldn't recommend this dish.  Asked the person that came to our table to check on how we liked the food and she swore up and down it was branzino but it wasn't. They substituted some other fish.  Wouldn't go back.

8vlli8DjwgOEOyj5W0a8pw.text: My friends visited from the other part of the globe. My husband and I already went here beforehand and enjoyed it, so I really recommended it to my friends. Unfortunately when we came back the second time it was an underwhelming experience  Pastas were either too thick or undercooked; meatballs and my husband's fave bacon-wrapped dates were only so warm and did not taste as great as we had them before, for some reasons. The seven of us couldn't get a reservation earlier than 9.30 pm that night,  so maybe the quality of the food decreased dramatically around that time?   Our company enjoyed the drinks which were tasty and great. Service was always great although our server had problems with some slow-running tablets that night. We were able to see some parts of the Bellagio's water fountain show from our table, which was a plus.  Not sure if we will be coming back...

vO3ELd9NNDH79TeQ7AsNkg.text: My Aunt & her best friend took me to Giada's for a yummy birthday dinner. First impressions of the restaurant very classy and warm. The normal feeling if being at a very nice place to eat. We were seated shortly after we got there. Unfortunately, had to ask someone who was not our waiter for menu's they were not very prompt on greeting us with menus or water.   They did have an interesting addition to the menu called a tasting menu. Had about a 5 course meal to choose from. Too much food for us. But also had some of her recipes included.  We order bubbly wine & a couple of appetizers. A mozzarella cheese ball very moist & full of flavor. Also some bacon wrapped dates with a lil'chilly & blue cheese. Very flavorful.   We all order something different on the menu to try. I had the lobster ravioli, aunt had the spaghetti lemon & her best friend had the risotto with Scallops. All very tasty.   Lastly we had all split a wonderful chocolate tart dessert. Looked like a Reese's peanut butter cup. Had a yummy raspberry sauce drizzled on it with blackberry's & edible gold flakes. Just enough goodness to please the chocolate lovers.   Overall very good experience & great food. Definitely make a reservation. Great view of the strip & Bellagio fountains. Food is not on the cheap side but definitely a good date night.

0ReEk0FS2z-42WqG3pzdjg.text: Our first visit here (my husband's all time favorite). We didn't have a reservation and waited just over 30 mins for a table for three.  We relaxed in the waiting area and had some free fun in the photo booth. Our table was overlooking The Bellagio and it couldn't have been nicer. Our server was absolutely lovely, knowledgable, attentive but not too much. The food... Oh my the food!  We only had antipasto but it was stunning. The bread was fresh out of the pizza ovens, hot light and just enough salt. We had cheese plates, mushrooms and prosciutto with a delightful bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. For desert we had the tower of chocolate and the lemon souffle- outstanding. A little pricey, but worth every penny.

6521Uk0gp-C-7pFND6jblg.text: Omg this reataurant was GORGEOUS. Entrance to Giada was amazing, and the interior was bright and had amazing views of the strip. Staff was extremely friendly and it was easy to tell they were really proud to work there. Here's what I ordered:  Hannibal: it was like a tiny fishbowl! Boyfriend enjoyed this drink   Raspberry nectar agave iced tea: omg cutest and fanciest presentation ever! MUST GET THIS! The nectar liquid sugar was so good!!!  Bread: presentation was so cute and so Giada! Loved the lemon butter mm. Mix it with pesto! Yummy  Orzo meatballs: so so soft! Came with 5 - they were tiny but a good appetizer! Delicious!   Lemon spaghetti with shrimp: shrimp was HUGE! Literally the size of a baby lobster. So crunchy and so succulent! Don't be fooled by the "lemon" because it was pretty salty! But balanced perfectly with the shrimp. Spaghetti cooked PERFECTLY!  Lobster ravioli: there was a tarragon flavor which I was not a fan of! Flavor was just really citrus-y and not what I expected at all. Skip this dish!

I7jVEtiDPCT7p6dLWYNqDA.text: Only Giada not being there last night to help celebrate my cousin's 50th birthday would've made it 5 stars!! Awesome dinner and atmosphere. Would love to get books for some of those dishes we had...

HqBGzhKPLBLHhJCSrvMnhQ.text: Veal Milanese... too greasy, thick and overcooked.  I love Giada, the restaurant is nice but the food is awful. For an amazing Veal try Carbone or Il Molino!!  The lemon pasta with shrimp was so cheesy that it was imposible to eat. The whole pasta was stuck together- NOT GOOD! The shrimp Itself was tasty. We ordered several plates and the only one I really enjoyed was the arugula salad! Vegas has so many great Italian restaurants I felt I lost a night here! Made it up at Carbone the next day, and the had lunch at Cucina which is also amazing!!

ovggdUXaaHFCEW3ZE9urlw.text: I couldn't have wished or imagined anything more fantastic than my dining experience at Giada's restaurant.  Every bite was divine and the hospitality was top notch from my first steps off the escalator to the last sip of my vino.  It's been a sublime night and one I will cherish deeply.    Thank you Giada, Nancy(waitress) and all the staff for making my birthday dinner so special.

YKkDM4XywGiKSRcTzG7XNw.text: This place is so romantic . Our server his named was Joseph , he's amazing he knows what he was doing . He told me to try the ravioli lobster . I did and it was Bonn and I took his opinion for a desert and he picket for me the Cheesecake and a one scoop of ice cream it was delicious.  Im going to talk a little a bit about the food is so good but small portion ok to get full , you must have an appetizer the. You order you main dish to get full

jHwMjun8GEUDPaFLqnK_6A.text: went to my favoritefood channel personality resturant. special treat for 4. personnel are great, hostess and waiter, staff. somewhat noisy.  ordered the pasta trio, was told the Bolignase was vegetarian!? HUH?the whole meal was average, strip mall itallian is as good and 1/4 the cost.    you expect inflated prices on the strip, but it should be better than what i can do at home. the wines are nothing special at the cost of $100, imprted from Monterey, Ca.  Not again, steering visitors away,,  I live here, my mistake.

Q4AEd4G0fuDMsNpClXIbyg.text: Great customer service. Delicious food make sur you get appetizer to get fall
