OZFr80-mCt4rHVnovPfmGQ.text: My favorite restaurant!! Billy is the best !! Excellent service always !! Food is amazing ...Always! Never disappointed.

IQ6l4k-cPVwaBd5CdeH12Q.text: Incredible. My husband and I came to Las Vegas for our (planned!) wedding and honeymoon to get hitched and see Phish and we chose this restaurant as our wedding dinner as Giada is my favorite chef, and what a wonderful experience. We had some cocktails, signature to her, fantastic meals (a la carte) and a great view of the city. It was romantic, a free dessert plate with the classic chocolate congrats with Giada a choice favorites and a dimly lit view of my handsome new hubby. It was pricey (that's obvious) but so worth it. Highly recommend!

gMozNfQ_ubNzkz1ctXjaaQ.text: Dear Giada, your place looks amazing, service is 5 stars, but your food doesn't have any flavors. My husband & I visited your restaurant last night & I was disappointed when I first got my meal & I had specifically ordered without cheese, then I had to wait another 30 min to get it right, grilled chicken breast was dried, pasta was just ok & the sauce had no flavor. I was beyond excited to find out Giada has a Restaurant but very disappointed with the food.

F2PbLbU9hjYTYfnnQ9rnng.text: Amazing breakfast. The antipasti board was very good. Billy is the best. Service is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HGg5aKNeMXgdQl9VIf6Ipg.text: We stopped by midafternoon for a cocktail.  We were not disappointed in the tests or decisions.  However we were disappointed in the smokey environment from the casino floor.

rKL0_AA8ibEIUmtrsSBijA.text: The service was great from beginning to end. We had a brunch tasting Groupon. The main entree was great. The rest of the meal was not good at all. My wife had the burger and added an egg and bacon, which cost a little more. The burger was large, juicy, and flavorful. I had the salmon cakes and Eggs Benedict. It was outstanding. The salmon cakes were crispy on the outside and moist and well seasoned inside. It came with perfectly poached eggs and a velvety, lemony Hollandaise. But the rest of the tasting menu was unremarkable. The antipasto consisted of bland looking and bland tasting ham and a few chunks of a chalky, dense Parmesan. A pastry stuffed with lemon curd and blueberries and lemon muffin were good, but it was not something I would have ordered a la carte. The Caesar salad was sour from too much vinegar. The desserts were pretty, but horrible. I had an chocolate espresso ice cream cake. The ice cream filling and chocolate sauce were very good, but the cake itself was dry and so coarse that it ruined the overall dish. My wife had a lemon souffle with creme anglaise. It was eggy and tasteless. We did not finish them. Fortunately, the decor, the service, and the main course were enough to make us consider coming back. But I would stick with the main course or order appetizers more to our liking, and I would probably skip the desserts.

GokxsrgNueVFy8MJGBgEWw.text: Just took my sister-in-law here for an early Mother's Day dinner & it was such an amazing experience. First of we are really huge Giada fans so we were in heaven.   The ambience was superb. I honestly thought it was going to more Italian-y but it exceeded my expectation of decor. So modern , simple yet complex, and my favorite part was her pieces of art I have see in her cooking shows. I felt like I was in her kitchen aka a dream. 10/10 for ambience !   The food was amazing ! A lot of people give this place only one or 2 stars because the portion size but if you are a True Giada fan you would appreciate more of the experience. The food is very favorful in so many ways. The service was awesome thanks to our server Valentino. I'm bummed we didn't get to see her even though she has been here in Vegas all weekend for food event ! But anyways , I will definitely be back with my SIL and I'll bring my other girlfriends experience what we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My crab and scallop risotto  my dream to try Giada&#39;s risotto
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy rosemary bread. The fried capers were amazing
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. She got the spaghetti which was sooooo good

F9Xl3sFzAF1Tq8rJk8CYQQ.text: I made reservations for 4 people 7/16/18 at 5:45 we informed the front desk one of our guest got sick and couldn't make it if we can still use it even if it says 4 people, she stated not a problem.  We ate and at time of pay out of waiter was so kind to let us know he couldn't honor it and we explained that reception said it wouldn't be a problem and she confirmed so he got the manager and informed us his manager was  difficult. and Good Luck  When the manager approached us he said we cannot honor this, do you not know to to Read? My husband felt disrespected and explained to him we were advised differently by Reception and he went spoke with the reception girl and came back stated he understands she told us that but she MADE A MISTAKE, so my husband and him went back and forth and when I got tired of hearing my husband and him bickering As I was already humiliated enough on my Birthday. I mentioned to the Manager as a Manager Myself when My employees make a Mistake it is my Job to Correct or find a solution to problem.  My husband informed him we would be contacting you and putting a complaint on the restaurant and a Yelp Review and the manager still had to have a say, "WELL MAKE SURE TO SPELL MY NAME CORRECTLY WHEN YOU DO"   Like at that point I felt very disrespected was it because we are hispanic and he wasn't that he started of the conversation off by "Can't you read' and finished it off with "make sure to spell correctly"  Giada's is my favorite restaurant and we usually eat here more than 1 during our 10 day stay, but with this kind of treatment and experience, I am considering if I should ever go back

awDUtLFfrf8be5IlqYPIHw.text: Food is good, but service is horrible. I expect far more when dropping $500. Plenty of options in this city; dont waste your time and money at places that can't deliver a good customer experience.

D3cxPrP-M0FvNleQkW8OWg.text: Located inside the Cromwell on the second floor, Giada has brought a piece of her home and cooking  to the Las Vegas scene of top notch restaurants.  I started off with a couple of cheese plates to wet my whistle.The Gorgonzola with pears and honey was a perfect trio,a little bit of all three and you have a perfect bite.Pecorino tartufo was the other cheese plate I sampled and it came with apricot and a side of arugula which complimented the bold and spicy cheese.For my main I ordered the Salmon cake Benedict,spinach with piquillo peppers on the bottom,salmon crab cakes in the middle and then topped with two poached eggs cooked perfectly.As  I bit in all the flavors flowed like a conductors wand. This was one of the best brunches I've had in years.  The restaurant has a hip and modern upscale vibe but with comfortable furnishings that give it that homely feel.It also has a great window view of the strip.The server and the hostess were okay and would of given this place a five if it wasn't for them. And that's my take on Giana's place,Peace out.

Nq7dynqG6mpn7mFupFynfg.text: Great ambiance, food, location, drinks, people just yum! They have a great brunch that I highly recommend. During the summer the windows open up to the Bellagio fountains which is great. They generally close the windows during the winter because it's cold. A definite must

KR7GIJbvKx8Z8ug6Xv8BJw.text: Brunch is so wonderful.  Light, airy setting these breeze wafting though.  So many wonderful flavors.  Generous meats and cheeses.  The chicken meatballs with Marsala!

V42xHLx6mUa8dbUytFpQ2g.text: As someone who watches Food Network and had success baking and cooking a bunch of delicious dishes using Giada's recipes, I had to stop by this restaurant despite the mixed reviews. I'm not sure how the dinner is here, but my husband and I enjoyed our brunch!  I loved the decor of this restaurant. It was much bigger than I expected, with a huge open floor plan and large windows, offering a nice view of the strip.  We ordered the Sunrise Polenta Waffle and Italian Chicken & Waffle (we sure love our waffles!) The waffles were delicious, but without the maple syrup and bechamel sauce, the Sunrise Polenta Waffle was lacking in flavor--it would've helped if there was more than just tiny bits of pancetta. The eggs were perfectly cooked, and the fried chicken was delicious--crispy skin with tender meat.   Service was great. The hostess was friendly and our waiter was attentive. We were able to get a free glass of prosecco with our Yelp check-in! We also took advantage of the photobooth.  The price of the dishes weren't cheap, but we still enjoyed our food and thought the portions were pretty big. We were really stuffed, and ended up having to box a large piece of chicken along with half a waffle. There are tons of spots in Vegas I have yet to try, but I wouldn't mind coming back here again to try out other dishes for brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunrise Polenta Waffle and Italian Chicken &amp; Waffle

B2aEPEK3Mwbxd_5hvekTSQ.text: We didn't have a good experience here! Our waiter was rude and the food wasn't anything special! We want be back

pwal7ypt319PEOq374J-lg.text: The experience at Giada's was exceptional. My grandmother is a HUGE HUGE fan of Gaida, so I took her there for a meal of a lifetime. My grandmother was savoring every bite (so was I).   So here's what you should do if you go to Giada's. Come with three people, because her tasting menu ($125/person, the price is worth it don't worry)has three items per course. This way you can taste her whole tasting menu which is a great way to try a little of a lot.   They start you with an amazing antipasti plate, which is killer. If you check in through Yelp you get a free glass of Prosecco, yeah! They were nice enough to give my grandmother one on the House because she didn't have Yelp. They also have a great wine list.   The pasta was amazing and the second course, my favorite was her Lemon Shrimp pasta. Just so simple and delicious.  The Third course consisted of different kinds of protein. The chicken was so good and crispy, and the Salmon was out of this world.   The best part of this tasting menu is the Dessert. They have a cart they bring up to the table and you get to pick three items a person! It was incredible. In total we had nine different desserts and they were all spectacular.   On top of all the wonderful dishes, the staff were very educated on all the ingredients and dishes, incredibly nice, and provided exceptional service. If I had it in my budget, I'd go every year.

eyzm533NYzy_YPRJeHup_w.text: Food:  Above average Italian and fine dining.  The portion size is very small, but I think that's OK.  The presentation and selection of dishes were very, very good.  Price is a bit on the high side - but for a swanky restaurant on the Strip it's expected.  Prices are also well advertised, so don't claim shock when you visit.  Ambiance: Above average ambiance.  We had a private room (loud and obnoxious party who needs to be separated from others), and it was adequate.  The overall look and feel of the restaurant is very nice.  Service:  For me, service is the most important aspect of a fine dining experience.  Unfortunately, it was very, very poor during our party's meal.  During the meal and entree service, not once was any individual asked for drink preferences or orders.  My water was never refilled over the period of 2.5 hours we were in the room.   Why was it a 2.5 hour dinner you may ask?  The main reason is that we were basically held hostage for 1.5 hours after the dinner while the staff sorted out the check.  I've never been part of such a thing - and I had to leave the private room to seek assistance three times to attempt to find out what was going on.    Once the check (finally) arrived, it was quite disappointing to find out that at least one extra bottle of wine had been added, and perhaps 4-5 side dishes and appetizers for a grand total of around $200 in over charge.  By that time the group was very anxious to leave and the remaining members of the party just had to agree to overpay in the thought that any further obstacles would have resulted in more of an insane wait time.  One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had.  It took *forever*, we were overcharged, and the service was nowhere to be found when needed.

kh4h6fdLKqpHlICzHcFLJA.text: This is by far my favorite place to visit when in Vegas. I usually have brunch and dinner here, often in the same day. The staff is fantastic! The food is spectacular. There isn't a single item on the menu that I wouldn't put in my mouth. The atmosphere is welcoming and charming. This is a must to visit when in Vegas. Our waiter Billy (William) was attentive, friendly, accommodating, and all the other things that a spectacular member of a fantastic team should be. Billy contributed to making this one of the most eventful and memorable experiences so far.

F_NPrsOxpXwOs0_Tod90aw.text: The boyfriend and I had to try Giada's when it opened up. I always watched her cooking shows and enjoyed them. So once we saw a she had a restaurant we just had to stop by.   I've have been several times, and each time I have had the Sangria there is two kinds the white and the red, I definitely recommend trying each to see which one you prefer best, they are both good but in my option I like the red one a lot more.   The food is always amazing we've had the flatbread and many small plates and they are all very delicious with so much great flavor.   I will definitely be stopping by to get some Sangria (red) next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flatbread pizza&#39;s
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Sangria

NfVPU6f6ciBh0NBadnSuxQ.text: Went here for a business dinner. The view is spectacular. If you can call ahead and get a table with a view of the Bellagio, I recommend it.   The food is above average. The pastas are extremely fresh and tasty. I loved the lobster ravioli and the salmon was perfectly cooked. I also recommend the polenta.   The service was abysmal. Slow, inattentive, and didn't deliver on promises. We had to ask twice for bread, and the courses came out with large delays in between.   All in all, not worth the money.

1msRt9qh5GSU3xN550yDSA.text: This is the 5th time I have dined at Giada and I always leave satisfied.  Service was the highlight of this most recent visit.  Sarah was excellent in both her service, attentiveness, and personality.  She was so helpful and welcoming without being cheesy or fake.    The quality of the charcuterie board is amazing.  While you might think that cured meat and cheese can only be so good, I have been completely surprised each of the times I have ordered it here.  The quality of the meats is fabulous, as are the quality of the cheeses, jams, and mustards.  This comes with a price as a small order is $31.  We ordered a large last time and it was lovely.    We also ordered several pastas and all were excellent, but truthfully, not life changingly good.  The risotto had more scallops and crab meat than rice!  So delicious.  I love risotto and actually wished there was more rice.  First world problems.    What's even better is their kids' meal.  For $11 each, my kids ordered sausage pizza and chicken strips.  Each order came with a generous side of broccolini that us adults really enjoyed.    On more than one occasion over the past 2 years my son has called this his favorite restaurant in Vegas.    After having eaten here many times now, with photo booth photos as souvenirs each time, the only thing that can top it off is to actually meet Giada.

-mxTADWTUdn3NMD1LL-JgQ.text: Giada's matches the theme of the hotel.  Classy, sexy, inviting, exquisite. The Cromwell is my favorite hotel and not surprising, Giada's is my favorite restaurant in Vegas.   From the moment you walk in, you are treated like gold.  Service is top notch and the managers are constantly walking around to ensure that you have everything you need and are content.  Thanks to the roulette table, I was able to splurge 2 nights in a row and I still can't get the taste of those bacon wrapped dates out of my mouth.  Paige was my server both nights and she was terrific.  The management (specifically John D.) was  great also and made me feel like royalty during my meals.   I'll be back next month, Giada, please save a seat for me.  :)

JYc72LCsix_YRXuHR0bovA.text: In town to ring in 2019 so we made reservations for 9:30 while driving in from Cali. We arrived a little early so we had a cocktail in the bar area. The bar area is cozy and you can see everything in the open kitchen. We had a Blanco Cosmo and a Strawberry Basil drink. Both were yummy and $15 a piece.  Dinner we had the Margarita Pizza, Orzo Meatballs, Bucatini , Pappardelle and cookies for dessert. Everything was deliciously scrumptious and worth the $$. Oh yes the staff was very attentive and provided excellent customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Basket= Olive Focaccia &amp; Lavosh. Giada&#39;s personal spice blend

wDwlbjBHYWHPxjRUWo7__A.text: The best brunch of my life. Hands down.  Came on a Saturday afternoon in July.  Ambiance: Perfect. Gorgeous view of the Bellagio fountains and Las Vegas boulevard. Quiet, romantic music, and a cozy interior. Super comfortable chairs and impeccable, classy table settings.   Food: My husband and I both got the brunch tasting menu ($55 each).  First course: A romaine salad, two pastries, and a selection of antipasti.  The salad was light and refreshing with a bit of parmesan and a citrusy vinegarette dressing. The pastries were flaky and not too sweet. The ricotta-lemon-blueberry Danish was surprisingly light. I could have just eaten the filling with a spoon. The highlight was the mozzarella balls, soaked in a not too spicy chili oil, with a bit of lemon zest. A simple bite elevated to something truly amazing.   Second course: I got the cavatelli. My husband got the salmon Benedict. The cavatelli was perfectly cooked and enrobed in a decadent pesto cream sauce. It was filling yet light, and had bits of peppers and mushrooms. This is what pasta should be. The benedict was perfectly cooked and the yolks ran beautifully when we broke them. Hollandaise was lemony, complex and had just the right amount of heat.   Third course: Dessert. I got the lemon souffle and he got the chocolate espresso cake. The souffle was light, fluffy and just melted in my mouth. The cake was the exact opposite, as it needed to be. Heavy, rich, and layered with an ice cream whose base had been infused with espresso beans overnight.   Overall, a beyond brilliant experience that I'm sure will be repeated on every future trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon souffle with a creme anglaise
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate espresso cake.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon benedict.

HHElH_QnloJktnUVFopTwg.text: The one thing that keeps me returning to Giada is the impeccable service. I have had incredible meals and meals that were just okay, but the service is the shining star here. The food is delicious but it is the service that makes this a go to local gem.  The servers enjoy what they do and are always willing to give a glowing recommendation on menu items. Giada is also worth the trip just for the decadent dessert selections. I suggest a seat with a view if you are visiting from out of town.  The Limoncello Souffle with Creme Anglaise is as much fun to eat as it is to look at. Fluffy, sweet with a rich creamy center. I can still taste it, hours later. It was also a nice place to take my parents who were visiting from out of town. They love celebrity chefs so this was an obvious choice for Brunch and they were definitely impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Ricotta Cookie Ice Cream Sandwich
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limoncello Soufflé with Creme Anglaise

EyD4GptJ5vTytTJkRV7f3g.text: I would not recommend Giada's for a special occasion. After making reservations over a month in advance for a 50th anniversary family dinner, we were excited to be at Giada's. When I made my reservation, I indicated that we requested a window table. Additionally, when I confirmed the reservation that afternoon I asked about the view and was told, " all our tables look out over the strip...we have your requests from your reservation."  When we were shown to our table, I was surprised that we were in a back room with a TV playing a football game and no view. I went back to the hostess, and asked about our table. Stating that we had requested a view, I asked about options. She said that they did not have a table for our larger party. She then had me speak to the manager John. John apologized and offered to move us if we could wait a while. I reviewed that the reservation had been made over a month prior and that it was confirmed that afternoon. I did not want to wait, so asked that he could ensure that our meal experience was very good. He assured me he would, and that he would personally come to the table. Our meal experience was not very good. Appetizers were excellent. The eggplant entree was very salty. Other entrees were ok. Service was nice, but not very attentive. We piled our plates to get them out of our way, crumbs were not cleared from the table, etc. John never came by or checked on us. It was disappointing. At the end of the meal the server brought out a plate with 2 complimentary cookies that said happy anniversary. I tried to speak to John before leaving, but he was busy talking to a table.  I was looking to have an exceptional meal for my parents anniversary and was disappointed in all areas.  I would not recommend Giada's for a special occasion, as they are not able to follow through on requests or to make the occasion special.

zd0LW6Y6NQyNZtRPG0LW9Q.text: Honestly ... not impressed with this restaurant, I've heard good things about it but was sad to say I was disappointed after eating here. The best thing that me and the hubs ordered was the meat and cheese plate. When we try new restaurants we like to try a few different dishes... Here when we ordered thru a few appetizers (mind you they are small) the waiter proceeds to cut me off and say "you realize your ordering like 5 appetizers".... I was just kind of thrown off by that response, one order of cheese is like 4 slices and the meat follows the same pattern, followed by a few meatballs so honestly I didnt think it was too much food. Not sure what he was implying when he said that but it is what it is.   Hefty bill at the end and left with a feeling of ... little satisfaction. I would come back here as I did like their options for meat and cheese platters but theres just way better places out here to eat for the same price.

WpTLECnT1SF077st_j1yMg.text: Was in Vegas for business and have always wanted to try Giadas place, as I'm a big fan!!! Highlight dinner of my 4 days in Vegas! Sat at the bar as the place was busy and since it was just me didn't need to take up a whole table.  Jeremy at the bar was excellent!!!! Defiantly ordered more, due to his recommendation and enjoyed taking with him. But the food was beyond amazing!!! Ordered the octopus salad, as I am a massive octopus fan. Literally one of the best octopuses I have ever had. Super tender, full of flavor, perfectly cooked!! Originally turned down the bread plate but Jeremy said it was well worth it so I agreed!!! OMG the focaccia was out of this world. And the presentation made it ever better!! Told Jeremy I trusted his judgement for my pasta dish....he orders the lobster ravioli and it was mouth watering. Perfect amount of lobster, the kale salsa verde sauce was not what I was expect but was delicious! Can't wait to have my leftovers!!!! Knowing what I had, and growing up in the casino food/bev world, I have a hard time believing the few negative reviews I read on yelp about this place. This place is amazing!!!!

4pZmNTlJbqOL0lslmH0mcQ.text: What a great experience at Giada's. When you first walk in you get a warm feeling. I first went to the bar and of course ordered a Bellini. You can tell that the bar tendered enjoyed his job! We went to our table for dinner and we got to sit next to the window,  which is right on the Vegas strip. I ordered the Bucatini, which is pasta with a red sauce. I added shrimp to the dish.It was delicious! The lamb chops are also a great choice as well as the Ravioli.  For dessert we ordered Giada's signature cookies,  which you can't go wrong. I was not a huge fan of the Peaches and Cream souffle. Overall I will definitely go back. It is so worth it!! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Bellini from the bar at Giada&#39;s.

Z68KRND2TaQL1ACevDNa_g.text: We did the Groupon for the tasting menu for brunch and it was amazing!! Billy was such an amazing server and was the absolute best!!! I would highly suggest to anyone

uKGAABHnvmZGHx0BMkEtvA.text: I feel that I was subject of gender discrimination as a male. I was turned away for wearing a tank top which I respected and went and bought a new shirt with sleeves so I could eat with my family. I walked in and there was three women with tank tops on in the restaurant.  Not nice tanks but tank tops you would wear at the beach or out for a walk. Frustrated and disappointed when I saw this.   Food and service was great at the table.

OaM-2lbmlgz5KrDCWCyrXA.text: Horrible did not meet my expectations, brunch sucked and was over priced for simple plan food. Never again will I go there!!! Not worth it!!!

m_DE3bVQej-bLw2bC8KvHg.text: Stopped by to check it out. Already had dinner so we had a couple drinks in the bar lounge. Nice view of the restaurant and big windows overlooking the strip. Paige our server took excellent care of us with drinks and an appetizer margherita pizzette. We also enjoyed some nice hot bread with an assortment of condiments sea salt, butter, capers, pesto.

gf4RVCJTjr3qo1ID_vd_Vg.text: We called last minute and got a reservation for a party of six. Our server, Bill and the rest of the staff were so courteous and nice. We ordered arugula salad, two salmon eggs benedict, lobster hash, polenta waffle and chocolate chip Nutella pancakes for the kids all were delicious. Great service, nice views and delicious food.

rS1wpxCqCUlO4eZA2FnKbA.text: My fiance and I dined here over the weekend to celebrate our anniversary and were extremely excited for our experience to try some of Giada's famous dishes! Upon arriving a few minutes early for our reservation, we decided to have a drink at the bar which was followed by being seated at our table. Both the appetizers and service were great, however once ordering our entrees, I noticed my fiance looked a little flushed (she ordered the fettuccine with lobster & I had the rissotto with scallops). Upon finishing our dinner, we went straight to our hotel because she wasn't feeling well. Needless to say our night did not go as planned as she was continuously making trips to the restroom. We couldn't quite figure out the cause until realizing I hadn't sampled her dish. It made me very sad to see her sick especially because of how much we had been looking forward to the night.

rraZt9F6ycq3VtXJTBqMRQ.text: The Frito Misto was well done and big enough to share, scallops were well prepared, veal rib had a different presentation and was very large not spectacular. What was spectacular was the pannacotta with a Merlot sorbet and some crunch on top.  Service excellent. Noise level was either energetic or loud depending on your definition.  Pricy, find a discount on Travelzoo.

SGnm5TnovzUpRr74DueWfg.text: Giada was mediocre for the hype, but nonetheless was a solid meal along the Vegas strip.   The toasted bread crackers they bring out with butter, salt, pesto, and chili before the meal are amazing. A nice light bite before dinner, which was great. Also a big fan of the Fresh Mozzarella Crostini. The sweet honey topped with salt and chili was an amazing contrast to the creamy cheese, and the toast was as crunchy as I was hoping it would be.   Drinks were good, but nothing special. I had a blood orange martini. Good, but nothing to write home about.  The meal, unfortunately, was much less exciting than the appetizers. We shared the Spaghetti (with shrimp, mascarpone, lemon, and basil) and it was lackluster. The mascarpone wasn't as creamy as it should be, and overall it lacked flavor. The Italian Fried Chicken was pretty good, but didn't entirely make sense. The soupy cacciatore sauce was good, but didn't really match the flavors of the chicken seasoning. It was a huge portion too, and it should have only come with one piece of chicken and a small side.  We finished with the Giada cookies, which were very good. I'd definitely go there for those again!  Overall, a nice experience, but it's not a major destination for an upscale meal.

hmAg1eDA0u8Rd0CennPkAQ.text: The ambiance was great.  The food and  Rocco our server was outstanding I highly recommend dinning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8biCxzCqygn72U1zofWbTw.text: Lovely meal, we ate at bar without a reservation. We split a delicious pizza and pasta dish. Had great service, atmosphere, no complaints.

A_khOCrTgoqSm0P9X5Hnqg.text: I went here before seeing a show at Planet Hollywood and it was so incredible. Definitely on my list of favorite restaurant now. I highly recommend the bacon wrapped dates. I tried the bucanti pasta which was very good and also the lemon cookies were the best. Customer service was very good. Small delay in our food and the manager immediately came out and apologized. Overall, highly recommend!

rmUSSU221RENX4QtT_rgVw.text: This is a long review, but in a nutshell, you'll love the service and the food; just don't order the veal.   Started with a reservation for 12 and needed to change it very last minute (think: the morning of my Sat reservation) for 15 people. For more than 14 people, you are supposed to go through group sales, a pre fixe menu, and make a CC payment. Lucky for me, Amber, of group sales, spoke with the manager who allowed us to change the reservation to 15 without going through that entire hassle!   2 of my guests last minute canceled and we actually ended up with 13 people with our last 2 guests arriving late. We were seated quickly without them being present and weren't given any problems for them showing up late.  We were seated in a semi-private area perfect for our group and since it was early in the evening (5pm reservation), the two tables next to us weren't occupied until immediately before we left.  Our group of servers were amazing! Our glasses were always full, we didn't feel rushed, and we weren't waiting/ having to look for someone if we needed something. They really took care of us. Service was some of the best I've had.   I tried some appetizers that we shared family style, the scallop and crab risotto, bone-in rib eye, wagyu beef, spaghetti, another pasta I can't remember it's name, lamb, and veal. The risotto with its crab chunks was delicious, rib eye was seasoned well, wagyu beef and lamb was deliciously tender, and you can't go wrong with any of the pastas. The veal was breaded and didn't seem to complement the rest of the menu. Hence, the loss of one star.   Dessert was delicious (chocolate tart for the win!) and my brother was given complimentary cookies as we were celebrating his send-off to Navy boot camp. It was very nice of them and a great end to a delicious meal.  Overall, a great experience and I would definitely return.

i5-bEaALdtbe_FIJSAGwpw.text: I watched Giada's cooking show on Food Network every day after high school so I was so excited to try her restaurant. Not surprisingly, everything was outstanding. We ordered the family style tasting menu so we were able to try a little bit of everything. The antipasto platters were huge, delicious, and had lots of options. The meatball appetizer was by far the best meatball I've ever had. Our favorite dish by far was the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. I'm still craving it! The service was impeccable as well - our wine and water glasses were never empty. The only thing that would have made my night better was if Giada herself had been there. Would highly recommend!

C73yq962jaRqX41WdJ7NQg.text: Came here for my 40th birthday dinner and fell in love!! We ordered a little bit of everything on the menu and shared and everything especially their fried brussel sprouts was delicious!!

tKGpsiw1dQ39mEncCaA6OA.text: Ohhhh, I wanted to love this restaurant. This was to be the highlight of our trip. If I ever were to visit Giada again, I would definitely do things a bit differently - rather, I would order differently. Giada's philosophy is, "I eat a little bit of everything and not a lot of anything." To express the mantra, there are two menus in Giada: one with several small plates, and the other with entrees. You can mix and match from each menu, and the restaurant staff is more than accommodating to meet your request. (In fact, the staff was excellent the entire time we were here. This review is more bias based on the food.) The house-made foccacia and cheese crisps served tableside were heavenly. The selection of short plates is exceptional. Actually, that's where the fault lies - in my choices! Torn between item menus, I decided to opt for a small plate as an app and a pasta dish as an entree. It's Giada, it's Italian, so a pasta dish made sense. For the app, I decided on the bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with sausage. The dish hit every flavor component - sweet from the dates, salty from the sausage, smokey from the bacon, and spicy from the chili inside. I would definitely order it again, if given the chance. The pasta dish is where my meal derailed. I ordered lamb ragu with mint-yogurt sauce. Taste-wise, the dish was amazing, but the PORTION was downright pathetic. Why am I paying 30-something dollars for literally three strips of pasta dough and two tablespoons of sauce? Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but absolutely not worth the money. (The waiter told me they are removing it from the menu; perhaps that's why.) In fact, the entree portions all around seemed underwhelming.  Giada's restaurant should have the wow-factor, but instead, I found we are paying for the branding. The food was delicious, but I can't justify paying for Giada's name for the small portions. I would be open-minded to returning to Giada just to try some of those small plates, though.

F0vUliEZkM5RQ31gqr2VxQ.text: My wife was very excited to eat at this restaurant.  Of course, we all know who Giada is and we were expecting to be blown away by the food, atmosphere, and service.  A big disappointment would be a good way of describing it.  The hostesses were nice and we felt welcomed. We made a reservation for brunch, which was the first weekend they ever served it.  A table next to the window with a view was nice so it was easy to pass the time waiting for our food.  I made the mistake of wanting an appetizer.  Yes, they cost more money than they are worth.  Yes, they come in very small portions.  That is a given at most of the nicer restaurants, so it didn't really bother me.  What I ordered bothered me.  Meatballs.  I ordered meatballs because the waitress recommended it.  Mediocre at best.  My wife makes better meatballs and she's   not a very good cook.  I could make better meatballs if I bought some frozen ones and dumped some Ragu and cheese on it.  At least I could have 50 of them for the price of the four I received in a cup and saucer.  The presentation consisted of meatballs in a cup.  Can you imagine reading meatballs in a cup on a menu?  Surely no one in their right mind orders meatballs in a cup.  Do not order this, unless you just hit on the craps table and you don't know how to blow through your money.  My wife ordered a nutella latte right at the beginning.  She did not receive this drink for a long time.  When it finally came, it looked nice because who ever made it wrote a big G in chocolate  on the top.  Little did we know, the G was for Garbage.  It tasted like a regular hot chocolate.  Neither of us could taste nutella at all.  We both took a couple of sips, then the drink sat on the table untouched.  Now for the food.  My wife ordered... sorry, i can't remember what she ordered because it was so forgetful.  Oh yeah, it was eggs, toast, and some kind of tomatoes.  Usually I remember all the details but at this point, I stopped caring.  I felt sorry for her, but also laughed and made fun of her for making such a terrible choice.  Needless to say, she didn't eat it all, and it wasn't because it was a large portion.  She also ordered a pastry.  I ordered the $29 chicken and waffles.  More like the $not worth it chicken and awfuls. I'm not sure if I ever felt so mad over $29.  Luckily, I only yelled and cried on the inside so I didn't embarrass my wife.  I have made better waffles at a continental breakfast.  I've made better waffles without looking at the instructions.  They call these things $29 waffles?!  They make me sick.    You know what made me sicker?  The chicken.  The ridiculous chicken they put on my plate.  It looked like a baby chicken.  It even had a wing.  I don't know about the chicken and waffles you eat, but usually I don't get a wing with it.  Have you ever seen someone eat a wing with a knife and fork?  Next thing you know, I'm eating a snickers with a knife and fork like Costanza.  Cutting anything in this restaurant will be a tall task.  The knife's handle is turned opposite of the blade.  I have never in my life seen a knife in a restaurant like this.  If you are into martial arts or have a hand that grew 90 degrees to the left of your wrist, then you will use this knife very naturally.  It's served with a bowl full of baby tomatoes, bell peppers, and a tomato paste.  Now, I'm no chef or chicken and waffles connoisseur, but I not sure how that fits in.  Maybe it does, I just haven't had enough drinks and substances pumped into my body.  The pastry she ordered came after our meal even though she ordered it at the beginning to eat with her latte.  It was supposed to be a delicious $4 raspberry danish.  It was a hockey puck with a red stain in the middle.  Absolutely no flavor.  My local donut shop has better danishes.  My wife took 2 small bites and I took one just to have something else to gripe about.  It granted me my wish.  One other thing: We were not the only one disappointed.  My wife and I got a kick out of watching the lady at the table next to us react to each plate that was served to her.  Her face was one of shock, horror, and finally mad.  In that exact order.  We felt the same.  If you guys want to experience these emotions yourself, book a reservation asap.  I give the hostesses 4 stars.  The waitress 2 stars.  I give the food 2 stars, only because it was edible.  For the money, do not come to this place.  Completely not worth it.  If you want a meal that you actually get what you pay for, go somewhere else.  Especially the brunch, which is not any better than iHop, Cracker Barrel, or you mom's house.

deUA5hDnaovQnSy-r0EBkQ.text: It's my first time here and Billy helped me build a yummy antipasti plate for a late lunch. Awesome table too with a perfect view of the Bellagio water show. Can't wait for the next time I'm here in Vegas - will definitely return.

SxWKiVWBlWFS2HbE64TkxA.text: so I was pretty hyped to try this place. the previous time I came, they said there were no opening for the whole day. so when they weren't booked on Christmas Day, I came for a visit. located inside Cromwell Casino (previously Bills), the restaurant is beautifulllll! I love the decor and set up and color and the whole she-bang. the atmosphere was my favorite part of dining here.  the food was good. not sure if it's because we went on a holiday but the menu seemed a bit limited to me. I did expect a little more pasta dishes since it is an Italian restaurant, but there was none so don't expect any of that.   what we ordered: tenderloin sliders- I didn't try it, but everyone who ate one was raving about it and said it was the best out of the dishes.  lemon pesto grilled cheese sandwich- we got one with prosciutto and one without. the one without was my dish and I really enjoyed it  sweet ricotta pizza- this was good also! as good as a pizza can get :)  for about four dishes, it was around $120 which isn't bad at all for a Vegas restaurant. service was great, from the hostesses to the servers to management-- our server was super friendly and attentive! would come back when I revisit Vegas (with a reservation!)

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu

A2F8PhtfxwNalyZAt36TYQ.text: I went in here with high hopes, the wife had raved about this place so I thought it would be good.  It was not to be, it gets 2 stars only because of the physical side of the place, it is a great place to have a meal, it's just a shame the meal could not do it justice.  For a start, the Charcuterie board, this was something the wife raved about, honestly, I have no idea what she must have been smoking on previous visits, this board really set the tone for the whole meal, bland.  I had the Pappardelle, it's obvious that they use quality ingredients and yes, I am a fan of letting the ingredients be the flavors of the meal rather than loading it with spices, however, there was little to no taste in the dish.  We also shared a short rib, a dish I love, again, bland, I would have thought that something was up with my taste buds, had we not eaten at La Cave the night before which showed they were working fine.  The service was good, though the diet coke got to stand empty for lengths of time which really was a pain due to one overriding  thing, about 10 minutes into the meal the heating kicked on and did not stop, waiters sweating everywhere, guests sweating (one of our party actually left) and even after speaking to the manager, who for some reason decided it was below her to come to the table where the party is taking a good run at a $1000 tab, so the wife went out to talk to her, the heat remained on.  On that point alone, sorry Giada, you failed.

EdMHC4Cg0Kh6oK-WGXftlg.text: Good Italian food, surprisingly good service for a vegas restaurant.  Prices were a little high, and portions were tiny.  We basically had an assortment of anti pasta for our entrees.

h0myL9QFBrUhy3_ok2K6hA.text: Ate here last night. Lindsay was an excellent server! Very attentive and gave great recommendations on the menu. I ordered a the eggplant parmigiana and the arugula salad, both were delicious. The view of the strip at night was beautiful!

izKj8lgj1Aqs32TyNdbPMQ.text: This was a wonderful culinary experience. Nancy was our server and she definitely added to our dining experience from the time we sat down she and her team were extremely attentive and did not miss a beat. We started with the seafood tower which was absolutely delicious!!! From there we moved on to the Arugula salad which is a must have and a Giada specialty; the prosciutto and Gorgonzola plate- both melt in your mouth; then the flights of pasta- our favorite was the lemon spaghetti and we finished with the pumpkin souffle and the cookie plate.

nVm053yFzB4LgYBjQU-ewQ.text: This place is good, but not great. I'm a fan of Italian food, and the menu options were nice and the appetizer list was good.  Ambiance: A tad noisy, hustle and bustle, busy. Really nice view and a very open layout with elegant decor. Noise aside, it is pleasant.  Service: Great. Fast. Friendly.  Food: Just OK. Nothing was bad. But of the various appetizers, entrees, and drinks tried - nothing really stood out or had a "keep me coming back" factor. People keep mentioning the tiny portions, but I have no issue with that. The portions were just about right for us, and allowed us to try many things without getting too full. I personally did not like the meatballs. Your mileage may vary.  Prices: Very, very expensive. I honestly did not feel like the food overall really warranted the prices.  If you like Italian food, smaller portions, and don't mind the pricing - this place *is* worth trying. This is why I am giving it 4-stars, as I don't think people seem to care as much for 3-stars, even though there is nothing wrong with 3-stars.

odbXM96c4y7oqi63kR9X_w.text: I had high hopes for Giada's, but unfortunately the restaurant fell flat.  I anticipated the food to be the centerpiece of the visit, but it ended up being the leading contributor to my one-star experience.  Three of the guests in our party shared two orders of the risotto.  Not only did both plates have a significant number of crab shells (real crab at least), but all three became ill after eating it.  Admittedly, the pasta and branzino were cooked much better, although the simplicity of the dish, an apparent hallmark of the restaurant, rendered them far from memorable.  Service was more akin to the risotto than the pasta.  Our waiter Joey had a strong, friendly start that quickly disappeared, just as he did.  His salesmanship was highlighted by his attempt to push the prix-fixe menu primarily based on an autographed Giada folio with the menu and a few recipes.  Admittedly, Joey was probably correct that the restaurant's selection of the least interesting dishes for the prix-fixe was likely not what was driving diners to choose it.  The pitch on the prix-fixe was followed by his description of one of Giada's signature cocktails as the most popular selection but also the most frequently returned to the bar.    After his presentation of the menu, Joey disappeared for an extended period of time, and later in the meal he did not even bother to visit the table from the time the first course was served to when the check was delivered.  This seemed particularly surprising given the apparent high ratio of staff to guests at the restaurant overall.  As if the experience wasn't already far short of expectations, the check was also incorrect, as Joey had added a random dish that had not been ordered or served.    As someone who professionally reviewed restaurants for years, this restaurant falls on the very low end of its peer group.

S2IFMZgpYt4u8mF_J6Bi2Q.text: I was really looking forward to dining here especially since it was my birthday! I love watching Giada's shows on television and all of her recipes that I've tried have been amazing. That being said, I was disappointed with my experience at Giada. If I were rating the service, atmosphere, drinks and dessert it would get 5+++ stars! The restaurant is warm, classy and inviting. There was a very nice view of The Strip from our table. Our waiter was just awesome!! He knew so much about the menu, gave recommendations, was very descriptive, so polite and seemed like an all around nice person. We started with cocktails. I ordered the Giada, it was beautiful and delicious! We decided to do the tasting menu. It was around $125pp. That is expensive but not unexpected since we were in Vegas. It was 4 courses plus you get some recipes and an autographed picture of Giada. The waiter brought out an assortment of breads and spreads to the table. That was excellent!! Next, the first real course were appetizers which were a few of Giada's favorite antipasti. All pretty good, stuffed peppers, bacon wrapped dates etc. Next course was the pasta course which was the worst. Pasta was gummy and flavorless. I was expecting so much more in terms of quality. For main course, we ordered the veal and salmon. Both dry and also flavorless. The dessert course was pretty epic! They push out a dessert cart and each guest can select 3 desserts each. Not only did we get to try 6 desserts which were all delicious, the waiter brought out sorbet for me for my birthday. Overall, a ton of food was served!! So if you have a big appetite this place is for you. I wish the main course and the pasta course were better...it would've made this a fantastic dining experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread board
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two different types of tiramisu

HUH_Yodbehl-jsSsqF2ksg.text: Great restaurant, amazing food, and incredible view what more could you ask for???? Make sure to ask for Stephanie she is great and makes the dining experience that much more memorable!!!! Must visit!!!!!!

LkwY1RL8mr3K4nEef31urA.text: Hard not to have high expectations coming to Giada. All of them were exceeded. The delicious food was well presented and complemented by the staff - Valentino, Diego and Joe were the super team who ensured the experience was best in class. Great job - thank you!

iFnGOrYLaXEH27tOzXBVIw.text: The chicken and waffles were on point. The frose' was an added touch. None of this would have happened if Jeremy wasn't our bartender. He was a bright light and Giada would be proud. Thank you, Jeremy!

7euQCCVTCrrmORNCbiF2Og.text: I really enjoyed my 1st experience at Giada's for my daughters birthday.  Dave brought out dessert and made her birthday extra special. I will definitely be returning.

6lWrMDIX5chdxiFmQN46NA.text: Food was delicious, but service was so SLOW. Our reservation was at 8:00 PM on a Tuesday night. We finally received drinks and bread at 8:43. The check couldn't be split individually. Automatic 18% gratuity on a party of 8. My credit card was charged for the entire bill. Waiter rectified the extra charges. We are hoping the void comes through on the credit card. Checks were done by 11:15 PM with hardly anyone in the restaurant. I wouldn't recommend unless you're feeling the need to spend in excess.

clMX_UxeNTuiUsbKRDlWEQ.text: As a disclaimer, I must state that we are huge fans of Giada and Bobby on The Next Food Network Star. And we are also accustom to fine dining. Not a single thing about this restaurant reminded us of her warm personality and her constantly stating how important "branding" is. This place screams "I have more investors to please than I can handle" and "this is my first restaurant" like crazy. Prices need to reflect this as it is not even close to being on par with other "celebrity chef" restaurants on the Strip. There is a lot of work left to be done here.   That being said, most of the food was fine. Everything needed a bit of editing and more salt. The "grilled" artichokes with lemon aioli were served ice cold, and the "grilled" zucchini & eggplant involtini was served room temp. The pancetta in the arugula salad was chopped way too large for such a delicate salad but the parmigiano was sliced perfectly thin. The aioli was by far the best thing on the table all evening.  We were honestly surprised we could not hear Drai's, but, when all the windows were opened, it became too loud to hold a pleasant conversation. We did not complain, but our waiter kept apologizing profusely. And that was our cue that it was time to go. So we did.  There are so many better restaurants on the Strip for the same price range, it's really not worth a return visit. I highly suggest reading the other reviews to get a better picture of whether or not this is the dining experience you want to have. I wish we would have.

mZfE6Vu8QxNwvLQQKK5mhw.text: Wow. Everything here is thoughtfully done, from the floor to the ceiling, the starters through dessert. Giada's statement - immortalized in the light fixtures - "I eat a little bit of Everything and not a lot of Anything" is the guiding principle here.  We tried a medium sized starter, Giada's choice. Every bite was amazing. All of the crostini were to die for.  The rack of lamb was perfect, as were all the pastas we tried.  We will be returning.

RX9HnI1-Kel2h0a_SpEI9Q.text: We had a dinner at Giada and the food was excellent, we had the orzo meatballs, dates, delicious, tricolor salad, amazing.... As a main course we got the salmon and risoto, perfectly cooked, but the service made our night, Ron was amazing with all the suggestions and attention, thank you for everything. Did I mention the view, table by the windows, Bellagio fountains, incredible. We'll be back for sure, pretty soon,  had a great time at Giada, definitely met my expectations

d1jGxKyveQME42y726XO-w.text: It did not meet my expectations,food was okay nothing special small portions and overpriced.  The only plus was the view of the strip. If you really must go have a drink and appetizer at the bar, but don't waste your money on dinner.

T-Sidtly1CaDAtFSL0WN2A.text: Wow!!!! Where do I start! From being greeted at the door to the the food and everything was amazing. I am a huge fan of Giada and have been wanting to try her rest. For a while and I was amazed! Cliff and Doug helped us as our waiters and diff an amazing job to describe what the dishes had. I could eat here for every meal. Was amazed! Thank you

Lyc78o_IVu3uhptRaJfWNw.text: Ripped Off At Giada! Let me start by saying that I never even bothered to eat at the restaurant after my experience at the bar. Four of us sat down for a cocktail before dinner. We ordered two Vodka with juice on the rocks, a beer and a margarita. When we got the bill we were charged 14.00 per vodka drink with an additional 3.00 charge per Vodka for "The Rocks"? I asked what that charge was and he said it is always more for "on the rocks" in Vegas. I have been to Vegas hundreds of times and two of my friends with us live in Vegas. We said we NEVER heard of a 3.00 per drink charge for "on the rocks"! We asked if we had ordered the Vodka and not said on the rocks would he have given us ice? We also asked if we ordered w/out ice would it cost less. He could not answer except to say that is how it is in Vegas! I was so frustrated by his stupid explanation and bewildered look we just left and vowed NEVER to eat there.   Later that night we told some other Vegas locals about it and they shared a horror story as well about there recent experience at Giada. They had 8:00 Pm reservations and arrived at 7:59. The hostess told them they were backed up and to go get a drink and come back in 30 minutes. The bar in the restaurant is tiny so they had to go downstairs to get a drink. The crowds were busy and by the time they got their drinks it was time to be seated, the hostess told them they can't bring the drinks in from outside. They told the hostess she told them to go get the drinks, she said sorry either leave the drinks or gulp them down but you can't bring them in. It was 80.00 worth of drinks! They guzzled them down and were seated and waited FOREVER to be served and all they had to say was the food was fair at best, the service poor and the prices way too high!  BTW.. I have never given a 1 star review before, I am NOT the angry kind of customer and generally only leave good reviews of places I enjoy. This experience aggravated me so much I had to tell it like it is.

VKhSO0J4P24dsAT3iidVrw.text: Although I have seen Giada De Laurentiis several times on the Today Show cooking segment, I was only vaguely aware of her restaurant at the Cromwell Hotel across the street from Caesar's Palace. I hadn't planned on eating here until yesterday when a Las Vegas native friend, who is both full-blooded Italian and a superb cook in her own right, sang the praises of Giada. Boy, was she right! We had lunch here and it was simply outstandingly delicious and unique; what an exceptional food experience. We started out with an appetizer order of the chicken meatballs with mushrooms and a reduced Marsala wine sauce; OMG! Incredibly mouthwatering; well worth the visit in and of themselves. My friend had the Lasagna pasta entree and I had the smoked salmon and avocado sandwich, which was served open-faced on toasted whole grain bread with marinaded onions and roasted capers; YUM! Both lunches were served with the freshest arugula salad with a delicious light dressing capped off with slivers of aged Parmesan cheese. We drank the Bolle bottled mineral water (with gas); it was very refreshing. For dessert, we each had an espresso with a shared shot of Sambuca Romana. What a great way to cap-off a superior dining experience. We were ably and politely served by our Table Captain, Stephanie, and her bus boys. I would highly recommend this place and I clearly intend to return. Oh, my

ymnYa3-dTke-bBiLCH3WOA.text: Last December, for part of my wife's 'month long' birthday celebration which was highlighted by attending the Andrea Bocelli concert in Las Vegas.  To make it a complete weekend event we invited our son's in-laws and my wife's brother and his wife to join us for the concert as well to make it a complete 'In-Laws & Out-Laws' weekend.  One of our activities included lunch at the recently opened Giada's Restaurant located in The Cromwell Hotel on the Strip. Having made reservations in advance we were seated in a timely manner and our server, Patrick, was very attentive and provided great service.   Also, we were very pleased with the quality and taste of our food. Patrick and his team of assistant servers made every effort to listen to our special requests and responded very well which included a little extra pepper for my soup as seen in the attached photo!  Lastly, we are looking forward to dining at Giada's again, on our next Las Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little extra pepper for my soup!

DD3IpZuDcfy_zkSkjCiq8w.text: So disappointed. We were so excited because when we looked at the reviews they were great. The food was dry and overcooked. After sending back the first course and never getting a new one back, we tried the main courses and they were just as bad. No seasoning and dry. The only part of the meal that was good was the board we got to start. The server was great and apologetic but the manager not so much. The manager who was rude right off the bat did comp all the food which was about $500 dollars but he had a chip on his shoulder the entire time he talked to us. He seemed very annoyed we had complaints. Not a complaint but multiple complaints. He had the entire table cleared of all plates and told them not to bring anything else. We left hungry and disappointed. Great service but bad management.

uyaQnYhRTkJ-pn4pqCA3AA.text: I really, really wanted to enjoy this evening and meal. My husband planned it out for us and knows my love of food. I've also met Giada a few times as I work in the food industry and she is a nice person. I cook from her first cookbook and our meal could have used some of those recipes.   We started with the mussels which were good but a small portion for the price. It took another 15 minutes for the grilles artichokes come come out afterwards leaving us wondering if they were meant to be Luke warm because they sat. They were flavorless and had no grill flavor. My husbands entree was good ; the pappardelle but mine was, again, flavorless and oily. I had to forgetto. For $28 it was a pile if Israeli like couscous with, I'm not kidding, 3 small slices of zucchini and 2 small Chantral mushrooms. Very oily at the bottom. We skipped desert.   For $200 meal I would much rather go back to Mesa, Olive or Nobu. As much as I wanted to have a special night, this was a disappointment.

isZsUAT3ukwam-beeraxrA.text: Saw Giada speak at our conference and wanted to try her restaurant. The bacon wrapped dates were very tasty, the tricolore salad was really good as well. The lemon spaghetti was our favorite main course meal and best pasta I've had in a while. The drinks were really good too. I will be back here next time I'm in Vegas!

nl6nmX9H6CpPGVLx0cevOw.text: Food  was good but our waitress was terrible  Therefore the experience was not good.  i would not go back anytime soon Hire better people who want to work there Giada

nHS2KvteIXiN8441snHX4A.text: Awesome restaurant with a great view of the strip and delicious food!  Service was a little slow but they were slammed so we understood.  The bread service is a perfect way to start the meal and we followed with several small dishes to share.  All of the food selections were on point... Really really yummy!

Yvwj4YgWbHU-pM3swArelw.text: Incredible meals at Giada! Service was excellent. Food was beyond fantastic. Chicken Marsala meatballs and Ravioli with lobster is divine. For dessert get the Leaning Tower of Espresso. Cannot say enough fantastic things about Giada!

Xumc3WqdfTgZHuOYqCVn5Q.text: Loved our experience. Fabulous service. Bread plate and antipasto platter yum!! Flavors amazing!! Must go.

ujL3ne2dipXsoTHnnpEj0Q.text: I booked this event for 22 people thru the group sales division. We were offered three choice for a family style price fix dinner, and we went with the top option.  At $125 per head and a minimum of $150 required before tax and tip, we all arrived on 10-5-14 for an experience that topped all others anywhere that I have been.  We were greeted promptly at the top of the escalator, and escorted to 3 tables, all beautifully laid out.  I spoke to the GM, and all the wait staff, to greet and handle the alcohol arrangements.  Everyone was super friendly, and the feast began right on time.  This is no ordinary meal, and it took all of my eating powers to try every one of the 28-30 items we were presented with. The house wines flowed freely, and a few awesome cocktails as well, and every dish they brought was spectacular, starting with fresh breads, and amazing amounts of appetizers.  After catching our breath they set up new serving dishes and proceeded to serve up the lemon spaghetti w/shrimp, lobster ravioli, and some amazing salad.  The dinner entrees were the bone-in rib eye, chicken , and scallops w. risotto, all amazing. I requested a nice vegetarian meal for one, and they presented my friend with a beautiful plate of food, which he was very pleased with. For dessert they kept bringing all kinds of wonderful cookies, and other treats, plus each table had fresh sorbet w/ berries, that was made with agave nectar for diabetics like me.  I asked for whipped cream, and they made it fresh for me, which is awesome.  Tremendous service, great food, and great company all for $215per person, including taxes, and tip.  This made sound high to for some reading here, but believe me, not one person complained, as it was an amazing experience.  As a foodie, this was the best ever, so I give it my top rating of all time.  Giada knows how to do first class for sure, so go and enjoy yourself.

buhU5uNm5YtkXsNHDgvxnw.text: Absolutely the best food I have had.  It was a dining experience not to be forgotten.  The food was delicious and of high quality.  Our waiter was knowledgeable about the wine list.  The ssetting was beautiful and relaxing.  Would fly to Vegas just to eat at Giada's.  Thank you.

yEydBqJ7MfAJEsMusSVc5w.text: Best views in the City of Las Vegas! My wife had a birthday and Giada's was the first place she wanted to go

tckRwCVsMB-6ktRiAFq_lA.text: Had an appetizer, delicious. I live in Manhattan for 30 years, main course was insulting in terms of value for money. Clarissa had absolutely no ability to solve the situation appropriately. Really, really, don't go here. Giada, you  should be  embarrassed.

pnUCIzRSeYqI9FRk7PowHA.text: One star is too much!  Giada I wanted to love your food!  I know from watching you on Food Network and making your recipes what you can do!  I was so disappointed and felt betrayed by you.  You are lovely and I so wanted to love your restaurant and food! The restaurant is pretty, open and light.  The service was okay.  My party of four went on a Saturday evening  in mid-May 2016.   The food was very bland and so tasteless!  I usually don't care about the price of food, I enjoy good food!  But I felt so cheated by my experience.  I literally could not eat any of the entree!  The waitress sent the Maitre D over and I told him my veal chop was not a quality piece of meat and that it was very bland and tasteless.   He said that's the way it should taste "it's a taste preference"!  I said "what taste"! Giada do you know what the food is like!  I can't imagine you do?  We paid $500 and ordered a lot of food but not one dish was edible!  Shame on you!!

6O_CTNemU_NEaHgm0LGfqw.text: Stopped by Giadas's for a quick drink. Ended up ordering the imported burrata as an appetizer and was not disappointed. Also ordered the sangria which was very refreshing in 100 degree weather. The burrata was rich and creamy and the sangria had a mint twist to it that gave it a mojito taste. Will come again for lunch.

z5H-F3pKguQbQEx1SN96BQ.text: The ambiance is very nice. The service was average. The food was rich and tasteful but serving sizes were small. For that reason, the food was overpriced.

ZhXEGi_7rJpN_WYXMqzmww.text: My son & I took a chance of dining @ Giada's without reservations while on vacation in Vegas & so glad we did! We were able to secure seating in the lounge area near the bar which was perfect.  Our server was awesome; prompt, professional & very knowledgeable.  We ordered several different small plates to share & all were great!  We could have ordered anything off the full menu.  Would definitely recommend & go back when in Vegas- thanks Giada!!

c809nBO12X_Ub0aQJaezsQ.text: I had some friends that dined during lunch and they didn't have a good experience so I was a bit nervous but man was I blown away! My fiance and I arrived early for our reservation but we were seated fairly quickly which was nice. We did have to wait a few minutes before we saw our server Nathan but he by far was what made our night! He was knowledgable, friendly and seemed to really like what he does. I had the bucatini which for those of you who don't like spice, I'd recommend going a different route. While delicious, the spice was a bit much for me. The cauliflower side was out of this world! Fiance had another pasta dish that was flavorful and in my opinion the best I've ever had! Nathan sent out a round of moscato to congratulate my fiance and I as we had just got engaged which was such a nice touch and much appreciated. We cannot wait to back again. We ended the night with the apple tart and chocolate cake! Was so pleased with the experience!

F-Sj6tIYMO8LGdoQbUvC9g.text: Excellent service and food was fantastic! Highly recommend giadas spaghetti with shrimp, it was delicious. The staff was very friendly even though we had to ask a lot of questions about the menu items. Would recommend.

emRNyQEqVlBioI9ZZhJxeA.text: The dinner we had at the restaurant was spectacular and our waiter was prompt and friendly ,we had Valentino as a server the previous time we were at Giada's and he welcomed us like an old friend. The meal was delicious,appetizers,crab crostini,mozzarella burata, perfect starters. Our entrees, shrimp spaghetti ,very large shrimp well seasoned,filet with lobster ravioli,filet done perfect! Desert chocolate torte, definitely a chocolate lovers delight, rich creamy with a touch of peanut butter,home made gelato,ended a perfect evening! Would absolutely recommend Giada's,beautifully designed,elegant atmosphere, great location with a great view of the strip,fun not stuffy, very friendly and welcoming staff! Absolutely recommend this restaurant.

7Tob6bkfxfxkwDnr4rELTg.text: Was excited to try this place. Very cute decor. The staff at the greeting desk all wore the same black dress but it looked subpar as it didn't fit well and super short on some of them but I got over it.  Seated on a round table which was nice. Ordered the medium size Giadas favorite appetizer platter and we devoured it - it was very tasty especially the bacon wrapped dates. The table ordered various items - risotto, braised short ribs, spicy spaghetti dish that starts with a 'b', and surf and turf. The risotto hit the spot along with the spicy spaghetti. The bummer is that my friends surf and turf came out incorrect-her steak was rare when she asked for medium well. By the time it was sent back and redone for her, we were all done with our dishes which was disappointing for a first time experience. The manager did come by to apologize and did the right thing by providing a complimentary samples of desserts. Overall it was  good but could have been better. I think one of the highlights for us was goofing around in the photo booth in the reception area and taking group pics! It was also nice that they had someone to take picture at the bottom of the stairs-that's a nice touch for special occasions

eQTlRo_Jl-ruDqw00CqEiA.text: Had dinner there. Pretentious, overpriced, mediocre food. The two stars are for the great service and the great tasting cocktails.

xEHu-YKVjl5mCVCVv_EeOA.text: What a gorgeous restaurant and the location is unbelievable.  Giada was smart to put her very first restaurant on the famous four corners of the strip!  The food was amazing, service outstanding and one beautiful place, thanks Giada for coming to Las Vegas!

WGbZCgciCe-5NG7WVC61gA.text: Service is horrible, waitresses have an attitude and it took about an hour to get a pizza and a waffle.

qgX2Q-tZfUmvNt1HQM_1pw.text: My friends and I decided to get breakfast. We didn't wait long and even had our pictures taken in the photo booth. I don't know why, but all our photos were blurry. We were seated promptly. I don't remember what my friends ordered but I ordered salmon eggs Benedict. It took quite a long time for them to take our order and for it to be brought to our table. I would have understood had there been a large breakfast crowd. However, I think there were only a handful of diners in the whole restaurant. Halfway through my meal I found a hair on my toast. I was surprised to find that they still charged me full price for my meal. I've been to small  eateries where they did not make me pay if I found hair in my food. Overall, I was greatly disappointed by my experience here and would have expected more.

UA6S8DMqsPHIQ6EDuLVIcA.text: My friends and I visited Las Vegas for the first time the week of 6/30 through 7/7.  We decided that Saturday night we would enjoy a fine dining experience and then see what the nightlife had to offer.  We got dressed and headed out to the strip sometime around 7PM.  After debating on where to eat we settled on Giada (she is my partner and I's favorite chef after all!).  We were all dressed in appropriate attire, however at the reception desk we were treated as though we had walked in wearing flip-flops and tattered shorts.  We made our way up the escalator and I approached the desk.  A young dirty-blonde haired woman greeted me and I stated that I had a party of 6 and we wished to have dinner.  She started to say "Oh I"m sorry but we..."  At that moment another blonde haired woman (slightly older) literally nudged her with her elbow and said "be nice".  She then preceded to ask me if I would perhaps like to see the menu before we were seated.  Essentially she was insinuating that we obviously could not afford a meal there and looked the part to boot.  I was infuriated, however being the opposite of what hey assumed I was I played along and agreed to see the menu.  We were then whisked away on a tour of the kitchen area and finally seated.  The drink menu was very unique (based on Giada's father's favorite films), I had a Hannibal which was great and my partner had the Barbarella (his favorite film) which was equally refreshing.  We ordered Giada's favorites and calamari for the table as the antipasto, spaghetti and tortellini for the pasta and shared the porterhouse steak with a side of polenta.  The food was amazing just as we expected, however the treatment by the staff left a sour taste in our mouths.  There were other patrons sitting near us wearing shorts and t-shirts whom I am sure were not treated as we were.  The main reason in my opinion is because we mostly looked Hispanic unlike the fairer skinned individuals who were poorly dressed.  While the food was amazing, we will not be visiting Giada again.  I myself have experienced True Italian hospitality, unfortunately it was nowhere to be found at Giada.

KcE5ZQwmkfdNByfmXOpbCA.text: We were so pleased with our dinner last night at Giada at Cromwell.  The room was an upscale contemporary design and the food was well presented and delicious.  We highly recommend Giada.

FRRYf4ZHbdGtAmWegJ2AMA.text: Reading a lot of this reviews, it seems that people's main criticism was the price.  This restaurant is very expensive, but you are receiving a high quality service in return.  The waiter, Fred, made our experience extremely enjoyable.  The antipasti sampler platter was amazing, as was the bread medley that was brought out to us first. In our party there were three dishes ordered.  The first was the lobster ravioli (my order).  I was a little disappointed as the portion was a bit small for $36.  The sauce was good and there was a good amount of lobster in the dish.  The second dish ordered in my party was the shrimp pasta which was given two thumbs up.  The third dish was the vegetable bolognese which was also highly regarded.  The desserts were great. We had the chocolate tart and the espresso tower. Both were great and the prices weren't ridiculous either. Overall, it was a bit pricey, but it was good. I'd go back.

qaJAxwvRPwsNyGegw3FRRQ.text: What a disappointment from service to entree. Mediocre food, and the prices were high for what you are served. Service took forever. I ran out of water several times, and the bill...I thought it would never come! I ordered the lobster ravioli, small portion, lobster over done, kind of tasteless. A friend of mine was not impressed with her homemade pasta, she called it dry and tasteless as well. The view of the city was cool, but not worth the price, nor one of your nights in Vegas.

6wyZLbCnGetUDbrw-wOR8w.text: We had a nice experience at Giada.  Nice 2nd story open air views of The Strip.  Much like her cooking show, the decor was simple, classy & comfortable.  Both the white & red sangrias were large & very refreshing.  The Margherita pizza was great.  I'm giving 3 stars since I made the mistake of ordering the Sweet Ricotta pizza which was too sweet & goopy to be considered pizza.  I would have sent it back, but I figured it was my ordering mistake.  I would probably try Giada again but stick with more standard fare.

tCJDH5BPcoOpqNxdlI3hWw.text: Having seen Giada on the cooking shows for years but never having had her food before, I was excited when local friends suggested we give Giada's a try on a recent Friday night. But after spending almost $300 on an extremely marginal meal - sans any expensive wine - I was a little taken aback by just how bad Giada's really is. For instance, a $79 bone in ribeye came with a bone so big it would have made Fred Flintstone blush. Extremely showy, but not very much fun if you were actually looking for meat, as the bone had to take up at least 10 ounces of the dish. The meat itself was completely flavorless - it didn't seem at all seasoned, not even salt - and the cut was most likely "choice" as opposed to something quality. The mushroom soup my wife ordered was flavorless and bland, but the lemon/shrimp spaghetti pretty good. All in all, not awful, but so many better choices. Of course, one needs to remember that Giada's prides itself on a "female centric" tasting menu, where no one actually really eats any food beyond a nibble (but the white wine and xanax flow freely.) Even desert was blah. Of course the setting was spectacular - and there was "big name" guests in town, but I can sincerely tell you that the hot dog I had at Pink's in Planet Hollywood about an hour after this meal was a far sight better than anything Giada put on the table. Even the waiter seemed adept at suggesting only the most expensive dishes - and ways to share them - so everyone is on point - problem is, just not sure what point they are trying to make at Giada's. Let's see: Pretty face - check. Celebrity pedigree - check. Really cool surname that evokes the glory of American film - check, check, check. Decent food that tastes good - hmmm? Save your money - there is so much better in Vegas.

PoD28x5kN2q9LbyRWsm8bw.text: I was pretty disappointed in our service. Our food was overall really good. We were in a group of 6 and ordered several small plates before dinner.the waiter had recommended the ravioli and spaghetti. I had ordered spaghetti one of their signature dishes and when the ravioli shows up I very politely told the waiter I didn't order this. He very quickly and adamantly told me I was wrong. I hate being that person so I didn't send it back and the waiter didn't even offer an apology. I feel like all restaurants should make an effort to right their wrong. Especially when you your bill is $100+ a head.

oA9j8bkl2hx_83MQlKZW_A.text: My boyfriend and I were extremely excited to try Giada however I would say it was one of the most negative dining experiences I have had in a very long time. The service was absolutely horrendous, our server would disappear for long periods of time and we would have to ask several people to get her for us. Our food came out before we even received our bottle of wine. We finally had to ask for the manager once we were almost done with our meal why we STILL hadn't even gotten it. We also ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was extremely fishy, not fresh at all and at this point we were already having a negative experience.  Overall would never go back here any of our future trips and have already told family members who are going in a few weeks to avoid this restaurant!

DU3fWfRpbENVXLNBPtRDeg.text: I don't post very often but this place deserves the time. Pricey yes BUT the service, the staff, the food, the ambiance, easily justify the money. Our waiter, Gary, was great he recommended a great wine and was a pleasure to talk to. Kyle, mgr or maitre d was there to make sure everything was done right. Our cocktail waitress, didn't get her name, sorry, but she looks like Marsha from the Brady Bunch,LOL, also did a great job.  Next time we get to Las Vegas we will be back. It was a great experience.

yX7-tBEe5bXQxUPkyVUG4A.text: Giada, you need to work on service and timing at your restaurant. Lunch yesterday was a disappointment due to these issues. Even great food will not be enough to bring back diners. Also, the gals at the hostess station gave off a very unfriendly vibe.

Ybzel79AtYPgxIrw5RxkNw.text: Wow, what a disappointment!!!! Perhaps one of the most overrated restaurants ever. The decor is great and that's where it ends. We had 3 apps and 4 different entrees and they were all not worthy of finishing and not to mention I don't know how they can serve espresso that bad.

xB50j8TuoAZ3Buu24u1eZw.text: From the moment I walked in everything was splendid. I ordered the Sangria which was very tasty. Our food came out in a reasonable amount of time. Ordered the Lobster Roll and Wow! Was it delicious! Our server David S I believe he mentioned was great as well. He was very attentive to us and so funny. We asked a few questions about the area and Hotel and he was very knowledgeable and patient with all our questions. What a great personality. Overall I give it an A+.
