One of our party has a gluten allergy and we were all so impressed with how well they accommodated her and she was so overwhelmed by how amazing the gluten free options tasted.  The best part of the whole experience was our server, Rocco S.  I can honestly say that I have never received service as good as what we got at Giada's.  Rocco went above and beyond to ensure that all of our drinks and food were out on time and his knowledge of the dishes and the wine and his quiet, pleasant and humble demeanor just made our night.  It's a restaurant that is definitely worth the price and I will return the next time I visit Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QanfbJVBIKjt7U_Jdgs1mw.text: This was a very reasonably priced restaurant. The salad I had, the Brussels sprouts and the calamari were among the best I have ever had. We stopped in at the last minute during our last few hours in town for a light meal and I'm very glad we did.

QFA6_9o9M8NKwHFZ2Vvevg.text: Our experience at Giada's was fantastic. The food was delicious and we thoroughly enjoyed our evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P7bE5Mlok2OstZb5W_qlkw.text: Giada's has one of the nicest views around. We went at lunch time and got a nice table next to the windows. I could see the Eiffel Towel at Paris and the fountains at The Bellagio. The interior is modern, with a warm, classy touch. It was clean and the staff was very helpful. The breakfast and lunch meals are all on the same menu.  For lunchtime it was pretty quiet. The only server I saw was Billy (fantastic server) and he moved quickly between tables. We started with a white sangria. I'm glad my wife and I split it. Not only was it delicious, it packed a little punch.   I had the Giada burger with an egg and bacon added. The onions overpowered the other flavors, I'll do the burger again without those. The provolone was flavorful and the beef blend was spot on. The burger, bacon, and egg were cooked perfectly. You could bite cleanly through them without pulling the toppings off of the burger.   My wife had the Arugula Salad with the shrimp. Be aware, if you add the shrimp ($11 upcharge) you get 2 shrimp. They are decent sized, but not worth $11.   I will be back, after having the good lunch experience, I'd like to try the dinner out. Give Giada's a try, I think you'll be happy you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Arugula salad
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giada&#39;s burger with egg and bacon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White Sangria

hNwyTXoaogmG1iv8UJygCg.text: Great service.  Flavor of the food was incredible.  Tasting menu was impressive.  Be prepared for a lot of food with the tasting menu but well worth it.  The view of the Strip was fantastic.

YTgI-DUydxp_JLVFYCFIkw.text: Oh Giada... I love you.  This place has become one of my "musts" when visiting Las Vegas.   I made a reservation for one at 5:15pm on a Monday (before leaving for my flight home).  Sure, I definitely didn't NEED a reservation during this not-so-popular time, but I wanted to make sure I could get in.  Sure enough, no problem at all, and I was seated at 5:15.  I'll admit that I had a late lunch around 2pm and wasn't the MOST hungry, but I still wanted to order my favorites.    The Fresh Ricotta Crostini is so unique and delicious... I dream about these things.  Ricotta, honey, lemon & pink peppercorn... perfection.  I also have an inexplicable love for arugula, so I had to order the Arugula Salad.  Arugula, parmigiano-reggiano, candied lemon & pancetta... it's so fresh and light and delicious.  A little pricey at $16, but I really wanted that arugula.  Oh, and I almost forgot the complimentary bread platter!  The rosemary bread is perfection.  It's served with sea salt, an aioli, crushed red pepper, olive oil pesto & capers.  I love having the various "dippers"... every bite can be unique.  I also ordered a cocktail - the Amaretto di' Mulo (amaretto mule).  It's an interesting twist on the mule that features bourbon (Basil Hayden's bourbon), Disaronno amaretto & Fever Tree ginger beer.  Wow this thing was good.    I highly recommend visiting Giada if you're in town.  Service is great, food is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_fzspi_kedMfxlQT_sAdvw.text: Really nice restaurant.  The decor is beautiful. You walk up the stairs to the entry to check in.  Then proceed to the open kitchen. Quit impressive.   We were seated in a great location with views of the fountains at belagio.    Food was amazing.  We started with a cold octopus salad, meat balls and bacon wrapped dates.  All very good.    Mains lamb, pork chop and I ordered the rib eye.    Service was amazing.  Wine selection fantastic  .

pF154q_kpZbyg_Q-t8_u3g.text: Had apps around 3pm as only menu at that time.  Bacon wrapped dates were amazing- otherwise all pretty basic

_GkNq5oibysXSxx2ayrHeQ.text: Simply spectacular!! We ordered the Bacon wrapped dates and fresh ricotta crostini for appetizers and they were made to perfection. The ricotta, lemon and honey blended well together. I ordered the spaghetti for a main entree. The freshness of the pasta simply radiates during the meal. The portions look small but I was stuffed after  dinner. Great dining experience and worth the price. 10/10 would go again!

py5RM0XoGn1ydVmmInoUdg.text: My mom and I went to Giada's for lunch during our trip. There was a slight wait, but once we were seated we knew the wait was going to be worth it. The view from our table overlooking the strip was lovely. We each had a glass of champagne and ordered the charcuterie. Everything we tried was tasty and unique. The service was prompt and the atmosphere was fresh. I would definitely recommend.

iYoq7TuhifuZslrBM4bQEw.text: As a Food Network Junkie, I had very high expectations.   The experience knocked my expectations were knocked out of the park.  We had brunch reservations, however we couldn't just order brunch options.  Appetizer was an order of the hazelnut chocolate chip pancakes to share. The presentation was beautiful and it was delicious.  Crunch of the hazelnuts made the dish.  I was worried that it would be too sweet, but it was perfectly balanced.  I had the spaghetti pomodoro with meatballs and added milanese chicken (Hey why not). Absolutely Phenomenal!   Make reservations and GO!

W4tmk2l_K4I1ZvxD4gF0jQ.text: Having visited Rome last October we wanted to compare the pasta and this didn't come close.  Sad to say but this was our worst meal while in Vegas. They really have their staff trained to upsell you on everything!   Pretty much came here for what I thought was just going to be appetizers that turned into a $150 disappointment.   The best thing was the pesto with the bread, we asked for more to put on everything.   Pasta flight with chicken was horrible. It might have been 1 breast cut up if that. Chicken had a crust but was very dry. Spaghetti tasted like it was from a can, no flavor. The only one that was decent was a lemon flavor one.   Creamed brussel sprouts were very salty and it was a mush, I like whole or halved brussel sprouts so I know what I'm getting.   So yeah, pasta flight, wine flight, a beer, a side, espresso and lemon souffle that all sucked.   And they let some lady with her fake ass service dog sit at the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. overpriced and lacking flavor

lm1rQuqUjvSf2TozcjNYWg.text: Great food and environment still wondering  about how they make the plain arugula salad so tasty! It doesn't feel like Las Vegas at all!

iAtIKN5eWmBtYi6IVyhLIw.text: We've been wanting to try Giada for awhile now. I love watching her cooking shows and have several of her cookbooks.  We decided to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary there. We got there early for a drink. We were pleasantly greeted by the bread prep person who asked us how our day was going as we headed to the bar. Super nice personal touch. The bartender was fabulous. Great personality and after asking us what types of flavors we like, he knew how to concoct a drink that we would enjoy. 5 stars for those 2 people. When our table was ready, we were seated at a lovely table by the window as we requested.   It was a good 5 minutes before anyone greeted us or dropped off menus or water or anything. No biggie. Just odd when it wasn't that busy and one would think their service would be great after our bar experience. Our server showed up with menus and introduced himself. A couple minutes later his helper showed up with water and introduced himself. Nice touch. Our server's personality was pretty flat, zero energy or enthusiasm for his job. Seemed like he was just punching in on a clock. Ok so ambiance 8, server attitude a 3. He made a couple of recommendations when we asked him. We took him up on his recommendations. We had the bruschetta and the Marsala meatballs. Both were good. Not great, but above average. We then ordered our entrees we had the petit filet and the pan seared halibut and the rigatoni dish to share. The filet was terrible. It had very little flavor, was dried out (medium rare) and was just bleh. I've made better at home. If you want an amazing steak...Stripsteak is the place to go. The halibut wasn't much better. It was the toughest fish I've tasted for halibut. Dried out and tough probably because it was over cooked. The sauce was flavorful. I was not a fan of the Swiss chard served with it. The pasta rigatoni was the best tasting out of all the dishes. It was flavorful and fresh. It was time for dessert. They have a dessert cart. I'm not sure what it was for because our waiter never offered to bring it by. It was kind of a tease because it rolled past us a few times, but our waiter just dropped off two small dessert menus. Then 5 mins later showed up and said "which one do you want?" We chose the limoncello souffle. It appeared our waiter wanted to turn the table when he said "oh that one takes 12-13 minutes." Well ok. That's fine. Didn't ask if we wanted coffee or anything, just walked off. The souffle was ok. Was a little too undercooked/raw for me. It was just wet foam inside. All in all, we were greatly disappointed in this restaurant, the food wasn't good and the service was below average. With all the competition from other restaurants on or near the strip, the pricing and portion sizes I wouldn't recommend or revisit this restaurant. Looks good, but doesn't deliver the quality. 2 stars are for the pasta, location/ambiance and the bartender. Otherwise it would be 1 Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E8crpNYzCLXoGbOH17uhVg.text: Food is great and excellent customer services. Little wait time and the food is fresh. It's a must for something light. FYI the hash browns are a must

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SxkYS2RaTfAVaZhxC4JaRw.text: I love everything Giada so I must be honest, I'm not one bit surprised I loved her restaurant. As soon as you walk up the stairs you are greeted by elegance. From the decor in the 'waiting area' to the friendly hostess's. It was very welcoming right when we got there. My boyfriend and I decided to sit at the bar and as soon as we sat down I noticed every bit of detail from the napkins to the ice cold water waiting for you, very elegant and very Giada. I ordered a frose and so did pretty much every woman around me. They were so good it was dangerous. From there we ordered a pizza (pictured) and their sliders. Both were delicious. You could taste the love and fresh ingredients in every bite. I can't wait to come back and explore the rest of the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kUEeMS-iuTKNkFEQx9y4ZA.text: Was here for brunch last time and did not enjoy the food that much, but I wanted to give them another try. So glad I did!  The lobster ravioli were the best ravioli I ever had!!!! Filled with real lobster meat and I can taste freshness of the lobster in the sauce too!!!! The smoked  Berkshire was out of this world. I had to go back the next day for them.  Will be back soon!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ld1QSn2RcRoVYN0gWPxOgg.text: Generally overrated! Good for gawking at plastics in dental floss dresses that leaves nothing to the imagination, 6-in stilettos, and 20 layers of makeup for your viewing pleasure. If you are wondering if she is his daughter or his girlfriend, that's his girlfriend!   I finally made it here to have dinner to see what the hype is all about. I had been told by several friends that it was impossible to get a reservation, which I truly don't understand.  The view is nice but significantly lacking from the one at Paris or Cosmo, mostly due to the fact that the restaurant is on the 2nd level and not much higher. The Bellagio fountains are obstructed by the crosswalk bridge over Las Vegas Blvd, so not my much of a view. I probably saw more weirdos on the strip my whole meal more than anything else.  The service was ok but considering this is a fine dining establishment my drinks were not refilled during the meal & I actually had to ask a busboy to do it. I ordered an entree and an appetizer. The bacon wrapped dates were very good $16 for 5. However, my entree was terrible! Small plate of whatever it is that I had 3 bites of and left. Cost $28 and was a complete waste. The only thing that kept me from going home hungry was the complimentary bread with a variety of salts and butter.   Definitely would not come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon wrapped dates
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

mcyKGAl7J52C0KYidlsG8w.text: Wow. Small portion high prices. Not a good combination.   The food is good, but it's rationed. Giada's got a gold mine as long as she maintains a high profile.   Will I return. No. I don't mind paying, but I need value for my hard earned $$$$.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2gM3TDFvl8ueffLOwXAHkQ.text: I can't wait to return for their breakfast menu! I had the waffle with an egg and procuitto on top and I was amazed that breakfast can be so simple yet so perfect. The syrup was light yet sweet. The flavors weren't super amazing, it's just breakfast done right with elegance. I didn't get hingry right away so the meal gave me long lasting energy. My husband had an American Breakfast. The toast comes with different toppings such as homemade jelly, nutella, lemon butter and salt and pepper.  The restaurant is so cute and resembles so much of Giada. It has a feel of home.  I am coming here again and again!

XB4PwgokH0FkY24-ecQkSg.text: Everything is so good, starting with yogurt (perfect taste and consistency without artificial thickeners!) going on with sandwiches and don't get me started on biscottis and gelato and coffee. Definitely a highlight of my Vegas trip!

bK9IzP6pKBC1Xm37bL7k-w.text: We had reservations of 8 for brunch.  When we walked into the restaurant we loved it!  The decor is great and it doesn't really feel like a typical restaurant.  Our waiter was really nice and helpful.  Everything seemed great, until after our entrees were dropped off.  I'm not sure if they were short staffed that day, but all of a sudden we couldn't find a waiter/waitress to help us fill our drink glasses nor ask us if we needed anything. After what felt like over 10 minutes, I finally was able to wave down our server.  He simply stopped and didn't apologize or even ask what was needed, he just stared.  Hmmm okay. well can you fill all our glasses???  Then it took me another 10 minutes to flag someone down for the check.  It's really sad we were so happy at the beginning, but they just couldn't keep it up.    I probably won't be going back, the food was just "okay".  One of our guest actually had to exchange her salad for another dish (soup) and she was still unimpressed.  Maybe dinner is their strong suit.  Who knows...

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta special of the day... lasagna

bgb0YG8jcE7vAc5Abr8ALA.text: We were excited to experience this restaurant because of its popular name, there was a celebration, my husband's 60th !  The tables were really 'crunched in a small space', maximized where the servers bumped into you ! It was a noisy place, crowded, food was not the greatest, we have experienced better food preparations and taste, we don't mind paying more money if the taste and preparation of the food is extraordinary but it was not ! We were disappointed so to speak !  My three stars are for the effort and the name ...and the 'Happy Birthday' plate they prepared for my husband ....

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some celebration

qAkDylLpbTRwstX8dVNRZg.text: Another yummy breakfast at Giada's  We love having breakfast here. The ambiance is light and airy. We had a huge round booth overlooking the strip. American breakfast with eggs, bacon, house made sour dough toast, lemon fingerling potatoes. The most delectable pastry baskets wonderful non alcoholic drink creations and I absolutely loved Giada's Sangria. Our favorite place for breakfast in Las Vegas.

Q7uMzaZ2zkZQgIf7Y8XgNQ.text: I expected a lot and got more than expected.  Been here several times.  If you are lucky, Giada herself will be  there and she is more than happy to say hello and check on you personally!  She told me a secret about the two of us (same birthdate) and we had a good laugh.  How personable is it?  The service staff while not perfect, was one of the nicest ones I've encountered.  You feel like you are not in a restaurant but an open room having dinner in someone's dining room off a kitchen.    Get the meatballs and the sandwiches are spectacular.  And obviously do not skip on dessert!  The restaurant is on the 2nd level of the Cromwell Hotel.  Don't miss the selfie picture booth while you wait for your table.    The first time we ate here we were seated along the window with a great view if the strip and Bellagio fountains.  My colleagues had pasta dishes and I had the prosciutto grilled cheese sandwich.    They messed up my colleagues dish ( forgot to add chicken) and then it took a while for it to come, but the hostess and waitress were extremely and sincerely apologetic.  They brought him a whole new dish although he ate half of the first dish.  My new favorite upscale casual dining experience on the Strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbet
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donuts
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Button pasta (orrechetti)

Dgf2LVmxTPsoP6DfMdGq4g.text: Accolades to Diego and the staff for the attention to detail and making the Tasting Menu better than we imagined. The variety for our table of 3, just-right portions of Lobster Raviolis, Lemon Shrimp Spaghetti, Antipasti Platter with the scrumptious Bacon Wrapped Dates, Sauteed Mushrooms, Honey and Parmesan and Goat Cheese stuffed Sweet Peppers. The Filet was perfectly seared, Branzino pan fried crispy and stuffed with beautiful greens, while the Salmon with the Tangerine Vinegrette was light and cooked Medium rare. There was no room for the pastry cart but who can pass up the handmade Chocolate Bar, Lemon Cookie, sorbets, and Lemon Cheesecake. Such a lovely evening with a view of the Bellagio Fountain Show. Reserved on Open Table before leaving town. The crowd arrives after 7pm filling the room.

g8EbH0ChbTmqeY-4ugfHDg.text: Booked a reservation a few weeks in advance on open table since we were a party of 10.  They sat us in a private dining area which was just as beautifully decorated as the entire restaurant.     Started with a medium Salumi platter although the waiter said it feeds 3-4 people it actually is plenty for about 5-6 people.   Also had the calamari and shrimp and oysters for apps which we were also delicious.   Since we were a large party, we ordered different dishes and I was able to try several which were all fabulous.   Signature spaghetti was the top of the list, lobster ravioli, risotto, and branzino are my runner ups.  Ended the dinner with the chocolate molten cake.   Awesome dinner, fantastic service by Timothy our waiter, would love to go back and try the new additions to the spring menu.      There's even a photo booth to capture these memories.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto with scallops and crab
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Place setting
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salumi platter - medium size

TsUPX7Ur-mvc4xdcrIBZYA.text: This Italian place provided excellent service and a fabulous dessert, Champagne Cavier! However, the rest of our NewYears Eve meal was overpriced. The lamb shank was tender but not at all flavorful and the shrimp was unremarkable. While I know meal prices on "The Strip" are expected to be elevated, my meal, for the 5-star price was disappointing. The special tasting menu was good, but was priced for a wine flight and didn't include the wine!

P2QsP6IjB4ImQ3wxYhGuug.text: Mediocre Food, Great Service, Nice Ambiance   Let's start with the positives, the restaurant is beautiful and the service is great!  The music was a bit loud, but we were also there on a Friday night.  The table we got by the window was really nice since you could look out on the Vegas strip and see the Bellagio water fountain shows.    The food.  I mean, the food would be 2 stars for me.  It was just so mediocre and predictable.  It's never a nice meal when I know that I can make better food in my kitchen at home.  First, the lack of a price on the tasting menu is beyond annoying (FYI - it is $120 / person).  I hate that I had to ask.  Second, it's way overpriced.  I've eaten at e by Jose Andres, Joel Robuchon and L'Aterlier, Le Cirque, Guy Savoy, etc. (just for comparison in Vegas), and this was not worth it.  As such, we just ordered off the regular menu.  Other than the free bread that comes with the meal, which was outstanding, the food was disappointing.    Pecorino Tartufo with apricot preserves  - meh.  Needs a vessel to be served on.  Only came with the cheese.  This was a server recommendation.  Blah. Roman Caprese and Baby Kale Salad - both excellent.   Spaghetti - shrimp was excellent, but the spaghetti was underwhelming.  It was under-sauced, and the sauce was more like an Alfredo if it was weak and bland.  This was a server recommendation.  Meh. Whole Roasted Chicken - well cooked, salty.  Overall, it was meh.  I can make it better at home.  The cacciatore was super sweet and underwhelming.  I can do better by making my own sauce in a pressure cooker that has way more depth of flavor.    All in all, we would not go back.  You can easily identify how the recipes come together, and where they fall apart.  When my party and I spent the majority of the meal discussing how we could have improved the dish, it isn't a dish worth paying for.

Ofh1k9yi94QbDh9-BZZNNw.text: Despite some of the other reviews, I enjoyed my experience at Giada. The hostesses could have been a little more friendly but over all it's the perfect spot for a date night. I've always loved an open kitchen where you can see the chefs preparing food so you get an idea of what to expect ahead of time, and the room itself was spacious and beautifully decorated. Our table had a great view overlooking the city though I was seated too close to another gal who kept bumping into me. The service was exceptional and whenever our waiter was at the table he always seemed to be smiling and engaging. Very friendly! As for the food, it was on the more expensive side, but very tasty. The serving sizes were big enough to share so we tried a few different dishes which is always the way to go in my opinion. Honestly, the pizza was probably one of my favorites. All of the food was good but you can't go wrong with a home made pizza with a hint of a smokey flavor from the oven. Next time I will have to try the desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

46WrrcUW8LFPQhL1nWDBIg.text: We celebrated our 27th anniversary at Giada's. It was amazing and the food was great!  We were greeted and treated so kindly. It was a great experience.

wgCs-v5QJyl4xJL5cRd8TA.text: Beautiful restaurant with an even better view of the Las Vegas strip. The food was good. My only complaint was that it was a little oily for my liking. I had a pizza and my friend had the lobster hash. Hers a well was very oily. All in all the flavor was great.

ahswtVruWelYMa4UX47D8w.text: This dining experience was very good. I wouldn't say it was great. Our server had the personality of a rock. I believe you could tell him that he won a million dollars and he would just look at you and say okay. The starter breads were very good, the pizza appetizer was good, my veal chop was very good and my wife's spaghetti was good. One thing that irks me about these high end restaurants is no salt and pepper on the tables. How does the chef know what everyone's palate is like? I don't get it. I don't know if I would come back, there just weren't enough food options that I like. We ate at Gordon Ramsay's the day before and that was awesome and definitely some place I would revisit.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AWaSoNBdfc-mbsjy3vJAeQ.text: I wanted my first 2015 review to start off on the right foot and that's why I've been saving this one!   We actually went last month for dinner. Definitely be sure to make a reservation way in advance if you're wanting anything between 6pm-8pm. And when I say in advance I mean months in advance. We booked about a month out and the only option we had was either 5pm or 9pm.   Yes the service is slow. Our entire dining experience was 2 hours total. But that's what exactly this is, an experience. If you're looking for a quick in and out, this is not the place you want to be.  Yes the portions do look small. However looks are very deceiving. Once you start eating, it is very hearty! In fact we had a difficult time finishing everything. And trust me, you want to finish everything because it's so good!  Now onto the food:  -COMPLIMENTARY CARBS: I have to say, these were so delicious! I could sit there and eat that all day. In fact we even asked to take it to go! Haha. There were 3 different types of bread that came with 3 different types of sides to put on. This here will definitely fill you up to try to control yourself!  -LOBSTER ARANCINI: This was ok. Definitely tasted more of the breading than the actual lobster itself. Wouldn't recommend this.  -PIZZETTE MORTADELLA: It was our fault for ordering this thinking the portions were small and that we weren't going to be full. This is a mini pizza but definitely skip this and save room for the main course. It was nothing special. Felt like lunch meat on puffed up pizza crust.  -SPAGHETTI: Definitely get this! This was amazing. The size of the shrimp was literally the size of my hand. And it was cooked to perfection. Love the pasta since it was freshly made. Again the portion may look small when it's first brought out but I had to have my husband help me finish it.  -SALMON: Definitely get this as well! Again cooked to perfection. The quality is that of sashimi.   -ROASTED CAULIFLOWER: Various color of cauliflower, roasted just right.   -GIADA SIGNATURE DRINK: They are definitely not stingy with the alcohol put into this. A beautiful drink. But not for me.   Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. Get only one antipasti. A main dish per person. And I promise you your taste buds will thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Arancini

M_84J6cxyKdMuJd8WMrx3Q.text: I was super impressed with GIADA despite the contrary of these people leaving them bad reviews!  GET ROCCO as a server he's seriously the best. His suggestions were amazing, he was never trying to upswell and you could tell he cared about you and your evening so much.  I mean he started with are you celebrating anything this evening?! He actually cared about how our time was and that everything was palatable and enjoyable.   I started with the best aperol spritz I have had so Light and fresh with the perfect notes of orange and just enough bubbles. Then the bread selection was RIGHT UP MY ALLEY, with 6 different things to get your taste buds going.   The branzino was flavorful, and the kale salad to start was just the right amount of sweet tender and salty. I ate it in minutes.  Overall, we have a very enjoyable experience and a GREAT view of the strip. It's a beautiful clean restaurant and I so glad ROCCO could be at our service, the pleasure was all ours.

tT3RBcTXH1dMCaXeXA3r5A.text: After I posted how disappointed I was in our experience at Giada's I received a reply from a manager, Mina S., stating that if we had wanted a nice view table for our anniversary dinner, they do require a signed commitment that we would spend a minimum of $100 per person. First of all, I wasn't offered that option when I made the reservation. Secondly, we would have easily spent that amount. Lastly, how arrogant! I own a restaurant and this seems like bad policy. Don't let them hold your wallet hostage.

SQtbx9gCRwL8XgI8I1dJig.text: This was such a surprising find! Half of our group is huge Giada lovers while the other half is unsure. We left fans of her food and design, at least! The room is fantastic. You walk in to the smell of the wood burning ovens. The tables at the window give an indoor/outdoor feel, which was great. Wonderful view of the Bellagio fountains. The staff was generally attentive although it added to our weekend's experience that service in Vegas doesn't live up to expectations. Our server was "trying" too hard, which made for some awkward moments at the table. But back to the food...the lobster roll with fried capers was awesome although the value was a bit off (not sure it was nearly $40 good!). The carbonara pizza was unbelievable-clear highlight of the meal. Or was the Barbarella cocktail the winner? I'd go back for both!

u-KHIPOTxAvapouw9L5byQ.text: Food here was great but a little over-rated. I love italian food so I had high expectations. Overall some of the food was lacking seasoning. I had the crab risotto and wasn't that impressed. The small plates are the way to go!

7vzCsdC7FB1YN5iT1FQSIw.text: Wow.  Made a reservation and was seated 20 minutes late.  Ordered, and received our meal an HOUR and a HALF later.  No explanations and never saw the waitress Stephanie for over 30 minutes.  Finally, received an insincere apology from the waitress after asking for the assistant manager, Greisy, who also did not show any genuine concern that they set us back 2 hours waiting for some scrambled eggs and a waffle.  The treatment from the staff was simply rude and dismissive.  When the food finally arrived, it appeared thrown together, there was another delay in getting salt and pepper (?), and the meal was mediocre at best.  Dined at numerous high end restaurants on the Strip and this is hands down the most unprofessional and unpleasant dining experience of the bunch.  Skip this place, plenty of other great options to enjoy weekend brunch.  Zero stars.

xIeC36zo0KHHlLB_E8z29Q.text: Loved it! Wanted to visit this place since it opened and reading the reviews was just making me more and more interested in going. Sat at the bar since I was just dining by myself, hostesses were nice and welcoming, even offered me a small tour of the restaurant. Eric, the bartender who took care of me, owned the bar! He was making great suggestions to all of his customers. I started with a cocktail, the Destroyer it was so good but 18 dollars refrained me for getting a second one. For my meal I decided to make two antipasti and a pasta dish. Great choice! I started out with the Vitello Tonato crustini antipasto, it was a fancier version from the rustic original Italian version, but all the flavored were there! Delizioso! Second came the Bacon Wrapped Dates, good but I was still overwhelmed by the crustini I had before. Eric offered me a small splash of Nero D'Avola to pair my dates and enjoy them better, it made a huge difference. Before my entree I had the Oro di Milano beer, nice and full bodied beer, around 8,5 abv. Finally the dish that blew my mind came, the Lobster Ravioli!! Wow, I was speechless when I took the first bite. Everything in that plate balanced perfectly, I could go back tomorrow and eat the same thing again!!  Overall, great experience! Would definitely recommend and come back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meal in four pics

INiDGcOHOKbFEvewCbYpgQ.text: 6 in our party for dinner. Cocktail called Hannibal was awesome. The ambiance real nice, loved the spacious round table and comfy upholstered dining chairs.  I ordered the romaine salad with fried capers and vinigrette Caesar. It was dressed well not saturated I liked the flavor. Missed the fried capers, too few to be memorable. The two croutons sucked and may as well been left off.  The bucatini was alright. Again I liked it but not for the price.  The al dente stuck to my teeth and not in a good way. Lacked sauce!!!     The ricotta was a teaspoon Seriously!!  Husband had the lobster ravioli and liked it.   The service was great!   So, if you like small portions(trust me, you won't need a doggy bag here) and care less if there's  any yummy sauce to mop up.  Bread was more like a soggy garlic ball and not crusty, too much Rosemary . Then there you go, it's pricey, it's in the strip and we've been there and won't likely return.

QrS0LS0S_eT_J_iz9MkI5Q.text: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at Giada. From the moment we walked in, we were met with friendly smiles and treated like royalty, especially after being seated and then greeted by our server, Nancie. Nancie obviously loves her job and it shows with her friendly and knowledgeable manner in which she guides newcomers through the realm that is Giada. We were made to feel more than welcome and fully intend on enjoying Giada when we return to Las Vegas.

HUcxHsZamoOh5K72wLoMcg.text: I think the main reason why people go is because she's a popular food network star. The service was great, the decor was very nice, and the food tasted amazing, but as expected of a restaurant by a celebrity chef, the food was somewhat overpriced. I also think you should beware of very limited menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing amazing desserts

rjFPWgqK5_v-q9y1YH_y5Q.text: Love going to Giada's restaurant it had an elegant  setting with a beautiful view. Well prepared elegant meals that are all super yummy. I've had their Sunday Brunch Tasting Menu, the selections were amazing and the price is worth it. The dinner menu is superb, I can never get pass the Auntipasti and Pizzette, I always get stuck ordering everything on that selection.

ye9KMOTqPXvpguCDik3IdQ.text: Service was spot on, my wine glass was never empty! Courses were timed appropriately and everything was delicious. My only critique is that my Scallops in the seafood risotto were slightly salty. Highly suggest he short ribs, kale salad and giada's favorites. The BEST part of the meal was the lemon ricotta cookies.... UNREAL!!!

XvMjKBsI7oquiE57sfI4tQ.text: Went as a business dinner with eight people. Unlike many other Italian restaurants, the portions are not huge. But that is OK when you are traveling and don't have room for leftovers anyway. The flavors were delicious. The service was OK.  Between the eight of us, we tried about half of the menu. Everyone enjoyed their food.

d3cdiHiG3VYkRm1kC3jLjw.text: All I have to say is WOW. I came into tonight with high expectations and let me tell you what we were not disappointed. From the vast wine selection, to the endless appetizers and entrees and the wonderful staff this meal was beyond marvelous. 5 Stars!!!

mkOV7NThuu-XOiRQREMLDg.text: My visit to Giada's was all and more than I expected. Myself and 3 guests really wanted to go for dinner but didn't make reservations early enough to secure one. We were not going to go but we couldn't imagine leaving Las Vegas without going to Giada's so we found a lunch reservation that fit perfect in our vacation plans. Hands down BEST meal of our vacation!  Stephanie was our server and she gave amazing service! She was joyful, welcoming and most importantly, she knew the menu very well, as our group had questions and dietary needs. We each ordered a cocktail and lunch entree and then shared 2 desserts. Everthing was "lick my plate" wonderful! Next Vegas trip we all agreed a must repeat. BTW all 4 of us are Italian and love how Giada captures Italian flavors in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria with amazing view from our table.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert! cookies and the lightest tasty donuts with Nutella

C-t4OhcMNkdTUiHifp9NQw.text: Nancy was our server, and absolutely delightful! The food is very delicious, and service  is impeccable. A bit pricey, but if you plan for it, you will not be disappointed. Well done to Giada and her staff!

BjU0nVEzzcN1jgfcSiCdOg.text: Had An amazingexperience at Giada. Food and service amazing!! Nancy our server was the best server we have had on our trip. Will definitely be back!

n6wwl1x8z1u0PWA1JHT8Gg.text: We just left.  Probably the worst fine dining experience we've ever had.  Started out with Calamari which was over breaded, over cooked and rubbery.  We sent the hyped up $60 chicken entree back because it was over cooked, dry as a bone, and no flavor. KFC OR Popeyes would have been way better.  They suggested the tomahawk pork as a replacement. It was thin, fatty and tough. They paired it with lobster ravioli that was undercooked.  We had come expecting and looking forward to greatness instead we left our special anniversary dinner $250 lighter in the wallet and feeling ripped off.  The only reason for 2 stars instead of 1 is that our server Tim was professional and apologetic about the kitchen's failures.  I honestly think Giada and Gordon Ramsey should become friends. And we absolutely love Giada. She's always been my favorite celebrity chef.  But can't help but feel she would be embarrassed if she had been there tonight.

B6gdzYU3XwtjQiFEX4j5ZQ.text: My husband and I enjoyed lunch at Giada on Saturday during our stay at The Cromwell. We would have preferred to eat dinner there, but lunch was our only option because we decided to go to Vegas as a last minute getaway. Even with a lunch reservation, we had to wait over 20 minutes for a table.   Service was good, but there is room for improvement. Delicious bread was brought to our table, but we had to wait five minutes for bread plates. We witnessed this same thing happen to another table, but they had ordered several pizzas to share and had to sit there staring at the pizzas until someone brought them plates over five minutes later. This should be an easy fix for Giada. Also, my husband ordered sparkling water and was not given a different glass, so when a different server automatically refilled his water glass with flat water, our server scolded the water person. It was a little awkward, and to fix this, they need to bring a different glass if someone orders sparkling water.   The restaurant is open and lovely. You notice instantly that they have put great thought into the details of the restaurant. Unfortunately, out table was right next to the server station, so nearly each time a server left this area, I would get bumped in my seat. With so much thought put into every aspect of the restaurant, I am surprised that they have squeezed a table into this area. Hopefully, they will remove this table so diners can enjoy a relaxing dining experience without the irritation of having servers brush up against you or knock into your chair.   The lunch menu seemed quite limited, offering only one pasta dish, and no meatless pasta option. I really wanted to order pasta, but since this was not an option, we ordered the olives, burrata, the kale mushroom and gorgonzola pizza, the romaine salad, and the lobster roll. Everything was fabulous, but it all had a lot of olive oil.   The specialty coffee drinks and desserts sounded amazing, but we were pretty full and the restaurant had gotten pretty hot in the direct sunlight, so we decided against it.   Next time we are in Vegas, I will make reservations for dinner far in advance, so we can try a pasta dish and definitely enjoy dessert and coffee. I do not think we would go back for lunch, but I look forward to trying dinner at Giada.

DryaA0CAtd7J41ItNeViCA.text: Trust me... this is one of the great food experiences of Las Vegas.  Easily headed to our top-ten list.  From the initial greeting to the final goodbye we experienced professionalism, good food and drink, and a True feeling like everyone was on the same page making sure that good times happen for the guests. Giada and her team goes all the way and succeeds; thanks to all for giving us one of the times of our lives!

cS0zykyACjLpXIULDXReCA.text: This place was amazing! The lemon spaghetti with prawns was, by far, my favorite. The service was top notch as was the atmosphere. I'm a foodie and was really looking for a great experience to start my Valentines weekend off right. This place did not disappoint!

LR4x5xzIr4OvzcE8Tq6Dbg.text: Wow, what a slide down the slippery road of culinary success:(. I brought my brother and his wife from LA with promises of Italian ambrosia and what a disappointment!  We ordered the $78 rib eye, which was tasteless, under seasoned scallop risotto and very mediocre shrimp pasta.  The appetizers were also disappointing - eggplant parmigiana was tasteless, same as charred octopus. Very sad. We're locals and have a great selection of excellent restaurants in this city. Giada does not stand close to being a good restaurant.

7K2e_gwJ-u9-8GPWVyZpGQ.text: I've been excited to stay here so I was looking forward to our Brunch reservations. The restaurant is nice, we ordered two waffles and cappuccino the bill was over $50. The waffles were delicious however we were required to refill our water on our own. I sat there for over 10 mins while all of the servers were standing around talking (there was only about 6-7 tables so it was slow). Not once did the server check with us to see how the food tasted or offer more drinks. I actually refilled mine and my sisters water when we were out. I do not have plans of returning again. I knew it was expensive but went for the experience, however the service is better at the buffets or any restaurant we went to besides Giadas. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

SIrLnYY_OWhLMahspPd3_Q.text: Very disappointing! My husband and I ate here at 8:00 p.m. on Sunday, Dec. 10th. First of all, we had to ask for bread. When it did arrive, the waiter did not explain anything about the selection of items on the bread board. We were not told of any chef's specials, if there were any. We wanted the butternut squash soup. They were out of it. The oysters rockefeller were extraordinary! Unfortunately, that was the only great thing about  our meal. The veal saltimbucca was just barely lukewarm, so the cheese was not ooey gooey, as it should have been, and it was dry. It had way too much breading on it for my taste, and I did not care for the red sauce that came with it, on the side. I've had much better saltimbucca at Bootleggar, and it didn't cost $57, either. The service was so-so. They did not keep our water glasses filled. This place is very over priced and underwhelming. I would not go back. The first time we dined here was just after it opened, and it was wonderful! The service and the food were superb. That was, sadly, not the case this time around. I also remember them asking us to rate and review them after dinner, on our last visit. They did not do that this time. I also remember the manager coming around to the tables to greet everyone and check on them, on our last visit. That also did not happen this time around. When you factor in the $14 we had to pay for parking, even as locals, it was a truly disappointing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cold, dry, bland veal saltimbucca, $57
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters Rockefeller was the only good thing about our meal

ap8UkqkxAPypVOTGJvor6Q.text: Went to Giads's last night. Absolutely phenomenal. Did the tastings menu at our servers suggestion and was not disappointed.   The two of us had the tasting menu. The breads and antipasti were very good. I really enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates. The lemon spaghetti and shrimp were out of this world ( remember this is not ronzoni pasta folks, it's fresh made and served al dente). For our proteins we had the rack of lamb ( 4 pieces and you could cut it with your fork) and the tenderloin. Both had a perfect medium rare cook. The garnishes were all tasty as well, but honestly we just tried them as we were getting full ( I may or may not have polished off the basil mashed potatoes). Then the desert cart comes out. Again, we were getting full, but we tried the 8 layer chocolate cake and one other. Awesome!  Our servers, Andrew and Michael were on point all night. Anticipated our needs, made suggestions and delivered the goods! True professionals!  I laugh when I read some of the reviews as they complain about the portion sizes. I'm 6'1", 230 lbs and I was full. I wasn't stuffed to the point where I had to undo my belt like on thanksgiving, but I was full.  Vegas has plenty of all you can eat buffets. This is not one of them. If you want quality and a unique dining experience I suggest you give this place a try!!  Thank you Giada!

apqZzwr7TXMeuStjjFDYBg.text: My wife is a pretty big fan of Giada's show and we heard from family that this a place worth trying when we were out in Vegas. The service and ambiance of the restaurant were without a doubt a 5 out of 5, it's by far the most elegant restaurant I have ever been to. The server was really attentive and helpful; recommending drinks and constantly asking if we needed anything. We decided to do the tasting menu, it had no prices on the menu which was disappointing, we knew it was going to be really expensive but we decided to roll with it anyways. Overall we liked the food, but we felt like every dish was very rich, the meal could've been better balanced. We both had the steak, which was over-seasoned, I'm tough steak critic though. The highlights of the meal were definitely the lemon spaghetti appetizer and the dessert cart! The Lemon ricotta cookies live up to the hype, they're to die for. I really enjoyed my experience, and I would go back, just wouldn't do the menu tasting experience, but I'm glad I tried it once.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria, highly recommend
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious way to start the tasting menu experience. Very good bread, and the lemon butter is awesome
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti

JW5IeDUJeGmeEzQ7kG8LoQ.text: Avoid avoid avoid! There are much better places to try and this is just a celebrity chef trying to capitalize on her family name.  Go to Bobby's restaurant across the street. Its WAY BETTER.   First of all my husband and I are really Giada fans and have been watching her show since it started so long ago and have cooked alot of her recipes so we were super excited to come here. We dressed up well and were excited.  From the moment we came in it was just weird.   1) The staff that welcomes you first said HI and that you are early, which is fine so we start waiting, but while we were waiting the hostesses kept looking over at us and chitter chattering.  It was kinda uncomfortable. I made eye contact with them multiple times and it was ODD. 2) Giada's restaurant is known for its location and main dining area with windows all around it to view the strip.  We got taken to a table in the dark corner at a L-shaped dining arranged across from the bar where ppl's backs were facing us.  We asked if there was another table and they showed us another dark corner of the restaurant where only 2 ppl were sitting and the table was next to the escalator.  Then they told us to wait 30 minutes for another table.  So we decided we did not come all this way to Las Vegas to sit in some dark corners so we said we would wait.  We go back out and then suddenly and magically another hostess says there is another table ready and we get taken to the main dining floor.  I mean com'on MAGICALLY there is table.  Ridiculous.  We were dressed up so I do not understand the run around.   The ppl next to us were wearing shorts. I have no freaking clue, but I was pissed by the time we sat down because we were bypassed for this table which was clearly open in the main area.  3)  Our server showed the tasting menu to another table, but not us.  My parents actually went to Giada's a few months prior and told us they did the tasting menu.  What the heck. I'm not doing your job for you.  4) We ordered.  And here are the bland dishes.... A) charred octopus - tasteless.  the fennel added nothing, there was one kumquat slice on it, it was not seasoned, no citrus, just bland well cooked octopus.  B) orzo meatballs - it does not tell you what kind of meat is in it in the menu which would be helpful. The orzo is just mush in the meatball.  There is no texture and its just a basic meatball.  C) Bucatini - the calabrian chili pomodoro is not spicy. Calabrian chilis are supposed to be medium spicy at the least and it was a basic good red sauce with well cooked bucatini I could do at home. D) Tortellini- pea, pancetta - OK, nothing special. For some reason it was a really sour sauce and my tortellini were not fully cooked.  I did not taste the peas and the pancetta was burned so that made it taste weird too. The saltiness from the pancetta was well past in the cooking. When I told the waiter at the end when he asked me how dinner was that the tortellini were a bit raw he said it's al dente. OK I"M NOT STUPID. I know what al dente is. I've been watching Giada and other chefs for a long time.  But if I'm chewing alot to eat the food, which I told him, it's not al dente.   E) Giada cocktail - this is the reason why i gave it ONE STAR, because the drink was actually well made and tasty.  Kudos to bartender who was the only person doing good work.   Needless to saw we did not do dessert in this wretched place and got the hell out of here fast.  We did not take the usual pictures of our food that we do bc we were mad.   The server decided to ask us how the food was at the end otherwise we never saw him.  The water guy was excellent and kept us filled up.    What a waste. We were really disappointed. We are big Giada fans and watch all her shows and have seen all her cookbooks and have cooked alot of her recipes, but after this experience I'm just turned off and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  You can do better at Bobby's Mesa Grill across the street. I gave that 4 stars and would go there again.

68zaySRM3QQ2RBSDYgK8HQ.text: Wonderful experience! We are locals and so are used to having our pick of restaurants in Vegas. Whenever we have family in town we come to Giadas and we're never disappointed. From the amazing service (thank you Nancie) to the outstanding food, the experience is always 1st rate.  Highly recommend Giadas!!

BGNhxYZs65XphHqpvwvptQ.text: I wouldn't recommend it to anyone else me and my wife went there while waiting to be seated my wife ordered a glass of house wine almost fell over for like quarter of a glass it was $20 that's nuts good thing we had a Groupon for the the meal the main meal portion was like ordering an appetizer anywhere else $34 for little bowl of spaghetti the price of everything there for the amount you get was outrageous I won't recommend this restaurant to anyone

Lhv7uadaoTCqAOCXeap7FA.text: My husband and I enjoyed Giada's restaurant. We tried the lobster arancini--delicious! The Parmigianno was good, but very small portion.   Then my husband had the lamb which was good. My risotto with crab and scallops was divine, I just wish there was more. The banana gelato wasn't really gelato, but it was a very good ice cream. I loved the Chocolate Amaretti cake!   All in all, we would go back if we are in Vegas again, but I do recommend they reconsider portion sizes. Far too small for the prices we're shelling out, even for Vegas standards.

CyLEfC53OYGgjjMgvtekQQ.text: Loved the photo booth at the reception. We got a table with the best view of the Strip, The Eiffel Tower at the Paris Hotel, and the Bellagio fountain. The service was quick and waiter was very professional. Had the most delicious vegetable bolognese rigatoni. Was so good that you wouldn't know it didn't contain any meat! A must try if you fancy Italian food.

HAvOoyoKJfqLXEkPPVFogA.text: I had the pleasure of dining at Giada's on July 3rd at 5:00. We had a party of 8 with 4 children. The staff was very accommodating, friendly and prompt with their service. The atmosphere was beautiful and the food was delicious. One of my favorites in Las Vegas. I would highly recommend this restaurant. I try to dine here at least once when I vacation in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AzpL33IPOt6eVJbg5fDJqg.text: What a great evening- the food was amazing (we recommend the veal chop!) and Nancy was a fantastic server- great recommendations, attentive service and she appreciated our quirky sense of humor! As well the manager George made a visit to the table (with cookies... my goodness!)  The food, the ambiance, and the people all make this a great experience.

dkAExlCsKp6N41cmuuKkeA.text: Giada, When is the last time you ate here? My wife and I went here for her birthday.  We both had high expectations and left very disappointed. We got Caprese and sent it back.  The tomatoes were sliced almost transparent and were over ripe. The waiter tried to tell me it's because they are heirloom tomatoes. I told him we didn't like it. He took it back and never asked if we wanted it replaced. He just brought us another one that was no better. He then brought the Caponata. It tasted pre made and reheated. Not fresh. Our entree was rigatoni. It also was not fresh made. We both commented at the same time it tasted like out of a can or something.  If this restaurant was not on the strip it would never survive. There are many better Italian restraints in Vegas.  Locals beware. It's not worth it.  High priced and does not live up to the hype.  If you read other low reviews you will see the same comments. Maggiano's is right down the street. It's a chain but still better.

F-sUQm_6DJvwqxpQgKPCMQ.text: Giada's that pretty lady from the Food Network that's always cooking something while gracing us with that candid smile of hers and to be honest I probably have the biggest woman crush on her. Evarr.  FOOD: Came for breakfast had the American Breakfast that came with smashed lemon potatoes, two eggs (style of your choice, toast, and sausage meatballs or bacon). Let me just say this first, ALWAYS get the Orzo Sausage Meatballs as the side. SO GOOD. Delicious aromatic marinara sauce were drizzled atop these delicate balls of awesomeness, no joke was like ambrosia (especially after the disaster of all meatball situations at Andiamo the night prior). The smashed lemon potatoes were also amazing as well, gently cooked on a skillet these potatoes are then dressed with a beautifully made sauce consisting of lemon juice, thyme, and parsley topped with a light sprinkle of lemon zest. You can taste every bit of the ingredients used. The microgreen tomato salad was surprisingly delicious and refreshing, I was originally hesitant since I'm not a huge fan of sprouts.  SERVICE: On the higher end of the spectrum in terms of restaurant so general rule of thumb you would expect good service and the wait staff here proved that to be True. Very attentive and made sure every table got their order and that the food was the way we liked it.  ATMOSPHERE: The venue is gorgeous, everything here is so pretty and well thought out. An architectural and interior representation to Giada herself. Light colored wood with white painted walls, occasional splashes of gold. It was very inviting, the seats/booths were all super comfortable. The way the restaurant was built allows sunlight through so the entire place is awash in bright refreshing light. The entire place makes you feel good eating here.  SO. IN. LOVE. With this place........ :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Breakfast: Lemon Smashed Potatoes, Sunny Side Up Eggs, with Microgreen Salad, Sausage Meatballs, and Toast.

cb_MkCXCNapErPEy0HhR9Q.text: This was a bucket list restaurant for me. There were so many menu items we wanted to try but ultimately were quite pleased with our selections. The ravioli was the best I've ever had (and I just returned from Italy), and the brussels sprouts side dish was savory and delicious. The desserts were delectable. Even the bread presentation was creative. Our waitress, Nancie, was absolutely wonderful - attentive and helpful as we made our selections and throughout our dinner. It's well worth the splurge to dine here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts all around...we couldn&#39;t resist trying Giada&#39;s recipes. (We weren&#39;t disappointed.)
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Limoncello soufflé - incredible!

a-EU_KJR-TC2gq1GzFYvvA.text: Spaghetti - 5 stars Brussel Sprouts - 5 stars Tim and Christian the Waiters - 5 stars

hz5ldNDhiwnsJtvP4jlZng.text: After all the great reviews I heard about this place I was expecting excellence, however I was disappointed the food was just ok and the servers were a bit pushy to up sell.

Ww64Vc7W5_iJsMjavMJprQ.text: This place was fantastic! Great food, great service... everything is pricey in Vegas so yes be prepared to drop some cash but I thought it was worth the food and experience. We only had one dish that was good but not mind blowing... the rest was out of this world!

s-2tHPYJHMtfY1EFDwCFsQ.text: This place was phenomenal, from the service to the food, I would definitely recommend going here. This is a great place to go for a romantic dinner or to have a nicer dinner with friends. The salmon was cooked to perfection and the pasta my husband got was flav

UYAIWXoj_bKHqJlhQKhMqQ.text: The food was superb and the waiter was friendly and tentative, but the hostesses were unprofessional. We arrived around 5:30 even though we had reservations at 6 PM for dinner and decided to go sit in the bar. They informed us they would come get us when our table was ready. It was 6:15 and we were still waiting. We went and asked if the table was ready. They said "right away" but they still didn't come get us. It wasn't until we stood there and wouldn't move that we were seated.   The food is amazing, but I have had food just as good, but half the price. I feel like because Giada is a chef on the food network they feel they can overcharge for food and people will pay. The waiter was extremely attentive as were the rest of the general staff. We never had empty glasses of water and they would take our plates almost as we finished. The bartenders are friendly and work extremely hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh antipasti ingredients
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemoncello souffle
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salami antipasta dish small size

uHu3CsPLt16yV9Lxv7rnwA.text: WHY WE WENT HERE: - originally was going to Earl of Sandwich, but this was a pleasant last minute change, especially considering our group consisted of Food Network fans and at least some knowledge of Giada  THE LOOK (FROM THE OUTSIDE): - I like how there's both stairs and an escalator that leads up to the restaurant - when you reach the top of the stairs/escalator you see the front desk (which makes you feel like you're at the front desk/lobby of a spa to be perfectly honest) - the front desk workers are very warm and welcoming, and behind their desk is Giada merchandise behind a glass case - facing the front desk but to the left of it is a seating area - to the left of that seating area is a free photo booth you can take pictures in! - already you can tell that the decor is very warm and classy  THE LOOK (FROM THE INSIDE): - we were in awe of the how put-together this space is! - it's open, spacious, various types of seating that give you different settings while still being part of the space as a whole; tied-in well together - the bar is amazing! - her name is EVERYWHERE and on EVERYTHING - I don't blame her; if you work hard to have something, why not put your name on it?  THE MENU (LUNCH): - I like how it indicates which items are Giada Classics and which are Gluten Free - to be perfectly honest, the names of the menu items were SO Italian for us (not what we're used to and not bad because it's authentic considering Giada IS an Italian FROM Italy) that we had to Google the meaning of them - antipasti (vegetable, meat, cheese, salumi, pizza) - soup - salad - sandwiches - pasta - signature cocktails  WHAT WE ORDERED: - orzo meatballs - arugula with chicken milanese - sausage & eggplant lasagna - sweet pea tortellini - orecchiette al pomodoro  THE PORTION SIZES/TASTE: - majority of our group are former fraternity boys so when our food came out one of them said, "we're going to get burgers after this right?" - the portions are VERY small; enough (or barely enough, or not even close depending on your appetite) to feed one person; the salad was a lot bigger than the actual pasta dishes - the taste of EVERYTHING was AMAZING though  CUSTOMER SERVICE: - warm - welcoming - made you feel at home (at an expensive home straight out of a magazine or the newly renovated ones you see on HGTV) - very knowledgeable

tMJe0BqKiVJet2_T32yfNA.text: Simply amazing; service, food, beverages, ambiance, decor. Extremely possibly THE best espresso martini in the actual world (coming from a connoisseur here!) Have yet to visit for brunch but shall definitely be returning very soon. Thank you so much for the consistent hospitality every single time. Valentino is the man!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quite possibly THE best espresso martini ever in the world

0-wqZuLfHOHmiXdshWV3mA.text: When in Vegas go to Giadas & ask for Cliff! Great service & loved everything about the prix fixe. Definitely order the lemon ricotta cookies for dessert! They have great window seats where you can watch the Bellagio water show if you make reservations in advance.

E9uNl1xFbgYUeOUV19zTiA.text: Had a wonderful night here with friends!  Cliff was an amazing waiter, great service!

UNITG3RoirSRqp7ZaISyRw.text: My wife and I just had an amazing dinner at Giada's restaurant on the Las Vegas strip.  We ordered the tasting menu and it was unbelievable.  We had steak, lamb, shrimp all super delicious.  The best pard of our menu was the service.  Our waiter Cliff was super attentive and fun.  I want to keep this short so go to Giada's and see Cliff.  He will give you the best experience with eating great food.  I will definitely be back

0lJPWPw6NRrHAwyWrxoJrg.text: We have been 3 times now and I want to love this place. The first 2 times were terrific, but the last time was not so good....Im not sure why but the hostess never answers the phone. I must have called 20 times and I always ask for the hostess or manager and they send me to the reservations hotline......Giada get a phone that works in your restaurant. So the last time we were there for some reason they ran out of lobster rolls by 1pm.....Waiter said sorry but you can order something else. We are locals and love the food and the location. At the end of our meal the waiter also told us that they do not honor local discounts any more......Again I love this place but you really need to work on the little things like staff and stocking your food.....I guess these would be considered big things. Im sure I will give it a try again at some point.

98zsF-jj8TNiBC6ER3E8fA.text: The entire night, from start to finish, met and exceeded our expectations!  Our waiter was attentive, helpful, and had great suggestions. We elected not to do the Giada tasting menu for a couple of reasons. One, I had my eyes set on the veal chop. And two, I felt the selection would have taken the experience from a culinary sampling and turned it into a tourist experience. They included an autographed picture of Giada and some recipes.  And that option would be fine if I wasn't so interested in making my own selections.  We started with a bottle of champagne and a antipasti sampler platter and it was delicious. Bacon wrapped dates, cream stuffed peppers, crostini, and filet on toast with a pesto sauce. Wow. Our entrees were very large portions. I ordered the veal chop saltambucca Milanese style. I could rank that dish alone in my top five of all time. Splendid sauce and a perfect cook to a delicate piece of veal. Our dessert was some chocolate tower which I wish we had more of and a lemon hazelnut torte. Perfect way to end the night was with a drink recommended by the waiter. A spicy liquor with a double shot of cappuccino over ice. It was divine!

fiIE2149UQeVtPOF0l9gOg.text: Service was perfect. Restaurant is GORGEOUS. View is incredible. Food was absolutely awesome. Not much more I can say.

YA5xSwsu6BUzrb7kswpRGQ.text: Eh. Went in mid july for our 1 year wedding anniversary dinner. Tried to book reservations 2 weeks before we got to Vegas, but they were all booked. (this was before Giada was open for lunch). My hubby and I were waking past the Cromwell (please see separate review) and we wandered upstairs to get a look at Giada's. We were able to make a reservation a week in advance for dinner at 9:30pm on a Monday. Upon making the reservation, the hostess asks if we will be celebrating anything special. I tell her its our anniversary. (thinking maybe Giada will come say hi?!). They were very vocal in telling us about the dress code. However, as we arrived in our Sunday best. people strolled in wearing sneakers, shorts, and maxi dresses from the pool...The night of our reservation, we arrive a few minutes early. There is a free Photo Booth there that was a fun and free souvenir. The open concept kitchen as you walk into the dining room is gorgeous. Fresh antipasti station, Fresh pasta being handmade, bread being baked... The room itself is beautiful. Very white, very chi chi. Very Manhattan pretentious. When you are first seated, the waiter brings you a menu with "Giada's selections". This menu is several courses meant to work together that Giada arranged to compliment eachother. This was $120 pp. We weren't interested in eating all that. The waiter brought over an iPad to take drink and antipast orders. I didn't want to drink and the (3) choices of antipast did not impress me. I was praying the whole menu wasn't on an iPad because this layout was so annoying to use. Finally the waiter comes back with a real menu. I am a major foodie (please see ALL my reviews), and it took me forever to find something I was interested in eating. This rarely (if ever) happens to me. Giada raved and raved about having "gluten free food", so we expected to see GF pasta. NOPE. Her GF foods were meat and veggies, which by the grace of God, are GF already. That was a disappointment. Again, it  took forever to figure out what to order. GIada's Italian food is not your "traditional" Italian food. (ex spaghetti and meatballs, manicotti, braciole, red sauce, etc). For traditional, amazing,  Italian food, please see my review for Buddy V's. Her food is more Mediterranean Italian- lots of lemon, fennel- very different recipes and combinations of food. I felt lost and unfamiliar with the menu. We wound up ordering chicken marsala meatballs, shrimp scampi with marscapone cheese, and we each had a salad. The meatballs were excellent. Shrimp scampi was very different. Not at all garlicky, which is often synonymous with scampi. Salads were good. They bring out a big selection of bread to the table, with pesto dip and several other dips, and that was good. The only thing I entertained getting as an entree was the rack of lamb, but it was $45, and something I make at home. I wanted something different. For dessert they bring over an entire cart of desserts- from homemade gelato, to cookies, to pastries... we had cappuccinos and tiramasu. I had traditional Tiramasu and my husband had Peanut butter & Jelly tiramasu. Those were amazing. It was extra cool that GIada was there that night cooking, and coming out to tables in the dining room to talk with patrons. They seemed to send her out to select tables, aka high rollers, as she didn't go around the room to all. That wasn't cool. It was very cool to see her in person, as I am a big fan of her shows, but being the anniversary and all, she could have stopped by. I wonder why they even asked that...We felt it was a little too much for us. We are laid back people that enjoy casual places. Not enough offerings on the menu for our palette. We go to Vegas every year, and I don't think we would go back. For 2 people for 2 appertizers, 2 salads and 2 desserts with cappuccino, it was over $100. Portions are SMALL.

kMEpJyeGYvSZtVUml1cD5Q.text: I love Giada.  I love her cookbooks, tv shows and meeting her in person.  She a great person.  However, someone has to pay for the rent in that new and prominent Cromwell hotel.  I walked out after dinner feeling violated financially, in other words, ripped off.  $9 for a small bottle of sparking water.  Come on.  The food was good but the small portions and high prices makes me a one time customer.  The waiter was pushing the fixed price dinner at $120 per person.  (The whole table has to order it.)  When we didn't go for it, the service dropped off noticeably.  I got suckered in.

SElL-NU-KwmsFMFbqnxl7A.text: Unorganized, sloppy, and rude. The hostess couldn't find our reservations initially because they were spending more time chatting than listening to the party name and count, part of our party was joining us later and we'd asked to be seated anyway which they ignored entirely instead letting us sit in the bar with a waitress obviously hired more for looks than ability. Unable to get water, drinks, or appetizers from her she instead threw attitude when  we got them directly from the bar (who I'll admit every one of the counter staff were amazing). Finally being seated at the empty table I'd been staring at for nearly an hour, a quarter of the menu is unavailable not because they ran out but rather because they put the wrong menu in and the kitchen was unwilling to cook that menu. Being pushed heavily toward the rather unimpressive special we instead had appetizers, some salumi, and oysters, a few drinks and our dinner was instead a light snack. Next time save half the price and get twice the meal, go to Joe's.

mBHcteCKp4OYZshr6HM9zg.text: The decor is nice and when you walk into the restaurant it looks inviting. We started off with the bacon wrapped dates as our appetizer and it was delicious. We would order that again if we were to go back to Giada's. I had the lemon spaghetti with prawns and my husband had the lobster ravioli. Both were just okay. For the price we paid, we thought the dish would be more spectacular. The lemon spaghetti wasn't anything special and the portions were a little smaller side. The prawns were huge and I guess that's what we paid for. My husband said the ravioli was really buttery and all you can taste was that. The lobster meat lack the natural sweet seafood taste. Unfortunately the buttery after taste was too overpowering. Then we moved onto the dessert menu and nothing really stuck out. I can't remember what it was called but it was some sort of chocolate molten cake. It was a little spongey and dry. We also ordered a cappugiro and that was delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Overall, the ambience was nice our server was polite and friendly. However, the food was just nothing special. Our bill came out to be $160 and we walked away not completely satisfied.

cJ6krJovK4muiYVLgni2Kg.text: I rarely give a bad review, but due to the horrible food I am forced to dish this place. First off the service is great, but beyond that it was a dismal experience. The food lacks flavor, and tries to be original, but fails. We spent over $100 on appetizers alone. All of which were bland, simply, boring, and completely lackluster.  My husband spent $70 on a bone in steak that was over cooked and each bite took him five minutes to chew. I was going over the Heimlich maneuver in my head because I was convinced he was going to choke at every swallow.  After eating there I read the New York Times review, and it was totally right on. This place screamed Giada and every glance, but made her look like someone who is completely over her head when it comes to the restaurant industry. She needs to stick to what she knows and leave the business of serving food to the masses to the professionals. Clearly she isn't one.

VpufIcTcHZawPdHMlS7iTg.text: Let's make it simple. Great view. Great service. Very mediocre food. Incredibly mediocre. I'm a local, so I go the strip once in a while for an experience. This food was subpar to say the least, not nearly as good as Mastrionis or Duo Forni, restaurants in Summerlin where I live. If you're coming from out of town, there are a lot better places on the strip. Trust me. Try Lupo at Mandalay. You won't get the strip view, but the food will be worth it.

IFEfFLsBx2d7_97lZABB8g.text: Beautiful restaurant. Had high expectations especially because we are big fans. However we went for lunch, we were forgotten about most of the time even though we were there for a bday. Food was beautifully presented, sangrias were amazing. But the lunch menu was a little disappointing. Very very pricey for a sandwich. May give it one more shot for dinner next time but not for lunch.

LTKAtdRlF1TyBTBIBaZ0ew.text: Wow. Went with a group of 7 and our service was fantastic. Usually large groups have to wait for food but our server Nancy gave great recommendations on how much food to order and we had a steady stream of service. The breads were fantastic and the aranchini was amazing. The dolce cart was the best part. Small portions of so many amazing appetizers.

qA842yq5BELeI6gIkyr0Wg.text: so we came and we ate and we left feeling eh- nothing special. granted the food was prefer good, the bread basket delicious but the ambiance, the decor - screams giada. not kidding. everything bad giada written on it- from the dinner napkin, to the artwork, to the plates, to the damn bathroom paper towels!!!! good lord woman- we know which restaurant we're in!! don't need reminders that it's your restaurant, it's your food, and your recipes!! waiter identified the pesto sauce as "giada's summer basil pesto sauce". good god!!! waiter was pretentious. I guess he doesn't approve of women with tattoos.  too bad. will I go back? probably not. rather spend the $ at the slots

-R-Se06GyyoTegJiSNf0Dw.text: First of all, I don't watch the food network, so I had no idea who Giada is. There are so many great places to eat here in Vegas. When this opened, we thought we'd try it. My wife knew of her and she was supposed to be a great chef. We've been there almost a dozen times since it's opening. I've read some of the the other reviews, and I was so surprised. We go to Europe once a year. Spent the whole month of August bouncing around Italy and other places. Eating at Giada was like eating in Italy. It was that good! We see her there all the time. She's making sure everyone is having a great meal and a great overall experience. She's a cute tiny little thing. Came over to our table and sat down for a picture. Again, I didn't freak out as I didn't know who she was. But she was very sweet. We've had most of the menu. Small but filling portions. If you're used to big servings, this isn't the place. You order a few smaller tasters. Each of them are filling enough without gorging yourself.  That's how to get the most out of the experience. The wait staff is exceptionally attentive, and they always made us feel like Rock Stars. They take their time with you. Allowing you to enjoy each plate throughout your meal. Like they do in Italy. If you're rushed, this isn't the place for you and you'll miss out. The atmosphere, view, presentation, and the food itself, are so worth the price, that again, I'm surprised at some of the reviews. This place is our single favorite place to eat in Vegas and I've been here since 1994. We're going back again next week. Oh, no matter what you do, no matter how much you eat, save room for the lemon ricotta cookies for desert. For all I know, she puts crack in them! They are that good!

DT4szdvudRYTFxthiBFKbw.text: I had high hopes for Giada's first restaurant after watching her for years making mouth-watering food that made me want to jump into my TV. She has exceeded my expectations in every way. The staff is welcoming, the place is spacious yet warm, and the service is efficient yet  unpretentious. You can really see that she paid attention to every detail, down to the shapes of the bar ware. And the FOOD - OUTSTANDING! The four of us ordered one of their mixed mushroom pizzette, their medium assorted antipasto platter, the lobster arancini, and the braciole, and then we each ordered a different pasta. I had the vegetable Bolognese rigatoni, the others ordered the lobster ravioli, signature lemon spaghetti with shrimp and the scallop and asparagus risotto. Every dish was so delicious that we made a reservation for the next night before we even got through dinner. Which brings us to the dessert cart. And another OMG. The dessert portions are small, which allows you to sample several of them. We tried the white coffee gelato, the mascarpone cheesecake and the chocolate amaretti bars.  In fact, the portion sizes in general are reasonable rather than overkill, so you don't leave feeling overstuffed or like you wasted half of your meal by leaving it behind.  In summary, if you can get a reservation, run, do. Run, do not walk,  to Giada for one of the best meals you will ever eat.
