dNMRbgD8eXZ5dVAix7b3og.text: We had the most unpleasant experience here.  We were sat 15 minutes past our reservation time and were unable to get a window view as requested.  Not terribly disappointing since we were really there for the food, not the views.  I was looking forward to the grilled cheese and disappointed when they informed me they were out.  Long story short, our experience consisted of a lot of waiting...waiting for our table, waiting for our order to be taken, waiting for our drinks, and waiting for our food.  My husband was served his food at least 20 minutes before me.  He politely tried to wait for me as long as he could and ate slow, but his food ended up cold.  The food in general was okay and a little bland.  I would expect more considering the prices.  They were kind enough to discount my meal for the wait, but it will be long before we ever return. I hope I'm not discounting them on a bad day since I heard the table next to us call someone over for water and menus after they had been sitting at their table for 10 minutes without anyone going over.     Drinks were excellent and bar service was great while we waited for our table, which is why I gave it two stars instead of one.

X4L7fHGuicsN7QwDg1I8ww.text: Nice location. Way over priced for finger food. Go before it closes due to the extraordinary prices.  Quality of food was excellent. If not for her name and star status this place would go under.

lUca8gWuI3xI3MjRXkmzjQ.text: I am a HUGE Giada fan so I was so excited to share my first experience with my BFF for her birthday.  Could not say enough about this place... beautiful decor inside, excellent customer service and the food was fantastic!  We had such a great time, the desserts were AMAZING!!! Should def try this place out fan or not a fan..

q4F5GTDEr1F7cLBioSU-Bg.text: Over the Thanksgiving weekend, the mad Russian and I went to visit my sister in Las Vegas and had to try to the new restaurant in town. We had a little time to kill so we went down to the casino and won some money, so the night was starting in the right direction. We were seated promptly and had a choice table by the windows. Our waiter, Joseph came straight away and offered us a specialty cocktail menu from which we decided on 3 Blue Velvets. Beautiful to look at and somewhat sweet for my tastebuds but good none the less. The decor is very nice and the restaurant is not loud at all. The waitstaff was very attentive and had all the plates cleared and kept the water glasses full. We ordered a shrimp pizza, veal chop, bucatini and a side of mushrooms. All were presented beautifully and came out hot. I'd offer another half to one star, but after dessert and coffee, our bill came and we were charged for food we ordered and wanted but did not get to try since it hadnt been delivered.  Upon pointing out the mistake, our waiter corrected our bill very courteously and apologized for the oversight. Overall, we had a great meal and would come back on a future visit.

kCNb9tgQWYK4C-qCwVAF2Q.text: The view is nice, some of the food is outstanding and the service is a bit below standard for an upscale restaurant.   Cons:  We ordered drinks and a meat and cheese tray ($56.00).  It was a bit over priced but had a nice selection of cheeses and meats with some tasty sage honey and Dijon mustard.  We waiting to order our entrees a bit to try to enjoy our lunch but the waitress too a very long time to return after our meat and cheese try was done.   My husbands sandwich had a large piece of twine in it.  He was about half way done when he bit into it.  Our waitress never returned to our table to check on us, so everyone else finished before she returned to tell her about the twine.  They took the sandwich off...BUT if your total bill is over 250 for 4 people at lunch.... Maybe a dessert or something on the house as he didn't get to finish his meal.    Pro:  Most of the food was tasty.  Best entree was lemon pesto grilled cheese.  It had big bright flavors.  The zucchini scalapi is amazing!   It's long zucchini strings... So good!   So many amazing choices in Vegas so will not choose to return here anytime soon.

RFtwch3qcmnEBc27ULjjPA.text: Another wonderful dinner out ... Service was great and with the windows open it was like dining al fresco but inside ...  "A little bit of everything not a lot of anything "

GpBPzaZwjbQRmDfMTIC1bw.text: Service was extremely poor. We were seated late despite having a reservation. We waited over an hour for entrees. The wait in between appetizers and entrees was exceptionally long. Overpriced mediocre Italian food.  Giada you fail.

vygGyNTp9pwuv5yen3FIgQ.text: Overpriced and good was not great. Lacking in flavor and service. Bread plate was the best part.

Gja5ZWatcgYuebVG8G3zsQ.text: Space was nice, BUT:  1. We were seated 20 minutes after reservation time.  2. Waiter reprimanded his assistant, saying he embarrassed him where we could hear.   3. Waiter "pushed"food telling us things weren't very big portions.  4. Our water glasses weren't filled for most of the meal.  5. Side of asparagus didn't come out.  5b. When pointed out, asparagus came right out and was lukewarm. Likely sitting out the whole time.  6. An extra drink was on our bill.   7. Waiter kept constantly apologizing, very awkward.   Food was mediocre at best and definitely not worth the horrible service. Will not return or spend my money on Giada products. I'd choose Walgreen's pre made sushi first.

vNSpY71xtKBW3PCsgBdsBg.text: We went here with another couple who own several Italian restaurants in another city to sample the food and, in their case, to pick up some ideas. However, we all had a poor experience beginning with our pushy waiter who seemed focused on turning over the table as soon as possible. The menu was surprisingly limited and pricey. One of the entrees that was ordered was the veal chop saltimbocca. We've all had many saltimbocca style dishes and this was clearly not saltimbocca style. It looked and tasted like a breaded pork chop with lots of fat hidden in the breading and without the sauce that typically comes with a saltimbocca dish. A side dish of polenta was ordered as well which was not the solid form of polenta that we were used to but, instead, resembled a dish of grits. With the exception of the brussel sprouts, the other items were just as disappointing. Another item of note is that, although their wine list is extensive, the prices were three to four times market prices as opposed the two times market price that we typically encounter.   We went to another Las Vegas Italian restaurant, Canaletto, the following day and had a great experience which helped erase the memories here.

v7PQZuy1nBw2UCceqHp-aA.text: Giada is an experience! The view, the table, the overall attention to detail is immaculate. Then there is the food. It is pricey, get over it. But it is delicious and fresh. The tomahawk pork was amazing and HUGE! I am gluten free and there are clear and wonderful options. I wish there was more than one option for dessert but luckily I was full anyway.

8DV4mMCdCkkBV2u8fLSLCg.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants on the Las Vegas strip. From the moment you walk in and greeted by the host staff to the walk to the table, I always feel like this place has it all. Never had a bad moment coming here and today is the same. My favorite dishes are the pastas, but the whole chicken is great too.

BSzjP5WYMcaFsoVL4vHBSg.text: Lindsay!!!!!! What can I say!? As a server myself ...you made my entire night! All I wanted was amazing food and excellent service and you ma'am provided that for us last night! I told you, make our experience for us! You did that plus more.  You chose every course for us! Meat and cheese platter, pasta and shrimp, tomahawk, Brussel sprouts  (no dessert because we didn't have room). Lindsay all I can say to you, one server to another is you are one amazing server! You took what I asked of you and you gave us such an amazing experience. Not only was the food AMAZING but your personality was so on point! You treated us like a guest in your home and really that's what we are about! I felt comfortable and appreciated. I felt like you wanted me to have a good time! Management....Lindsay needs to get a pat on the back! She is the epitamay of great service! She is the reason I will always come back everytime I'm in Vegas (btw I live in Los Angeles so I'm not far). Lindsay as I told you, please come visit me at my restaurant when you are in LA. To the chef.....excellent dishes! Food runner was informative too....he explained every dish with confidence and class! George is the manager I just spoke with as I praised Lindsay and he also had such a great personality via phone. He genuinely cared about my comments I had about Lindsay and my experience at his restaurant.  Thank you FOH and BOH for everything! Lindsay girl! You are the real MVP though!!!

8VJv5ane7qzDDt7fl7Q34w.text: Went for an early lunch today. Lasagna $24: came with a petite side of arugula salad. Lasagna flavor was ok and a bit on the salty side. The pasta had a non existent texture. It was soft and mushy. Tasted like cafeteria food.  Orzo meatball $14: flavor was so so but the texture of the meatball was like blended tofu. It was soft and mushy and the meatball didn't retain its shape after scooping it up into my plate. It just fell apart. It's hard to tell from the photo but the meatballs are bite sized (tapas portions). Each one was like a small cherry tomato. Tricolor salad $16:  over dressed. The veggies were soggie.  Extremely salty.  I couldn't make out the veggies because it has so much salad dressing.  Free pizza bread: fantastic! Crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  The pesto olive oil was delicious. Service: slow. We sat down and waiting 15 minutes before getting water or a menu.  It was 10:45am and there were 5 other tables. Our waitress said she was in the back and didn't know we were seated there.  My friend and I were highly disappointed in our meal.  The food didn't taste good. Everything had the same texture (soft and mushy), small portions for the price you pay, leans towards the salty side, and one dimensional.  I would not recommend this place.  Sorry :(

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orzo meatball. Avoid this dish. Super mushy texture that falls apart right after you scoop it up.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $24 for a small portion of lasagna.  It didn&#39;t taste good.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy and salty.

b-W_XndxETgCa8e3ikGEyw.text: Joseph was great! A wonderful experience. The tasting menu is the way to go. And you get three choices from the dessert cart. Don't go to a show until you go here.

va_ABVnqx6FGQFgrJ-8YiQ.text: This my first time ever writing a review. We ate dinner here may 10th we had read some reviews after we made reservations we almost cancelled them but my hubby is a big fan so we said let's give it a try..... Sorry to say but so disappointing it took about an hour for the food to come we ordered the spaghetti with shrimp the short ribs and asparagus .. The shrimp was over cooked  the noodles were dry no sauce what so ever the asparagus was under cooked the short ribs was just ok..... I should have complained because it was not busy at all. I'm a Diamond member so I was using my $100 voucher thank goodness I only put out $40 of our own money . We had to flag down another waitress just to get our bill!!  They will b lucky if I give them 1 1/2 stars!!!!!!!!believe the reviews when u read them

eNRlS_3qFPDlfahrKKjHuw.text: We had a company party last night for 30 people or so in a private room in Giadas restaurant in the Cromwell in Las Vegas. The food was excellent from the bacon wrapped dates, oysters, crab, cheese, honey apoetizers, to pasta bolonese, to lamb chops, steak, salmon, and the wonderful desserts. Everything was delicious. And our waiter, Valentino, was excellent, very helpful, friendly, wonderful service.

o26QoQ-rGI2Oi-ej-9OoDg.text: If you're willing to pay, this is the place to eat!  Came here to celebrate two birthdays and we made reservations months in advance.  Coming up the escalator into the restaurant and you already knew it was going to be an upscale restaurant. Since we made reservations, we had no wait. But, there's a photo booth on the left side of the entrance that's free that you can take advantage of if there's a long wait!  We walked in and we were seated right away. The waiter and waitresses were really nice and the manager of the restaurant even came to say hello and check up on our party of 8.   The ambiance of the place was lounge like with romantic lighting. When you walk into the restaurant, you can see some of the cooking. Even the bathrooms were nice as the napkins to wipe your hands had the G logo on them. Oh, Giada.  I got the Spaghetti with the shrimp, lemon & basil for $34. Never have I ever expected to pay so much for spaghetti. When I first got the entree I thought it was sooo small. But it was actually veryyy filling! It came with three shrimps and they were HUGE, fresh and delicious.   All in all, great food and a classy experience. Definitely on the pricey side but if you're really to drop $50+ per person (just for an entree), this is a place to wine and dine in Vegas.

1Phag9zBifYA8V9-nS6MjQ.text: Had a wonderful meal! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was outstanding! The decor is beautiful! And our waitress Nancy was the best!

E-z17mALkRxH2nhbqC0CFA.text: I can't say enough about my experience. First of all Rebecca our server was out of this world, her suggestions were on point and she was just amazing request her if you can. The food was excellent. Everything was top notch. Try the pastry basket and the strawberry waffle. The mimosa's were by far the best I've ever had. Have brunch here you will not be disappointed!

T6ID-6SRN9bpF5RNZmzNKg.text: I've been watching Giada for years and I've always though she was great. My husband and I came to Vegas for our 4 year anniversary, to relax at the pool and eat at some AMAZING restaurants. Unfortunately Giada's was NOT amazing!!! We felt like we were not treated with the great customer service that I would expect. Our server was very inattentive, he missed an opportunity with us, we were planing on spending a lot on our meal and ended up only ordering 1 glass of wine and mediocre meals, then closing out our bill, with out dessert or more drinks simply because we desperately wanted out of the restaurant. My kale salad was drenched in a heavy cream dressing, So much so that you could not taste and other elements of the salad (I complained and they did kindly take it off our bill). I ordered the lemon spaghetti, and it was just ok, for 35 dollars I would have expected more.   Seems like they are just looking to make money here, and do not truly care about your experience. With so many options in Las Vegas for fine dining I would skip this one. My favorite local Italian restaurant in Denver far exceeds what I experienced here at Giada's...... What a disappointment.

qvsUG8zSti0bZ_uVBGcztQ.text: The look and feel of Giada is on point. Our service was excellent. The food was just average. I've had worse and I've had better. For the price I paid, I expected better. I did really like the lemon cookies we had for dessert. In the future if come back to hang at the bar.

sFY4eBLfMetiShHFF2PhCA.text: I really wanted to like this restaurant.  Smells great when you walk in the door and nice ambiance.  I came in for breakfast and had the frittata with prosciutto.  It was way overcooked and rubbery.  No sides came with it and at $23, not a good value.

Daz0I-V0bstvSSrbNCfRMw.text: If I could rate Giada's higher I would!   She and her team have created an elegant yet very approachable restaurant that I hope is around a long, long time. We got in for my birthday dinner (thanks Doug) and could not have been happier with the service, food, decor, and view.  From the bread plate with its fresh made rosemary muffin, to the scallop and crab risotto, to the mind-blowing lemon smashed potatoes, to the filet Mignon, there was not a  wrong note the whole evening. Which itself is amazing for new restaurant.  We ordered the much-applauded bacon wrapped dates, but the merguez sausage was really spicy that night. Our server took it ff our bill and was happy to bring anything else instead.  Our table was in the center window and had a perfect view of the Bellagio fountains.   The restaurant itself is so beautifully decorated and tasteful you wont want to rush your time here at all -- and they don't mind at all!

c1n2rQIT3UCsS1572vhucw.text: Had lunch this afternoon at Giada's new restaurant.  I did enjoy the Gnocchi al Pomodoro, but a very small portion. My daughter had the Sweet Ricotta pink peppercorn, arugula, apple balsamic pizza. It came with enough arugula to feed a herd of rabbits. We had to remove to see the pizza. There was much sweetness to the pizza, and we thought it might be good for a shared appetizer but not a main cold dish.  My wife enjoyed the Muffuletta with the fried string zucchini. A bit bready but tasty.  The Super Tuscan at $17 per glass was very good. Probably not worth $17.  I would not return for lunch but I would try the dinner menu.  The music in the restaurant was loud and 2010. Very strange.  F

Av2wrkg4FMcIuEosiqnr0A.text: The restaurant color scheme of white and brown contributes to a bright and airy space with a comfortable feeling. Wall decorations include many Giada family photos, posters from her grandfather's movie career as well as Giada retail items which were in abundance. The hostess stand was staffed by several people waiting to escort you to your table. Upon entering the restaurant dining room the hostess offers a tour of the open kitchen and describing the items on display starting with the antipasti table. We received a nicely located corner table for four people next to the windows. The restaurant uses iPads as well as printed menus. I did have difficulty navigating the wine list on the iPad because it froze up. I was brought a second unit which encountered the same problem. Our server stated they were having problems with the wireless service. Thank goodness for low tech paper menus.  The dinner menu is wide and varied with many appetizers, pastas, seafood and meat dishes. The wine by the glass selection not extensive but did have some moderately price choices. Our server Turley was friendly and helpful. The following was ordered for our party of four. Appetizers: Orzo Meatballs were 5 to an order and tender with a tasty Pomodoro sauce. Clams Casino topped with prosciutto, a new twist on an old school item. A large bowl of about 25 small clams were juicy and more than enough for four people.  Entrees: Branzino - 3 crispy skin filets served with arugula and tangerine vinaigrette were tender and juicy Veal Chop Saltimbocca Milanese style - A very large portion which was very tasty Rack of Lamb - 4 chops cooked perfectly as ordered medium rare 7 oz Filet of Beef - comes with polenta but potatoes were requested as a substitute. The potatoes were tender balls dusted with cheese. The filet was ordered well done but several pieces were a little pink. Overall a nice piece of meat.    Desserts: The dessert cart has a variety of treats that were beautifully displayed and explained to us. Our choices were: Chocolate Sorbet Coffee Gelato Tiramisu  Our server offered complementary dessert to compensate for the steak. Although that was not expected or necessary it demonstrated the staff's willingness to satisfy the customer.

O6n2S5nGp4ooKZfzlySvuQ.text: Her signature is even on the hand towels in the men's room. What a waste, I would rather her put her money in a more reasonable price and larger portion. I would say that the food was adequate - but for the overpriced food and very, very small portions, One would expect excellent food. This was not the case and I will not come back. My wife had soup and I was shocked by the small amount of liquid in the dish. My Caesar salad was nothing special. The rigatoni is dance and the pasta was overcooked. I was very disappointed.

kAcnq6L-tCjuhlj-q5lTsg.text: After eating at Giada last night, I'm Team Nicole Kidman. The space itself it beautiful with a lovely view of the strip. However, the food and service were underwhelming, to say the least.  It took forever to get noticed, given menus, and get our drinks. The cheese plate appetizers we ordered were good (although they were out of burrata and they substituted it without asking). The entrees were disappointing. A relatively small portion of bland risotto for $34? No thanks. The polenta was even blander, which is a feat. The lobster tail was slightly over cooked. For the cost, Giada is definitely not worth it. I won't return.

wyZ1sEzpkdTM3U05bCb3dQ.text: We went for a lunch.  We started at the bar. Our bartender was great.  His recommendations were very helpful, and the service was very responsive.  We then moved to the dining room, our waiter, Chris, was great. He knew the different dishes very well.  He also made valuable recommendations for us.  Portions were satisfying for a lunch.  The zepooles were great to finish up with.  We even got a glimpse of Giada while we were there.  Don't expect to see her, but it was a great experience all around.

VnjMKsSL1qatuQvgPGGGhQ.text: Amazing experience. The seafood risotto was recommended by the bartender and did not disappoint. The bread plate that comes with the meal is probably the best I've ever had at any restaurant. Dessert was my least favorite. Nothing on the menu really stood out.

nWQnflYnLfOmroFQY13x2A.text: I waited 2 months and finally my night to try Giada came! The restaurant is beautiful and decorated very classy!  Pros The orzo meatballs Complimentary bread Seafood Risotto  Service  Cons Sangria (tasted like cherry soda) Chocolate cake dessert (not worth it)  It was $260 for 2 of us having dinner and we left stuffed!

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful place

JwAwTBzLMOH2XFsIGClEPQ.text: Maybe this place gets awards for Brunch and Power Lunch but it deserves no awards for dinner.  BOTTOM LINE: For the price, there are much better meals to be had in Vegas. Go find them instead of having dinner here.  The food itself is good, I'd give it four stars.  The wines are typical of Vegas, jacked up five times what you'd pay for them at the winery.  The service overall here is a below average for a restaurant with those prices. The staff is trying but they need far more polish if they're going to be serving $55+ entrees.  The management at this restaurant is non-existent and that's the real problem.  I've eaten at thousands of restaurants all over the world and I don't say this lightly...whomever is the manager for the dinner shift on weeknights at Giada should be fired.  We had a party of 7 with an 8:30pm reservation on a Wednesday night in February. That shouldn't be hard to service, right? WRONG.  We arrived at the hostess station exactly on time. The hostess told us our table "wasn't quite ready" and we could go to the bar and they'd come to get us when it was ready.  After sitting in the bar area for fifteen minutes, no one even asked us if we wanted a drink. Normally at restaurants I go to, if you're sitting at the bar this long past the time of your reservation, the manager will come over, apologize profusely and comp your drinks: Not at Giada. At Giada they simply ignore you.  Finally after fifteen minutes of no one saying a word to us, one of the women in our party flags down a cocktail waitress and we order drinks. A hostess then comes by to tell us yet again that our table "isn't quite ready".  Another fifteen minutes go by and we get our drinks finally. It's now THIRTY minutes past our reservation time and we're still NOT seated. No apologies from anyone, nothing. Instead a hostess comes by a third time to tell us our table is "almost ready".  FORTY THREE MINUTES after our reservation time, a hostess comes to tell us our table is ready. During this forty three minutes we were not visited at all by anyone in charge of the restaurant. No maitre d' or manager of this restaurant has stopped by to apologize for such a RIDICULOUS wait or possibly comp the drink we had while waiting!!! Nothing! No one! Who runs that restaurant? Giada herself should be ashamed to put her name on a restaurant with such atrocious service! We pay our bar bill, which for some reason can't be transferred to our table, and finally go to be seated.  As we sit down, one of the women in our party slips on the slippery wood floor and her white wine flies in the air, spilling all over her dress. Only one waiter comes to her aid. Two other restaurant patrons help her more than the staff did.  As we're finally seated, another woman in our party tells the waiter about our 45 minute wait past our reservation. He had no idea we'd been waiting that long. He said he was sorry but he didn't get the manager to come over either. I've never in my life had to wait 45 minutes past my reservation to get seated. And I've never been ignored by restaurant management before. If I were Giada, I'd be furious at that manager and demand   The waiter gave us some sort of elderberry concoction by way of apology for our wait, but the complete unprofessionalism of the place just threw the whole meal off for all of us.  Unless they get real professional management for this restaurant, avoid it.

pfec9nmcGNFXssHgbhDayw.text: The BEST dining experience, ever. I'm a huge fan of Giada and was giddy with excitement to eat here. Everything was perfect, the food, the service, the view of the Bellagio fountains.   From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm welcomes from everyone we encountered. We were visited by management twice throughout our dinner to see how we were doing. Our waiter, Greg, gave us great recommendations and even steered us away from a few menu items. The sommelier visited our table to assist with the wine selection.   Started with medium-sized Giada favorites antipasti - bacon wrapped dates, stuffed baby bells, veal crostini, pea pesto crostini, and caponata. Even the bread basket was delicious! Main course was the bucatini and the 28 oz bone in Tuscan ribeye. Served with a side of crispy polenta and sweet corn with spicy sausage. For dessert we had the trio of tiramisu. Everything was delicious!  We ordered a lot of food for two people but wanted to try a bit of as much as we could. It was an amazing experience and we will definitely be dining there again next time we're in Vegas. Ask for a seat by the window to take in the views throughout your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the window terrace
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan ribeye, crispy polenta, sweet corn.

ISv2oDUMZyGNzppIsjUZxg.text: We enjoyed the tasting menu last night. It was plentiful and delicious. We had a wonderful server name Nancy, she was very attentive and knowledgeable.  Save room for dessert!

Q-mE1m-yXJmROV1j01IQpw.text: Very good dinner really enjoyed the decor and view.  Split the Mortadella and Caponate for appetizer.  Mortadella was fine but not my thing, but Caponate was terrific - almost could be served as a bruschetta.  The arugula salad vinaigrette was very tasty - hint of lemon was excellent.  Enjoyed the Giada spaghetti w two large prawns and lemon pasta. Definitely would recommend and return!

vnV9LxJKW69-IoM9ktR7lA.text: Local first-timers who really enjoyed dinner at Giada.  We had reservations with friends from out-of-town and were seated upon arrival.  The atmosphere was bright and airy, the service was professional and world-class, and the food was fresh and delicious!  Our wait staff was terrific and Nancie was outstanding - helpful and attentive!  We enjoyed her recommendations, especially Giada's personalized Gelati selections!  Met Manager, Kristal, who, like the rest of the staff, was interested in providing an outstanding dining experience.  We will be back and look forward to checking out the new location when it opens.

7xZ3vovwpnl3VeTaQ3mLeA.text: I had 2 glasses of cheaper wines, 2 appetizers and 2 main courses and with tips I paid almost $200 and the part that's said is that I went home hungry. If I spend $200 I at least want to feel that I ate something but their short rib pasta was ridiculous... 8 pieces of tiny pastas filled with short ribs as a MAIN course. Went home and had to eat not to stay hungry... not recommended. This was my 4th time there btw, but I will not going back ever again....

Qr0IHfEi0linHqR5DxIUBA.text: One word: Underwhelming. Save your money and find the many restaurants in Vegas that offers a real experience.

vQHcQvbkvJqAnhAfubkyIw.text: Bad service, prawns undercooked, made reservations two months in advance and had to wait 45 minutes extra and we were early and there were tables available .  I went here because I love Giada!! I cannot express my disappointment and the lack of care by her staff... will not be returning .

cU9eQJpsquFwwYaEajY38A.text: This place will rob you with your eyes wide open. I had a good day at The Cromwell back in Mid February. My friend and I were hungry so we tried  Giada.  It as packed on a Thursday night, so we thought, ok it must be good. I'm a bigger guy that the average male. I like to eat if you get my drift.  I ordered the Lasagna thinking it would look like most American servings if Lasagna a square piece with layers of noodles and meat sauce. This  server brought me something the size of a silver dollar. Hell I thought it was an appetizer or something. I asked what that was, he said it's the Lasagna you ordered. I started laughing thinking he was just messing with us.... he wasn't. I ate it in about 3 bites.   The worst value in the damn city for the food they give you. They should be ashamed of themselves for that, but, it Vegas baby. If you don't have any money stay your ass at home. Giada won't have to worry about getting anymore of my money again.

J3gaBIrKcR2R_Lsv4AXC9Q.text: The food at this celebrity establishment exceeded our expectations.  We were there for lunch and had a party of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids.  We were pleasantly surprised that there was a kids' menu even though our kids were more adventurous and shared with the adults.  We had the carbonara flatbread, which had a perfectly cooked sunny side egg on top. We also shared the sausage and eggplant lasagna, which was well seasoned but the portion may have been a tad small for the price. It did come with an arugula salad in the side, though. We also had a salumi flatbread -- dried salami that resembled pepperoni -- and the orzo meatballs.  We also started with a gooey chocolate croissant monkey bread, the size of a muffin.    The service was really good, once the server came to our table.  They did a great job refilling out complimentary coffee and our waters.  We asked about the famous bread basket but learned it was only available at dinner.  We were offered Parmesan cracker bread on the house, and it was divine.   We had a reservation to request a table with a view, which I recommend highly.  We also enjoyed the fun photo booth in the way out.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our table.  Fantastic!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The delicious carbonara flatbread

8LN9X5WrnD-Tkc8_tSVVYg.text: Overall, it was a mediocre experience. It was my friends bachelorette party and she wanted to eat at this restaurant. The service was slow from taking drink orders to even getting menus. However, we were a party of 10 so maybe the waiter was short handed. I had ordered side dishes since I could not make up my mind. The caprese was delicious and the chicken Marcela Meatballs. However, the potatoes were a bit dry. The Giada cocktail was cute for drinks but a little bit too much of citrus for my enjoyment. However, the decor of the restaurant was beautiful and it was pleasant for a girls night. I thought the picture they take upon entering was clever and very cute! A nice touch for our ladies night.

zR5VvoMI4EIlNj6ZflvXvA.text: Nancy was amazing!! I brought my friend to Vegas for the first time, and he loved it! I was kind of upset that they quit making the ice cubes with the G in it, because I was literally talking about it all day. Other than that it was wonderful! Please bring back the ice cube :)

5yGjuBhKCaKhciSB2MKleg.text: First time there and we love it!  From the service to the food!  It was a great experience even we have 4 kids. The souffle was to die for!  Everything was so delicious & we were all stuffed!  Yes it's kind of pricey cuz it's on the stripe!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop, not too bad!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla lemon soufflé to die for!!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian mix platter appetizer! So good

JkNesV3tsz9sECCsAVYaZQ.text: Took out the most important ladies in my life on Mother's Day and was finally able to taste Giada's.  Been a fan of hers for quite some time, not to mention my mom loves her, so we had to check this place out. Kinda felt like the other reviews are spot on; pricey and a little underwhelming.  The place itself is beautiful, wonderful location on the 2nd floor of the Cromwell with really nice views of the strip, especially when the sun is going down.  Bread was solid w/different varieties and was great to dip with our entrees. As apps we tried the calamari and dates which were ok, but what stood out was the chicken marsala meatballs.. Super tender, in a broth that would of been good by itself. Dipping the bread in that broth was excellent, everyone loved it.  Entree's were solid, recommend getting the cacio e pepe as it's cooked in a cheese wheel that they bring out and you can eat parts of the cheese wheel too, enough for 2-4 ppl imo depending on how much you wanna carb it up. Really enjoyed how the pasta wasn't over cooked and it was nice and thick.  Also had the fried chicken that was really good as well, tasted Nashville style which I like (crispy and hot!) Overall it was just ok, ambience and layout of the restaurant is very nice, just don't think the price and quality is worth it to come here frequently, but will try it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s the details the count.
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aqPZ0WDejwo_2tPIGC1eXg.text: I'll admit that I had really low expectations going into Giada based on reviews I read ahead of time. My husband and I were both pleasantly surprised by our Christmas morning brunch. I have only good things to say about my experience.  We made reservations a couple of days ahead of time and had our pick of times. I chose noon because I prefer to enjoy my holiday feast early in the day. We were warmly greeted by the hostess and taken to our table. We were seated next to the window which was nice for people watching.  Since it was Christmas we were offered the regular brunch menu as well as the Christmas prix fixe menu. We opted for the Christmas menu since it offered a variety of dishes from the menu.   I started with a drink called the Dolce Vita which was really delicious. It was nice that there were some interesting drinks on the menu that were alcohol free. Next up we were brought an assortment of pastries and antipasto. The pastries were out of this world. My favorite was the Nutella pastry because it was so buttery and flaky. The texture and taste were delicious. The antipasto included bacon wrapped dates, polenta, and goat cheese stuffed peppers. I don't usually like bacon wrapped dates, but these were amazing. The polenta was also very tasty.   My main entree was the Sausage and Eggplant Lasagna. This was served with a small arugula salad. The lasagna was truly delicious. The arugula salad had a nice dressing that was well seasoned. My husband had the Italian Chicken & Waffles. If possible, this dish was even better than mine. The chicken had the most amazing seasoning and crispy crust with tender chicken inside. The savory style waffles were good too.   The end to the meal came in the form of a lemon souffle for me and ricotta ice cream sandwiches for my husband. My yummy souffle was served with a delicious gelato. My husband absolutely loved the ricotta cookie ice cream sandwiches. I tried a bite and agreed that they were amazing. The cookies had a great texture and taste with delicious raspberry gelato in between.  Our waiter was great and very professional. He was great at making sure we had full water glasses and that we had everything we needed during our meal. The staff also took great care to be sure we were finished with dishes before clearing anything from the table. All of our courses were perfectly timed.   Don't miss the photo booth behind the black curtain next to the hostess stand before you leave! What a great idea and a nice memento of a nice meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Soufflé
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon Ricotta Sandwiches
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage &amp; Eggplant Lasagna

FWUsodeRk9-1eqHuqzKKfw.text: Giada's is always consistent... great food, Wonderful service.. and always request Fred as your server. Always. I know the other servers are great too.. but we always request Fred. Even after a year's absence, he remembers us. The charred octopus has a new twist and just as good as before. We've had a great deal of the items already... the salmon is wonderful, the lamb chops are a must. The pasta with prawns & lemon, have it at least once. Make Giada's your splurge meal... and to really splurge, do The Tour menu .... can't say enough about it.

WVNvAe2QbJuGVH9orWcgWA.text: Try to get a table by the windows! Best dining seats on The Strip. Had a couple appetizers, salads and the meatballs were great. Ambiance and service was superb. Would definitely go back.

LG56XYpJfDKd31H2FKeqQg.text: The service was amazing. Rachel S was super attentive and made some great recommendations. Brunch was amazing! The nutella pancakes were to die for. Make sure you do the unlimited mimosas too.

AGtWs3gW95jV7KhDZGokzQ.text: We love it here.   Everything was absolutely wonderful.  The views of The Strip are spectacular especially while eating this gorgeous meal.  We enjoyed the Friday Brunch Tasting and highly recommend coming here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nR2sh5pRst6ooLX4tCXIeA.text: The decor and service kind of outshined the food at Giada's. I love a beautifully decorated dining room and applaud outstanding service. Giada's nailed them both! The food was good, but something inside me wanted a little more. Not in portion size, but in flavor. As a Food Network junkie who has dined at Bobby Flay's, Emeril's, Paula Deen's, and Guy Fieri's restaurants, Miss Giada needs to kick it up a notch and she'll be golden!  Here's what me and my fam bam ordered during brunch:  Pastry Assortment   A+  Salmon Cake Benedict   B Strawberry Polenta Waffle   A- Sardinian Gnocchi al Pomodoro   C+ Chicken Meatballs A++  On the way out, there's a cool photo booth - and it's free. Another nice touch by Giada and a smart marketing tool to capture emails of her patrons.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Polenta Waffle
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Meatballs
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sardinian Gnocchi al Pomodoro

wApBb-g9YD1epk_w8xlqDQ.text: We made reservations for four through Open Table, arrived and were seated promptly by the window, overlooking the Bellagio fountains, just as we had requested. Perfect.   Our waiter Rocco was great but may have had one table too many for this price point. He was very knowledgeable and detail oriented. A great waiter.  We had the artichoke appetizer and the bacon wrapped dates. The dates were amazing the artichoke was ok. I'll try the meatballs next time.   Main entrees were Halibut, Spaghetti, Pork Chop and lobster ravioli.  I had the pork chop and it was great. A high quality cut, grilled to perfection, but the peach glaze was heavenly!  We ordered one side, a lemon potato dish. Man o man!  That was amazing!  For desert we had coffee which was actually Americanos. A bit more bitter than a typical Americano. The souffle was spectacular if you are into souffles. It was so light it was nearly a meringue.   My two very minor negative thoughts are:  The silverware used for the appetizer course was annoyingly unbalanced and hard to use. I found myself more focused on trying not to drop my silverware than being able to enjoy the appetizers.  My waiter would have been so much more attentive had he had one less table.   Obviously, four star means these are minor. We had a great time and a great meal!

MO9wgvpj7sXs29HnyPzrqA.text: This is my new go to Italian in LV, had a great Birthday dinner with my wife, great view of the strip while drinking wine, eating, & enjoying each other. Now the food, meat & cheese platter would have been enough didn't leave one thing, then we had main course tasted better than it looks.

iFRmwmHphJwa_Qlz2Tr-Bg.text: Great Italian place- we came here for an early pre-show dinner across from Caesar's.  we really enjoyed all our dishes.  Their complimentary focaccia bread is SO good- has to ask for another! We really enjoyed the lobster ravioli.  Our dinner was complete with one of the best desserts I've had- a hazelnut crunch cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hazelnut crunch cake
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli and kale salad with chicken

jEKWKAi-IeSk8IZYL9t58Q.text: Treat yourself to the sampler and enjoy. The food was amazing and very filling. The restaurant is very warm and welcoming. Our waiter (Jesse B) was very attentive and provided superior service. Bring your appetite!

lu-qi95VNWeRb4SjPMZkLA.text: I went to Las Vegas with my 3 girlfriends and decided to try Giadas despite mixed reviews. We had an awesome dinner with a great waiter and unbelievable food. We had the tomato arancini, chicken marsala meatballs, lemon cream spaghetti with giant shrimp and 2 other things I can't remember. All were exceptional!!! The bread basket before dinner with 5 accompaniments was delicious also. Can't say enough and will be back. And btw it is a beautifully decorated space.

PBl4jdPyZ1Mr_Kp1t6zghw.text: Classy and elegant! Giada has everything in this place so prim and proper down to the little details of the placemats and napkins! Impressed how spacious the place is. Server were very courteous and doesnt make you feel stupid when you ask something at the menu.

8zd9LZvXXzYFKXX3brDEJw.text: Stopped in for lunch.   Excellent giada burger.  Great staff, inviting, fun.  Make a point to go

yPMFodMEC2Ek6T45pgYCsQ.text: Service is great--attentive and smoothe. We checked in on yelp and got a "splash of Prosecco"!  Had the veal chop which was a big piece of meat that was breaded and pan fried to perfection. Side of Brussels sprouts was tasty. I had the seafood risotto which had 2 fresh, nicely cooked scallops on top. I don't like scallops but it was fine. Would come back to try other items esp the signature items

Cl9mQqGtX_cTwZXdzfbx_Q.text: Such a fun spot for girls night or date night! I am absolutely OBSESSED with the lemon spaghetti with shrimp. I just wish the portion size was double! I've literally come back here on 3 occasions when I'm in Vegas just to eat this dish. Have also tried the arancini and lobster ravioli which were also fantastic! Make sure to stop by the photo booth by the checkin table to snap some pics!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most delicious Lemon Spaghetti with Shrimp - wish there was more of it! Yummmm

KAEHl4YwF89S2A4aFoj5gg.text: One of the restaurants that I have been wanting to go to because I love watching Giada on Food Network!  The service was really good! The place was really nice!  Though, I am a little disappointed because the food was just OK. I ordered one of her specialty which was the spaghetti w/ shrimp, and it was bland. I expected more due to the fact that it was one of her specialty..

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NfLyS3HSWIuQ5Xmhu3gL4Q.text: So in my head, My review goes back n forth between a 3 and a 4.  I'll give it a 3.4.  The restaurant opened at 5 and we arrived at around 5:08 after wasting time on the tables downstairs.  (That wasn't a good idea).   The place is lovely and right off of the elevator.  We did not have reservations and the hostess said that she can get us a reservation at 5:15.  Okay, so... we had a "reservation" for 7 minutes after we arrived.  We said okay and decided to wait at the bar of course.  While walking to the bar, we realized that there is about 4 people max in the restaurant area.  So why did we have to wait you ask?  Good question.    Once we got to the bar, Beau the bartender asked if we were dining at the bar.  Good idea Beau!  Since they wouldn't seat us. So we dined at the bar with beau.  Beau was good and attentive and Max was good as well.    The food:  White Lasagna - taste decent. Really small portion Lobster Ravioli - portion like an appetizer Wine - good complimentary bread - good   After we ate, we were still friggin' hungry so we ordered a pizza appetizer. It was small and fresh.  Taste decent.  So all in all, it was a nice place with nice service.  But for $120 I would like a better portion, and to be seated when seats are available.   The end.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Bh1QO5md92nC3ugHDzV4A.text: I really wanted to like this place, but the average rating says it all. For the price, I expected so much more. I wouldn't really recommend anything I tried, but I do recommend avoiding the Brussels sprouts.

tbzQ11uPti389A5zYOy3OA.text: We were excited to try this place while we were in vegas Because well, Giada, and it left us disappointed and broke. All of the food was a la charge but very small portion sizes that were extremely overpriced. The pizzas were the size of a grapefruit. The sides were pretty good portions and the potatoes were good, but nothing to come back for. We split the famous roast chicken and it came out bone. dry.  We felt so bad bc we never sent food back, but when you're spending 60 + on a chicken dish, it just made sense to see if they would redo it. They did and it was much better, but once again nothing  to come back for. The service was really great and I hope they make some changes to make it a viable place on the strip.

9r9cYI8WNlcLj0h9KoXQ4g.text: I loved my lemon spaghetti with shrimp fish and bread and dip dish was good. Best sea salt I have had to date. The buffalo mozzarella ciliegine appetizer was smooth and tasty. I can't remember the name of the dessert but it was good. I believe it had caramel in it. The portions were the only thing that bothered me. The usual high prices for small portions that some high end restaurants have. Nice ambience and attentive staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another entree
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon spaghetti with shrimp

0jVT7Tl5v4YoJXrwOSf13g.text: After hearing so many good things about Giada, I made reservations for Thanksgiving Day. The restaurant is beautiful and has an excellent view of the Bellagio fountains. The service is also excellent, but I can't say the food was anything to rave about. I hoped there would be a vegetarian entree on the fixed price menu, but the only entree was a turkey dinner. I ordered off the regular menu and my brother had the turkey dinner. I'd read good things about the lemon spaghetti, so I ordered it, minus the shrimp. The first couple of bites were good, but overall, the whole dish was just too dry. I didn't eat more than 3-4 bites. I thought, fine, I'll have room for dessert. I ordered the Bomboloni (Italian donuts). There are 6 to 8 in one order (I think), and the first one was to die for. The rest of them had all stuck together during cooking, like one big ball of smaller ones. They were all undercooked and sticky on the inside. My brother said the turkey dinner was very good. I'm sorry, I just couldn't say the same for my dinner. I think Giada is a place you should try at least once, but I doubt I'll be going back.

5IP_0NUSP-y4nKEika9Fiw.text: Always perfectly. I've dined here approx five times since opening. Always one of the best dining experiences in vegas. Came for the lemon spaghetti will be back for the caprese salad (the watermelon and fennel included made this dish outstanding).  I always start with the Giada cocktail, which has a beautiful apricot flavor. Salted rosemary focaccia is served to every table.   This tine I also tried the ricotta crostini and chocolate blackberry and lemon cookies.

pUxISkHV0xnL4S6ZQPjGCg.text: Went to dinner last night and the food was amazing but the morning  shift manager(Saturday morning) was no help at all. Their server charged our credit cards twice which we understand human error but it ended up tying up our funds on our vacation. When we told her about our problem she was unprofessional and un empathetic which ruined our morning after an amazing dinner making us feel like it was somehow our mistake and not theirs.

Ej6RduA29r5A7OBD2pJqFA.text: Great and prompt. Fast service. Great food! Did not even get to take a photo of what I got I slurped it up! But I got the fettuccini with shrimp and a Froze so delish!  I can't even.

3hlyU0lybqGZN46xhygp4g.text: Omg!! So when I first sat down and looked at the menu I'll admit I was confused. It seemed like the appetizers cost as much as an entree. I was worried. We chose to get the 4 course sampler menu. It was $120 a person....kinda pricey but for a special experience was amazing!!  First the appetizer sampler platter came. The bacon wrapped figs were a mouthgasm! The stuffed peppers were a party in your mouth. The seared steak crustini was sophisticated.   Then the antipasto. The lemon shrimp spaghetti was one of the best pasta dishes I've ever tasted.   The main course I had the half roasted chicken cacciatore. Dear god almighty it was delicious.   And then the grand finale!! They brought a dessert cart out with like 15 different desserts. I had settled on the five layer moose cake....then the magical words that blew my mind came...each of us got to pick three different desserts!!!   I ended up with the 5 layer moose cake, the classic cheesecake, and finally a chocolate chunk cookie. All were amazing...and then to top it off they brought two more lemon ricotta cookies!!   This was such a treat in my culinary life. It was costly, $300 for two of us without alcohol. But for a once in a life experience, it was a must!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The grande finale
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The appetizer
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini

NEjCGzX93TNOD-yRlbYuqg.text: Made reservations on a wimp to celebrate someone's birthday. We were a party of six. A table was ready not too long after we arrived however the hostess asked whether we would be willing to wait a little longer for a table closer to the window. We opted to wait. We probably waited an additional 20 min or so but the time passed quickly because we discovered the photo booth and had lots of fun with that.   Regarding the food, I enjoyed every single thing that was ordered. We opted for the a la carte menu as opposed to the pri fixe because there were several things on the a la carte that I wanted to try that were not on pri fix. Also the pri fix menu required that everyone at the table chose this option and we did not want to do this.   The food came out within 10 minutes of ordering. Appetizers came out at the same time as the main dishes which was surprising but not unwelcomed.   I had the Bacon wrapped dates, Burrata, Bresaola (Salumi) and 7oz Filet. Burrata was delicious- only thing that surprised me was that it came out on a platter on its own without any bread or crackers. I had to ask for bread for the Burrata. The bacon wrapped dates were by far my favorite - sweet, savory and spicy all in one. (I enjoyed these so much that my husband even tried to replicate at home.)  Overall very good experience and would definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burrata, Bacon Wrapped Dates, and 7oz Filet.

TjbjADHv4apZYG8UmT-w-w.text: I love Giada. I spent most of my highschool-college days watching her on food network. I was so excited to try out her restaurant, but unfortunately, I wasn't blown away by her restaurant at the Cromwell, neither by food or decor. It does have awesome views though.  We started out with the assortment of bread, and two HUGE veggie, meat and cheese platters. I enjoyed the roasted mushrooms, sweet peppers and the bacon wrapped dates. It was a lot of food, very salty too. The breads are yummy! Was truly full by the time we were done with it and a lot was left untouched. For the main I got the Shrimp Spaghetti - the shrimp was overcooked, pasta was okay and warm-ish -  let's just say disappointed... or maybe it's the full belly talkin, but either way overcooked tough shrimp on a signature dish is not cool. After that we indulged in 4 different desserts with coffee (souffle (it takes 15-20 minutes btw), chocolate torte, chocolate tiramisu and lemon hazelnut torte) The lemon dessert was good - nice and tart.  And boo, the photobooth was broken. Service was good, our waiter with a thick Italian accent was charming, answered all our questions, paced the dishes out nicely and checked in on us often. But considering everything else I probably won't be back.

I-ZujjvdJvC7rmW0n2W-GQ.text: We had a reservation, upon arriving we had to wait for about 5 minutes to be seated. The restaurant has open seats all over. So I was a bit shocked by having to wait. But whatever. The server was very polite and accommodating.  The scallops and risotto was ok. Scallops (2 small ) were cooked well but the risotto seemed like it was one of then Uncle Bens box rice packages with the smallest pieces of asparagus on top. Both our dishes came out within 10 minutes of ordering, so I know that the food was prepared ahead of time. Two entrees, Diet Coke ran  $80. I will not be back, I know Vegas is expensive but come on.

og-YYNf4FHrI76iEZLfM2w.text: We went to Giada's last night for dinner and it was amazing! We had a party of six so we were able to try multiple different things. I will tell you now that if you are looking for huge American sized portions this is not the place for you, however, the sizes also aren't tiny as you can see in the photos people have posted. Personally I think they're just right.  Location - the restaurant is located on in Cromwell and it faces Cesar's Palace, Paris Paris, and the Bellagio. It has a huge round window that allows you to see all of those places with a great view. The decor is cute and all of the tables have nice, really comfortable chairs.   Service - I honestly can't say enough about the service. Our server, Rado, was extremely nice, informative, talkative, and attentive. He really made our experience top notch, along with all of the other servers who kept our table clean, brought our dishes, and helped us with the wine selection.   Food - Oh the food. Wow. They start you with this tray of the most amazing rosemary focaccia bread, Parmesan crisps, pesto oil, lemon butter, chili flakes and sea salt. SO GOOD. We ordered the seafood tower and chicken marsala meatballs. Both were great, the meatballs were juicy and flavorful and al of the items on the seafood tower were cooked and seasoned very well. My party ordered the salmon, veal with fried brussels sprouts, lobster ravioli, whole roasted chicken with lemon potatoes, and spaghetti. All of it was prepared to perfection. And the brussels sprouts, OMG. I am not even a fan of them usually but these were prepared in a pancetta oil and came with Parmesan and pomegranate seeds. My boyfriend ordered them but I probably ate 75% of them. I couldn't stop! We finished with lemon ricotta cookies thanks to my Yelp check in. They were delicious as well.   I would highly recommend this place to everyone, and ask for Rado!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Salmon
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels Sprouts Crostini
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Veal Chop Saltimbocca

vFR3SdGhwPSqe8XZkDYlVQ.text: Spent some time at the bar. The bartender Giovanni was amazing. Very attentive and knowledgeable. For sure worth the money. And we will be back again.

a2JS2HI_-PhcWpOo0mFTCw.text: We really enjoyed our experience at Giada.  Our server, Lauren, was excellent and very helpful with recommendations.  Both mains, Wagyu short rib and veal chop, were very well executed though we didn't need both.  The pasta was tasty but could have been hotter (didn't feel like sending it back) which takes this to a four star vs five star review. The star of the show may have been the bacon wrapped dates as a starter ... they were delicious!

p3E13rp6Q8ZKMw2H6i_E0w.text: A visit to Giada was always a highlight every year I'm in town for a luxury travel conference across the street at Bellagio. It has become a joke among my friends - that I always drag them to Giada. I have traveled the world, am a travel editor on two magazine mastheads, and eat out more than I even want to! I know great restaurants, and great service.  Yes, I love Giada herself, but I also just love the ambiance and the food here. I live in New York City, so prices don't scare me off. What has really gotten so terrible is the service. The hostess greets you as if it is your privilege to be dining there. Then, if you're not willing to commit to paying $150 a person for a "window seat," you are shown to a "toilet" seat (airplane analogy). Which is funny since Giada's motto is "Eat a little of everything, not a lot of anything." I wonder if $150 a person is "not a lot of anything." Then - the timing is always just off. If you don't tell them anything, your meal takes four hours. If you tell them you need to leave by a certain time, your meal takes five minutes (but then you can't find the server to pay).   Again, the food is good to great, the ambiance is needed on the Strip (if you were allowed to sit at ANY table...), and I love Giada. But there are still so many service-related problems here four years after opening. There must be a ton of turnover.

fTJ53_Be51oDjkXoJZyLPg.text: We recently celebrated our anniversary here. They were able to accommodate our requests, this was our second time here. We really enjoyed our dinner and the view that we had. I love their bread ! And our entrees were delicious. We ordered the spaghetti with the 2 jumbo shrimps and a side of brocolini. For dessert we had a key lime pie which was so good and even the presentation was beautiful.

HZLpxrSX7PExYN_5tH8gkw.text: I was very surprised that this place is not rated a atleast a 4 or 5 Star. This is my fourth time dining at this restaurant and it had never let me down: everything is delicious, not the typical Italian food the flavors are so well balanced. My favorite is the lobster ravioli, soooooo delicious but we also had the halibut and that was also amazing. I really love this place! Definitely a must try!

R_B_05bUf7JK1yrsExmW9g.text: We arrived a little ahead of our 8:15 reservation so we decided to relax at the bar and we were greeted by a very friendly bartender, Katie. I asked her to make me a signature cocktail with bourbon and what she came up with has now shot up to one of my favorite cocktails of all time! It contained bourbon, blackberries, and rosemary, along with one or two other ingredients I cannot remember off the top of my head. We we need up drinking these delicious cocktails (we referred to them as Katie's bourbon & rosemary cocktails) the rest of the night.   The hostess arrived and then sat us with a table with gorgeous views of the Bellagio's fountain. Just like everyone said, this restaurant is very well thought out so that almost all the tables have views of the city.   Our attentive & adorable waiter, Rocco, then lead us through culinary bliss. His recommendations were spot on as we started off with bacon wrapped dates, prosciutto, and the gorgonzola cheese with honey appetizers. Then, we enjoyed Giada's signature spaghetti along with the raviolli. Topped off by s'mores gelati.   Overall, the food was good. However, what made this place special was the people who work there. Katie & Rocco were some of the best we have ever had the pleasure of interacting with. Very professional and pleasant.  We highly recommend Giada's restaurant to anyone wanting a special night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Katie&#39;s Cocktail

L9eMobX1hT0Pq4DuOffW_Q.text: It was my wedding anniversary weekend and my wife, being a huge fan of Giada, recommended we eat here on our anniversary. I set up the reservation, we made it to the restaurant, and our high expectations for the restaurant and menu were met. The both of us ordered the tasting menu and were given several courses of incredible food, including the main course of the italian fried chicken Cacciatore. My wife only had 2 bites of her main course before being full, and I ended up eating all of mine. The both of us were satisfied and impressed by both staff and food, paid the bill, and left to catch a show we had tickets for. That's when the sweats set in. An hour or two after the meal my romantic anniversary weekend was cut short and two days of hellish toilet time started. We ended up cutting our trip short despite having already paid for the hotel, deciding to fight through the food poisoning at home rather than in Vegas. My wife and I deduced that Giada caused my misfortune as we shared the same things for all of our meals, the only difference being that I had ate all of my chicken whereas she only had 2 bites. She did experience a little nausea but nothing compared to the faith questioning pain I'm going through. Be careful with undercooked chicken.

ydE8FJQw_G0OF7fqJhs1IQ.text: Giada. Giada. Giada.  On the napkins.  On the menus.  On the plates.  On the placemats.  Even on the hand towels in the bathroom!  Ok, we get it.  Your name is Giada and so is your restaurant.  I've been to a lot of places to eat and can't think of anywhere I've ever seen such a thing.  Before we got to see all of her monogrammed items, we had to wait for a table.  The hostess said we could sit at the bar with no wait, or wait 20 minutes for a table.  Since we were all starving, we walked into the bar to get a seat to avoid the wait.  Well that's humorous because there is maybe 6 bar stools and they were all taken.  Then the other couches and table in the area are just a waiting area, not a place to sit and eat.  So back to the lobby we go.  While we walked back out to get on the wait list, I looked over and the restaurant was practically empty!  They we're only seating the tables around the edge by the window.  All the other tables stayed empty.  I'm guessing b/c it was lunch or maybe lack of servers but whatever the case, not a great first impression.  Once seated our server was very professional.  (I think Stephanie was her name).  I ordered the Lemon Pesto Grilled Cheese with heirloom tomatoes because I love lemon, pesto, and grilled cheese sandwiches so how could this be a miss.  The server recommended I add the Prosciutto di Parma which was at an upcharge of coarse that I didn't notice but still added per her recommendation.  Unfortunately this sandwich was a huge disappointment.  The lemon pesto and prosciutto was all I tasted.  The sandwich was over cooked so if there was any cheese on it, it had all melted off and was non detectable.  And those were not heirloom tomatoes.  Small, flimsy, roma tomatoes at best.  I picked it apart and tried to eat some of the bread but it was just not good.  What was good though was the Spinach & Buffalo Ricotta Pizza.  The dough was so fresh and the pizza offered great flavor.  The only thing about it I found flavorless was the thinly sliced porchetta on top.  This was not a restaurant I had bookmarked and could have gone without visiting during this Las Vegas vacation, but when your starving and tired of trying to make a decision, you take what you can get.

qbwgSJnX3PcBuOj-5DRddg.text: Anyone else notice how HOT Giada looks in her restaurant's Yelp profile photo?! Definitely 5 stars for that!  As for her restaurant...  It's a beautiful space overlooking The Strip.  As expected, it's expensive.  Had breakfast there with a friend - good service, good food and great coffee ($6 for a large cup.)  I ordered a "hash" and enjoyed the mix of eggs, veggies and sausage - not typical diner slop.  In all, I really enjoyed Giada's restaurant.  4 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Hash for breakfast...quite good!

89Y3I5XlAIkoT0ghXtQ7aw.text: Visiting Las Vegas for the first time, we had to try Giada, our fav chef, cook her recipies all the time! Restaurant is absolutely Gorgeous and stunning with attention to detail. Service was incredible for the most part. Our party of four-everyone loved their fancy cocktails and the food. The only criticism i have is my Eggplant Appitizer was under-cooked and tough to cut into, but everything else we had was delicious!  We had a beautiful experience and i would go back. A big perk is the view of the Beliggio dancing fountains from most seats in the restaurant and the view in general is spectacular, the windows open - like French Doors a lovely touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a sweet touch: on the house Birthday cookies that melted in the mouth!
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. beautiful art work, including posters from Giada&#39;s Grandfather the famous Producer Dino De Laurentiis

Ldo_xxwVkl0im9zRMtpZ7Q.text: Beautiful boutique like restaurant, great ambiance and decoration. The bread appetizer they give is amazing! They even have an oven made bread, that come with butter, salt, anchovies, pepper and more.  The food was delicious, portions are very small, but very good. I ordered a crab and scallop risotto with was amazing! My husband had a pasta with pork.  the only reason thy I gave them a 4 star review was cause I had an unpleasant moment there. I asked the hostess to charge my phone and she plugged it at a register close by. When I asked my waiter to bring it to me he said it wasn't there, i had to stand up, and started getting stressed! Then he said e was going to ask around, he came back saying he was sorry but it wasn't there. I was about to yell and he laughed saying it was a joke! I literally asked for the check and left!

qUBGmSMySAdFEZKWcXyQTQ.text: Appetizers were delicious.  Entrees were not nearly as good.  I would suggest getting drinks and apps only.

txKDw8d0A3zB5a27qENeag.text: I was so excited to try Giada,  but was sadly disappointed.  The server was extremely aloof -  I felt like waiting on us was a major chore for him.  The pasta was cooked perfectly & the flavor was great, but the accompany shrimp was over cooked.

EKIiqb7-bAuqErynfGJc6A.text: We had reservations on a Sunday night.  I've always wanted to try this place out.   Inside the Cromwell hotel (where Drais is located) we went up on the escalators and there was the hostess station at the end of the escalator.  We were invited to go to the bar and have a drink while waiting for our table.  That's exactly what we did.  Their menu of cocktails was on the ipad.  We just ended up getting our usuals.  Our hostess finally seated us.   We were approached by Cliff, our fantastic waiter! He was very accommodating and friendly.  He made us feel warm and welcomed.  Very personable.  His Hawaiian accent is great also! He took care of us.  So 5 STARS for CLIFF!  As for food, I'll rank it 3.  The plates are small.  I ordered the lobster ravioli.  Which was a bit too lemony for my taste.  My bf ordered the risotto and scallops.  That dish was much better than mine.  Bread plate came out first,  I really liked the freshly baked bread on the bread plate that we got served. The resto itself was pretty pricey.  It's nice to try new things.  Sadly, I don't think i'll come back  Overall, I had a good experience with this place. ambiance, excellent service and the PHOTOBOOTH! That by far was my favorite part in the whole experience!  Thanks again Cliff! YOU ARE AMAZING!

MCGqST7PfIskl2pGBHPPaA.text: Pros: Giada's beautiful style evident in the food and design, gorgeous space, delicious food choices, fun cocktails  Cons: slow service, pricey for lunch, cocktails really expensive, her "Giada" stamp on too many things (not needed on each placemat, reminded me of Perkins or something)  We enjoyed everything we ordered--the antipasto board (highly recommend), muffuletta sandwich, and panzanella salad. Loved the 2 types of sangria--both delicious in their own way (red was sweet but not too sweet, and the white a uniquely dry sangria).  Tiramisu good but not earth shattering like I hoped for, from the Italian goddess herself.  I would go back the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wnb31elA9YdDYzxQwVkVlQ.text: I will not go back.  I was looking forward to this dinner in Vegas. The location is great and we had a good spot with the reservation. The service was good and the server was knowledgeable and polite.  The food, however, was really bad. I am vegetarian and had a really small portion for my main course that virtually had no flavor. The meat based main course wasn't impressive either. The lemon based dessert was so sour that we could not finish it. We went in with high expectations and left with a big disappointment.   Vegas offers so many other great restaurant options. I won't be choosing this one again.

c_pslhVx59l-O-Ll2pl4yA.text: The restaurant looks beautiful but not impressed with the food. I had the lobster ravioli, the pasta part was kind of hard as if it wasn't cooked all the way. But the sauce it came with didn't have much flavor to it. You only get 8 raviolis as well. Which dining at a fine dining I don't expect a full plate but I got 8 not so great raviolis. The stars don't lie when you look this place up.  The service was great though!

xUgXHwg8QeHxePlxbSe65g.text: Simply the best!!!  I love coming here for all occasions and events.  A great place to have lunch or dinner and meet with new clients too.  They have open air dining area and wonderful staff too.  Of course the food is totally Amazing!!!  You gotta come and check out Giada at the Cromwell.

Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Hash
Photo of Giada - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Across from the Bellagio Hotel and Resort.

dz6BqKUFPtjFe50jwaeK-w.text: We weren't planning to eat here and hadn't even perused the menu online. One of the reasons I had intentionally not put this restaurant in the "must try category" was the less than 4 stars on yelp which are abundant in Vegas. Yet somehow, we found ourselves hungry at lunch and no plan...a bit of an anomaly for an avid foodie/yelper!  Sometimes flying by the seat of the pants is so much better though.  Walked passed Mon Ami Gabi and were both tempted go back as their steak/frites and moules/frites are a safe bet. But time to venture to something new and I remembered that Giada's was just another block up the strip.  As we headed up the escalators in the Cromwell, two ladies were descending and their friend hollered up...."how was it?" One called down..."I had the lobster roll which was fantastic!"  I looked at my husband and said, "it's gonna be pricey...but I don't care how much it is...I've been craving a lobster roll and I'm going to order it!"  So we sit down in this gorgeous very un-las-vegas-ey style restaurant....meaning bright and open with awesome feng-shui. I was hooked as soon as I melted into a nice comfortable club chair with a good amount of space between tables.     In addition to the lobster roll (which was a whopping $37) we ordered the Salumi Picante pizza that totaled only $16.  They were both really beyond fantastic. The salumi was nothing like I've tasted before...a bit spicy but not too oily.  The crust was on the thicker side but light and airy at the same time. Giada knows her pizza!  The lobster at first looked small...that was deceiving because it was open faced so the entire 1 1/2 inches on top was all lobster. We decided it must have been well over a pound of lobster perfectly dressed in the lightest aioli with fried capers...never would have though of that but it worked well. In fact, this was one of the best lobster rolls I've ever tried.    They get knocked one star because wine by the glass is pretty steep so we ended up getting a bottle of French wine on the lower end of the price range...Vouvray Francois Pinon.  Our server immediately informed us that they serve that one by the glass at Spago where he used to work and it is delicious. Ok, that made us feel better about our choice, and much to our surprise, it was the perfect choice....light and not too buttery or oaky.    The service was wonderful and even with the steep wine prices I would definitely return.

I5uCTRoN7q7N4iIArxwPRQ.text: It's our honeymoon and we chose to eat here because of recommendations from family who had experienced her food before. It did not fail! We went with her preset meal...and shared with each other! It was divine! Our server Nancie was amazing and very helpful too! The dessert guy helped us choose the best ones and we were given complementary champagne for a toast to our new marriage! So sweet...we will be back again and I'll probably blog about this meal on onenotsoboredmommy.com
